Beautiful river and waterfalls with a perfect large pool to immerse yourself in and cool off, dive off rocks, or just contemplate the jungle around you. One of Veracruz' hidden gems! There are apparently two other waterfalls nearby, Cola de Caballo and Velo de Novia, which I have yet to explore.

Medium-sized flat grassy spot in the trees where you can park up. The site is managed by the family who live in the rancho next door; follow the track to their house and they'll open the gate for you. They charged me $100 for a night (travelling alone so not sure if that was pp or per rig) - more than I would usually pay but decided it was well worth it when I saw the place.

It's about 5km down the road towards Miguel Hidalgo/El Apompal) - turn left onto this road before you cross the larger bridge over the river if driving round the lake from Catemaco. Don't do what I did and follow the closest road Maps.me shows to San Martin, you can't get there from there and it's a rough road (albeit with beautiful views!).

it had rained a few days ago and it was fine to get down the dirt track to the parking spot, but I imagine it could get challenging after recent heavy rain; it's a bit of an incline. In other conditions should be fine for any vehicle. 

A very rustic portaloo-style toilet on-site, no other facilities and no phone signal.

name: Cascada Cola de Caballo
description: Impressive waterfall of 40 metres or so, hidden in the jungle. Need to park up in the road when you see the sign for Rancho la Cascada (Cola de Caballo), then follow the path down to the river and upstream - maybe 500m total. There is a short cut that veers off to the left but I wouldn't have found it had one of the youngsters from Poza Reyna (see point nearby) not shown up and guided me there. Worth a stop, nice spot for a swim too; watch the current after recent rain.

name: Laguna Azul
description:
Gorgeous large clear pool. No road here; I left my van with a friendly family in the pueblito of Laguna Escondida (they also invited me to park up on their grounds for the night), and they guided me down the 40-odd minute hike to the pool, beyond Laguna Escondida - I don't think I'd have found it without a guide. Worth the sweat for the swim at the end!

NB: the area looks nice for camping but I'm told it's privately owned and permission would need to be sought from the owner, a lady named Eva who has a hotel in Montepio. No further info! Zero facilities.

name: Cascada las Gemelas
description:
Aptly named twin waterfalls with a choice of refreshing bathing spots to splash about in - one has a crazy strong current! I was there on a weekend and it was popular with local people, a couple of small comedors catering.

$60 to stay the night, $30 for entrance only. Toilets and apparently showers available, included in the price if you camp. Keep an eye out for ticks, I found a couple of tiny ones on me after just an hour and the poor local dogs are infested.

name: Street parking opposite vacant lot
description:
I just parked up on a pretty level grass verge alongside a wall on a quiet street for the night, opposite another wall with an empty lot behind it. Nothing special to report, had a peaceful night, aside from a couple of stray mosquitoes that breached my defences!

Toilets and showers available at various places along the beach for a small fee, plenty of options for eating back away from the dunes

name: Cañon de Cinacatla
description:
Short hike (500m or so) through nice forest, following a stream to a canyon; if you follow it to the end there's a charge of $30 and you can venture a little further upstream to a cave with a faint pre-hispanic painting on the wall. There are pre-erected tents if you wish to camp, and a natural pool which I'm assured is 'bien, bien azul' in the dry season.. if it's not dry season chances are you'll get your feet wet accessing the cave, no higher than knee-deep though. They offer rapelling too.

These coordinates are for the small car park at the entrance; I'd be surprised if you couldn't boondock here too but I didn't ask - very gently sloping and visible from the road, but there's not a lot of traffic.

name: Side road next to bridge
description:
The dark caught up with me on my way up to Huautla de Jiménez so I picked a spot for the night. Right turn just before a bridge over a beautiful, crystalline river. I parked next to a large abandoned-looking building and had a super peaceful night with just the fireflies and a friendly, scrawny dog for company. The river looks like a popular spot during the day, even by 9am on a weekday there were people relaxing down by the water. 

Space for big rigs, and I don't see why you couldn't erect a tent, though it would be on the roadside so not ideal. 

No phone signal, but wifi available to buy from a nearby establishment, I didn't so can't comment.

name: Agua Purificadora - no sign
description: Standard purificadora. There's no sign up, just a big brown (at the time of writing!) metal garage door, give it a knock. They're open till 7pm. Friendly, efficient, thorough - and cheap; $15 for 22l.

name: Cascada de Puxtla
description:
Large flattish field where you can park up for the night and erect tents if required. Some trees for shade. Quite a steep dirt road down to get here but ok with 2-wheel drive (I saw a regular taxi make it without problem), though might be challenging after heavy rain. I stayed at the top of the hill at the request of a local family who were concerned about my safety as a solo female, but I walked past with the lady I stayed with at night and it looked super peaceful, full of fireflies! (And a flock of sheep in a fenced-off section of the field.) No services but there are toilets available 200m up the road.

Walk 10 minutes down the road from here and you'll find Cascada Puxtla, at 83m apparently the tallest falls in Puebla state - nice hike down to the river at the base through the forest (take the path to the left just before you get to the top of the falls and head downhill!); it's steep but beautiful, as are the falls! You can rock-hop across the river to access a cave behind them, recommend taking sticks for that!

The campsite owner's young grandson was here and said you pay whatever you feel is right to stay the night. The owner (Diego I think, not sure!) lives in one of the last houses before you head down to the site. 

Note that there's a small house a little further down towards the river inhabited by a friendly elderly lady; her dogs will bark at you a lot if you try to go past at night! Enjoy!

name: Mary's house
description:
Flat parking spot outside the house of Mary and her family. She considered it unsafe for me to stay in the area below (which I posted about on the spot nearby) and seemed to be very wary of the guy who ran it. She says people are welcome to stay on her land - when I asked how much she would charge she said between $200 and $500, depending (!). She was quite insistent on accompanying me down to see the fireflies in the evening and when I asked in the morning if I could give her something for guiding me asked for $100. She has embroidered ponchos for sale, and is planning to sell the fruit wines the region specialises in too. They have friendly pets, and I spent a peaceful night. Outdoor toilet was made available to me too.

Mary's number is +52 233 125 8588. Friendly pets welcome - they have two dogs, a cat, turkeys and chickens so need to be non-threatening to them!

name: Large car park
description:
Decided to cone and check out the waterfalls before going to Cuetzalan, and stayed the night here first. In the morning they asked $50 for the car park. Toilets available for $5 in the building with a tiny shop - it was quite active first thing so if you want a quiet morning don't park too close! Space for big rigs. No phone signal; it's possible you can buy wifi access but I didn't ask.

There are 4/5 waterfalls accessible here; I didn't realise before heading off that each one has a price - Las Golondrinas ($30, payable at the car park), Tres Caidas ($15), Las Brisas ($25) and Escondida/El Salto ($50; toilets & showers included). Each has a swimmable pool and the water clarity varies depending on location - crystal clear further downstream. I began at the furthest downstream and most dramatic one, Las Golondrinas, and walked upstream from there - you can do the lot in a couple of hours comfortably if you don't stop too much - there are also zip wires and other activities on offer, for an extra fee, and snacks available at various spots as you go.

There's also a little complex of cabins between Las Golondrinas and Tres Caidas, called 'Las Cuebañas', run by very friendly folk - about as rustic as it gets but in a superb jungly location right on the river, and ridiculously cute - think The Shire from Lord of the Rings and you're about there. $500 pp per night, includes sleeping bag, toilet paper etc. You can just show up and book on the spot, or I think there's somewhere in Cuetzalan where you can book ahead, but not sure of details. Take bug spray if there during the rains.

name: Quiet road next to cemetery
description: From reading other comments I was expecting to struggle for a spot to park here, but actually I found a few street spots. There are major road construction works currently underway so this road is temporarily a dead end - I parked next to an empty lot opposite the cemetery and asked someone working in the lab next door if it was ok, she said no worries. I can't speak for when the road is opened up again but I had a peaceful night.

name: Lavanderia San José
description: Little laundrette, didn't note all the prices but it was $20 a kilo for the express service - I dropped off at 11am and had it back by 6pm same day. The point I've marked is actually the entrance to the car park of Baños San José, just opposite ($42 for an hour's glorious bathing time - individual, mixed and I believe a temazcal option too - albeit possibly not during pandemic times) - ideal if you want to clean your clothes and bedding at the same time as yourself!

name: Fee entrance city
description: tool with fee entrance of the city Corozal 40 ppp

name: Patte Brook
description: Nice campsite with drive through access.

name: La llegada del pescador
description: Good place to have lunch. Delicious fish and sea food. Cheap and visited for local people. As well you can have a ride in a small boat in front of the restaurant till Isla de las Conchas 150mxn for person

name: CoCo's New Corner
description: Coco, the man and the legend, has moved next to Highway 5. After the new highway was built, people stopped visiting, and Coco was forced to move to this new location. Coco will be turning 85 years old this month (Feb 2022) and has been welcoming tourists into his home for decades. He has a few things to sell and depends on the kindness and generosity of visitors. Don't leave without signing his guest book. And if you are one of the fortunate, he may invite you to stay and camp at CoCo's New Corner Ranch.

name: Dorado Autopartes
description: Autoparts store. Owner is very friendly, helpful, and prices are fair.

name: Security Checkpoint
description: Guard will record your licence plate and name before allowing you to proceed to the Laguna Ojo de Liebre to see the whales. They will check you again when you leave the property.

name: Cerro Todos Santos
description:
Public land, unpaved, close to a hill. This is close to Jazamango, but there is no access from there. We actually stayed in a nearby place to this spot but noticed people staying here which is better.

Note that like a typical Sunday in Mexico, this is a spot which turns into a party with multiple cars playing loud music and drinking, but everyone keeps to themselves.

Area is uneven, but you can find a leveled spot here and there. Expect empty bottles and some trash around, however quite dark nights when there are no parties, as well as a great view of Todos Santos.

If you do dine in at Jazamango, make sure to get the wifi password so that you are able to reach it from here ;)

name: La Trinidad
description:
So close, but still so far from Xilitla is this ecotourism area in the mountains of the Sierra Gorda. It's only 15km from the town, but the drive up takes a full hour! It's a steep concrete slabs road which I would only recommend for vans or 4*4 campers (narrow turns). We drive a VW Crafter L2H2 (similar to a Sprinter van) and were fine. 

The place itself is gorgeously set between pine trees. It has cabanas for different groups sizes, a field to pitch a tent and space for a about two or three vans. It's $100p.p.p.n. There's a little restaurant (which we didn't try), flush toilets and a shower. They're pet friendly too!

It's an ecotourism campground so profits go to the locals. You can do a few pretty cool hikes in this area, but only with a local guide (to a viewpoint, a cave and a sinkhole). It costs about $250-350p, for up to a group of 6, depending on the hike (between 3-6 hours).

Oh and no cell reception or wifi here, enjoy nature!

name: Grupo Ayala Navarrete
description: Tire shop. Michelin and other brands. Huge covered workshop. Their alignment machine was large enough and strong enough to align the wheels on our 21 foot Promaster. The roof is so tall their are no overhead height issues here.

name: Amazing desolate campsite, 2WD OK
description: Beautiful, desolate campsite with amazing views of the sandstone cliffs in the near distance. 2 Wheel Dr. is totally fine with medium size clearance. Our 20 foot van did just fine. Do not go farther than the GPS coordinates unless you have four-wheel-drive. Absolutely not another soul and very beautiful

name: Hotel Restaurant las Paloma’s cantona
description: Right next to the archeological site. With prices from 250-500. clean, hot showers, Wifi and friendly staff!

name: Hotel Bocana
description: No frills hotel, air conditioning, fan, but no hot water. Loud in the mornings. secure parking available on the next block. We paid 600 pesos for a double room (May 2022).

name: San José
description:
Translation:Beautiful place.  next to the river.  Very clean, quiet and tidy.  cared for by their owners.
 It has a cost of 200 pesos per person, plus 200 pesos per vehicle.
 Excellent place.

Hermoso lugar. junto al río. Muy limpio, tranquilo y ordenado. cuidado por sus dueños.

Tiene un costo de 200 pesos por persona, más 200 pesos por vehículo.

excelente lugar.

name: Axolotl Camp - El Cedral
description:
To get here requires some effort, but it's totally worth it and here's why. This nature campsite is a protected area for wild axolotls! There are a few trails on the camp ground that lead towards pools where this critically endangered species live.

So that's why you want to go here, now how to get here. You need to make a reservation or call/whatsapp/facebook chat ahead. The phone number is +52 4412768838. The name of the place is Campamento El Cedral. 

To get there I only recommend small vans or 4*4s with a rooftop tent. We have a 3m high, 6m long van and could not make it there (too many low hanging branches). So, instead we hiked about 2km downhill with our tent. Don't ask Google Maps to bring you here because it fails miserably. Find the bus stop in Pinal where Calle Federal 120, meets Calle La Escondida. Follow Calle La Escondida downhill to where the pavement ends. Take the left dirt road, it does show on MapsMe not on Google Maps. Follow this road all the way down, you'll see an axolotl painted on a wall to mark the entrance.
 
Costs are pretty steep but worth it to protect this area. We payed $200p per person per night and there are zero amenities here, not even water. The only water source is where the axolotls live and you can't touch it (rightly so!). There are sites with fire pits. Dogs are welcome for another $100 and need to be kept on leash near the pools. There is Telcel signal ranging from H+ to 4G.

If you want to get more info you can also visit the highly recommend Pinal Adventures outdoors sports company in town.

name: Puebla Fantasma
description: This is a strange place with tons of unique art. It is worth a walk through just to see the craziness.  There is no fee to enter and everything is for sale, but this is not your normal art shop.

name: San Rafael
description: a quiet place to camp near the river balsas --- un lugar tranquilo para acampar cerca del río balsas

name: Al Forno Pizzeria
description: Excellent pizza and pasta. The owners are Italians. It is open only during the weekend 2 - 10 pm.

name: Indian - Cardomomo
description: Omg yummmmm! A welcome change from tacos, awesome Indian food in Mexico! The vindaloo and the butter chicken were delicious! They give you a bunch of sauces on the side too that were all unique and delish! Not overly expensive, everything is about 150 pesos. We got two dishes and had enough for leftovers. Don’t miss it if your in San Cristobal!

name: Água 2000
description: Water to fill any size tank. 50 pesos for 200liters

name: Refrigeración Servicio  Garciglia
description:
Services in refrigerators and air conditioners.  Mr. Joel is a very helpful person.
Servicios en refrigeradores y aires acondicionados.  El Sr. Joel es una persona
 interesado en ayudar

name: Soriana Mercado
description: We asked the store manager who allowed the overnight.  Inside the market there are restrooms.  Closes at 11pm. It has a small snack bar with pizza and other fast food.

name: truck park
description: A large truck parking lot, next to the fire department.  Across the street is the army.  Quite dusty.  The city has few options for big rigs.  Free.

name: Pemex Gasolinera
description: New gasolinera, New bathroom, available water.

name: empty land
description: A large land, flat, without infrastructure and used by some tourist buses.  During the day there is a police station on the next street.  In front of a health post.  Calm night. Nearby restaurants

name: Argentina
description: SHell gas station . Good for one night.

name: TEHUALOFTS
description: Apartments that are rented through Airbnb

name: Taller Mecánico El Paso
description:
These guys were amazing!
They fixed a problem I had with my gas tank hose, did an alignment replaced parts, Thorough check, top all my fluids, oil/filter change, fuel filter replacement, etc! So glad I stopped here with me 32’ class A Motorhome after spending time at the National Park! On top of that they let me fill my 65 Gal tank with fresh water!
I couldn’t believe the price, 880 pesos all in!
Thank you Ismael!
Super nice and helpful guys! Do all your repairs here before going back to the US or Canada!

Por suerte decidí parar aquí luego de visitar el Parque Nacional, estos muchachos me arreglaron un montón de cosas en mi Motorhome, Cambio de aceite, filtro de combustible, un problema con la manguera de gasolina, revisaron todo! Lubricación completa, alineado etc! El precio: 880 pesos! En USA me hubiese costado 20 veces más!
Súper agradecido Ismael por tu servicio y atención!

name: Tapicería en general
description:
Upholstery place. 
Great same day service, our sprinter driver’s seat was rip and the foam was damaged, he fixed and upholster the seat, not a fancy place but very professional and good price.

name: Laboratorio San Sebastián
description: Lab that specialises in clinical analysis, ultrasounds, x-rays, tomography and mammograms. 967 631 5727 to make an appointment, 963 633 0311 for urgent attention. I went without making an appointment and was seen almost right away, $800 for a mammogram and ultrasound. Results and x-rays available to take away within the hour, good professional service.

name: Casa Raab
description:
Beautiful place to stay just outside of Oaxaca. It is located in San Pablo Etla, 15 minutes drive from the center.
Rebecca and Tony are amazing hosts! They have a little shelter “Friends of Megan” at their place, they save dogs and help them to get adopted! Maybe you will leave with a lil puppy 
You can park your van or they rent rooms as well. We highly recommend that place !
Plus the money you spend will go to the shelter to help them save more street dogs !
You can contact Rebecca via whatsapp : +1(206)2914702 or visit their instagram : friendsofmegan

name: Trapitos Al Sol
description:
excellent service, 14 pesos/kg in normal, 20p/kg express. good job, very clean clothes. 
--
super service déposés à 10h, récupérés à 17h en express. biens propres et pliés nickel. je recommande et la dame est très sympathique.

name: street behind thé Mexico Border
description:
quiet place to sleep, next to the Mexican customs.
--
endroit au calme pour dormir, à côté de la douane mexicaine.

name: Vid-ah Bistro
description: Delicious food (sandwiches at lunch, pastas for dinner). Fantastic, friendly service. Ocean view. Dogs welcome.  We’ll be back!

name: Carburacion de Gas Teopisca
description: Tank refill station not too far off the highway.

name: Spanish classes with private teacher
description:
If you like to take spanish classes in your private environment (while waiting for your car to arrive in your hotel), you can call or write to Nicolas. He is and english teacher, but can also teach spanish. We took a few hours and he was on point with our needs. Very recommended! 
Contact information:
e-mail: nicopohltutoring@outlook.com
Phone Number/WhatsApp/Telegram
(52) 229 490 6906

name: Capital O Hotel Mision Y Spa
description: Decent hotel with good location. They only had one room available (#26), which had no air conditioning (fans only) but warm water and wifi. This room was in the third floor with rather narrow stairs cases, which may be an issue for some overlanders. Original price quoted was 1,300 pesos, but they ended up letting us have the room for 900 pesos (May 2022). Secure parking is available in an adjacent lot.

name: Cabaña Erika
description:
Small restaurant in the Parque Nacional Cumbres del Ajusco. 5 minutes walk from the start of various trails. The hike is amazing and you have a beautiful view of Mexico city and the surrounding. Plus it is dog friendly :)
Maria is very friendly host and you can sleep in the parking lot of the restaurant. You can use the bathroom even at night, and during the day, their wifi. 
The food is very good, especially the sopas!
Very quiet at night and very dark, but completly safe !
There are 2 small rooms that you can rent as well.

name: Comes
description: After a lot of searching, we were able to get white gas here for our camping stove.   You will need to bring your own container.

name: Between the Dunes
description: Nice, fairly clean, and somewhat less wind. Some vegetation around. Very quiet. Sand path seems to be packed for 2wd but be careful and pay attention. Should try with a large rig but a van works.

name: Pemex gas with showers
description: Showers with hot water once you figure out how to work it. 60 pesos but not a long  wait. Clean.

name: Hotel Moniett
description: Basic hotel with fan only (no a/c available), hot water,  good water pressure, clean bathrooms, and secure gates parking. I paid 470 pesos for a single (May 2022).

name: Parador turístico BioHidroSelva
description:
Large aviary with lots of parrots. free.
---
Grande volière avec des perroquets. gratuit.

name: Agua purificada Aketzali
description:
Potable water on sale and also have a hose to fill vehicles with non-potable water.
--
Eau potable en vente et possèdent également un tuyau pour remplir les véhicules d'eau non potable.

name: Hotel Pasada La Loma
description: Great hotel just 7 minute walk from the centro, has parking with a gate (rough cobblestone on a hill but manageable on the motorcycle). I paid $600 for a single room. The quoted $800 but got them down to $600. Nice open feel and tables to have coffee in the morning.

name: MB Mini Bodegas Tijuana
description:
We stored out landcruiser here for 3 years during the pandemic. They do not have under cover storage, only outdoors (not sure about less tall vehicles).
After 3 years everything was as we left it, they even tried to start her occasionally until the battery died. Oswaldo speaks English and was super friendly and helpful - we checked in on WhatsApp occasionally to check on her.

+52 664 689 3763
minibodegastijuana.com

name: orillas de laguna
description:
We spent an afternoon here.  beautiful and quiet place.  It is free and has lights in the night.  There is a small neglected dock but it allows access to the lagoon of exquisite temperature.
-----
Pasamos aquí una tarde. lugar bello y tranquilo. Es gratis y se ve luminaria pública para la noche . Hay un pequeño muelle descuidado pero permite acceder a la laguna de temperatura exquisita.

name: Street parking Tequila
description: We parked here for two nights while exploring tequila. Large parallel parking spots. We were able to fit our 24 foot truck camper and there are no low hanging trees here. Very convenient location.

name: Calma Cafe
description:
Spacious outdoor cafe in a gated area that includes parking during hours of operation. Food is good, prices reasonable and it has good wifi. I asked the owner if it was possible to park for the night and he suggested that we parked across the street, but he offered to leave some lights on in our direction to increase security.
Recommended for a stop in Huehuetenango!

name: Hotel Real de Juarez
description: Basic hotel, good location, ceiling fan (no a/c), hot water, good water pressure, clean bathroom. Secure parking. Only downside is that there are only two outlets available in the room to charge electronics, and only one of them is accessible (the other one is on top of the dresser). Paid 400 pesos for a single room (May 2022).

name: Fortuna White Bus restaurant
description:
This is a side of the road little restaurant in a white bus. The food is varied and the steak and shrimp tacos yummy. Had a breakfast burrito and coffee the next morning that was also tasty.  Very nice family and the cook, Adal, was great. They also have Wifi, one of a few places in town to check your email
or call home.

name: Balneario El Mirador
description: Nice water park with several pools for kids and adults. The place is three years old and they are still adding few amenities like a new kids area and five private jacuzzi. We stayed here on a Friday night and it was quite but a bit of noise from the nearby highway. The rv place is separated from the parking, it is on grass and has hook up for electricity. During the night is closed as we saw the police passing by several times. We paid 280 pesos for the night and the park entrance.

name: Parador Cherangueron
description: This was a nice combination of gas station, restaurant, hotel and overnight parking. I asked the attendant at the gas pump if we could stay the night. The arrangement is that you speak with the security guard, he charges you $40 pesos a night, writes you a receipt as well as provides you with Wi-Fi password that worked reasonably well out in the parking lot. There are two security guards after 7:00 p.m. The bathrooms were super modern, spacious and clean. Though we did not use the showers they cost 40 pesos per person. We felt safe and secure. the location is maybe 2 miles north of town. Incidentally, traffic was horrible in town! We passed through at about 2:00 in the afternoon and again at about 6:00 in the evening. I would give this stop five stars but for some reason the app defaults at two and a half and doesn't allow me to change it.

name: Hotel Casa de Oracion San Jose
description: Good hotel. Clean, modern rooms, hot water, excellent water pressure, clean bathrooms, restaurant integrated, wifi available. No a/c, but room had balcony with doors that could be opened. Paid 545 pesos for a single with online reservation, indicate cash price without reservation was 600 pesos (May 2022).

name: Hotel Sevilla Plaza
description: Excellent western hotel, great location, has all of the amenities, including air condition, free secure parking, hot water, excellent water pressure, laundry service, room service, etc. I paid $75.59 (USD) for a single, booked online.

name: Howard Johnson Calle Real
description: Very good hotel: great location, hot water, good water pressure, free wifi, secure parking. The parking garage is at the back of the building, which is a bit confusing to drive through,  thanks to the maze of one-way streets. Pro-tip: Google Maps has the entrance to the parking garage as a separate address, so you can use it to navigate there.

name: Calle General Arteaga
description: Street parking. Arrived late on a busy Sunday night and wanted somewhere safe to overnight. Talked to the night worker at the hotel, he said it’s a very safe street, and no problems as long as I don’t block any entrances. Not quite level, but I felt safe, slept well, and enjoyed the cool shade in the morning. Not suitable for large vehicles.

name: Agua Purificada Express
description:
Only for garafons 24/7
Garrafon per 12 pesos.

name: Agua purificado
description: Aqua purificado. No hose but refillable jugs. 18 peso per 5 gallon jug. Hours M-F 9-6 and Saturday 9-2

name: Street parking
description: Safe street parking in a very nice neighborhood. We stayed 2 nights in this neighborhood with our truck camper. Lots of space for tall rigs like ours (11’ tall). Agua purificado around the corner

name: Arabic Sahara Restaurant
description: We felt like eating something a little different then tacos and found this very good Arabic/Lebanese restaurant. Very good food and reasonable prices!

name: Zagas
description: Filled up our propane tank here for 220 pesos. Good service and a lot cheaper than in America!

name: Camohmila
description:
This is an established campground with pool, hot showers, access to water and electricity.
A lot of space. 
YMCA Campground

name: Arteaga Parking Lot
description: Just arrived for our first night. It seems like a large overflow parking for some park or field below the hill. Police drove by a few times with no trouble yet. There are currently fires over the mountain that we have a great view of with the sunset and smoke.

name: Pemex
description: Pemex with a large truck parking lot. It does get busy but it’s great for bigger campers as there is lots of room.

name: Checkpoint
description: Looked pretty dodgy, just two guards in the bushes, but they were perfectly friendly. Just asked our nationality, where we were coming from/going. No issues.

name: Campamento Lancandon
description: This is a big, built-up restaurant area with river waterfalls pools (also has cabanas and camping). The big, clean, new washrooms behind the restaurant have good showers. Water was nice and hot during the day, cold at night. Maybe it’s solar? The right tap is the hot water. If you buy a drink at the restaurant, you can use the showers. They have beers here.

name: Cascadas de Golondrinas
description:
A smaller set of beautiful waterfalls not far from the entrance, with a few large pools to swim in. Lots of picnic tables, clean washrooms, not many people during the week. At sunset, hundreds of swallows fly through the big waterfall into the cave behind! 
25pp entrance + 20pp entrance to the town. You can camp here in the secure parking lot, surrounded by nature and listening to the waterfalls as you fall asleep also! Watch your step as we saw a really well camouflaged little snake in the parking lot and the guard told us that the snake was venomous.

name: Hotel Nuvo
description: Very good hotel with secure parking, super clean rooms, air condition, hot water, excellent water pressure, and very spacious and clean bathrooms. This hotel's Achilles heel is the location, which is about a 20+ minute drive from the town center. Taxi and Uber service is spotty, so you may have to resort to using your own transportation or use a local app, like DiDi.

name: Casa Hadassa La Cañada
description:
SOOO happy we found this place! A block from the vibey area, but nestled in the jungle. Rooms are super big and modern, hot water, AC, shared kitchen and beautiful patio for 500p. They have parking for 2/3 cars in the driveway. 

Best part was they let us stay in the truck and use the luxurious showers/toilet/kitchen/wifi for 200p/night! Best kept secret gem in town! Be super polite so they let overlanders keep coming!

name: Fiat/Jeep/RAM/Chrystler garage
description: We got a big maintenance for our European Fiat Ducato at this place. Dropped the car at 9am and could pick it up at 1pm. Paid a reasonable price (probably more then at a not-official garage, but the car needed a good check-up) and they were very professional! Oil change, cleaned diesel filter, new oil filter, new airco filter… can recommend this place! They washed the car too

name: Corrupt Police
description: Do not enter this town - police will stop you if they see foreign plates and tell you you have some unspecified infraction (he said eventually that we cut someone off, which we did not). Our "infraction" would cost us 2800 MXN. They take your license (original) and won't return it until you pay. We got very lucky and a local bus driver stopped and told these dirty cops to leave us alone. We got the license back and left.

name: El taco Loco
description:
Seafood restaurant at a good price, (fish fillets, shrimp, octopus, snails) specialty seafood tacos.
See a menu photo

Marisqueria a buen precio, (filetes de pescado, camarones,!pulpo, caracoles) especialidad de tacos de mariscos.
Mirar las fotos del menu

name: Highland Silver Lake Rest Stip
description: The rest stop on I 70 westbound.  This was a typical restart on the interstate. Semi trucks came and went during the night, nobody mess with us, it was a pleasant rest.

name: Kaibab wild camping
description:
When turning off Road 64 in the Grand Canyon national Park, you have to go about 1/8 before you enter into Kaibab Forest. There are a ton of little pull off to camp. We had people 1000 yards up from us, and 1000 yards down from us, it was very quiet very peaceful very pleasant. I highly recommend it!

We have AT&T and had good service here.

name: moreno gas
description: we filled up our gassbottles here because global gass didn't had the right American fitting. This place did. Costs 14,31 p. liter

name: end of the beach
description: We found this place  after visiting the first beach mentioned here. The first was ok but noisy, locals with loud music. therefor we drove to the end of the beach. We asked if we could stay in front of palapa and if it was safe. No problem. Didn't have to pay, only if we wanted to use chairs and table would be 100peso. We didn't need them. Totally quiet, only the sound of the sea!

name: pemex
description: Pemex and supermarkt. Guys, who put gasoline,  acted a bit weird but seems to be ok. Didn't sleep here butthink its possible.

name: gulf restplace
description: this is a restarea for truckers but they let rv's and campertrucks in. spotless bathrooms hot showers and 24 h.security. paid 150peso  will find out how quiet it is

name: near finca hotel
description: paid 5 peso for filling watertank.selfservice easy and cheap 24 horas service

name: Forest spot
description: Nice big parking lot in the forest on the way to a view point

name: Shower
description: Nice hot and good pressure showers for 50 pesos/2 persons. They offer also rooms and camping, we didn't stay for the night

name: Luna Clean lavanderia
description: Lavanderia with very friendly staff! Prices are fair, wash and dry for about 100 pesos. Free wifi! We were here around lunch time and they invited us to consume our lunch in their garden just behind the shop!

name: purificadora Las Palmas
description: water kiosk. self serve. $10 pesos to fill a garrafón. only takes coins. if you need a fraction of a garrafón you can just put in the money you need.

name: On the breakwater near lighthouse
description:
Beautiful spot right under the beaconhouse. No services of any kind. Strong Telcel. Quite a few fishermen and locals nearby during the day but utterly silent at night. Wasn't bothered, locals were friendly. Felt safe.

It's not big rig friendly - they should use the big sandlot mentioned right near by. I would think the max vehicle size would be a full sized pickup, or maybe a SWB Sprinter. The access is easy enough (2WD), but turning around at the end would be impossible for big vehicles.

name: Behind the Dunes
description:
Nice place to stay behind the dunes. 100m to the beach.
Could be crowded at the weekends, but other days quiet.

name: Gratitude Coffee Makers
description: Excellent fresh coffee! They also sell whole bean or ground. We have purchased several bags of their Veracruz and it’s absolutely delicious. They’re also at the Saturday/Tuesday market, four blocks away. Highly recommend!

name: San Pedro purificadora
description: Standard purificadora with super friendly staff - get the impression they're not super used to seeing tourists! Open Monday through Sunday

name: Marina for Wale Shark Tours
description:
Would NOT recommend this tour.

 After a lot of research we booked a Wale Shark Tour with DC Explorer. 
It costs 130 US$ (Tour) + 15 US$ (Marine Reserve Entry fee) per person. 
Includes breakfast, drinks, snorkeling with Wale Sharks (May-September) and lunch at Playa Norte in Isla Mujeres (sandwiches, ceviche).

The crew member takes a video of you while you snorkel with the Wale shark. Without telling you anything about the costs up front the agency then wants you to pay 80 US$ for this video, which is way too expensive for one or two videos of you! 
There are no nice video cuts of the whole trip, like getting in the boat (the start), ride with the boat (which can be fun), the snorkeling itself and the lunch break close to the beach of Isla Mujeres. 
But 80$ without getting a nice memories of the whole trip, just for sending a video from underwater, without any work of editing? NO WAY!
The worst about all of it is that the guide told us she would send us the video for a tip. So we tipped and left our email address. In the end we received an Email telling us to pay 80$ for the video. There is always a new scam to experience I guess.


I in general don't understand why they ask for tips. They make us pay twice. 

The captains job is to bring us safely to the destination and back. 
So we already paid for this (130$).

The crews job is to make the trip as memorable as possible. They should be friendly, cheerful and helpful. Prepare food and drinks and what else the tour offers. 
So we paid for this either (130$). 

What would not include the paid costs would be if the crew member would do me a favour and record me with MY OWN actioncam. Then I understand that this is an extra service and would be happy to tip. 

But other then that. NO SORRY agency. Pay your employees yourself with the money your already demanded from us!

name: Cactus forest overlook
description: A nice quiet spot overlooking a cactus forest.  Not too far off 1. Breezy. Not too hot actually perfect for temps.  Cool at night.  A 20 mi. Drive to the ocean and conejo surf spot.

name: Free Parking and playground
description:
Stayed there for 2 nights and it was quite and felt safe..
The place is right next to the "Centro de Salud" Health center.
About 200 mts towars the town almost next to a bar called Tepakilia there is a small hotel and store and they rent showers in $ 35 pesos

name: Street in front of the Francisco Goitia  museum
description: Stayed there for 2 nights, Nice neighborhood in front of a nice park.

name: Street next to river
description: Stayrd there for 2 nights, great spot next to the river under the trees, 50 mts from the Mismaloya beach. Quite spot. Busy during the day so you must get there early to find a place to park

name: Agua Purificadora Manantial
description: Purificadora staffed by ridiculously friendly folk. Paid $10 for 26l of water and they even patched two bottles with splits in for free - and then gave us presents of seasonal fruit and veg, and samplers! Lovely people. Think this is the only purificadora in Tapijulapa - there's an auto-fill option for garrafones if you get here out of hours.

name: Campo y aqua caliente
description: This is a wonderful camping in the National park of barranca del cobre. The road to this place is 19km dirt road with some difficult spots (it took us an hour to get there on 2WD - would recommend 4WD), but the reward is great! We stayed two nights for 360 pesos. There are multiple level spots under the trees with bbq and there is a hot spring fed pool that is very relaxing. The people do run this place are very nice. We felt this was a local secret, because it was so quiet. There is no restaurant but there is a small shop. Best to bring some food of your own. Can highly recommend this place!

name: Turnoff to campo y agua caliente
description: Could serve as a wild camping spot, but post it as the beginning of the dirt road to campo y agua caliente camping spot.

name: Servigas
description: Filled our propane bottles here for 14.24 pesos per liter.

name: Carnitas los Alteños 3
description: this truck stop has large restaurant that cooks carnitas and chicken out front in extremely large pots.   There is buffet or menu. Out back is large area to spend the night with restaurant as a sound barrier from trucks and road noise. It also has picnic tables and kids swings.

name: La Bamba Surfcamp
description:
La Bamba Surfcamp is a really nice place with a few cabanas and a clean toilet with tp, shower & electricity.
Nice level grass to park or pitch a tent. We tent camped for 50 per person. Enough space for a van. Very friendly owners and a friendly dog.

name: El Jardín de Dios
description: Lovely botanical garden run by 8 siblings, each of which are responsible for their own section - founded by their grandfather, who allegedly lived to 117 years old! We paid $50pp for a tour of around an hour or a little more, with the knowledgeable guide showing us a multitude of plants and flowers and describing their properties - genuinely fascinating, with lots of chances to touch, smell and taste. Turn up the steep road and drive to the top. Highly recommended.

name: Centro de Conservación para la Investigación y Atención del Manarí
description: Manatee conservation centre. If they have time  they're happy to give people tours of the centre and explain the work they do (looking after the manatees, monitoring the lake population, raising awareness to help their conservation etc); they appreciate a small donation or gift of some local veg to feed the manatees. At the time of our visit they had two young ones they were caring for and preparing for an attempted release (they say there have only been two successful attempts in Mexico so far) - at least one is likely to be there for the next three years as it's a slow process! Go give them some love, they do good work and could use some support! And the manatees are fat bags of cuteness.

name: Tortas de la Tortuga
description: Homemade Mexican food. Martin is very friendly and a very good cook. Prices are reasonable. I highly recommend this place.

name: Taller Mecánico Ely
description:
Great option for any arrangement of your van. We contacted "Edi" by phone and he assisted us on the street giving a fantastic service, later we had to take the van to the workshop and he fixed a piece that was very difficult to find in the entire city of Oaxaca and much of the country. They are in the process of expanding the workshop. A very professional treatment and good family of this workshop without a doubt a good option for any traveler.

——————————————————————

Genial opcion para cualquier arreglo de tu van. contactamos con "Edi" por telefono y nos asistio en la calle dando un servicio fantástico, más tarde tuvimos que llevar la van al taller y nos arregló una pieza que era muy dificil de encontrar en toda la ciudad de Oaxaca y gran parte del país. Estan en proceso de ampliar el taller. Un trato muy profesional y buena familia la de este taller sin duda una buena opcion para cualquier viajero.

name: São José da Coroa Grande
description: Lugar muito tranquilo e calmo, vários supermercados, farmácia, restaurante,pitzzaria, policlínica moradores bem receptivos,uma pequena vila de pescadores, banheiro público com chuveiro para banho,tem água,a energia se consegue com facilidade, estacionamento 0800, passamos 1 mês estacionados

name: Mazunte entry sign
description: In this place you can park behind the Mazunte sign. On the day is a fresh spot to be safe from the sun and in the night is quiet (later from 11pm, when the restaurants are closed).

name: Cascada del arbol
description:
beautiful place with grass, next to the river, very quiet, we stayed here with our combi and it is very cool. Rv's can fit too but I don't think big rigs. There is no electricity but there is a lot of peace...
---
hermoso lugar con pasto, al lado del río, muy tranquilo, nosotros nos quedamos aca con nuestra combi y está muy padre. También pueden entrar Rv pero no creo que grandes "rigs". No hay energía eléctrica pero si mucha paz...

name: Los 4 Pulques
description:
Hotel with rooms, camping site, parking, wifi and good showers with hot water. Large cars can enter.
The site is very quiet, it is attended by its Owners Daniel and Angélica, they are very good people who provide very good attention.
They sell homemade pulque from nearby communities, you can go with them to know the pulque route and explore it with local people.
highly recommended place.
---
Hotel con habitaciones, sitio para acampar, estacionamiento, wifi y buenas regaderas con agua caliente. Pueden entrar carros grandes.
El sitio es muy tranquilo, está atendido por sus Dueños Daniel y Angélica, son muy buena gente que brindan muy buena atención. 
Venden pulque casero de comunidades cercanas, puedes ir con ellos a conocer la ruta del pulque y explorarla con la gente local.
lugar ampliamente recomendado.

name: Huerto 3 Marias
description:
beautiful place, well kept with a large camping area where all kinds of vehicles can enter. Ahead they have a cabin with rooms. They have showers with hot and cold water. They wanted to charge us 100 pesos per person but we were able to fix it for 50 pp.
Very quiet at night and it is right next to the river, a highly recommended place.
By the way, we came during the week, perhaps on weekends it is much busier.
---
hermoso lugar, bien cuidado con una gran área para acampar donde pueden entrar todo tipo de vehículos. Adelante tienen una cabaña con habitaciones. Tienen regaderas con agua caliente y fría. nos querían cobrar 100 pesos por persona pero pudimos arreglar por 50 pp. 
Muy tranquilo de noche y queda justo al lado del río, lugar super recomendable. 
Por cierto nosotros vinimos entre semana, quizás los fines de semana este mucho más concurrido.

name: Vera del rio
description:
This is a place that we found on the way to the El Tomatal dam. The river is beautiful, transparent and very calm.
We are going to spend the night here.
---
Este es un lugar que encontramos de camino a la presa de El Tomatal. El río es hermoso, transparente y muy tranquilo. 
Vamos a pasar la noche acá.

name: Walmart
description: Stayed here two nights in the Walmart parking lot. No height restrictions to enter this parking lot. Also a movie theatre with lots of subtitled (English audio) movies.

name: Peace Hostel
description:
great place, private rooms and dorms made from converted shipping containers, reasonably priced dorms (~mx300) In 2022 offseason. The setup of the dorms is very private, each bed has a separate entrance and space separated by curtains.

WiFi, coffee, continental breakfast, events most nights, ping pong, nice common areas, parking for about 4-5 cars or *small* trucks/vans + some motos, fairly central location, walking distance to supermarket 2 min) and malecon (10 minutes).

name: street parking in quiet area
description: street parking around a Park in a quiet résidentiel area. Protected from noise of main road, very quiet for a city location.

name: Las Bocas next to fishermen
description: Some places to Park on the beach. No sand flies today and some wind to refresh the RV.

name: Réservoir Beaudet
description:
Great location. Super nice trail for biking and walking. Restrooms @ 9 p.m. For small units. Dog not allowed on the slopes

Très bien situé. Super belle piste pour vélo et pédestre. Toilettes @ 21h. Pour petites unités. Chien non permis sur les pistes

name: Restaurante Las Adjuntas
description: After arriving at the nearby hot springs that were closed, night was quickly approaching, so we stopped at this restaurant and asked if we could park for the night. They were a super sweet couple and let us park in their parking area and use their restrooms. They did not ask for money, but we gave them 100pesos. They offered to take us to the hot springs by boat, but we left in the morning. The restaurant is on a beautiful point overlooking the lake, fishermen use the dock for boating and fishing. A great option if you're in the area!

name: Miguels' Posada
description:
After seeking via iOverlander, I saw in the comments somewhere that someone suggested Casa Verde. I messaged them, but they took too long to respond. In the meantime, we walked past this greenery-covered building with the word 'posada' out front and a phone number. The number did not work so we knocked on the door using their clever door knocker method. Miguel greeted us so warmly! He has three rooms with private baths, all overlooking the valley. There is also a pool. He is an architect and built this place himself - you can definitely tell, there's so much character. You can pull into the parking area, but maybe a 7' height max. There is also a whole floor, again open air and overlooking the valley that is a communal cooking area. About a 10 min walk to centro. I can't recommend this place enough. 600p per night for two people in a single with our dog, a little steep, but so worth it.

FYI, this town has insanely steep hills, we had to put the truck in 4L to get up certain streets.

name: Police Check
description: Police barricaded street and decided for us to be the ones to pull over.  Not sure if they were legit cops but didn't appear super legit. Told us they pulled us over because we didn't use our hazards, but let us go after a few minutes

name: Fiesta Inn
description: Free wifi, just need to use an email or social media account to log in.

name: Roaguía
description: Roaguía, just before Hierves el Agua. Take the highway from Oaxaca and the northern route through San Lorenzo. It is a dirt road but in good condition. At the end there is a parking area and the road is closed by chain. The locals told us that we have to pay 20 p.p.p.  We thought it was for entering the village but it was for the ride to the HeA by car. You can easily walk there (1km). We asked them if we could camp there in a car. The night was calm, the view great.

name: New facility, entry Chile - Customs & immigration
description: Brand new facility, with a messy entry as the line of trucks block the relevant lanes, just pass them wherever you can safely. The proces takes half an hour, Covid check is only the insurance and your C19. Very thorough car check!!

name: Moto servicios La Expista
description:
service for all kinds of bikes including big bikes from bmw, Harley, KTM etc.
i had a top end gasket fixed here and they seem very knowledgeable/precise about what they're doing.

name: Cabanas for Rent...
description: this appears to be a weekend party spot for the Mexicans so Friday Saturday maybe Sunday nights are not a good idea but during the week nobody is here and... they charged us 250 pesos... the bathroom supposedly has a shower haven't checked it out yet but the beach is just awesome

name: Pemex agua potable
description: There are two spots to get water at this station, but only the one in the picture has pressure. Filled up for free

name: Base Camp Hostel
description: Dorm 220 pesos, possible to park motorcyle inside, very friendly owners.

name: El Jarocho
description:
Very good tacos here. The proof is the long cue :) The cue actually got our attention, so we tried that Taquería. It was delicious! We wanted to come back for breakfast, but they only open in the evening from 7 pm. 
They have corn and wheat options. They are not the cheapest but very delicious. About 20 for a taco and about 44 for a wheat taco with cheese.

Enjoy!

name: El taco loco
description:
Excellent Taco restaurant specialized in sea food. not the average street taco
taco, ceviche, burito

name: zyanrooms
description:
a good hotel with all the necessary comforts (fridge, sink and kitchen area, TV) and nice people. the price is not super expensive. 400 pesos / night

un bon hôtel avec tout le confort nécessaire (frigo, évier et espace cuisine, télé) et des personnes sympas. le prix est pas super cher. 400 pesos / nuit

name: 7 Autos
description: Skilled specialist with all vintage classic cars. Walther is extremely helpful. We are driving our 1979 Ford class C motor home (V8 460) and limped into Saltillo yesterday. After going to a few mechanics who couldn’t help us I found Walther on google maps. He helped troubleshoot, let us park in front of his shop and went out of his way to secure parts and helped install. Great place!

name: Repsol (Oxxo)
description: Free water hose at the gas station! Very friendly people and loved to see the skoolie

name: Mariscos vianey
description: Mariscos place with decent prices - whole friend fish 160 pesos - ceviche camarón 260 pesos - super friendly service. Great food and it’s bring your own beer

name: Parque Paraiso
description: This spot is in a neighbourhood of many familys and kids, the Marine ground is just next to it. I found this spot because there where no other spots on te map in Champoton, without the Big Trucks passing by. This spot is pretty quiet and good for a night. Nothing special but quiet. Many little stores around.

name: Empty lot mext to Pemex
description: large open empty lot next to Pemex station. Good cafe across the street, Leys grocer down the road. We overnighted here in a 34ft motorhome towing a jeep. Road noise and a rest stop for truck drivers. we stayed over night as we dropped off our laundry. we needed rabies and 7 way vaccination boosters for our dogs, and grocery shopping. This was a great convenient stopover to accomplish many tasks from one location.

name: Atenguillo safe Riverside
description:
beautiful place next to the river, very quiet, cared for by local peasants, few people passing through here. At night very serene, you can enjoy millions of fireflies. Nearby lives a man who has horses and goats who share water to wash dishes.
---
hermoso lugar al lado del río, muy tranquilo, cuidado por los campesinos locales, poca gente pasando por aquí. De noche muy sereno, se pueden disfrutar millones de luciérnagas. Cerca vive un señor que tiene caballos y cabras que comparte agua para lavar trastes.

Telcel H+

Beautiful spot next to the river. Really quiet, the locals take care of this place. Few people going by. At night the silence is absolute and you can enjoy millions of fireflies. (in rainy season).

name: Petrolera Park
description:
Street parking all over the park. It is pretty quiet during the day, it gets busy after 4pm but other than that super nice!
The park is clean and there is a water faucet next to the benches.
I parked across the street of the Green Cabana café, it is a vegan café 10/10 and you can get signal from their Wi-Fi across the street (Password: GreenCabana)

name: Beautiful area overlooking the city
description:
There is a dirt road off of the highway and a large pull off area overlooking the city. Very wide open so any size of rig could fit here. We did have a 3 sets of police officers drive by and ask if we were okay. They told us that it was fine to park here and is safe. 

Also there is a little hiking trail up to a higher look off point but we came across a large copperhead snake so make sure your dogs are leashed up. 

2 bars of 4g telcel

name: La Palapa
description: Good option for lunch or dinner at the Carretera Cristóbal. Friendly staff, okay prices, yummy.

name: Baja Port Water
description:
Here is the actual location of Baja Port Water like stated in the other entry. 

$8 per 20l
Super friendly staff

name: Gas Vehicular
description:
Gas filling station. They filled our european bottle without any problems (we provided the US adapter). Fast and easy. 

Price: $11.66 per liter

name: Street Parking, overnight
description: Relatively flat overnight street parking for Sprinter.  Traffic noise dies down after 10.

name: Jixom Car Wash
description: 200 pesos (plus propina/tip) for an excellent car wash. 2 weeks of Baja dust, and years of grime and sand cleaned off. Make sure to tip the workers who don’t earn much.

name: Pemex/Oxxo
description:
Stayed one night here during transit to CDMX. 
Big, partially illuminated gravel parking lot next to Pemex/Oxxo. Relatively quiet (road noise nearby but manageable).
Very clean restrooms for MXN 5.
Couple of restaurants also available.
Suitable for small and big rigs. Not suitable for tents (unless you are hardcore).
Felt very safe.
Parking lot is hidden behind Oxxo. Drive through on the right side of Oxxo.

name: Valle del Ovni
description:
This is a valley in Biosfera del Cielo. They charge the entrance at $10 pesos per person per day… here they have 6 cabins with WC and hot shower…

Also if you camp, there are only WC, no showers…

name: Impetus
description: A very relaxed Cafe / breakfast /lunchroom. Modern interior, no wifi, but good coffee and food, friendly staff.

name: Farmacia De Autopartes Mendoza
description: Luis helped me to replace the front suspension arms on a Mitsubishi L300 4x4. Beforehand I got hold of the necessary parts, so it was only mechanical work, but it was done well. Besides mechanical work Luis is specialised in gasoline fuel systems. It is close to the center, lots of other refaccionarias are close by if something else is needed that Luis doesn't have.

name: Tavernier
description: This is a good mechanic for work on all types of cars. It is an old fashioned garage with complete workshop. Lathe, press, welding. I was here for repair on the steering and suspension parts. Alberto is very helpful and has a lot of knowledge. He even made a small improvement on the skid plate.

name: GOAND Automotriz
description: Highly recommended! The great mechanics did a great job, found the solution to our problem very quickly and changed the broken brake pad. All people there were very friendly, trustworthy and helpful! We are happy that we found them!

name: Parking verde cerca de Aurrera
description:
large parking area near the Aurrera. Open Wi-Fi. Baths in Aurrera. Large area of green grass. Pretty quiet.
gran zona de parking cerca del Aurrera. Wifi abierto. Baños en Aurrera. Gran zona de pasto verde. Bastante silencioso.

name: Malibu Beach Sur
description: Well worn RV park that has seen more glorious days.  But still, the beach and ocean views are spectacular.  Only a few people (residents) when we came.  Quiet (loud surf when tide is rising) and peaceful.  Flat spots to park on edge of cliff/beach and more flat spots a few meters away.

name: Hotel del bosque
description: Nice clean hotel in Torreón. English speaking host. Good location near Parque Bosque. A/C. Breakfast supplied. Hot water. Very quiet neighborhood.

name: Villa Margarita
description: Private w/ AC & bathroom 247q. Couldn’t find anything cheaper with AC (41’C today!) in our walk around. Wider street with parking, we were able to park right below our balcony, so we can keep an eye on it sort of.

name: Parking Jirech
description: Left our truck here for 3 nights, was safe on our return! We also left a bag outside the truck and Antonio kept it safe for us until we came back. 50/night (started at 80/night).

name: Katok- sausages, jams, cheeses
description: Awesome selection of takeaway uncooked sausages, had about 10 kinds. Not too expensive. Also ribs, hams, cheeses, goat cheese, jams. The restaurant was great too!

name: Pull-out en route to Tolantongo
description:
Small pull-out next to road leading to Tolantongo.
Quiet, very little traffic. Stunning views.
A little bit of Telcel 4G service.

name: estacionamiento publico
description:
Free public parking in front of the central park, a few meters from the beach. it is safe to sleep, there is a bit of noise from a nearby bar but it is very spacious

---------------------------
estacionamiento publico gratis frente al parque central, a unidad metros de la playa. es seguro para dormir, hay un poco de ruido por un bar cerca pero está muy espacioso

name: regaderas 20p
description:
showers 20 pesos and wc 10 pesos. very clean, close to the beach and the park


----------------------
regaderas 20 pesos y wc 10 pesos. muy limpio, cerca de la playa y del parque

name: Laundromat
description:
Very friendly and professional laundromat. It cost 21 peso per kg. Owners spoke a little English and were very curious about where we had been. We dropped off at 10 am and had our laundry back by 6. 

Parking is a little tight for big rigs but street parking is available.

name: El Molinito
description:
Staffed purificadora, friendly and helpful. There's an automatic filler-upper too that's 24/7. Charged me $20 for 26l.

Just across the road from this spot, on the corner. Parking might be tricky with a big rig.

name: Oxxo ATM
description: ATM inside oxxo right after the FMM and Tip Office

name: Toll booth
description: Toll booth 45 pesos for suv and camper going south bound

name: Gas and oxxo
description: Going south bound gas station on the left with an oxxo attached.

name: Flat Spot near Autodromo
description:
Quite spot in the middle of nowhere. A few minutes beside the mainroad. Follow the autodrom sign. Good dirt road. 
Movistar 3G

name: Igloo Kokolo
description:
Hello Travelers.
A beautiful place, nature and peace, many birds, hummingbirds and butterflies. View on Lake Chapala, view of the beautiful sunrise and sunset.
The place has space for 4 or 5 Van, combi or Class B motorhome trucks only. It has showers {cold water sometimes hot}, dry toilets, water tap to fill your tank, a shared kitchen, gas stove and oven, a freezer to put your food but you must bring your ice pack. There is no 110V electricity, only 12v system, Usb input. The place has cabins for rent, a large Palapa for yoga and other types of activities.
The price is 100 pesos for the Truck and 50 pesos per Person per Day, free for children up to 12 years old.
IMPORTANT: ONLY RESERVATION BY PHONE
Contact: Salvador {+52} 33 1835 8026

name: Playa Hermosa
description:
Nice place to sleep or spend the day. Quiet, by the sea
---
Lindo lugar para dormir o pasar el dia. Tranquilo, al borde del mar

name: Cenote Canunchen
description:
Beautiful cenote with combination of natural and artificial light. They open at 8 am which is perfect since other cenotes in this area open at 11 am. This cenote is in the end of the road.

Opening hours: 8am- 5 pm
Clean toilets and showers
Area with tables 
Nice personal
Camping possible in the parking lot, please ask the guarding person

name: Pemex
description: Gas station heading south bound with an oxxo

name: Top of the hill
description: Was a very nice place, but run down now. Perfect for a camping car or van. A bit steep to get up there but very calm place. Free.

name: Gas station
description: Gas station heading south bound right after toll

name: Chevron
description: Chevron heading southbound. Very friendly

name: Walmart
description: We stayed a night in this Walmart parking lot. Parking lot is free to enter and has lots of parking available. I talked to the security officer and he said it is safe and fine to spend a few nights here. Police patrol the lot from time to time.

name: Masaja Park
description:
We spent 3 quiet nights, it is very safe, nobody bothered us, on the contrary, there are people who came to say hello and gave us mangoes. There is a man on a bicycle who passes by in the afternoon to sell bread, they are very good if you see him you have to try it.

Pasamos 3 noches tranquilas, es muy seguro, nadie nos molestó, al contrario hay personas que se acercaron a saludar y nos regalaron mangos. Hay un señor en bicicleta que pasa por las tardes a vender pan, son muy ricos, si lo ves tienes que probarlo.

name: Winding road pull off spot
description: Traveling north back onto the highway, this spot with some tire tracks appeared just as night began falling. It is fair to say I held my breath a few times and kept it in 1st gear a long time crawling on this road. 4wd&high clearance, as there are some steeper rough pitches, sandy flats, and a continuous unimproved quality on this road. The spot could take 2-3 rigs max. Spacious and protected turn-off spots are rare on this road. Some remote ranch property off to the south, otherwise, heard no one, saw no one.

name: Hotel Capital O Los Herederos
description: Decent hotel: air conditioning, hot water (inconsistent), good water pressure, wifi (slow & inconsistent). I've stayed here twice in the last six months and had one room that was good and one room that was a bit of a disaster. Think Motel 6 Quality.

name: Laguna de los illusiones
description: A pretty nice spot next to a big street, but far enough that it's not that loud. no one bothered us here and it's under trees in the morning, so a good shadowy place, for no sauna car. It's next to a police station, cat included. Some cars pass by during the day but not too bad, I liked it.

name: Parking Lot
description: Big parking area next to a school, was told by several locals that this is a good safe place to park. Stayed one night and there were a couple of other vans here with me. No problems. not great for big rigs, okay cell service (most of San Pancho has none, so that's pretty much the same here)

name: Parking Place Parque Guadiana
description:
big parking place in front of the huge Parque Guadiana. We spent one night here under the week and it was very calm. 
It's about 2 km from the down town city.
You can walk in the big Park, it's very beautiful there.

name: Forest Camping La Ciudad
description: We been here for 3 days in the forest. the Police came and said it's safe and okay to stay here. it's close to the city but far enough to have a calm place. 4g telcel internet.

name: Joya Crater
description:
beautiful Crater, you can hike around. it's a little bit tricky to reach out to this campspot.
you have to drive the Street "Routa al Crater" for a couple of kilometers until there is a gate on your left side with a sign "joya crater". Please close the gate after you drive inside. 
take the left road and then straight up to the hill. especially in the rainy season you will need 4x4 at least high clearance also in the dry season.

name: Bomberos and Park
description: it's a nice and quiet place for a night. I don't know how it is on the weekend. Good Telcel signal. And better then Pemex. Friendly Neighborhood.

name: Concordia at the lake
description: Best Spot for us after 3 months in Guatemala. A big lake with a huge flat for Camping. The locals are super friendly and welcome. It was quiet and safe all day and night. The locals said the area is very safe and calm. There are some Restaurants close by. Check Out Doña Irma, they have great Ceviche and fried fish from the lake. They told us we were the first tourists in this Area and a Family Invited us to a Dinner with Ants 🐜 😅 a local speciality They have here once a Year. It is definitely worth the ride, the streets are good and paved in both directions. if you pass through, from here in direction to the Guatemalan border you have to take two "ferrys"or rafts😅 to cross the lake. they go every 30-60min and charge 50-100 Peso, depending on the size of your Vehicle. 4GLTE Aviable may wifi at the restaurants. we didn't check. Lake has warm and nice water.

name: Mussel conservation area
description: First site is a gravel pull out on a bluff. Quiet no services, pack it in, pack it out. Great for small rig.

name: Surf Camp
description: Several small huts, pit toilets, shower (questionable).  Plenty of places to park and camp.  Several fire rings.  Right on gorgeous beach.

name: beach via dunes approx. 6 km East of Bahia Tortugas
description: This is 50m from high tide situated behind dunes. it is 20m from the road. the pad is large and created by a road grader. our rig is 11m long weighing 8164 kg. the pad is holding us well, it will not in a rain storm. approx. 6km from the town of Bahia Tortugas where you will find a nice grocery store "Aborrotes anaiD" we found almost everything on our grocery list. We love peace and quiet and this place provides it. if you have a composting toilet and plenty of solar stay for a while.

name: Road block by locals
description: Road block (chain) by locals, no way to pass with own vehicle. Kind and respectfull people. Park your car here and pay 20 pesos per person to be transfered by tuktuk to the official parking of Hievre el Agua. Other road trough the mountains seems open

name: Speedbrake - parts for brakes and clutches
description: Speedbrake is well stocked shop with parts for brakes and clutches. Within 3 hours, they rework handbrake shoes if needed. Prices are reasonable.

name: Park front of Grupo Tomza
description:
Nice place to have a rest for a little pic-nic & perfect grass to lay your Yoga mat and do your stretching. 
Road is right next to it, yet there are loads of birds, butterflies, fruit trees & greenery. 
Safe as the petrol station is right next to it on the other side of the road. We asked and the town a km ahead is Calle 80 (even though it does not appear as a town in Google maps).

name: Lavanderia 24h self service
description:
At the Walmart (open 24h) there is a self service lavanderia. Also open 24h.

1) Buy card at the machine (10 pesos)
2) Recharge card with amount needed
3) Washer and dryer 25 pesos/cycle

Cycle duration depends on program selection.

For washers, only "Normal" program works but you can add extra rinse and change water temperature. For dryers, only "heavy duty" seems to work.

Place is clean and seemingly popular with locals. So try to avoid peak hours.

name: Tacos Chiquirringui
description: Taco restaurant at end of dead end street.  Ask for potato stuffed with shrimp and mushrooms!

name: playpong
description: restaurant-bar with pinpong tables, mexican and international food,snacks, happy hour from 5pm to 9pm, pinpong tournament every thursday, so cool and fun, taco tuesday (2×1 in tacos), great breakfast, really good  and well served

name: Public Shower CLEAN!
description: ist a public shower pretty clean for 21pesos, on google you can find it under Regaderas Publico.

name: Inter Motors S.A. Mercedes and Freightliner Service
description: We came here with our Mercedes Truck, to get some damage at the suspension done. Also we had some issues with our air conditioning. We had the problems fixed within a few hours. Very helpful stuff, that speaks English.  Excellent and professional service! Very recommended

name: Rio Teapa
description: We stayed here one night, no one came to bother us, very beautiful place next to the river, very quiet at night, just the river and crickets sound.

name: Playita junto al rio
description:
Nice and safe place to spend the night. We slept here 2 nights with the doors wide open and one feels calm. people were nice to us. It is possible to enter the river and take baths in it, although we prefer to do it in an area with semi-flooded trees. There is shade for the vehicle but there are palapas to take refuge. nearby there are shops. Mobile Internet is very weak. At night you sleep very well and only hear the sound of the fishermen working in their canoes.
Lindo y seguro lugar para pasar la noche. Dormimos aqui 2 noches con las puertas totalmente abiertas y uno de siente tranquilo. las personas fueron amables con nosotros. Es posible entrar al río y tomar baños en el aunque preferimos hacerlo en una zona con árboles semi inundados. Hay sombra para el vehículo pero si para refugiarse hay palapas. cerca hay tiendas. Internet móvil es muy débil. De noche se duerme muy bien y solo se escucha el sonido de los pescadores trabajando en sus canoas.

name: control militar
description:
They stopped us at this point after making a long line of about 40 minutes. They only asked to see the vehicle from the outside and asked us where we came from and where we are going. Very friendly people.
nos pararon en este punto luego de hacer una larga fila de unos 40 minutos aproximadamente. Solo pidieron ver el vehículo desde fuera y nos preguntaron de donde venimos y a donde vamos . Personas muy amables.

name: GasMaz Station
description: One of the nicest rest areas I've ever seen. if you fill up your tank here they'll let you stay overnight. Free wifi, TV, couches, even a laundromat if you need. Dog walk area, 24 hour security.

name: Street parking
description:
Very quiet block to park on. It is right beside a baseball field and there is a municipal police station just across the Main Street. Very quiet in the evenings. Police patrol and nobody bothered us. 30 minute walk to the main mercados in the centro. 

Also, be sure to check out the baseball stadium for a baseball game. Was a ton of fun and tickets are between 2-7$.

name: mijaus
description: really good Chinese food , a little restaurant.just take away. 140 peso for a guisado and rice.big portion.

name: Parque Los Salones
description:
River, trees, BBQ spots and even a treehouse more surely used as ladies room. Just friendly locals.  Accessible to any type of car. Tent easy to install.
.....
Hay río, hay árboles, hay asadores y un árbol que cumple de WC. Espacios no muy planos para montar casa, pero seguro si buscas encuentras. Pasamos una tarde de picnic. Pero promete gran espacio de camping. Fogata al lado del Río. (Cuidado en invierno parece hojarasca muy inflamable)

name: Mirador La Roca Entrance
description:
Entrance to the walking path. Natural walk to a high point of the hil, rocky trail. Special shoes make it easier. You can park here and start walking up.
.....
Entrada a la ruta que lleva al Mirador La roca. Parquea aquí y comienzas la caminata por camino rocoso, en temporada de lluvias hay lodo, zapatos especiales facilitan la subida. Se prometen grandes vistas.

name: Mirador la roca
description: Top of the hill. We brought our food for a rocky picnic. Nice views of San Cristobal and the surroundings, in the middle of the week no one around. You can start walking from Don Lauro red tori (we walked out from his entrance) although you can drive a bit more high to the other spot marked on iOverlander and start walking up following the red arrows and once you make it to the “Corazon de la montaña “ (a 30 min walk) there’s different trails up to different spots. Not hard, but with a stick and good trail shoes it may get easier. Of course bring water this is a hike.

name: Estacion de gas
description: Gas station next to the road in Ciudad del Carmen. Good price.

name: Posto Pratão
description: Bad place, 10 reais a bath and cold water with bugs in the box, horrible service, place without structure for landing in the car.

name: Tintoretto a Dryclean TX
description:
Full service laundry 
20pesos / kg
Monday to Friday 9am to 6pm
Saturday 9am to 2pm

name: Autoservicio Mechanex
description:
They changed our fuel pump and some electrical issues. fair prices. The owner is part of a motorcycle club called Never alone on the road. highly recommended
--
nos cambiaron bomba de combustible y algunos temas eléctricos. precios justo. El dueño es parte de un club de motos llamado Jamás solo en el camino. muy recomendado

name: Aurrera Bodega parking lot
description:
We had to stop here because our roof rack was damaged, fortunately there is a Welding guy just on the opposite of the street, a store with car parts too. 

I asked someone in the Store if its ok to park here for a night he said, si no problema. Nothing beautiful but we felt safe.

name: Playa Bruja
description:
On the beach you can ask for Don Amador, he will very kindly assist you and charge you either for the stay on the beach or even outside his house. The attention was excellent to the point that he told us where we could buy food at a reasonable price and allow us to bathe in his house.
It is recommended to take everything possible to deal with the mosquitoes, there are too many. Totally recommended.

Español
En la playa pueden preguntar por Don Amador, el muy amablemente los atenderá y les cobrará ya sea por la estancia en la playa o incluso afuera de su casa. La atención fue excelente al punto que nos indico donde podíamos comprar comida a un precio razonable y permitirnos bañarnos en su casa.
Se recomienda llevar todo lo posible para tratar con los mosquitos, son demasiados.
Recomendable totalmente.

name: G500
description: Adding because this had significantly cheaper fuel than any other in town (I saw one other at the same price somewhere) - $19.99 for regular when most others were at $22.19. Three pesos a litre adds up to a lot!

name: Hotel Uruapan
description: queen size bed room is 450 a night. good enough for a night, nothing fancy  . hot water available, wifi good (Speedtest 20 ) . secure parking for any vehicle

name: Pollos al Carbón estilo Sinaloa
description: Delicious roasted chicken at a great price. I paid 75 pesos for a half chicken. Served with rice, beans, tortillas and salsa.

name: Cabañas Sarylu
description: 350 pesos for a cabaña with nice view and private basic restroom and bathroom. No warm water but you can warn some with an electrical apparel they give you.

name: Tripwagen
description:
Tripwagen - Repair and camping of combis.
Cristian and his family are super welcoming to travelers. We were able to park, use the bathroom and share with other travelers.
---
Tripwagen - Reparación y camperizacion de combis.
Cristian y su familia son super acogedores con los viajeros. Pudimos aparcar, utilizar el baño y compartir con otros viajeros.

name: Parque central
description:
On two sides of the square there is parking diagonally, you are in the center, some music at night but nothing serious, we stayed two days and there is free Wi-Fi from the park and from a telecommunications center that works perfectly
---
Sobre dos lados de la plaza hay parking en diagonal, estás en pleno centro, algo de música por la noche pero nada grave, estuvimos dos días y hay wifi gratuito del parque y de una central de telecomunicaciones q funciona perfecto.

name: Parque central
description:
There is parking alongside the Park in the town center. Some music in the night but not too serious. We were here two days with free wifi.  
.....
Sobre dos lados de la plaza hay parking en diagonal, estás en pleno centro, algo de música por la noche pero nada grave, estuvimos dos días y hay wifi gratuito del parque y de una central de telecomunicaciones q funciona perfecto.

name: Posto seguro
description:
We spent the night here and there were many trucks stopped too, we found it very quiet.
--- 
Passamos a noite aqui e tinha muitos caminhões parados também, achamos bem tranquilo.

name: Hotel Guillen Jr.
