description: Inexpensive, clean hotel.  Stayed for two nights. Has great secure parking where you have your own private garage attached to your room! The garage fits a car or minivan but not large enough for bigger rigs.  Still,  it's safe,  secure and very convenient. Friendly and professional staff.  $37/night for weekdays and $50/night for weekends. A bit of road noise, but the comfy bed made up for it and I felt safe. Free Wi-Fi (very good connection),  big screen TV,  and air con included.

name: Hacienda Mucuyché
description: Really nice visit of cenotes with a tour guide who gives some information about the history of the hacienda too. But quite expensive: 690 pesos per person (for a 2 to 3 hour tour). No possibility to visit the cenotes without guide. Not allowed to stay at the parking lot over night

name: Agua Purificada
description: Agua purificada - really helpful service. No hose, but we brought a funnel from across the road 10peso per Garafon

name: SmartWater
description: Purified Water dispenser by the gallon or 20liter jug. Coin operated. 24 hrs a day. Right next to a grocery store and across from a propane refill station. Can also buy soap, detergent and softener by the liter!

name: Don Huerto Restaurant
description: Really cute restaurant along the highway at the campground.  Across the street from the river. Beautiful view and cute palapas. Good food at reasonable prices

name: Casa Cervecera at Los Pinos
description: Bar next to a restaurant. Pretty busy Friday night with live band. 590 pesos for a half rack (massive) pork ribs with potato and chips/tortillas, two margaritas and a beer. Very fast service. Bar is pretty new. Restaurant is established. We would give it 4/5 stars.

name: Street parking
description: Kinda sketchy but no knock in the night. 3 vans here. Parked on one-way street a block from Cabo Wabo Cantina and a few blocks from clubs downtown.  Drug deals happening next door through the fence, and some drunks walking around late, but no issues. stayed one night. Recommend Ramiros Tacos near here. The park is full of cool rocks and next door is a cool place to oversee the city.

name: ZooVet clinica veterinaria
description:
Best place to get your pet checked out and ready to cross the border to Guatemala. In Palenque they dared to ask $800-$1000p for a health certificate. Here only $250p and the people were much nicer too!

Listed their Whatsapp below.
+52 916 111 5747

name: De frente pro mar
Servicio automotriz Cabañas
description: Señor Rafael Cabaña and his team are specialist in suspensions, brakes and batteries. They really saved us on a Saturday to find and adapt a suspension part  that was not available in Mexico. Great work in no time ; did not hesitate to work after opening hours to have the work done. Very reasonable price!

name: Posada Karina
description: Small hotel with rooms to rent. There is a small secured parking lot (no big rigs) if there is some space. We paid 400 pesos for a room for a night, two people/one bed. Hot shower and very good wifi. Towels and shampoo+soap given. Less than 10 minutes walk to the zocalo. There are a few restaurants around the place. This is the cheapest place we found around here.

name: Aqua Express
description: Purified water dispenser by the garafon 10pesos. Bring your container. Right next door to some awesome freshly made tortillas de Luvi

name: Parque Los Columpios
description:
Very nice park of 14-hectare full of lpine trees, they charge 25p per person for entry to spend the day and if you want to stay to sleep or camp after 7:00 p.m. 50p per person per day.
There is no Wi-Fi, no signal, there are bathrooms they charge 5p, there are no showers, there are games, swings, food and drink, grills, horses, etc.

Español 
Parque muy bonito lleno de pinos de 14 hectáreas, cobran 25p x persona de entrada para pasar el día y si quieres quedarte a dormir o acampar a partir de las 19 hs 50p x persona x día.
no hay wifi, si señal, hay baños cobran 5p, no hay regaderas, hay juegos, columpios, comida y bebida, asadores, caballos, etc

name: G & G Guesthouse
description:
A very beautiful hotel with a big variety of rooms. Rooms go from 10.000 to 25.000. There is a kitchen available and the views are amazing! 

+250787475380 or +25789381846

name: Hotel “Quinta La Herradura”
description: Small, family hotel in San Fernando, Tamaulipas, about a hundred miles after the border heading south. Motel-style rooms around a parking area, a small pool and some shaded gardens and walkways. Clean and comfortable. Parking seems secure, in a gated and walled compound, and is suitable for small vans, pick-ups and motorcycles (probably not RVs…) 630 Mex$ (US$30) for a room with two beds and a bathroom. A useful stop if headed south and don’t want to push far on Day 1.

name: Agua Alcalina de Cinco Filtros
description:
The cleanest water in Morelia I’ve found. 8.5ph

There are 5 filters: particle filter, activated carbon, reverse osmosis, UV, alkalinizing, and ozone.

A lovely couple runs the business, and I got a chance to look at the filter setup in person. They have new state-of-the-art filtration and alkalinizing system. It’s only 2 months old as I’m writing this.

$.25 USD / Gallon (5 mxn / galon)
$.50 USD / 10L (10 mxn / medio garrafón)
$1 USD / 20L (20 mxn / garrafón)

name: Hotel Hacienda Baruk
description: This is a hotel and an “RV parking” lot. We came for the lot, but ended up staying 2 nights in the hotel. They let us plug in the van to recharge though. The rooms are nice, comfy beds, buffet breakfast and they serve food all day, pool, gym, and we got massages (800 pesos 50min). The room was 1300pesos and more than sufficient. Very nice staff. Went on a tour of the mine, and city…400pesos but slow. We would have rathered exploring ourselves. Nice views from the tram, but you can see the city in one day. There is A LOT of traffic noise here at the hotel, and with all the engine braking of the big rigs, I think camping in the parking lot would have been really hard. But, they do let you use the bathrooms, showers, pool, gym, etc for 550 pesos per night. And it is very safe, with cameras, and it is all gated.

name: casa caminando lento
description: With enough space to park They can lend you a shower and a bathroom and they can access it if you need to make some repairs

name: Pollo Brujo
description: Excellent grilled chicken restaurant, Sinaloa style.

name: panoramic viewpoint parking
description: a free place yo sleep, un very quiet on te night. i stayed 1 night and everynight they're air

name: CantoCamp
description:
Nice new big place for camping and they rent some pretty Cabañas as well. Lots of space and stuff to do if you have kids. Cabañas are around 900$ per night.
For camping they told us it is 150$ per person per night including the bathroom and a pit with firewood but without shower. It was too expensive for not having a shower even if the place is nice and clean so we negotiated it to 100$/ppn plus they were kind enough to lent us a shower from a cabaña.
The place has a lot of potential since is the only one for camping close to the archeological site, is clean and and well made, they also have internet but you need to ask.

name: Bolis de Yogurt by Carlos
description: My friend Carlos, who hosted me during my bicycle trip in Isla Aguada, uses a wheelchair due to a serious injury and now sells frozen yogurt treats at the toll crossing to help take care of his family. He is an incredible and generous person, and is also planning to go on a bicycle trip on a hand-pedaled bicycle next year. If you see him, please buy some bolis de yogurt to support him (they’re also very refreshing in the heat). Thank you!

name: Milk Brewpub
description: Kitchy restaurant in the old town. Cool decor, outdoor seating, with lots of cocktail and beer options. Menu was diverse, and original. We had a Thailand salad with coconut fried fish, shrimp, oranges and peanuts on it, and a ‘baguette’ with bbq chicken on it. With 3 margaritas, a beer, and a shot of tequila, the dinner came to $40US. We would go back happily!

name: Small Repair Superstars
description: These guys are truly superstars!  They work out of a closet sized shop on the corner of the Soriana parking lot. They fixed my back window that would no longer open or close. While I was waiting, I watched them do locks,  door handles that wouldn't open, and other cars with the same issue as mine.  And they only charged me $800 pesos for the work,  which wasn't easy since it was so jammed. They were honest,  upstanding guys and one spoke a bit of English which helped.  I highly recommend!!

name: Motel Princess
description:
Had a wonderful stay here! The owner is the sweetest woman. The rooms look brand new (they’re about a year old). Everything was impeccably clean. A/C worked like a charm, comfy beds, decent wifi for the town that has no signal and relies only on wifi. 
They just got Starlink wifi here! It’s not perfect. Can get slow and comes and goes if too many people are using it but I was able to work well during the day when most people were out. Video calls were pretty much a no go though.
Pet friendly at an extra cost of $5USD. Check their websites for prices and come prepared to bargain a little as the prices listed online were slightly cheaper than asking in person. Paid $1,300 per night with a dog and fee to pay with card.
A lovely place! Would totally recommend it!

name: Under the trees
description: Quiet and shady place under the trees. Good for one night.

name: Rud's I-94 Mobil
description: This gas station has a complimentary dump station for customers! There's no potable water, but the cashier said that the park up the road has some (didn't check personally). Fill your gas tank up and empty your black water for free!

name: Cabañas El Amanecer
description:
beautiful cabins with a spectacular view of The El Salto waterfall. surronded by pines. there are two cabins, one with three bedrooms with double bed, bathroom, grill, outdoor kitchen, salamander. the other cabin has two double beds and bathroom. 
very good prices can be negotiated.  phone +52 1 649 104 2853

name: Estacionamento da igreja
description: Nice and quiet place. We stay a few weeks here there were always other motorhomes around. Once a very friendly police stopped us and asked to change to the other side of the street as we were covering the sidewalk. (We recommend to park like on the photo we uploaded)

name: Car Service
description:
We choose the mechanic Car Service because of good Google reviews. 
The garage looks neat and clean and we had a good feeling. We got our injector changed for 900 pesos which was quite alright but not cheap for a 2 hour job and we provided the new injector. In San Miguel de Allende we had to open the engine again because of an gasoline leak. The gaskeds the mechanic used were broken. Cannot recommend this place!

name: Ponte Férrea sobre o Rio Vaza-Barris
description:
Photogenic railway bridge located 5km from the Center of Itaporanga d’Ajuda.⁣⁣
  ⁣⁣
 Almost nobody in the municipality knows it, as it is a little isolated from the city and with unpaved access.⁣⁣
 ⁣⁣
 This stretch is over the Vaza-Barris River.⁣⁣

name: Lavandería la Estación
description: Great place to get laundry done. Per kilo. We had 7.8 kilos and asked for it done express. Check in at 11:30 and done by 3:30pm on a Thursday. For 273pesos. Perfect for us to park and see the town and come back yo get our clean clothes.

name: street camping in front of police
description:
We asked the police at the plaza if we could park there. They told us that there is a fiesta on Friday and sent us here. They said we can park in front of the yellow building. They are many police officers and it's safe. 

Good place to stay here overnight when you arrive late. Many cars passing by at night though, but we felt safe.

name: Checkpoint
description: Waived us right through heading south bound

name: El Paste - Empanadas & Cafe
description: Nice baked empanadas, meat or vegetarian, and coffee in a nice atmosphere with patio out back. Wifi. Friendly owner. Also selling locally made kombucha.

name: Cafe Galo
description: Excellent home roasted organic coffee from Chiapas at a very fair price (I paid 75 pesos for a quarter kilo). You can buy whole bean or ground the moment you buy so it’s nice and fresh. Definitely the best place in the area to get freshly roasted coffee to take with you and not overpriced. To order, send a text to their WhatsApp at +52 983 177 6106

name: Diversity diving
description:
We went diving with Gustavo for four days (first we did the advanced open water course and the last day we went to dos ojos and the pit cenotes). Gustavo and Paulina are the best dive instructors! They make you feel very comfortable and become your friends along the way. They give a lot of info about the fish and the area and we absolutely loved the dive sites! The reefs, the mama Viña wreck and the cenotes! If you want to dive in this area we can recommend them highly. For experienced as well as not experienced divers. Enjoy the dive!
PS: we just went to their store, but they don’t have a clear sign outside. So just knock at the gate or text him: +52 984 145 2663

name: Newport Restaurant
description: Seafood restaurant with a large menu, featuring shrimp dishes, octopus, ceviche, and fish. Mariscos soup and the ceviche tostadas were excellent! They have beef too, enchiladas, tacos, etc, but the fish plates were excellent. Decent  prices. Full of locals, good service.

name: Incógnito Police Checkpoint
description:
Very sketchy "police" checkpoint going north (maybe south too).

Police cars have no indication of what agency they are. They immediately told me to pull for inspection. Never asked for my name, just where I'm going and where I came from.

Asked to open the hood which is the first time I've ever been asked to do so. Then they wanted us to come out of the vehicle while they inspect it, which is also the first time since I'm always there while they check.

Wouldn't identify what "police branch" they were when I asked. Instead just got the main person in charge, which showed me his id, then explained that they are an investigations unit, looking for drugs and guns.

Very sketchy! watch out, I don't think they are real cops specially since there was a military checkpoint not too far from here, so why another one right away.

Record everything! Stay safe!

Oh also at the end they didn't want to close my hood....

name: Eléctrico Automotriz José Luis
description:
Great electrical service!
Jose Luis was very clever, he was the first of 6 diferent persons that solve the problem of my electric fan of our combi.
If you get stuck in puebla message him 2216071834 before calling or just arrive his place.
9 to 7 from Sunday to friday.

name: Restaurant Chiquirringui
description: This place is an experience you cannot miss if you pass this town. The owner is such a great character and restaurant itself something you wont forget soon. Food is pretty good as well. From the outside it does not look like a restaurant but there should be a sign outside with the name.

name: Grand Cenote
description:
Big cenote :
180 pesos for adult and 90 for little kid. My daughter aged of 10 paid the adult price because of the size.
Cenote very touristic but very beautiful. Caves, turtles and fishes 🤩

name: Socoro
description: This lady is on a corner before the main street that enters into the attraction. She has a big space and is willing to let people camp for the night for around 100pesos. No amenities

name: Restaurant Stacy
description: Decent restaurant open until 8pm in Tanchachin outside of the town. Very clean outdoors seating. Basic milanesa, shrimp, enchiladas and breakfasts

name: London Paste
description: Great stop for pastys! Yummy hot chocolate and mandarin green tea too! Crazy bunch of dogs live here but are friendly

name: White Sand Beach
description: Check in with the security guard and let him know you are going to the beach.  He will let you through.  Drive all the way down to the end and park on the road.  Walk between the houses and you will come to an incredible,  nearly deserted white sand beach.  Paradise!

name: Baja Gas & Oil
description: Simple in and out. On east side of highway

name: Hotel Villa Campeche
description: Useful little hotel on a quiet edge of Campeche. About a couple of miles from the Centro Histórico. Simple and clean. M$620 for a two-bed room. They have their own parking lot, which seems to be less common for the hotels in the old quarter downtown. You can keep a bike/van outside the room.

name: Organico Vital
description: Here is the only place where you can buy rye flour.

name: Peter's Trucks Inc
description: At this workshop you can get body work done and repairs and parts. If it's not possible here, he will manage to find you the right place or part. Super friendly and helpful owner. Speaks English, German as well. Very recommended!

name: Beej Ka'ax Ha Community Project reception centre
description:
This is the base for trips to visit the 'serpientes colgante de Kantemó', a tour to a cave in which snakes live in the cave walls and hang down to snatch bats out of the air when they leave in the evening. It consists of about a km hike or cycle through the forest to the cave mouth, then 90-odd minutes checking out the snakes and the bats, the aquatic life inside a small cenote within the cave, and some marine fossils which apparently date back to the Jurassic era. 

Necessarily an evening tour, $630pp. Kids are welcome from aged 10 and up, same price. It's pretty physical (and not for the claustrophobic, or bat or snakephobic!), take closed shoes and comfy clothes, and water. You'll get hot and sweaty, and probably a bit dirty. Hard hats, gloves, headtorch and facemasks provided.

Apparently best end August till May (we were there in July and just saw a couple of - disappointingly inactive, though I'm sure not from the bats' perspective! - snakes; it's mating season and they're mostly hiding out deep in the cave where humans can't access them!). 

There are also comfortable cabañas available nearby for $700 (mosquito nets, hot and cold running water etc) - I'm sure they'd have no problem with people parking up for the night in the village, or in the lovely quiet cabañas parking area. Small village so come prepared in terms of food and water etc.

Contact Baltazar on 997 977 4920 to arrange.

name: posto goiabeira
description:
Very simple gas station, but it has free filtered and cold water, a good point of support for a rest and replenishing water.

Portuguese
Posto de gasolina bem simples mas tem água filtrada e gelada gratuita, ponto de apoio bom para um descanso e repor água.

name: Taller mecánico Ugalde
description:
This is a very professional and helpful mechanic place. I contacted them through Google maps and then we talked using WhatsApp. That told the price of service in advance and helped us to find some pieces that we needed to change. 
Phone number: +52 981 139 0866

name: Servicio Lopez, taller electromecánico
description: Alejandro is really friendly. He helped me to scan my rig for electronic failures in the engine. He found the problem and cleaned the connector. Didn’t ask anything. Very good vibes here

name: Hotel Prariso
description: Nice hotel. Top tier parking spot has power available next to water closets. I plugged in my rv two nights no one said anything. The roads to this place are really twisty but paved.

name: Jardín Lozoya
description: We were next to the Lozoya garden, in San Miguel Regla, very quiet, safe and very friendly people.  We leave the motorhome here to get around and get to know other places like Pachuca, Mineral del Chico, Tulancingo, Real del Monte, Omitlan, etc!  In the garden, there is water!

name: Rancho "La escondida"
description: Beautiful little oasis with blue/green water river passing right through. Perfect for a quiet stop only 40 minutes away from the busy city. Open only a year a go, it has basic service but the host is very nice. Staying overnight 30px. The parking is limited as is the space. No big for rigs. Camping and cabins(400) available too.

name: ecoaldea triunfo vivo
description:
Ecoaldea project. Run by David (+522337599278) and Pili. They have a dream to create an space for community. They work with permaculture and eco building. The project is in its first months so there is a lot to do and learn.
There is a river and plenty of shade, super quiet and safe area with friendly locals. They own a friendly horse and some dogs. We are building a dry toilet now. Space for camping and parking middle size rigs. Possibly to volunteer and have your food in exchange

name: Pemex
description: Stayed here overnight. Loud engine brake noises thru the night. Bathrooms decent for 5 pesos. Flat area to park.

name: Mariscos Bloom
description: Amazing setting, open air, lovely restaurant for any meal. We had the best margaritas we have had so far here. The Bloom salad was amazing, and ceviches were great. The arachera steak was juicy and tasty and the chimichanga with shrimp delicious. Super friendly manager and the service was perfect. Totally recommendable!

name: Store
description: Propane. It was 2.99 per gal when I was tanking. Really quick service

name: Valero gas station
description: water spigot on the Side of the gas station building. I asked attendant if I could fill my U-Vans tank and she said I dont see why not! Plus de gas and diesel is super cheap!

name: Coconut water stand - giant coconuts very cold!
description: Gigantic fresh coconuts full of delicious coconut water and very cold, with a little shaded area to sit and enjoy it. 40 pesos.

name: El Abasto Café & Bakery
description: Argentinian cafe. Delicious coffee, house made pastries and bread, sandwiches, and other gourmet products like meats and cheeses, also homemade pasta to go for cooking, in a small and interesting space with good music and a colorful VW bus with a bench parked out front. Almond croissant (weekends only) is dense and so, so good.

name: los Kocos
description:
A small restaurant that also provide camping. They have a deck above the river and you can park/camp directly at the shore.
Everthing is simple but clean. The owners are nice. The food is excellent.

name: Dolphin Bay
description: Beautiful tiny spot off the highway - no Amenities- a couple of  man made fire pits - dolphins come by a couple times a day ( morning is best around 7:30 am ) lots and lots of clamming yum ! Rocky beach space for 2/3 cars. No 4x4 needed. Nice sunset and sunrise. Quiet. Good for a night or two.  The moon is beautiful here and some nice wind that made car camping bearable. FREE

name: Ranchitos
description: It's a simple, humble and traditional place to have breakfast on the way. I took "menudo", and a "taco de adobada". It's the first place i found to do so in my way from Colima to Minatitlán (bike touring).

name: Camping next to the beach
description:
Very nice place where there are few spots to camp. 2WD will work on the beginning of the beach as there are some rocks.
Beautiful white sand beach. We didn’t have any wave but we heard it’s a very good place to surf.
To access this place, you have to drive through the village. 
We were the only one here but we felt safe.
No cell reception.

name: servicios mecánicos Mitre Sr Gerardo
description:
Mr Gerardo saw us and controlled the excessive smoke from our exhaust pipe.  Check and clean, sensors, fix a hose, controlled spark plug, advise us on various issues.  we recommend it.  In total he charged us $500
---
El Sr Gerardo nos vio y controló el humo excesivo de nuestro caño de escape. Checo y limpio,  sensores, arreglo una manguera, controló bujía, nos asesoro sobre varios temas . lo recomendamos . En total nos cobro $500

name: In the green valley
description: Right after you crosses the bridge make a right and follow the small path. After 100m you will see a green valley with trees and a winding river. Lots of space. Depending on the wind you could hear the main road. Quiet at night. We slept very well. Very low internet service.

name: Riley Campground
description: Free potable water at the campground.  Just past the turn-in to the park on the left.  No entry fee until farther down the road.  Follow the signs to the dump station, just past the turn into the campground. There are signs for the potable water faucet, next to the dump apparatus.

name: Turdo
description:
Really calm and quiet place in the middle of a big grass area. Fabulous view on the Caucase's mountains.
circuled by trees. Many corn and wineyards in the surrounding areas. The way here is easy. Some dogs came but really friendly. In the morning, some Shepards....but they stayed away. 
woken up by the sing of the Cicadas... 
Good resting night after a wine testing at the ROSTOMAANT MARANI ....A very nice family wine seller.
4G

name: Hotel Cocos
description: I could add this place as a hotel, restaurant, bar or WiFi spot, but given I was there for the WiFi I'll go with that! I needed to get some work done and tried Italian Coffee but they no longer have WiFi (why not?!) and the libraries were closed for the weekend, so I followed advice and came here. They were helpful and welcoming, and not at all put out that I took up one of their tables for hours while nursing a huge agua de sabor - decent WiFi, I came back the following day for more! Can't comment on the food but the prices weren't extortionate for a hotel restaurant and it smelled good! Parked right outside on the busy road.

name: La Locura Del Mar
description: Amazing seafood with plenty of wide street parking overlooking the water. Fried fish tacos were some of the best we had in Baja. Amazing ceviche tostadas in huge portions. Also had great shrimp tacos and grilled scallop tacos. Huge plate of fresh condiments came with the order too. Didn't get photos of the food as we ate it all so fast - it was so good! All very fresh and tasty! Highly recommend if passing by. Server was very slow but food came quickly once order was placed - be prepared to chill and enjoy the view :)

name: Playa del Rey Hotel
description: Lovely updated modern tiny hotel with maybe 20 rooms. Claudia, the owner speaks great English, and is very welcoming. 900pesos for two of us king size, lovely room. No full-time cook yet, but will have one in a month, for breakfast and lunch. Awesome A/C which we required…sooooo humid here and the mosquitoes and sand flies are awful, so we were not camping! We fit our Sprinter under her carport no prob (though it was steep). Pool is outdoors. Pleasant stay in a not so pleasant town.

name: Estacionamento do Parque das Águas
description:
Great place to stay overnight. Arriving at night, you can park near the drinking water point.
.....
Ótimo local pra pernoitar, chegando à noite você consegue estacionar perto do ponto de água potável.

name: Hotel Del Rio
description: Beautiful grounds and pool. Restaurant onsite. Small park for kids. Pet friendly. A/C is new and the hotel is quiet. Restaurant is fair, regarding service, food is good. Breakfast is extra unless you book on booking.com. $55 US for two people for the night.

name: Quiet spot
description: Small gravel place with some trees, quiet.   Enough space for 2-3 campervans. At the morning I saw some local farmers passing the road. Next to the small river. At the end of the parkig spot there is some sign suggesting it's a public area. When we were preparing to the road sheriff saw us, raised a hand and did not stop.

name: Hotel Los Cisnes
description: Decent simple hotel for the night. Local cops stay here (contract with them). Pool and jacuzzi, AC, wifi, breakfast for one if you get a one bed room, 100 pesos for the second person. 850 pesos for the night. Can walk to restaurants.

name: Biblioteca Lic. Javier Rojo Gomez
description: Nice library with a dedicated tech area to use their computers or bring your own laptop. Decent WiFi and I had no problems parking outside. Open till 8pm Monday-Friday

name: Citibank
description: In the center of town there is a bank with an ATM.

name: Salt Flats!
description: There is a packed dirt road going straight through huge salt flats. Great place to take a cool photo! Road is fairly narrow so not too easy to turn around on, with a few washboards. No need for 4wd. But epic scenery!

name: Street Parking
description:
Street (no exit) and quiet, very close to the trade of Capivari. Although it has no structure it is worth staying for those who are self-sufficient.
.....
Rua sem saída e tranquila, muito perto do comércio do Capivari. Apesar de não ter estrutura vale a pena ficar pra quem tem autonomia de Luz e Água.

name: Xpuhil Archaeological Site Carpark
description:
Had a peaceful night parked up here, after checking with the staff at the ruins that it was safe and wouldn't bother anyone. Dark and pretty quiet at night, some road noise in the morning but if parked towards the bottom you're a decent distance away. 

Gently sloping for most of it but some fairly flat areas at the bottom. Space for big rigs.

name: Water show and Querétaro letters in front of Fuentes de Santa Rosa de Viterbo
description: There is a watershow combined with music in front of the Fuentes de Santa Rosa de Viterbo and the Querétaro letters. Maybe it's here all day, but we have been here shortly before 9 PM

name: Elba restaurant (El Bar Co)
description: One of the Elba restaurants, on this side of the street. Reminds me of a roadside diner. Food is FAST, and the menu is large. Service is fantastic. Needed a Denny’s style meal for my unsettled stomach and this was perfect. Hubby had liver and onions. Cheap! Definitely come again! Open until 11pm

name: Dirt lot Carrizalillo
description: Not safe place!!! Not police or security around, no cameras!!, they broke in to our 24ft Motorhome and stole a lot of things, in Saturday afternoon with a lot of people around!!

name: Dump station free
description: Free dump station the name in google maps  is “PTAR Punta Colorada 2”, but this is the right location, no so bad an is free!!

name: P.T.R.A Free Dump Station
description: Free dump station!! Super fast! Fidel the man in charge is great , so helpful and didn’t even accept a tip!!

name: Free Dump station
description:
Free dump station, if you want you can tip,  
Jorge a super nice guy is in charge 
There is also not potable water 

“Planta de tratamiento de Aguas Residuales”

name: Mecanico Jorge
description:
Jorge the owner is a great guy,  Super helpful, he knows about RVs, kombi, vans, etc
Also he let us stay right there, and hook up to electricity, used the shower.
He did a grate job with a 25feet Rv for a reasonably price! Totally recommended!

El dueño Jorge es una gran persona, nos ayudó con todo lo que le pedimos, nos limpió el chasis y colocó  pintura antioxidante, él arregla Rvs, kombis, vans, etc.
Nos quedamos en su taller y nos permitió conectarnos a la electricidad y usar la ducha.
Realizó un gran trabajo a nuestro Motorhome de 25 pies, por un precio razonable, lo recomendamos totalmente!
WhatsApp: +52 983 177 6805

name: Border Crossing Reynosa, MX to McAllen, USA
description:
This is the way to cross the border from MX to the US.

1. Follow the signs on the Libramento Ote Highway to "International Bridge"
2. When you start seeing cars lining up (right lane) and vendors running around, squeeze through in the middle and keep driving until you see the loooong MX Customs building with the silver cantilever roof
3. There is a small white booth out at the parking lot. Drive there and get in line to get your vehicle inspected and photographed. Your TIP will be canceled here. Since we payed the deposit with credit card, we will get it reimbursed within a few days. If you paid cash, you may have to go to the Banjercito inside the silver building.?
4. Park your vehicle and go inside the building to the customs counter. Have your FMM taken and passports stamped with the exit stamp
5. Drive to the veery back of the line (right lane) which I mentioned earlier you should bypass.
6. Stay in the line which will take you across the bridge to US Imigration. There is one last toll both before the bridge which charges 30pesos for Autos. We are US citizens with a US registered van so fairly simple process, no idea what it would be for non citizens. You basically drive through one of many booths and an officer checks your paperwork.

name: Nueva tierra Guisii
description:
This is a place where a very friendly couple is building their camper. It has a lot of space, fruit trees and shadow to spend a day. They have non potable water available. 200pesos per night per vehicles.

Español
Este es un lugar donde una amistosa pareja está construyendo su motorhome. Es una finca grande con mucho espacio, árboles frutales y sombra para pasar unas noches. Tienen agua de pozo disponible. 200 pesos por noche por vehículo.

name: Euro AG Diesel specialist
description: Francisco is well known in this area and can fix all Diesel cars. Very profesional but also kind of expensive. If you have a serious isue with your Diesel car, be sure to ask Paco. He will help you for sure! His number is: +52 33 1054 2753

name: Water Spigot
description: Just a water spigot next to parking and road

name: Penedo - RJ @queres
description:
Quiet street, great place to stay overnight in a motorhome

Portuguese
Rua silenciosa e tranquila, ótimo local pra pernoitar de Motor Home.

name: La Terraza del buen zazón
description: Nice view of the main square and the mine.  Varied food, low prices.  The food is not the best but it's ok.

name: Checkpoint
description:
Military Checkpoint and Guardia Nacional
From Aguascalientes to Zacatecas

Stopped us and asked:
Where are you from?
Where are you going?
How many people are in the Van?
Can we have a look in the Van please?

Took us about 2 minutes. 
Friendly officers wished us a nice travel.

name: Laguna de Carrizalillo
description: Cellphone signal is ok for Telcel. It has bathrooms. It has parking lots. There's a restaurant. You can rent a cabin or you can pay for a camping site. At the entrance they sell water and soft drinks.

name: Los 4 Pulques Hotel Moto Posada Camping
description:
Moderator Note: Place added by owner.

Los 4 Pulques Hotel
Moto Posada Camping.
It is a space created so that every traveler can pause and rest. we have comfortable rooms and space for camping. We also accept motorhomes. WiFi, showers with hot water. Clean bathrooms. Large garden. A very safe place.

name: La gallina correteada - resto gloria
description: Restaurant on the side of the road, the owner Emigdio is very friendly and very thoughtful about Maya culture. We could camp there for the night. There is place for vehicles inside the property. closed on Wednesday but still could stay there.

name: Ultralight Rental
description: These guys are a little further down the sandy road into Cholla. They have ultralight rides up and down the coast for $50US for about 13-14 minutes. Ask for a ride with Carlos. They will even try and get your foot wet by a wave if you want! Really cool thing to do that is no longer allowed in the US (the engines pollute too much). A guy will sell you a photo for $10US if you want as well.

name: Proyecto Yum Kaax
description:
Small hippie community, not possible to park, but stayed few days to rest during biking Trip. Sharing experiences, food moment and community work. Got a spot in the open on the jungle dormitory :p

Follow the road until the bridge on the river, then follow the river ! 

Old coffee plantation, focus is to let nature take back full space and share her ressources. 

Amazing river with a fall to discover if you up to adventure.

500pesos for one week "all included"

name: Police check point - Daytime hours
description: We have been parked at a gas station for a while now and noticed that during the day, the police set up a checkpoint right in front here. It looks like they are mostly or only stopping people outbound from Valle De Bravo

name: Parking, Power, and Water at this gas station
description: Parking, power, and water available at this gas station we have spent about 5 nights now.

name: In a dry river bed
description: When you come from Durango just 100m behind the bridge make a right. There is a gravel road parallel to the main road. Follow back to the broken bridge and all the way into the gravel river bed. No one can see you there and quiet at night.

name: Los olivos purificadora
description:
This is a place where you bring your water recipient and they clean it and fill it with with pure water. It’s 20L for 20p. 

Aquí uno trae su garrafón de agua y lo limpian y llenan por 20p el de 20L

name: Cory’s Smokehouse Barbecue
description: Incredible Texas style smoked meat barbecue!!! Tacos and tortas including brisket, pulled pork, tri tip, costillas (ribs) and much more. Also birria! Options vary depending on the day. I’m from the US and can say this is some great quality US style barbecue. Highly recommend a stop here. Only open weekends: Friday starting at 5pm, Saturday & Sunday starting in the morning. But he sells out everyday so get there as early as you can. Viktor the chef is a good guy originally from Mexico City and spent some years living in Texas where he learned to cook barbecue. Bring your own cerveza.

name: Hidden Platform
description: Follow the gravel road until you reach the platform. There is no one around and we had a quite night in a beautiful green surrounding.

name: Grutas de Garcia Parking lot
description:
Nice, clean and well lit parking lot. Pulled in last night, no one there to ask, but no „no overnight“ signs. Some traffic noise due to trucks to and from the local mine (or quarry) and some teens on their motorbikes, but no one bothered us, good fresh air and cooler than down in Monterrey. Toilets available when the Cave Park is open.
INFO: the cable car is under maintenance till 2023, so you have to WALK UP to the cave entrance, about 1 mile and then down again! we didn’t do it, too hot!

name: Loncheria Olich
description:
I was recommended this restaurant from a local to eat typical food from Yucatan. I found it to be a little gem.

- Not too many choices but what they offer is good from my experience
- Very fair price
- Homemade drinks
- Cosy restaurant
- Nice and friendly service

They enforce the use of mask when moving in the restaurant.

name: Parque Ecológico Apatlaco
description:
BEAUTIFUL Place with a Lake, Hikingtrails and Waterfall. Big grass Field suitable for any Size of Vehicle. Bumpy Road to reach the Site but double with any Vehicle. Off road (Careful when it rains) There are Trouts for sale, Zipline etc. View of Popo and Itza from an upper hill. Very friendly Family owned place. Secure and quiet. A hidden Gem!
100$/Person. Entry to Waterfall 30$.
Entry included if you stay overnight.
Cabañas for rent 1500$ with 2 Beds Bathroom and Fire Place.

name: Del Angel
description: Full-service laundromat and dry cleaner.

name: Quality Inn
description: Reservations available but not required. Parks vehicles all sizes. Showers, wifi, pool access and breakfast includes. Rates vary from 1,700 to 2,200 MXN per night depending on availability and room size. City does not recommend to drink tab water at the time regardless of filtering system.

name: Oxxo gas station
description: Medium sized Gas station on Route 54, open 24/7, very busy, not a lot of parking space for customers, but we asked inside - no problem, nice people, they let us stay overnight. Traffic all night, trucks filling up - noisy, but safe, clean. Shop is well stocked, breakfast available. Didn’t use the bathrooms and there is absolutely NO WiFi anywhere here. Other than that a good place for one night because it’s a long drive from Saltillo to Zacatecas.

name: Pemex Gas Station
description: Gas Station on Route 49 towards San Luis Potosí, large parking lot with even pavement, clean - asked if we could stay overnight, they said yes, anywhere on the grounds would be ok and safe. Chose the parking lot to the west of the gas station behind some shrubs. Traffic noise from the road not too bad, the roosters and dogs from the adjacent farm made up for that :-) But we had a good night’s sleep and felt safe. NO WiFi here. Didn’t use the bathroom, got some breakfast at the shop in the morning. Very nice people, they also speak english.

name: Whitefish
description: The campsites are very beautiful. (at least number one is.) They’re very spacious, very clean, surrounded by trees, view of the lake, Cedar, Pine, Spruce, Liddel trails. There is a stream that flows into the lake. the water is very clear and there is boating and fishing available if you so choose.

name: Quinta Reina - Centro Turistico - Albercas - Palapas - Campismo
description:
This is an established Campground with a pool and nice view to relax. 
Currently they are expanding their services. 
The small town is very safe to be and to walk around. Filemón is always present at the campground, taking care of the establishment. The owners are very welcoming and visit this place regularly to make sure that everything is working fine. 
Highly recommended to spend some time there to relax. 

Note: at the moment the internet connection is very limited! Not stable enough to work from there. Better connection can be found in the center of the town. 

I brought my own extension cable which was then connected inside the kitchen, which gave me the access to electricity 24/7 

The access (see photo) might be difficult for bigger vans, but the owner told me that they are planning to improve and make this access bigger! 
In the future he also wants to install a wifi connection, remodel the bathrooms and offer tours.

name: Toll booth
description: Paid 146 pesos for a car at this toll booth

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Large, clean, well lit parking lot behind the gas station, even pavement, bathrooms 24/7 (fee), shop closes at 11 pm. Asked for permission to stay the night, no problem at all, no fee. A bit of traffic noise, other than that quiet and safe.

name: La Paz Customs
description:
Llego con mi carnet ATA sin sellar, ya que en Tijuana no hay ningún tipo de control para entrar y no me permiten el acceso, les indico que al ser aduanas, ellos son los que me tienen que sellar el carnet, y que independientemente de eso, el carnet ATA no debe ser necesario de presentar para trasladarse dentro de un mismo país.
Me indican que tendré que regresar a Tijuana a sellarlo + de 1500 km de distancia. Al final me devuelven mi documentación 5 minutos antes de que cierre Banjercito, donde hago el pago de una importación temporal gracias a que la trabajadora de ahí me ayuda con ello.
Curioso que el ATA no valga y no se pueda gestionar, pero la importación temporal si. Todo esto sin ser capaces de asegurarme nada en ningún momento. Un desastre.
A mi compañero de ruta en los últimos días, moto comprada en México, con matrícula mexicana, ciudadano mexicano, le exigen lo mismo al no haberse fabricado la moto en México (KTM). 
Mi trámite empieza a las 16 horas y embarco a las 19, ya que me tenían retenida la documentación.
Un absurdo total. Al embarcar, una persona de la tripulación me cuenta que mucha gente tiene problema con aduanas, tratan de sacar dinero de la gente.

name: Walmart
description: Be careful, we almost felt into a scam inside this supermarket. We were looking for a simcard, a guy came selling the simcard we wanted, but he said the price was 300 pesos, 100 for the credits and 200 for the simcard. My boyfriend found the price on the Internet and the simcard costed 50 pesos. He returned our money saying sorry and that he made a mistake. Clearly it was not a mistake.

name: BP gas station
description: We asked the guy that works here, and he said it was ok to stay here overnight. The bathrooms are clean, but the place is very noisy.

name: TECALLI MOLLI
description: Nice restaurant on the rute 57, in between San Miguel de Allende and Querétaro, very close to dam Santa Catarina. Delicious food, correct pricing. Try the Enmoladas with different sauces, my favorite was the mole verde (green sauce). The mole is a typical Mexican dish, very similar to curry. Those I tried weren’t spicy. Nice restrooms. So I hope everyone enjoys this restaurant. Have a good one people!

name: Los Pilones Queretaro
description: Amazing rock formations in Queretaro. Took me 1.5 hours to get there and 1.5 hours to get out. Definitely you need at least an AWD vehicle, the road is completely broken, very rocky and if it’s raining the road will be slippery. So take that in to consideration. But it is part of the journey, the views and the rock formations worth it.

name: Estación la Virgen
description: Gas Station + Starbucks + Burger King + Subway + others. Very noisy because lots of trucks pull in and out during the night, and the highway is also very busy, but - safe, clean. Stayed behind the gas station and hid between the trucks. Bathrooms 24/7 (fee); WiFi if you park near Starbucks.

name: tacos Los primos
description: fish tacos for 15 peso Camarones for 20 peso  and other different tacos.very delicious and local everything is fresh. highly recommended. the place is always full you may need to wait for a little bit to sit down.

name: Balneario de Aguas Azufradas "Atonaltzin"
description:
Lugar perfecto para dormir y bañarse en aguas de azufre. piscina muy grande, césped y baños también para hacer barbacoa. 200mxn dormir el precio incluye la entrada al barbeario para bañarse. ideal para descansar o si estas de paso.

Perfect place to sleep and bathe in sulfur waters. very large pool, lawn and bathrooms also for barbecue. 200mxn to sleep the price includes the entrance to the barber shop to bathe. ideal to rest or if you are passing through

name: Medfjørdvær
description: Online camperplace on the fjord. So you can the way upstares en there is a beatiful Parking where you can see the sea and the mountians. Also hinking

name: Oxxo
description: In the middle of nowhere, there is an Oxxo to get food and cold beverages.

name: El Cuerudo
description: A fantastic opportunity to taste traditional dried meat called "machacado". Has very good internet connection and high quality food.

name: La Peña Del Porto
description: Very inexpensive and basic accommodation with private bathrooms, air conditioning and good wifi. I paid 250 pesos a night for room 6.

name: Cafe Landa
description: A tiny homegrown and roasted coffee company. It's extremely good coffee. A must stop.

name: Maty La Huerta
description: Restaurant with a famous gigantic taco. I tried to finish it and I couldn't. Good food and good prices.

name: Luz De Noche
description: A gorgeous old home with a modern coffee shop with a brand new Italian coffee roasting machine. The coffee is amazing and it's a very affordable place to stay. 220 pesos for a bed in the dormitory with separate bathroom and 450 pesos for bed with private bathroom. These prices are half the cost of many of the other hotels in the village.

name: Mini Zoologico Museo
description: A small old home with a garden filled with animals and reptiles. It's an interesting stop worth the visit. 50 pesos entrance fee

name: Balneario Paraiso Escondido
description: A gorgeous little hidden paradise next to the river with several natural swimming pools. A great place to camp and escape the heat.

name: Camping La Guerra
description: A beautiful location on the beach with a large river running along the side of the property. They rent hammocks and pavilions along the beach. They also have a bamboo forest next to the river with shady spots to camp and relax. Tent camping is 50 pesos per night. Good wifi for 30 pesos per day. Large caravan parking for 200 pesos per day. Only locals use the area and you'll find it very quiet at night.

name: Pozoleria Regalo De Dios
description: This is a traditional corn based drink from Tabasco. This lady sells it by the side of the road at her nice stand with chairs. she's very popular and many cars stop to buy from her. The drink is vegan.

name: Restaurant Don Guillo NO VEHICLE ACCESS
description: A gorgeous little beach restaurant. I asked if I could pitch my tent on the beach if I bought food and they allowed me. Cozy place under palm trees. I set up my tent and placed a table next to my tent while I ate. Then I went for a swim and relaxed drinking beers into the evening. Extremely nice people.

name: Mini Suites Isla Aguada
description: A very clean and well maintained house which offers rooms and camping in the garden. Camping is 100 pesos... large parking area for rv/camper... talk with the owner about the price for vehicles. This house is directly in front of the malecon and near the bars and restaurants. A private room is 950 pesos for two people. When not busy 750 pesos for a single person.

name: Punto Tres
description: This is a modern, extremely clean (new August 2022) hostel. It's owned by a very nice Canadian from Ontario named Sean. The entire house is a hostel with a large common area with a kitchen, refrigerator, sink, toaster oven, cooktop, flat screen tv and great wifi. There are nine bunk beds in the sleeping area. Two modern bathrooms with great water pressure. An outside terrance with a hammock and a flat yard which is also available for tent camping or caravan parking. He also has a washing machine (additional fee), external electrical outlets and water. Sean also has a beach bar and beach cabanas with great wifi on the beach if you want to work.

name: Punto Tres
description: The hostel also has a nice level camping area and an area to park your caravan/camper securely within a fenced in yard.

name: Playa Montes "Wild Beach"
description: 5 gorgeous cabanas/beach cabins on virgin beach in a little jungle village. It's simply a ridiculously gorgeous place with a private beach bar. Sean the owner is Canadian from Ontario and he also owns the hostel in Sabancuy called "Punto Tres". You can rent a beach cabin or camp on the beach. There is great wifi access for 1 kilometer along the beach. They're building nine more beach cabins which will soon be done. Sean doesn't advertise... so you have to come to the gate and ask one of the guards about staying here. You could easily stay here for months. It's a great location for Digital Nomads to live/work in paradise.

name: La Noria Hotel
description: Simple hotel on the beach- $600 pesos. Camping allowed- $100. Cold shower and flush toilets. Wifi- $40. Owners nice but do not speak English.

name: refaccionaría González Muelles Cabanas
description: Mechanic specializing in brakes, suspension, and radiators. Appears to work on commercial and passenger vehicles. No one there speaks much English. But everyone I met was very friendly and helpful. Bruno Replaced two leaf spring bushings on my Toyota pickup for 300 pesos. Really pleased with their service. They appear to have lots of spare parts in stock- particularly u-bolts which I had trouble finding elsewhere.

name: Gulf fuel station
description: Basic but functional and very clean single-room/cubicle shower in a truck stop-style fuel station. I suspect there would be no problem staying the night among the trucks but didn't check. Shower is 'page lo que le gusta'. Magic!

name: Cempoala archaeological site
description: Large, very well-maintained and unusual Totanac (among others, I think) site, constructed from stones brought up from the river. Open daily till 5, though this seems flexible! Allow at least an hour, there's a little museum too. $65 entry at the time of writing.

name: Bus to Divisadero & Chihuahua
description:
The buses to Divisadero and Chihuahua are leaving here. There are two companies called Noroeste & Rápidos Cuauhtémoc. 
The first bus to Divisadero leaves at 10:30 am. We took this one to visit the copper canyon. The bus costs between 70 and 100 pesos per person to Divisadero and takes 1 h.

name: San Joaquin park
description:
beautiful place with quite and amazing beach. super relax.

there is a small ruins that goes inside a perfect beach. we were alone and the water was clear and nice. there are some boats  of tourists stop to take pictures but not much and they also stay for 5 minutes. the place is really beautiful and we highly recommend  to go there, super quiet.

there are mosquitos! bring some spray and net with you. 
they way there is unpaved road with lost of hols in it but with our 2×4 we managed with no problem at all (in the rainy season). you can put directions also through Google map San Joaquin Park. it will bring you there easily. if you take different roads and wandering around the area, you can also see Flamingos (closer than in any touristic tour) and they are also inside the beautiful pink salt lakes (in the noon its more colorful than the morning)

we didn't slept there since we arrived at the morning and didn't know about the place before. so we slept on the official public beach between two restaurants which was also nice. 

enjoy and don't miss it!

name: Parque Morelos
description: There’s water fountains in this park, you also can park around here. There a restaurant in one of the corners.

name: Corrupt police
description: We were heading to Rosarito and police stopped us wanting 1600 pesos, saying we were above the speed limit, which wasn't the case. My boyfriend said he would call his lawyer and police let us pass without paying. Be careful.

name: Viñedo Tierra de Peña
description: Viñedo Tierra de Peña produces natural wines, which is a challenge (no pesticide, herbicides, sulfide, yeast, etc.). Nonetheless, the wines (Tempranillo, Merlot, Syrah, Muscat) are fruity and have a nice body. Luis and Beki are happy to receive visitors, let them experience their wine making processes (August-September) and serve some of their precious liquids for tasting. The price range is 500-600p/bottle. We stayed in our motorhome on their premises for two days (400p/night).

name: Falafel Nessya
description: Very delicious falafel! Also hummus and Israeli salad. All at very reasonable prices. 80 pesos for the full size sandwich which is filling and very worth it. 115 for the full plate that includes falafel, hummus, pita, salad and French fries. Highly recommend, especially for vegetarians.

name: Quesería y Cremeria Alarcón
description:
Reason #327 to love Veracruz. I've named the little shop I happened to call in at, but there are several all along this stretch of road. Delicious, fresh, cheap cheese of many varieties. So good!

Lots of restaurants here too, I bet they also serve delicious fare but I didn't try them.

name: Hotel Champoton
description: A new hotel that's very clean and spacious. 390 pesos for one person. Great wifi and new air conditioning with memory foam mattresses.

name: Reserva Ecológica Río Pancho Poza
description: Beautiful little cloud forest reserve centred around a lovely clearwater river - I visited in August, well into the rainy season, and it was still crystalline. A 1500m or so walk upstream from this spot takes you to a waterfall (you need to be on the opposite bank to see it - there are two or three bridges along the way) lots of places to swim all along the river, popular with locals. The path continues upstream from there and it gets wilder, with far fewer people. Slightly steep set of stairs down from this spot, otherwise it's an easy walk.

name: Pemex Gas Station
description: Heavy rain and thunderstorms- pulled in at the gas station around 7:30 pm and asked for permission to stay the night - friendly employee called the boss, no problem at all. Gas station closes at 10 pm, but police circles around during the night, safe place. There are bathrooms, don’t know if they are available 24/7 or only when the gas station is open. Some traffic noise, dogs barking, but ok for a night. Boss came in next morning, and confirmed the warnings about St. Martin, by the way!

name: Ivanstoragecabo
description: Secure parking with knowledgeable owner who is flexible on duration and reasonable price

name: Todos Santos Motorsports
description: Motorcycle mechanic. My 07 Kawasaki was overheating due to fan not working. Owner correctly diagnosed problem of dirty temp sensor and non working ground wire. Fixed bike so that I could continue my onward journey to Mazatlan. Very reasonable cost.

name: Pemex Gas Station
description: Quite large Pemex, 24/7, with an Oxxo shop. Guarded by police - safe. Police officer told us where we could stay, had a safe and relatively quiet night. Bathrooms available, didn’t use them. No WiFi.

name: Taqueria Hecelchakán
description: Incredibly delicious tacos and tortas with juicy chicken or roasted pork "lechon". An absolute must try.

name: bosnia camping
description: Verry nice place at a small lake verry nice owner we join food and drinks and stay one night for 30 euro 2 persons one car verry recommend good and cowesy

name: Reserva El Jabali
description: Tiny reserve with a handful of jabali, a tesquintle (but they're nocturnal so don't expect to see it!) and a couple of white-tailed deer, one of which is super tame and comes up for strokes. Voluntary donation. Pretty area and friendly staff, I wouldn't necessarily make a special trip unless you're passing though, all over in 15 minutes!

name: Parque Ecoturistico El Salto
description:
Nice place for camping, in front of the lake. We pay $30 for person and $20 for the van.
No signal or wifi.

name: Las Pozas
description: Beautiful swimming holes. Need to park up in the little car park where there's a big stone arch, then ask directions - the path is reasonably clearly marked - or take a local guide for a propina. It's maybe a 15 or 20-minute walk, then there's a choice of bathing areas - the path diverges at the marked point, river to the right, waterfall to the left. It's popular with local people, especially at the weekend, but I had the waterfall to myself. Apparently somebody drowned there a few years back, watch the currents. Beautiful though!

name: South Africa
description:
A modest lodge right on the main room with private en suite rooms and communal dorms. 

Able to camp. 

Breakfast included. 

En-suite room for one, 300k, camping 200k.

name: friendly family  tapanatepec
description: Friendly family helping refugees, stayed for the night with several Venezuelian waiting for their humanitarian visas. the family installed hamac and matras for everyone. Putted my tent next to them for the night. space in front for van

name: Cascadas Tuliman
description:
A huge set of waterfalls; the main one is some 200-300m tall. There are actually three different setups here, which I think all have different viewpoints on the same falls. I opted to visit Tuliman - $100 entry fee. There are three zones within it, where you can park and check out the sights. The first is the main huge falls, the second a longer walk (steep for the first bit) to a suspension bridge and a big hollow tree, plus a thermal pool for bathing (been closed since the pandemic and still is at the time of writing) and the third to a smaller waterfall and the confluence of two rivers.

There are other activities throughout the park, including ziplines and canopy bridges, tree climbing etc, all for an extra fee. Lots of restaurants and michelada stalls open till 6pm. If you want to camp there's a spot down in zone 3, fine for vans or tents - lots of space for big rigs too if they can manage the road. $50 fee, toilets and solar-heated showers, option to have.a fire, and there's a BBQ grill. Lovely and peaceful, plenty of shade from the trees. Nice trip out from beautiful Zacatlan!

It's a very steep drive down, need decent brakes coming down and traction going up!

name: El Rancho De Macario
description:
The place is in the road from San Mateo Río Hondo, to San Ildefonso. Dowing the road from the football field. Is not allowed go to San Ildefonso, they don't accept foreigners.

The campsite have a Very Beautiful Landscape, is a private Ranch. The Owner is Don Macario and his son, Noe, they are offering a place to Park RV, or campers, with pure wather and dry toilets. They offer some meals, tortitas caseras, and local mushroom. They have a special place to have very beautiful mashrom experience, they gonna tech you also to find eating mushroom s.
He also rent the tools for any self fix. 
The place is now starting, and have a space for 5 RVs. 
They also offer Internet connection. 
They are a very lovely couple, and his father, they harvest milpa, and wood. the farm is small. And they also rent some rooms in the house and a little cabin they have in the forest. 
For parking, with drinking water access they ask 70 pesos per person. Internet day 30 pesos. And you can ask about food and meals.

name: Hotel Mision Argento Zacatecas
description: Solid hotel with an excellent location in the city center. Has attached parking garage (accessible from the rear of the building/block) for secure parking. Has hot water, wifi, clean rooms.

name: Baja Magic Hacienda
description:
Hacienda-style camping with hot water showers, great cell signal/4g, free WIFI, a common area with games, books, a dipping pool, garden bbq, TV, and food for all types of diets.
At Baja Magic Hacienda we cater to all travelers, we have a large area that can hold RVs and overlanders easily, and glamping tents available; we also have inside units for those wanting to take a break from the road and sleep in a nice bed, as well as a bunk house hostal style for hitchhikers and cyclists.
A pet-friendly place with large fences, VERY secure.

name: Campamento El Derramadero
description:
Take a deep breath and get amazed by the views the camp offers. First you have to check in and pay at a little house just over the main road with signs off camping, then you go and park your car at the parking lot (it’s completely safe). Then you have to walk all the way up to the top of the mountain, is a bit steep, in about 10-15 minutes you will arrive to the camping area. And then choose your camping area and enjoy!! The camping area has toilets (very clean!! 👏🏾). And the owner has some grills were you can cook, and you can buy to the hosts the firewood. 

Very nice people run the place.

Recommendations:

1. Go light with the equipment, in may make a difference with the hike.
2. Take your own groceries, there’s a tiendita very close to the camp entrance.
3. Use a waterproof tent, cause the weather get crazy some times.
4. In weekends try to arrive the earliest you can get, so you can set up with the best views. 
5. It gets chilly in summer nights, and it’s very cold all winter. 
6. You can reserve by phone one spot, but you can’t choose until you get there. 
7. Enjoy the beautiful sunset, the amazing starry sky and the increíble foggy morning.

The price I got was $150.00 pesos, about $8 US

Check out the Instagram and Facebook, I’ll put the links:

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100063595659125

https://instagram.com/camp_derramaderodebucareli?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

Sorry if I made writing mistakes, I’m practicing my English skills. 

Have fun and ride safe.

name: Palapas de Yaxal Juk Pik
description:
A beautiful place for camping. just outside the pueblo of Santa Cruz. clean, natural, fresh water for bathing. very comfortable for families. super nice and welcoming people. 
there are palapas, tables and benches. 
very natural and quiet place, the local community wants to establish a camping ground with more facilities in the future.
for now, no electricity. free toilet.
connected to the village toll casita 1 km before.
you can buy good wifi for 10/20 pesos.

name: hotel Santa clara
description:
look for Hotel Santa Clara on Google maps.
we arrived on a very rainy day and most of the places where closed. 
this place was open and let us take a shower  (not super hot but clean), restrooms, cook on the tables outside and even let us go into the pool, we  parked and slept at there small parking area that is full of trees for 200mxp (2 people and a van)
the guy at the reception gave us great tips for traveling around in the nature reserve de Bravo that is close by..and was very friendly. we also got to see flamingo on the laguna at the back yard. 

it's a good spot, not on the beach, not in the style of camping but did the work for us for one rainy day and night.

name: Tabagas Villa Hermosa
description: Filling propane station. We where able to fill our fixed tank on our motorhome perfect and with no need of adaptors. The also refill bottles.

name: At Augustine
description:
A small food truck court with lots of parking. Several water spigots. Great food
We were very dirty after 3 days on winter roads from Nova Scotia took a couple hrs to wash the rig and hose clean.  If you came at of peak hrs you can use the dump station the food trucks use

name: Behind Pahuatlán church
description:
I thought I might be stuck finding a flat spot in this beautiful pueblo mágico, but there are a few here - asked one of the nearby vendors in the evening and she said no problem. Smaller vehicles in this particular spot, but big rigs might fit on the road around the corner. I was going to say they may struggle with some of the roads generally but the buses seem to navigate them ok, so..

Gorgeous town, hidden in the mountains - lots of curves and steep roads in getting here but beautiful views, and everyone I've spoken to has been very friendly. Glad I ventured in this direction!

Toilets available round the corner during the day, as well as on the plaza, and eateries and shops everywhere. Decent Telcel reception.

name: Miirador de Ahila Colina Azul
description:
Miirador with a stunning view out over the valley, facing east so perfect if you're capable of dragging yourself up for sunrise! (I struggle, but it was worth it!)

There are two neighbours who both offer somewhere to stay, this one and Don Miguel.  Here there's the option to camp for $50, right next to the view, or stay in your rig in their car park a few moments' walk from there, also $50pp, or they rent rustic cabins right on the edge for $150. Friendly family, killer view.

Don Miguel next door has signs up saying it's free to use the car park; I don't know if that applies to overnight too, didn't enquire. 

I think you could just about fit a big rig in, though it might be tight to turn around. Patchy Telcel reception (better from the edge). They have dogs and chickens so you'd need to keep pets under control, but all seems pretty chilled. They offered firewood for campfires, and said I could buy food or use their facilities to heat some. Didn't enquire about bathroom facilities but I imagine they're available.

name: Rancho Santa Fe
description: lugar genial para visitar las ruinas de El Tajin y la ciudad de Papantla. tambien tienen cabañas,  baños y regaderas. es muy interesante el recorrido por su sendero ecoturístico y el cultivo de la vainilla. los chicos nos trataron de maravilla.

name: area sosta camper Terrauzza Sul Mare
description: Nice campground at agriturismo. 2 minuten walk from the sea. Trees and electricity. Wc and cold shower. Lovely place!

name: Ruins of Labná
description: Not much space here, it is just the driveway to the gate, which was already closed yesterday evening but it was dark and we didn’t want to drive any more. So we stayed on the side and had a quiet night, no traffic, just the sound of the jungle. No amenities, of course, no cell service, no WiFi. Guard came in at 7.30 this morning and opened the gates.

name: los capulines
description:
great campsite!
a natural creek puring into a big pool, few small pools around.
restaurant and a bar, open 8-18.
a guard during the night.
the owner, merwin, is a very good guy. helpful and caring.
excellent place.
allowed us to use the washing machine.
the food is good.
real people, not the tourist heavy induy.
fully recommended

name: Restaurant Chapala
description: wifi for 20 pesos for one hour. good food too.

name: Walmart
description: Large, clean parking lot. Pulled in at night, after shopping we asked at Customer service if we could stay the night- yes, no problem. Not much noise although the peripheral highway is nearby. Parked at the far right corner next to a tree, had a good night’s sleep. WiFi inside Walmart, not outside. Toilets available when Walmart is open.

name: Playa del Carmen
description: Parking on the beach access for cars and people

name: El Patio
description: An absolutely delicious place to stop. Very good prices and gourmet type food with a beautiful presentation. I highly recommend the empanadas... they're the best I've had in Mexico.

name: Centro de Bustamante
description: Bustamante down town on the street behind police departament

name: El Arquito
description:
Campsite next to a small natural rock arch. There's a small stream to fall asleep to the sound of, there's fresh water piped down from the mountain to fill your bottles with, rustic toilets I think. tucked away in a valley in the forest, super peaceful, no phone reception. Will fit big rigs no problem, at the time of writing there's a friendly blue-eyed cat and her kittens, please keep pets under control.

My maps have no roads marked to get here but if you follow the route to Los Reyes Tepezala it's signposted from there, and I believe there's a shorter drive out to Bosque el Zembo.

It looks like it might be quite active at times - there are buildings set up to serve food, along with fire pits and palapas etc - but was virtually deserted when I was here - maybe busier during weekends? I think there are quad bike tours from San Miguel Regla that come here. No cost when I was here. Nice find!

name: Wasteland Tula
description:
free vacant lot near the archaeological site of Tula. Close to amenities (Burger King, supermarket, DIY store...) quiet at night. just behind the sawmill for those who want for dry toilets. the police came and ok for the night! 
OK with an RV over  30 feet
access from the main road

name: Santa Rita
description:
House just before the river crossing, you need Esmeril or Hilberto. cost is a bit steep for just a parking (200 pesos) but they offered me coffee and gave access to the bathroom.
currently (aug 2022) there are some issues between the pueblo and park Triunfo administration and they don't allow visitors to hike unless permission by pueblo assamblea is given. For that check with Hilberto or his brother David Santiago, both live by the basketball court.
They gave me a permission but asked 500-600 pesos 'apoyo' which I negotiated to 200.
Trail is nice but there is an unmarked fork before the river, there was a sign but they took it down. See one of the photos.
There is a free CFE wifi by the kindergarden 50 meters down from basketball court.
No cell signal

BEWARE OF TICKS, wear pants!

name: Estacionamiento API-Aba
description: Spacious parking with water, electricity and bathroom. 150 daily

name: pijiji campsite
description: Nice small and sandy place to stay in tends, next to the beach, quiet and really enjoyable in week days, 100 pp, Google this place and call the owner when you arrive to the town

name: Toll
description: Toll heading East and west bound $103 pesos.

name: Three flags
description: Little campground with full hookups. Right next to I90.  All sizes and types welcome. They also have covered tent sites.

name: Street parking by the mirador
description:
A spot big enough for three small rigs opposite the museo - another couple of spots around the corner right overlooking the town. I found a few flat spots hidden around town and picked this one for the view. Checked with the people in the house behind and they said fine, as long as I didn't block access to the little gate as they take motos in and out.

The police patrol regularly overnight but it was very peaceful once the sunset crowd had left - whole town feels very safe. You're at almost 3000m here so it gets pretty fresh at night (can feel it when walking up all the steps too!) Beautiful town with all the colours and narrow stairs and roads, like a mini Guanajuato. Decent Telcel signal.

name: Chu
description:
Termas do Tio do Pouso
Um excelente ambiente para um bom descanso com águas termais. Vale a itens conhecer em Tubarão sc

name: Gravel Parking lot at Community Center
description:
When you pass by the community center from rodeo road, there is a gravel parking lot. There are signs that overnight parking is not allowed in public parks in Santa Fe. Therefore we asked the community center and they said it’s not a problem at all because the parking lot is not a public park. 

The space is large enough for several vehicles. It is quiet and no one disturbed us. Good place to stay in Santa Fe where free overnight parking seems difficult to find.

name: Bluff off the dunes
description: Find an entry to the beach to get to this bluff, if you get a running start you can make it up about 30 feet completely safe from the tide and a semi flat area to camp. Just an incredible view and endless miles of flat beautiful beach for your enjoyment.

name: Public Library Wifi
description: Free wifi at the library.  Seems pretty slow, but if you need to check email or light surfing, it works.

name: Villas Del Penon
description:
Basic hotel. Clean room - AC, hot water, beds mediocre. Safe parking. Paid 420 pesos.
Checkin is at the main Hotel Panaramico a block north.
Rack rates are expensive so book online - I used Expedia.

name: Hostel Barrio Vivo
description:
super cool hostel that let us use their clean showers (warm) and toilet for 50 pp. and mainly,  very nice place to know..
we arrived because we heard some live music played, immediately the manager of the place started to talk with us, gave us cold water and offered to help with everything we need..so we asked to take a shower :) , they also invited us to stay for Pizza night at the hostel and we're super helpful and friendly,  gave us recommendations and let us sit and relax at this beautiful hostel. 

we highly recommend to go there if you need a shower, toilet or just nice company.

we also tried to camp our van in the park next to the hostel but it was too noisy and full of lights for us, in some point around 2am there was also fireworks so we moved (in the middle of the night) to Mejorada Park that was much better for sleeping .

name: Parque da Gare
description: Um lugar tranquilo onde se reúne famílias, com banheiro e torneiras. Vigilância 24h

name: quite wide parking space at the entrance to waterfall
description:
free. it's located to the left (if you look at the entrance to waterfall), free, quite, shaded, lots of space for big campers. felt safe. entrance to waterfall costs 30 pesos for mirador (view point on top ) and pool next to it +5 pesos for bottom part and river access, can swim there too. there are free bathrooms and showers inside.
 fried fish with rice and salad for 150 pesos offered at many places here.
enjoy)

name: Pemex
description: Super nice attendant. I didn’t need them but they had showers, bathrooms a restaurant. It looks like a new Pemex with nice landscaping ect so I would imagine the bathrooms would be nice and clean. Big flat, paved parking area next to the Pemex with ample lighting. Very safe

name: Pemex
description: Very few fuel stations. Super nice attendant

name: Hotel Rias
description:
Excellent clean basic accommodations. Ac, wifi, hot water, secure parking for bikes, low vehicles only.
Booked online Expedia for 306 pesos/night 1 pax.
Rack rates are 500 pesos.

name: Taqueria Bonampak
description: These were some of the BEST tacos I tried in Mexico. Great prices and they're extremely popular with locals.

name: parking en parque
description: hay un parque muy bonito con un gran parking para estacionar, hay electricidad desde que cae el sol hasta q sale muy necesaria por el calor. vista hermosa del mar. de lunes a viernes suele haber mucho movimiento, clase de Zumba 7am y por la noche partidos de básquet, esos días se llena y hasta tarde. los fines de semana más tranquilo, muy seguro y bonito. en el parque no hay nada de sombra, durante el día salíamos del parking a los árboles de alrededor para tener un poco de sombra.

name: Pemex - Large Parking
description:
Just a Pemex gas station with a large parking lot. The store is very big and modern. Subway inside.
A working came up to our window at night, I thought we were getting kicked out but he just asked for a lighter 🤣

name: Anza Borrego - NICE
description: Free Camping on Anza Borrego Park. Nice and was very quiet. Has something away a toilet.  Price: FREE

name: Spencer Hotsprings
description:
Hammer site. Lots of places for vehicle or tent camping with good views.

Three pools, the one in the center can be somewhat adjusted temperature wise.

Roads leading to it are 2wd dirt roads and should be easy unless wet.

name: Burr Trail - NICE
description: Very quiet sleeping places on the Burr Trail to Boulder on a BLM road.

name: Coral Pink Sand Dunes - OK
description: Free camping without nothing in the BLM area. But you can also everywhere else camped nearby!  Price: Free

name: Ely - OK
description: Cookies at the 50 to Ely. Heard BLM. Fire pit, benches and trash cans. From here, start some offroad trails. Goods only at noon there. Traffic has hardly!

name: Elyn - OK
description: Sleeping area in NF. Was super quiet here, albeit cold.

name: Lake Mead RA - NICE
description: Nice place outside the Lake Mead Recreation Area between the Valley of Fire and Las Vegas on a 4x4 route slightly away from the main road. Very quiet, aircraft can be heard sometimes.

name: McDonalds Kanab - NAJA
description: Shakedown at McDonalds in Kanab for the morning to drive directly to the raffle Wave.

name: Salton Sea - OK
description: Sleeping place behind a palm tree at the Salton Sea. You can sleep anywhere here beside the road. Is not especially beautiful, but good starting point for the Salton Sea bird watching.

name: Smokey Mountain Rd - NICE
description: Very nice place on top of the cliff with great views! Attention, certainly often windy!

name: BLM Free Camping West of Zion
description: Sleeping place just off the main road on well marked road. Big rigs welcome. Warm according to circumstances but quiet at night. Verizon decent, good t-mobile.

name: Walmart, Port Angeles, Washington
description:
Amazingly quiet place

Update 2019-06-01 : Especially quiet next to the garden center.

name: State Line Campground
description: Cute free BLM camping in near  TH baths.

name: White Pocket
description: Sleeping place right in front of the White Pocket on the parking. Super quiet, 0 Services. Ideal for morning and sunset photos!

name: Tolsona River RV Park and Campground
description: An old standby for us.  Multiple sites for large or small RV's and tents along a windy creek.  Hot showers cost .25/minute, wifi close to office.

name: Beverly Beach State Park
description: This is a great campground for a first night on the Oregon coast.  It is a very nice State Park campground with great beach access under a highway 101 overpass.  A Beautiful old growth loop-system campground with full hookups, tent sites (good selection), hot showers, clean bathrooms, but no wifi available. It is not free (which is hard to do in Oregon) but the price was $17 (update: $21/night May 2022) for a tent site. Be sure to check the pay period dates though as we were there in a "Discovery" period ($17 was between Oct 1-Apr 30).

name: Sunset Bay State Park
