About 20km out of Springdale (south entrance of Zion NP), you turn right in the Kolob Terrace Rd (paved road). You follow approximately 2-3 km and you turn right. If its rainy or its not totally dry, it will be slippery and you probably need 4x4 and high clearance due to the soft red sand. There are plenty of spots by the river. We were not alone (two caravans were permanently settled). 

I had no bars on Sprint, my friend had a few bars on Cricket/AT&T

name: Jumbo Rock
description: Nice large campground right in the middle of Joshua Tree NP. $15/night and you can have two tents/cars per site. No showers though, bring lots of water.

name: Sea Bee Park
description: 3 free campsites with a covered picnic table and a fire pit. This is a city park on a lake. It has flush toilets and a hand sink.

name: Spotlight 29 Casino
description: A large open lot for RV and big rig parking. There is a large sign with what RV's are allowed to do or not. It was extremely hot and so we started off with our windows open. Come night fall, the wind started picking up and so did the sand.

name: Hunters Check Station Campground
description: Very rustic wooded sites. There is a hand pump for water (seasonal) and a pit toilet. Camping is free with a two week limit. only a couple of sites will accommodate larger than a pickup camper.

name: Pinyon Flat
description:
National Forest Campspot.The usually thing.Firepits, Tables.Vault Toilets.But has potable Water! 8 bucks, self registration.
Cactus Trail starts above the Road.

name: BLM rd 772
description: Just outside Carlsbad Caverns national park. Clearance for a loose climb. Nice sunset.

name: Carlsbad NM (blm)
description: A lot of nice places at a rough gravelroad in blm clos to the carlsbad NM, fire rings, nice view and quiet

name: Mountain Palm Springs Campground
description:
Nice place in the desert.Very quiet.Clean Pit toilet.Nice trails to group of Palms, like Oasis. We liked it.
It seem to be free camping, so no costs.
Good place to stop before going to the mexican Border

name: Creek Pasture, Canyonlands NP (Needles)
description: Official BLM campground with lots of spots. Pit toilets, picnic tables and fire pits. First come first serve system. 8 km before the entrance of Canyonlands NP (South entrance, Needles). Open all year round. 15$ per night. Excellent place to camp and relax. Dramatic sunsets on the red rock formations!

name: Barnett's Propane
description: Easy access from I-10.  Cheap.

name: Sunrise RV Park
description: Gravel sides whith full hook up. 60$/night. Pk but nothing special. Good location.  101 is next door, but walled off.

name: New Melones Lake Rec.Area
description:
Campground $ 22 with $ showers

Campingplatz 22 $ mit $Duschen

name: Lost Dutchman
description: Excellent, very clean campground for $ 30/night. Good hikes nearby, half an hour to Phoenix.

name: National Forest Road 618 Loop
description:
Gravel loop. quiet. pack in, pack out.
Rock fire rings.

name: Waldport Forest Road
description: Forest road pull out. Nothing special just overnight wildcamp spot in Siuslaw National Forest.

name: The Lost Coast And Cape Mendecino
description: Beautiful rugged coastline on the lost coast. There are quite a few pull outs and parking spots along this bit of coast netto the road. Good for surfing too. Some cars Will come by but its pretty remote and absolutely stunning scenery

name: Ajo BLM Land Boondocking Site
description: A boondocker's dream. Access by high clearance vehicles only. Expect thorny trees to scratch your vehicle's paint. Bring your own firewood. No facilities, no network coverage.

name: Berdoo Canyon Trail
description: Rough road to a side entrance Joshua Tree National Park. High clearance essential. Do not attempt when rain is expected- high risk flash flood area! Sorrowly sometimes used as a shooting range, trash all over.

name: Mojave Ntl Preserve Cedar Cyn. Rd. West
description: It's an established campground actually but it feels almost like boondocking and it's free. Beautiful scenery. A couple of firerings, no other facilities. Wood cutting and gathering prohibited. Access by high clearance vehicles only.

name: Tecopa Warm Pool dispersed Camping
description: Dispersed camping on BLM Land with your own pool on the site. Close to the town of Tepoca. Can get busy at night. Water temperature is around 85*F — too cool in the winter. Tepoca Mud Baths clothing optional public natural hot springs where the water emerges from the ground at 118° close by (1.2 miles).

name: The Lazy Lizard
description:
Hostel with bungalow, room with dormitory, small space for tent and possibility to camp in your van (no space for trailer). Price is 8$/person for camping (van or tent).I think it is 14$ for a bed in the dormitory. Great staff and relax vibes. Simple but clean bathroom, hot showers, laundry machine, good WiFi, shared kitchen.
We manage to park our van in the shade along a bungalow so we were able to plug it into the electric outlet. We stayed 5 days instead of 2! Very cheap for what you get! 
Notes: you can use the showers for 3$ if you don't stay overnight ! 
They have cats and doves so I'm not sure if they are pet friendly, but I'm sure it is worth it to ask.
The address is 1213 south highway 191, Moab, Utah
( 3km on the main road South of the tourist office)

name: Kern River Campground (Lake Ming)
description:
actually a nice big place with big parking spaces, for 12 dollars, but the sanitary facilities are terrible (especially men's toys without doors and walls ...) and dogs cost an extra 4 dollars (for what?)

eigentlich schöner großer Platz mit großen Stellplätzen, für 12 Dollar, aber Sanitäranlagen furchtbar (vorallem Männertoi ohne Türen und Wände...) und Hunde kosten extra 4 Dollar (for what?)

name: Ajo (blm)
description: My posting on March 18, 2021 needs to be removed. Our GPS took us onto a different road (Scenic Loop Road) to get there and that's what I was writing about. If people go from West Rocalla Ave. in Ajo they should be fine.

name: Ocala National Forest
description: There are also established campgrounds around as well. This particular spot is near the town of Salt Springs, so I can pick up Verizon 4GLTE, no ATT coverage but there are 600sq miles of forest to explore.

name: Aliso Campground - National Forest
description: Free national forest campground. Toilet, fire pits and camping tables. Nice secluded spot, 6 mile drive from the main highway.

name: Prewitt Ridge Rd. - Los Padres NF
description: One of the most spectacular campsites on the pacific coast, weather permitting. There are numerous sites with varying degree of view and cover situated on the mountain top directly over the coast. At the top of Nacimiento rd turn right onto the Forrest road (as of 2202-May-25 Nacimiento-Ferguson access is closed, use Los Burros instead), after about 3 miles, where the road forks, turn right and continue for another 2 miles or so. There are many sites throughout the 12 mile drive from hwy1 but the most spectacular are towards the end at the top of the mountain. Give yourself plenty of time to get here as the road in is slow and can be steep in places. Experienced drivers could get in with any car. Some sites have fire rings and tables. It can get quite windy. The GPS is to our favorite site.

name: Kofa National Wildlife Refuge
description: Miles of free BLM camping in the area, no  designated sites, no water or toilet but you stay in the middle of a desert between some cactus for free (it’s all gravel, some places require high clearance).

name: Overton
description: Located a few miles north of the east entrance to Valley of Fire State Park on 169, this huge mesa is known as "Snowbird Mesa" or "Poverty Flats" depending on your point of view. there are no signs limiting stays and there appear to be some long term residents. There are a few stone fire rings and plenty of stones to make more. There can be dozens to hundreds of rigs depending on the season. There are several roads in to the east side which goes back a good ways.(free)

name: Mojave Desert - Heritage Trail Rd.
description: Beautiful but exposed as there's no trees just smaller shrubbery.

name: Buckeye Hot Springs
description: Many free campsites in national forest land adjacent to a creek and Buckeye Hot Springs.  Also nearby is Twin Lakes Campground (Forest Campground) but it was closed. Only campfire rings in the campsites, no facilities.

name: Catalina State Park
description:
Overpriced campground in beautiful park close to Tucson. $25 for non-electrical, $35 for electrical sites (these prices include the $5 "reservation fee" which is required even if you're just driving up.) Clean and quiet. Great hikes in the area, although limited trails allow dogs. 

3G Verizon coverage.

name: Alabama Hills
description: Alabama hills recreation area. You are allowed to stay for free in the middle of all the rock formations. It has some firepits and it's very quiet and a great place to stay and walk.

name: Flint River preserve
description: Campground maintained by the county power company. $5 per night. Nice shady sites with water, grills, picnic tables, and garbage cans. Located next to a electric dam/water reservoir. No reservation required but you can register if you like 229-535-6275 to make sure you have a spot

name: Barton Warnock Visitor center
description: Small RV park ran by state parks Texas right behind the visitors centre. only five spots. The Visitor Center has a dump station and you can also fill your water tank with drinkable water for free located on the side of the building.

name: Blue Ridge Wildlife Management Area
description:
Beautiful River front camping in this WMA, a few nice sites right by the river. No ATT service, got Vzw with the booster.

Continue up the road for more/better sites.

name: Davis Mountain State Park
description:
Nice size of campground with various services at sites. WiFi but no cell service 
Camped here one night in a tent. A little pricey for my tastes ($15 per night plus $6 entrance fee) but it is a state park so it’s expected. The trade-off is the sites were pretty nice with a bunch of trees around, I had water at my site, and the showers were pretty clean and hot. Heard what I think was a javelina and coyotes at night, place was about 1/4 full of other campers. No reception. Nice little park to spend a night in.

name: Boat Ramp Lot
description: Giant lot, no traffic, restrooms. Free. Lakeside

name: Monahan Sandhills State Park
description: Nice facility, just in the dunes. Good sandbox for kids. Price is 15$ for camping +4$ per adult to enter the park.

name: Palo Duro State Park
description: Awesome campground on the bortom of the canyon, Various option and price range from $12- $24. Wifi at the entrance building.

name: Sinclair Gas Station/Truck Stop
description: The Sinclair has a side parking lot for semi trucks so we asked the cashier inside if we could pay to park overnight. He said we could and didn't need to pay. I told him we'd get our gas here in the morning and buy some snacks. Not that there are signs in some areas stating No Parking. The semi area is labeled with a TRUCKS only sign in the North fence, that is where we parked. The restaurant two doors down let us use the restroom. Couldn't hear the traffic on the road next to the gas station. The semi trucks were on all night but it didn't bother is. It's not a quiet spot but was darker than a Walmart parking lot!

name: Caprock Canyon state park
description: Nice campground with all amenities for $15

name: Antelope Valley Fairground RV Park
description:
A reasonable place to stay for full hookups and toilets and showers if you are passing through. Not for tenters. 
$20 for 30 amp power or $25 per night for 50 amp power.

name: Alder Dune Campground
description: $22 - clean and well maintained site, among coastal pines and native vegetation. Some road noise but mostly masked by bird sounds. Low key and friendly ground manager

name: Lake Mineral Wells state park
description: Nice large campground on the lakexxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

name: Bastrop State Park
description: Awesome camping here, clean and all options possible.

name: Diamond Lake Resort
description: Large rv park.  Many permanent residents.   Kid friendly.   Helpful staff.   Internet available at office.   Commercial WiFi available from third party.

name: Brazos Bend state park
description: Nice camping for $20 in the Houston area. Second night 50% off with Texas state parks pass.

name: Philip's RV Park
description: Nice Spots with trees, bathroom clean, hot showers included, 20 dollar dry site, loud because of train and street nearby, 24h Walmart in town

name: Guadalupe River state park
description: Not the best of Texas state parks, the place could use a reno, especially in the bathrooms $20 for electrical sites

name: Mtn. Shasta Forrest
description: A dirt road leaves 97 and heads towards the mountain. There are several good spots along the road. It continues up to some train tracks and continues towards the base of the mountain. A few trains did pass in the night so may not want to camp too close. Great views of mountain and valley. The GPS is the spot we chose, but there are many closer and easier to access. Snow on the ground during our visit, may not be accessible after big falls.

name: Bromide Canyon
description:
Flat pull off on an otherwise steep and narrow dirt road, next to a small stream. We had gotten tired of the heat in the desert below and decided to gain some elevation to cool down. We spent a couple of days walking in the surrounding mountains, and relaxing. 

The road up is steep and rocky.

name: Dexter Creek
description: flat site next to the Dexter Creek. Only a few minutes drive from Ouray, we spent a couple of days in Ouray, and drove out here in the evening. The river is loud but it's a sound I could listen to all day.

name: Saddle Mountain Wilderness
description:
Boondocking site with stunning views over the saddle mountain wilderness. Plenty of nearby hiking.

Take the Grand Canyon Highway south from Jacob Lake. About 26 miles onwards (5 miles from the Grand Canyon entrance station) take the 611 east going east, opposite the entrance for the better signed 22. At the first signed junction, take the right fork onto the 610 headed towards the Marble View Point. Carry on this road for about 14 miles, until you reach the saddle mountain trail head.

name: Picketwire Canyon Trail Head
description: 5 free campsites with fire pits and pit toilet at trail head.  Unmaintained dirt road access.

name: Lone Rock Beach
description:
This Lake Powell campsite is located in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, so campsite fees and entry fees both apply. Camping was $14.00 per vehicle, see Glen Canyon website for entry fees. 

The campsites are mixed from being right on the beach front, to being further back (and uphill a bit). You can essentially camp where you want, so long as you are not off the sand roads. Many ATV's on the beach, but it is not really an off road area so people are pretty respectful of the land and it is kept in good shape. 

There is a decent number of pit toilets that have flush systems, but drinking water is not available at these toilets. Toilets are scattered across the camping area. washrooms with running water are a short distance away from the camping, and do include outdoor (mild temperature) showers. 

Fires are allowed but need to be kept to a decent size, and many pits are already dug and lined with rocks. Wood can be purchased at the Greenhaven Estates gas station about 3 miles from the main road entrance. 

The beach is great for swimming but does not get deep very fast. Many boats put in and/or pull up right on the beach, and the majority of vehicles are larger RV's and 5th wheels. Some spots however are pretty soft sand and people can get stuck - low clearance sports cars are NOT recommended. 

Beautiful, family oriented primitively camping. Good place to be on a warm day!

name: Little A'Le'Inn
description: Restaurant in Rachel, NV near Area 51 that plays on alien theme.   They have for spots with water and electric hookups plus tent camping and dry camping area.  Tent and dry camping are free.

name: Blanco State park
description: Nice campground on the river side halfway between Austin and San Antonio. $20 for electric sites + 5 dollar a night person entrance fee.

name: The Wayward Traveler's Inn
description: The Wayward Traveler's Inn, Bed and Breakfast, Tea House, Writer's Retreat and General House of Awesomeness. Run by a writer and avid motorcyclist, we will give any great trekker up to two nights free accommodation. That's how important supporting the travel community is to us.

name: Lower Bowns Resevoir
description:
Dispersed camping sites tucked into the trees. There is a paid for campsite adjacent to the the reservoir but these sites are free and in a sheltered location.

We had intended to drive the back route into Capitol Reef but the trail is pretty extreme and totally unsuited to a large rv. The reservoir gives good fishing and swimming and makes a nice area to walk around.

name: Boondocking site off FR 088
description:
Boondocking site tucked into the trees. 

We spent the night there and intended to drive straight into Bryce National Park the following morning. Sadly the gate into the park was locked, but it was still a nice place to spend the night.

name: Animas Forks Boondocking
description:
Great camping spot next to the ghost town of Animas Forks. 

The road up is very rocky and is hard on an RV. There was a boulder on the trail further down when we visited, but we managed to squeeze past in our 2.5m wide truck.

name: Goliad State Park
description: Various possibilities to camp here, with rlectric snd water$15. Close to town.

name: Colorado River Basin
description: BLM free - no camping restrictions is what this means.

name: Indian Pass Road
description: BLM Free

name: Mustang Island state park
description: Parking lot like RV park with hookups for $20 or primitive beach camping for 10.

name: Walmart - Tchoupitoulas St.
description:
**please, park in the parking in front of the Walmart, with the police cars (GPS: N 29.92544, W 90.06998 ). If you park in the lot right by the Walmart, you might be tell to leave, as other comments mentioned **

Free overnight parking at Walmart in New Orleans. Restrooms & wifi at McDonalds. Quiet at night (it closes at 10) and pretty safe. A sheriff was on duty in Walmart while 20-30 police cars where parked outside of the store. 

Only 4km to the French Qt through the warehouse district. Safe route if you take the Tchoupitoulas street all the way to Canal Str. You can also ride the bus.

name: Shell Oil Road Hunter Camp
description:
Free Primitive campsite, no facilities.  Basically a clearing just off the road.

Usually deserted.  Can fill up during hunting season Oct - Jan

name: Double Lake Recreational Area Campground
description: Double Lake Recreation Area was built in 1937 by the Civilian Conservation Corps and offers a little of everything, including camping, fishing, swimming, picnicking, hiking and simply relaxing in nature. A variety of tent, RV and group campsites are available.

name: Huntsville State Park
description: Nice state park with trees, real trees and a lake. 20$/ night with water and electricity 25$/night for w/e + sewer. Purchase State Park pass - 70$ takes care of all entry fees plus get 4 coupons for 50% off second night stay. Pass ends up paying for itself.

name: Cagle Recreation Area Campground
description:
Cagle Recreation Area, located on the shores of Lake Conroe, offers great fishing and water sports just 45 minutes north of Houston. Cagle has a boat ramp, hiking trails and two camping loops with 47 full-service RV sites nestled among the pines of the Sam Houston National Forest. Sites offer drinking water, electricity and sewer hookups plus a tent pad, lantern post and fire ring.
Reservations for all sites must be made at least 48 hours in advance online at www.recreation.gov or by calling 877-444-6777.

name: Stubblefield Lake Recreation Area Campground
description:
Stubblefield Lake Recreation Area was built in 1937 by the Civilian Conservation Corps as part of one of President Franklin D. Roosevelt’s New Deal programs. Just an hour north of Houston, in the Sam Houston National Forest, Stubblefield offers great outdoor experiences, including camping, canoeing, fishing, hiking and picnicking.
Forest visitors can now camp up to 28 days at selected recreation areas in the National Forests and Grasslands in Texas.   Extended camping is offered at:
Stubblefield Recreation Area - Sites: 20-29
For more information call 936-344-6205.

name: Lake Bryan
description:
Nice campground, has bathrooms, cleared areas and tree'd areas.

Restaurant closes in the winter time.

name: Freeport Beaches
description:
Free camping on the county beaches. Watch signage near homes/neighborhoods. Do not drive in the dunes, you will be ticketed.
Main area of sand is usually packed and fine for all vehicles to drive on.  
Stahlman park, near enough, has all hours free restroom with outdoor shower.
Town is nearby, multiple good restaurants..

name: BLM camping free!
description: nice gravel areas away from the road- free camping. often used by those with ATV's, lots of large RV'S drive up throughout the area and camp but you will have space all alone and away from the noise and city :)

name: Warriors Path State Park, Kingsport.
description: Lovely sites next to River, with Good clean showers and Toilets

name: Sweetwater campground
description: nice hidden Gem, legit camping $29 for partial hookups, $32 full hookups, showers, and the view! Wireless internet in campground.

name: Tamarack Beach US95, Nevada
description: Free camp site along US95 in Walker Lake, near Hawthorne. No amenities. Only pit toilets, and trash dumpster. Dramatic views of the lake.

name: Swamp Boat Ramp
description: Dead end road in middle of nowhere, looks like a boat launch but no signs. Free and quiet.

name: Village Creek State Park
description:
nice quiet park area,  separate tent area,  open from 8am to 10pm
20$ a night

name: Goulding's Camp
description: Beautiful campground in a wonderful position, with store and all services.

name: Twin Arrows
description: Big parking in front of the Navajo hotel and casino where you can find 24 hours restrooms, bar, restaurant and shop. RV welcome, no place for tents. There's a 10$ lounge with showers and more it seems.

name: Alamo Canyon campground - Organ Pipe NM
description: Beautiful campground with 4 sites. Big campground 10 miles south at the Park Visitor Center with all services. Here, only pit toilet and beauty!

name: Ray Campground
description: Beautiful campground at the entrance of West Seguaro NP. Tent 10$ RV 20$. Pay no attention to the First Come First Serve signs and info on website. Reserve online through a convoluted interface here https://apm.activecommunities.com/nrpr/Home

name: Gee Creek Rest Area
description:
Decent Rest area, with separated truck/car parking. Clean washrooms.
Southbound side has separate rv parking way in the back and a free dump station.

name: Eagle Creek Campground
description: Fully open in July. Reserved and some FF. (Very loud, no showers, one water tap; only use if you really need to crash.)

name: Mojave Desert near Rainy Day Mine
description: Many different dirt roads to choose from. Don't forget to bring enough water! Probably unreachable except with a 4WD vehicle, no RVs except possibly a truck camper. See official NPS page at URL below, search inside page for "Rainy Day Mine".

name: Joshua Tree Outskirts
description: Dirt road access into the park or a simple free desert camp spot just outside the park limits.

name: Desert Hot Springs Trailer Park (With hot Mineral pools)
description:
$45/per night trailer park.. with hot tubs with natural mineral water.

Worth it.. maybe.

name: La Salle County Rest Stop
description: Texas rest stops are the best! Large, clean bathrooms open 24 hrs. Picnic tables. Electricity only inside the building for charging gadgets, not your rigs. No WiFi. FREE camp.

name: Guadalupe County Rest Stop
description: Texas rest stops are the best! Large, clean bathrooms open 24 hrs. Picnic tables. Electricity only inside the building for charging gadgets. No WiFi. FREE camp.

name: Colorado County Rest Stop
description: Texas rest stops are the best! Large, clean bathrooms open 24 hrs. Picnic tables. Electricity only inside the building for charging gadgets. No WiFi. FREE camp.

name: Chambers County Rest Stop
description: Texas rest stops are the best! Large, clean bathrooms open 24 hrs. Picnic tables. Electricity only inside the building for charging gadgets. No WiFi. FREE camp.

name: Alabama Interstate Rest Area
description: Large, clean bathrooms open 24 hrs. Picnic tables. No WiFi. FREE camp.

name: CamAmboyCrater
description: Nice space at the trail to the crater,  tables, pit toilets, free.

name: Cachuma Lake
description: Established camp site. Rates were $25 off season plus $3 for dog. Didn't stay here no further info.

name: Coldfoot Camp
description: Coldfoot Camp is a known truck stop on the Dalton Highway. it offers food, gas and accommodation as well as an RV park. I slept on the grounds in my car.

name: Limekiln State Park
description: Nice campgrounds with some sites facing directly to the water and offering spectacular views of the sunset. Has beach access. there is a walk-in/overflow campsite directly under the bridge, loved it.

name: Veterans Memorial Park
description:
City campground, $44 per night. Hot/lukewarm shower, bathroom, picnic table and playground for kids. 
Few minutes away from Monterey and some public beaches.

name: Cane Creek Campground
description: Rv and tent camping available $25 for dry camping $30 for hook ups. Second Saturday of every month they have live Blue Grass

name: Hot Springs Off Road Park
description: $15 per night for tent sites, best to confirm rate for RV electric sites. Forested camping area, separate RV area, heated & clean washrooms, hot showers. Pet friendly. Extra money and a waiver to use off road trails, we didn't indulge but can only assume they are legendary as the place started getting busy Sat morning with dirt bikes, ATVs, mudders, you name it. We had the place to ourselves overnight which was a dream. Can see this place being a good, rowdy time overnight in the warmer months on weekends. There's a small convenience store open during the day for ice, water, coffee, firewood. Prob big rig friendly but best to confirm.

name: Indian Springs Campground
description: Campground RV park. $30 for full hookups. No public restrooms open year round. We stayed in winter. In summer there is hiking and lake access. There is also a catch and release pond

name: Port Aransas Beach
description:
Nice little island with a sandy beach and great people
Stays of up to three nights are permitted along the 8 mile long beach. 
RV, tent and other types of camping are permitted.
Some portable toilets & trash cans.

name: Padre Island National Seashore South Beach
description:
a beautiful beach on Padre Island
free camping on the beach is permitted up to 14 days
no restrooms, no water , no Stress
just a few other people here -  just perfect!
you can also drive along the beach for miles but in some areas a 4x4 is recommended

name: surfside  beach
description:
Super nice wide beach with several driveways. Easy to drive. 

Super schöner breiter langer Strand mit mehreren Einfahrten. Gut befahrbar.

name: British Autoworks
description:
If anyone needs a Land Rover mechanic near San Diego, we can highly recommend this garage! Peter is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. :)

https://www.facebook.com/BritishAutoworksSanDiego/?fref=ts

name: Victoria Bryant State Park
description: State park camp ground. RV sites with hook ups and tent camping available

name: Magnolia Branch Wildlife Reserve
description: Beautiful location. Rv sites with full hookup $30 electricity and water $25 and tent camping. Also gave day rates for activities. Kayaking, canoeing, zip line, tubing and fishing available

name: Rutherford Beach
description: Amazing location right on the water. Sand firm enough to safely drive on! Backed up to beach and slept with back hatch opened merely a few feet from the crashing waves! Will definitely return when passing through! since there are nice big dumpsters take a couple of minutes and pick up a few pieces of trash...will only make it better! 2 bars of cell service.

name: Westport-Union Landing State Beach Campground
description: Campground with a great view of ocean on the side of the cliff. Not much for facilities (pit toilets), but a beautiful place. 25$ per night.

name: St Bernard State Park
description: State park outside of New Orleans. $18 +$6 transaction fee for site. Bathrooms wifi beautiful setting.

name: Lake Van Municipal
description: nice place at lake. hook up $15, dry camping with shelter $9.

name: Lake Corpus Christi State Park
description:
State Park at a lake
nice ,clean an quiet
10$ per night plus 5$ entrance fee per person 
WiFi an the headquarter and restrooms

name: Tombigbee Lake Campground
description: RV and tent sites. Water and power. $20-$30. Pull through spots with nice views.

name: Campland On The Bay
description:
Very clean. Store, Cafe, wifi, pool, close to aquarium. A nice place to relax a couple days. Good stop before Mexico or after Joshua tree.
They only accept manufactured vehicles. No conversions.

name: Wells Fargo RV Park
description: RV Park in Tombstone Arizona. $37/night, wash is $1.75 and the showers are hot and clean.

name: Black Canyon
description: Good spot, pretty calm and clean toilets

name: Deming Walmart
description: Good spot. Very popular for RV's and trucks. Got here at 8:15 and a lot of folks already here. Actually pretty quiet later which was a nice surprise. Can hear trains early though. Overall very good overnight spot.

name: Alamogordo Walmart
description: Fine to park overnight if park down the left hand side lots of RVs there

name: BLM camp spots near Carlsbad Caverns
description:
Free Spot 
Primitive campsite up a hill. Nice pullouts with small rock fire pits. Nice views. Remote & quiet. Road is large gravel stones, 2WD fine but make sure to have clearance higher up. First couple spots are very accessible.

name: Faywood Hot Springs
description: Located between Deming and Silver City near City of Rocks State Park, this is a great place to soak away the aches and pains from long days of driving! We have stayed here three times over the past 3 years - improvements being made all the time. Lots of camping options - pull through a for big rigs and tent camping. Pets allowed (must be leashed) for a nominal fee. Prices range from (1person/2 people) $25/$40 per night for tents to $34/$50for 30 amp RVs and $42/$60 60amp RVs. Each additional adult is $22 and $17 for kids. Cabins can be rented for $72-$186 per night. A day pass for soaking is also available for $13. They have private pools available for individuals, couples, and groups for $17/hr per person but $34 minimum.

name: Van Horn Mountain View RV Park
description: RV Park

name: Rio Grande Campground & Store - Big Bend NP
description: $2 showers for 5 minutes even if you're not staying at the campground. Not the best showers but better than nothing! Cheap laundry ($1.50/load wash and 25 cents/eight minutes dry). Cheaper groceries than at Chisos Basin store. Decent WiFi and shade. Good place to sit and watch coyotes and roadrunners.

name: SpiritMountainCasino
description: Free camp site at the Casino. Only parking in a nice asfalt ftat space with light. They ask only a registration, no fee! All the services are at the Casino.

name: Seminole Canyon State Park
description:
State park. Sites range from $10-$20/night, plus per-person daily entrance fee. 

Note: campground closed until June 2020.

name: Casino del Sol
description:
Nice casino with swimming pool and good restaurants. A gas station and convenience store at the corner and not too far from Big Box stores and restaurants along Valencia. People stay all season. 

The Casino has a new rv park with full hookups and Jacuzzi for $36 Back in and $40 for pull through. Laundry and Hot showers also. They no longer accept free overnight parking.

name: Circle S Campground Rv Park
description:
Full hookup 43,00 $ usd hot shower wifi quiet close to everything . Close to hyway 40 and Fairy noisy all night.

Fuel hookup 43,00$ usd douche chaude wifi tranquille pres de tout 

no toilet paper in the bathroom since methheads kept on stealing it

name: San Antonio Walmart
description: RV Parking Very quiet place for overnight special on left site of building in the Corner

name: Interstate 40 Grand Canyon RV Park
description: 34.00$ USA full hookup

name: Bill Fredrick park
description:
Nice park in the middle of the city. They have a RV park and campgrounds. The price for tent site is about 8$ a night. Bathrooms and warm showers are close to the campsites, as well as a sink for washing dishes
We slept in the van in the campground parking lot.

name: Middleton's Fish CampPark
description:
All campers must register at the Tackle Shop.
Visitors are limited to 7 days.

name: Cieneguita BLM Land
description:
Primitive campsite in the desert. Very little shade. Free.
Awesome views Road in is good

name: Lo Lo Mai Springs Resort
description:
44.00 $ usd full hookups very nice site swimming pool nice toilet shower with warm trees river for RV and camping 16km from Sonora 

44.00$ usd full hookups tres beau site piscine belle toilette douche avec chaude arbres riviere pour RV et camping a 16km de Sonora

name: Semiole Canyon State Park
description:
very nice state park with a great view and cool trails
camping from 8$ up to 20$ plus 3$ per person
WiFi at headquarters and restroom
A beautiful desert canyon hike from here with pictographs. No bugs. No trees. Very comfortable and clean. Note primitive sites have no bathrooms? Or showers?

name: Fredericksburg Walmart
description: Walmart Fredericksburg parking lot. The usual.

name: The Vineyards at Fredericksburg
description: Large place with full facilities. About 2 miles (3, 5 km) to the center of town.

name: Dream Catcher RV Park
description: 15.00 USD full hookup

name: Casino Miccosukee
description:
Open for overnight in January 2022 when I was there.

USer reports We went to security and were told to see the front desk. They wanted to change $75 just to park overnight. No hook ups or anything!

name: Werkstatt
description: Werkstatt San Antonio

name: I10 rest area
description: 24 hours security and toilet. Sign at entrance says "no overnight parking", but security guard said it's no problem and directed to park next to a picnic table

name: Chief Propane
description: Was ok to full my french/Argentinian 13kg bottle

name: Swan Lake Campground, Flathead National Forest
description: Lovely clean campground with large sites separated with trees for privacy. Beautiful lake across the road, very nice for swimming on a hot day. Well worth the $15

name: Helena Campground & RV Park
description: Campground a few kilometres out of town with clean showers, coin laundry and WiFi. $20

name: Bozeman Trail Campground
description: Campground located between Interstate and railway and therefore somewhat noisy. They have washers and dryers. $20

name: Eagle Creek Campground, Gardiner
description:
Nice small campground not far from Gardiner. The camp hosts are very friendly. This is about 10 minutes from the north entrance of Yellowstone.
This is dry camping only with bear storage boxes for tent campers.  There is a vault toilet.

name: Picnic area off highway
description: Lots of parking and big rig friendly. Trash bins, too.

name: Great Gallery
description: Parking lot. Accessible with a european RV

name: Little painted desert
description:
Informal campground with a wonderful view at the sunset on the Little painted desert.
Good LTE with Tmobile. 
Several fire pits

name: Ole Towne Cotton Gin RV Park
description: Full hookup 27.00usd with AAA card, laundry room, store, www.oletownecottonginrvpark.com

name: Poinsett State Park South Carolina Usa
description: 19.25 used water & elect. Mobile only very nice

name: Ancient Cedars @ Mesa Verde RV Resort
description: A very good site with all facilities and warm bathrooms, a great treat when travelling in early spring. Approx 30 dollars for 2 depending on what sort of hook up required. Site just across the road from the entrance to Masa Verde National Park.

name: Stans Merc
description: RV park back of Stans True Value, the general store in Circleville. Basic but a good find in an area where there was a shortage of places to stay. Cafe next door with good basic food. As we didn't need a restroom or shower we did not inquire about them.

name: Grant Village Campground
description:
We arrived late at this campground and it was high season, but were lucky and got a site which we could shared with other overlanders (myartoftravel.ch).
The he campground is huge and not very nice. The showers are about one kilometer away.  No showers for 2021

name: Indian Creek Campground
description:
Arrived on a Sunday and spent 2 nights. 
When we arrived @ 5PM there were still plenty of sites available but after 8PM everything was taken. 
Still, among other Yellowstone campsites this is the one where finding availability was the easiest. 
Limited RV space.

name: Hoback Campground
description: Nice small campground in the Bridger-Tenton National Forest. $15

name: Walmart, Rock Springs
description: Open 24h, many fast food restaurants nearby

name: Junction West RV Park
description: RV Park near Grand Junction with clean showers and WiFi. $28

name: Hal Canyon Campground
description: Small campground not far from Arches NP. $20

name: Squaw Flat Campground
description:
Quite campground with limited spots, first come first serve or make a reservation some time before you plan to go. Hike in the incredibly beautiful canyons, for a day or a week. We weren't sure if this was still earth...

Water spigots are not for RV tank fill. No utilities offered in the campground

name: Blue Mountain Trading Post & RV Park
description: American style RV Park. Sites are half gravel half grass. The WiFi is fast and the owner knows many off road tracks in the region.

name: Irish Canyon
description: Nice area for free camping near the Glen Canyon NRA. Some spots have fire pits. Camping officially allowed. FREE

name: Fruita Campground
description: Campground in the Capitol Reef National Park with restrooms, drinking water but no showers. There is a nice hiking trail starting right at the entrance of the campground. $20

name: Sand Creek Campground
description: Campground in Torrey with clean bathrooms, washers and WiFi. $20 (Cash!). Has laundry on site.

name: Great Basin Rovers
description: There are only a few really good Land Rover mechanics in the states, Bill Davis in Salt Lake City is one of them. He works with Land Rovers since decades and knows everything about Series and Defenders. We stopped here for doing some maintenance and getting some spare parts. We camped behind the workshop before hitting the road again the next day.

name: Sunset Campground
description: Campground in the Bryce Canyon National Park with clean restrooms, drinking water and hot water for dish washing. There are no showers on the campground, but at the lodge nearby.

name: Red Canyon Campground
description: Campground in the Red Canyon with Restrooms, showers. $18 p n. $2.50 shower (8 mins). Beautiful surroundings and location. Very quiet & close to g walks at the visitor center

name: Sandpit Campground, Sand Hollow State Park
description: Full hook-up for $35 a night or primitive lake front camping for $25. Not much coverage so it can get windy but beautiful views. Has showers and bathrooms too.

name: Jacob Lake Campground
description: National Forest Campground with pit toilets and drinking water. $18

name: DeMotte Campground
description: Official campground in the Kaibab National Forest. Only pit toilets drinking water available, no showers, $12.

name: Sun Resorts RV, Mesquite
description: American style RV park with clean bathrooms, fast WiFi, etc. but no shade. $22.30

name: Pahrump RV Park
description: Wifi was good, toilet clean, but the price is now 20$ without electricity and 25 with.

name: Arabian Oasis RV Park
description: Old Trailer and RV park at the Interstate to Bakersfield. Old bathrooms with hot showers, slow WiFi. $14

name: Buena Vista Aquatic Recreation Area
description: Not a nice place, it was loud, there was a lot of trash laying around, the bathrooms are old and it's way to expansive ($28).  $22 for dry camping

name: Kirk Creek Campground
description: Kirk Creek Campground in the Los Padres National Forest. Only pit toilets available, no water, access to the beach, great view, expensive ($35).

name: South Campground, Sunset State Beach
description: Paid $39.00 for a self contained SUV. Showers are on a meter .25c for 2 mins but are hot. Fire pits are available. The sunset was beautiful.

name: Skyline Boulevard
description: Small dirt pull off spot in front of an old gate hidden in the trees. This gate leads to someone’s property, so do not block it. Directly at the road, a lot of trash, noisy until 11pm on most days. FREE. It can get muddy when raining.

name: Chabot Campground, Anthony Chabot Regional Park
description: somewhat Quiet campground in a regional park near Oakland with a lot of shade. Showers available. $25 walk in. 27$ RV no hook up.

name: FR6S15, Sierra National Forest
description: Pullout at gravel road in the forest, no traffic, quiet, no facilities. FREE

name: FR14S29, Sequoia National Forest
description: Nice spot about 30m from the forest road FR14S29. Shade in the afternoon, small creek nearby, very quiet. FREE

name: Cerro Alto Campground, Los Padres National Forest
description: Campground in National Forest along a narrow, winding road parallel to a river in a canyon. That road is also the fire lane: campers must fit in assigned space. Some sites are reserved for tents and are first come, first serve (FCFS) but camping in vehicles is OK - tables and BBQ at a small distance. Pit toilets and drinking water available, no other facilities.

name: West Coast British (LR)
description:
Land Rover specialist near San Francisco. Mike runs this workshop since 1981 and knows everything about Land Rovers.

190 Airway Blvd.
Livermore, CA 94551

925-606-8301
wcbr@netzero.com

name: Acton Los Angeles North KOA Campground
description: Overpriced KOA campground in the Soledad Canyon with clean showers but small sites with no shade. WiFi only near the office. $30

name: Sycamore Flat Campground, Angles National Forest
description: Small campground. You need an "Adventure Pass" which is available at the gas station at Hwy 138. Without the pass you risk a fine of $5... 😅

name: Hidden Valley Campground, Joshua Tree NP
description: Very nice campground between huge rocks. No water available! We stayed at Site #3, were we could hang a hammock between two two Joshua trees. $15

name: RV Resort of America
description:
This is a huge RV park, and although it is advertised as "open to the public", this resort is filled with long term RV, 5th wheel and cabin residences. Not that that is a bad thing, it really does have abbot of community feel. 

The resort has a outdoor pool, washrooms with running water and showers, electricity and potable water at the sites, a coin laundry room, a common room (that has wifi, a pool table and change machine), as well as dog walk areas.

As of October 2017, the price was $40.00 per night, and laundry was $1.50 for each wash and dry load. Wifi is in the resort, but only located in or directly around the main front office. It is fast though when in the commons room. 

Overall, could be cleaner for the price.

name: San Luis Reservoir Medeiros Area
description: Nice primitive spots around lake. Very quiet at night. Easy place to break up long highway 5 drive across CA. $25 a night.

name: David Wilson's Toyota Las Vegas
description:
They have a mechanic called Mathew, who is from Nigeria and has a lot of experience with older Toyotas. 



 it is on the corner of East Sahara Avenue and South Mojave Road in Las Vegas

name: K Bar - Big Bend NP
description:
2 pitches including 1 for 2 vehicles. No services. $ 12 

2 emplacements dont 1 pour 2 ivéhicules. Pas de services. 12 $

name: Hyde Memorial State Park
description:
State Park in the Hills of Santa Fe
only 15 min from the Centre 
nice and quiet
10$ per night

name: Lake Livingstones State Park
description:
Very nice Texas State camp grounds, lots of trees, depending on your site you could be on the lake. All hookups, electric, water, (too late in the year for the pool) etc. 
$20.00 per night. The park personnel are very friendly and helpful. 

Definitely stay here over "Escapees RV park", the "lady's" there said my trailer didn't meet their standards! Lucky me I found this state park and saved money.

name: Walmart
description:
Walmart parking lot. Good place to stay before or after a border crossing. 

The WiFi actually works well here and there's a water dispensing machine inside the store. I parked around the side next to the grassy park and hardly saw anyone because I wasn't near the entrance.

name: Delores Canyon
description:
BLM campsite, pitches have fire rings, benches and shelters. Still $8 a night, half price with access pass. 
Clean pit toilets and near a river. 
About 7miles of lumpy but passable gravel road to get here, RV's shouldn't have any issues. Great site! Even has a horse area :)

name: Monument Valley Tipi Village
description: Campground run by local natives. You can spend your night in the Indian tipi or use your own tent. Full hookups for RVs available. After 8 months on the road and lots of campgrounds behind  this place had the nicest bathroom among all.

name: Langtry
description: Community Center Ground. Wifi au Visitor Center de l'autre cote de la rue.

name: Kingston Campground , free
description:
Small, free campsite (2-3 places), fire places.  
Seasonal closure 1st July to 3rd September Camping prohibited, due to flood risk!

name: Cottonwood Campground
description: $20$ campground in Canyon de Chelly National Monument.  A must-see place in the Four Corners area. some site shaded, some open. dump station and water refill for 5$ if you don’t use the camping

name: Anza-Borrego Desert State Park - Yaqui Wash Primitive Campground
description: Free dispersed camping all through out the park

name: Indian Springs Campgrounds
description: Nice place. $30 for a tent and drop toilet, though. Restrooms close at 8 PM and WiFi does not reach the tent sites.

name: Crystal Geyser
description: Free. Unestablished sites. We didnt see the geyser go off. Apparently its one or two times a day. A good overnight spot. 10 km off the highway on unmaintained road.

name: Savannah River Boat Ramp
description: Dead end road in middle of nowhere. Boat ramp without signs.

name: San Antonio Hidden Valley RV Park
description: Hidden Valley RV Park offers full hook up RV sites starting at $50/night.  Pull thrus and back ins available. 30 & 50 AMP. Note: depending on local health department recommendations, our bath houses may not be open for use.  No dry camping or boondocking spaces available at this time.

name: Mc Cannon
description: $15 off season. No hwy noise. Gravel lot with trees and picnic tables.  Good one nighter place. Behind the chevron station.

name: Holloman Lake Campground
description:
A little busy with lots of RVs but if you keep driving down the road you can get A little further away from the crowd. However, keep in mind this is essentially a beach so there is no privacy between sites.
Also a little noisy from the military base / airstrip. Multiple take offs/landing heard though they seemed to stop at night.

All in all, convenient location, free, but not really the feel of an isolated campsite if that is what you're looking for. Great sunset over the lake though!

name: The Box
description: BLM Campground. pit toilet. people come here to rock climb.

name: Big Pine Fishing Site
description: Very easy to get to. Im driving a 2wd Vanagon so you know it's easy! Only One other person here (9/15). Free site and super quiet. Has picnic table and fire pit. Stayed one night here while on the way to Yellowstone.

name: Grapevine Campground, free
description: Nice BLM campground with fire rings, some with metal grill. Private and secluded in winter but probably not in high season. Some dispersed and more secluded sites exist a few miles further up the road in turnouts but it was raining and cold so we opted for this one lower down the canyon.

name: Apache Creek Campground, free
description: Free National Forest campground. Large, spacious, shady sites, with picnic tables, fire rings, and grills. Clean vault toilets. Very quiet and peaceful.

name: Crystal Forest Campground
description:
Great access to Petrified Forest National Park. Lots of places to park. Some with picnic tables. Some with shade structures. There are power posts but no power. This is dry camping with level sites and some tables. Quiet at night.

Current Details: free, 15 sites, All Year, Self-Contained Units Only, All ages, Tents, 45 ft max RV length, Accepts Big Rigs, pull thrus, electric ($10), tables, pet friendly, store, Sep 2015: 4 nights free (C)

Correct data by putting Y or number behind it.

Total number of sites:
18 free RV sites on East side (museum lot). 10 30-Amp RV sites on West side (gift shop lot) but only 8 outlets are operational so the other 2 sites are free.

Open all year?
Yes

8 sites $10/night+tax for 30 amp hookup. 20 free sites.
RV sites: 28

name: Peaks Of Otter Campground
description: Typical NPS campground in the Blue Ridge Mountains just off the Blue Ridge Parkway. It offers shaded sites with level pads, picnic table and fire ring. Campground is open seasonally. The Peaks of Otter Lodge and restaurant is about 1/3 mile away.

name: Mt. Valley
description: Nice place to do laundry and take shower. Full hookups for $20/night and tent $18. Very quiet.

name: Arizona Snow Bowl
description: big hidden parking lot in the middle of a forest next to the Arizona Snow Bowl

name: Madera Canyon Loop Roadside Park
description:
Picnic Aera with table, barbecue, garbage under trees, next to the street, but quiet (free) 

Picknick Aera mit Tisch, Grill,  Abfallkübel unter Bäumen, neben der Straße, doch ruhig (free)

name: Tsali Campground -Nantahala National Forest
description:
beautiful large pitches, in each case with barbecue and fire ring. wintersaison from 01. November closed. 15$ 

about 300m further, there is a boatramp, where we have stayed.

-------------------------
schöne grosse Stellplätze, jeweils mit Grill und Feuerring. wintersaison ab 01. November geschlossen. 15$   

 ungefähr 300m weiter gibt es eine boatramp, wo wir übernachtet haben.

name: Rest Area
description: 0$ great truck stop to overnight. Clean bathrooms picnic tables.

name: NAPA auto care
description: My van needed a little fixing as I came into town and I was directed to this place. The owner Lance is super knowledgeable, helpful, friendly, and just an all round great guy. I would highly recommend visiting if you have anything that needs work. I would definitely come back here again. I wish these guys were my local mechanics.

name: Butch Cassidy Campground
description: 40 sites for RV's, smaller vehicles and tents. Clean bathrooms, hot showers and a shop. Friendly staff. Paid USD 10 for one vehicle 1 person

name: Walmart Neighbourhood Market
description: Walmart parking. Close to Gulf Freeway I-45

name: Wheatfields Lake
description: Great spot on the lake. lot of place to camp. Picnic tables and grill in the area.

name: Kartchner Caverns State Park
description:
Beautiful campground, very clean bathrooms and showers, water and electric. Nice trails and a walking distance from the caverns check in. Make sure you reserve early!

Dry camping for $15 in the parking lot if they don't have sites. $30 for electric campground sites.

name: Rocky Top
description: Motel & campground. Quiet place next to highway 24. Open year round. Clean hot showers and bathrooms free. I paid 22,- for one car/tent. Wifi at sites but weak signal.

name: Kaibab National Forest, free
description:
At the east entrance to the Grand Canyon NP, several parking spaces 

Am Osteingang zum Grand Canyon NP , mehrere Stellplätze

name: Smoky Mountain Road
description: Small campsite with fire ring and nice views.

name: on the Hole in the rock road
description: nice place with trees and fireplaces

name: Santa Fe National Forest
description:
Several places with fireplaces in the National Forest(off the highway 4) near the Bandelier National Monument and Los Alamos.
Dirt road is rutted but had no problems with my Honda Accord.

name: Saline Valley Hotsprings
description: Nice and warm place with 6 different sizes of tubs. Maintained by volunteers and donations.2 showers and 2 dry toilets host in place to take care of it. Road going in can have snow during certain times of year so planning is very important. Road is very rough but a sturdy 2wd vehicle with high clearance can make it.

name: Palmetto Island State Park
description:
Very well maintained campground with free laundry. It is located in a biotope with many birds, wild boars, giant animals etc. n the ponds in the square one can observe aligators. 

Sehr gut gepflegter Campground mit kostenloser Laundry. Er liegt in einem Biotop mit vielen Vögeln, Wildschweinen, Gürteltieren etc.. n den Teichen am Platz kann man Aligatoren beobachten.

name: Gordonia-Alatamaha State Park
description:
Very nice campground on a small lake. There are different sporting activities, there is even an 18 hole golf course. As a seniors we paid $ 45 for two people in a camper. The greenfee with car is not quite 25 $ on weekdays. 

Sehr schön an einem kleinen See gelegener Campground. Hier sind unterschiedliche sportliche Aktivitäten möglich, es gibt sogar einen 18 Loch Golf Course. Als Seniors haben wir 45 $ für zwei Personen in einem Camper bezahlt. DerGreenfee mit Car beträgt an Wochentagen nicht ganz 25 $.

name: Houma
description: Parking Civic Center. 20 $ la nuit. Eau & electricite.

name: Walmart
description: huge walmart right by the beach, other motor homes here too, quiet and perfect.

name: Super 8 Motel, Nephi
description: We got a huge room with two queen size beds. Everything was clean. Breakfast included and free WiFi.

name: Days Inn SeaWorld/Airport
description: Small but clean double room with free WiFi and breakfast for $57. About 800m to the train station.

name: Motel 6, San Ysidro
description: Nothing special but room was clean and cheap. Close to the border and there is a huge mall in walking distance. WiFi in the room costs $3 extra.

name: Kanab wild camping very nice!
description:
there were already so many options in Kanab,  but none as nice as this one!
just 10 min away from the BLM office for the wave lottery 
beautiful landscape,  trees and a smaller river
a lot of possible sites 
 2-3 bars ATT service

name: Edisto Beach State Park
description:
Good campground, but with over $ 50 very expensive 

Guter Campground, allerdings mit über 50 $ sehr teuer

name: Willow Springs Road BLM
description:
Beautiful little spot, off the main drag, somewhat private, nice 360 views, close to porto toilet, fire pit, fairly flat, had spotty service with Verizon. Loved our views!

$15 per vehicle

name: East Creek Campground
description: Simple utterly quiet campground with very few designated places on a creek. No hookups, one bio restroom, tables and fireplaces. Free in winter, self registration

name: lake dorr national forest
description: 34 places.all back-side in; direct at the lake; very quiet; nice and shady

name: East 96 Ranch Rd.
description:
This is not blm land, it is AZ state trust land which requires a state issued permit

A good dirt road several pull outs.

name: keys Deer Refug.
description:
Stepped out to stargaze for a couple minutes, and felt some nibbles. Heeded warnings, and didn’t even run the Maxxair, to make sure the van remained bug free. Was joined by another van around midnight. Woke up to perfect morning temperatures.

Please respect this spot

name: Checkpoint - Immigration/Drug Dogs US Border Patrol Checkpoint.
description: The US border patrol were located at 78/86 road intersection. Looking for drugs and illegal immigrants

name: Lands End - Grand Mesa
description:
Beautiful boondocking spot close to the Lands End Observatory. Good views from the vehicle accessible area, stunning views a short way beyond the rocks blocking the route. Secluded and not easily visible from the road. 

The short track from Land End Road (FS 100) is deceptively rocky but should be fine in any high clearance vehicle.

name: Posey Lake Campground
description: nice place, picnic tables, fire rings and grill, 5 $ off season, we stay in the picnic area to much snow in the campground entrance, drinking water only in summer

name: Sunglow Camground
description: nice Camground in Fishlake National Forest, open from April to October, 10 $ pro site

name: Mayflower County Park
description: Tent camping $30-35. Full hookup $45-50. Old campground with outdated bathrooms but still functioning with hot water showers with lots of pressure. Right on the river. Quiet and clean patrolled by local sheriff. Big eucalyptus trees for shade throughout park.

name: Behind the rock
description:
- just place to park overnight
- covered from highway by rock
- BLM land
- 2WD ok, not sure if for big rigs

name: Tres Piedras National Forest
description:
Some places with table and fire places in the light forest 

einige Plätze mit Tisch und Feuerstellen im lichten Wald

name: St. Vincent's Guest House, Hostel
description: Located fairly conveniently in three Garden District. Walking distance to restaurants and trolley line for going to the French Quarter. Big beautiful old building. Unfortunately quite dirty. Dorms & bathrooms where not cleaned while I was there and they looked like they hadn't been in a while. No lockers or storage shelves in the dorm rooms. Probably the cheapest place in town and ok if you're in a pinch or very cost concious. Has parking lot that should fit even big rigs. $ 5 extra for parking. Not secured or gated. I parked my motorcycle by the side entrance, near the "grotto" and had no problem. Had it covered. Place could be very nice but is poorly managed. Staff was friendly. Has WiFi but at extra charge, per day.

name: Anchor Bay Campground
description: Established campsite. $30 for camping. We got a overnight spot for $20. Close to shops. Hot water

name: Cedarville State Forest
description:
ohne Elektrik 23 bis 25$
mit Elektrik 29 bis 31$

----------

without Electrical 23 to 25$ 
with Electrical 29 to 31$

name: Greenbelt Park National Forest
description:
Camping fee is 20$
10$ America the  Beautiful Senior Pass /Golden Age passholder and aGolden Access/Golden Pass holder
Reservation required. Recreation.gov or 1-877-444-6777

name: Lava flow campground (Craters of the Moon Nat. Monument)
description: nice place, 51 campsites with picnic tables and grills, no open campfires allowed, water only in summer or in the visitorcenter, price $15 a night, no pets on trails only in campground and parking lots on the Loop road.

name: Salmon River Campground
description: nice place by the river, picnic tables, fire rings with grill, 5$ off season, drinking water in summer

name: walmart
description: great for a night and decent wifi near the store

name: Camp Spots Along the River
description: When you take the turn (North Creek Rd) to head to North Creek Campground, there are several pull-offs all along the river. Plenty of flat spots, free, quiet, no cell service. Some of the spots could accommodate big-rigs or multiple vans.

name: North Creek campground
description: Nice campground 10$ no hookups but bathrooms and water available. beautiful site

name: walmart/target
description: if you park in between the two, you can pick up open wifi from the Olive garden. Big complex quiet for the night.

name: walmart
description: quiet for a night, restrooms available and a nice spot to stop before venturing into Baltimore or South into DC

name: Honey Lake Rest Area
description:
Nice rest area, good alternative to Walmart parking. Fair amount of noise from hwy, but gets quiet at night.

Update: As of June, 2021, the lake is almost completely dry. Rest area is fine, just don't expect a lake.

name: Sands RV & Golf Resort
description: Paid $35/day for 8 days (discount for longer stay - $42 normal rate). Customer service was superb! Manny the night guard and front desk receptionists were kind, polite and welcoming. They offer for the price GREAT wifi, exercise room, pools, showers/bathrooms, saunas, limited cable, full hookups, tennis courts, sawing room, dog parks, 30&50 amps...the works. Our site was tight but enough room for a couple of chairs. We got the tail of some serious wind for two days but the rest of the time the wind was almost non existent.

name: Walmart
description: 24 hour Walmart. No problems staying here.

name: Auxiliary dam recreation area.
description:
- National forest camp on Isabella lake.
- 10$ per night.
- America the beautiful pass holders can camp for free.
- Lots of places on the shore.
- Only toilets.
-water

name: Rocky Springs Site
description: Campground on the natchez trace parkway. free. mile 56

name: Natchez Trace Parkway - Davis Lake
description: nice campground with site available lakeside. Picnic table and grill at sites along with water and electricity. Clean showers and restrooms. Laundry facilities available. Potable water and dump station. 200 acre lake is good for fishing stocked with largemouth bass and more.

name: Hebo Mtn Road
description: Side of the road. No cost. Starry view with snow

name: Site 70
description: Near Detroit lake off off blowout rd and spur 68.

name: Picacho Peak State Park
description: Pull through RV site not quite leveled but got electricity, bathrooms, dump station. $30/night drop in. Our site was elevated which kept highway traffic noise at bay. We chose not to pay additional for wifi but it is available.

name: Truckstop
description: Good truckstop with showers, grass and shade.

name: Grand Canyon Camper Village
description: Campground has lots of rv space with full hookups. Some rv and camp supplies in a little store in office. The Tent camping is up on a hill overlooking the rv area. Has bathrooms with hot showers that cost 4.00 for 8 minutes. At 29.00 for a tent space I think this place is over priced. Don't know what the cost is for rvs but obviously more than a tent with no electricity on campsite! However this was the only campground near the Grand Canyon that wasn't full.

name: Coinjock Marina
description:
The restaurant has a marina with good sanitary facilities. We ate there dinner and we were allowed to sleep in the parking lot and the sanitary facilities for the boatmen with to use. 

Zum Restaurant gehört eine Marina mit Guten sanitären Anlagen. Wir haben dort zu Abend gegessen und uns wurde erlaubt auf dem Parkplatz zu nächtigen und die sanitären Anlagen für die Bootsleute mit zu nutzen.

name: Martinak State Park
description:
In a high pine forest quiet campground. We paid for dry camping $ 25 a night 

In einem hohen Kiefernwald gelegener ruhiger Campground. Wir haben für Dry camping 25 $ pro Nacht gezahlt

name: Hollofield Campground
description:
The campground is located in Patapsco Valley State Park. It is a good starting point for the days before the shipment of Baltimore. Dry camping costs about $ 15. 

 Der Campground liegt im Patapsco Valley State Park. Er ist ein guter Ausgangspunkt für die Tage vor der Verschiffung von Baltimore. Dry Camping kostet etwa 15 $.

name: Red Rock Country Inn
description:
Nondescript Motel in Kanab. In low season we were able to get a double room for 55.00. Apparently in high season (starting in May) the room would cost 130.!!
There are many RV resorts and campgrounds in this town but since last night the temperature was in the low single digits (C) we decided on hot showers and a heated room.

name: Wild Horse Spot 1 of 6
description: Wild site off dirt road just west of goblin valley state park just a few minutes away. Free

name: cayuga lake state park
description: camping, cabins, electricity with or without electricity.

name: Kelly Camp Trail Dispersed Camping (FREE)
description: free camping, dispersed, quiet. with firepits and pull off right in the woods, peaceful. USFS maintained in Green Mtn NF

name: Camping!
description: free campground next to the creek, grassy areas for tents and pit toilets.

name: Terry Lee Enterprises
description:
Heavy truck garage, specializing in Unimog and Mercedes trucks. Rob is very helpful and familiar with the overlanding  community.
terryleeenterprises.com
708 E 1st St
LA Junta, Co 81050

719-384-0882

name: Chicago - Parking Mc Cormick Place
description:
Not pleasant and noisy. $ 35. Little or no choice on Chicago. Lot B. Entrance by 31th Street. 

Peu agreable et bruyant. 35 $. Peu ou pas d'autre choix sur Chicago. Lot B. Entree par 31th Street.

name: Seven-mile Overnight Parking
description:
This is now $30-$40 per night. Keep going up the road to Willow Springs.
-
Overnight parking on private land next to Hwy 191. 5$ per night. Probably the less expensive option for overnight close to Moab. All other campsites on BLM land cost 10-15$ per night.

name: Convict Flat Campground
description:
- Free.
- 5 lots but a lot of space.
- Clean pit toilets.
- Nice shady place.
- Firepits and tables.
- Bear free area ;-)

name: Camp 4
description:
ADMIN NOTE: TENT CAMPING ONLY

- Tent camping but if you pay for tent you can park next to the camp.
- We have been sleeping in the car.
- Suprisingly not fully occupied during our stay.
- 6$ per person per night.

name: Paramint Springs Resort
description: This is the only campground we found that had any trees for shade. The view is amazing, there are bathrooms and showers. There is a store and restaurant across the road.

name: Watts Bridge Access Campground, free
description: nice place by the river, some picnic tables and fire rings with grill, river boat entrance

name: Indian Trees Campground
description: nice place in the forest, open just in summer!, we stay the night in front of the closed gate

name: Big Larch Campground on Seeley Lake
description: Nice campground, a lot of campsites with picnic tables, fire rings, and grill. Free in the off season until May 28 but no drinking water. Boat ramp.  Good Verizon service.

name: Rocky Mountain Hi RV-Park
description: nice RV-PARK also with tent sites for small campers 25 $ with electric and water, 10% discount for AAA and ADAC members

name: Forrest park - free
description:
free camping. electricity/water/dump available. 4 night maximum. city park. on a slope
Spent 1 night here while travelling through the area. Saw reviews that said some electric posts didn't work, but the one I pulled up to did. Nice grassy park to walk the dog. Water hookup. Dump station. Quiet & very dark at night. All spots filled up. I'm always sure to buy gas, a meal at these friendly towns that provide free camping for travelers.

name: Circus Circus Manor RV Park
description: Good camping site just off the Las Vegas strip. All bitumen. 26 USD for a car without hookup. 44USD with.

name: Ferry Port Angeles - Victoria
description: $45,- for the car $18,- per person. If you haven't reserved they put you in a waiting row for the next boat.

name: Bighorn National Canyon
description: $5/nite or $30/yr, this is an absolutely spectacular park that receives very few visitors. It is by far my favourite of all the national parks.

name: Uwharrie National Forest
description: Badin Lake Campground, Uwharrie National Forest. $20 dollar for a single spot. No electricity you can fill your watertank. Campfire is possible. Great spot at the water. A lot of trails around here.

name: Pleasant Valley RV Park
description: A clean, well run RV Park.  Includes wifi, hot showers, coin laundry and a lot of little domestic bunnies hopping about! Can accommodate any size RV and also has grassy spots for tents. Short drive into Tillamook for groceries.

name: Wood Lake
description:
Nice spot, easily accessible. This may turn into a pay campsite in the spring of 2018 ($10).

Bathrooms were clean, and there was a big stack of pre cut fire wood as a bonus.

name: Capitol Reef NP East Entrance
description:
Wild camping up the hill near the park entrance on BLM land.
No cell coverage whatsoever.

name: Hell's Backbone Rd. National Forest
description: Wild camping. Several pull outs along the road. Great views.

name: Kaibab NF
description: nice large area with stone fire pit. No amenities. This spot is perfectly level.

name: next to the gas station, laundry, coin operated showers
description:
paid showers, laundry, between motel and gas station. nearby Navajo bridge.
Not very clean, few machines not working

name: black mountain camp
description: small dirt road going into some bushes. off main road. quiet, difficult to get with small low car, but there are some camping spots b4 , in the open. camping permitted in the national park.

name: Myrtle Beach State Park
description: 28,50 for a small bus, no hookups. Hookups are available, dont know the price.

name: Hole In The Rock Rd. First Mile
description: Nice place near Escalante. Plenty of space. Get overnight permit at the interagency visitor center.

name: Escalante rest area
description:
tables, bbqs, reasons, drinking water near a gas station and grocery store.
nice playground for kids

name: Los Padres National Forest - East Camino Cielo
description: A few turnouts up the hills in the national forest. Choose the first turnout that suits your needs. Beautiful view over Santa Barbara area if the weather is good. Can get misty the higher you go. Free.

name: Barcelona Harbor Pier
description: Parking Marina. Picnic tables, nice view, quiet and safe.  Spent one night here. One of the best spots we ever slept. Quiet. Benches, picnic tables, trash cans. Beautiful. no signs prohibiting overnight parking. Staff definitely noticed us because as soon as we got out at 7 a.m. to walk our dog she immediately came out and asked if we need a doggy bag. we have our own, and thanked her for the offer. we took our cue to move along and drove 1/4 mile down the road to Barcelona Harbor Beach to enjoy our coffee stress-free before heading back on the road.

name: Davis Pond Campsite
description: Car camping site. 4x4 recommended, but doable with a 2WD SUV/truck in dry conditions. Basic pit toilets on site. No running water. It is possible to filter and purify pond water, but not recommended.

name: Coopers camp
description: Open camping in Coconino National Forest. Exit on gated road 692 and select a spot. The road is passable unless really rainy. There is a beautiful, large campsite near the highway with an amazing for rock for cooking. But lots of open spaces, tall pines and flat spots.

name: Grant M bowling park
description: near fire valley in Nevada. nice area picnic takes, playground,bbq, toilets, water, plugs. good location grocery and other shopping within 5 miles

name: Welcome center Mississippi
description: dump station

name: Elephant Knees
description: no facilities. 4WD and / or high clearance recommend. Hiking trails close by. Guests during the day but quiet in the night, if no wind. FREE

name: Clear Creek Campground
description: Nice little campground with fire pits picnic tables, pit toilets, potable water and some large sites. Some trailers can fit in here. Campground host will arrive quickly to charge your site. Pretty sycamore grove, and a little creek running through. Walk to end of road then hike 1.5 flat trail to where the wash narrows and there's a nice pool, rocks, and at the far end a little sandy beach. Nice surprise after a long day on the road.

name: Coal Creek campground
description: This is a free established campground on the side of the road. Not many cars passing by during daay and night so a good option. There's maybe a dozen sites with firepits and some benches.

name: Campground
description: There's a small free forestry campsite heere with amazing view and a trail near by. Didn't stay here but found it while passing by. There's a few benches and firepits.

name: Lost Johnny Campground
description: nice campground on the Hungry Horse Lake, just 5 places with picnic tables and fire rings, off-season free, some other campgrounds along the Lake

name: Apgar Campground in Glacier NP
description:
$20. near lake and apgar village with food, boats etc. free shuttle to avalanche & back from visitor center at weekends & 1 July to Labor day

Bar, gift shops, coffee, restaurants within walking distance. made it very worth while. Kayak and sup board rentals in walking distance for lake as well. 

Open all year round

name: Free campsite on Hungry Horse Lake
description:
Free campsite provided by the National Forest Service with pit toilet. Campsite with a wonderful view over the lake and a gravel beach.
...........

name: St. Mary Campground in Glacier NP
description: nice campground, picnic tables and fire rings. Electricity at shower block. WiFi at nearby visitor centre.

name: Potrero County Park
description:
Very nice campground. just across the border from Tecate. Part of the San Diego county park system. Clean, decent facilities with lots of roomy sites, nature trail , etc hot showers. Book exchange  Clean quiet.  Hot showers available, charged per 2 minutes.

 USD 29 (through self registration).

name: walker pass campground
description: Donations based campground. Basic, some tables, some shade. Pit toilet. Only 4 pitches for caravans. Plenty of spaces for tents.

name: The view monument valley campground and rv
description: This is an established campground in the monument valley with a view directly looking at the valley. Stunning sunset and sunrise. $22 USD for tent. No campfires allowed but you can cook on stoves. There's a trail close by that you can take to the valley. RV Park is closed in winter.

name: Children's park
description: for those traveling with kids, this is a great place to stop and get out some energy on some great playground equipment and toys. close to the border, new park that was completely deserted :)

name: Sage Creek Campground (NPS)
description: free basic campsite inside Badlands NP with pit toilets and no water BUT many bison around and you will wake up to them grazing around you :)

name: Sheffield Creek, National Forest
description: $10/night. wonderful campground host. follow the FS road up to the spot where there are pit toilets, picnic tables, water and horse corrals. beautiful!

name: Hite camp ground
description: There's camping ground with some benches and restrooms by the lake. Marked location is the grocery store and gas station. There's a ranger statipn here but the park seems to be free. PS due to the draught in California there's no water at this part of the lake. I was told lake is full further south, may 2016

name: Bear lake state park
description: This is a nice clean camp ground by the lake. $17 to tent. Tent sites do not have electricity but there are covered places with benches and bbq pits and electrical outlets. Restrooms are clean. Rule says no gathering of firewood in the park but ranger told me that it is okay. Also this place is the cheapest for tents that I could find in the area.

name: The Balance Rock
description: Parking lot at the back of restaurant The Balance Rock. We asked the owner and she was very friendly. Food is OK but she was pleased we ate there.

name: Off State Highway 138
description: Various wild camping areas in Winema National Forest. Not sure if it is allowed but judging by the number of tracks and firepits it happens a lot. Totally remote and quiet.

name: Mc Kay Crossing Campground
description: Wonderful campground with scattered spots along a creek. It says somewhere "fee area" but all the signs and self registration gear is taken away for this intermediate season. Some big trailers will fit in when pulled by a 4x4 but big rigid RV's will not. Excellent for 4x4's with RTT's and tents. From here there is a nice easy 10 KM hike along the creek to Paulina Lake

name: Frog Lake Campground
description: I camped for free on the access road between the snopark and the campground because the road was blocked by a meter of snow. I walked further down the road to the "loop" but the campground is actually still further to the lake. It looked OK. Its near the highway but after seven at night there is hardly any traffic.

name: 300 Meters Off Oklahoma Road
description: One or two sites on a dead end track. No posts at all. Extremely quiet

name: Lake Leland Campground
description: Nice little campground between a meadow and a lake, under pine trees. Some 300 meters off the road. Tables and fireplaces. One pit toilet. Only $15,- a night, self registration.

name: St. Vrain State Campground
description: A newer campground with many sites, most of which have electricity. Some have water as well. It costs us $33 per night! Which included a state park fee. The only unfortunate aspect of this park is that it is right next to I-25 so there is considerable road noise from the traffic. There is also a couple of walking paths around the ponds where there's a lot of bird life to be seen.

name: Cherry Creek State Campground
description: A large state campground with about 150 +/- sites. The sites are well dispersed. And several have large shade trees although most are open. The basic site was $29 per night which included the Colorado State Park Day Use fee of $9.

name: Sinclair ProStop Gas Station
description: RV waste dump ($6), and regularity and premium gas. Diesel as well. Mini Mart with Food and supplies

name: Kanopolis State Park
description: Beautiful State Park set right on the shores of the Kanopolis Reservoir. A basic site was $16. A little of the beaten track but worth the drive. The first campsite in Kansas!

name: Hole-in-the-Rock
description:
Spot is located end of the Hole-in-the-Rock road at the trailhead. Stone firepits. More spots along the road.
The last ~15 Miles, 4WD and high clearance recommend.  Check weather and road condition before travel.
Hiking trails down to Lake Powell and to the Lake Powell overlook.
Overnight permit avaible here at trailhead. (BLM says "do not camp at trailheads" but 2 other campers overnight here too)

name: Graham Cave State Park
description: A nice older campground that is close to the interstate but the stands of mature hardwoods completely block out any noise. A hidden gem if you are passing through. A basic site is just $13.00. Did not have time to check out the hiking trails or the cave.

name: Pilot
description: Gas station with large truck stop area, good for overnight parking. Has water spigot to the left of propane tanks next to air station on car side of station

name: Carter Cave State Resort Park
