description: A large facility with a lodge, cabins and campsites and equestrian facilities. Tent sites (basic) are for tents only. Our site has electricity and water and was $25 a night. It is somewhat commercialized and the campsites are close to each other.

name: Lathrop State Park (Walsenburg)
description: Nice campground next to a 9 hole golf course. Dump and water available in park. Pay-showers, takes quarters. Free restrooms. All very clean. Campground hosts are on site and do a good job. Hiking, biking, and horse trails and two lakes, one allows swimming and has a nice visitors area. They are adding gazebos as of 8/2020. Piñon Campground open year round. Internet at visitor center

name: Comb Wash
description: Left and right after crossing the wash if going to Blanding, sandy road, sites with firerings. Didn't sleep there, but seems to be a nice, shady possibility.

name: Olema Campground
description: Very expensive campground...usd 49.- for a tent site, usd 63.- for a rv site and the unfriendlyest staff we ever ad after 20 month on the road!!! Internet was never working, but they said it's our fault, it's working for them...other campers, same problem...asked for a discount...not cooperative at all...not recommended!!!!!

name: Alexander springs
description: Natural springs swimming and canoeing. Nice.

name: Desert View Campground
description: Established CG in GCNP.  Very nice.  Clean restrooms, water available at campground.  Store, etc nearby.  Reservations required.  Fills up early. Closed in winter.

name: Marrero Travel Park
description: Pretty crazy campsite. People live here in their RV's. People are friendly and it's save (you won't always think it but you are). Their is laundry and restrooms with shower. Don't expect much...but the price is fair 18 dollar a night.

name: Off FR 525
description: Beautiful surroundings. Access by 4X4 only. One of many options in the area. Free

name: Ashley National Forest
description: Informal sites on a forest service road that leads to a trailhead. Several good, large sites with a good view. We had no problem getting our 28' Class A in here. Strong AT&T signal. You can hear the highway nearby

name: Marin Headlands Campgrounds
description: Nice, clean and quiet spot for tents. $5-30 depending on site. reservation required

name: Sherbrooke WMA.  LA
description: Free primitive campground WMA. Free permit. 3g service from Verizon and Google FI. Picnic tables and fire pits. Nice open raised field.

name: Oaklawn
description: Primitive campground  WMA. No generators, please. water at the first picnic table. if you want it more quiet, go left before the dam and camp somewhere in the grass

name: Florida Welcome Center
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed.

  Very nice parking lot. Clean toilets, picnic area, nighttime security, free orange juice during opening hours of the visitors center.

name: Texas Travel Information Center Laredo
description: Free overnight parking in the parking lot of the travel information center. Beautiful spot with palm trees, pond and fountain at the Interstate 35, exit 18.

name: Near Bryce Canyon
description: Forest service land. No services. One bar on ATT. Nice views! Fire ring. 4x4 recommended but doable without. Come in from the East fork road. Let the dogs run loose! ATVers drive by now and then.

name: Kings Creek Campground
description: $15. Sewer Dump. 38 sites. Pretty campground in the pine trees. Tropic Resevoir very nearby. Good for fishing, kayaking, paddle boarding, etc. Boat launch too.

name: Devil's Playground
description: Drive through the gate with the sign "devil's playground" and follow the dirt road. At the begining of the road on weekends lots of RVs with quads, so follow the road up to the hills, find your place behind the rocks and enjoy the view! This area is open to the public and for free, we asked the other campers.

name: Lake Washoe State Park
description: Year round camping in a desert setting with mountain views. Well kept sites and facilities. Sites have table, sun shelter, fire pit. Good cell coverage.

name: Stanilaus Boondock
description: Beautiful site, huge trees, fire pit. just off rt120 on the way to Yosemite. 100% free. Get a free fire permit online from The national forest before you start bonfires. Road in is a short but fun, could be interesting when muddy but I got the motorhome back here easy enough

name: Rest Area I-10
description: This is a basic highway rest area. Not much shade for parking but tables in the shade. Restrooms with running water. Pet area. Sign prohibits camping but not overnight parking. So park, sleep but don't throw out a tent or awning and you will be fine.

name: Cycle-Moore
description: basic campsites with on site motorcycle service and parts.

name: Hunnewell Lake conservation area
description: This is an established free campground at a lake and fish hatchery. There are fire pits, picnic tables and vault toilets. Nice grassy campsites. Good verizon service.

name: Target Tree campground
description:
Nice wooded sites with fire pits, picnic tables and vault toilets. There was no water when I was there but the pipes are run. cost is  $18/night 

closes during winter.

name: Terry's spot
description: Woodsy with a small meadow with mixed trees.

name: Holiday Group Camp
description: USFS group camp just up the road from Wheeler gorge. Fairly expensive at $150 with advance reservations required. Lots of poison oak, so keep dogs on leash. No cell service at site. Large grill could could a pig. Check in with camp host at Wheeler Gorge and get campfire permit at Wheeler Gorge visitor center. About 8 spots with tables and fire rings.

name: ACT Campground Moab
description: Litte Campground close to the Highway. Some traffic noise. Really clean restroms and showers! Laundry at 2.50$, dryer $2 for 40 minutes. Price without hook-up 27$ for a van. With full hook-up 45$.

name: Haviland Lake Campground
description: Lakeside camping with hiking, fishing and kayaking right from the campground. Rates start at $20 and go up to $35

name: Kendall - San Juan National Forest.
description: Rustic free campground. River side campsites

name: Cinder Hills OHV Area
description: Many nice sites to choose from in an OHV Area about 10 miles from downtown Flagstaff. Plenty of firewood. Can get busy especially on long weekends but you'll still find a nice spot. Free.

name: Steelbridge Campground
description: BLM campground in a forest next to a river, 11 sites with tables, bearlockers and firerings, 5$ per night, very quiet. Not all sites may fit for really big RVs.

name: Matole Campground
description: Right on the ocean behind dunes, 8$ per night, firerings, tables. At the end of the Lighthouse Road.

name: Brush Memorial Park
description: This is a city campground. It's $25/night. It's nothing fancy but is connected to a very nice city park, playground. Pool is out of commission.

name: Dyea Flats Campground
description:
Municipal Recreation Area and campground, very nice campground, amazing this beautiful spot is only $10! Lots of sites with picnic tables and fire rings.
No longer free

name: Dyea Campground
description: nice campground, may - sept. $10 US or CAN  , the other time free, about 20 sites, picnic tables and fire rings

name: Florence Keller Recreation Park
description: Campground in a young redwood forest, sites with tables and firerings under the big trees. 20$ per night, watertaps near sites. Very quiet and not crowded. Like out of a fairytale!

name: Snake River Boat Luanch
description: This is a large paved parking lot at the end of a 2 mile dirt road. It's a NFS run boat launch but camping is allowed up to 16 days. There is grass area for tents, fire rings, pit toilet and pull thru parking spots. We're here the day after a holiday weekend and we are alone. Nice water views and very quiet. Free.

name: Camp Fishlake National Forest
description: Nice wild camping in National Forest. only 10 Miles from the Interstate I-5. No services, only a fireplace and free.

name: Mills RIM campground
description:
in the "kiowa ntl. grasslands" are  2 free  campgrounds. pit toiletts and firepits. quiet. 
big rigs and trailers at the rim only(dont try valley).

name: Joshua Tree Lake Campground
description:
Private tent and RV camping. Small store, lake and fishing, showers $5 for non-campers. with lot of tentspots.
15 USD pp

name: Rest Stop
description: Quiet rest stop with bathrooms. In thousand springs park. Sign says no camping, but sleeping in a truck or van is likely ok.

name: Black Rock Canyon
description:
NPS campground with lots of Joshua trees. Flush toilets, potable water. Picnic tables and fire pits. Many sites are not level. 

As of 10/2021, sites cost $25/night.

name: Hat Creek Campground
description: Staying at Manzanita Lake Campground in Lassen, but came out here for a lunch by the creek. Lots of picnic tables, clean restrooms, and quiet spots along the creek.

name: Abandoned road
description: Just off the the golden road there is a paved road that's been abandoned for a long time. offers flat elevated tent pitches and firewood already left in a pile. very well hidden and quiet at night. ideal for motorcycle and cycle tourers.

name: Ayer Junction
description: Free and fairly wild COE Campground on the Snake. A few fire pits and a boat launch. We made our own camp area because the established sites were all full. Good for van camping or tent camping. Also a boat launch. Great bass fishing from boat or shore. Not as popular as other nearby destinations, but also quite out of the way. To get to one of the established sites you have to drive up a hill to the train tracks, along the tracks and back down to the river.

name: Dead End Road
description: Dead end forestroad on the way south to mount st. helen. Hidden behind the trees, there is a small flat pull out fitting for landrovers or toyota landcruisers. 4WD recommanded for this forest road. After some meters behind the pull out there is a red sign "dead end road" and a little bit further up the road trees are blocking the way, so also could park on the road in front of the fallen trees. Not recommanded for mobile homes or RVs!

name: Dilley / Texas
description: Hank motorcycle BMW is a motorcycle mechanic here and can host bikers travelers in his garden. very kind.

name: Rest Area (Eastbound mile 54)
description: Rest area at or near mile 51. Very nice little shelters with picknic tables and lighting at night. They are each separated from each other by about 100 yards. NM allows free camping at rest areas from on night at a time.

name: Kerrville Schreiner State Park
description: Very nice campground along the banks of the Guadalupe River. RV, tent and day use. Tent sites were $15, RV were $25-30. Reservations and walk ups. Nice swimming, fishing, boating and diving on the river. Boat rentals and great play areas for kids. Large butterfly garden. Free HOT showers (standard and handicap) & bathrooms in the RV section. A few trails. Part close to river is nice but there is road noise. Back section quieter also with a 3.5mi trail.

name: Ponderosa Grove Campground
description:
Beautiful small campground near Coral Pink Sand Dunes SP. With benches, pits, toilets (no drinking water), this is great place if you are on your way to Zion and dont have a camp reservation there. We set our camp here for two days and made day hiking trips to Zion. It takes approximately 50 minutes to get to Zion visitors center.
Theres plenty of shade and its one of the nicest campgrounds Ive been to.
Night rate: 5 USD
No
t suitable for vehicles longer than 24ft

name: Spirit Mountain Road
description: There is a big grassy area just above US Route 14 from Cody to Yellowstone. Turn to Spirit Mount. Rd. Reachable by normal car or truck (probably not suitable for RVs though). There are no amenities, but considering how close to the route, it's very quiet for a sleep. Further up to Yellowstone only camping in hard side units is allowed due to grizzlies so we felt relatively safe and close to civlization in a tent here.

name: Neat Retreat
description: only one tent site, but its a beauty. Operation Manager Jason is super nice and friendly.

name: Walmart Parking
description: 24 hour walmart, free camping (ask service desk), gree wifi, restrooms, subway.

name: zapata falls BLM Park
description:
nearby great sand dunes np. from hwy 150 about 3 mi. there are signs.
the Fee is 11 $. Great view to san luis valley and overlook to great sand dunes and sangre de cristo mtns. waterfall nearby.

name: Dockweller beach RV park
description:
classic RV park near the beach
fool hook up.
price 55 to 65usd 
just behind the planes...lot of noise

10usd reservation fee. reservations can only be made online

name: Diamond Rd. Dispersed camping area
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Only self contained campers. Portable Toilet required

There are many many places for dispersed camping along Diamond Road based on recommendation of Canyonlands ranger. 
There are no amenities here but its good for when the official campsites are full. Only takes about 10 minutes to drive to Island in the Sky Visitor center.
Its sandy so probably not very good for RVs

name: Weston Hills Recreation Area
description: 3 spots with stone fire rings in a ORV area.

name: "upper" Five Springs Falls Campground
description:
2 BLM campgrounds (lower and upper).
GPS location is the upper campground.
Most spots are tent sites but 3 "RV" sites at upper and 1 at the lower campground.
firerings, pit toilets, tabels, water at lower campground, hiking trail.
7$ per night.

name: BLM Hogan and Luce Campground
description:
6 sites close to a lake.
pit tiolet, fire rings, tables, food storage boxes.
no trash container, so carry in and carry out. But some local day guest only carry in :-(.
FREE

name: Wupatki and Sunset Crater Loop Road
description: On FR 244 just off the CR 395 (Wupatki and Sunset Crater Loop Road). Nice and quiet. Free, but you have to cross one of the NM and pay entrance fee there.

name: Stanton Creek Dispersed Camping Area Bullfrog Lake Powell
description: It's not a boondocking site actually but a huge dispersed camping area directly on the shoreline of Lake Powell with dozens of more or less secluded bays where you can find your private spot out of sight of anybody (except the boaters). Restrooms far away from the marked place.fee is 12 per vehicle and 25 Park fee.

name: Speedlab Automotive
description: They do customs build, welding and help you arround finding parts

name: wild camp in forest
description: wild wide campsite. near the road and a river.

name: Southern Section Of Rio Grande National Forest
description: Free dispersed campsites of county road 37. Signs said there is a lake and some other campgrounds 7mi from Hwy 84 but we did not go that far. Found some beautiful boondocking sites off the road about a mile up a windy dirt road. Road was in great condition. Some sites have scenic overviews. We found a beautiful site off to the right in a wild iris meadow. 10 min off the road. Very quiet. Also, because of altitude we are able to get 4G coverage from AT&T.

name: Wild camping free
description:
There are a lot of place to camp in middle of trees on Cocomino National Forest. No amenities but fire place area and lots of wood to put fire. 5 km from Flagstaf near Walnut canyon. Great 4G reception, 4 bars Verizon and 5 bars AT&T. I believe most 2WD vehicles with good clearance would be able to access.

PLEASE TAKE YOUR TRASH WITH YOU

name: Wild camping free
description: In the National Forests of USA there are areas to wild camping for free. No amenities but fire place is ok.

name: Laundry in Page
description:
If you need, there are 2 laundry here. U$2 to a smal wash machine.

Update: 
4usd small load
9usd big load
1 usd/28 min drying


Open until 8pm

name: Brunig Lake Park
description:
Campsite close to the San Antonio city. Nice place around a lake. You can just camp and pay USD 7 per person plus USD 8 overnight. If you need electricity and/or water you must park at the RV parking and pay USD 16 more.
No shower and a dusty restroon.

name: Outside Arches
description: Inside Arches you pay 25 dollar, around arches you pay 15 dollar. On this spot you pay nothing and also got the amazing view. Follow the road and go on the dirtroad (at the beginning you see a sign of a trail). When you are up on the platform you have a great view and nobody can't see you.

name: Big Lagoon Campground
description:
Campground for tents and small RV's in an amazing forest right next to lagoon and beach. They have hot showers, toilets, firepits, no hookups. 
Update: two sites are hookup for extra $10

name: Sooner Rocks GSENM
description:
There are a half dozen sites around Sooner Rocks, and the best two are the one we stayed in (located north of the wash on the right as you are heading south, with some shade and wind protection from some big sandstone rocks) and right at the wash in some tamaracks. This area can be very windy so some wind breaks are valuable. Climbing back onto the Sooner Rocks offers great views of the Straight Cliffs, as well as the slickrock around the Escalante River. No Verizon service.

The site we stayed in had a bit of a dip preventing a Honda CR-V from driving all the way, but anything higher off the ground would be ok. The Hole-in-the-Rock Road at this point requires medium clearance and good tires, but is passable for small SUVs/crossovers. Overall this area is pretty hot by May but there is all-day shade at this site. Great place to stay if doing a loop hike of Fortymile/Willow Gulch.

name: Above River
description: At the end of a dirt road near a bridge over Johnson River, a pull out fitting for two cars or one bigger, not for really big RVs. Great view down to the river and to the bridge, but no way down to the water. Good for one night. Track in was a bit narrow for our truck camper but we made it with a couple of scratches

name: Arctic Circle BLM Camping
description: BLM campground for free directly on the arctic circle at Dalton HW. Tables, firerings, places are big. Good place to sleep on the way to Prudhoe.

name: Antelope Island State Park
description: Beautifull park!!! Complete different then the rest. 250+ kind of birds, big lake, bisons, antelope, etc. 15 dollar a night. Showers at the day area. Hot shower is 1 dollar, cold shower outside free.

name: Riverside Campsite Near Tropic Reservoir
description: Grassy campsite on the side of the Sevier River just before the river restriction area (sign posted 1/4 mile further)  To find this site take East Fork Road. Just before the cattle guard turn right on dirt track. Pass through an unlocked gate. Site is on left at river bank. Fire ring. Trees. Near Bryce Canyon. Not too far from services. Trout fishing in river and nearby Tropic Reservoir.

name: Mardi Gras RV Park
description: ~20 $/d. Restroom could be cleaner. Breakfast included. Bus stop to downtown. Friendly welcome.

name: Jack Wade Creek
description: good place at the small river, 100 m from the street

name: Dude Ranch
description:
Chamberlain, South Dakota, off i90, exit 260, 4 miles. Follow brown signs for Dude Ranch, not for Cedar Shores.
Next to lake with boat ramp, drop toilet, picnic spots and fire pits. With nice views & dog walks. 11.67$ per night.

name: Camping group between nv and ca
description:
close to primm valley and has tables.

no water but perfect for camping

name: Blackwood Campground
description: 15 usd per night with 6 sites for tents with picnic table, bear lock and fire ring,  car can be parked next to the site, we slept in the car though, toilet available, water can be filled up at the Kaspian Campground which is at the beginning of the road to Blackwood Campground

name: Red Cliff Campground
description: Beautiful campground right on the Gallatin River in the Gallatin NF. About 60 or so sites. It was $15. Without electric and $20 with when we stayed here. Sites are spacious and the river sites have direct access to the river. Good fishing here. There is a nice trailhead at the south end of the campsite. The photo with the cliff was just up the river.

name: At the Richardson Highway
description: nice place just 500 m from the street, no view to the street, quiet at night

name: Canyon View campground
description: Campground in the Navajo National Monument. Pit toylet, pic nic table and place to put fire. A bealtiful view to the canyon. Big Rig OK! FREE

name: Sunset View campground.
description: This free RV and tent campground with paved roads is close to the visitor center, has 31 small sites with picnic tables, charcoal grills, and parking spaces. There are restrooms and running water available at the comfort station but no hookups or dump stations; RV's are limited to 28 feet or less. The campgrounds are available on a first-come-first-served basis. In the winter, campers should be prepared for cold temperatures and snow. The terrain is sandstone and surrounded by a pinyon pine and juniper forest. Open campfires are not allowed through out the whole park.

name: FREE camping
description: FREE camping on Bridge National Monument. No amenities, place to fire and woods available. Very nice! Bring your leveling.

name: Lake campground
description: US$ 5. If you have a Anual Pass the price are 2,5. Fresh in midle of alot of big trees and near lake. Good to swim and fishing. Bathroon pit toilets, pic nic table and place to fire.

name: La Sal Forest
description: Camping free Lá Sal Forest. It's fresh, good to relax and sleep. Moab is very hot in summer. In midle of trees, lots of shadow. No amenities but place to fire. Near cold river and near a great lake with pic nic area. Very good here.

name: Ainsworth State Park
description: it is very good place. $26 for full hookups

name: GSENM 500
description: a campsite near kodachrome state park, at the gsenm road nr.500 about 1mi from paved road to kodachrome (at Skutumpah road). drive  uphill and when you arrive the hill go right. Big  View!! normaly permit requiered (free). 3 bars of Verizon LTE, 2 bars of AT&T LTE

name: Dixie NF off UT 12
description: Nice place on a glade in the forest at a small brook. Fire pit. Free

name: MacKerricher state park Campground
description: Large campground with lots of trees very close to the beach. Lots of water spigots. Showers (Hot). Whale watching, great park to walk around or exercise in.

name: King Solomon Falls
description: This location can also be accessed from Wyoming. Near Savery pick up County Road 129 headed South. It will pass ranches and homes and then into forest area. The left turn for the falls camping area is a left. The hike to the falls takes about an hour and requires good shoes, using the ropes provided, climbing on rocks and crossing waist deep water. Plan accordingly.

name: Morefield CG
description: Large campground inside Mesa Verde Nationsl Park.  Almost never fills.  $32/night. $20,- if it's not in the season.  Cell phones don't work, but there is free WiFi.  Free showers.  8000 ft altitude is nice in the summer.  On site store and gas station.

name: Bowl Canyon Lake
description:
We have been traveling around the Four Corners area for 20 years and didn't know this place existed.  A very nice, quiet campground on a lake.  The sign said $15/night, but the booth was not manned so there was noone to pay.  7800 ft elevation means it is cool in the summer.  Two entrances, the north for a picnic area and south for camping.  No services.  
Unfortunately, some local hoodlums arrived at 1am and howled at the moon all night.  They made us very uncomfortable so we left at dawn.

name: Turn Out
description: Turn out on a country street. Near Dillon Beach. Road is very quite during night. No sign that parking overnight is prohibited.

name: campgroup 0
description: is good to stay. $24 for 2 people.

name: Bolar Mountain Recreation Area
description: This is a beautiful National Forrest Campground on the shores of Lake Moomaw. The sites are level and quite large. Most of the sites have a view of the lake if not right on it. Sites start at $18.

name: Beaver-Pond at Steese Highway
description: 50 m from the road, nice spot with excellent beaver viewing in the evening and during the night, a little bit view in the mountains and over the small pond, but some trash (broken glass and paper) around the fireplace, why?!?

name: Near Twelvemiles Summit Wayside
description: very nice place with a great view around, you can go a long hiking trail "Pinnel Mountain Trail" from Twelvemile Summit Wayside 44 km to Eagle Summit Wayside, we went just to the Table Mountain about 5 km, nice

name: Birch Creek Bridge
description: A big parking lot,  just a gravel spot, but nice and quiet, boat launch, a lot of mosquitos

name: Circle at Yukon River
description: simple campsite with picnic tables at boat launch, a small grocery store and gas station / drinking water, coin showers and laundry at "Washteria" two blocks away

name: Eagle Summit Wayside
description: very nice place with great view, here start/end the "Pinnel Mountain Trail" to the Twelvemile Summit Wayside 44 km, you can see the midnight sun from June 17th until about June 24th

name: Moorings at Carrabelle
description: Great accommodations at the marina. inexpensive and accepts pets.

name: Coconino National Forest Boondock
description: Large area for tent and RV camping.  The site is free but expect others to be camping.  Cell phone and data access is good.

name: Jacks Canyon Climbing Area Campground
description: Free camping

name: The Priest Draw Bouldering Campsite
description: Forest road access and may be impassable when wet. High clearance is preferred, not required. Nice wooded area with no services. Free.

name: Koosharem Reservoir
description: Free camping on scenic lake. Level sites, plenty of room.

name: Hole On The Rock Road Mile 51-ish
description: Very remote and requires high clearance vehicle. 4wd a plus but not necessary in good dry weather. Free.

name: Camp Run A Muck Campground Hyder AK
description: Typical campground for RVs and tent camping. You're able to walk to town in 10 mins. $15/night for dry camping or $30/night for hookups.

name: Camping at Library of Gllennalen / Alaska
description: out of the village, going Anchorage, on the right, the library. can stop behind. free WiFi.

name: Delta Junction water
description: Dumping station and good drinking water behind the car and RV wash

name: kitsap Memorial State Park
description: its a good place for stay. $40 for 2 people .

name: Creek Side - Targhee Natl Forest
description: This is a single camp space for a small rig. Located a little ways down a closed road, near the closure gate. Site has stone fire ring and a creek. A few mosquito and flies- but better than other sites in this area. Located down North 1400 East road towards Cave Falls. Nearest services in Ashton, Idaho.

name: South Of Tropic Reservoir
description: Camping south of the Tropic Reservoir within half a mile of the Sevier River is allowed in designated dispersed camping areas along the river only. The marked one is # 2 out of 10 in total. Not bad. Free.

name: Green Canyon Hot Springs
description: Improved camping for tents or RVs. Hook up sites and non-electric. Water available. Flush toilets and pit toilets. Showers with hot water. Full grass area for either. Fee was $17.25 for one night tent site (with VW van).   Also has two large pools-improved. An additional $11.50 for 2 to use the pools. Chlorine plus minerals in both pools.

name: At George Parks Highway
description: small gravel road at the Highway with pull out, good for a night, nothing special

name: Island Park State Land
description: Nice and quiet place in the wood, close to HWY 20. 10 day camping limit.

name: Free Gallatin National Forest Campground
description: 13 sites with firepits and tables. There's even 2 outhouses. Quiet place and you can stay free here for 16 days out of the year.

name: At Denali Highway - Great !
description: very nice place with spectacular view, just 300 m from Highway, a small Lake between Highway and this campsite

name: Tonsina River Crossing
description: nice small place by the Tonsina River, just 500 m from Highway

name: Three Glacier View at Richardson Highway
description: nice big gravel place, just 300 m from highway and 3 km from Worthington Glacier View point, enough place for many campers, from here you can see 3 Glacier tongues

name: Cottonwood Canyon Rd North End
description: Nice panorama, shade, fireplace. Good privacy with space between sites. High clearance recommended. Free.

name: Vermillion Cliffs NM
description: Nice place close to Coyote Buttes South in the Vermillion Cliffs NM. At the beginning of the road leading to this spot there's a sign '4 WD mandatory' but it's easy to get there with a high clearance 2WD car. Free.

name: forest route 160 warren pa  free
description: Beautiful place, many pull outs for camping but some have rocks so that you cannot pull too deep into Forrest. Almost all have fire pits, all beautiful. Many sites along 160, all primitive. Three pit toilets are available a mile away at the Jake Rocks trailhead. https://www.fs.usda.gov/recarea/allegheny/recarea/?recid=6092 Dew Drop campground https://www.recreation.gov/camping/campgrounds/232036  is two miles away with water and showers.

name: Lakesite Camp on the way to McCarthy
description: Nice small place direct by the lake. The road is a bit close but not busy.

name: Riversite near Valdez
description: In a huge Riverbed. Lot of place and a lot of firewood. Watch for the water level. 4x4 recommended due to high water levels.

name: Wildcamp on Alaska Highway
description: Good Overnight place on a big gravel field. Hidden from the highway. Good for one night.

name: Wickersham Trailhead parking Alaska
description: Nice gravel parking with a pit toilet near by the Elliott Hwy. We don't know if it's alowed to stay overnight, but it doesn't have a signe "no overnight". so we stay the night here.

name: Sunny Side up
description: On a sunny place in the forrest. Close to a little creek. Natural Firering, enough firewood and just great for free campers!

name: Grand Teton Lookout
description: Dry, free camping for up to 5 days. As you come up on the gravel road there is almost every turnoff signposted. Look for the sign 30312 and follow the power lines on that one. In 200 meters there is another turnoff to the left. Road leads you up on the small hill. This spot has great view to the mountains and you don't need 4WD to get up here. Collect some firewood before you arrive to this site. There are fire pits but the forest is a bit far to haul it up to the camping spots. There are a lot of other campers on the side of the road driving up here.

name: walter f pratt forest,old keenan rd, brasher falls,ny (free)
description:
3days free camping can be extended to 14 days (FREE).
NICE shaded camping in woods overlooking lake,each pitch(20)has own pit toilet,picnic table & fire pit.
lots of bugs in june / july....

name: Duck Lake Meadow
description: Nice spot in Lassen Nat forest, big fire pit lots of wood! Gorgeous

name: Hope Highway - Top
description: Great spot by the Sixmile Creek. A narrow bumpy Road goes down to the Creek.

name: Plasket Ridge Rd over the fog
description:
From Hwy One take Plasket Ridge Rd uphill. 
The rough dirt road requires a good driver or 4wd. 
Up on the ridge you will find a handful of campsites that overlook the ocean. Great view and sun even when the entire coast is fogged in.
5 miles from Hwy One, all the way on top of the ridge there is a locked gate. 
Only stove grills with a permit. No campfires, no wood collecting.

name: River Moss Forest Campground
description: National forest campground. $16 for pitch with fire ring and wooden table and benches. Our pitch was directly over a beautiful river, surrounded by miss covered trees. Half the pitches can be booked online and half are first-come first-served. Look on the posts of each pitch to see which ones are reserved. Apparently it gets busy on the weekends. Payment is via honesty box. A woman came by selling firewood bundles for $6. Lovely campspot if getting late and need somewhere to sleep. Very quiet (except for the sound of the river).

name: Stanislaus National Forest service road
description: Not sure exactly what this road is for, but no posted signage to keep out or prohibiting camping. Came in the dark, threw the tent out for one night here and left around 10am, quiet and no one else seen. Dirt road on the north side of Highway 4, opposite Meko Dr. Head up into the trees, left at the fork for a series of large grassy pullouts surrounded by trees. You'll be following power lines, but can find spots away from them. Closest place to get food and drinks is the Lube Room Saloon in downtown Dorrington a few minutes south. Food till 9 pm. Lively and friendly locals spot, especially if you're there on the annual gathering of the ECV drinking club. Enjoy!

name: Moose Pass - Ok
description: Big gravelplace on the Lake with nice place to stay. Maybe busy on weekend and the Highway is not so far. Also Airplane land here for a picnic. FREE.

name: Elizabeth Furnace red area
description: flat sites. showers. water and dump. no electricity at sites. river for swimming and fishing. Off season rates still $10 in April 2022. Bathrooms are closed in off season. Please PUT YOUR HUMAN WASTE IN THE TRASH CANS PROVIDED TO AVOID CREEK POLLUTION using whatever system you devise or bury it at least 6 inches deep at least 100 feet from the creek.

name: Buffalo Lake at Glenn Highway
description: nice place at the small fishing pond Buffalo Lake, just 100 m from Highway, use the public access from the road, it is a small spot for 1-2 campers

name: Peterson Lake
description: very nice  small campground, small boat launch, picnic tables and fire rings, water at pump, free

name: Crow Creek Road
description: Several nice sized turnouts along this road, some with nice fire pits, in the Chugach National Forest outside little town of Girdwood. Convenient to over night or do a couple of nights and hike the Crow Pass trail, Iditarod trail or go to Crow Creek Mine. If you're pulling a trailer you might need to camp at Crow Creek Mine though for $10 a night, the sites were pretty nice. Verizon 4G signal is great.

name: Kings River
description: Nice free boondocking area. Quite a few spots to camp on both sides of the road and both sides of the river right off the Old Glenn Highway. 20 minutes from Palmer and not far from Matanuska Glacier. Oddly there is really great Verizon LTE in this spot. There is a gas station about 6 miles away that has laundry and showers.

name: Tesoro Gas- and Dumpstation
description: right at the Gasstation, Sani dump 5 $, potable water free, wifi

name: Galbraith Lake
description:
Free campsites with pit toilet and small trash receptacles. Near a river and Galbraith Lake. No other facilities. Only official state campground on the North Slope at the base of Atigun pass. Scattered primitive sites with a pit toilet and a couple sites have picnic tables. The campground is not on the lake.
Good cell reception with T-mobile.

name: Hope Highway 2 - Great View
description:
Great place with very nice View. you can finde a few nice place on gras also including firerings.
A short walk get you down to the nice river.

We finde this after a long great walk in Hope.

name: Annie Creek Sno-Park
description: Just a pull off on to annie, just after a cabin set up. Big parking lot with toilets, a snow shelter, fire rings and even firewood. People fully set up with solar panels and even tents. Free! Good stopover before crater lake. Free electricity in the snow shelter. No trash bins. Pack in/pack out.

name: Caribou Campground
description: Only 3 sites with a pit toilet and no fee for camping. There is small creek running between the two western sites. the third site is away from the parking area backed into the treelike. Bear lockers are at each site. Very quite and remote. On my hike to Caribou Mountain I did see Wolf scat and Grizzly marks on some trees but no actual sightings.

name: Hensley Hill
description: Just below the top on a mountain where a fire tower used to stand. Easy dirt road to travel, no facilities but breath taking views and the site indicated is sheltered from all the wind. Fair Warning, if you camp here you will want to stay more than one day!!!

name: Mooney Dam, Douglas County Park
description: $10 self registration fee, located 12 miles off highway 53 east of Gordon WI. Picnic table, fire ring, pit toilet. We were the only one there. Quiet spot.

name: Dumpstation Homer
description: Dump station $15 with potable water, picnic table and poop bags for dogs

name: Whiskey Gulch Campground, Free
description: Beautiful campground directly on beach, wonderful view to the snow cap volcanoes, some gravel and grass spots, 14 days camping limit, free

name: Portage Valley Boondocking
description: Gravel road leads to several nice large spots near the water. Mostly hidden from the road. Close to the visitor center and tunnel to Whittier. Just barely any Verizon signal.

name: Glenn Highway - Nelchina River
description:
Nice Spots in the trees by Nelchina River. It's a old Campground. Now its for free.
Easy access via a bitumen and gravel road for even the largest motorhomes. Few potholes but nothing to worry a sensible driver. All sites large, level and screened from other sites. Perfect.

name: Tesoro Gas- and Dumpstation, Free
description: free dumpstation (flush water and potable water disabled) located in back of gas station.

name: Whittier Town Campground
description: This used to be a free spot to camp right by the water and next to the old Whittier airstrip, the town has turned the spot right by the water into day use only and created a large gravel lot next to it as a place to camp divided up into large parking spots as camp site. $20 for an RV spot. I did not realize this until the morning because I had always been told this was a free site. So I didn't pay. The view and location are still nice. There are put toilets and trash, nothing else. Verizon signal is ok unless a cruise ship shows up, then no signal until it's gone. Portage Pass trail makes this place worth it though.

name: unknown near us 50
description: BLM land without facilities. 14 day limit.

name: Glacier Road
description: Beautiful place near the Resurrection River, some spots in the dry gravel river bed, watch for the water level! Four-wheel drive needed only if going really far out. Designated Special Use Area allowing camping for up to 8 nights.

name: Harold Parker State Forest
description: $20. Easy access to Boston. Very wooded and secluded sites. water, no electricity. good cell service. Hot showers.

name: Walmart Bozeman
description:
Free. This place has a very cheerful air. It seems that all employees are happy and enjoy their work. Many RVs are here. Looks like a campground. Great location and at the gas station across the street has dump and water free for customers. Congratulations Bozeman and Walmart.

NO TENTS

name: Walmart
description: Walmart parking lot. Big area next to walmart also a lot of campers/tents. There is a campingstore next door. You can dump your toilet there and can get fresh water. Walmart closes at 11pm. Park near the building and you have wifi.

name: Living On The Edge
description: Great great great campsite. Take the road between mile marker 61 and 62 on the river side (right side if you come from Idanha). When entering the forrest follow the road to the right and drive till you see the edge. From here you have a beautiful view. Down below you can go fish/shower on 3 banks. Please keep it clean!

name: Kamook Staging Area
description: Free area with picnic table, place to set up a campfire, and restroom pit toilets. Nice place to sleep and stay near a main road.

name: Shel gas station
description: Gas station 24 hours, with bathron. Water and air to car free. Subway until 8 p.m. Place to sleep. FREE!

name: Cabela's
description: Cabela's Outdoor Gear Shop, overnight parking/camping for 24 h allowed, big parking area like Walmart. No dump or water.

name: Matanuska river camp
description: Nice area by the river. may be 5 places to stay.  good to brake the drive between Anchorage and Glennallen.

name: Lakeview Campground - Free
description: A free nice campground by a lake. It has maybe 10 places with picnic tables and firepits. Length restriction max. 30 feet (10 meter) Also exist a small trail to a photo blind. It's a quiet and very nice free campground. You can give a donation if you want.

name: Canyon Edge
description: Great Boondocking spot. Some sand to drive through if coming from the north, just at the highway off ramp. Some rock fire rings, probable 5 dispersed sites on canyon edge.

name: Walmart southwest of Austin
description:
Walmart 6am-11pm
Standard Walmart Parking on E HWY 290

name: Gillespie County rest area US 290
description:
Very nice grassy rest area with tables and BBQ places + little pkayground for kids. We didn't sleep here, just filled our water tank. But they said it is allowed to stay overnight in the vehicule or tent. For free.

The Lyndon B. Johnson state park next to it is also nice to visit and for free too.
You see how the former president Johnson lived (house, airplane, cars) and can watch a little german farm 100 years ago.

name: San Isabel NF - free place
description: National Forest campsites near US 82 between Twin Lakes on Independence Pass. Nice place near a creek with 360° Rocky Mountain views.

name: catamount rec area.nr burns colorado
description: blm land with boat ramp next to the colorado river with drop toilet and picnic tables with some shade under trees.max stay 7 to 14  days depending on time of year. FREE

name: Oliver Reservoir Recreation Area
description: Free camping for RVs or tents. First come first serve. Max 14 days in 30 day period. Self-register at entrance. Camp host Karen comes and checks registration stubs. Next to lake. pit toilets. potable water faucets. 40+ sites, many with shade. beautiful but near train line. but still worth it. free.

name: Walmart Fort Stockton
description:
Walmart parking a bit small compared to big city stores but plenty big. 
.
Other level parking just before Walmart

wifi no shade

name: DNR lyre River
description: Beautiful campground, free of charge if you have the $30 annual Discover pass. Only 11 spots. No trailers over 20' and no big rigs. Very busy during the peak season.

name: Poe Paddy State Park
description: $15 campsites here with quite decent bathrooms. Right along Penn's Creek which is huge for Trout fishermen. Lots of trails around here for both 4x4s and hiking.

name: Poe Paddy State Park
description: $15 campsites here with quite decent bathrooms. Right along Penn's Creek which is huge for Trout fishermen. Lots of trails around here for both 4x4s and hiking.

name: Picknick Area
description:
Nice parking area with grassy area around for free.
Tables, BBQ places.
Nice mountains around. Some noise from the street next to it.

name: Rest Area at Highway 10
description:
Parking lot. Loud because at the highway.
Tables with BBQ too.
free

name: Michigan, ND City Park
description: City park with picnic tables, electric, and basic restroom. Donations accepted.

name: Woodward Creek Falls
description: Beautiful place right on a creek close to a waterfall with a natural pool below. Free

name: Mono Hot Springs
description:
The mapped site is one of the few options to camp with your camper van for free around the Mono Hot Springs (there are some beautiful spots for tent campers along the road). 4WD recommended to access the siteI. t's a beautiful area with several hot tubs on the south fork of the San Joaquin River in the Sierra National Forest. The nearby campground is 26 $. Do not attempt to get here with a big rig as the road is a very narrow and winding, severely potholed one-lane road. 

strong ATT 4G throughout area. 

water at nearby "resort"

name: Walmart Las Cruces
description: Walmart big parking lot. Best stay on the asian buffet side

name: Winslow Park
description: Amazing "city park". Waterfront sites, Wi-Fi, hot showers. Beautiful views of the bay. $30

name: Exit Glacier Road
description: Several spots tucked into the woods along Exit Glacier Road. Free camping for up to 8 days. Some of the spots have been blocked by large rocks but a few good spots. One spot appears to be blocked by a boulder but actually is not and you can get out to the river area and camp right on the river instead of in the woods. A few miles up the road is Exit Glacier within Kenai Fjords National Park. Cell service works pretty good. Only a few minutes to get into Seward.

name: Globe Creek - Elliot Highway
description: Gravel parking next to the road and Globe Creek. In the creek there is fire place but there are a lot of mosquitos

name: Pole Creek Road
description:
Very beautiful place in the Bighorn National Forest 

Sehr schöner Platz im Bighorn National Forest

name: Lake Cameahwait
description:
Very nice place with toilet and covered seating

The sites ^^^ are covered picnic tables. There seems to be fencing screens to block some of the wind (this would be helpful when cooking, as long as the gnats aren’t too bad.

 Water is crystal clear! Hidden gem for sure

name: Lander City Park
description:
Lander has generously allowed for free legal camping in the park! Beautiful place with shade, garbage cans, and tables. Flush toilets available. There's an area for tents and another area along the river for RVs and cars. 3 night max stay. Great Verizon service.

schöner Platz mit Schatten und Tischen grosser Park mit Zeltmöglichkeit

name: Louis Lake Road
description:
Very many nice places on the street 

Sehr viele schöne Plätze an der Strasse

name: Lovell City Campground (free)
description:
Place under trees with toilet, shower, supply and disposal (all free of charge) 3 day limit 

Platz unter Bäumen mit Toilette, Dusche, Ver- und Entsorgung (alles gratis)
3 Tage Limit

name: Bighorn National Forest
description:
Place under trees with toilet, shower, water and dump point(all free of charge) 3 daily limit 

mehrere Plätze mit Feuerstellen im lichten Wald 
in der Nähe von Medicin wheel

name: Beach in Malibu
description: A bealtiful beach, lots of people, big beach. There are restaurants, toilets runing water and externa showers. Fee parking lot but it is possible parking near road for free.

name: Cibola National Forest, Cedro peak
description:
There are signs thats you need permition for camping. But the ranger said it is allowed and he recommended this beautiful place. Great view with sunset. 
At the gate 200m bevore turn left. The last part is not possible with big vehicles, but there are other nice spots in the forest.

name: Tillicum Beach Campground
description: Great campground with oceanfront sites. A few sites are electrical but most are no hookups. Paid $24usd for non-hookup with ocean view. Great beach. Basic bathroom facilities. A couple of miles south of Waldport.

name: River walk RV Park
description: A motor home type park but right off hwy 101, and after a few very wet couple of nights we got free wifi, free hot showers, good facilities and a hot tub For only $4 more than we paid last night in the redwoods for no services. Friendly staff and 3 blocks from a brew pub. Paid $39.43

name: Cachuma Lake Campground
description: Huge campground about 20 miles from Santa Barbara on what is a nearly empty lake after 3 years of drought. Bathrooms, showers, dog park, and pool in summer. It was ok. We found the map and site locations very confusing because there are few markers just what are basically grass/dirt areas. It was fine for 1night. We paid $25 for a tent site. Prime tent sites, hookups, yurts etc are all more.

name: Belle campground In Joshua Tree
description: Great little campground on Joshua Tree National park. 18 sites built in among the boulders. No water but clean pit toilets. Fantastic hiking and views. $15/night

name: Aspen Basin Campground
description:
Big parking area with tables. 
Free camping, "Big Tesque" a bit lower at the same road is another free camping.

name: Barnum City Park Campground
description: Great little town park campground, $10 per night, grassy spots under tree shade, cooking grills, bathrooms, everything you need.

name: Watson Lake
description: Really nice place, free, right on Watson Lake

name: Pawnee Buttes National Grasslands
description: a nice place with view to the buttes. nearby is a parking lot with pit toiletts and shelters. good verizon network.

name: Routt  NF near Dumont Lake
description: a place for overnight near the Dumont Lake also is a campground nearby. there are some places to stay.

name: Homer Spit Campgrounds and Tent Areas
description: There are two campgrounds along the Homer Spit: Mariner (milepost .04) and Fishing Hole (milepost 2.9) and two tent areas (mileposts 2.7 and 2.9). This specific spot is for the Tent Areas 1&2, where campers under 20ft are also accepted. All of them offer similar facilities and self registration is needed. Price for RVs is 24$, 15$ for tents. They also have dump station for 5$. 14 day limit per campsite.

name: Bealtiful beach
description: Only a day use, until 11 p.m.

name: Chevron Fuel Station
description:
Free camping site behind the fuel station. It has shade. Quiet place at night. 

Free dump station with fuel purchase. Propane and water.
Tent friendly under trees in corner but ask first.

Local para acampar free atrás do posto de combustível. Possui sombra. Lugar calmo a noite.

name: Rio Grande Gorge Bridge Rest Area
description:
Free parking with tables.
Nice canyon and bridge, also a good stop if you want to spend the night. Good T-Mobile service.

name: Great Sand Dunes NP, Piñon Flats campground
description:
20$ for camping extra to the park entrance.
By reservation only. Flush toilets, bear boxes and fire pit provided. No showers.
It is not allowed to sleep somewhere else in the park. Just outside the park is an other camping.

We liked the park. We hiked up the high dune like everyboady else. Took us around 2.5h both ways.

name: Browns Creek
description:
This is just one of many possible spots to camp for free. You can camp where ever you want in this forest. We saw around 40 motorhomes at different spots.
Follow country road 270 from road 285 to get there.

At Trailhead to Browns creek there is a pit toilet. The hike to the lake is 10km one way and 800m high difference. Took us 7h, was very nice.

name: Liberty Harbour Marina & RV Park
description: very convenient RV park to visit New York City  thanks to excellent location : a few blocks away from train that takes you in 15 min. to World Trade Center and downtown. it's basically a parking but slots are big and you face the Marina. Laundry available + restrooms and showers with hot water. Potable water is NOT available during off season.

name: Toilet, Shower, Wifi
description:
Toilet and Wifi free
Hot shower 
Buena Vista is a nice little town

name: Ashland Creekside Campground
description: Nice campground with actuel trees! Best privatly owned campground we have seen so far. Laundry, pool, shower, shop it's al there for a fair price. Do a night and you can start living like a clean hobo the next day. See picture for price (25 for tent)

name: Lower Onion Creek CG
description: BLM campground along highway 128.  Pit toilets, fire pits, tables.  No water.  Spectacular view of fisher towers.

name: Ramdom Place Next To River
description: We found small pull over right next to river. Close to houses but also far enough!! Free and quiet;)

name: Close To Nature Center
description: Big pull over next the small road which ends in Nature Center in Eagle river!! Quiet all day, couple cars pass the road, at night is quiet!free

name: Nähe Brooks Lake
description:
2 places in the forest on a very beautiful stream with bearcontainer. Down a short side path just after you cross the river.

2 Plätze im Wald an sehr schönem Bach mit Bärcontainer. 
Wegen Bärengebiet sind nur Fahrzeuge mit festen Wänden erlaubt

name: Slate Creek
description:
Several places directly at the river with table and grill site as well as shade 

Mehrere Plätze direkt am Fluss mit Tisch und Grillstelle sowie Schatten

name: State Park Campground
description: Manchester State park with some nice spots. $35 dollars. See picture for more price details. The have a rv dump and cell phone reception.

name: Baker Creek Campsite
description: Beautiful fall colors with Aspen leaves burnt orange color. $12 per night. Water, tables, vault bathroom, fire pit. Great star watching at night.  Around 7500' elevation.

name: Roadside gravel
description: flat gravel beside road with incredible view. Short but steep downgrade from the hwy. Bumpy ride to the spots but worth it. Best for small vehicles.

name: Black Kettle Lake
description: National Grassland campground. Free. Restroom and water. Pretty place. Local partiers showed up around 2 am. I ran them off.

name: Cedar Lake
description: Run by the Forest Service, Cedar Lake recreational area is a beautiful camp with a great swimming area. Beautiful clear lake nestled in the pines and hills.

name: Osage Point Park
description: Abandoned State Park now "managed" by the township of Osage, OK. When we visited it was in poor shape. Everything was overgrown. ATT&T reception was good. The one spot not overgrown was a shelter house. Beer cans littered the ground and syringes and razor blades were found. This place is free to camp but a bit sketchy. I recommend camping here in a group for safety.

name: Sulak
description: 12 sites of from a gravel road that dead-ends at a canoe launch site. Sites are generously spaced apart, each one has a fire ring and bench. Pit toilet in the middle (A bit of a hike from the sites at the beginning/end of the road). No water (unless you count the river). Not bad, considering it's free!

name: Green Machine
description: A great garage with mexicans guys. We have changed the oil and filter of our Defender Land Rover. The price is good. Muy buena gente!!!

name: Shepherd Hot Springs
description: This is one of several options to camp along Hot Creek, a river with a water temperature of about 100 degree Fahrenheit. You can soak in the river.  This site is not on Hot Creek but nearby.  Two bars Verizon service.

name: Lil' Hot Creek
description: This is one of several hot tubs in the area. Clothing optional. Free. You can camp right on the spot or in the nearby forest for more privacy. Can get busy especially on weekend nights. The water is hot enough to soak in even with freezing cold outside temperatures. Please close the valve before leaving as the water can get ways too hot to soak. Amazing place.

name: Hartley Springs CG - (Donation)
description:
Free NF campground with tables, fire pits and vault toilets. 
3G signal at times.

name: Forest Track Camp
description: Take Track off the highway,then take right fork to dead end with fire ring. Far enough away from the highway to be quiet. You can hear the sound of a stream running nearby.

name: Obrien Creek Rd
description: Nice little lakeside spot right outside Chitina. Great place to stop for a night or two before starting your bumpy journey down McCarthy Road. There is also camping at the end of the road, but it's just a parking area and there will probably be lots of ATVs. Verizon 4G signal is really good here.

name: Indian Reservoir
description: Great spot! The road to here is a easy but beautifull dirt road. Nice views miles away. On this road there is a free campsite with a pit toilet and on the end of the road there is a campground (next to the lake). You pay 6 dollars for day use and 13 for camping. If you arrive after 7pm you just 7 dollar. There is a shower (not always working) and flushing toilets. The campground is used by hunters but most of the time that's in the weekends. There is a old man staying here often (Richard), please say hi to him!

name: Fulford Cave Campground
description:
$8 per unit (self payment). With tables and fire places.
It's in the White River National Forest.
There are 2 campgrounds in this area, this one and "Yeomam Park". 

The trailhead to a nice hike is there (Lake Charles and another one). One way is 10km and 600m up. Took us 7h both ways. Some people sleep in tents up there.

name: BLM Campground At 60 Mile (Near Hot Spot Cafe)
description: nice campground with some picnic tables and fire rings, dumpstation and drinking water, next door (200 m) is a small Cafe Road House

name: At Dalton Highway
description: very nice spot with view over the green Tundra to the Brooks Range, about 500 m from Highway

name: 60 Miles BLM - 5 Mile Campground Dump Station
description: Dump Station, still currently free. Do not use the drinking water station to clean out your tanks.

name: Lewis and Clark National Forest
description: Several free camping spots along the river with fire rings. Nice valley with many trees and quite.

name: nahe Spirit Lake
description:
Beautiful spots on the road to Spirit Lake 

Schöne Plätze an der Strasse zum Spirit Lake

name: Sheep Creek Lake
description:
Very nice places right on the lake 

Sehr schöne Plätze direkt am See

name: Primitive Site-Custer nat'l Forest
description: This is just a few clearings off the side of forest service road. Road is negotiable by smaller rigs as there's a few switchbacks and some uneven surfaces. Very quiet area with scenic views. Turn right on forest road 4777

name: Thousand Spring Sno-Park
description: This is the overflow of the official park campground, 8 miles before the entrance of the park. There is a big parking lot and you can also camp in the woods. Restrooms and shelter. Quiet and view of the forest.

name: Hobo Hot Springs (& Showers by Donation) Saratoga
description:
Hot pools, free use, open 24 hours. The bath house is complete with showers and restroom facilities (although the restrooms have no doors, at least on the ladies' side).

 No potable water, so bring your own. 

Pools range from extremely hot (116°) to pretty cool (100°). Daily temps written on board at bath house. Swimsuits required.

http://saratogachamber.info/play-here/things-to-do/mineral-hot-springs/

name: Gerstle River Bridge
description: Very nice place with beautiful view to the mountains, use the small gravel road from the rest area to the river, pit toilets in the rest area. 1 bar of LTE

name: Stampede Trail
description: Couple of camping spots close the lake! Pretty busy, fireplaces. Good spot when you want to go hiking the next day (Stampede Trail).

name: Parking lot to park and sleep overnight
description: Pretty easy spot. Parking lot located in between IHOP and the Valero gas station. the IHOP is open 24 hours for bathroom use as well. FREE!!!!

name: Cripple Creek BLM Campground
description: Very nice camp ground at only 6$.  very quiet with lots of very friendly mosquitos.

name: Farmers Korner Wastewater Treatment Facility
description:
Campers/RV's 10$
Busses 20$
Self paying
They have potable water

name: Lake
description: Goid place to swimming in the lake, water is warm. There are 2 camping grounds arround $20. National Área.

name: Shingletown Rest Area
description: Quiet rest area even id on the side of road 44. Clean restrooms, pick-nique tables. Around 20km from the Lassen volcanic park, north entrance.

name: FREE forest camping
description: Good place with wood stove, table, area to fire and pit toilets in midle of trees. Shadow all day. Near a small creek. Cold at night fresh during the day.

name: Carney Park
description: This is a city campground that is next to a rodeo arena.  The sites have 30 and 50 amp service with water.  There is a grey water only dump station.  This campground can accommodate larger 5th wheels and possibly big rigs.

name: East Fork Carson River
description: Nice little place on the banks of East Fork Carson River just beside but well below CA 89. Perfectly quiet at night. 4WD may be needed to get back to the road. Free.

name: Treasure Island
description:
Large parking on the river with Botrampe 

grosser Parkplatz am Fluss mit Botrampe

name: Medicine Bow  National Forest
description:
Beautiful places on the street 318 

Schöne Plätze an der Strasse 318

name: Cowdrey Lake
description:
Very nice place right on the lake little shade 

Sehr schöner Platz direkt am See wenig Schatten

name: Dinasaur National Monument
description:
Primitive camping, 10$ per site (self registration)
Tables and BBQ places.
Gravel road to get there, around 6km.
There is a short easy walk you can do (2.4km both ways) but not much more.

name: Toiyabe National Forest Campground Markleeville
description: Very small campground (10 places), quiet, clean near a small creek. 18$ but 9$ with the interagency annual pass (federal park pass).

name: Rest Area
description: Good place, restroom, pic nic table, drink water, lots of place. Good to stay 12 hours and move to other side.  just keep moving back and forth as needed.

name: American Sunset RV Park
description: Great place for families. Clean, heated pool, free showers, Good Sam discount, fast wifi. A little bit on top of each other, but staff very accommodating. A touch pricey.

name: Ozette Loop Trail Head Parking Lot
description: Big Parking lot at ozette loop trail head. The near by ozette campground was full (only 8 spots) so several cars and campers spent the night here. Lots of people leave their cars here while camping on the beach for a few days, so technicly the rangers dont know if you are sleeping inside your car or just camping on the beach. Just be sure to hang your national park entrance tag or Olympic park entrance tag from your front mirror. Restrooms next to ranger station, fantastic access to the ozette lake just 5 mins away inside the campground, good to swim. Non potable water at trailhead info board

name: Wild camping on the lake
description: Nice and quite spot on the bord of a small lake. Enough space for a RV or two.  Medium good Verizon.

name: Big Sandy Recreation Area
description: Nice free camping at the lake with tables and BBQ places. (See more details below)

name: Soda Lake
description:
Many free camping spots around this lake. Even in high season it is easy to find a nice spot.
Wild horses came to drink to the lake.

name: Green River
description:
This is just one of many nice free spots along the Green River.
There are also offical campground (12$), a nice one is at the end of the road where the Green Lake is. There you can do some hikes. Very beautiful area!

Road 352 is paved until the forest. The rest is all gravel road, every kind of car can drive but maybe very slow. We only drove 20km/h in our van.

name: Roosevelt National Forest
description:
National forest roads 3 miles off the highway

Einige Plätze ca 5 km von Meekerpark

name: Hefferman Gulch
description:
Space in the forest very narrow only suitable for small vehicles up to 5m. 

 Platz im Wald sehr eng nur für kleine Fahrzeuge bis ca. 5m geeignet.

name: Plumas NF Beckwourth
description: Just off a narrow unpaved forest road in the Plumas NF close to the tiny town of Beckwourth on eastern CA 70. High clearance required and height limited to about 9 feet due to hanging branches.

name: Summit Creek
description: Nice place in a small clearing at the end of a spur forest road right by a little creek. It's the closest legal free option south of Lassen Volcanic NP. Perfectly quiet at night.

name: Butte Creek CG
description: A free NFS campground beautifully located along Butte Creek about four miles north of Butte Lake CG in the Lassen Volcanic NP. Sites with tables, metal fire rings and grilles, large and far between.

name: Iron Canyon Reservoir
description: Well off the beaten track on the shore of Iron Canyon Reservoir in the Shasta-Trinity National Forest roughly half way between CA 89 to the north and CA 299 to the south (about 25 slow miles in either direction). High clearance recommended to access the shoreline.

name: Rest Area
description: Toilets, poc nic table, 24 hours, water. Good place.

name: Rest Area Mile 269 Near Haley
description: Is a rest area with pit toilets but with a nice picnic area in the forest next to it with tables and fire places. Room for 3 parties and direct access to river. Don't miss the small gravel road leading down to the spots!

name: Lower Whitefish Campground
description: Lower whitefish Campground: $15, no trash, non potable well, outhouses, near the river, faint highway noise

name: The Big Eddie
description:
Free campground with tables. Plenty of space for about 15 rigs.

Solid Verizon service  and plenty of space for doggies to roam and play on river.  Nice views of the Tetons.

Be aware: moose frequent the area and coyote packs too close for comfort at night.

Popular area for day use.  Would come again!

name: Flying J
description: Truck stop. All the amenities you could ask for. There is a Denny’s inside. Plus hot food and dessert options from flying j. Bathrooms, of course gas and snacks. Shower and laundry for a price - I didn’t check it out. A decent parking lot. I parked along the back grassy area. I heard a couple trains before I fell asleep. About 6 RV spots available as well.

name: Spider Rock Campground
description: Privately run CG just next to Canyon de Chelly south road. Run by a friendly Navajo named Howard. Nice setting, with junipers & sagebrush. Sites are spacious (at least section I was in), all with fire pit and picnic table. No hookups or showers, bathrooms are port-a-potties. $11 a night, very pleasant place to stay.

name: Salt Creek Falls
description: A little pull out  that has pit toilets 100 meters away. Super quiet and robanli open from april till october. When you arrive to the sno-parking take the gravel road to your left and drive 50mts on the left is the camping spot with a fire ring, probably big enough to fit 1 big rig. Very nice and quiet, little noice from the nearby route. During winter you can camp on the sno-park directly.

name: Dump Staion Ashton
description:
Dump station + drinking water. It's written 5$, but we took only 10l and didn't pay.
Also visitor center with toilets and wifi.
Open until 5pm, no overnight!

name: Fantasy Canyon near Vernal
description: its a parking lot with a pit toilet at a fantastic landscape with sculptures. Golod for fotograph.its a BLM Land

name: Sheep Creek near Flaming Gorge Reservoir
description: a nice place on the sheep creek just before it flows into the Flaming Gorge Reservoir  (Sheep Creek Bay) - some places with firepits

name: Three Rivers Casino at Florence
description: Free first night, then 50 player's points each extension!! Not that crowded in winter. Verizon 4 bars. ATT 4Bars.

name: Wonderfull view near the arctic circle
description: Beautiful view. Dire circle. Near the road but no trafic at night. Si quiet and so wild.

name: Angel Peak (BLM)
description: This free campground is quite a gem! It's on BLM land, and there are a couple of picnic sites, then you reach the campground with about 8 spots. Both tent & RV sites available. It's right by the edge of a canyon full of badlands formations. Very cool views! 6 miles down a gravel road, that's ok for passenger cars except possibly after a heavy rain. You'll pass some overlooks and picnic spots before you reach the campground.

name: Bacon Creek
description: Located on the boundary of the North Cascades National Park, in the NC National Forest (dispersed camping allowed). Spacious, quiet place in between trees with multiple fire rings, on a steep bank of the Bacon Creek, with a narrow entrance and a mud pool in the middle. The road up here is potholed and not suitable for RVs and trailers.

name: Near Highway 20
description: Nice place and quite. Between big trees.

name: Arapaho National Forest Guanella Pass
description:
Very nice places near the brook 

Sehr schöne Plätze in der nähe zum 
Bach

name: Tarryall Reservoir
description:
Beautiful places on the lake. 
.....
Schöne Plätze am See

name: Oil Well Flat
description: Camping allowed in designated spots . 4 WD roads. Need fair clearance. Free. Primitive, camping , but has fire rings at the numbered spots.

name: FR 316, San Juan Forest
description: A little way east of Mancos, forest road 316 heads north, also called Madden Peak Rd. The first mile or so goes thru private property, then it enters the national forest. There are scattered boondocking locations in the next few miles of the road. If you take a right into FR 568, there are also a couple of spots there.

name: Bonita Valley Auto Care
description: We had an apointment for oil change and check-up before going to Mexico. We arrived on time, the guy went to see the van, came back and suddenly a worker was missing and he was not able to take care if our van. There were hours of delay and he insisted that we go to another place and even called one for us. Impression was he did not want to take care if our van but he did not tell it the dat before when we took the apointment.

name: Texas Creek
description:
Large open spaces without shade 

grosse offene Flächen ohne Schatten

name: Humboldt County Fairgrounds
description: In the nice little town of Ferndale. Near the iconic North entrance to the Lost Coast.  Humboldt County Fairgrounds RV Campground is the perfect base camp location for all your North Coast explorations.  Good value at $20 for a dry site/tent including unlimited hot showers in newly renovated bath house.  No wifi available at this time.  All public camping is closed in August for the annual fair.

name: Rodanthe Watersports Camping
description: Small campground with waterfront camping spots.  Good wifi and clean showers. Water and electric hookups available - decent prices.  $20 flat rate per night plus $7 for second person and plus $9 for electric. Compared to other campsites in the area, good price and good location.

name: Poncha Springs
description: Pull over spot, about 100 ft off hwy 285 next to Poncha Creek. Picnic area, some hiking trails, & creek nearby. Plenty of space for big rig but not super level.

name: Near Lake (steep Descent Off Highway)
description: Perfect Alaskan view! Camp trailer can fit.

name: Sand Flat Summer Free
description: Summer or when there is no snow on the roads. Sand flat free campsites more than 20 with fire rings and many big enough for big rigs. Quiet and deers on site

name: Klahowya NF CG
description: nice setting in dense forest. approx 20 USD. 55 sites some on river

name: Mora, Olympic NP CG
description: Large campground in dense rain forest (lush green) Approx. 4 km to beautiful Rialto Beach. Flush toilets and heated restrooms.

name: Garnet Ghost Town 2
description:
Great place with a amazing view. The place is in a dead end with firering.
Just take the right track to go to this place.

name: Arkansas River
description:
Known as “elephant rock” 

Very nice places on the Arkansas River with fire rings. 

Sehr schöne Plätze am Arkansas River mit Feuerstellen

name: Homestake Road
description:
Several places along road
.....
Mehrere Plätze

name: Tesoro Gas Station Valdez
description: Water for free on the back of the Tesoro gas station - at the propane tank you will find the tap (blue - potable water/green - non potable water). A laundry you will also find in this gas station. There is also a free dumping just 10m away. Car wash too.

name: KOA campsite
description:
This place is now KOA campsite. There is a fee to camp
Great for those with sand toys, who don’t care for privacy or peace and quiet. Not what we are looking for so we are driving on south.

name: CRAZY JUG VIEW POINT
description: Wild parking, site nesr the vieuw point. Amazing vieuw from the North Rim CGrand Canyon. Local tip.

name: North Fork Flathead River
description:
Free spot. I guess you also can stay at the river but it is not flat there.
All paved road to get there.

name: Big Sur Campgrounds and Cabins
description:
Eye-wateringly expensive campground. One of 3 private campsites along this road. All others in the Big Sur strip currently closed due to fire, except Plaskett Creek and Limekiln State Park, both of which fill up and require bookings.
Riverside costs $65 for an unpowered site, this one, Big Sur, costs $63 or $73 for unpowered sites, and Fernwood was full when we passed but probably similar. Complimentary coffee and hot showers at Big Sur though - what a deal!

name: Baca Campground
description:
Quiet the weekend we went. Large, open field with scattered, mature trees. Many loose stone fire rings scattered about. It looks like it is really popular for groups to meet up in nice weather and hang out around a fire. As advertised on the forest service website, there are no water sources, tables or metal fire rings. Two dual-sided (male/female) vault toilets. There are ranches nearby, so expect some traffic on the dirt road. The road is better maintained than other forest service roads; that's probably because of the ranches. 

BEST OF ALL:  FREE

name: Scrub-Tub Laundromat
description: What seems to be a 24-hour laundromat.  There is a change machine and facility looks new.  $3.25 per 30-lb washer cycle and $5.50 per 60-lb washer.  Small dryer is $0.25 for 8 minutes and large dryer is $0.25 for 5 minutes.  Next to a fuel station, Aldi supermarket across the road, and another shopping plaza with Planet Fitness gym across the other street.  There is also a power outlet inside.

name: Wailaki CG
description: Nice trails for campers with dogs. $4/night if you have a National Parks pass

name: Usal Beach Dispersed Camping
description: Large dispersed camping area at the southern end of the Sinkyone Wilderness State Park. At the entrance there is a sign reading that you are supposed to pay $25 for primitive camping but we didn't see any fee boxes and obviously nobody paid. If you're coming from the north in a regular passenger car, a big rig, or towing a trailer, do not attempt to take Mendocino County Road 431 as it is very rough, narrow and winding.

name: Sonoma Coast Vista Point
description: An undeveloped Vista Point on CA1 400 feet above the ocean large enough to hold a couple of RVs. No 'No Camping' or 'Day Use Only' signs. The road is pretty busy during daytime but surprisingly quiet at night.

name: Carbella Recreation Area
description:
Nice Recreation Area with Picnic Table , bear food storage and fireplace.  14 day limit to camp here. FREE

Camp in numbered spots only. Sites big enough for two vehicles all spots are along the river. Been recently renovated. Previously used to have lots of spots , more restrictive now.   Easy to get to camping area. Pit toilet available. 3 bars Verizon LTE. Not buggy at all for being so close to the river. All rig sizes can fit.

name: Halibut Campground
description: Incredible view! Quite Place at a nice beach.

name: Fall Creek - Nice and FREE
description: Nice grassy place. National Forest place.

name: Dodge City
description: Reststop before Dodge city. At the 400. Big stone cross on a hill

name: Coal Creek
description:
Very nice places at the brook


Sehr schöne Plätze am Bach

name: Dos Reis CG
description: Nothing special. $25 per night including unlimited hot showers. Somewhat run down and dirty. Tent camping on weekends only. NOTE: As Stockton is leading in crime statistics and there's farmland all around, it's a good idea to stay in a campground when overnighting in this area.

name: Hoh, Olympic NP  CG
description:
At the end of road to the Hoh Rain Forest. 20 USD. Some sites near river in open space, most in forest. Walking trails near the visitor center. 

trash bins are available at entry to each campground loop, as well as aluminum can recycling at restrooms. there are no showers. 

minimal cell signal only in loop a

name: Willaby NF GC
description: At Quinault Lake in beautiful rain forest. 25 USD. Swimming, fishing, walking trail. A similar CG just 1 km further. Check in at Quinault Lodge 1 km up the road

name: Mossyrock Recreation CG
description: 3 large campgrounds on a lake. Nice setting, very well maintained. 26-35 USD, shower 25 CTS/3min

name: Cougar Rock, Mt. Rainier NP CG
description: Large NPS CG with nice private sites. $20 USD, potable water, bathrooms, dumpsters, and dump station on-site.

name: Ohanapecosh, Mt. Rainier NP CG
description: At the river in dense forest. Large CG but nice privar sites. 20 USD

name: Antilon Lake NF CG
description: A few km N of Branson along a forest rd. FREE. On the lake shores several sections. No large vehicle access to some of the nice sites.

name: Ballard NF CG
description: Located along Lost Creek Rd , approx. 8.5 m behind Mazama. 8 USD. Next to a river, 7 sites, nice setting

name: Trailheadparking Mt. Sauk
description: Access via 10 km steep but ok gravel rd. Nice level parking. Walk up to Mt. Sauk, 3.2 km one way, 400 mgain

name: Ellicott Community Park
description: Near Colorado Springs off the 94. Gravel Parkinglot. Picknicktables and a little hut.

name: San Elijo State Park
description: Surf spot. Great beach. Packed and super popular. We lucked out with a last spot but paid a crazy $60/night (long, tiring day).  Road and train traffic.

name: Forest Clearing
description: Medium sized clearing just of a forest track. Very quiet and peaceful. Deer came within a few metres of our camp in the evening. Track is a little rough on the way in. Plenty of space for a few vehicles. Fire ring. Generally very clean. Need to use stones to get level. We were in toyota landcruiser with rooftent and stayed 2 nights. Saw a very large Grizzly bear in the area - so keep a clean camp!

name: FS 10 / Mt. TABOR
description: Many great little pull offs along this forest service mountain road. Many of them have fire rings.. Free wild camping. No cars using the road during the night!

name: Thurston's lobster
description: Good place for a lobster sandwich (we preferred the grilled cheese over the roll), some drinks and wifi while looking over the harbor. This area is more off the beaten path and is nothing like bar harbor.

name: Hartmann Rocks
description:
Very nice places in the rock formations. Steep access, toilets and potable water (hand pump) at the entrance


Sehr schöne Plätze in den Felsformationen. Steiler  Anfahrtsweg, Toiletten beim Eingang

name: Wright's For Camping: Cannon Beach
description: About 12 sites, some small and some medium. Probably not room for big rigs but there is an RV place down the road with bigger spots. Call for reservations, books fast on the weekends and summer. Bathrooms were relatively clean. Hot water shower. Fires allowed in pits. Few was $36 for two people one night. Couldn't find and wild camping nearby and was great to be a few mins away from the beach for sunset and sunrise. Picnic table and fire pit at most sites. Highway exit is within hearing distance but wasn't too loud. Firewood bundles were $5.

name: Kiser Slough Reservoir
description: Camping spots all over the place up here but all of them are right on top of the road. Extremely busy resort area with lots of cars trucks off-road vehicles dirt bikes people walking, at least 50+ a day go past my campsite But it’s nice and cool and beautiful and lots of hiking and I have a gorgeous view of the Rocky Mountains and the lake.
