Still off-season so no services whatsoever up here and still have some snow. But it’s a great way to escape the hundred degree heat down in the valley of Grand Junction. 0 to 1 bar LTE Verizon.

name: Lands Ende Road
description:
Some nice places near the road. Great view of the plain, slightly rough driveway


einige schöne Plätze nahe der Strasse. Super Aussicht auf die Ebene, etwas raue Zufahrt

name: Montery Pier street parking.
description: We couldn't find a good spot to sleep and ended up here. It's a parking spot in the town. If you draw much attention it works. In the night it's quiet. I don't know about the risks of a ticket. The parking is free and there are no signs.

name: Dry Creek in Healy
description: Dirt Track to dry creek near Healy. Maybe visible from the road and you can hear the cars but close to Denali National Park.

name: Off Denali Highway
description:
Just off Denali Highway. Narrow Dirt track leads to small clearing. Great view of surrounding mountains, with fire pits. 
Probably also used by hunters.

name: Beargrass Lodging & RV Resort
description: RV camping, no tents. even if you don't stay on camping. There is a pool, sauna and laundry. Near Glacier National Park.

name: Coin-Op
description:
US$ 1 for machine
US$ 0.25 to dry 7 minutes

name: Walmart
description: Walmart 24h with Subway inside. The parking lot is filled with RVs, campers, rigs and conversion vans.

name: Butte Walmart
description:
24 hours open
toilets, water
subway
free WiFi 
(July 2020) Due to COVID store hours 6:00 -21:30, believe SubWay is closed.

name: NFS designated dispersed FREE camp
description: Big gravel lots for camping, multiple spaces. Nice view of Grand Teton from top lot. Near park entrance at Moran junction.

name: Walmart, Marion
description:
pretty quiet. near I-81
walmart closes at midnight
others shop around

name: mousetail landing stage park
description:
Very nice spot. 
Prices Nov. 2017: 
17 USD (no off-season discount anymore) 
Discount for Seniors (62+): 25 % 
Very kind and supporting rangers. 
We were allowed to use the showers at the developed Campground (approximately 2-3 miles away). There is also a Laundromat beside the showers (need coins)

name: The Wedge Overlook Campsite #9
description: Very nice BLM with a amazing View over the Canyon.

name: Crack Canyon Slot - Top
description:
Great nice place to spend a night. The hike and climbe true the slot are great.
To get here you need at least high clerance and 4x4.

name: Goblin Valley - Drinking Wather
description: Dumping Station with water

name: Along Mtn. Scenic Loop Rd
description: Approx. 300 m off the hwy. Right on the river, car must remain about 20m from site

name: Stagecoach Horse Camp, State Forest CG
description: Very few visitors therefore no problem to stay without horses.  15 USD. Campsites well suited for cars and tents. Direct access rd from Hwy OR-6 very steep at the beginning, alternative on better road further East. Very quite place in beautiful dense forest. Lots of 4x4 opportunities nearby. Pick up free maps from state forest.

name: Cape Lookout State Park CG
description: Right on the beach. 21 USD dry/tent. Walking trails, swimming

name: South Beach State Park CG
description: Large CG but with private tent sites, hookups are smaller. 21 USD dry, 29 with EW. Walking trails, beach access. S of Newport

name: Valley Hybrids
description: Georg and his team really know what they're doing. Specialists in Toyota Land Cruiser (no other makes or models!) they will solve your issues fast and efficient. Highly recommended.

name: Natural Arch, Rio Grande NF
description: Beautiful! End of a dust/gravel road. With care normal cars can drive here. Follow signs to Natural Arch

name: san Juan River
description: Next to the river. Between 2 ghost towns. Beautiful

name: Harrison Town Park
description: I stayed here in Sept 2016. Nice park, very green & well kept, and this is FREE now! 2 RV spaces for max of 3 days, and you could probably tent camp here too. RV spaces have 20/30/50A power + water. Park has flush toilets, no shower, and pool that was closed for season when I stayed. Great deal!! (-:

name: walker
description: wendy's fast-food.ask to stay. near walmart who refuses overnight parking. pretty quiet

name: Lake Crowley
description: Crowley Creek Campground for only $8 a night. Big sites with beautiful view : Up the hill from Lake Crowley, west side of 395 with a 360° view on Sierra Nevada, lake and mountains. Very quiet although occasional road noise.

name: Teepee Campground
description: RV park just outside Rapid City, with spaces for tents too. Prices vary from jumbo RV sites with full hookups to tent sites without electricity. Price for a 24' RV with full hookup was $35. Flush toilets, showers, and cheap laundry ($1/load). View of sunset over the black hills from the top of the campground. Free wifi.

name: Wilson State Park
description: Nice campsite on a large lake with primitive camping as well as campsites for RVs. Bathrooms and showers available. We paid $16 for a basic site and it is about 10 miles from I-70.

name: Tish Tang Tribal CG
description: Operated by local indian tribe. Nice and clean setting on a river with a great swimming lake. In a oak tree forest. 15 USD

name: Sagehen Creek NF CG
description: Approx. 4 miles of rough forest rd to get there. FREE. 9 sites. Good for SUV size rig.

name: End of Palmer Creek Road
description:
Dead End of Palmer Creek Road. Start of nice hiking trails to old mining site. 
Last 8 Miles not maintained, high clearance vehicle recommended - many potholes. 
A view pullouts/camp spots with fire pits along the road. Not much traffic here.
Amazing views of surrounding mountains!

name: Roman Nose
description: Great little spot with handicap access to the first lake and a small (2mile loop) to two more alpine lakes.  Campsites available with pit toilets and flat tent sites. No Trailers or large RV's.

name: Lunch Peak Lookout
description: You can rent this lookout to stay in or there is plenty of room for a few overlanders 100 yards down the hill near the pit toilet. Great views. Very windy every time I visit.

name: Columbia River RV
description:
RV Park in Portland. 35$ per night with all services (nothing without). Not very quiet, near a street and the airport, but maybe the closest to Downtown.

2019-05-26 update : 40$/n

name: Hobuck Beach RV Park And Campground
description: This is a pay park that included full hook up sites, services areas and also cabin rental. The arrangement for selecting a site is VERY unstructured. Folks were camped in washes, under trees, near the beach and even in a line up. Anything goes. $20 for tent site. Includes free shower, wifi and bathrooms.

name: Evergreen Museum and Waterpark
description:
Note: Signs posted that there is an event and there is no parking from May 31 to June 19 

The home of the Spruce Goose is a great museum of flight and space and a Waterpark too.  Admission includes a big screen movie. Ask for AAA or other discount to save $$$. Then dry camp for FREE in the parking lot for free. Your rig will be among airplanes or army tanks or in the Oak Grove picnic area. Loads of space and picnic tables and potties.  Oh and the playground is amazing!!!  No pit toilet so they only allow RV’s

name: Van Lake Road- Open Area
description: This road has a couple of spots near the highway. Then back about 1 mile it splits- go left. There are multiple roads off of that which are BLM and passable. Silent night with starry sky.

name: Dispersed camping In national forest
description: This is the dirt road turn off which leads to many, many dispersed campsites. There are some within a mile, and many more about 4 miles further on the left turns. Some have shade and grass. Great area to spend a night or several days. Quiet. 14 day stay limit posted. We saw trailers and motor homes back in there that had made it down the roads. Also tents. There is a pit toilet at the turn off, but nothing back in the woods. There are a few cow ponds and a small stream. This main road is not passable in winter, however. But you can still get to the first parking area.

name: wild camping in Kentucky.
description:
just of route 9 one of these special spots for staying the nite in nature.
the trail is a bit rough but hard rock.

name: Uncompahgre Nat. Forest
description:
Schöne Plätze auf der Mesa

Domingues-Escalante Forest. Access marked on Hwy 141 on the left. Up on the Mesa, a few flat campsites with fire rings near the top. Gravel road in good condition, good for car and suv's, just watch for atv's and pickup trucks tumbling down as if it were Paris-Dakar. No great view but you're in a pine and tuya forest.

name: Uncompahgre Nat Forest
description:
Many beautiful places on the Mesa


Viele schöne Plätze auf der Mesa

name: American Horse Lake
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Hunting Fishing License or Conservation Pass needed for Overnight Stay. 

American Horse Lake near Geary is a no boating lake that offers bank fishing and tube fishing. Facilities include picnic tables, a water well and primitive campsites.  No other facilities are available. 

The lake supports an abundant population of good-sized bluegill and catch and release only bass. Shoreline length is seven miles and the lake covers 100 surface acres.  American Horse Lake is operated by the Oklahoma Wildlife Department.

A conservation passport is required of all individuals, residents and nonresidents who enter Department owned lands, unless exempt.  Exemptions include persons who possess an annual hunting, fishing or combination license; a lifetime hunting, fishing, or combination license; senior citizen lifetime hunting, fishing, or combination license; disability hunting or fishing license; and residents under age 18. Go to https://www.wildlifedepartment.com/forget1/OnlineSales.aspx to purchase licenses and conservation passports.

name: Kenai Lake, West Side
description: Beautiful gravel beach camping on Kenai Lake surrounded by mountains and turquoise water. High Clearance 4x4 recommended, narrow and steep dirt road down to the spot from Snug Harbor Rd.

name: Eckvoll WMA
description:
Free camping  on east side of Agassiz NWR.
6 or more  campsites in the trees.
Lots of wildlife, deer, birds, etc.
Perfect spot.

name: Seescape Summer Street
description: At the far end of a Street in a fancy residential area in Seascape. Parked here at 9 p.m. and left by 8 a.m. Slept in our pop-up-roof tent. Nobody bothered us. Note: This post is not to promote that specific site but to encourage you to look for a place to spend the night even in housing areas when there are no other affordable options and no hinterland with boondocking sites.

name: Big Eddy free campsite
description: Several campsites close to lake with picknick tables, fire rings, food lockers and clean toilet. For free. Max stay 16 days. We were the only ones at end of September.

name: Rio Chama
description:
informal camp site on the Rio Chama. 
Take the road from the Abiquiu damn. There are a couple of fire pits. 
Nice and quite.

name: Chena Lakes Recreation Site
description: Nice campground with a lake and lots of space. Tent site USD 15.- and RV USD 20.-. Only dry camping. Noisy from the airport and Air Force. Lots of mosquitoes like almost everywhere in Alaska.

name: Rio Chama
description:
Small campsite next to the Rio Chama. There are a coupe of fire pits.
Take the road from Abiquiu Damn down to the road along the river.
Nice and quite.

name: Riverview Cuttoff
description:
Beautiful little camp site just off Riverview Rd on the river.
There's a couple of fire rings and nice green grass for a tent. 
This is cow country, so cow patties might be abundant.

name: Rio Grande Campground
description:
Campsite right on the Rio Grande, without charge - donation welcome
.....
Campingplatz direkt am Rio Grande, ohne Gebühr - donation erwünscht

name: Kendesnii Campground (Nabesna Road)
description: Nice, quiet, clean (and free) campground at mile 27.8 of Nabesna Road, before the river crossings (Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve),. It has 10 campsites, picnic tables, metal fire rings and grill, vault toilets, lake and short hiking trail. More hiking trails along Nabesna Road. Should this be full: there are many pullouts / campspots, some with picnic table and stone fire ring along the road.

name: showers / laundry
description:
very clean public shower and laundry, located at Snowshoe Motel.
7,- USD / each with towels + 3,- USD for an additional person.

name: Am Doloresriver
description:
Very nice places at the brook


Sehr schöne Plätze am Bach

name: Caddis Flats Campground (free)
description:
Take your pick - shaded nooks or sunny. Right next to clear river and surrounded by cliffs and forests. 
BBQ stands, picnic tables and shelter
Free with maximum stay of 14 days. 

Schöne Plätze am Bach

name: Beef Basin Road - Top
description: Very nice place with a fantastic view. Beetwen trees with firering.

name: Chilkoot State Park
description:
Great campground, firepit, pit toilets. 15$ per site (you can include 2 vehicles).
The place to be for the salmon run.

name: Hungry Mother State Park
description: Really nice state park with lake swimming beach and developed camp sites for tents and RVs. Lots of hiking trails around the lake. Tent sites all have a large wooden platform for tents, fire ring, tables and new clean bath house. Recommended!

name: Near the 1, in the forest
description: Nice place. It's a parking, before the entrance of hunters unpaved way with a gate.

name: Lime Creek Road
description:
Huge open area bordered by Aspens. 14 day limit. OK Cell service with booster on T Mobile & Verizon. Very quiet, especially at night. No OHV also, so daytime is quiet other than a little road noise from Million dollar highway.  Easy access, huge field, plus 3 more spots in the trees down the dirt double track through the aspen, if you have a van or SUV. Pretty buggy when we were there. Stayed 3 nights. Between Durango and Silverton, making it nicely convenient to a lot of trails.

Places with fire place --- Plätze mit Feuerstelle

name: Private property, camping permitted by Grand Canyon West Ranch
description:
Sign in at the registration box and get a car pass for the windscreen. Instructions on the sign. Free. We found a spot about 100m up the track on the left. Only visitors in the night were coyotes but it is a hunting area, not sure what time of year. 
Grand Canyon West about 20kms up the road is expensive, but amazing, especially at sunset. Arrive about 5pm at the latest to see both the viewpoints before closing. Costs $50 pp, plus $20 for the skywalk platform.

name: Mountain & Aspen View Bush Camp
description: Great view of Aspen trees and mountain vistas.  Campfire circles already established.  Could be breezy at times but there are some sheltered areas out of the wind.

name: Mountain View Bush Camp
description: Amazing vistas just a short drive from Telluride.  High clearance and 4x4 not needed.  Free. LNT.

name: Nähe Navajo Dam State Park
description:
Single place over the river, very rough and steep driveway


einzelner Platz über dem Fluss, sehr raue und steile Zufahrt

name: Free Dump Station & Showers
description: Free dump station and toilets&showers across the street from Colorado Welcome Center. There is no pressure tap water.

name: Lewis & Lewis Insurance
description: Very friendly and straight forward procedure for car insurance for Mexico. Paid about $770 for full coverage including partial theft and vandalism (car value $45,000).

name: Juan Creek
description: Large pullout on the 1 . The view is outstanding, perfect to enjoy the sunset & star gazing.

name: Panther Meadows
description:
Free

Comment: road was closed at the bunny flat trailhead and onward. sign said it closes in November. But it's July, almost August. no snow on road. not sure why it's closed. Google maps suggested an alternate route, but it looked more like atv trails. would not suggest even a small car go down it.

name: Choteau City Campground
description: A municipal campground with bathrooms and water and dump station. 10$. If you go across the little bridge around the corner you are closer to the bathrooms that have real Toilets and lights and next to a little stream. Good ATT, Verizon  and T-Mobile signal.

name: Porcupine Flat NP CG
description: First come, first served. Few sites for large rigs. Fills up early. On Tioga Pass Rd. 12 USD. 55 sites

name: Lowe River outside Valdez
description: Nice spot a few miles out from town by the river. Hidden from the highway, beautiful mountain views and river access. Verizon signal works good.

name: Backslope brewing
description: In a industry now over saturated in mediocrity this brewery stands out. Great beers at a cheap price $4, and very good food. (Try the ginger pork sand which with fries ($10). This place is very good and should be visited while you come and go from Glacier. Stands apart from most/all of the other Montana breweries we've been too!

name: Saddlebag Campground
description: Closed Campground in low season. Quit and nice view

name: travel plaza seneca ,indian reserve nr silver creek on the i20 west 20 miles south of hamburg ny.
description:
truck stop with cheap diesel and taboc products
plus free overnight parking and dog park?

name: Jackson Park, Pie Town NM Free
description: Located in Pie Town city park called Jackson Park.

name: Joe Skeens - El Malpais NCA (free)
description:
High desert campground set back from the highway. A loop of 10 free campsites (no reservation system/first-come-first-served basis), each with a covered picnic table, fire grill, and tent space.  There are 2 vault toilets.  Some of the sites have pull through parking ideal for total lengths up to 50 feet.  There is a steep arroyo at the entrance, so long vehicle drivers should inspect it firsthand before entering.  Maximum persons per campsite is 8 and maximum vehicles are 2 per campsite parked only on gravel without blocking the road.  The road is graveled and passable in most conditions.  Wait for water in the arroyo to dissipate before attempting any crossing. Stay is limited to 7 total days per month and the total stay in this NCA (National Conservation Area) is limited to 14 days each month.
 
Quiet hours are from 10PM to 6 AM and prohibit music, parties, or generators.  ATV vehicles are forbidden unless secured on a trailer.  No horses, livestock, or animal carcass are permitted in the campground.  Pets must be leashed.  Firewood and any other collecting is prohibited.  Check with local authorities for open fires regulations for each day.  No fireworks or firearms can be discharged in the campground. 

You MAY be able to get up to 5 gallons water daily by driving north 1 miles to the Ranger Station (ONLY when the ranger is open).  The closest town is Grants, Mexico.   Plan accordingly

name: Kasilof River Special Use Area
description:
Special Use Area. Beach Camping allowed. Probably crowded in summer with fishermen. Empty when we were here. 
Watch the tide. Nice view of the Cook Inlet. Beautiful spot.
Maximum allowed stay between May 31 thru July 1 is 21 consecutive days
Between July 2 thru May 30 is 14 consecutive days.

name: Armijo Springs Free
description: Very nice places in the open forest with tables and hearth open all year

name: Showers @ Skagway Rec Center
description: clean and hot shower, 5,- USD per person, no time limit.

name: Sherman Island
description:
$30, first-come first-serve camping is available in the middle parking area of this county park. It's basically a small parking lot, but there are trees alongside it and the beach is a very short walk away. There are multiple picnic tables in the camping are. Garbage and recycling bins are available. Pit toilets were clean. 

This is a popular kite-/windsurfing location, so it is extra busy on warm, windy weekends. 

Pay at the machine near the entrance. Camp hosts were friendly.

name: Boat access on lake near Detroit Lakes. Parking slot.
description: Late in year it was okay to park for one night. "No Camping" rules. But all campsites are closed for the winter, so nobody asked us. Very quit and a nice view over the lake.

name: Cadillac Ranch RV park
description: Nice campground with some places for tents / Vans with shade. 22$ per night for 2 without services.

name: San Francisco Hot Springs Free
description:
Some nice places at the Trailhead to the Hot Springs


einige schöne Plätze am Trailhead zu den Hot Springs

name: Fox's Friendly Automotive LLC
description: Very good mechanic

name: Hole in the Rock Road
description: Very nice spot berween trees with Firering and a great sunset and sunrise view. Very quite.

name: City of Rocks State Park
description: A beautiful, tranquil location among a big group of boulders. Small hiking trails and dispersed camping among the boulders, each site has firepit, tables. Big rigs will fit in the parking lot, each site for big rigs with table and shelter. Toilets and hot showers available at the visitor center. $10 per site includes water, $14/site with electric or $5 day use per car. Walk or bike in is free. 8 min movie at the Visitor's center.

name: Shell gas station
description:
Crazy gas prices but convenient propane fill up for RV's

Also a west indian food place inside the gas station.

name: Horse Creek Trailhead
description: Begin on this trailhead up a rocky path for approximately 2 miles. it will take nearly an hour to reach the top. Once you arrive, you will be met with an awesome view atop 100 ft cliffs overlooking Hot Springs NC. The trail ends a couple hundred feet past this. Return down the way you came.

name: White Top Mountain
description: One nice spot with good views of the clouds clear. No bathrooms, okay Verizon signal.

name: The Castles @ Reva Gap CG (free)
description: Free campground in the Custer National Forest. Here on a rainy Friday in late September. Leaves are turning, and it looks really pretty, though obscured by fog. Quite a few people coming & going, though no trouble getting a space near the road. Muddy conditions so I didn't want to drive much further, but plenty of trucks went on up the road. Nice spot, one pit toilet in this area, covered picnic tables & even one pole with electricity! Definitely a winner!

name: TAVLLC
description: TAV is a company that prides itself on credibility and functionality. We are a company focused on building fully functional, high end expedition vehicles with the best equipment and tools found in the overland market today.

name: Wild camp
description: Camp right next to the main road and West Walker river. Access road a bit rocky, but riverbank spacey and sandy

name: Wallace State Park
description: Nice little State Park with campground. 2016: 13 $ Basic site, Still 13$ in 2021.

name: Prescott National Forest
description: Great views and well maintained campground in a pine forest. Lots of trails around too. Usually $14 a night but was reduced to $6 in October. There is also a day use area.

name: Dick's RV park and campground
description: Established campground. Not too far away from city center. Hot showers and a bar 300ft away. AAA-discounts. 24 dollars for a campsite.

name: South Jackson Avenue Campground (Pinedale, WY)
description: Located centrally in Pindale, WY. Perfect spot to put up a tent. $10 per tent per night. DRY CAMPING ONLY

name: Camp Hidvegi/Osoba
description: Second access road back from trail head. Definitely 4wd only. No utilities. Remote and secluded.

name: Dump station
description: This is a FREE dump station at the Maverick Gas Station.

name: Silos Recreation Area
description:
A nice camping area directly next to the Canyon Ferry Lake with a nice view over the lake - quiet. Top! 

$12, requires online reservation but can be made day of

name: Walmart
description: Stayed 1 night no one bothered me. Parked to the left side as you are facing the store. ask permission to be sure no one bothers you.

name: provincial park
description: it is a wonderful place

name: Turnout before Needles overlook
description: Quiet and secluded place on a trail 2.2 km on the  left of the road to Needles.Dispersed camping, no amenities. High on the plateau, can be very cold at night.

name: Kokopelli Trail
description: The Kokopelli trail is marked, turnoff from hwy 128 north of Moab toward I-70 past the 30-mile no-camping area. 4x4 only, trailhead is relatively smooth at first, then very rough. You can camp anywhere. This area is quite different from the Moab-Arches area, more desert-like, no shade, lots of antelope, nevertheless spectacular. Free dispersed camping, no service. Nobody around.

name: Kokopelli trail
description: Three or four more campsite up the rough trail from where we camped. 4x4 needed, we made it with our stock xterra. Quiet, secluded, nobody seems to be using this off-road trail. flat sites with fire rings and one with stone "tables" to set your camp kitchen. That trail ends further down and is blocked by a wire fence but you can continue by foot for a nice hike.

name: Uncompaghre Forest
description: Levelled established campsite by the road in the Forest, with fire rings, surrounded by huge pines. A bit dusty and noisy during the day, this whole Forest being used by hunters during hunting season but traffic stops around 8 pm and starts again around 6 am. Free. Lots of other campsites along the road in the Forest, you have a lot of choices here.

name: Deep Creek
description: A few established free sites with fire rings. A couple un sheltered with beautiful mountain view, others nearby (100 m and +) are sheltered in a nice birch Forest. Access is via Hwy 145 from Naturita just before Telluride, turnout is marked Deep Creek. Road to BLM lands is good and goes through private lands.

name: San Juan National Forest off FR 316
description: Nice area full of good campsites with fire rings. Sites closer to the entrance had a few hunters so we continued up the road to the mountain to this nice and sheltered site. Road is good without 4x4 when dry.

name: Out of Canyon Lands
description:
Very quiet and have a 360° view !!!

Stay there with 43’ Toyhauler no problem, beautiful view and quiet

name: Kelly Lake Campground (Free)
description: Free campground by Kelly Lake. There's enough space for about 7 (?) campers. Vault toilet, water.

name: Canyons of the Ancients National Monument
description: Don't be fooled by the road to get there, it's a real maze so use google maps. Access is through private farm lands and you might think you will be camping with the cows. But soon you will reach the access road to this magnificent natural forest. Sites are few, but have fire rings. By far my favourite spot to camp. A real gem.

name: Layby
description: Gravel pull off behind trees under telegraph lines. Quiet. Fires ok and a few stone fireplaces and there is a lake down through the woods. One of the few places along this part of the hwy which is not posted private so why it is worth using.

name: Chloride Western RV Park
description:
Small and well looked after campground/RV Park. Clean showers/toilets. Dry camping area has picnic tables and fire rings. Wifi, recreational room with TV and pool table. Laundry facilities. Camping $10 per tent. $25 full RV hookups with 30 amp electricity .  
Laundry $1 per load wash,  $1 per load dry. 
Town has basic dry goods store and restaurant. 
Beautiful sunsets.

name: O'Reilly Auto Parts
description: Auto parts. People are very nice. They lend us tools to repair our van

name: Doheny state beach
description:
Beach front site in Southern California
Lots of sand beach camping for both tent and rv. Right next to a railway line so pretty loud at night. $60 beach site, $40 off beach

name: East Canyon State Park
description: Now $40 for full hook-ups, $35 for partial. No tent camping option.

name: Westy werks
description: Specialist european vehicles esp. vw. These guys have taken over all the work that Gowesty used to do and thank goodness for that! 20 minutes from Gowesty they can get all the parts you need and they are super helpfull and offer good impartial advice.

name: Owens Vally - Nice
description:
On the way to Death Vally nice place to stay with a nice view. High clearance recomended to get to this place. 
Up hwy168 then take road right a Zurich. notes distances to services

name: Duo tech
description: it is a good place to repair the car. they work well with travelers.

name: Fort Frederick State Park
description: Be sure to note park hours as can be very restricted. Camping along the Potomac River is available on 29 unimproved sites which include a fire ring and picnic table. The family campground is first come, first served and includes portable toilets only. Four youth group campsites are available for organized youth groups.

name: Harris Beach campground and rest area
description: Donation is optional but appreciated.......................

name: Thunder Valley Casino
description:
Casino has a big parking lot across the street where they allow RVs and big rigs to park overnight. No facilities here, but across the street you have a big casino with all its facilities. Stayed 2 nts in Oct 2016. There were 8-10 RVs each night, and similar number of trucks. Must be self-contained, no tents. 
Note: no cars or SUVs only large RV.  They kicked me out because my car is not an RV.

name: Santa Fe National Forest
description: Access via Hwy 126. Turnout is indicated as Girls Scout Campground. Follow the dirt road, then cross the bridge. Lots of beautiful and secluded sites on a little stream, with fire pits. Surrounded by tall pines. Perfect!

name: World Auto Body
description: Very friendly and helpful mechanic that helped us with some welding, even though we arrived afer 5pm on a friday night. Specialised in auto repair and collision repair. We highly recommend Juan and his team.

name: Carlsbad
description: Good camping but full when we arrived

name: San Mateo Campground
description: At San Onofre state beach, nice camprground with 150 sites, big sites so better privacy than for example KOA. There is a dump station and you also have an access road of 1,5 miles to the beach. They we full when we arrived bit agreed to give us one of their emergency sites as we were getting desperate (5th camping we tried and it was getting dark). We paid 35 dollar ($40 USD as of December 2018) for our site without hook up.

name: Notom-bullfrog Wildcamp
description: Nice and quiet space near the river. No facilities. BLM area so wild camp is authorised. We are across the road from this site so where we are is not for big rigs.   Right off 24

name: Mesa Farm Market
description: Excellent place to buy some fresh products, 100% bio! They have pork, goat cheese, bread and some fruit and vegetables. Nice owner!

name: Nice Camp Outside Gobelins
description: Great spot (multiple spots can be found around) to free camp just outside gobelins state park. No facilities but you can have a shower for 5$ at the state campsite. Campsite was 25$ inside the park but this spot is much nicer and free.

name: Archview RV Resort And Camping
description: One of those big campgrounds that have all facilities. Good location between canyonlands and arches NP but at the main road so noisy. Tent site without hookup is 37 dollar so quite expensive. Hot showers, laundry, small swimming pool, gas station, shop, wifi, etc. You can also pay here to take a shower and use one of the many blm campsites which are nicer.

name: Little Molas Lake Campground
description: Nice campground by the lake. Was the only place we found 'open' end of october. There was no sign that it was closed and several people dropped by during the day. There are restrooms but these were locked when we were there. Nice views on the lake, fire pits, tables and further from the road than the other campsite down the road.

name: Ridgway State Park
description: 8 dollar to enter the park and $24 for a tent site, full hook up for $34-36. Several walk in sites but the majority needs to be pre-booked. Off season only one part open. Showers, toilets, water, all you need. Need to reserve ahead (phone or online).

name: Saratoga Lake Campground
description: Camp at the lake, 15 for hookup, 10 without electricity and 8 for tents. Pit toilets on site.

name: Atherton Creek CG
description: National Forest camground, close to Teton south entrance. Beautiful campsites at the lake, usual pit toilets, fire pits and tables provided. Also only campground that is open in low season. first come first serve. Price is $15 single site, $25 double site. No fees in low season. Nr 20 has the best views! but many others with great views. no cell service.

name: Chevron Dump Station
description: Is now 10$, open 24/7, non potable water available, free if you refill gasoline

name: Encino near the playground
description: noisy place due to the train but a place between Santa Fe and Roswell.

name: Holtville Hot Springs (camping)
description:
This is a FREE hot springs with two or three pools and a shower. Frequented by area campers. 
There is a parking lot with "no overnight" posted. But several areas nearby where overnight parking would not be noticed. Just check the dirt roads nearby and along the canal. There is also a campground across the street but we did not check details. 
The hot spring parking area has pit toilets, concrete surrounding, shade, seating. Used all day and through the night. Bring flashlights at night. 
This is alongside Hwy 8 at Vanderlinden Exit. This is accessible by all vehicles.

name: Bull Run Regional Park
description: Very nice campground suitable for tents (some tent sites have flat sandy pads) or big rigs with full hookups. Clean bathrooms with hot showers, spacious wooded sites. Even laundry facilities ($1.50/wash). There is a shooting range nearby so it can be a little noisy during weekend days. There is also a water park on site, open May-Sept and a winter light exhibit in December. Open year round.

name: Lincoln NF
description: Nice and calm Spot out in the forest with a fireplace. There are several spots on that NF-Road. Not so hot in summertime.

name: Benson Ridge Road
description: Nice place in the forest to relax. Fireplace available.

name: Carson NF
description: Realy dirty road to get there, but nice place to relax with firepit.

name: Mallette Creek
description: Not specially beautiful but near to Red River. Lot of spots for overnight. There were several other peoples there.

name: San Isabel NF
description: Nice Spot just before entering to Great Sand Dunes NP by Medano Pass. There is a Fire Pit

name: Rosevelt NF
description: Nice and calm overnight spot. Steep and dirty road to geht there! Must absolutely have 4-whele drive and high clearance.

name: Black Hills NF
description: Nice spot in Black Hills National Forest. There were some cows. Not easy to find an other place in that region. Dirty road to get there.

name: Teton NF
description: Absolutely beautiful spot. Nice view on the Grand Tetons. Near to National Park. Fantastic sunrise. Fire pit there. Only for a small car or tent. There are other places for overnight on the road.

name: Teton NF 2
description: Overnight place in National Forest near to Grand Teton National Park. Firepit there.

name: Caribou-Targhee NF
description: Quiet Place in National Forest. Nothing special. Fire pit there.

name: Saddle Creek
description: Primitive Campground in Hells Canyon National Recreation Area. 8 sites with fire-pits and tables. Pit toilets. Fantastic view over Hells Canyon. Near to Hat Point Overlook.

name: Home Depot Parking
description:
We went there after know Walmart doesn't allow to spent night anymore. We stay 2 nights there without any trouble. There was other . The Burger King in the parking lot was nice RVs. Closer places to eat, a Walmart and a gas station. Free wifi available at some moments. 

see comnent: not sure if possible to camp here.

name: Okanogan-Wenatchee NF
description: Nice spot with lot of space. There are also other spots on this NF-Road. Big Fire-Pits there. Near to Mt. Rainier NP.

name: Gifford Pinchot NF
description: Spot near to Lava Canyon and Ape Cave. In National Forest. Not a special place but really quiet.

name: Mt Hood NF
description: Nice view on Mt Hood. Lot of yellow-jackets when we where there. Big fire-pit.

name: Ochoco NF
description: Nice and quiet spot in National Forest near to Painted Hills. Lot of space on a gravel lot. Not really beautiful but for 1 night ok.

name: Deschutes NF
description: Only 10-15 minutes from Bend. Near to Tumalo Falls Trailhead. Dirty Road to get there. On Phil's extensive bike trail system get a map from a bike shop in town and have a great time!

name: Deschutes NF 2
description: Steep road to get there. Lot of cars drive on that road, but quiet after dark. There are also other spots on this road.

name: Deschutes NF 3
description: Not special beautiful place but near to Mt. Bachelor.

name: Top of the rock in Winema NF
description: Amazing! Site on top of the rocks with a 360 grade view. Fantastic sunset and sunrise. Just at the northern entrance to Crater Lake NP. To get on top of the rocks you need 4-wheele drive and hight clearance, but there are some of other sites there reachable with 2-whele drive. 5800 ft elevation.

name: Umpqua NF
description: Nothing special but quiet and near to Umpqua Hot Springs and Toketee Falls. Fire-Pit. Steep NF-Road to get there

name: Riverbend Motel Parking Slot at the river.
description: Of season in Helen, the Blue Ridge Mountains village with "a touch of Bavaria": the big additional parking slots are empty. We could stay for 3 $ the night. Quite and safe.

name: Hume Road
description: Nice and quiet place. Good view to mountains. Short and steep NF-Road to get there.

name: Seguoia NF
description: Nice Spot with space for up to 10 cars. It is more a group site. Several fire-pits.

name: Homestake Dry Camp
description: Spot near Race Track Playa. Road from North is bad! To reach this spot from Race Track Playa you need w-wheele drive and high clearence. Fantastic view over the valley. Absolutely quiet. Below there are more sites and also a pit toilet. It can be windy out here.

name: Greenwater Valley
description: Place near Dantes View. Not special beautiful but ok for one night. There are also possibilities uphill but it was windy when we were there.

name: Lake Mead
description: Nice place at lake mead with beautiful view. There are hundreds of possibilities to camp there for free. Chose your preferred spot!

name: Dixie NF
description: There are several designated campsites on that road. Camp only there, but it is free! Fire pits there.

name: Kolob Road
description: There are lot of places to be down at the river (east side of the road). If you want like to be alone come here. This site is up in a little canyon with amazing colors. You need a 4-wheel drive and high clearance to reach this spot.

name: Kanab BLM
description: Overnight place just 10 minutes from wave-lotterie. Not special but ok for one night. It's on BLM-Land.

name: GSENM Cottonwood Road
description: Spectacular view on cliffs. Lot of colors! Some traffic during the day on cottonwood road but quiet at night. fire-pit there. Permit for overnight in GSEMN required.

name: GSENM Dry Creek
description: Near to Highway. Good for one night if you are late. You must cross a little creek to get there. 4-wheel drive and high clearance required. Permit for overnight in GSENM required.

name: GSENM Hole in the Rock Road
description: Amazing spot between rocks and plants. Spectacular view. There is a fire pit. Enough space vor 3-4 cars. Hole in the Rock road ist dirty on the last few miles! Permit vor overnight in GSENM required.

name: The Box Canyon
description: Great sites in the Box Canyon National Forest, access via HEY 60 west, take left at the sign. Our site was on a flat spot with fire rings, near the end of the dirt road where the trailhead to the canyon starts. More sites further but the trail is very rough and require high clearance 4WD and preferably with a second vehicle.

name: Cedar Mesa
description: FREE! It is a campground in Capitol Reef NP and it is for free! Only 6 sites available. No water and electricity. Pittoilet. Fire Rings.

name: Wild Horse Rd
description: Fantastic view! There are several spots for overnight. Near to Goblin State Park and Wild Horse Canyon (Slot Canyon). The environment is amazing.

name: Salt Valley Road/ BLM 145
description: Overnight place near to Arches NP. There are dozens of possibilities on this road. Ranger says anywhere in BLM that you can find a safe pull off is OK to stay at. After dark, no traffic at all. Just be sure to bring water and leave no trace. And enjoy the stars. :)

name: Island in the Sky Road BLM
description: Nice spot behind rocks. Near to Island in the Sky Canyonlands NP. Dirty road to get there. 4-wheele drive and high clearance needed do not attempt with a travel trailer or RV as the road is horrible and no way to turn around.

name: Hart Point Road
description: There are several overnight spots on that road. Can be windy on the hills. This site has fire pit and space for 2-3 cars. Near to Needles Canyonlands NP.

name: Valley of the Gods Road
description: Fantastic view in valley of the gods. Nice sunset and sunrise. There are several spots on that side road. Fire rings  are there.

name: Seaman Canyon Road
description: Nice place and quiet. Great view of the canyon. Near to wave lotterie in Kanab. Fire ring there. Plenty of space for multiple tents or vehicles. Ground is gravel but not nearly enough to get stuck. Site should be accessible in most weather conditions. Not suitable for big rigs or long trailers. I managed an SUV + 16ft motorcycle trailer with room to spare.

name: Pine Tree Road
description: Nice place between red rocks. Sandy surface. Fire ring is there.

name: Prescott NF
description: Nothing special but ok for one night. Some noise at night from Highway. Fire rings there.

name: Pull out on the road
description:
Is a large pull out on the highway 1 with a very nice view on the ocean and beautiful sunset. Is pretty quiet at night. Nobody  bothered us. 

Can fit about 6-7 rvs

name: water spring
description: water spring on side of road with free water

name: Precision Performance
description: Perfect mechanic in Las Vegas. Specially Toyota and Lexus.

name: takhlakh lake campground
description:
Beautiful forest service campground with bathrooms, picnic tables and fire rings. We were here in November and it was free and we were alone, I think it's free all the time. Good lake fishing, beautiful views of glaciated mt. Adams reflecting from lake, one of our favorite spots in the states we've been to yet. 

There may be about 5 miles of well maintained gravel to go through to get here.

name: Welcome Center Colorado, Fruita
description: Dump Station & potable Water next to the Welcome Center Fruita

name: Blackridge Road Colorado
description: A small place next to the radio tower entrance with a great view over the Colorado National Monument Area.

name: greenvalley campground
description: A reasonably priced, rv park. $25 for full hook ups. Friendly owners.

name: Cottonwood
description:
Great campsite, some sites have great views. 
You pay $ 14.00 a day, half with USA senior pass. 
October first they close down most of the bathrooms and some of the sites, reducing the price too $ 7.00 a night.

name: Emerald Forest Cabins, RV, and Tent Camping
description: large rv park that has rv, tent and pop up sites. has laundry and nice showers.

name: Behind the gas station
description: Truck parking very quiet.

name: Pactola Lake
description:
it is really nice place.
The staff are kind and helpful. 
Campsites are clean and equipped with fire rings and picnic tables.

name: Jamaica beach rv resort
description: Formal campground with all amenities including pool, hot tub & mini golf. Very big place. All big rig sites are pull through. $45.20/night.

name: Mono Lake Jeffrey Pine NFS
description: Gorgeous view on mono Lake and mountains. Wild - Can find the spot you pictured Sunny or not. USNFS. We have a 27 ft motorhome but we re used to drive on Sandy - gravel dirt roads.

name: Euclide en Santa Mónica
description:
FREE, we spent a Sunday night, it is an intersection of residential streets.


FREE, nosotros pasamos una noche de domingo, es una intersección de calles residenciales.

name: Lakehead Boat Basin
description: Full service campground at marina. Half mile from Canal Park. Ideal location for exploring Duluth on foot. $38.99 inc. all taxes and elec. Sounds expensive but hotels in summer on lake are $200. Good location value.

name: Hawthorn Bluff Campground
description: $20 with 30 amp, $16 without. Nice paved sites, some lakeside. Hot showers. Strong LTE signal, no wifi. Army Corp of Engineers site.

name: Wal-Mart
description: Standard Wal-Mart parking lot.  Tons of RVs here. Park in West parking lot (left side) or you’ll get a knock

name: Fern Canyon/Gold Beach Campsite
description: Excellent campsite, VERY expensive (35 for a tent). Near excellent trails and right on the beach. Beautiful location. Down a long bumpy steep dirt road, probably not possible in an RV. First come first serve (during off season only!), nearly full on a Friday in the off season... BUT there is a small lot in between the day use and camping lots which is spill over for both, in which, you might be able to get away with only paying for day use if you arrive late. Day use is covered by a Natl. Park Pass.

name: Bear River Casino
description: FREE camping for up to three nights in the parking lot of Bear River Casino. You have to fill out a form, but it's quite easy. They also give you $10 in free gambling money, if you're into that. Everything must be self contained but still a damned good deal. Parking lot is slightly sloped, but there are spots in the shade that are flat enough. Lights, cameras and security in the parking lot were nice.

name: Rec Area Beach Parking Lot
description: $40 overnight parking. Self registration across the street at the camp ground, bring cash. Right off the highway but it’s quiet at night. No amenities but they do have a clean bathroom (smells because it’s a pit). Amazing view, steps from the sand, worth it.

name: Vista Point
description: Beautiful Vista point with no signs specifically forbidding camping.

name: Horsethief Trailhead
description:
Just a gravel lot on USFS land. Quiet, free, and close to the Tecate crossing into Mexico. 

Saw it on another app and there aren't any "no camping" signs. 

There are some FS roads further up, but after a long day this lot looked just fine. 

(edit) Saw border patrol and Forest Service Rigs and nobody seemed to mind us camping here.

name: Mojave Road Camp
description: Just a fire ring off the Mojave Road. BLM.

name: North Rim Camp
description: Just a few miles from the North Rim of the Grand Canyon. Big spot with lots of wood and a nice fire ring on Forest Service land. Plenty of other free camping in the area.

name: Red Desert Hideaway
description:
Just another fire ring on BLM. We camped here on our way to the National Park and the Burr Trail. 

A nice, protected spot between some hills. Very quiet and we had a beautiful sunset. 

The road isn't bad, but does cross a wash. High clearance rigs recommended. 

Plenty of other BLM out here as well. Just ick a fire ring and enjoy!

name: Exit Spanish Fork To Arches
description:
It seems to be an abandoned camping. You take the exit from the highway to go to the state park but you continue in the road about 3/4 mile and there is an entrance. There is a creek and some wild places with fire

Comment: this is a fees place it s 20 dollars per night.

name: Saddlehorn Campground
description: Plenty of free sites. Only few sites are more or less level. 20$ per site. Loop C is primarily for tents, RVs longer than 20ft should stay in loops A and B.

name: Pope still hunt camp
description: Free campground in the National Forest. There were only two other campers on a Saturday. No facilities. Very quiet at night.

name: Garcia River Casino
description: It is permitted free camping at the casino park lot. You just have to get in and register with security. After registered you can also use the restrooms. We ordered dinner here with free soda. A big plate called Gigante Nacho serves 3 persons for 14 bucks and soda free. No ground tents here. only campers, vans, rigs or roof tent like us. The casino closes at 11 PM but has security all night. We were warned that there are wild animals and to not let pets loose outside.

name: Cabela's
description: RV’s welcome to overnight. Asked to park on lot closer to McDonalds, away from entrance.

name: La Sal Mountains - nice view
description: Parking lot trailhead - with a great view over the Mesa. There are other possibilities in the forest around, especially during summer.

name: Beef Basin Road - Top View
description: A nice Place with a firering and a really beautiful view over the mountains

name: Natural Bridge National Monument Campground
description: The Campground in the NM is for free and has 15 nice places under trees with picnic tables & fire rings. Water is available at the Visitor Center. It is a nice place to explore the NM.

name: paradise casino yuma arizona, $10/night
description:
next to parking lot is a dirt parking for rv and van. no tent parking

THIS IS NOT FREE ANYMORE. Horrible parking lot.

name: quechan casino
description:
The only good thing is it is cooler than other areas. 

I’ve stayed at a lot of casinos and this one is not worth paying for! And they and their sister casino, Paradise over in Yuma now charge $10/night, $25/3 nights, $50/7 nights. 

Lovely passive aggressive Notice/Violation at both casinos. Bad business and very unwelcoming.

name: Davis Bayou State Park
description: Davis Bayou Campground is located east of downtown Ocean Springs, Mississippi, and is a part of Gulf Islands National Seashore. Visitors enjoy the campground for its easy access to boating, fishing, biking and hiking trails. 22$ for a night

name: Courthouse Rock
description: Primitive camping/pull-offs on dirt road. May want 4wd depending how far back you go.

name: South Mineral, Silverton, Colorado
description: South Mineral Campground, located along South Mineral Creek, is one of the most popular campgrounds in the San Juan National Forest. The campground has 26 sites, all of which are first-come, first-serve.  Most campsites are shaded and well-spaced thanks to spruce and fir trees. Some sites are handicapped accessible.  Some sites have large parking areas.

name: Twinkle Toes
description: Wild dispersed camping in the forest. nice spot but a high clearance 4WE vehicle needed.

name: walmart
description: it is good for one night, lots of rvs parked for the night

name: Twin Lakes Free Camp
description:
Stay was good, I stayed away from the crowds and stayed at one of the trailheads there - 2 other cars but both I guess stayed on the trail all night. Gorgeous views, great atmosphere, good place to bring our promaster.

The Forest Service is closing down camping and driving near the water and in areas that are flooded-which is illegal. The water is used for drinking, but it is getting polluted. Also, many bad actors have been driving over and destroying vegetation and small trees and destroying closures. Overuse and abuse are destroying this area. Expect more closures and restrictions as a result of this destruction. I.O. is contributing to the problem !

name: Twin Lakes
description: $23-24 usd per night, busy on weekends in summer. Fire pits, clean pit toilets, fishing access to lake. Reservations available online.  recreation.gov.   Cell service.

name: Pike National Forrest
description: Dirt roads leading from Bailey to Jefferson with plenty of separate pull offs with fire pits and beautiful scenery. The camp spots do get busy on summer weekends and during hunting season (fall).

name: Havasu - BLM
description: Lot of nice place to stay in this Valley. Great fire pits and accessible for all sized rigs.

name: Near Williams off I40
description: A few camp spots, this one has a large fire rings. Quiet and secluded in a pine forest a few miles off I40. A bit noisy due to nearby interstate.

name: Death Valley on Cottonwood Canyon
description: Awesome camp site on Trail Canyon. We were the only campers around for miles of emptiness. Free dispersed camping in NP if you pay the entrance fee or have an annual pass. See map for allowed dispersed camping, available at Visitor centre.

name: Death Valley NP Cottonwood Canyon
description: Good spots with great vista of the valley on the trail to cottonwood canyon about 15 minutes from the canyon entrance. Quiet and secluded. Dispersed camping is only allowed after 8 miles past the start of the trail.

name: BLM Land East of Zion NP
description: Several spots, some soft sand. Free. Just off Hwy 89 near Mt. Carmel Junction along dirt road. No facilities. AT&T Full Bars

name: Fremont River South Shore
description: The other spot nearby is difficult to reach because of recent washouts. Turn off main hwy into Hartley road. This new spot has many sites near, the nicest is at the given coordinates. Right on the river, below large trees, nice and level, room for several vehicles. Probably only accessable when dry

name: Southern Section of Canyon of the Ancients NM
description: Off the main road through gate. 2 km private road then BLM land. Nice spot road a bit rough.

name: On Silver Cr. Canyon 5 m SE of Holbrook
description: Access from Hwy 180 into County Rd 180 4.5 m from Holbrook. Turn into small track  W after approx. 0.5 m. Several possible sites after approx. 0.5 m. We camped next to the canyon. High clearance vehicle recommended. 4x4 required if wet.

name: Upper Burnt Corral NF CG
description: Right on Apache Lake. Recreation permit required. Access via dirt road (Apache Trail)

name: Bog Springs NF CG
description: 13 sites, 10 USD, very nice setting, good hiking from desert to alpine, very good drinking water. Be early on weekends, quite popular

name: Arivaca Lake Southshore
description: Dispersed camping in Corona NF. About 8 km SE of Arivaca via gravel/dirt road. Several campsites next to parking or some small ones above the lake

name: Mojave Natl. Pre. - Sunrise Rock
description:
Dispersed camping. Near Teutonia Trailhead. Beautiful spot between rocks and Yoshua Trees. Several sites. You'll need some ground clearence to get to some sites. No large RV but trucks ok

Added....full size trucks or Sprinter type rigs can access this area easily.  I would recommend 4-wheel drive and good clearance, however.

name: Free parking lot near the US Naval Reservation
description: Small parking for cars or vans. Very quiet. Location requires extra stealth, so no RVs. The neighborhood can be loud on weekends, so plan to park, sleep, and leave early to avoid detection.

name: walmart
description: it is good for one night

name: Ottawa State Fishing Lake
description: If all you need is a cheap, safe overnight spot to camp, this place is great. Off the beaten path north of I70, it has picnic tables, fire pits, pit toilets and a pavilion. Free.

name: Water and Dump in Lees Ferry
description: Potable Water & Dump free even it says "for campground users only"

name: Cabela's
description: its good and free for one night. parking is next to a pond. Dump station $5.00

name: Feyodi Creek
description: it is beatifull! !! i love

name: Pit Camping
description: As described. Large BLM campsite. Still only $5/night. Toilets and trashcans on-site. Multiple SoCal college geology classes doing field studies had almost every site used.

name: South Coast Road Boondock
description: Remote primitive campsite just off the South Coast Road. Nestled in the oaks with a beautiful view towards the coast. There is enough room for a few rigs and several flat tent spaces. There are no facilities and no water. Pack out all that you pack in and keep this site beautiful for the next overlander.

name: Canyons of the Ancients
description: Canyons of the Ancients off MC BB. Great site a few hundred metres from Anasazi ruins. Fire ring, flat spot, great view. Very quiet, a few visitors were at the ruins during the day but all left before 18:00. From Cortez, drive north on 491, turn left at MC BB (MC roads are named A B C D, etc. BB comes after Z, then AA). Drive 6 miles on BB, turn left on 10. Drive for 11.3 miles then turn left into BLM  4531, a high clearance dirt road for about a mile, then you get to a small parking area. The camp site is just past the parking lot on BLM 4531. A few miles further is the Cutthroat ruins. Breathtaking! The road there is very rough and requires a high clearance 4x4.

name: Coconino National Forest
description: Lots of dispersed camp sites. Rough road, a bit of traffic during the day as this area is on the area where Jeep tours take tourists from Sedona but it gets quiet after 17:00. Sedona is only 8 miles away so get there early to find a quiet spot away from the dirt road. Breathtaking views of the sierras all around. Free. Take Time to visit the Two nearby ruins, it's worth it.

name: Joshua Tree NP Entrance (water management agency lands)
description: A few sites near the beginning of the dirt road. Most with fire rings. Highway is a few miles across so a bit noisy but it dies down between sunset and sunrise.  In range of LTE cell service.

name: Tolsona Wilderness Campground
description: USD 25,- for a tentsite on the creek, with table and firepit. Good wifi near the office reaching to some of the sites. Laundry and reasonable showers and toilets.

name: Wildcamp On BLM Land
description: Big enough for two or three cars. Just off highway 2. Larger vehicles will be able to turn and pull thru.

name: Walker Fork Bridge
description: Nice medium large campground. Free firewood and drinking water. Firepits and tables. USD 10,- per vehicle. New and very clean pit toilets.

name: West Branch State Park
description: Beautiful big campground with lake and boatramp. Many hiking trails. USD 26,- for a car/tent

name: rv Feyodi
description: it is a beatifull place.

name: Pine bluf regional park
description: its good for rv and Motorhome. for tend not, because no restroom. we pay $20

name: The Bike revolution
description:
This shop is bike, rental and fix.
a lot of bike gear.
experenced bke mechanick.

name: Larry & Penny Thompson Park Campground
description: Miami-Dade city camping ground.  Mostly seasonnal RVers but has a tent area ($17). no pets in tent area but allowed in RV sites ($34)  Office hours seam to follow regular employee city (close on holidays). Good free wifi-internet.

name: Cottonwood Narrows North Trailhead
description: A nice place with a fire ring. Good for hiking in the Cottonwood Narrows.

name: Bolivar Peninsula
description:
Boondocking on the beach. You need a 10$ annual Beach Parking Permit that you can buy at a few places in the area. We bought our permit at Basket Market in Winnie. Permit is valid for one year (Jan. 1st to Dec. 31)

2WD perfectly fine. Very buggy at night.
Decent service AT&T and Verizon.

name: Stowell County Park
description:
3 days overnight parking permit required, for free. Call Chamber County at 409-267-2644.

Big park with playground and some trees. There is water available and dump stations.

name: China Gardens
description: USFS undeveloped site off hwy178

name: KOA Astoria/Seaside
description:
Tentsite with shelter and electricity, wifi, showers, pool, hot tub, laundry.
On weekends and summer season resort fee is added.

name: Aguirre spring campground
description:
Nice camp ground tucked behind the "Organ" mountains east of Las Cruces New Mexico. $7.00 per night, pit toilets. 2-3 bars LTE reception with AT&T and Verizon.

Open year round. Winter hours they lock the gate from 8am-6pm. $7.Water station not working. Rangers there everyday - must pay. Well maintained

name: Manatee campground
description: Nice campground for less than 30$ with hookup. Tent sites have electrical.

name: Butler beach
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed DAY USE ONLY. 

NO a Dump Station, just WATER and BEACH SHOWER

name: Stewart's Point
description: Free camping at lake down shoreline road. Beautiful beyond belief. Pit toilets but very far from camping spots. Really quiet. 15 day stay limit. Pit toilets but no water or garbage bins.

name: North shore
description: Clean quiet, $20.00 to $27.00 depending on location, on the north shore of lake Bastrop north and east of Austin, TX.

name: Upper Rainy Creek
description: Few pull outs along Upper Rainy Creek Rd. Dirt road but not bad. Great views looking towards the Tetons.

name: Picnic área Texas 16
description: It's a developed picnic area between the road and the river. Not allowed the use of the facilities for more than 24 hrs. I overnight in the van one night. The Medina river is beautiful. Busy road though. Picnic tables and grills available.

name: Salinas near Monterrey
description:
Location indicated by the police who asked us to leave the Walmart of Salinas yet 24 hours a day. This place is a ground of rodeo. Calm. No other motorhome. Note the Walmart of Marina nearby is forbidden to the RV. Free.

revenu deux jours après... toujours aussi calme sans être dérangés.

name: Quinault Beach Resort and Casino
description:
This is a very nice place to overnight as you are right at the seashore. We are here in the offseason and camping is free. This is a back, side parking area which runs along the seashore about 1/4 mile from the resort. 
No services and campfires aren't allowed but you can walk into the casino for bathroom if you need. In regular season it's $10 for weeknight or $20 for fri/sat. 
Bonus: Sunday breakfast for under $3 in the casino.

name: Kelso Dunes
description: One of the oldest and most extensive dune fields in the West. Famous for their sound.

name: Craggy Wash Camp
description:
muddymiler@gmail.com
BLM free camping, no amenities. Good Verizon, 3 to 4 bars depending where you are. Lake Havasu City is a couple miles away.

name: meskwaki
description: Water tap at casino RV Park

name: BLM land near Canyonlands NP
description: Wild camp spot just outside Canyonlands NP ( Island in the Sky)

name: Overland The World's Home - will host Overlanders with advanced notice
description:
This is not a business, nor open to the public, but near this spot, is our home.  We are happy to host overlanders for short stays or parking in an enclosed yard. We can also help find repair shops or other logistic issues on your travels.

2020 Update: we recently moved into a home with a much larger private yard, separated from the main house. We are hoping to make an informal campground (with more amenities), in the future, and are asking for donations if you stay with us, with the intention of using all proceeds to improve the space for visitors. 

Please note that you must contact us on social media (Instagram or Facebook) with your details (people, pets, etc.) and during COVID we prefer if you are self-contained, as we do not have a restroom available. If we don't get back to you in time, maybe we can recommend some activities to do in the Scottsdale area; it is a great place. Cheers - Jeff & Monica

name: Grayton Beach State Park
description:
$24 + taxes electric+water in the second loop.  Bathhouse has washer -dryer ($2 each) but also laundraumat in "town" with more machines available and wifi (close on monday)

No night arrival without prior reservation.

name: Klean Wash
description:
Laundromat with big machines.  They have summer and winter hours.
http://easycoinwash.com/hours/

name: Cedar Street public beach access
description: nice and quiet parking for campers less than 21 feet.

name: Middle Fork Creek Rd
description: A small parking lot at the top of a 3 mile dirt road. Windy, very rough and not well maintained at all. High clearance definitely recommended. 4x4 maybe. With the purchase of a $5 adventure pass it is ok to stay overnight in the parking lot. We had the pass, but we're not convinced anyone would have come up to check, given the state of the road. A picnic table with a small clearing would've maybe been a decent spot to pitch a tent if needed. It serves as a trailhead parking lot, but you need a permit to hike there. Pit toilets that had seen very little use were very clean. The parking lot had next to no level areas to park, but we managed to find one right in front of the bathrooms. Beautiful views and definitely secluded.

name: Toad Springs Campground
description: Free established National Forest Campground with five spots. Not maintained at all and the road in, despite being very short, was very rutted out. Not recommended for larger rigs, but we did see a brave soul bring down a 30' rig and get it into the first spot in the campground with some effort. Spots not level.

name: Forest 525 Road
description:
2 Camping places a little further down the road: 
Fire pits and quiet on a weekday but very busy on Spring break and Summer season. Many spots were recently closed by rocks.

name: Montezuma Castle
description: Montezuma Castle National Monument

name: Sunset Point
description: Rest Area. Overnight parking permitted. No camping. Nice view.

name: Bear Mountain
description: Wild camping in Gila NF. Pine forest. Just off the dirt road, several pull offs. 2wd just fine. No clearance for Rvs. Very quiet, some shade from the pines. No amenities No water. Pack in pack out. Don't break glass everywhere.

name: Clearing Behind Pull Off
description: Pull off by road and there is a clearing by the river through a gap in the trees. Stone fire pit so it is regularly used and a pleasant view of mountains and right next to the river.

name: Walmart
description: Quiet parking of Walmart. Protected from the highway by commercial buildings.

name: Texans park and Campgroung
description:
This is a beautiful Campgroung near Edna, TX. 
I showed up late, called the phone number on the sign and the guy was happy to let me in after hours. It has terrific hot showers, it's on the LaVaca Navidad River Authority lake. A+

name: Norris Hot Springs "Water Of The Gods"
description: 13 spaces 9 with hookups. Established campground $32 with hookups 22 without. Includes discount to hot springs

name: Little Beaver State Park Campground
description: Far from the roads, a great campground with fast wifi, clean bathrooms, hot showers. 35-40$ a night

name: My. Pleasant/Charleston KOA
description: Great Camping grounds, clean bathrooms, hot showers and fast internet. For ~$70/night, it is way too expensive place....

name: Bayou Segnette State Park
description:
Big campground with well placed sites. Hot showers, so so internet, free washers & dryers. Lots of wild life around, including alligators, etc.
$30 a night & relatively easy access into NOLA

name: Frog City Rv Park
description: A rv park that is close to highway. Fast wifi, clean bathrooms, hot showers. Very loud road noise and packed like sardines sites. $34 for full hookups.

name: Borrego Springs - Red Star Laundry
description: Clean an top laundry. You dont have to stay on the RV Park.

name: Dixie 4 Wheel Drive
description:
They are really friendly and helpful. If you have your European filters - they maintain all 4 wheel vehicles.
We were really satisfied!

name: Gemini Bridges
description: Grand spot! This established free BLM campground has 5 sites clustered together at the bottom of a really beautiful red rock canyon, but there is a lot of privacy and you can't really see the other campers, beside most of the time there is nobody around. The campsites are flat with a rock fire ring. No facilities, pack your trash out and have portable toilet The trail from HWY 191 is not for the faint of heart and will require a high clearance vehicle and good off-road experience. A guy ahead of us in a Jeep Patriot had to turn around, which was quite harrowing considering the narrow trail and how steep the canyon is...My wife cursed at me throughout the entire ascent, our cat was terrified, I kept my calm but I must admit I had sweaty palms. Eventually the trail becomes manageable at the bottom of the canyon. It is quite an experience. Gemini Bridges are a few miles away and well worth the drive along relatively good dirt roads that would still require 4x4. We found out once we reached Gemini Bridges that you can get to the site via HWY 313, and the trail is much more civilized but not as "fun".

name: San Rafael Natural Area
description: Approx 13 miles from Patagonia, 6 miles on dirt road. Just off Patagonia/San Rafael Valley Rd. Not much traffic, quiet. A few adjacent sites along the road. The road crosses private properties so make sure you chose a site within the National Forest.

name: Whites City Carlsbad Caverns RV Park & campground
description: Camped here on nice open grassy area with a few trees. Vehicles with RTT can be accommodated in tent area. Toilets clean but with communal shower area and toilet door are plastic shower curtains. Plenty of hot water. Small facilities for potential number of campers. USD 20/night for RTT with 2 people dry camping. Shower $3 per shower.

name: à 20 km du lac Pillsbury
description:
Corner on a runway towards Pillsbury Lake to the left of the river from Lake Mendocino. Quiet. No signs of interdiction. There is a river nearby.


Recoin sur une piste en direction du lac Pillsbury à gauche de la rivière en venant du lac Mendocino. Tranquille. Pas de panneaux d'interdiction. Il y a une rivière tout près.

name: Palmetto Island State Park LA
description:
$18/night with electricity + water (add $6 for transaction fees). WiFi Nice sites
hot water showers +  toilettes  very clean (there is also washing drying machines and a "trade-a-book" shelf) bring quarters for laundry, change not available on site

name: South Llano River State Park
description: Beautiful camp ground with hot showers, clean bathrooms. No internet! Nice trails. $30 first day, $20 after with electric and water hookups.

name: Stoney Crest Plantation campground
description: it is a great place. they have a good price.

name: Turquoise Trail Campground and RV Park
description: Close to trails with hot water showers (closed now because COVID), and fast wifi. There are sites with full hookup, sites with no hookups and tent sites. $32 for only electric hookup/night.

name: Boxcar Cove Road
description: There are lots of places - choose your favorite one! Entrance fee is 20$, camp  is limited to 15 days and it's free at a certain spot. Some campsites require payment. Really beautiful views over the lake and to the mountains! Close to Las Vegas!

name: Sheep Bridge
description: Awesome boondock sites on Verde River with hot springs. Long dirt and rock road, 4WD not necessary but good tires a plus. Plenty of turnouts on the way for wild camping. Lots of off roaders out there on the weekend. Have fun and LEAVE NO TRACE!

name: Gunsite wash - BLM Camping
description: Huge area. No facilities. Free. May stay for 14 days.

name: Maytag Laundromat
description: Clean laundromat and friendly staff near Tucson

name: Silver City Visitor Center
description: Gives excellent information and very friendly.

name: Upper Scorpion Campground
description:
Nice, free campground. Walking distance to Gila Cliff Dwellings. 
Tables and fire rings - but all are walk to sites for tents. We parked on the edge of the parking lot (slight slope) adjacent to the grass. Nice view. Quiet.

name: Lower Scorpion Campground
description: Small campground. Free.

name: Gila Cliff Dwellings National Monument
description: Amazing place to see how people built structures inside Cliff Dweller Canyon's natural cave.

name: Gila Hot Springs Campground
description: Nice place to relax in a hot tub. Campground (hot tub included) 10 $ per person. Day use of hot tub 7 $ per person.

name: Flying J
description: Free overnight stay.  Park by the Denny's side.

name: Visitor Center White Sands National Monument
description: Beautiful Adobe building. Has an excellent museum. Restrooms and drinking water, sales (t-shirts, books, staff medallians, patches, etc). Entrance to dunes is further up the road and it will blow your mind.

name: Keller Bay
description:
At the end of the road, near boat ramp.
municipal park camping allowed up to 5 days. no washroom keep off grass 
many fishermen.

name: Grand Canyon Mather Campground
description: Nice campground in forest. $18/night. No internet.  Verizon 3 bars

name: Walmart
description: it is good for 1 night

name: route 281 rest area
description: one RV park here will we were there.  restroom where close

name: Honey Hill Recreation Area
description:
Beautiful mostly undeveloped camping in the Marion Forest. 
Fire rings and pit toilet, several concrete picnic tables. No other services. Very Quiet. Hiking opportunities right from camp. Camp accommodate large RVs and trailers.
Nearest potable water, 8 miles south (Turn right on highway 17, 1/3 mile on left just before fire station).

name: Walmart camping
description:
We spent 3 nights sleeping in Walmart in New Jersey and took the bus that stops there to New York. No problems. Quiet at night.
Wifi and bathrooms inside the supermarket

name: Brookings en Oregon
description:
Garage specializing in transmission. Nice boss. Correct prices. Sleeped on site with water, electricity and w.c.
---
Garage spécialisé en transmission. Patron sympa. Prix corrects.  Dormi sur place avec eau électricité et w.c.

name: motohank motorcycle workshop
description:
Hank is an old traveller and has been working on BMW's for many years. He is a one of a kind mechanic and knows his stuff
He also sells tires and Touratech goodies. Can help with other brands.

name: Tahoe National Forest
description:
Little dirt road off Highway 89 leading to this beautiful little campspot in Tahoe National Forest. 
There are two National Forest campgrounds within a couple of miles, both were closed for the season. This might also be a free alternative in summer.

name: O'Neil Regional campground
description:
Moderator note: 2/9/2021. Campground is open. Please visit the website for more details. If you like to call in for campground information and availability, here's the contact # (949) 923-2260 or (949) 923-2256

-------------------


County campground in middle on Trabuco oak Lots of trail and bike trails
90 spaces Ranger on site
near famous Cook corner . there a country store and steak house walking distance. great place to unwind

name: Former mining camp on the way to Death Valley
description: An old trailer park for a mining operation with concrete slabs and lots of space. It is situated between Death Valley Junction and Death Valley and good for park access. No cell coverage.

name: Saline Valley Road
description: It is a nice place with a view to the mountains around you. The place is great especially when you are too late in the evening. It is half the way to the "warm springs". There are fire rings and it is totally quiet.

name: Navarro mechanic
description: Pedro the owner helped us replacing the water pump. Decent guy. He let us stay at his entrance and gave electricity. Higly recommended.

name: Lake Dorr
description:
Nice wild camping in the Ocala National Forest with the Door Lake besides.

Admin note: user reports location inaccessible. 4x4 high-clearance required.  

Visitor note: follow the arrows on the tree if coming from the south. You can't cross where Google says to go.

name: Rockhound State Park
description: 14$ with water and electricity, 10$ without. Very nice and clean park. Clean restrooms with hot shower. And just about the most beautiful view I have ever seen. Fantastic place. Only bad thing: It also has the most AGGRESSIVE flies at daytime I have ever seen...almost glad I only spent one night on my way through. Except for that, highly recommended.

name: Pima County Fairgrounds
description: Not much of a deal for $30/night with currently-closed showers and restrooms (covid?), I suppose it depends on your expectations. No shade or tables but it does have laundry. We travel in a van and were simply seeking a site with a 15-amp plug. The sites have full hookups.

name: Ocala boondock
description: Free site set back from side road, plenty of wood

name: Forks Area Trail System (FATS) Trailhead
description:
You can also camp on the forest dirt roads behind this lot, part of the Sumter National Forest. 

Main parking area may be inaccessible (gated) if trails are officially closed due to weather.

name: Scaddan Wash
description: 14 days area. No restrooms or any facilities. But gas stations close by. It's a BLM campground. Huge area. So away from I 10 it's quiet. Access bia Dome Rock Road East.

name: Trail Canyon - Death Valley NP
description:
Little spot on Trail Canyon Road just off West Side Road near Badwater Basin. Very nice view of the valley.
The West Side Road was washboard when we were there and the further up you go on Trail Canyon the more high clearance is necessary due to big rocks. There were several nice spots to camp on the way up, some of them were already taken. 

It's officially allowed to camp on any of the Canyons off West Side Road, you just have to be 1 mile away from the West Side Road.

name: Showers at Furnace Creek Ranch
description:
For 5$ (now 14$!) you are allowed to use the pool area, including hot showers and a recreation area with tennis and basketball. 
The pass is valid for a whole day from 8am till 11pm.

name: Buff Creek Dispersed Camping
description: All along 550 there are dispersed sites for tents, vans or truck campers. Excellent access to hiking and biking trails.

name: Ben Tyler Trail/Colorado Trail Dispersed
description: A few nice spots that look out over the valley for a small RV, truck, van or tents. Access to the Ben Tyler trail and Colorado trail in the Lost Creek Wilderness. A bit of a bumpy road in. Not recommended for low clearance.

name: Temple Canyon Dispersed
description: There are several pull out spots along the road here. Two more established areas with picnic tables and sun shades. Access to hiking trails in the canyon. The road in from the East is not bad, but after heavy rains a river crossing on the West end can be flooded.

name: RovnTechs free Land Rover Mechanic
description: The best Land Rover Mechanics in the World. I had problems with both differentials and I was allowed to repair with their help. Friendly with great knowledge.

name: Buffalo Valley Road
description: A big pullout near the Buffalo Valley Road with a very nice view into the valley. In the night a quiet road.

name: Gunnison, Hartman Rocks
description: On BLM ground. The road in is dirt. This area is a playground for the activ outdoorsman. There's free, dispersed camping scattered about. There are trails for everyone, hikers, bicyclist, motorcyclist, horseback and crosscountry skiers. The only facilitates are at the main entrance. There you'll find a vault toilet, trash cans, recycling, picnic tables, a pavillion and a hand water pump. Camping is not allowed there. Take your own trash with you when you leave. Coordinates entrance-road: N38.5058º, W106.9406º

name: Dixie Forest, Free Camping
description: In open field, dispersed camping. We've seen a lot of deer.

name: Veterans Memorial Park Water & Dump free
