description: Next to the Campground directly at the public restrooms located you can find water for free and a dump station | dump station is $12

name: Jalama
description: Very nice remote camping, especially if you are into surfing or kiteboarding. Price 25 USD without hookup, but well worth the money. Beautiful beach walks.

name: Forest Finney Lake Campground
description: Small lake with dispersed camping around the unpaved road. if the roads are wet it will be difficult to navigate. close to the Salton Sea and Slab City, we spent a very comfortable night here. No pit toilet.

name: Pismo State Beach Park. Oceano
description: Well kept campground. Clean bathrooms, hot showers with token, no internet. $25/night with no hookups. Drinking water available.

name: Wolf Autorepair
description:
european vehicle repair shop. The owner is a very friendly german.

4300 North Pecos #10
Las Vegas, Nevada 89115
http://www.wolfautorepair.com

name: Olympic NF Hoh river
description: Nice small place in the forest not far from Hoh river and Olympic NP.  Free.

name: Pullout on rt71
description: Just a big sand turnaround on the south side of 71 about a couple of miles from 93.

name: Pahranagat NWR Campground
description:
14 Sites some with tables, firering, grill. Trash container at the entrance. Well maintenance and clean!!!  The spots fill up quickly and there were a ton of bugs so be prepared for this. The camp spots were clean and tidy. Great views of the lake. There are fire pits and grills so bring wood or charcoal. Lots of road noise though.
Nice hiking trails. Host on duty. 
FREE

name: Near Temple of the sun
description: About 1 mile from the temple of the Sun and temple of the moon. Just outside the Capitol Reef national park. Very beautiful campspot - you can actually see the tip of the temple of the sun. Next to a small river (dry when we were there), fire pit and pretty leveled.

name: Forest 525 Rd
description: Great boondocking spot. There are tons of boondocking places along 525. If someone is in one keep driving to find another. The further north you go the better the views of the red rocks.

name: seligman truck and auto  Seligman Arizona (south of town, off route 66)
description:
1st class garage who undertake all kinds of mechanical work including European vehicles,4x4's and tyre repairs
even has level parking if you need to overnight.
John,Curt and Dave couldnt be more helpful and friendly,at times even funny.
All garages should be like this.
thanks mate.

name: I 75 Rest Area
description: Highway Rest Area, Safe, Well lit, roomy, super clean and fresh water spigot located by the last pavilion on the north side of the parking area.

name: Water Canyon / Cibola National Forest Campground
description:
Take the road to the Magdalena  Ridge Observatory, where the  asphalt  ends turn right on dirt road to campground. Road is steep and partially washed out in places. High clearance recommended. 
Quiet spot, we are alone here.

name: El Morro National Monument Campground
description:
El Morro National Monument operates a nine-site campground year-round. Each site has a graveled tent pad, picnic table and ground grill for fires. During the warmer months, water is available in spigots.  You are not allowed to fill up your RV at this site.  Once the overnight low's begin to reach freezing temperatures, water is turned off for the season. There are no hookups for RVs. The length limit on all motor homes is 27 feet overall. One site, #5, is handicapped accessible.

Sites are available by self-registration on a first-come, first-served basis (reservations not accepted). The campground occasionally fills-up on weekends from May through September. El Morro National Monument no longer collects camping fees. Campsites are fee free. The site is regularly patrolled by NPS Police.   The closest town is Grant NM.  

Fires are permitted in provided grills only. Please comply with any seasonal fire restrictions. Collection of firewood within the monument is prohibited, so bring firewood with you if you intend to have a campfire.

name: Bisti BLM parking
description:
Gravel lot    Bisti Badlands parking lot. Free, very quiet except for the cyotes! 
Lots of great badlands formations.

name: N portero rd, next Malibu NRA
description: After the bridge drive Below Portero road  and park Above the creek. Less noisy than pacific coast turn out.

name: Metro Park and Rise Station Car park
description: Park and ride lot. A piece of the parking lot accepted 72 hours max, better to find a spot  after 6 pm. Park inside the lines. A few spots where  Big rigs 28ft max can park with the back above dirt areas. Very Close from red line metro rail station.

name: S San Diego - Léon Av - 3 mi from border
description:
Dégagement  plat en terre le long de la route.
Flat- Ok for one night.

name: Stone Mountain Georgia
description: 3,200 acres of green and nice Lake views all in the middle of Atlanta area. $20 park entrance fee. 50 primitive campsites and 200 RV sites plus another 150 partial hookups. May need reservations during peak season. Book online at www.stonemountainpark.com

name: Lone Pine Campground
description: Beautiful area! In winter no fee. Don't know about other times. There is a water tap. But not usable in winter.

name: Film Museum
description: Museum of Western Film History of the Alabama Hills and Lone Pine. Fee 5 $.

name: Coastguard Pier - Warm Showers
description:
Open and working! Súper accesible, really. Just come and park (25c / each 10 minutes, just like in town). Simple toilet with one WC and one shower. WARM! 50c each 3 minutes. Just a simple curtain separating from the restroom. All good, clean enough and easy to use.

Coin operated. 50 c for 3 minutes.              .

name: Rest area/Visitor center
description: Dump station located in rear. Also had designated pet area for walking

name: Texas Spring Camping \ NP Camping Furnace Creek
description: Smaller and much nicer campsite than the big one at the road. Tables and fire pits. Showers only at the Ranch (Fee). Separate loop for tents and RVs. No generators! Quite.

name: RV camp
description:
$21 per night for tent. İt is not best place to camp but if you cant find anything they will let you use a RV place for tent

Not much privacy. but amazing location and super friendly everyone! 65 a night w tax full hookups. within walking distance to the little town and .03 miles to rent affordable scooters. I wanna stay here longer but spendy! short walk to Ocean that u can drive on. wild baby deer will eat from your hands here. 5 stars

name: Apache NF lookout
description: "White Mountain Wildlife Area". It was very quiet. We were the only ones there. Dry camping, but free, clean and absolutely beautiful.

name: Red Rock Canyon State Park Camping
description: Beautifull and scenic place. Unfortunatly they want 25$ per night.

name: Scenic view point
description: Paved parking lot for visitors wanting to take a short trail. There are no signs that prohibit parking overnight. When we stopped here, we we're delaying travels north to Grand Canyon, because of severe weather warnings (mayor snow storm). We had already parked nearby on one of many boondock sites across the road (FR 525), but since it was raining non stop, all those sites were thick mud pits. The road is visible from here, but it's quiet enough. On the upper section of the loop, there is a small patch of level gravel that fit our 31' RV. Was warmer than parking straight on the tar.

name: Goumaz CG
description:
Free campsite (with pit bathroom) next to a creek. Dirt road to get there. Six sites. Fire pits at sites. Cellular 2 miles up dntrance road. Bears in the area.
https://goo.gl/maps/rvLwmto2xS52

name: Gas station Parking
description: Estacionamente at Chevron for trucks, with parking for cars on the right hand side. We were forced off the road by weather. The wind might get seriously aggressive at this parking. Should that happen, just drive past the big roundabout to the shops located near the Chevron. There is some shelter to be found behind them on dirt rather than tar.  Good for emergencies.

name: Comb Wash
description: Shady site in afternoon on. Great scenery. Dirt road in good shape. Small 25' rigs can pull in at first entrance, Class A or towable should probably back in at second entrance. Or go past and turnaround and come back. Another review mentioned pit toilets at the site right before this site.

name: Ironwood Forest BLM Free camping
description:
not the exact coordinates but there are several large pulloffs along this part  of the road.  some of them even have fire rings of stones.  Nice quiet place to stay in the desert.  can get a bit cool at night.  Nice view of Ragged Top and crazy stars at night.  Silverlbell road is washboard and Red Rock Lane was officially closed (but we snuck our vehicle through)

warning! roads can get flooded when there is rain

also if you have pets watch out for cactus needles they are everywhere, we had to pluck a couple dozen off our dog..  Zverizon gets 1 bar, AT&T is weak but can get signal with booster.

name: Spider Rock
description: Spider Rock lookout is 100m from here. Large parking for all size vehicle, small track to walk out and see the STUNNING vista, with the Spider Rock monument. We were here in winter, it was snowing and absolutely magical. The roads are kept clear to drive with ease.

name: Oxbow State Wildlife Area
description: Free camping near I-50. Gravel lot with room for 5-6 rigs. Walking distance to Arkansas River. Quiet. Safe. ATT cell signal!  Seasonal closures from the last day of spring to Aug 15 each year.

name: Old boat launch on Reservoir
description: Corps of Engineers site. Boat ramp closed. Vault toilet. Trash cans. Lot big enough for 5-6 rigs. Quiet. Safe. Scenic view of water. Good for one night and free as long as you have a fishing or hunting license!

name: First Landing State Park
description: On the north shore of Virginia Beach. Excellent facilities and tent as well as RV sites. Beach is also wonderful and not very crowded

name: Maumee Bay State Park
description: Great place. For RV and Tents. Great biking, laundry facilities and close to Toledo and Detroit as well as Windsor Canada

name: Ohiopyle State Park
description: As described. Standard state park campground with bathrooms, showers, etc. 30$ for a non-electric site, closer to 40$ for a site w electricity during peak season

name: James Island County Park
description: Excellent county park minutes from downtown Charleston South Carolina. Full of all kinds of amenities.

name: Quiet Waters
description: County Park that has tent structures already on each site. Water and electricity also at each site. 4 miles from beach. This campground is NOT FREE!  This is not an rv park.

name: Koreshan State Park
description: Excellent location close to wonderful beaches in and around Ft Myers. Bathrooms are closer to RV site than tent sites

name: Hasty Campground at John Martin Reservoir
description: Camping in Lake Hasty Campground and Point Campground require a reservation as well as a park pass. Fees vary

name: Wabash And Erie Canal
description: Small campground located in Wabash & Erie Canal Park. Camping fees updated *2020: Full hookup (30/50 amp)-$30. Water/electric (30/50 amp)-$25. Electric only (10 amp)-$15. Free showers and dump. Nice town with restored opera house, restaurants, grocery and laundromat.

name: Grassy point bayside campground
description:
Florida Fish and Wildlife
Conservation Commission
Free with online reservation.
Very nice and by the beach
Dirt road

name: Pawnee Rock State Park
description: See picture of gate. Doubtful it's enforced or maintained.

name: Hillsboro Cove
description: BIG campground by the lake. Trees and scenic. Fire rings and shade. See picture for rules and fees. Deserted and free in winter, good spot to boondock for a night or even a few days!

name: Pershing State Park Campground
description: Nice, big Campground lots of trees. Good amenities. Showers. Water. Toilets. Pay Campground $, deserted in winter....

name: FREE Carrizo Plain NM Campground "KCL"
description: One of two free campgrounds in the NM. 7 big sites for cars and additional tent sites. In the Park are some trails (e.g. Painted Rock), nice landscape, nature and you can "hear the quite". Bring all water (and other things) you will need. Next town\services 50 min away. No Dumping.

name: FREE Carrizo Plain National Monument Campground "Selby"
description: One of two free campgrounds in the NM. More information: pls see KCL campground. This site is 5 miles away from the main road in the hills.

name: CA1 Turn off near Ragged Point
description: Nestled within trees, this spot is safe and quiet. This pullout is for free, has a wonderfull view and space for 4-5 camper.

name: Shell truck stop
description: Boondock in the far back parking lot. Good for a nights rest!

name: State Trailer RV & Outdoor Supply
description: The EVERYTHING Store!!  This business offers free dump station. Reasonable propane fills. And a huge, organized supply store for everything you need for your rig! Water systems, light systems, mechanical, they have everything. Possibly even overnight parking- as there are a few rigs here tonight.

name: Action Shop Services
description: Propane refill for RV. Great staff and service.  $2,60 per gallon.

name: Walmart
description: Parked at the Walmart for 3 days (too much) in winter, the RV campgrounds are all knee high under snow. We were fine, but no facilities (obviously), including no wifi. Our friend, a Heber City resident, said that the Chase Bank (near the Walmart) also allows overnight stays for self-contained rigs.

name: Stoddard Wells OHV Area
description: Very large dirt lot right off the interstate just outside of Barstow. A few big rigs scattered throughout the lot, but there's plenty space so it's easy to find a semi-secluded spot. This place is perfect for an overnight stop if you're passing through. It's quiet and dark enough. There are no facilities, but it's a comfortable place to stop for the night.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart 24 hours. A lot of restaurants near.

name: The Junction Restaurant
description:
Large flat carpark adjacent to the restaurant where overnighting is permitted,  but ask first. If eat in the restaurant,  could use the toilet while open.  Good menu with range of prices.
Open wifi from restaurant across the road if you have a decent antenna. 
Note,  area is used by trucks,  but if you park against the bank where we we parked,  they will be clear of you. Don't block the access around the end of the building.

name: Texaco
description: Texaco gas station has dump facilities, with potable water. Purchase fuel, then use facilities for free. Otherwise it's $5 to get the key. Large space, suitable for big rigs.

name: Russel Lakes Wildlife Refuge
description:
Bird sanctuary with info and walks with large gravelled parking area 100m off the highway where overnighting in the parking area is permitted. Toilets available and garbage bins. 

Just as you drive out the entrance there was a running water pipe just next to a large tree. Water quality unknown and may not be running in summer.

name: Anastasia State Park
description:
A Florida state park with Large clean campsites and beach access within walking distance.  Listen to ocean all
Night. Flush toilets and hot showers are bonus.

name: Lake Manatee State Park
description: Nice location near Sarasota Florida. Half hour from beaches, very reasonable price and nice facilities.

name: Lake Kissimmee State Park
description: 6000 acres of pastoral view for both tent and RV campers

name: Morse Creek
description: Free spots in the forest.

name: Blue Lake Road
description:
Quiet spot in the forest.
Found this place on freecampsites.net.
There were also other people with tents there when we came.

Comment: the road is quite steep so didn't make it with our packed campervan 2wheel drive. Maybe not recommended on wet days.

name: Hood River Dump Station
description:
Dump Station and potable water (free).
Non-Potable water at the dump station, and potable water at a tap forward of the dump station.

name: Clark Creek
description:
Some quiet, free spots in the forest.     
Entrance to this place is from Highway 35

name: Cyrus Horse Camp
description: Free campground with tables and fire places. Also fences for horses, you can bring your horse there if you want.

name: Parking at creek outside Bend
description: Small parking where other people camp too.

name: Humbug Mountain State Park (Dump Station)
description:
Dump Station and potable water. free.

It's also a campground next to it:
-22$ with electricity
-17$ without electricity
-2$ only shower

If you like hiking, next to it is the Humbug Mountain Trail. Very nice forest and nice view. 5km, 600m height difference.

name: Horse Ridge Lookout
description: Many free spots at this road in the forest. Nice view on lake.

name: Tavertine Hot Springs
description:
NO OVERNIGHT CAMPING! Day use only!
______
Free Hot Springs
One pool at the parking, 4 pools around 100m behind the toilet.
______
A user reported on 20-9-2018: There is no camping allowed at the hot springs. I have been going there for years and as the number of people visit and camp in or around the parking lot, the BLM and law enforcement take notice. The only camping near the hot springs that is allowed, is about 1/2 mile before you get to the parking lot. There are numerous signs posted saying no camping and visitors say it’s allowed because they read it on this site. Don’t get me wrong, I love your site! This place is in danger of being closed due to people illegally camping and leaving a lot of trash. Please post for people to obey the posted signs, so this place can be enjoyed by everyone, especially us who live nearby, and those that visit from around the world! This info can be verified by the adept of the Interior office located in Bishop, CA!

name: Bridgeport / Travertine Hot Spring
description:
Free spot, close to the Tavertine Hot Springs. To make a fire you can get a permission at the ranger station. 

If you need Wifi, go to the Library in Bridgeport (open and very fast). And if you need water, very close to the Library, there is a sport field with a water tap (potable).
The food and petrol is very expensive in Bridgeport. 1 Gallon Diesel for 4$.

name: Bodie Ghost Town
description:
Interesting ghost town from gold rush.
8$ pP
Opening hours:
Summer hours 9am-6pm (18.March - 31.October)
Winter hours 9am-4pm (1.November - 17.March)

name: Spangler Hills
description: Free spots, no facilities.  Near busy highway. Good place to get some rest.

name: Palm Canyon Road
description: Boondocking sites along Palm Canyon Road in the Kofa National Wildlife Refuge. Lots of flat places, easy access, beautiful scenery. Free. Only 20-30 minutes from Quartzsite and good for 2WD and large RV's. Make sure to hike the 1 mile trail to Palm Canyon, go mid-day for the best sunlight to see the palms and climb up and around them. Great place!

name: Ray Frey Auto Center
description:
fast and helpful mechanic.
reasonable price (100$ per hour of work).
explained everything before doing it.

name: Parking Lot
description: Large Lot across from Chevron and Ludlow Cafe. A big parking lot not so far from highway 40 but quiet enough to spend the night if you have to stop here. It's better to wake up early because of the trucks that are starting (+-7h. )No amenities but a coffee and a gas station nearby.

name: Big Biloxi National Forest Campground
description: 20/ night, nice spacious sites for tent/rv. Clean bathrooms w free hot shower. Water and electric at sites included free. Stayed several nights, really enjoyed. Check out Biloxi schooners sailing trips and desportes seafood (delicious, cheap)  in Biloxi if you're in the area!

name: Hi Jolly
description: Free with many other campers (snowbirds). But in the whole area free spots everywhere.

name: Flying J Gas station
description:
Big parking for trucks beside the highway 15.A little bit noisy but perfect for a night.
Payed shower,clean toilets and laundry inside the store (everything is planned for truck drivers).Denny's restaurant.Free.

name: Walmart
description: Overnight parking autorized!Quiet place for a night! Not a 24h but no problems to stay here. In the right of the Walmart garden it's perfect.

name: G & K Propane
description: Nice wide pad for RV 40' level easy.....

name: Agua Blanca Ranch BLM
description:
Big Gravel Lot - Big Rig Friendly - No Services. Beautiful Mountain Views. Close (30. Minutes +/- to Pinal Air Museum & Tucson)

Update: Verizon cell service works just a bit slow.

name: Tombstone RV Park
description:
RV Park 3 mins from downtown Tombstone. Nice large pet area if you have dogs. Flat full service sites and very nice accommodating staff will lend you water or electrical extensions if you need them. Also the park boasts that their the only park in Tombstone with a Pool! $40/night.
They also have donkey/horse/cow to pet if you're into that.

name: Hueco Tanks State Park
description: Super cool historic site with many activities like hiking, rock climbing and bird watching. Must watch 15 minute orientation video once and obtain passes daily in order to access the park trails. Camping is 16 usd per night plus a 7 usd per person per day fee. Sites include water and power. Public shower rooms are nice and heated and free. Rangers all wake up on the wrong side of the bed. Extremely unique and large sites; ask for one against the rock walls!!

name: Parking Lot behind McDonald's - Free
description: Large gravel parking lot behind McDonald's. Free. Quiet. Lots of garbage in grassy areas. Not very nice. Will do for a place to sleep over night if you're tired.  Wife's description; gross.

name: Lake Colorado City State Park
description: Nice state park on a lake! 20$ for electricity and water. 22$ for large pull through sites. Hot showers and clean bathrooms.

name: Cedar Hill State Park
description: Beautiful state park 30 minutes from Dallas! 30 and 50 amp sites with water and sewer. 25 no sewer 30 with.

name: McKinney Falls State Park
description:
Great campground with lots to do, biking, hiking trails and a creek to fish for bass and catfish. 

Phone number for reservations: (512) 389-8900

name: Braunig Lake RV Park
description: Passport America Compatible -great staff- clean- pool-spa, basketball/ fishing- hot clean showers- super super clean

name: Shepard State Park
description:
Beautiful State Park with all the usual amenities plus, dog park, archery range, frisbee golf course and a boat launch! 
RV site: 18$ per night 
Primitive site: 13$ per night 
Day use: 4$

name: Torreya State Park
description: Rustic State Park with a Plantation called the Gregory House.  Sites have power and water or choose primitive. P&W $19 including fees and taxes. Two persons.

name: Sheep Canyon
description: Just past the "formal" pay $10/night Sheep Canyon Campground, where there is an outhouse and picnic tables, is an area at the base of the Sheep Canyon trail head where you can camp for free.  First come, first serve and it is a popular spot because of the flowing creek up the canyon.  The whole Coyote Canyon valley area is closed June 1st to Sept. 30th to preserve the watering rights of the desert Bighorn Sheep.  Lots of dispersed camping all around this area.  However, 4Low and high clearance is necessary to get up the "staircase" part of the trail past the third shallow water crossing.

name: Amistad National Recreational Area
description: Primitive, but quiet camp spot near the lake. Pit toilets, picnic table and grill. $6 and it was real quiet. Free spots also available in the boonies here. read reviews for more infos.

name: Walmart Nogales AZ
description:
Slept 2 nights there.
Parked at the right side of the building, had wifi in the van.

name: Cobb Camp Osceola National Forest
description: Primitive camping. Portapoties. Some spots have picnic tables and fire pits. Free camping for 14 days every 30 day period during hunting season. Big rigs can fit here, I wouldn't go too far in if in a larger Motorhome 40+ feet. Good Verizon signal

name: JB Road
description: Many free spots at this dirt road. Nice and very quiet. Fire pits. Close to Tonto National Monument. Great Verizon reception.

name: Weigh Station/Comfort Station
description: Big parking lot for tired travellers to sleep overnight. Nothing fancy here perhaps some vending machine snacks and drinks if feeling snacky.

name: DeWeese Reservoir Dispersed Camping
description:
Free dispersed camping around reservoir. Stone fire rings. Mountain views.

Open all year.

name: Jessie's tire service
description:
Got 4 new tires here for good price.
Fast service too. Aces towed us in from desert yesterday. So if you're stuck call Aces

name: Skidaway Island State Park
description: Beautiful State Park. Expensive @ $40/night. Close to city. Lots of walking trails. Laundry facilities at each washroom location.

name: Los Padres National Forest - Turn Out
description:
Beautiful little turn out with a gorgeous view in every direction. Very quiet. Bit uneven. 
Dry full sun overlook. Lots of space. Little bumpy but we made it up w/ 2 wheel drive. Make sure you’ve got lots of water could stay here for weeks. So beautiful!! Above the clouds in the mornings. Peace and privacy. Van life dream. Leave it better than what you found it

name: Tamarisk campground
description: South of Borrego Springs at the junction of Yaqui Pass Rd and Hwy 78. Part of Anzo Borrego State Park. Nice quiet camping, $25 for a tent site for two motorcycles. We reserved through the park's website. Easy.

name: Rock Creek Canyon - Liittle Lakes Valley
description: Many dog friendly hiking and campsites. If you want a beautiful overnight (no car) hike, you have to get a permit in Lee Vining Ranger Station or Bishop. Day hikes, permit not needed. Dogs are allowed off leash! This is prime bear territory.

name: Cedar Fourche Rec. area
description: A couple dozen primitive camp sites on the lake shore. Popular boat launch for locals. The building by the boat ramp has free hot showers and restrooms. Pretty area to spend a night

name: Lowes parking lot
description: for overnight, but ask security

name: Monterey fairground
description:
$ 50/night - 2 people/no pets - full hook ups - no taxes 
$ 300/week 
When we arrived, a sign at the gate said "Reservation required". 
We drove in without a reservation and got a place. 
You need to check in before 6PM (Nov 1 - Feb 28) respectively 8PM (Mar 1 - Oct 31).

I saw a tent bit just realized, that it is behind the fence of the RV parking on the fairgrounds. Not sure, if they accept tents.

name: Cabin Creek Campground
description: Small privately owned RV park with camping spots. Offer free cable to RVs and well as the usual hook ups. They do sell propane but it's pretty expensive. If you take a 15min trip to the Tractor Supply you can fill propane there at a much more reasonable price.

name: Thompson Grove Picnic Area
description:
Large gravelled area approved for RV parking and grassed area for tents. 14 day limit. 
Tables, grills, bins, toilets. 
Note fire danger and disease warnings on notice board

name: Jalama County Beach Campground
description:
Superb location. Beach with rocks. Wifi ok. $ 25 without service and $ 40 us / night with electricity. Very windy and cool in the evening. Shower and toilet facilities very well. Picnic tables and fire base at each site. Shop (grocery store, resto, shop) very complete on site. Leaving 101, a poster will tell you if the campsite is full. This will prevent you from going down / - 30km lower.


Superbe endroit. Plage avec roches. Wifi ok. 25$ sans service et 40$ us/ soir avec électricité. Très venteux et frais le soir. Douche et salles de toilettes très bien. Tables de pique-nique et base pour feu à chaque site. Magasin (épicerie, Resto, boutique) très complet sur place. En quittant la 101, une affiche vous dira si le camping est plein. Cela vous évitera de descendre +/- 30km plus bas.

name: Emma Wood State Beach
description: RV camping along the beach. $40 / night. Must have a toilet in your vehicle. Additonal vehicles are $10. No tents. Trains run on the tracks between your campsite and the highway, bring earplugs.

name: Astoria Colomn
description: Beautiful 360 degree view. You can drive up there (5 $ for parking) or park below and walk up the hill.

name: Harris Beach State Park
description:
Paid $29 for a campsite with full hookup (no tent sites available). Absolutely beautiful beach nearby, nice private sites, firewood for sale. Very happy with our stay.

(ps - lots of pull outs on side of road just north along 101 within 10 miles leading into Brookings)

name: Black Mesa State Park
description:
Large RV and tent campground. Day picnic area (free) Power and water at RV sites. 

**book online at their website to reserve a spot. Last minute booking is allowed but you have to pay/reserve it online.**

Shelters, tables, BBQ grills, toilets and dump point. Free wifi around office. Walking trails, fishing. Playground. Dogs on leashes because of mule deer. RV $22 per night, tent $14. Age discount. Open all year. Note, photos taken end winter so place is looking a bit dreary

name: Kickapoo Cavern State Park Campground
description: Great campsite; very quiet. Potable water, picnic tables at each site, fire pit with grill for cooking. About an hour from the Piedras Negras/Eagle Pass border crossing.

name: Glacier Water Dispenser
description: Do-it-yourself water dispenser across the street from the Eastside Branch Public Library. 35 cents a gallon or $1.75 for 5 gallons.

name: Rest area
description: Rest area on Highway from LA to San Diego

name: Darby Wells Road
description: Hardpacked road suitable for any clearance and length. Easy on/off highway. Flat parking on numerous pull offs. Backside of mining slag pile. Close to main road, but quiet after dark. Felt safe and secure.  Read other reviews for more detail.

name: Baker Dam Reservoir (BLM)
description:
Nice and scenic little BLM campsite, accesible with all cars.
Approx. 20 sites available, some of them suitable for big RVs. 
2 Pit toilets, close to Highway 18 and maybe 25 mins from Snow Canyon State Park.
Night rate is $20.

name: Terrain vague entrée canyon chelly
description:
A simple place on a vacant lot. For a free night very good, quiet. 

un endroit simple sur un terrain vague. Pour une nuit gratuite très bien,calme .

name: Trinidad Rest Area Northbound
description:
8 hours parking allowed. Good rest area. Much better than the one south bound.

Gorgeous redwood groves

name: No Mans Land RV Park
description:
Area next to info centre. RVs only parked on bitumen. Some shade. Dump point and water. Toilets and showers adjacent. Shelter, table and grill.
1km from railway line. Probably internet available if info centre open. No signs prohibiting tents and nice lawn under the trees, but other source says no tents.

name: Hackberry Bend Campground
description: 7 RV sites with electric and water hookups, concrete slab, 12 level tent sites with shelters and grills in separate section past RVs. RV sites have 50 amp power and water and there is a separate dump point. Hot showers. Power available in toilets and cabin. $20 for RV, $12 for tent. Town of Beaver is 3km south with normal services.

name: Nebraska National Forest
description: 3 campgrounds available, this is for the dispersed camping throughout the forest.

name: 7 - eleven
description: Potable water $.25 per 5 gallons - pay inside and they will give you the key.

name: Puerto Palomas Columbus
description:
This border was recommended to us by a Pemex gas station worker near Chihuahua to avoid the big line ups in Ciudad juare, when we mentioned we were going to Agua Prieta.

It's a pleasant drive through secondary roads u til you get to Puerto Palomas. It's a small town with a small border crossing. no commercial fleets. smooth and fast. It took us 10 min to cross and 10mon to cancel the TIP from Mexico, which is located just before the big fence on the left when you're headed north, you will see the BANJERCITO .

All info about this crossing either going in or out of Mexico.

http://www.nmborder.com/Columbus.aspx

name: Holly Point Campground
description: State Recreation Area. Some of the loops have electrical and water hook ups. Over 100 sites some lakefront some nice and private hike in spots too. Big rig friendly even on the primitive camp area there are a fair amount of sites which are quite level. Make sure to book online or speak to a ranger before picking a spot as prices differ depending on location and or distance from the lake! Bathroom showers aren't the cleanest or warmest I've seen.

name: Country Life RV Park
description:
More a mobile home place with permanent residents.
But they do have a few asphalted places  with hookups for walk-in.  Office close at 5pm weekdays (1 pm on saturday - closed sunday). $40us /night.  

Oh toilettes closed 8pm to passover 9 am.  showers same thing.

name: Affordable German
description:
Great for VW Westfalias and Eurovans. 

Very knowledgable and accommodating

1510 West Broadway. Pheonix

name: Malaekahana Beach Campground
description: Malaekahana was awesome! We loved staying here, as it was a short drive to Haleiwa and other North Shore towns, but outside the usual tourist zone. They have cabins for rent, or you can camp in your tent or vehicle (no hookups for vehicles). The beach itself is a gorgeous bay, good for swimming. We camped in our rental car, which was about $10 per person, per night. Upside was a view of the ocean and sunrise from our site, downside was the incredible racket of roosters early in the morning. The vehicle camping area only has outdoor showers, not sure about other areas. Toilets were relatively clean. It got a bit rowdy on the weekend, with large groups making some noise, but not too bad. There's a food truck on site that's open in the earlier part of the day, if you're in need of a cup of coffee or breakfast/lunch. One major downside is that the gate to the campground is locked at 7 pm each night, so if you're out exploring you have to be sure to return in time. As far as I know, no wifi, but cell service was fine.

name: Manuka State Wayside
description: We found this campsite on the official site for Hawaii State Parks. It's a wayside, but has one site for camping available. I do NOT recommend this place at all, unless you are just in need of a place to crash for the night. The wayside has composting toilets - great that it's so environmentally friendly, but man do they smell! Not pleasant for a whole evening. Additionally, the site is directly on the side of a deserted stretch of highway and seems kind of sketchy. The site itself is a 3-sided structure with a couple of picnic tables. There are signs at the wayside that say no camping in your vehicle, which wasn't stated on the website - we slept in our car in the main parking lot, but the next day we saw some people who had driven their car onto the grass by the campsite, which may have been more pleasant despite being closer to the highway. Needless to say, no wifi - and also no cell reception (T-Mobile). Also, no drinking water! I read that there's a cool hike in Manuka State Park, but we didn't stay long enough to do it - so that may be its redeeming factor.

name: Isaac Hale Beach Park/Campground
description: This place was pretty nice, if you're not looking for solitude. It's a popular daytime beach park, decent for surfing. We paid for a permit online ahead of time, which was $27 for non-residents of Hawaii, for undesignated camping. There's a large open grassy area where people put their tents, although we just camped in our car in the parking lot. There wasn't an official around to check that we had paid for a permit, so you could probably get away with not paying. There seemed to be a lot of people sleeping in their cars. There had been a surf competition that day, and a live band was playing in the evening. Lots of people but not TOO rowdy. There are outdoor showers, toilets, port-a-potties, etc. Gorgeous view in the morning. There's a beautiful small natural hotsprings (not really hot, just warm) on the southwest side of the park by the boat launch. No wifi but cell service is fine.

name: Kalopa State Recreation Area
description: We arrived late at night and left early in the morning, so may not have the best information to review with. We thought you could pay on-site, but when we arrived there wasn't a way to pay. There were also only tent sites, and car camping wasn't allowed - but we didn't have a tent, so slept in our car in the parking lot. A park ranger never showed up though, so we fortunately didn't get a ticket. It's up in the mountains, and the area is gorgeous. There are only a few tent sites, so there was plenty of privacy and it was super quiet. Evidently you can also rent a cabin there. There also seems to be some nice hiking in the area, although we didn't stay long enough to check it out. No wifi, no cell service, no hookups. There is a building with toilets, a shower, and covered picnic tables. Tent campsites seem to be covered as well.

name: Namakanipaio Campground
description: This campground is right in Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park. There's a big grassy area for undesignated tent sites, and about 9 car-camping spots as well. You can pay for a site at the campground, or at the front desk of the Volcano House, a hotel nearby. It's first come, first serve, and since we wanted to drive around and didn't have a tent to set up in order to save a car camping spot, the woman sold us a walk-in tent pass for $10, and said it was fine for us to sleep in our car in the small parking lot. Another car with a rooftop tent was doing the same thing. It's a short walk to some beautiful volcano crater views, and you can easily drive around the park and see the various craters and petroglyphs. No wifi, but there was cell service. Bathrooms were in typical campground shape, not TOO dirty. No shower as far as we could tell. You can get some food or coffee at the Volcano House nearby.

name: Shower Moab + Laundry
description:
Cheapest hot shower in Moab.
You can buy a coin in the office. 5min for $4. Then with quarters you can extend for an extra 5 min.
There are two showers. Check in at the camper up front (marked "office" with a yellow sign)

name: GoWesty Camper Products
description: VW T2, T3, T4 parts. Everything you need. Great people.

name: Akal Travel Plaza
description: 15 trucks parking, paved, restaurant, gas. Calm and free

name: Mystic Hot Springs Monroe
description:
Hot Springs: 16$ per person
Camping: 33$ per person 
Busses for rent~$100/night 
Sign says closed but call the check in number and they will set you up

name: Big Falls State Park, 1382 River Rd
description: Great little spot for camping, swiming , and rest. Tent only, no service

name: Weaverville Rest Stop
description: Rest Stop 2 miles east of Weaverville. Quiet, restrooms. On Hwy bot not much tragic at night. FREE

name: Mendocino Headlands State Park
description: Open 5 am to 10 pm. Free. Restrooms, water and drinking water available. Beautiful drive.

name: Cherry Hill RV Park
description: Every amenity, pools, hot tub, sauna, cafe, restaurant, ice cream parlour, banquet hall, playgrounds, dog parks, store, RV supply store and if course washrooms and showers.

name: KOA San Antonio
description: A big Campground  under nice trees, clean Restrooms with hot shower, Pool, Laundry, little shop, Bus to downtown just outside, price different - full hook up, only electricity, tent...

name: Fontainebleu State Park
description: A beautiful state park on lake pontchartrain. Access to the tammany bike & hiking trail. 45min to New Orleans via Causeway. Improved and unimproved campsites starting at $14. (increases to $18 in March 2017) plus a one time transaction fee of $6 which is mandatory in all SPs in Louisiana. Hot showers, laundry, WiFi.

name: Juniper Springs Campground
description: A nice Campground in the Ocala NF . 21$, clean restrooms with hot showers, canoe rental , swimming in crystal clear spring

name: Grand Sierra Resort RV park
description:
A user reported on 13th July 2018: The fee is $40 + $32 resort fee plus tax 
---
RV Park behind the Grand Sierra Resort (basically in the parking lot). Has very nice, large bathrooms with hot showers, a laundry room, dog walking area, and easy access to the casino. We paid $18/night.

name: Blanding RV Park
description: free when filling with gas at the gas station. get key for water at station

name: Cortez Gaz Company
description: 413 East Third, Truth or Consequences NM

name: Arizona Hot Springs TH
description:
This is the trailhead to the Arizona hotsprings. The whole loop is 10km, 500m high difference. Some parts are a bit climbing.
We really liked the hot springs. You also can camp there with tents.

name: Elk Mountain Campground (NPS)
description:
Official campground within Wind Cave NP. Open year round as long as paved roads are passable.
$9 October-April with pit toilets and no water. $18 during summer months. Water and flush toilets in summer months.

name: Ridgecrest Walmart
description:
Walmart car park - store opening hours 6am - midnight
Free wifi in store

name: Ponca Lake City Campground
description: Campsite on Ponca Lake. Power hookups 50 amp, water, dump point, toilets, hot showers, grills, fire rings, quiet location

name: Verde River Child's
description: A wild Camp Place beside the Verde River. The road is very bumpy an steep. Not recommended for big rigs. No Service, just a Toilette.

name: South Lake dispersed
description: 6-8 sites, bathroom, no water. On the lake. Some hiking trails

name: Lake Aire RV Park & Campground near Charleston
description: A nice campground just 15 miles east from Charleston downtown. Camping from 20 to 40$, Laundry, WiFi, Pool, quiet during the nighttime

name: Mistletoe State Park
description: A beautiful campground at the Clarks Hill Lake. Good for swimming, fishing ,boating and hiking.Laundry, WiFi at the Office, 25$ with water and electricity

name: BLM DISPERSED CAMPING AREA
description: Coming down on Sunflower Rd(just a few dried out dirt dips, easy access dirt road) as soon as you see the Solar Farm on the south side, I’ve seen campers setup here. The BLM dispersed camping is large. I recommend driving in further into the lake bed as there are several established fire rings. 24hr Yucca Valley Walmart is 12 miles west and feel free to call in to see if they have firewood in stock $4.84/bundle. Plenty of LTE cell coverage on Sprint & Verizon network.

name: Gold Run Rest Area
description: This place is Eastbound. Westbound is a bit further south. Allows 8 hour parking. Free.

name: Walmart
description:
I've never seen so many RV's on a walmart parking lot here! ! 

Je n'ai jamais vu autant de RV sur un parking de walmart qu'ici ! !

name: Maverik Fuel
description: Clean and easy for a free dump and potable water. Located on south side of the gas station.

name: Hebo lake
description: Quiet, nice feel. 12 sites. Pulled in around 5pm got the last spot. Lake is VERY small more like a large pond.

name: Windy Hill Recreation Site
description:
Tonto National Forest, Roosevelt, AZ 85545
347 campsites located at the largest Arizona reservior/lake.
Windy Hill CampgrouRoosevelt Lake is the largest of the reservoirs run by Salt River Project to provide water the Phoenix Metro Area. Roosevelt is also Arizona’s largest lake and is very popular with boaters and anglers. Hiking is abundant around Windy Hill Campground, and Roosevelt Lake in general. The Tonto National Monument is a short drive away from Windy Hill. Wildlife in the area include mule deer, coyotes, geese, fox and the occasional bald eagle.

name: Lake Kaweah Horse Creek Campground
description: Beautiful site by Lake Kaweah. Government operated, $20/night. Has decent showers and toilets although a little run down. Also has a dump station and water. Lots of space between spots. Most campers fishing in the lake. Non campers can use dump station and showers for a $4 fee each.

name: Chevron Gas Station
description:
This could help someone,  we stop for gas and on the counter there is a post saying

"camping :
tent $10
rv $20
monthly $??? I did not pay attention"


Have no more infos on it (didn't ask)

This area is Kaibab Paiute reservation land 

So, maybe, this info could help someone

name: Mammoth Campground (NPS)
description: 85 sites within the park. Rate is 25$ per night. reservation only during summer. there are several restroom buildings, in winter only the one at the registration is opened. water near sites available. remember this is bear territory, be aware. bear proof lockers available at almost every site.

name: Picnic area great view
description: A very quiet picnic area with a great view on the bridge and the canyon of picos river.  FREE

name: Mandarin Gourmet
description:
Chinese restaurant. 
All you can eat for 7,99$
Good price for value.

name: Diamond Campground
description:
Beautiful campground near the hot springs. The hot springs have a heavy sulfur smell. Lots of beautiful hiking trails. Campground requires a fee, although there isn’t anyone who check during the off season. Some bees in the morning. Signs say hear country and rattle snake sun bathing area. We didn’t see either . UINTA National Forest Campground. Plenty of paid sites. Normal cost seems to be $12 but during off season nobody checks fees being paid. 

***prices are now $24

name: Lake Jennings Campground
description: Lake Jennings is known for being one of the most scenic parks in all of San Diego County. It is a welcoming recreation destination located in Lakeside, California offering fishing, camping, hiking, and picnicking activities. The lake is a drinking water reservoir owned and operated by Helix Water District. The scenic views of the lake and the wooded surroundings make it feel as if you are in the middle of the wilderness, right outside of town.

name: Gearheads
description:
Moderator Note: GPS coordinates upadated & New Address-

 1040 S Main St, Moab, UT 84532

-----------------------

Gearheads has moved! Look on ioverlander for their new location just south of town.

Outdoor store offering free Filtered water inside the store. Bring and fill your own container.

name: Plaster City East
description: This a place to pull over and spend a night year round at no charge.  Summers are hot!!!  Be careful of loose dirt.

name: Hickison Petroglyphs Campground
description: Nice campground with picnic tables, shelter, fire places and bins. Very quiet. Free.

name: Samuel P. Taylor State Park, Camp Taylor Area
description: Camping in the redwood forest. $43 per night

name: Ebbs Canyon WMA
description: Dirt road to Ebbs Canyon located off frontage road. Lots of grassy areas to camp along the dirt road in the Wildlife Management Area on the way to Ebbs Canyon in National Forest.

name: Lawrence Crossing - FS Road 121
description: Primitive camping on FS land.  no amenities  pack it in pack it out

name: Marin Park
description:
Good location to visit San Francisco. Walking distance to Larkspur ferry - about 15 minute walk. 
Pool, laundry, warm showers, wifi, cable TV. 
Very helpful and friendly staff. 

overnight rate: $75.00 + 10% tax for 2 people,

name: Wild Camping near Valley of Fire
description:
A place for about twenty campers. Calm. 

Good Verizon coverage. 

De la place pour une vingtaine de campers . Calme.

name: Circle CG Farm Campground
description: Established camping with power and water, Outdoor pool(seasonal), shuffle board, store. One hour to Boston and one hour to Cape Cod.

name: Bangor Walmart
description: Walmart camping at its finest.

name: La clocha
description: Quiet primitive campsite, you need to buy a permit 12$ at the visitor center and you can stay 14 days for this price. View to the rio grande and the desert.

name: Pahrump Valley Winery
description:
Estate Winery. beautiful facilty. Free wine tasting - up to 7 wines.
Fine restaurant. reasonable prices on food & wines. 

Tours available. Worth the drive from Vegas.

name: China Ranch
description:
Old Ranch - Date Farm - Antiques. 
Out of the way but well worth the trip.
Fantastic date shakes!

Road paved for part of the way, the dirt/gravel road.

Lots of parking space.

name: Santa Cruz Redwoods Resort
description: Good location for Santa Cruz and Henry Cowell State Park. Pay extra for a fire pit. Free wifi, laundry, dumpster, great club house with pool table and board games. Nice view of San Lorenzo River

name: A parking lot end of road
description: A parking lot in the end of the road in the middle of the trees. Very quiet. FREE limited stay of three nights

name: Goat Meadow Snow Play Area
description:
A very quiet and nice place !! One parking lot at the end of the road.
 If you prefer at right you have a good off road with very nice spots in Forest.** AS OF 20/4/21 road to right has been logged. very minimal spots at road head. parking area still good to go!
Fire possible but have to call to obtain a permit. Permit is free. 
Minutes away from the gate to enter Yosemite.  Great place to stay and then head to the gate before it gets crowded.

name: Spring Recreation BLM Huntington OR
description:
BLM campground Huntington OR Snake River
Really nice. Established blm campground. Beautiful view. Felt safe. It was a little windy but besides that it was really quiet. Looks like the road in has be recently paved. We only payed $2.50 for the night with our America the Beautiful pass. Looks like you can pull over before the campground and camp along the Snake River shore as well. Would definitely suggest stopping here.

name: Mc Cabe Flats
description: Beautiful camps on the bank of Merced river for tents and small RVs with pit toilets, fireplaces and tables. Careful: access is from Briceburg via a suspension bridge for max 10t and then a dirtroad with some potholes along the river for about 4km/15 min. Cost is 10$/site. Drinking water available at the entrance sign just after the bridge. There are two more campgrounds like this further down the river, we didn't check them out.

name: RNS auto
description: Great mechanic. Very hepful. We did the drain.

name: Wildwood Lakes
description: Wildwood Lakes if a family owned business, it has been around for 60 years, and we are the third generation to own it.

name: Sacramento Pass Recreation Area
description: Nice campground with picnic tables, shelter, fire places, bins. Just off the Hwy but very quiet as there is not much traffic.

name: Washington City Community Center
description: Recreation Centre with an Indoor swimming pool and showers. $1 per person to just use the showers!

name: Freightliner of Maine
description: If you have a problem with your rig then ask for Mr. Mike Wilson at the Desk. He likes to meet Overlanders.

name: Dogwood campground San Bernadino national forest
description: This is the correct GPS location for Dogwood camp grounds.

name: Insurance 4 less
description:
He Can Provide Liability Insurance via Daryland for Foreign Cars 
Prices for 6 Month starting at 400$
ASK for Mark
Mark@Insurance4Less.net
TEL: (858) 694 8600

name: Cibbet's Flat Campground
description:
National Forest Service campground. 
$14
Well cared for. Small Creek runs past campsites, potable water, pit toilets, fire rings, tables. Quiet at night and a little chilly at 4000 ft.
The Pacific Crest Trail runs through here - lots of hikers.

name: Free campsite
description: Free campsite on turn of the road near lake and river.

name: Public parking lot
description: This is a quiet free public lot easily walkable to Ocean Springs bars and restaurants. No signage regarding overnight parking.

name: Beatty desert
description:
Good and quiet sites in desert juste near to Beatty. Many sites ont far the main road. Good Gravel road access!
Perfect for a night and free!

name: Camp-a-while Hegins Pennsylvania
description: Nice space but very noisy with trucks all night!

name: Pioneer Campground Off i81 Exit 84
description: The girl at the office is friendly, the bathrooms are clean but... the internet is not working according to our experience and the girl at the office, there is really a lot of noise from the motorway and we had to pay $40

name: Parking Walk of Fame / Hollywood
description: Fenced parking lot. Nearby walk of fame. 25$ / day. Also suitable for really big rigs/bus.

name: flying J Travel Stop
description:
We stopped here for gas and showers, which were clean and quite refreshing, didn't sleep here though, kept it moving.  Fast wifi in the parking lot of McNasty's.

Watch out for the lot lizards!

 It’s a good place to spend a night. The restaurant now is Dennys. Good WIfi. We stay in front of the restaurant.

name: Near Gas station
description: Parking next to gas station. Big rig friendly. Had cell reception. No WiFi. No toilets, showers, or dumping that I found.

name: Montezuma hot springs
description:
many smal pools whith verry hot water 38-50 Grad C . A cold river byside to cool down. All for free.
no overnight s tanding. Closed form midnight to 5:00 am.

name: Morphy Lake State Park
description:
a very nice place at a small lake. As we are here it was empty and quiet, but the ranger told us that sometimes it is full. At weekend it should come many fisherman here. 

Self registration 10 $ per night. Closed in winter.

name: National Forest Manzano Mountains
description: At the graveld read , 4.Juli Road, are in national Land a few spots for free camping. This here is realy the best, away the road, grassy ground behind big  trees by a verry smal creek. There are Campgrounds and parking  Spots whith pit toilets but they are closed and open later, i guess in May .

name: Rest area
description:
Several spigots, but they are all turned off. 

Update June 2022:  Water available.  (Probably seasonal.)

name: Williamson River Campground
description: quiet state park campground in the Forrest with picnick tables and fire pits. pit toilets open all year, water only on the main season. campground free during off season.

name: brady reservoir,  Nebraska
description: free place by a lake with firepit & picnic table next to a boat  ramp.

name: Ruby Creek Trailhead
description: A trailhead parking area with two picnic tables and a fire ring. We drove up a little double track that takes off just left of the main area and found a nice small flat spot to camp. Quite. Off the beaten path and a nice mountain bike or hiking trail too.

name: National Forest
description: Dirt road, many parking spots off road. Free of snow in spring.

name: Slide mountain camping
description:
Pull off along national forest road. In early spring we had the place to ourselves, except for a herd of deer. 

Great views of the lake. Fire ring. Lots of wood around.

name: Bog Hot Spring
description: Lots of space. Quiet and well off highway. Hot spring is HOT at source and cools down further away. Clay bottom makes entering spring a bit messy. No cell service. Access roads can be muddy/slippery after rain.

name: BLM Water Canyon Recreation Area
description: Free. 10 sites with picnic tables, fire rings and grill. Pit toilet nearby. 3 night maximum.

name: Pickets RV Park
description:
Small campground. Behind the Sinclair Gas Station
Have the Churches  chicken from the General Store !

name: Ambassador RV
description: Lots of large rigs... but a beautiful campground. On the side of Boise closer to Seattle.

name: Road 13S03
description: This is a designated dispersed camping area on the Sequoia NF. Check in the ranger station for road conditions. The road was closed when we were there but ranger said it's ok to camp at the gate. It is just outside the boundaries of the NP so very handy.

name: In the middle of the pins
description: Great place very quiet. A big fire pit. Enough place for big rigs. Place for a tent and to put the food up. Lots of animals around and a trail nearby. FREE

name: Battery Park
description:
Overnight RV Parking is allowed. Park in large gravel lot or under bridge; don't obstruct movement by other vehicles & don't park near boat ramp or in grass area. Mostly level, unlit, with marina and light road noise.  Quiet at night. Within sight of a police station. 5-10 minute walk into town; many restaurants there.

Small sign says $30 / night.

name: Henry Cowell Redwood State Park
description: Good campground, private bush settings $35 per night. No wifi, need quarters for warm shower.

name: Fernley wildlife management area
description:
Nothing here but no restrictions on camping or vehicles !
Lake a couple kms after wildlife gate. Dirty water but nice views.

name: Next to William in NF
description: Very quiet place in the middle of the national forest. A lot of places, fire pit. The signal of ATT is good.

name: Tachi Palace Casino
description: Overnight allowed at parking lot #3. There were other RVs for the night as well as trucks. Security running all night. A bit of traffic in near by road but not that bad.

name: Eddies Corner
description: Gas station allows vehicles to park overnight even though they are closed, and leaves a side door open to allow people to use the restrooms. No charge. Gas station, convenience store and cafe are open morning through evening.

name: Wayne County Information Center
description: Gives excellent information and very nice lady!

name: San Luis Pass County Park
description: Had to go here because all other Campgrounds were full. Very clean, directly at the Gulf. Usually only RVs, they made an exception for us. $40  in Peak Season.

name: Americano Motel
description:
If you should find yourself in Vaughn New Mexico and night is approaching, this clean but dated motel is acceptable, relatively inexpensive accomodations. 
The pool is inoperable but the rooms are spacious with two double beds, hot shower , mini fridge and microwave. They have airconditioning and heat. Next door there is a 24 hour diner (and much more expensive motel)
We parked our motorcycle right outside our window. $55US + tax for two people

name: Bad Medicine Campground
description: Forest Service campground on Bull Lake. Several spots with an upper loop and lower loops. The sites are up off the lake a little but easy hike down to the water. Quiet lake would be good for canoes kayaks and paddle boards. Make sure you hike up into the Ross Creek Cedar Grove.

name: Noxon Reservoir
description:
Several great spots right on the water. Not sure how busy it is in the summer but beautiful nonetheless. 

Comment: Beautiful location only if you don't mind being woken up every two hours by trains. The dog and husband loved swimming in the warm water though.

name: Old Isabella Rd. Recreation Site
description:
Dump station and water at the auxiliary dam. Also good place for the night. 

* update: used to be at the auxiliary dam, now it's a little bit east at the recreation site.

name: North Douglas Pull outs
description: A series of oceanfront pull outs and beaches that are perfect for overnighting, camping, bonfires. Beautiful views of glacier and mountains. Perfect sunset spot. Popular with locals.

name: Eaglecrest Ski Area Parking Lot
description: Large parking lot at base of city-owned ski area. Camping allowed. Good access to BC, resort, and XC skiing, summer hikes, and lodge.

name: Backside douglas beach camping
description: Go to end of road. Walk .5 miles down boardwalk trail that parallels power lines. Turn left at beach. Disperse beach camping. Excellent sunsets.

name: Echo Cove Campground
description: City campground. Sites and tables near boat ramp. Used by local party goers and ATV enthusiasts. Okay views. Great kayaking opportunities and boating in Berner's Bay nearby

name: Out-the-road pull outs
description: Multiple pull outs along the highway with amazing views of Chilkat Mountains and sea life

name: ZMW Adventures
description:
IMPORTANT: Contact ZMW before visiting. Phone 520-290-3374 or email zmwadventures@gmail.com
ZMW is a rare find. They have everything a motorcycle traveller could ask for including repairs, service, tires, and specialized adventure bikes. The owner/mechanic/host Frank is highly skilled and experienced with all motorcycle brands and was a BMW specialist for years. He is an avid rider and understands exactly what adventure riders and travellers need. 
Frank has extensive knowledge of the area for interesting routes in any direction. His facility has a guesthouse and camping spaces, fast wifi, and great views of the mountains. Best of all, Frank and Karin are the most genuine and kind people you will ever meet.

name: Streetside in residential Sta. Monica
description:
Spent a few nights stealth camping in this quiet upper middle class Santa Monica neighbourhood.
Check for the parking regulations and be super discrete (curtains drawn, no lights, no open windows, no leaking water) and you should be fine.
Right here at the marked spot you'll be better off on no school days, but streets around look suitable, too.

name: Shopping center parking lot
description: Parking lot of VONS supermarket. Manager gave me permission to sleep in my van for one night. Restroom in shop, good bread available. Very quiet at night. Compact cars only. Quite level. Sunny. Free.

name: Kearny Lake Campground
description: This place is not free. it is $10 a night payable at Town Hall or Police Station, or $20 for the one site that is electric. I will check in and post a photo. Max 14 day stay. 12 sites, toilets, water.  Adjacent to a man made pond. Nice quiet spot.  Site 2 even has water and sewer connection.

name: HW299 Rest Area
description: Rest Area, nicely off main highway.  says 8 hour max but we stayed overnight OK.  Free sanidump. Power in washrooms.

name: Port Orford overnight parking
description: A basic parking lot with great views of the harbour. $20 honesty box. close to restaurants. nice quiet spot away from the highway. Great views! Great cell service! Our last visit we met  'host' parked in lot with classic city bus conversion.

name: Blue Heron French Cheese Company
description:
This is a great place to visit,  lots of fun free tastings, $5 wine tasting, or just ice cream and espresso. YOU MUST CHECK IN DURING BUSINESS HOURS on the iPad, and then they give you a parking pass.  Nice espresso in the morning. 

Only allows trailers, RVs, campers, to stay overnight. NOT passenger vehicles, tents, etc. according to the woman at the counter. Great breakfast burrito!

name: Midpines County Park (Park & Ride)
description: This is a park and right parking lot near Yosemite. We did not want to spend 50$ per night for a tent site on the KOA nearby and found this place. There are no signs that overnight parking is prohibited and we had a really calm night. There are rest area style flush toilets. Nothing to stay for a few days but just right if you're on your way to or out Yosemite.

name: Near Horse Camp
description: Gravel roads lead to a turn toward a horse camp the road forks, we went right, following human on horse sign and found a flat area to park a few hundred yards down. You can also go all the way to freecampsites.net but we didn't feel like it and nobody bothered us anyways.

name: Paseo del Rio Campground
description: Relax at Elephant Butte Lake State Park a little away from the crowds? Paseo del Rio Campground is at the southernmost part of the lake at the base of Elephant Butte Dam. Camp spot is right on the banks of the Rio Grande.  Each campsite has an adobe shelter but otherwise very basic with bathroom facility.  Can be a little noisy in the early evening & early morning due to this being a base for NM Game & Fish wardens certain times of the year.

name: Tent Rocks
description: It's not THE Tent Rocks but very beautiful as well. There is a fire ring.  Cold at night, pack some warm clothes. Amazing Views, not too far from a couple of hot Springs. Coming from La Cueva you take the 126 for 3 1/2 Miles, at MM 35 turn left onto 376. Turn left again at 604, the toad will make a sharp right turn, that's where you want to camp. Roads are unpaved but fine, no 4x4 needed.

name: Victorville near Walmart
description: Walmart in Victorville doesn't allow overnight parking. But next to the Walmart is a dead end road and than a gravel road where you can spend a quiet night.

name: Sites behind municipal garage
description:
There is definitely a point where most sane drivers realize that they should not take their vehicles further, but a higher clearance 4 x 4 could make short work of the hill, and go beyond “the tank” (a large object of cylindrical proportions).

Pretty flat spot for a vehicle as well as tent, but on your way up, be sure to read the signage - there is a private drive. A saloon even graces your presence at the bottom of the hill where you turn off the main highway. As always, be sure to leave no trace as you enjoy this spot!

name: Nice FURTHER camp site high clearence off road
description: Wanna wake up to this? Rocky road for high clearance only. Would not risk a low vehicule. Sprinter 2wd made it

name: Grand Canyon Camping service
description: Has drinking water, dump station, showers (2.50$ for 5min.), laundry. Wifi, but ATM is not working.

name: Free dump station
description:
Free dump station with potable water!
Located in county park.

name: Lake Powell Shoreline
description: Free camping along the Lake Powell shoreline. Many different places, beautiful. The road to get here is with high clearance vehicles 4x4 only, very scenic through a gorge/wash.

name: Alstrom Point
description:
Stunning scenery high from the cliffs down on Lake Powell. Lots of different free camping sites around. Rocky road definitely only 4x4 with high clearance... this is Landcruiser and Landrover country! Bring firewood! Weak 3G reception available. Not recommended when windy...
AT&T gives upto 4 bars with LTE

name: Ashurst lake complex
description: Wild camping allowed for 14 nights. Several flat spots to choose from. Further up the road is an established campground. Plenty of RV boondocking space for all sizes. Pine trees and lake views can be found.

name: Pioneertown
description: There's an amazing restaurant here called Pappy and Harriets and an old western movie set. There is camping a few blocks north at Corral campground. It has bathrooms/showers and hookup for 10pp per night. we got the restaurant wifi in the car park.

name: Euro Cycle (triumph showroom)
description:
i got a heidenau k60 scout 130/80-17 here for 155$ inl. tax, 26$ for mounting when wheel off.
online shops were sold out and same price.
they fix many brands here, but won't be cheap.

name: NP Dump and Water free
description: Dump and Water for free next to the campground

name: Anchor Point
description: Public water supply. 25 cents for 6 gallons, more details on pricing for higher quantities in photos. Pumps for large and small tanks.

name: Pinnacles National Park East
description:
Nice campsite with lots of spots for tents and vans (80+) and RVs (30+). 
Located directly at the park entrance and visitor's center. 
Park fee: 15$ or access with the interagency annual pass
Nightly rate for camping 25$ and a bit more for RVs with electricity and water i guess.
Shower house near the pool. Coin operated. Two quarters will give you 3 mins if showering.
Be aware that the Pinnacles east and west entrance are not connected by a road and you would have to go around.
No At&t service.

Shuttle to hiking areas.

name: Lake Bob Sandlin State Park
description: Beautiful little state park on huge lake. Very organized with lots of well appointed campsites and cabins. Hot showers and good amenity blocks. $4 per adult and $18 fo ra tent site. Fantastic place to stay. Wifi near park headquarters. Could be busy on weekends and definately during holidays.

name: Charleston Visitors Center Parking Ramp
description:
This parking garage has 12' 8 clearance on first level, and ~ parking spaces designated for RVs. Parking $2 per hour / $16 max for 24 hours. This entrance is on Mary St.  The one via Meeting Street is low clearance for only automobiles. 

Last resort option on weekends. Super loud music and partying from 10 pm to 2 am. 

Visitors Center has restrooms during business hours 8:30 - 5:30.

name: Shoshone-Bannock Hotel & Event Center
description:
Hotel, Casino, Bingo. 

Great facility. Good food, very reasonable prices. All Staff extremely friendly & helpful. Clean as in New. Hotel 5 yrs old at time of writing.

Will stay here again.

name: Valle Vista Campground
description:
Primitive USFS Campground just off Hudson Ranch Rd. Pit toilet. Seven large spots with fire rings.

Road from highway is rough and uneven. Might be a challenge for RVs, trailers, or low clearance vehicles.

name: Pismo State Beach, North Beach Campground
description:
Open again since May 2019

Nice and well maintained campground.
Quite busy during summer. Next to the ocean. Good facilities.
Partly hookup sites. Mostly simple sites for 25$ without hookup. (as of 05/2017)

name: Wal-Mart West Waynesville NC
description: wallmart  supercenter 24h parking lot. no apparent wifi.

name: Terry's Shinhopple Campground
description: A nice family campground which can accommodate large groups. Showers and bathrooms. A peaceful setting.

name: BLM Wild Camp
description:
nice place next to a small river. Fire Ring and Shade under some trees.
Forgot to take a photo, sorry.
Quiet at night, can get a bit busy during day. Follow the 95 and take the Exit towards south Cottonwood National Forest access. Road gets unpaved but is fine. Camp is soft sand.

name: Bear reservoir
description: In the end of April, a parking lot close to the reservoir. Very quiet.

name: Salt Wells (Close to Fallon / Sand Mountains)
description: Dumping station in the middle of the desert 10$. The water smell very bad !!!! Not possible to refill the water tank

name: Close to a salt flat
description: In the middle of nowhere. No amenities but very quiet.

name: Humboldt toiyabe NF
description: Plenty places in the middle of nowhere. Not visible from the road. Mines around, the children tried to find minerals they found borax. Wild horses. Very quiet. FREE

name: Free camp in Dixie NF
description: Nice campground in the middle of the dixie forest. Tables, fire pit, barbecue. Places for tent. Hikes around. Beautiful landscapes on the road. From capitol reef take the 12 after few kilometers take a road in the right side to go to fish creek lake (North slope road) 9.3 km (5,7 miles) later take the road for fish creek in the left side of the road ! No phone signal.

name: Below  a huge cliff
description: Very nice place in a Canyon close to the road 12. Dirty road, high clearance. Don't go if it's raining !

name: South Fork RV Park
description: Nice, easy to get to, safe, clean bathrooms. WiFi. Electrical. Great spot to stay to refill water and dump tanks. A little oasis.

name: Black Rock Mountain SP
description:
Very nice state park. Campsites with water and electricity or primitive walkin sites. Great views, trails Foxfire Museum on site (remember those great books?).

Discounts for seniors, vets and disabled.

Free wifi at Trading Post store.

name: Spring Creek Recreational Area
description: Good spot by the lake. Electricity and water available. 15$ without hookups or 25$ with hookups. Free dumping station and fresh water. If you try to park overnight near the dam, you might end up receiving the visit of a park ranger requesting the camping fee. You can take your chance or simply park dirrctly at the camp site and enjoy a warm shower.

name: Thunderbird conservation park
description: Nice hiking trails. Also horseback riding trails. Great place to hang out and star gaze.

name: Dry Creek Henrieville GSENM
description: Public Land GSENM Henrievillle Creek. Dispersed Camping on a flat terrain. Overnight permits are required, they are free and may be obtained at any visitor center.

name: San Clemente State Beach - Calafia
description: Coastal view, tent and full hook up sites. Great spot! Nice walk down to the beach. No dogs on the beach, but path OK. $40 per night.

name: Rusty Bike
description:
Home cooked food. Local favorite. 

Owner is an avid motorcylist with plenty of good advice on riding the Tail of the Dragon.

name: Tail Of The Dragon/Deal's Gap
description:
Legendary motorcyle and sports car destination. More than 300 curves in 11-miles.

A bucket list road.

name: Next to park
description: This is parking spots on the west side of a public park. There are no signs prohibiting overnight parking. Bathrooms are open from 7:30am until the evening. Nice big grassy area to relax, have a picnic, walk your dog. Good for one night in our [stealthy] van. Not sure if RVs would be checked.

name: Whitney's Favorite
description:
Moderator note: Road is currently CLOSED due to High wildfire risk.7/20/21

River swimming hole, rope swing, and wooded tent area.

Park in gravel and mud pullout on the north river side of the road. Short walk down a dirt path to a wooded area where the underbrush has been cleared away and there's a fire pit and a makeshift table. River is just beyond and there's a rope swing into a nice deep part. 2 lte bars Verizon.

name: Bay city camp ground
description: Beautiful view camping along the creek. Site had a fire ring but lots of trash. Obviously a place for high school parties

name: Dexter creek
description: Nice little spot on the left side of the road just up the hill from the creek crossing. Bit of a rough road but got up fine in a 2 wheel drive sprinter 144. Has a fire pit.

name: Beas Lewis Flat Road. BLM
description: Capitol Reef Highway #24. Dispersed camping on BLM land, big area with many places. Free.

name: Near the monticello lake
description:
Nice place close to the lake. Very quiet, good temperature when it's too hot in Moab and canyonsland !! Good tires need, high clearance. 
Toilets. FREE

name: Walmart
description: Walmart parking lot with really fast wifi. Park near tires and lubes - You can still connect to wifi there.

name: Cusick creek trailhead
description:
A trailhead parking lot 3 miles from downtown pocatello and the tasty portneuf valley brewery.  Great access to city creek trails but no services.  There are no signs saying no camping.  Water and bathrooms are two miles down the road in a town park.  Spent two nights without hassle but may be a party spot since there is a fire ring very close to the parking lot.

Trailhead to one of Pocotello’s trail systems. The road is mostly paved until the very end, less than a mile. The trailhead is flat, quiet, and there weren’t any signs saying no camping. We parked our 23 foot sprinter van no problem.

name: Arco Propane
description:
Easy in/out
free Fresh water to, near to propane.

name: Street side parking
description: Parkin next to a country club, very quiet at night. We had no problems here. Must move by 8am until 6pm. It's partly residential but fully legal to park over night and sleep.

name: Avila beach
description:
Avila beachside first come first camp ocean side! Go all the way past the bars and first pier where you'll see rv's everywhere. Find a spot and greet your neighbors.

Avila Beach is so beautiful, and there is a huge amount of RV parking for $50 a night.

name: Valley Citty Road
description: Verry quiet, a hill pro Text against the HWY. No Services

name: BLM Land
description: I was not there, just at the entrance, but here is a Camping Space. I think for free.

name: Yankee Hill Wildlife Management Area
description:
Wildlife Management Area (Nebraska MWA) at Yankee Hill Lake.  Free rv and tent camping for everyone, no fees charged, that is the reason it's 4 stars.  Stay/camping limited to 3 days at a time.  There is a pit toilet.  No water except for the actual lake.  Nice area.  Roads are gravel/dirt.  You can fish and hunt if you have a permit and it's in season. This WMA and lake is in the middle of the countryside, surrounded by farms. Very quiet except for: owls, hawks, squirrel, rabbits, fox, deer, pheasant, quail, coyotes, birdwatchers, wildlife researchers with noisy notepads and binoculars, wearing tan and green shirts, hunters and fishermen in season.  This is close enough to Lincoln, NE, so you could see the north american common wing-less "urban humansis huskorite", occasionally in bright red plumage.  They are mostly harmless and pose no threat unless you are from Oklahoma, Texas or Miami.

Note* As a rule:  All Nebraska WMA's are free to camp for everyone.  Check signs as you enter for each WMA's specific's regulations, if there are any.  If you want electrical and water hookups for rv's, you will need to go to a $pay fee "Nebraska State Park", which are really nice but not free, like the free Nebraska WMA's.

name: Twin Lakes Wildlife Management Area
description:
Wildlife Management Area (Nebraska MWA) at Twin Lakes.  Free rv and tent camping for everyone, no fees charged, that is the reason it's 4 stars.  Stay/camping limited to 3 days at a time. No water except for the actual lake.  Nice area.  Roads are gravel/dirt.  You can fish and hunt if you have a permit and it's in season. This WMA and lake is in the middle of the countryside, surrounded by farms. Very quiet except for: owls, hawks, squirrel, rabbits, fox, deer, pheasant, quail, coyotes, birdwatchers, wildlife researchers with noisy notepads and binoculars, wearing tan and green shirts, hunters and fishermen in season.  

Note* As a rule:  All Nebraska WMA's are free to camp for everyone.  Check signs as you enter for each WMA's specific's regulations, if there are any.  If you want electrical and water hookups for rv's, you will need to go to a $pay fee "Nebraska State Park", which are really nice but not free, like the free Nebraska WMA's.

name: Gilbert-Baker Wildlife Management Area
description:
Wildlife Management Area (Nebraska MWA) at Gilbert-Baker Wildlife Management Area.  Free rv and tent camping for everyone, no fees charged, that is the reason it's 3 stars.  Stay/camping in general limited to 3 days at a time.  If you have questions or want to confirm anything, call the Nebraska Game and Parks office/Conservation Officers at (402) 471-5531 and ask about the specific listed WMA area and regulations.

Note* As a rule:  All Nebraska WMA's are free to camp for everyone.  Check signs as you enter for each WMA's specific's regulations, if there are any.  Signage may post longer allowed stay's, so check signage.  If you want electrical and water hookups for rv's, you will need to go to a $pay fee "Nebraska State Parks" or city run parks, which are really nice but might not be free, like the free Nebraska WMA's.

name: Peterson Wildlife Management Area
description:
Wildlife Management Area (Nebraska MWA) at Peterson Wildlife Management Area.  Free rv and tent camping for everyone, no fees charged, that is the reason it's 3 stars.  Stay/camping limited to 3 days at a time as a general rule.  Check signage to verify.  Nice area.  Roads are gravel/dirt.

Note* As a rule:  If you have questions or want to confirm the posed signage, call (402) 471-5531 for a Nebraska Gane and Park conservation officer/ranger.  All Nebraska WMA's are free to camp for everyone.  Check signs as you enter for each WMA's specific's regulations, if there are any.
