description: There is a grassy area and agravel section, tent’s also possible, it’s between Carlson Center and Chena River. Almost in the center of Fairbanks. Pioneer Park just a 5 minute walk. Certainly you can hear the traffic, but way not as much as at any Walmart.

name: Sheep Creek Slough
description: River access for anglers. About 1mile from highway. Big parking lot. Very quiet.

name: Crazy Gulch NFS
description: Pike National Forest. Open grazing area with access thru green gates. Camp anywhere.  Pass thru green gate.  Snowy in winter, great in summer.

name: Gas station 76
description: Cheap diesel and propane available. Ideal before crossing the border to Baja California.

name: Sunset Point
description:
A forest road between Lily Lake and Rocky Point leads up to this amazing camp spot with a great sunset!
The road leading to the spot is unmarked and at 46°38′41.9″N 114°22′28.87″W

name: Veterans Memorial Park
description: Open park setting. No hook ups or water, there are porta potties and the Wisconsin River runs right next to it. Plenty of fire pits and picnic tables, also has a nice boat launch and canoe landings.

name: Minidoka Wildlife Refuge Boat Ramp - Snake River
description: This is boat ramp parking area just ouside Lake Walcott park.  Lots of birdlife and the roar of the river.  we stayed overnight OK.  There were also cars at a picnic area on the opposite side of the river.  42.672956, -113.494704

name: Dolores - San Juan Nf
description:
Nice spot everywhere during 2mi with fire pit 
no services 
road paved at 200ft 
(campground 14 days free )

name: Jbm garage
description: You will find him just behind the gasstation and supermarket, in Leads. before going down the hill. Really friendly and helpfull guy.

name: Street Parking
description: Big gravel quarry set back from road. No signs forbidding entry or camping. Popular with overlanders. Good signal.

name: Park and ride at The American Center
description: A park and ride with a city of Madison bus stop. 2 days maximum parking. There is a 24 hour Kwik Trip And restaurants close by.

name: Great views from cell tower
description: Camp spot up on the small hill at the cell tower facility with amazing views through the trees. If you drive 50 more yards down the road you will have an epic 360 view at the point.  We couldn't camp there because someone else nabbed it first.

name: Parking at viewpoint
description: Parking spot at a viewpoint on the mountains. Close to the road, but good for a night's sleep.

name: Santaway Park Camping
description:
Great informal campground. Entrance looks like a cemetery entryway. Large open field for tents, a sizable pavilion, and spigot were located at the main entrance. Further down the well-worn dirt road were a handful of campsites, a cul-de-sac at the bottom had walking access to another open area by the lake where you could easily fit a half-dozen tents. We got 7 overland Jeeps/Toyotas to fit, and had an fire going in the fire pit. 

There was a ports-potty on site, as well as a spigot at the top of the hill, though we didn't test the functionality of it. Definitely a great place if you need to set a tent or park an SUV sized or smaller rig for the night.
No generators, please.

name: Chevron
description: No long offer RV dump but do offer potable water

name: River Bridge Campground
description: super mellow spot away from any roads. only 11 sites. no water but river is adjoining. there's a few more spots like this around but this place had spots at 5:00 pm on a thursday in july. 8$

name: Tuchuk CG
description: Flat free forest service campground amidst huckleberries.

name: Helena state forest - free
description: Stunning site for tent or RV right on the river.  There are about 8 camp sites around but this one is the best.  You can swim in the river and use it for cooking.  A pit latrine is nearby.

name: NPS Blackwoods Campground
description:
Pretty campground with all amenities except oddly no showers? 

Price $30pn with park pass
          $25-$85 park pass

name: fivemile meadow
description: PA forest service site. Ring and table 100% free just need to call or email for a free permit 570-895-4001. The PA Delaware State forest adminsters it and several others in the area

name: spot in plumas national forest
description:
first off, we didn't stay her; we point stopped to bathe in the river.
nice spot, with river pool and fire ring (watch it, don't just let it burn)

name: Roubideau Creek
description:
BLM suggested camping area. No services, pack everything out please!

Multiple camping areas along the creek in the canyon. Sand and riverstone. Possible flooding if excessive raining.

name: Teton Canyon Road
description:
National forest camping 12$ per single site. tables, benches, fire places, pit toiletts and garbage cans available. before and after the campground are many sites for dispersed camping.

Road closed to site Nov 19 until Fri before Memorial Day. Parking lot has “Day Use Only” signs.

name: Martin creek under the trees
description: Nice place under the trees. Fire pit. Close to the road but it's a small road. Quiet. Few meters from the river.

name: one or two spots
description:
one maybe two spots near the highway. because of the trees gps might be a little off. (give or take 40ft) one large fire ring. one smaller. Plenty of road noise but it dies down at night. not sure who owns this, but it seems to be minimally traveled, maybe 10 fires done in the ring.

no Verizon cell service if that bothers you.

name: Cedar Creek Primitive CG
description: 2 sites, one next to river, off Hwy 83, just across bridge.  River drowns hwy noise.

name: Border crossing south of Creston
description: Pretty easy bordercrossing into USA. No waiting times and friendly officer. He even let us take our fruit into the States.

name: Clean pulblic showers and restrooms at the harbor
description: Hot showers for only $2 for 7 minutes. There is a money change machine next to the door where you can change $1 bills only. Water is HOT with great water pressure. Fairly clean.

name: Public showers at Harbour Master
description: Clean showers at the boat harbor in Skagway. 25 cents for 1,5 minutes. Open 24/7. Very good. Also 2 more showers at the rear.

name: Dyea road on the river
description:
A huge gravel place on the river with two spots + fire ring right next to the river. There is more space for big rigs in the middle of the gravel place. It's close to Dyea road but at the end so no traffic at all at night. A ranger drove by at the evening and it is absolutely okay to camp here although it is the national historical park. 

10 miles from Skagway. Narrow winding road and single lane bridges. Not for large RV.

name: Grassland
description: All the way of a cow track there is this huge meadow/grassland hidden from the road where you can park for a night or few days. This spot is in a National Grassland so it is allowed to stay there. Beautiful landscape but not for long RV without clearance and can be muddy in raining time. 360° view on the top.

name: National Forest Road 803
description: Two sites with fire pits overlooking the river and trees below. There are several other pull outs along Forest Road 803 if you drive further in. Great view of the Flathead river valley. Good T mobile and Verizon service.

name: Trout Lake Campground Free
description:
Campground in the Colville National Forest. Free stay for max. 14 days. A handful sites whereas three of them are suitable for an overland vehicle. I was the only person at a Monday. 
Firepits, lake and a stream.

name: Meadows Campground
description:
Campground in the National Forest. Beautiful location, tons of hiking opportunity and nice mountain gravel roads. No trailers!
$8 per night, will change in 2018 to $10 (still $8 in 2019, not sure when change will occur)

name: Hidden Lake Trail
description: One spot on the road to the hidden lake trail head. Fire pit.

name: DPS Diesel Pickup Specialists
description: Our old European Mercedes diesel truck broke down, we called DPS and they made instant time for us as we arrived. Extremely kind and helpfull people, they had our truck back on the road in an hour.

name: Théodore Roosevelt park dump + water
description:
Dump station + potable water at the entrance of the campground. Even if you don't stay in the campground.

The Water and Dump are located in the North Unit of Theodore Roosevelt National Park. South Unit has water but no dump station.

name: Bay View State Park
description: Sites are within wooded location across from the shoreline. Plenty of room for small RV/vans.

name: In the middle nowhere
description:
Good place in the desert !!!

No amenities !!!

Not far away only 1km from the highway but quiet !!!

Great place 🏜

name: backside of Tahoe
description: Since there is no way to find dispersed camping on Lake Tahoe we found this lovely spot above Carson City

name: Elk Lake Campground
description:
Nice place on a warm lake (shallow not hot spring) small boat ramp for non-motorized boats. about 10 spots $10/night. Pit Toilets. no trash, toilet paper, or potable water. get water at Humbug campground before driving up. Road is quite rough but i saw a few subarus and even a camping trailer. 

seems relatively popular so may be full on summer weekends. 

much cooler than the valley below.

name: Holter Dam Campground
description: 10$ a night per campspot. Right on the river. You can see the dam. We only had lunch here, but seems like a nice place for the night.

name: Roadside pullout
description: shady pine trees, next to river.  Watch rafters pass by. Cool off in the water. noisy traffic during the day, but quiet at night.  lots of more options within 15min drive north on hw55

name: Wildrose
description:
Water, quiet, no shadow, free, picnic tables, clean pit toilets.
Great and cool place in the heights of Death Valley

name: Ballarat ghost town
description:
Freedom zone, a couple of buildings from old 1800s mining town. Camping free (or $5 to stay in old jail/morgue).

Nice sky views. Good if you're passing thru to the park

name: Rest Area Hwy 12 Clearwater River Idaho
description: Nice rest area with large meadows, picknick tables, really quiet. There is an area for big vehicles (mostly used by trucks) and one for cars that fits RV's up to 22 feet. It is allowed to stay here up to 16 hours. Dumpstation including potable water is right on this place.

name: Challis Salmon River Jct 93/75
description: Dump Station with potable water. Really clean.

name: Walker City Park
description: We couln't find a good spot in the nationals forest so we came here. This is a parking lot in a park, without sign "no parking at night". Grassy areas all around, benches, tables with roof and bbq, lake in front with a beach (you can swim) and a huge playing area on the other side of the park. (where you can also spend the night but there are houses)

name: Edgar Evins State Park
description: Wooden Decks overlooking the lake. More than enough sites to choose from. playground for kids and more than enough bathrooms. if you don't like to walk up hills not the place for you. lots of upward terrain.

name: Water dump and water
description: What can you say... water dump and fresh water....next to a park.

name: jocko hollow
description: Lovely small private campsite, just off the highway.  $18 a night, pay showers, nice clean washrooms.

name: Nenana RV and Campground
description: Nenana RV Park & Campground is a full service facility that is conveniently located  55 miles southwest of Fairbanks and 75 miles north of Denali National Park.  In Nenana you will find time to relax and enjoy yourself while away. .Come enjoy a relaxing stay in Nenana while seeing Alaska's most visited destinations and discover indigenous Alaskan living. The friendly village of Nenana is an easily accessible experience of authentic native and rural life in Alaska. Nestled within the Alaska range near two rivers, the quiet village of Nenana is the perfect spot to rest.  Please take time to browse our site and learn what you can do while staying at the Nenana RV Park & Campground!

name: Spot in the desert 🌵
description:
Close to the highway, but cannot really hear the cars (freeway is about a mile away). Be careful for the vehicle with a very bass clearance the access of the dirt road it's quite difficult. No amenities. FREE 

Great cell reception: 5 bars LTE T-Mobile data
Verizon hotspot 3 bars 4G LTE

There are spots for big rigs on the side of the dirt road, but you won’t be able to pull into a spot off of it.

name: Old work area
description:
Great views. Near a repeater station and just before a scenic pull off. Right hand side going north.

Weak data but sensational views.   Not for really wet times. Summer. Solid base and flat

name: Chevron Gas Station
description: parking Gas Station  Chevron quiet, free overnight

name: Walmart Porterville
description: Overnight 1250 W Henderson Ave, Porterville, California.

name: Cottonwood Springs Lake - Army COE
description:
Note - seasonally closed for camping October to ???

$10 night - 50% off with Senior or Interagency park pass. Interior roads are paved and a good gravel road leading in. Clean, quiet, well kept Campground. Hot/cold water in bathrooms. Host on site and patrolled daily by ranger. No hook-ups or dump. Nice fishing and picnic areas on the lake.

name: Free former campground at MP 65
description: Former campground, no services, no signs, no payment! 6 official sites, some more small spots around. Located west of the Hwy to/from Valdez, next to Mile Post 65. Nice spot, only some traffic on the road at night. We had a wounderful evening/night here.

name: Elma Rest Area
description:
Free dumpsite with potable and non-potable water. 
Washrooms 24h

name: Tok RV Village
description: This place is an RV parking lot with a few tent sites.  Tent sites are $33 a night.  Hot showers, laundry, and electricity.

name: Forest Acres Municipal Campground
description: Nice forested campground in Seward.  The beach campgrounds were very windy, none here.  Good for a tent.  Lots of road noise, bring ear plugs.  Water, flush toilets and fire pits. $10 a night for tent, $20 for RV.

name: Williwaw Forest Service Campground
description: Nice Forest Service campground, sites are very private.  $18 a night.  Pit toilets.  There are water taps, but the water is slightly brown, so don't depend on it.  Very close to Portage Glacier Cruise.

name: Olympic Pennisula/Port Angeles KOA
description: Typical KOA.  Hot showers, laundry, cabin rentals, swimming pool, hot tub. $35 a night for tent.  Lots of road noise, but you can reserve for when you are coming in on the ferry late at night.

name: Nice couple's home
description: This is an older couple's home.  They have set up a campground on their property.  It is very nice. Nice grassy areas for tent.  Great area for kids and dogs to run around.  The hosts are very friendly and helpful.  There is a flush toilet and primitive hot shower.  $15 for dry site, $25 for electric.  They also have a cabin for rent.

name: Tidelands Campground
description: Nice campground with large sites.  They have tent and RV sites with varying degrees of hook ups.  $25 for tent site.  Access to the beach.  The beach was almost empty.  Very nice at sunset.  Flush toilets which were clean and newly remodeled.  The sinks need to be refurbished.  The showers were gross.  We didn't use them.  Reminds us of many campgrounds in Mexico.

name: KOA Mt St Helens
description: Not great.  It is like camping in a parking lot.  Tent sites are so crowded you can here every word that your neighbors say.  Expensive $38.  I needed laundry and to charge my battery, so I booked this place online.  Half of the washing machines were broken.  Wouldn't stay here again.

name: Cape Perpetua Forest Service Campground
description: OK campground.  Some sites are very private, but the majority are not.  Flush toilets, and potable water.  All the tent campgrounds were full for 30+ miles north, so we were glad to find a spot.  Wifi at the visitor center which can be reached over a short trail.

name: Crescent City KOA
description: Tent sites are great.  They are in the Redwoods and not on top of each other.  We struggled for the last week trying to find tent camping on the Pacific Coast Highway and finally made a reservation the day before here.  We were not disappointed.  $38 for tent site, which is pricey, but not to bad for the area.  Hot Showers

name: Willits KOA
description: This place is amazing.  Great for families.  They have so many amenities.  We were tired of pitching our tent, so we rented a Teepee at $60 a night and it included water and electric.  Tent sites are $40.  Amenities include swimming pool, splash park, kids wading pool, hot tub, petting zoo, old West town, ride on train, laundry, hot showers, arcade, sand volleyball, fishing and two playgrounds.  They even have RV sites with private hot tubs.  We were here on a Thursday night and they had a kids party with karaoke. The kids were having a ball.  On Saturday night they have special stuff for teens.

name: Nice parking area near river on Highway 70
description: It's a paved parking area right on the North Fork of the Feather River. Beautiful swimming area and spent the night tucked in the woods right on the water. Wonderful spot!

name: McCarthy Lake
description: lakeside campgrounds within Manistee National Forest. Please follow all National Forest rules. High clearance 4x4 recommended, can become crowded on weekends. please don't burn pallets or wood with steel straps.

name: Costanoa KOA
description: Paid KOA Campground with may facilities. call 1-650-879-1100 which is for this campground and it is open as of at least July 9, 2021

name: Woodhead Campground
description: Full service campground operated by Idaho Power Company.  Paved roads and sites.  Power and water only $16.  Free dump station. Free showers. Large boat ramp.  Wifi available, $5 a day.

name: Boat ramp area
description: Just a few miles south of the Hells Canyon dam.  remains of an old building make a great flat area to park next to the river.  Tree for shade. Boat ramp nearby if you want to kayak.  other options on this road are Hells Canyon Park, $16, Eagle Bar and Big Bar forest service areas

name: Wallowa Lake State Park
description: Standard campground, $30 full hookups, $20 tent site. Nice lake, good swimming.Temporarily closed but some day use areas like the marina and picnic areas are open to day use.

name: walmart
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 

very quiet walmart we slept with the van's dor open. closed to the fort macon state park

name: Salmon Harbor Marina
description: Public Showers and Restrooms. Showers $1 for first four minutes then .25 for each additional minute. Open to the public, you do not have to be staying at the campground. There are dish washing sinks on the back outside wall of each restroom. Only the furthest one has showers. There are also trash and recycling bins in the marina.

name: Salmon Harbor Marina Campground
description: Dry camping on the water in Winchester Bay. The prices changed in the Summer of 2020. $25/night, $150/week. The larger sites are: $30/night, 180/week . No reservations. Bathrooms, dishwashing sinks and pay showers. Dump station is $10 but camp host can give you a coupon for $5. Can walk to shops and restaurants. Can be very, very noisy when many people are running generators.

name: Spring Valley
description: Free parking at boatramp. Police said it is okay to stay over night and safe.

name: Hoh Oxbow Campground
description: This is a dry campground with 8 camping spots for almost any size rig.  There are several pull through spots that easily fit a 42' 5th wheel.  There is also a boat ramp that provides easy access to the river.  You must have the Washington Discovery Pass to stay here.  Each site has a picnic table and fire ring.  The sites are large enough to accommodate several tents and vehicles.

name: Lewis Park Campground
description: A campsite in a beautiful park...Electricity and water at the sites have been turned off by the city so as not to compete with paying campsites in town. Dump station for $5 donation encouraged. Restrooms also available across the park...max. 3 nights stay within 30 days...enjoy!!! Donations are encouraged.

name: Slickrock Campground
description: Nice campground with fair prices in high season...charged USD 20.- for a tent site, has space for RV's too...pool and all other facilities you need and perfect located near Moab, Arches & Co.!!! no way its 95 $ now

name: Grout Pond
description: Fee of $16 per site per night to camp.  Tent sites are available closer to the pond. Small parking lot ideal for van dwellers. Overnight parking available- 14 night Max allowed. Has a pump well with drinkable water just down the trail near the pond. One rustic toilet available near parking lot. Quiet at night, but busy during the day with visitors to the grout pond trail and paddlers. We spent a night there and was told about it by a park ranger.

name: Mt Ashland Campground
description: This is Mt Ashland Campground. I misspelled the name. Lots of sites with picnic tables and fire rings. Had a great signal with Verizon. No fee. 2 wheel drive is not a problem.

name: Portland Parking Lot
description:
just a regular parking lot next to the portland art museum (modern art) but we paid $10 for parking from 11:00am to 7:00am the next day. no one bothered us and it seemed relatively safe despite a bit of homelessness nearby (to be expected in most cities)

safeway nearby has a bathroom which you need a code/receipt to use. safeway is closed from 1:00 am to 5:00 am. 

i would guess that car camping is probably not allowed but no one seemed to care/notice
keep it clean and discreet

name: Snow Mobile Park
description: In the Forest near the Lava Beds Park, very quiet

name: free Campground
description: near the wheeler geological area

name: Coquille Myrtle Grove State Natural Site Myrtle Point
description: A riverside bank pebble bar. Only about 100 meters from the road but you can be completely hidden. No signs other than state park turnoff.

name: waldon town park
description: Was told we can camp (tent) here by locals in gas station. grass, trees, shade, benches,  restrooms, cold water, close by town.. kids park/baseball field.. brought motos in park and hid them in trees.

name: Lonetree Camprgound
description: Several (8) palaba type huts, and even more spaces without the huts, each with picnic table and fire pit/grill overlooking reservoir. Huge Grassy area, lots of space. Good for all vehicles. Nobody here in the height of summer! Clean pit toilets (2). Can hear road a bit but for FREE its great. There's a water pump. I drank it. Feeling fine this morning!

name: Coquille Myrtle Grove State Natural Site
description:
River banks access next to Myrtle Point State Park.
No camping sign at park, no signs at river bank spur.
Only 50 yards from the road so there is some noise.
Isolated and hidden but people do come down there once in a while.

name: Morristown
description: Quiet at night. Great view Restrooms with hot showers. Power only to charge a phone or camera in the restrooms or at the dock.

name: Vedauwoo Climbing Area
description: Dispersed area camping is still open. I'm unsure of the actual climbing area though. Got some wind at night, and snow in the morning. Enjoyed the scenery and peace away from the highway even though you can see it in the horizon. Campsite #5 was a great pull through.

name: Clearwater Creek Wayside
description: One of the many places to stay on the Denali Highway but this one has two toilets, picnic tables, and fire rings! No "no camping" signs. We didn't have any problems since it's BLM land. Right off the road but very quiet at night. Beautiful mountain views at all the pullouts on Denali Hwy.

name: Beaver Peak with a view
description: This spot about 10 miles up usfs beaver peak road near the top of Beaver Peak has pretty great views and is very private. There are huckleberry bushes all around but few berries left on 8/11/17. Pretty tight road for a full size near the top but passable. Follow beaver pk road until it forks near these coordinates and follow the switchback to the left. Site is about 1/4 mile up on right.

name: Morgan Lake
description: Free county campground.  Only 8 sites next to the lake, well spaced for privacy. some with shade.  access road is a little rough, but our 24ft Class C managed OK. max 3 night stay. It was late so I settled for Birdtrack Spring campground near by.

name: North Fork John Day Forest Campground
description: nice clean and quiet campground. $8. Close to  a small river.  Alternatively there are lots of free sites along the road to Sumpter.

name: dump free
description: free dump, free drinking water ............what else

name: the dear mountain spot
description: near the road to Helena , small parking to stop for the night . nozy but there is no many car on the night . good view on the wildlife . Some dears comes drink water on a small stream . Better than Walmart...

name: NF55 logging parking
description: A steep logging parking clearing just off National Forest Road 55. Only a few miles away from highway 101 in the Siuslaw National Forest. 4WD likely requires to get up the 25 yards to the flat camping spot. Very high perch with vista view of clear cut area and the forest as well as the west direction to the ocean.

name: Walt Haring Sno-park
description: Dump station (5 $ fee) and camping free (14 days)  ! Very quiet and near the 97 highway. Pits toilets, table and bbq....

name: Shasta campground
description:
About 30 sites, restrooms, water, fire ring and very quiet ! 
Trails and bike route : 18 mile to Redding only by paved trail.
Access by the dam of Shasta. 10 $ per night and per vehicle.

name: Malheur National Forest
description: Driving through the forest until it opens up. Views onto some greenish hills next to a small river. No moskitos. There are several spots in the forest along the road.

name: Near Bonneville Salt Flats
description:
Take I-80 & Exit 4 to the Bonneville Speedway. Follow the road on the left at the fork to the speedway and then you find plenty of space on BLM-land. Quiet & nice views.
GREAT CELLULAR SIGNALS!

name: Showers in Sisters
description:
Clean and hot showers in Sisters. 
1$ per 2 minutes. 
Looks like the shower hours are 7am to 5pm, but look like hours vary on the season.

name: Spenard Hostel
description: Hot showers for travelers, towel included, $5. (open 'til 11pm)

name: dump station & water
description: dump station at cenex petrol station , free potable water .

name: the Pony stop
description:
If you are lost near here ...Small stop to stay one night . Very small place to stay near a narrow road .A place if you can't drive after a good evening at the Pony Bar . where you can find local music on the weekend . 
Ok for us for one night with my Rv of 24 feets. Very nice people on this small
 town ...

name: Cape Lookout National Seashore
description:
ATTENTION: Unless you are renting a Cabin at the point where the Ferry drops you off (34.761196, -76.413137), YOU MUST HAVE A 4X4 Vehicle. All the roads (14 miles of it) are sand roads. This is a solitude beach heaven unlike any other on the east coast. Yo can literally drive on the beach if that is what you want to do. It is simply amazing! 

HOW TO GET THERE WITH YOUR RV: You have to get to Davis, North Carolina and take the Ferry from there to Cape Lookout (about three miles off shore). YOU MUST MAKE A RESERVATION AHEAD OF TIME (http://davisferry.com/). If you are the only one getting there, you will have the VIP treatment on their "one vehicle" ferry. We could not believe it the first time we went there but boy was it fun to ride with two feet of your rig hanging over the back of the small ferry. Otherwise it is a four vehicle ferry. Once you are on Cape Lookout you may go wherever your heart desires. Just remember that you cannot camp within 100 yards of any structure and there are very few structures indeed. 

Bathrooms and showers (HOT SHOWERS) can be used at the Cabin area. There are no showers at the lighthouse but there are bathrooms. These are the only two places where there are bathrooms and they are ten miles apart.

You can climb the lighthouse or you may also visit the old, and abandoned, Cape Lookout Coast Guard Station. 

NATURE TIP:  If you are here on a full moon during the summer, you can literally simultaneously watch the Moon rise on the east while the sun sets on the west. We have never seen anything like it in our lives. It is simply beautiful beyond believe.

name: Falls creek campground
description: River outfitters headquarters, full hookups and primitive.  $17 for primitive, laundry, water, super clean bathrooms.  Dania the manager is incredibly kind and helpful

name: Siletz Highway OR-229
description:
At roughly mile 12 from 101 on Siletz highway south. A narrow jungle like vehicle path in the forest toward the Siletz river. Possible old electrical poles service path. Very tight clearance to trees and large ferns all around. Our camper is 6.4m long, 2.3m wide by 3.45m high and we could have gone in further.
We parked right on the path when the trees got very close to the camper. Maybe 100 yards hidden off the highway.

name: Sand Lake Recreation Area on beach
description: Enter beach area of the OHV area at Sand Lake Recreation Area. 1.4 miles of beach available for camping. Sign says DAY USE. Camping site host at area entrance was very courteous and said OK to camp on beach away from waterline. Not driven in OHV area after dark. A very exposed place for tents but ideal for big rigs with 4WD. Air down before you start on the sand. Noisy until after sunset due to people enjoying their sand toys. Will need a flag to fly on your vehicle as required per signs.

name: BLM free camping & fishing
description:
Nice place at the reservoir and before with firepit and small river 
free camping and fishing.
very easy to access !

name: Lutak Inlet / Chilkoot Inlet
description: Many free spots for a night or two direct near the Lutak or Chilkoot Inlet on Lutak Road. Aprox. 1 km east of ferry terminal there is one paved parking lot with pit toilet, west of ferry terminal just pull outs from the road. We stayed some days in both positions, no problems. No traffic at night!

name: exit glacier roadside
description: a legal place where overnight on the road to exit glacier with great views, close  to the river, we saw eagles bald there

name: Ferry County Fair, public campground
description: a large place. excellent . 10$ tent $20 rv

name: Memaloose Overlook
description: Tired of parks by the I84 and railway line? Try this little spot for overnight.  We had dinner in Mosier at the Indonesian food cart (Fri-Sun only) then parked up here for a quiet night.  Don't forget to do the Mosier twin tunnels trail while you are here.

name: Gateway Camping at Floyd Bennett Field
description: National Park with Camping. $30 per site. Laud during the day with cars rushing in and out and helicopters at low level. But at night absolutly quiet. They have walkin tentsites, drivein tentsites and big sites for RVs. No power, meaning RVs could run Generators or Mainengien all day and night. Boondocking is not posible, parkranger check at night. Take the Q35 Bus and Subway to Manhattan about 1h. You can park your car at the Visitorcentre near the Busstop during daytime.

name: Thomas mountain summit
description: A lot of great campspots on the dirt road up to thomas mountain.. Benches and grill pits and stunning views

name: O'Brien Creek
description: A small area between the creek and the road. About 4 camp rings. Close to the road but quiet and you are right on the Creek. Good spot to stop for the night.

name: Robinson Lake
description: USFS CAMPGROUND. ONLY 10 sites a short walk to small lake.  Pit toilets, no electricity, potable water available. $15 US per night.

name: Midland Rest Area
description: Bathrooms, WIFI, and vending machines. WIFI.

name: Joyful Journey Hot Springs
description:
Nice hot springs/sauna for $12 if you say you're local, they have camping here in an open grass lot, also you can rent a room.  Surrounded by beautiful mountains here in the middle of nowhere.  Check out their website for more info.  Open 9am-10pm daily.

Expensive camping but the hot springs are good.  Crestone is nearby if you need groceries, there are a couple spots but a little expensive.

DRY RV AND TENT CAMPING:

RV Single Occupancy — $45
RV Single Occupancy (with Electric) — $55
RV Double Occupancy — $60
RV Double Occupancy (with Electric) — $70

Camp Site Single Occupancy — $45
Camp Site Double Occupancy — $60
Each Additional Adult — $25
Each Additional Child (4-14) — $15

Check-in time 4 PM  •  Check-out time 11 AM
Cancellation Policy; 48 hours prior to 8:00 AM of check-in date to receive full refund. 50% deposit due at time of reservation.
Weekend and holiday rates will vary.

Check-out after 11am will result in a charge of $30/hr.

Pet Policy: $30 Pet cleaning fee for yurt and hotel.  $10 in Tipi and camping. 
http://joyfuljourneyhotsprings.com/

name: wilton community campground
description:
Nice little campground. $7/night. coin showers, coin laundry, library in 3 min walking distance with good Wi-Fi. power and water hookups at some sites, though that costs more.

spent 2 days, good place.

name: Larch Mountain Rd
description: visit Sherrard Viewpoint at the end of Larch mtn Rd.  Views of 5 mountains, picnic tables, pit toilets, but no overnight camping.  Park overnight at this spot, so quiet !

name: Skalkaho Rye Road
description:
Several disperse campsites under large trees! Some are big enough for large rigs and some are a bit more secluded.
Take Montana Hwy 38 leaving Hamilton, for about 13.5 miles. After you pass Black Bear Campground on the right, there will be a dirt road on the right that is Skalkaho Rye, there are spots on the left and right!

name: Wild camp in national forest
description: Great opportunities for lots of wild camping along this road. We stayed pretty far up, above a creek. Private and quiet.

name: At Deschute river
description: Nice place directly at the Deschute river. Locals were fishing here but nobody stayed the night. It was quiet and dark. :)

name: Montana River riverbed - by the bridge
description: South side of bridge has informal spots on both sides.  Many existing firepits.  Great location and Yoder Road (mile marker 3.1) is a pretty quiet road.

name: Juneaus Lot
description: Large dirt parking lot away from the road and just beyond the Camp Richardson Resort. Spent all night here without worry. Spotty cell service.

name: Valdez Library - free wifi
description:
We stayed over night at the library, no sign
free, slow wifi

name: Homer Split - Dump and water
description:
Dumping $5.
Water is $5 and is located on the restroom building, opposite the dump station.

name: park lake campground
description: Nice campground close to a lake. plenty of sites, $15/night. good gravel road with plenty of washboard

name: spot in the forrest
description: nice place off a small gravel road. Fire ring and was quiet

name: Burton Hill trailhead
description: space at trailhead, nice views all around. ok gravel road leads here

name: National Forest Dispersed Campground
description: Dispersed campground with several spots in the National forest. Very nice and very close to the Rocky Mountain National Park. Quiet and refreshing night! Free. No Services.

name: Fort Townsend State Park
description: Hiker/biker site for $12. Other camping (RV, etc) typically 100% reserved in the summer. Great area in the trees.

name: Stampede Trail pullout
description:
Rustic camp Spot in the trees. Rock fire ring, flat ground, 50 feet off trail.

Nice spot before the water crossings. Good 4wd or hiking necessary to get here. Many water holes to cross in the trail to get here.

name: B&C Laundry & Showers
description:
Laundry and showers. 
Showers $4,75 USD/15min hot water.  (Sharing is not permitted.)
Open 7am -8:30pm daily.

name: Haines Alaska along Lynn Canal-Chilkoot Inlet
description: There are several great boondocking sites along the highway just outside of Haines. Some are gravel and some are paved.  A few spots specifically say no camping but many of them do not. We've been at this site for 3 nights and it's been great! Some road traffic but it's not a busy road.

name: Seward Community Library Museum - free wifi
description:
free wifi, med to fast forward ok
no password. Printing facilities

name: Centralia
description: Underground coal fire since the 60. Graffitiroad. Absolutly no acces to the road by car, Jeep or even a bike.

name: Lock Haven
description: Parking lot with Boatramp. Picnick tables. Road directly near by, but its not that loud. Power only in the Ladies Restrooms.

name: Harisonburg
description: Boondocking at Walmart

name: Walmart Boone
description: Boondocking at Walmart. Near to Blue Ridge Parkway. Loud in the late evening.

name: Black Hills, NFS road, close to Hill City
description:
Perfect boondocking spot. Can accommodate one small rig with a few others. 

LOCATION:
Close to hill city (5 min drive back to town). Seen: Deer, Wild Turkeys, Elk, Bobcat tracks. 

ROAD TO:
Narrow, mildly rough dirt road. SUV/Truck clearance recommended, but a good driver could probably navigate a car. 4 wheel drive may be required in wet weather, can be muddy.

SERVICE:
4 Bars LTE AT&T & 1 Bar LTE Verizon

NOTES:
VERY FEW TURN AROUNDS, May be difficult for folks with trailers, or vehicles over 24ft.

If you stop off at any US Forest Service office (we stopped in Rapid City) they have free maps showing where Dispersed Camping (boondocking) is allowed in their forests which is virtually anywhere within 300ft along their roads. The trick is finding flat spots and making sure you are not on private land or restricted area.

name: North Fork John Day River Campsite
description: Flat spot next to river in the trees. Some shade. Lots of smallmouth bass.  Good for an RV or up to 6 vehicles. No one was here on a Saturday.

name: Beautiful spot at river
description: Beautiful spot off the cascade river road near cascade pass trailhead. You should be able to get here also without 4x4, however low hanging tree branches might be in your way :) there are at least two other spots along the road which are easier to get to but not on the river.

name: Quinault National Forest
description:
Calm spot in the National Forest. Your car will get scratched if you go all the way to the end of the road. Halfway is another, bigger spot. There are other spots along the main forest road. 
There are mosquitos.

name: Mt. Rainier View
description:
Spot with firepit and amazing view of Mt. Rainier in the National Forest. 
The road to get there has some low hanging branches but should be passable if your car is not too high. Apart from that, the road can be traveled with any car, no big rigs. 
May 2021. Didn’t see any low branches when I stayed.

name: bluegill hole
description:
Park is currently closed 5/21/20.

Boat ramp with no posted signs. 2 pit toilets, bad condition.
Lots of bugs. LOTS.

Other than the sound of bugs trying to ram their way into your vehicle. it's a quiet place. there is a grassy section to possibly pitch a tent. But I don't know if you could actually get away with it.

name: BLM Land on the John Day River
description: Dirt road with free dispersed camping on the river; great swimming hole; some spots in trees available; 4WD helpful, but definitely not required; read up on river permits (for boating/SUPing, etc.) and seasonal campfire regulations in advance

name: Forest Service Roads Outside Madras
description: Dense, expansive network of forest service roads with endless options for free dispersed camping; make sure you have enough water-- quite hot/dry in August

name: Bobcat gulch
description: Ok spot for the night or it you happen to be floating the Salmon river. Several campsites and a large clearing for any size rig. This section of the Salmon river has 6 or so of these rafting put in/take out points in a 10 mile stretch so if this area is taken just keep driving and you see another every couple miles. Great for a night, not much road traffic at night, quiet

name: Malheur Forest pull off
description: Nearly level campspot with territorial view to the east. 4x4 only.

name: Rampart reservoir dispersed camping
description:
In the shadow of Pikes Peak! This is dispersed camping, no services, only cleared parking and fire pits. If you want a campgrounds with more services the Rampart Reservoir Campgrounds is 1/4 mile down the road for $6.00 a night! I'm here because I waited too long and the reservoir was full. Click here for more info:
https://tinyurl.com/ya4h7rnj

name: Yellow post #29
description: One of the many free "yellow post" sites near Big Bear Lake, CA. Beautiful pine forest, huge boulders, scenic views, blue sky, fresh air, above LA.

name: The eclipse camp
description: Good place near the lake  ,ok for my RV 24 ft . Some people swimming here , there is a small beach and a picnic table at the another size of the bridge . One fire place . Take care if you go down , it Is wet . We past a nice time here during the eclipse 2017 ;)

name: Wind River Hotel and Casino
description: Parking behind the casino, toilet and garbage can available. Good if you don't lose some money at blackjack ;) Wifi extends to the parking lot.

name: BLM  John Days
description: Small BLM location for approximately 25 vehicles and tents. Close to John Days Painted Hills. No facilities. Quiet, some shade and good for one or two nights. Small creek along camp. Accessible for rigs up to 30ft.

name: Bixby Access Area
description: Open flat space with one fire ring and plenty of space. Easy gravel road for any vehicle. Quiet, except for occasional train. Lots of trees for hammocks.

name: Wild Camping in front of Glacier
description:
Wild camp site next to the Highway. Far enough in order to avoid noize. Haul on the gravel road but we had a small car and we didnt have any issue. 
we found some wood to start a fire but there is no tree. 
Beautiful view on a glacier with the sun until late. 
Big enough to have lots of cars!! And tents.

name: old horseshoe road
description: dispersed camping along a gravelroad. couple of places. national forest, little stream behind this spot

name: Hot springs and shower
description: Free bathhouse with showers. You can use it for 20 minutes.  open daily. communal showers. the website says the park has an entry fee but there's nowhere to pay, just lots of donation points.

name: Mud Creek
description: Uinta National Forest Area where you can stay up to 14 days. Nice view. Quiet.

name: Newhalem Campground North Cascades National Park
description: Wonderful Park with lots of shaded trees and privacy. Cost $16 USD or $8 USD with America the Beautiful Pass. Good for large rigs up to 35 feet. Free dump, no admission fee. Fresh water and tank flush connection.

name: Rawlins Fairgrounds
description: Free to $15 dependent on event schedule. Power, toilets, showers, conveniently located to downtown.

name: New Jersey parking lot with a view
description:
Comment: 11/2017  Got kick out by a towing during the night no overnight tolerate anymore 

Amazing place with a traders joe and other amenities like kuppicoffe with wifi and you can plug your laptop. The parking lot is not crowded, it's safe, you have a hotel nearby. No cost and you can leave the car during the day. Bus to New York!! There is wifi but you have to ask password at kuppicoffee

name: Wind River Campground
description: campground south of pinedale. nice host, wifi, laundry, showers and a book exchange. 21$ for a tent.

name: Oreville Campground USFS
description: Forest Service campground. Very well maintained, but near the highway with some road noise. Water, firepits, pit toilets, tables, cell service is weak. $20 a night or $10 with National Parks pass

name: McCoys Ferry - C&O Canal National Historic Park
description:
A 13 Site Quiet campground on the bank of the Potomac River.
Please note that you have to go through a tunnel that is listed as 10ft, 3 in clearance but our camper has a clearance of 8 ft. 6 inches...look at the pictures for an idea the actual headroom.
Nice mature trees to provide shade.

name: Rosebud Canyon Campground
description: Complete National Forest Campground ! Nice sites among trees and next to a river

name: Emerald Lake Disperse Camping
description: About 6 sites among trees right before you reach Emerald lake. It will be on the left. Look for fire rings and about 3 dirt roads heading into the woods.

name: Poverty Flats
description: Awesome site right off the roadway. Extremely quiet overlooking the Moapa Valley. We pulled in around 830pm and were the only ones here. A Subaru pulled in shortly after and parked several hundred feet away. It's hot. like the heat you get when you open up the oven to check your food hot. This is at 10pm. Bring your beer and sleep naked. Strong 4g signal with Verizon and TMobile.

name: Aztek Wash
description: Come from Southbound 95 onto an unnamed FR route. Paste the coordinates into your mapping app while you have good GPS signal. The trail to get here was rated as "Easy" online but it was more of a much more technical than I originally anticipated. Small 4wd trucks only with lift and oversized tires. 4Lo was needed on several occasions. Many places on the trail were washed out and numerous had 1 to 2ft stairsteps. Tight switchbacks, and steep, loose grades. You will finally arrive at the prize. A pristine cove leading into the waters of the Colorado River. A pink, white, and gray mountain make the backdrop amazing.

name: Tahoe NF pullout
description: Flat pullout next to a Forest Service Route. Exceptionally clean, zero traffic. Easy access but you need some clearance. Subaru will do fine.

name: Sky City Travel Center
description: Ok for one night. Shop and mc donalds 24 hs. Behind is a big parking lot. Near to the casino slow WiFi available.

name: Breakdown hill rest area
description: A friend had a breakdown and spent the night by the rest area. Close to a river, nothing special.

name: By the lake, 80m from Dalton
description: Nice place to overnight by a small lake. No facilities. It is about 80m from the road at the end of a short gravel road. It fits two small cars or a small rig. We positioned our rig of 6.5m / 19.5ft perpendicular to the road with our side / door facing the lake. It gave us some privacy. You won't be able to turn around if your rig is longer than ours, but can still reverse as Dalton is just about 80m away on a straight line. You can still hear the road during the day yet there is no traffic overnight. We had a very good night here. Not brilliant but very good, specially if you are tired as we were :-)

name: Water and dump at Sourdough gas station
description: On the back of the station: free potable water and dump station.

name: Mayersville
description: On the banks of the Mississippi. Absolutly alone. Free. Police said, its okay to stay there and safe. Big Rigs could have a hight problem, due to low treebranches.

name: Wrinkled Rock Trailhead
description: Near Mount Rushmore. Pit Toilets. Quiet. Recommended by the ranger. Gets very busy with climbers. No vehicles over 24ft or generators. Lots of tent spot that are generally uneven.

name: Mt. Rainier view #2
description: Same area, further up the road. The view to Rainier is a bit blocked by trees, on the other hand, you can see to the other side as well since this spot is on the ridge.

name: Free Site Near Mowich Lake
description: Mowich Lake campground has only 10 walk-in spots (car parked at trailhead). This spot is just outside the national park about 200m off the main road in the forest and has a firepit. There might be additional spots along the path, I didn't go look any further.

name: Near Mt. St. Helens
description: Multiple spots in the Gifford Pinchot National Forest close to Ryan Lake. Currently (summer 17) the Forest Road 26 is closed after Ryan Lake, thus you have to come from south if you wanna stay here.

name: View of Adams and Helens
description: A much nicer place than the other in this area. View of Mt. Adams and St. Helens!

name: Site with a view
description: This one is a bit though to get to and definitely needs 4x4 and high clearance, there are a few washouts to cross. However, I think it's worth it! Very quite and a nice view of Mt. St. Helens.

name: Tillamook State Forest
description: Not an exceptional spot but quite and close to Cannon beach :)

name: Vitus/Trapper Creek Trading Post
description:
Public showers. Nice, heated, spotless private bathrooms, 5 USD/10min running hot water. Quarters only (they will make change for you).
Also, gas here is one dollar per gallon cheaper than at Cantwell Chevron.

name: FR93 in National Forest
description: This is an easy FR road that leads to a double track off to the right. The double track seems to stop a few hundred feet behind the FR road. This location has several trees to break the wind which seems to come heavily from the North, and a campsite free of trash and traffic. It's beautiful. See my pics for the best description I can give. Strong 4G with Verizon and TMobile. There are free range cattle that will approach you out of curiosity but will not bother you once they get bored of your presence. I did not see any aggressive bulls in the area.

name: Bass Pro Shops at the Pyramid parking lot
description:
close to visitor centre. 
you can ask the security car for overnight. no problem. quite.
Coordinates are wrong, bring us Downtown

name: Dispersed Camping
description: Not sure if it's state or federal land, but multiple sites. On the Badlands MVUM map it shows as dispersed camping, road open to all vehicles.  Awesome view of the Badlands from every site. Sites are spaced every 300-800m apart. Very roomy. Was here over the 4th of July weekend and everything from tents to RV's. Online, people say that after it rains RV's are unable/have a difficult time making it in due to road conditions.  Highly recommend over the official Badlands campsites.

name: 2870 Scenic Overlook
description: Mountain campsite just off road 2870. Great views.

name: Free Camping
description: Free camping for max. 14 days. nice and quiet at a lake. No water. Only pit toilets. Coeur D'Arlene River Ranger District.

name: Leavenworth - Bavarian town
description: Small town like in Bavaria with beer, bratwurst and leberkäse. A lot of shops and food stuff. Nice for a break.

name: Riverview Campground
description: City park camping with WiFi and hot showers. No frills - basically an RV park, but good for a night. $10 dry camping or $25 with hook ups.

name: Tepui Tents
description: This is the site of Tepui Tents in Santa Cruz. We had our roof top tent repaired during a long term trip. Very kind and helpful. We stayed in their parking lot the night before due to them being closed when we arrived. No problem with LE, and staff was extremely friendly.

name: Delta Junction Library - free wifi
description:
free good wifi, no password
behind the Library is a gravel place, there is no sign so we stayed overnight, quiet, pit toilets not far at a sports ground

name: The end of route
description: The road to the reservoir close , we finish at the end on this narrow road . nothing special here but free . ok with my 24 feet rv. Just one place . some people must camp here and make some pit fire . ok for tent . Take care , there is lioons of mountains on this . the next road was close for that .  You can find some another place before on this small road ....Free ;)

name: FR 2848 Reid Creek
description: Primitive campsite near small creek in Flathead National Forest.

name: Flathead National Forest Tally Lake
description: Free campsite in National Forest near Creek, but it's late August and it's very dry and dusty here.  The road is pretty busy and it kicks up a lot of dust.  We'd suggest another spot further down the road toward the lake that's a little more secluded.  also, someone brushed their dog here and left tons of fur and the usual TP situation.  LEAVE NO TRACE!

name: Upper Stillwater Lake Campground
description: Small, free campground in Flathead National Forest.  Lake access.  Trains do go by a lot, but they sound pretty cool.

name: Nehalem River
description:
15 miles east of highway 101 is this wonderful spot next to the Nehalem river. A short trail gives easy access to it. There is space for two parties. Plenty of space for tents and there are fire pits. 
One big rig might fit here. I am not sure thus I put unknown in.

name: Apache Sitgreaves National Forest
description:
Wild in national forest. Lot of space. The stablish campground near charge you $20 for no hookups and $35 with. Too much, so we decided to park here for free. No amenities but really nice. 
A little of good shape dirt road but we could make it with our VW bus.

name: Dead Horse Ranch State Park
description: Big State Park. $20 without hookups, $30 with. Nice bathrooms, hot showers,  potable water. So much better than the other points nearby. Excellent and serene hiking trails, 3 lakes for fishing and day-use picnic area.

name: Seeley Lake Campground (Forest Service)
description: $20/night per camp spot. Beautiful setting in pine forest right by a clean swimmable lake. Clean bathrooms with running hot water. Nice host. We were the only people here although there was a giant fire on the other side of the lake! 5km from town. Picnic table. Fire pit. Paved 'drive' to each site big enough to park a big rig. There's another site nearer town which looked nice too although I think the camp spots a bigger here.. Leki plugs in bathrooms. Non-potable water.

name: Big Creek Forestry Campground
description: $14/night per spot. Lovely forestry service campsite beside swimmable clean River. Pit toilets, picnic tables, pine forest, big sites, bear cache, fire pit.

name: Sugarloaf Ridge state park
description: only camping site we could find near the sonoma valley.  $35 a night, nice large pitches with a mixture of sun and shade.  washrooms and paid (25c a min) showers in good condition.  don't  necessarily believe the gate if it says it's full,  we drove in and found 70% empty spots... phew!

name: Arroyo Seco National Forest
description: Only campground currently open on route G16 from Carmel. Good road but windy.  Campsites from $25 for basic site.  Lots of sites. River to swim in in day use area which is before main campsite.  Nice quiet area. Wood bundle $10 on site, buy before you arrive.

name: Potwisha
description: Campsite 4 miles into Sequoia NP. If, like us, you underestimated travel times it's a good stop just inside the park gates. $22. across the road is a dump station and also access to a creek.  great for a dip when it's 41° out at 5pm!

name: Hugh gravel lot
description: Hugh gravel lot behind trees, but near to road, quiet, free

name: Knox Knoll
description: My residence. Atop a hill on East side of Sterling Hwy.  Thirty miles from Homer. Long, wide driveway. No hookups- BOON-DOCKING.  Small yard for tent. Cyclists welcome.  Overnighters welcome. Text in advance if necessary: 907.953.9537 James

name: Johnny Creek Campground
description: Higher volume of campsites.  Tent and trailer sites available.

name: USA Intercargo
description: International auto shippers. We used their service to send our cars in a container from Newark to Le Havre. Very helpful and efficient staff. Low prices. +1 862 229 9091

name: Cook creek
description: Spot directly at the river. Firepit. Next to NF15.

name: free dump station
description: free dumping, fresh water, air for tire and you can stay in the park with a permit (ask at the visitor center)

name: The dune spot
description: Random pull off parking lot on the entrance road leading into Great Sand Dunes National Park.  About 10 minutes from the park entrance.  Some car traffic, but not bad.

name: Chena - Mile 38.2 River Access
description: nice gravel bar and parking area right on the riverwith a couple spots further off road and quite a few pretty close to the road.  quiet and existing fire rings.  no facilities and no cell service.

name: Chena River - secluded spot on the river
description: nice location just off higheay but far enough to not hrar the highway.  a few spots on the way in on the gravel bank, but only one spot all the way in.  Just Enough room to turn around at this spot though.

name: Angel Lake campground
description: nice grounds with smaller sites, high above the valley,about 4 miles from Wells, NV. there is also an exceptional beautiful hike up to Smith lake at 9000 feet , about 2 hours up from the trailhead at the camp ground.

name: Mt. Bachelor view
description:
Just a bit further up the road from the Deschutes NF 2 site is this spot which features a great view of Mt. Bachelor. 
The road up is a bit bumpy but I've seen ppl driving up with a van, so should be doable with any vehicle.

name: Hilton Hotel
description:
Super clean hotel, very comfortable beds, great water pressure in the shower. Pet friendly, they even gave my dog a treat bag with a toy and treats in it! Large campers (earth roamer etc.) would fit in the back of the hotel parking lot, but if you had a large rig with a trailer you might have to park someplace else. 

Great location for doing the TWVT, or a stop on your way south to the KAT or Overland Expo East. Google maps had strange directions coming I-77 south, it wanted me to pass the exit and come back North? It's the Mineral Wells exit, you can see the sign from I-77.

name: Colston Creek Access
description: Free. There is a pit toilet and a picnic table as well as a few fire rings. Along the river. Quiet at night even though next to the highway. There are a few spaces; they are not lined/marked out.

name: Buffalo Pass Road
description: Many places with fire rings along road. nice views. Gravel road which is extremely rough at times.

name: Jessie Lea RV Park & Campground
description: Great campground with super nice owners. Very clean bathhouse.

name: Scenic Chief Joseph
description: Public rough access road may not work with any kind of RV. Amazing view and really quiet place.

name: clear water lake
description:
one of the most beautiful lakes 
i've Seen so far the last 3 month in north america :-) you can also sleep at the parking lot of the trail head. Just take some dinner, walk ten minutes and enjoy this awesome crystall clear lake.

name: East Bank COE Campground
description:
Eastbank Campground is located on Lake Seminole on the Georgia-Florida state line. It is an Army COE Campground 

The lake and surrounding area provide a variety of outdoor recreational opportunities for fishing, camping, boating, picnicking, hiking, biking and birding.

24$ for water and electricity 
14$ for a tent

name: Wakepish Snow Park
description: Large paved carpark in a forest setting, free in summer, with day use shelter

name: White River Campground
description: National park campground. $20.  first come first serve.  if youhave a big rig, or sleep in your vehicle get in early to pick a spot as lots of sites are for tents with small sloping parks. Good place to stay after hiking Sunrise for a day.

name: Eastbound Rest Area
description: No signs banning camping. There was a few campers here parked in the loop. Not a good place for ground tents. I'd say stay in Roof top tents or camper vans. Don't park on grass. The interstate is busy all night so be prepared for some noise. Good for one night.

name: Devils Half Acre Campground
description: Old, no longer maintained(?) FS campground. Two firepits for two parties, next to the Barlow Creek stream. There used to be a pit toilet and if you don't mind the missing walls you can still use it 😄

name: CA 1 Pull Over
description: We tryed to sleep in the Visitor Center 18 miles south, but they made us leave.  It is a pull over, but a little bit bigger than the others. You can park far of road. No amenities. Free of course.

name: Flying J
description: Gas station, near Limon, lots of space, and nice, Free.

name: George P Cossar State Park
description: Very nice place. Sites with Power, wather, firepits and tables. Very cheap $25.00/night. Front Lake. Laundry. Recomended.

name: Hune Covered Bridge
description: I stumbled upon this small campground by accident.  It is free and one of my favorite discoveries for a quick overnight.  No reservations, first come basis.  The campground is small, clean, and has maybe 4 sites.  There are clean pit toilets.  Camp adjacent to the stream in view of the covered bridge.  There is a hiking trail so you can stretch your legs.  When I was there in mid to late April, there was only one other person there.  This campsite started a theme on my trip to find covered bridges along my route.

name: National Forest
description:
Informal Campsite
Have to drive for 6 miles on good gravel road to reach forest service land
No water, no facilities

name: Belknap Hot Springs Campground
description: Wonderful hot springs with campground and lodge right on the river.  Reasonable cost for RV $45 USD for electric and water hook up.

name: Medicine Lake
description: There are four campgrounds on this lake. From east to west the campgrounds are Hemlock, A.H. Hogue, Medicine, and Headquarters. The first three have easy access to the lake while the 4th does not. Of the 75 sites total 15 can be reserved. All of them cost 14$/night. Pit toilet and drinking water. Easy lake access and good fishing. Normally we wouldn't pay for camping but it was a really nice spot and good people around. The first campground is not for big rigs but the others are.

name: Taylor lake
description:
Top site for several days. It's so beautiful and quiet here. There are some firepits. Lake is good for swimming. 
For the last patch of the road you need high clearance, it's a bit rough. There are also branches hanging down. We did it in our Toyota Landcruiser with rooftoptent.

name: Naabia Niign / Northway Jct
description:
3 USD showers @ Naabia Niign / Northway Jct . Depending on which shower you get, you might not even have a time limit. This might be your cheapest shower in Alaska.
Hot, clean showers 2 USD. Gas was 3,25 (regular only).

name: Rainbow Falls
description: free primitive camping. there is a creek but it is fenced off

name: Oregon Trail Park
description: No sign about overnight parking. we were 3 vans to sleep here, without problem. Picnic table, barbecue, pit toilets (not very clean). Not noise from road or train during the night.

name: Dump Station at Fort Stevens State Park
description: Dump Station and Water. There are three stations to get service. It's before the campground so you don't have to enter the campground.

name: Old Bridge
description: Pull off next to the highway, stopped to take pictures of abandoned bridge. Did not stay but there are two "sites" with established fire pits. Pretty quiet, looks like a nice place to stay.

name: Baca Meadow
description: Beautiful meadow area. I was here for the JackFest in early August, and it was very green & serene. 14-day limit.

name: nice place for one night
description: Dirt road close to the highway with fire pits. Space for some RVs. Nice views and a bit noisy but not a lot of cars at night through the hwy.

name: Manzanita lake campground
description:
Campground and Dump station at Manzanita lake campground. $8 for a dump, but seen 3 RVs dumping no one paid.
Potable and flush water, hoses without connection so fill thru gravity fill hose

name: Paulina lake with dump station
description: $10 for a dump (dump hole is locked), credit only.Free water fill if that's all you need

name: Uhaul
description:
Refill propane bottle 
Il nous ont rempli la bouteille francaise avec raccord ACME

name: Silver Cyn Rd "campground"
description:
Dispersed camping along the side of the gravel road; some spots off road by 1/4 mile. Many more off-road spots. 

About 10 minutes from mid-town Bishop. 

No shade, no toilets (other apps say pit toilets - -none to be found). 

Cloud cover and slight breeze makes area comfortable in mid-August.

name: Coronado National Forest Arizona
description:
Beautiful site in the National Forest
Very quite. Not suitable for big rigs.
7.5 Mile of washboard road

name: Coconino National Forest By Exit 278
description: Road too rugged for this truck-camper, but I braved it, took the only level spot (1st site, others farther up the road worse), and was unhappy to realize this might be a weekend gathering place. Won’t return.

name: Coconino National Forest
description:
Very Quite Place, In Between The Trees.
No Noise. Not Suitable For Big Rigs. Crowded during the summer.

name: Edward's Rest Area
description: Free WC, dump station & potable water.

name: Sulphur campground
description: If you take the beautiful Mirror Lake Scenic Byway  driving from Teton to Salt Lake City, this might be a nice spot to spend the first night.The site is situated on a beautiful creek and it is very nice and quite here after the national parcs. There is plenty to see and hike in this valley. Enjoy it....

name: City of Chelan RV Park
description:
Grassy sites, nice size, mature trees
Pets are not allowed from June 1 - Sept 1
Easy biking into town and around Lake Chelan . Two grocery stores within walking distance

name: Beautiful spot on the river
description:
Small parking lot right at the river with beautiful view of the mountains.
Space for 3-5 rigs, no toilets, free. This place is opposite of the street of the other iOverlander spot nearby)

name: Southern Allegheny Nat. Forest
description:
Large spot with primitive fire ring right off the fire road. Could fit two - three trucks if traveling in a group. 

Close to ATV trail intersection so there is some noise during the day but the evening is silent and no one around.

name: Public Bath Sunset Empire Seaside
description: Public Bath with Gym and Hot Tube. Day fee is 9,- for non residents, you can uns the facilities the whole day. They offer shower for 2,- but only Mon-Fri 5:45-8am and 6-7pm, Sat 3-5pm, Sun 12-2pm  (extra 1$ for towel)

name: Flaming Gorge East Side - Forest Road 320
description: Great dispersed camping right next to the lake. You feel like you have the entire lake to yourself. Long dirt road you may need 4 wheel drive depending on the weather conditions.

name: KOA campground
description: Big RV campground near the Safari Drive through Park. Didn't stay at 35$ a night, but could park our car and leave the dog to visit the walking section of the safari park.

name: By the lake, very quiet
description: Decent place to spend the night by the lake with a couple fire rings. Free, quiet (depending on quarry). Good for small and medium (<20-23') rigs. 4x2 does fine. Fisherman may come in the morning to get in the lake / river but won't bitter you. Spot for kayaking, canoeing and fishing as well. AT&T coverage for mobile and LTE.

name: lots of great wild camping spots!!
description: This is a random trail off the main road but if you drive into it there are several clearings and a few spots where others have clearly camped before - rock firepits, etc.  there may also be wildlife bc there is a big dead cow that looks like it's been there awhile. really awesome spot with INCREDIBLE views!! 2wd ok

name: Tuttletown rec. area
description: Very beautiful campingspot next to the lake. Off season is probably the best moment to go to avoid a lot of people.

name: Will Benoit VW mechanic
description: Any issue with your VW you can go there. Will did the maintenance of our old kombi before we hit the road. Knowledgeable and can be trusted

name: Angel Creek Campground
description: It is a nice and small campground between the mountains. Very quiet! You can see a lot of deer. The sites have picnic tables and fire pits. The fee is 15 USD.

name: Free disperse Campsite
description:
Free disperse campsite between Landslide and Tenmile campgrounds. Very nice with lots of trees and shade. There is a lot of space. Peaceful and quiet. 
Main camp area can be noisy and crowded. The lower section to the right down the small dirt road has several secluded sites away from the crowded section.

name: Bear Valley Road near Dinosaur NM
description: A nice spot with a really great view near to Dinosaur National Monument. It's a great option on the way to or from Yampa Bench Road. No facilities, but really quiet.

name: Shrine Pass Road
description:
Quiet parking lot in National Forest. Some ATVs are on the road until late in the evening, otherwise quiet. Great view, nice meadows and forests. Some hiking trails around. Good for a walk with our dog.
Good AT&T coverage. GREAT Verizon coverage! Lots of pull offs for camping before the parking lot. Some side roads to camping our washed out, but main road in is fine.

name: White tank campground
description: Nice Campground between boulders. plenty of sites, 15$/night

name: Carson City Overlook
description: Close to the "backside of Tahoe" spot is this one. It's further up the hill and has a great 360 view of Carson city and the mountains. You might need a 4x4 to reach the top of the hill, it's steep and the road has plenty of stones in it.

name: Paris, Idaho
description: free dumping and drinking water site, watch signs on main street

name: Annie Creek Campsite
description: This is a boondocking campsite just down a dirt road from the snow park. It can fit about 6 campers. Up near the paved road (150 yards) are 2 nice pit toilets.  The campsites are both shaded and in the open, your choice.  Annie Creek go right past the campsites.

name: Best Tire & Wheel
description: Shannon is a local mechanic has his own garage in centre Kanab. Excellent service, friendly and reasonable prices.

name: Corsica, Pennsylvania
description: Small grassy parking pull off in front of a hunting trail. No signs denoting no camping, though one that says not to block the gate. I never left the area so if anyone had needed me To move it wouldn't have been an issue. Enough room for an SUV or Truck and tent. I pulled in around 10p and slept in the back of the Jeep. A few cars drove by throughout the night but no issues with anyone stopping. Quiet, across from a cornfield, easy access to I-80/90.

name: Lowe River Crossing
description: This is the site of the unfinished railroad tunnel and where the Lowe river crosses the Richardson Hwy. Alaska 4. There room for 2-3 Rigs, there is currently two stone fire rings. You could probably drink the water right off the waterfall that is next to the site.

name: Helper Dump Station
description: Dumping with non portable water just near the river in the city of Helper.

name: Price
description: Big O Tires. Changes and repare tires for a very good price. Very helpfull and kind service.

name: Insight auto glass windshield repair
description: We pulled into this car wash and windshield repair place got our rock chip on our windshield repaired in 10 min. the guys name is Paul Milk and phone is 303-507-0148. He is willing to work with your budget. Cost us $20.

name: RV Camp Site in Kalibab Forest
description: Free, authorized camp spot in the woods. Fire Places and a few sotes for tents and motorhomes. No water, toilet or anything else.

name: Dump Station and Water Refill
description:
A place where ypu can dump grey and black water, fill up thr water tank with normal water and adiitionally a drinking water station. (seasonal water)
5 Dollar should be left there in an envelope to help with maintaining the station.

name: Cochetopa Canyon Recreation Area
description: Free camping on BLM land. Close to the road, so you can hear the traffic but it's more or less quiet during night.

name: Boathouse
description:
Good hot showers at boathouse.  Get tokens at office boathouse upstairs. GO TO NEW HARBOR! 

12 minutes costs $4 dollar. @ boathouse

name: Denali Highway
description:
tentspots and 4x4 spots. close to the road but hidden!
Nice vieuw at the mountains.

name: Roadside Rock Pit
description:
About 150m off the Parks Rd. This spot has space 5-6 decent size Rigs. There are currently a couple fire pits. You will hear some road noise but only if you are in a tent. This may be an active rock quarry, not sure late on a Friday night. Tents will be on the rocks not the grass. AT&T has one strong bar of LTE. Great spot for viewing the Aurora Borealis.  

Edit: it is a rock pit but looks rarely used, appeared to be a locals shotgun skeet range.

name: Rieck's Park
description: Public shower in restrooms at north end of park. $1 in quarters for $5. It was kind of dark and dingy and I'd definitely wear shower shoes but the water was hot with good pressure. There is a cheap campground here too which I'll make a separate entry for. I think one might get away with parking a class b overnight in this parking lot but I did not try as it was so hot that I definitely needed the electricity in the campground for air-conditioning. It's a nice spot though, right next to the water.

name: Rieck's Lake Park
description: Small county Campground for small rigs only. $15 per night. 20 and 30 amp electric outlets at each site along with a picnic table and fire ring. Right next to the water, but also right next to the road. There are also a lot of trains going by at all hours of the day and night blowing their horns.  Restrooms with flush toilets and coin operated showers at the far north end of the park. There are Porta potties at each end of the Campground section however. There are also a couple of drinking water spigots in the park area. Self register and pay at a little kiosk at the entrance to the camping area.

name: Hidden Ring
description: Hidden gravel ring in the middle of the bushes. There was one fire ring and space for about five up to 20' rigs. Tight entry. We just made with our 2.16m wide Iveco. Wider rigs can make it, yet bushes may scratch the paintwork a a little bit, nothing serious. We found it better than the two other pullovers listed towards Chilkoot Lake.

name: Wheeler campground
description: A campground at 3000m, the trailhead for the oldest living trees and the Mt. Wheeler peak just around the corner. On top of that nice private sites and fantastic night skies for only $12/day!

name: Between boulders
description:
Beautiful place bin a valley between boulder rock formations. There are multiple sites with stone fire rings to chose from. 
Take the road to painter springs from hwy 50. To get all to the end of the valley where this particular check in is you need a 4x4 with high clearance. However there are spots with a great view before the rough part starts. 
There's also a small cave.

name: Douglas City Campground
description: Douglas City campground has paved access and 24 sites. There is a camping limit of 14 days in this BLM campground. it is $10 per camp unit plus $5 per extra vehicle. Golden Age is half off. There is a host at this campground.

name: eureka
description: library with strong Wifi even outside the library .

name: grotto trailhead close to aspen
description: nice and quite parking lot, next to a beautiful river. no signs for no overnight camping.

name: Green Ridge State Forest
description: State Forest with established primitive camp sites. Group sites also available. First come, first served. Gravel/4×4 roads. Boat launch. Outdoor shooting range.

name: Woodward Reservoir
description:
It is a quiet excellent Campground near a lake. It is close to the 120 to yosemite.
Cost per Night 60usd

name: Panguitch Lake North Campground
description:
It is a nice and quiet campground in the forest with picnic tables and fire pits. On the other site of the road is the South Campground. 
Fee is 17 USD.

name: Rasar State Park
description:
Campsites with and without hookups.  Sites cost $32 for economy (no hookups) up to $45.
 Hot showers are $.50 for about 2 minutes.

name: KOA Cherokee Trading Post
description: Paid 21USD for a tent camping spot under some trees. Bathrooms are clean. 24h coin laundry and wifi available.

name: Denali park campground
description: shower 4,50 for 12 min, potable water at dumpstation and laundromat

name: Close to glacier Gabriel Icefall
description: Long and stoney road almost to the foot of the glacier. Many, many spots. First part suitable for all types of vehicles, last part only for cars with high clearance.

name: princess campground
description:
25 USD per site
Drinking water available
Dump station 10 USD fees

name: Shower in village laundry
description: Laundry for 2.75, dryer for 0.25 and shower for $7

name: Several spots on the 16 county road
description: Several spots in the first km from the main road going to the park on the dirty road (county 16) accessible with 2wd when dry. Some spot for 4wd and/or high clearance. Quiet, very nice view and beautiful sky!!! Approx coordinates.

name: Park picnic area
description: Picnic area with restrooms, trash, recycling, water spout, tables and swings.

name: Mazama Country Store
description: Country store with a deli and coffee house.  Great bakery items.

name: Kelly's Automotive service
description:
Very nice place and very professional and good price !! I never see that before ! 
Battery repair
Battery repair and Charging System Services
DEQ repairs and certification
Computerized Engine Control System Repair
Computerized Engine Control System Services
Scheduled Maintenance Tune-Up Services
Pre-Purchase Inspections
Emission repair - Emission System Services
Fuel Injection System repair
Fuel Injection System Services
Electrical wiring repairs
Electronic brakes, steering, suspension control systems repairs
Bearing & Seal repair Services
Belts & Hose repair Services
Brake repair - Brake System Services
A/C repair - Cooling System Services
Drive Train repair - Drive Train Services
Electronic transmission - repair - diagnostics - services
Scheduled Maintenance or Service Packages

Thx Greg for that ! 
541-830-4005

name: Creekside
description:
Nice place near a small creek at 400m to the highway. just for one truck and one tent ! 
perfect stay for 2-3 days !

name: Jawbone
description: Parking lot in front of information center of jawbone desert. Quiet place. Sometimes windy

name: Laundromat
description:
Clean shower ($6), laundromat and grocery store. 

*Update* showers no longer available

name: Cathedral Valley Campground
description: Beautiful campground in the Capitol Reef National Park next to the cathedral valley. Six sites, I was told they rarely fill up.

name: Hi-Lo Motel
description: Motel and RV Park whit showers avaiable. U$7/ shower, U$41/ night in RV park

name: Showers At Swiftcurrent Mottor In
description: Showers avaiable for U$2,5 per 8 minutes

name: MontBleu Hotel Casino
description:
Another Hotel Casino on the NV/CA border in South Tahoe City. This parking lot is huge, although we chose to park a little away from the main entrances in the NE corner.

It was quiet and dark, with no interruptions all night. The Casino is great to stroll around in, and the Hard Rock Casino is across the street, which also adds another interesting thing to see (lots of neat rock memorabilia in the lobby). 

Nothing too special about the lot, but there were some nice picnic tables in the parking lot, right beside where we pulled over for the night.
