No garbage cans around aside from the entrances, so be sure to LNT (Leave no trace!) remember that these places tolerate us as we don't cause them problems!

name: Saddlebag Lake, Resort Parking Lot
description:
The Resort has closed, but the parking lot and trailhead parking remain open and Free! 

The Campground is in the same road up to the lake, but the parking lot showed no signs that indicate overnight parking is prohibited. Spoke with the campground host, and as the camp was full, he was actually the one that suggested it.

The lake is just outside Yosemite Park and is absolutely breathtaking with some fantastic hiking and (cold) swimming. Great place to spend a night or two at 10,000 feet above sea level. Remember to use the garbages and keep this place clean!

name: Valley of the Gods
description: Many beautiful spots along the road. This one was our favorite. No amenities except a fire pit

name: Wolf Creek Pass FSR pullout
description: Pullouts all along forest service road. Beautiful area just off highway.

name: Collet Top
description:
Site at Collet Top. Nice views, a bit of windprotection by the trees and 2 bars LTE with ATT 😄
Make sure to get the overnight permit from the VC and check on the weather forecast.

name: Cebolla Mesa Campground
description: Very beautiful place on the rim, with view on the Rio Grande. Very Quiet. There's one pit toilet near the main parking area. Accessible with 2wd but beware of the deep ruts, and don't come here if it's going to rain. Excellent T Mobile service.

name: Laredo overnight parking
description: Big, safe and quiet parking lot (fee) next to the outlet shoppes in the heart of Laredo next to the border. Wifi from the shops. Restrooms open till 9:00 pm.

name: Hermit Park Open Space
description:
County park with 3 campgrounds. Hundreds of empty spaces when the  nearby national park was full. Some with views. Pit toilets, dump, fire rings, tables. 

$24 dry camping + $6 entrance fee.

name: Old Lime Creek Road Corral
description: Great views, but difficult road and few flat areas.   This spot is next to an old corral and a few hundred feet from a river and waterfall. Recommended for small rigs with high ground clearance. Great fall colors. Weak cell service.

name: Junction Creek
description: Nice quiet and clean Forest Service campground. $26 per night. $12 extra for electrical available in E loop only (14 sites). Lots of shade, tables, fire rings, pit toilets, tent pads, drinking water.

name: Sycamore canyon campground
description:
A place to dump and fill potable water.
Also campground for 45usd.

name: Santa Rosa Camping and RV
description: Ok campground in town. Full hookups available. Paid 22$ for a site without hookups. Wifi, laundry, hot showers available.

name: Coal seam fires
description: Took me a while to find it, thus adding it here :)

name: Chanslor Ranger campground
description:
Nice campground with friendly staff. There are Picnic tables and very clean bathrooms. 
Horse riding available. 
Clean and quiet.

name: Independent Vehicle Service
description: US cars, European cars, Japanese cars, 4x4, you name it. Go there if you need  proper technical help. They are good! 312 Kinley Ave NW Albuquerque tel 505 247 9771 www.ivsabq.com. They helped me to release one the oillevel check nuts on the gearboxes. This service was free of charge. Thanks guys!

name: Flying C Ranch Free Camp.
description: Exit 234 from I-40. At the east side you'll find the paved parking. On the west side this gravel spot. More secluded with a nice view. We enjoyed a peaceful night. Free. Easy access for all rigs. Because it's close to the freeway, there is traffic noise, but it was bearable. We didn't explore the Ranches Services.

name: Lake McClellan Campground
description: Quite a few places around the lake. Per site per night $ 10.  Electricity $ 5 extra. Fees in envelope in honousty box. Hot showers and pit toilets. Dump station. Easy access for all rigs. Very quiet.   Verizon service weak.

name: Sugar Creek Casino Hinton, OK - Free Camp
description: Paved parking, a bit gravel and even a patch of grass. Free. A few $5 spots with electricity hook-up. Easy access for all rigs. It's between the gravel road and  the Event Center. Take the gravel road entrance. Pretty quiet.

name: confluence point of the Ohio and Mississippi river
description: Old State park area with 2 big parking facing Mississippi River. Safe, beautiful, and good for big rig. Ah and a lot of pecan trees!

name: blue mountain road
description: quiet place near dinosaur national monument behind end of cub creek road

name: walmart
description: just another walmart. at least one option where we couldnt find anything else.

name: commercial truck crossing
description: were sent to this crossing  as we needed a HS-7 form for exporting our car from the US to The Netherlands. Officer also gave us a CBP Form 7501. follow the commercial truck signs, so not the regulier can signs.

name: little river campground nice
description: little campground at the river......price bewegen 25-35 $.....very clean and friendly

name: River floodplain
description: Near the entrance to the Delta State Recreation Campground is a town brush dump. Enter there and work your way to the river bank. 2wd if you find the right way.

name: KOA
description: camping.  hot shower. pool. Huge communiste center. clear bathroom. Landry. $42 for salle rv.  close by there is à State park.  quail creek on the Quail lake with camping. open spot. cheaper. exit 22 on I15.

name: large flat spot - on route 9 , before the 89 jonction after Zion Nat. Park.
description:
Be careful low branches. Not suitable for rvs. 
 Hard sand. could install a tent. fire pit with rocks.

name: Zigzag falls
description: Lots of small camping spots along Kiwanis Camp Road, which leads to Zigzag Falls. Beautiful greenery along the river and lots of previous fire pits that lead me to believe camping and fires are ok here. The falls themselves are lovely too.

name: Topsy Grade Rd
description: Open woodlands along the reservoir with plenty of space to park and/or camp. Not sure if camping is actually allowed but we were not approached by anyone during our one-night stay. Campfires and a fair amount of glass/trash makes me think camping is common here.

name: Jackson Wellsprings
description: This is a paid campground (between $27 per car or $10 per person) but includes free entry to the hot spring mineral bath and sauna house. Clothing optional from 8 pm. A bit of a hippy watering-hole but great vibes with workshops and yoga classes etc if you're into that kind of thing. Well worth the overnight visit for the baths.

name: The Byrds nest RV Park
description:
Nice little RV park on the border between Texas and Louisiana.

RV spaces, cabins and motel  also tent camping with an onsite marina and are pet friendly.

name: Lava tubes
description: Pit toilet picnic table site

name: Astoria Pier 39
description:
TOP!!!
Wonderful place on the water with a nice beer bar „rogue“ with great cheep food and a lovely cafe - „coffee girl“ - we stayed here overnight on the street - quiet - no problems
and we had many sea lions on the pier - 
so nice to see them sooo close :)

name: Bullfrog Campground
description: The campground is okay, quiet and not so big, but hardly shadow. There are picnic tables, fire rings and grills.

name: eureka sand dunes
description: Free campground with firerings, pit toilet and bench. perfect view over the sand dunes and the surrounding mountains. there is no shade.

name: 7Cedars Casino
description: If you register at the casino cashier you are allowed to stay at their parking lot for three days.

name: Sauls Creek
description: National Forest Service open camping. Many pull-outs along road with clearing and rock fire rings. Some trash. Cell service. Can be noise from nearby work site.

name: Methow River Roadside, Pateros
description: Just a pull-off on the side of the road next to the river, but it worked.  Traffic from the road died down at night.  Free.  No one bothered us.

name: Montana de Oro camp ground
description: Nice campground . With a lot of great hiking and biking trails. And a beach in walking distance.

name: Grand Coulee Dam
description: Interesting place with visitors center, dam tour and walk along a bridge with lots of information.

name: Okobojo Point
description: Great Place with beach, huge sites, showers and toilets. Only 22 sites, 20 dollar

name: Gumboot lake
description:
parking lot with dirt roads around it. pleanty of parking .


further up on forest road 26 another parking lot at PCT trailhead. camped there for several days.

name: walmart
description: anything else needed? just another walmart. 24hrs. FREE

name: Mount Carmel first spot
description: Easily accessible from the hwy 89. There is plenty of space. Quiet area.

name: Trout Brook Tentsite
description: In the Bigelow Preserve. In Stratton take School Street. The name of the street change to Old Dead River Road than to West Flag Rd. The entrance of the campsite is on the left side of the road after a small lake on the right. Pit toilets, picnic table,  fire pit and beach access to the lake. Quite a nice place for free.

name: Forest roadside camp
description: Largish spot, 3 vehicles fit here. Free.

name: Vista Point just off Hwy 120 near Jamestown. Wonderful view.
description: No services except great phone service 3-4 bars at&t. Overlooking an amazing lake. Quiet   We couldn't believe our luck

name: DuPuis Management Area
description:
A great FREE campground near Lake okeechobee.  There are new bathrooms being constructed with showers and toilets.  There are several sites with tables and a fire pit.  Be careful of the mosquitoes! 
clean, but you need to register and have a permit

name: Siuslaw National Forest
description: A good gravel road goes from Sandlake Road south to a branched system of roads into the forest. After about 2,5 miles is a grassy area on the right with a fireplace. There is space for two small campers. No services & no cellphone service.

name: Forest Road 55 extended
description: Follow National Forest development road 55 for 3,3 miles, than turn left into a gravel road. After 0,5 miles comes a pullout on the left underneath trees. It's nothing special but a quiet place for a night and it's a little bigger than just a usual pullout.

name: 4th of July jack camp
description: just a place to stay for the night off the interstate 90.  Exit 4th of July summit exit, go up F S 614. Could go south or north off freeway.  Lots of FS roads here. Active logging.

name: Wild desert camping
description: Just a bare wild camping spot, on BLM land so free and allowed. Off of highway 70 you head SW on Haekel road for a mile or so, when the road comes to a fork take the right onto the gravel road for another half mile, where you will see some dirt patches on your left for camping. Quietest place we have ever camped!

name: Point Sublime
description:
PERMIT REQUIRED!
This campground is at the end of the road that goes to Point Sublime. It's an easy 4x4 route either from the park or outside. To camp here you need a back country permit from the park. Get it from the back country office ($18). 
Beautiful views from the North Rim, perfect for sunrise and sunset.

name: Caribou creek area
description: Looks like a steep road going down but not that bad. Maybe no RVs over 28ft as it would be hard to turn around at the bottom. Gravel parking area with spots for tents & bear proof garbage cans. No water. It's almost flat but not quite. Free! Look for the sign when on the road & go down, little road noise, nice view of valley.

name: Buffalo Bill State Park
description: Quiet state park just outside of Cody, WY. Not free but only 25 $for tent/RV. Flush and pit toilets. Hot clean shower worth the $1.25 in quarters. Beautiful view. day use  nine dollars

name: Bealls Parking Lot
description: Shopping center parking lot (Rite Aid, Bealls, BK, Starbucks). We stayed here for 2 days so we could catch up on work and use Starbucks wifi. No signs saying "no overnight parking." We stayed here for 2 days with no issues.

name: Elk City Lake Park
description: This nice spot is located at the shore of Elk City Lake, south of Elk City, OK. It offers 5 full-length RV spots with electric hook-up. You may stay up to 4 days and it's  15$ per night. Free hot showers are in the park but not close to where you park. Super hot showers!

name: Library South Tahoe
description: Library with the fastest free internet we ever had on this trip so far. You can use a computer for 1/2 hour for free. They can print (15 cents per Page) and you can scan documents.

name: Rockbox Offroad Adventure Trailer
description: This was previously a campsite but gained unwanted attention, so no camping is permitted here anymore. However, this is still a stop for offroad supplies, gear, some clothing, and of course trailers. He also does custom fabrication work. They have a good selection of fridges, coolers, and water heaters, and sell MaxTrax and Powertanks. The owner is very helpful and a great friend of mine. Please pay him a visit!

name: Tucumcari Municipal Park + Free Disk Golf Course
description:
Tucumcari Municipal Park has a dirt parking lot and is good for one nights stay close to I40/Route 66. The park has been recently transformed into a disc golf course - so bring a frisbee disc and play a little. It used to be a water park or something like that - the ruins of the pool and buildings can still be seen.
The entrance is a bit funny, there are no signs or anything and there is an animal fence and gate around it - it looks as if you were entering a farm, but in fact it's a public park.
I would not recommend it for big rigs, because the entrance is a bit rough and steep.

name: Thibodeau campground
description: It’s 5 miles down a washboard Road, so allow 20 or 30 minutes from the time you leave the pavement. It’s a nice BLM campground, though it may be managed by the state. The campground will be closed March 2022 to October 2022 in order to pave the road down to the bridge.

name: small bridge Little Colorado river on 180
description: This place is an alternateur if the close one in Canyon do not work. it's not the best because of debris on the ground.  road is by but no trafic when dark. you're close to the river but not on it. if you have a tent you Will have a Nice spot on sand on the river.

name: Lizard Head Pass Dispersed Camping, Telluride, Colorado
description: Next to the Lizard Head Pass with stunning views around.

name: La Plata County Fairgrounds County Park
description:
Only six sites and it is necessary to make a reservation. Therefore you can call +1 (970) 382-6468 or visit the office near the place at 37°17′26.72″N 107°52′24.57″W (Mo-Fr 8-5).
The place is not far from downtown.
Water & electricity right on the place - no dumping. Price 16,50 USD. Good to visit Durango. As we know open from April to October.

name: walmart
description: as we couldnt find much options on this route, we decided to add as many options that we found. here is another walmart. really enjoying Iowa

name: Wind River City Park
description: City park and stadium with camping spaces for RV or tent. Free. Police patrolled after 11 pm. Small town on route 44.

name: Coalinga-Huron District Library
description: Parking lot behind the Coalinga public Library. Nice for a night.

name: White river city park corrected
description: City park/ stadium on the edge of a small town on route 44. RV and tent free. Police patrolled.

name: Itch-Kep-Pe Park
description: Ex Campground with over 40 sites. No fee. At waterfront of the Yellowstone River. Donations requested. City water available. Trash cans available. AT&T cell reception is good.

name: Wheat Montana bakery
description: exit 274 on I 90. deli, coffee, etc. Your sweet tooth serviced here.

name: Pictograph Cave State Park
description:
Pictographs in a shallow cave.
No camping allowed. thanks

name: Grant Marsh Wildlife Area
description: Boondocks camping next to the Bighorn River.  Go to the right past the wildlife viewing area entrance.  Road ends in a turnaround. Later we found the river had washed away the main entrance to this camp. If you park at the gate and walk in, lovely camp sites right on the river. Pit toilet, too. Saw a Bald Eagle. lots of deer. neat place.

name: Walmart parking lot
description: open 24/7, very noisy but free. Lots of shopping and restaurants abound.

name: Clear Creek  Reservoir campground
description: Beautiful free campground along the Clear Creek. Plenty of space, fire rings, nice hiking trails. Natural water from the creek along the campsite. Pit toilet. Easy accessible for big rigs. Stay limited to 14 days.

name: Love's gasstation
description: Quiet spot for overnight. Just behind the gasstation on separate RV parking area. Restrooms available at the station.

name: Flagler Reservoir
description: This camping spot is about a 5 mile drive just north I-70 and is a free camping spot. The roads are dirt/gravel and I drove it easily with my 35 foot motorhome and towed car. There is a campsite loop with several spots to camp. The loop road does have some low hanging trees so I just drove on the grass to avoid them. One spot has a picnic table and fire pit. There's a pit toilet and dumpster about 150 yards away in their day use area. There's no water in the lake.

name: Gravel lot oceanview
description:
Joseph Whidbey Park is currently closed for camping, but you can still very much stay at the gravel lot. people still hiking along the coast. I've stayed several times now. not usually two nights in a row and I arrive to watch the sunset and move on in the morning

Small gravel lot with oceanview. 1 or two small vans fit. We stayed here for one night enjoying the sunset. Close to state park.

name: Unnamed road sites
description: Three great primitive campsites along this road.  All are off the road to the left down right spur roads, each designated with a sign.  Has fire ring, table, and a rough pit toilet.  First and second site are directly on the river and gorgeous, third site is slightly off the river.

name: Enchanted trails RV park and trading post
description: campground with services.  Propane near by.  Landry.  clean restroom and shower.  dump. Nice vintage set up inside and outside. Next door to Camping Word. Huge store.

name: John H Kerr Damn Campground
description: Beautiful Campground on Buggs Lake  that straddles the VA/NC border

name: Allaire State Park
description: Nice places in forest, $30/night, hike trails

name: Junior Point FS campsite
description:
Beautiful mountain top campsite near Lake Chelan in the Wenatchee NF.
 Long gravel road, but it was fine with high clearance.  FS road 5900.

name: Colorado River Camping
description: Lots of gravel camp sites can be found in this area. Some have make shift fire pits. The Colorado River is approximately 50ft from the camping spots. Very peaceful except for the sound of trains in the distance.

name: Dirt wild camping above the lake
description: Wild camping only accessible with 4x4 or dirt bike, steep tracks leading to electric pylones. Went there with KLR 650 with dirt tires. Flat space for the tent. Quiet and not too far from the city. RV park 5 minutes south by the lake with showers $1 for 3 minutes and from $31 for vehicle and overnight camping.

name: Windy Point Campground
description: Sites right on river. Site #8 is non reservable and first come first serve. Most of other sites are reservable.  $14 USD or $7 with Pass.  Sites are spacious but may not accommodate rigs over 25 ft.

name: Tree of Heaven USFS
description: This is a US Forest Service Campground. Cost is $15 USD or $7.50 with senior pass.  Right on river and really nice. Road access is paved but very steep.  I pulled a 20 ft trailer with no problems. Sites are large enough for rigs up to 35 ft.

name: Mill Creek Campground
description: Established Campground in the Redwood Forest. Great sites among the Redwoods

name: Wood Hill Trail System trailhead
description: A gravel parking lot for bike and multi-use trails, near Price City and above, up the hills. Rough road to trailhead and beyond.

name: Death Valley
description: Dumping station , drinking water, close to the visitor center at the other side of the road . All for free, what else ;)

name: Lucky 7 Casino
description:
- Free Camping - 
Newer Gamblinghall "Lucky 7 Casino" just aprox. 2 mile south of State border.
Special space just for RV parking behind main building. Max. 3 nights, no registration needed, better say hello to the guy from Security. Clean and quite area.

name: Natchez Trace State Forest
description: Great campground in an area where very little is offered for an Overland trip. There is also a full RV campground further down the road. ATT 2 bars.

name: Propane supply
description: This place was described in the iOverlander entry "Enchanted trails RV park and trading post".

name: Rod and Gun Campground
description:
Forest Service campground with 8 spaces.  Pit toilet and tables.  No fee when we were there.  Small stream next to the campground.  Timon Campground is 2 miles further.
There is a few posted at the sign. Please pay your dues.

name: Walmart El Centro
description: Walmart parking lot, not too noisy.  Mobile security cameras with blue flashing lights and recorded messages stop after hours. Closes 11pm, opens 7am. If you want access to the free Wi-Fi, you’ll need to park close to the store.

name: Climbers ranch
description:
Bunk bed lodging for $17.50 pp includes shower or showers only for $5.  Lots of hot water and the ladies side ones were powerful :-)
They won't let you sleep in your vehicles

name: Ward Mountain Campground
description:
Lovely national forest campground, tables, firepits, grills at each spacious site. Great stop after a long hot days driving. currently $8 and water spigots around the camp ground. Could fill up water tank. Decent cell service on ATT & T-Mobile.
Update: 6/23/21, camp host said well is broken. No water.

name: Sturgis Community Center
description:
Swimming pool, showers, hot tub, sauna.  $4 for seniors.
phone: 605-347-6513

https://sturgisareachamber.com/membership/profile/sturgis-community-center

name: National Forest by the lake and the highway
description: there is not much in the way of free camping on the Olympic peneinsula that we found.  this site was not ideal, but was free and was near the lake.  the HWY was quiet from 11-5 so not too bad.  fire ring and half a picnic table.  No cell service

name: Carl G Washburne State Park
description:
Wonderful campground with showers, restrooms, water, electricity hook-up and dog-friendly.
There is a single handicap bathroom with shower. 
Hot showers included in cost.

name: Salt Point State Park
description:
Camped in overflow parking for free near visitors center. Overflow parking can handle big rigs but camp spots would be tight.
No facilities.
Campground close-by for $35/night with toilets and water spigots.

name: Pine Cliff RV resort
description:
Just outside Yosemite's East side. Near June Lake.
We had planned to camp at Oh Ridge but it was $27.50/night with no facilities. This RV resort is only $15 for tent camping (no hook-ups) but fire pit and picnic table.
There are restrooms, basketball court, small play area for kids.
Pay showers with quarters.
General store on-site but closed by time we arrived.
This was a great spot since every campsite and hotel in Yosemite valley full.
Oh and there is a near-by gas station.

name: Navajo Lake State Park
description:
$8 dry camping, $10 with electric
Free hot showers and lakeside campsites make this a bargain. $3/hour WiFi service. Good cell service. Marina.

name: Gallo Campground Chaco National Historic Monument
description:
Small campground inside park. $20 pay at the visitorcenter. 
Roads out of park are difficult and could be more difficult when wet.

name: Blain Park
description: We stay on night here with two rv around 24 feet, there is no «no overnight sign » . More calm than walmart , good with children , many games , picnic table , drinking water avalaible . No problem for this night and Free ;) what else ;)

name: hector's mobile RV Repairs
description:
After visit 3 big company of RV , they have no answer for my problem of my fridge . We have meet this mexican guy , and he find our problem in one minute , and learn to repair alone during our travel . With you have a problem in your RV , try to call him , we never know , he can move around ...
559 471 8294

name: Wild camping near Neverland Ranch
description: This place is about 6,6 miles north east from Los Olivos. Take Figueroa Mountain Road, there comes a pretty uneven gravel place on the left. If you go up to the top there is a small platform to park straight line but only with a small campervan. Stunning view and sunset.

name: Baker Lake Lower Sandy
description: Very Nice, very clean. 6 places near the lake. Very quiet. Picnic tables and firering. TOP

name: Reading airport parking
description: We stay one night in the parking... quiet at night (no planes )

name: Walmart
description: In Jackson ... good for a night. Wifi in Applebee

name: Peach Springs rest area
description:
Nice rest area opposite to Hualapai Lodge. Overnight for RV possible. But noisy trains pass all 15min!

Aire de repos sympathique et possibilité d'y passer la nuit (RV). En face de la lodge Hualapai. Mais attention, le train de marchandises passe toutes les 15min et klaxonne à chaque fois!! Wifi gratuit de la lodge!

name: Bluewater State Park
description: $10 dry camping, $14 with electricity. Hot showers. Lakefront sites, and Canyonside sites. Good hiking opportunities.

name: Tractor Supply
description: Very friendly place to get your rv propane tank filled! They even fill VW Westfalia's tank

name: Black Hills Nat'l Forest 284.1a
description: Dispersed camping close to Crazy Horse & Rushmore. Get your maps free from Forest Service office or Visitors Centers. Beautiful Jack camping!

name: Codorus State Park
description: nice state park, $28/night, trails, biking etc.

name: Lake Owyhee on the river
description:
Head south out of Nyssa, Oregon and north of Lake Owyhee State Park. It’s a few miles off of interstate 84 and worth the drive. After two nights at “Neat Retreat” I needed some piece and quite and boy did I find it! Nestled in a canyon with a beautiful trout stream. Best of all it’s free and you can get here with a motor home
If it will fit through the tunnel (see photo).

name: Lake Owyhee State Park
description:
Oregon State Park, “McCormick Campgroung” Beautiful setting on the reservoir with electric, toilets, showers, tables, fire rings, etc. 
$22 for electric hookups, $17 tent sites, $41 for Tepee. Dogs okay on leash. Handicap spots, big rigs okay. Closes October 31st for the winter.

name: Brothers Rest Area
description: Rest Area besides Hwy 20 in Beothers used by truckers as well. Toilets & bins available

name: Rest Area on Hwy 20 between Riley & Hines
description: Big parking area. Used by trucks as well. New restrooms.

name: Rest Area on Hwy 20 near Buchanan
description: Parking area with picnic tables and restrooms. Non potable water available.

name: Greenwood acres family campground
description: Very big campground near lake, everything inside ... big playground good for kids. We stay one night and we paid 34$

name: Walmart
description: Walmart near 94 highway wiht wifi near Lowe ´s store, we find is calm despite the road.  Just for information the walmart in pawpaw indicate No Overnight Parking and is very noisy.

name: Searsport Shores Campground
description:
well established with excellent service.
Seaside

name: Castle Creek Campground
description:
A full service Campground in CT. There aren't many places to camp in CT and we happen to find this one after much searching.
Family oriented and very well run with very clean facilities. Also very expensive as we paid $50 for their cheapest site which had cable, electricity and water which we didn't need...

name: Trail break RV & Campground
description:
Nice little RV Park off interstate 84 Glenn’s Ferry exist. 
Address: 432 N. Bannock Ave. 
Glenn’s Ferry, Idaho 83623
208-366-7745
Very friendly owners $25 for my truck, trailer and dog 🐕 cheaper than the state park near by. 
Hookup, tables, fire pits, toilets, showers, fast WiFi.

name: Klamath Glen, by the River
description:
Follow Hwy 169 from Klamath for 3 miles to Klamath Glen. Than cross the dyke (dam), pass the airfield (its on your right) and arrive at an huge area by the river. Overnight camping is possible on small roads or down by the river.
4WD recomended for places down by the river but not needed if you stay somewhere on top.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart parking lot in Elkton. Fine for one night.

name: Taneum Junction/Wenatchee Okanogan NF
description: Free creekside camp spot near the Taneum Junction campground and trailheads.  South of Cle Elum on FS road 133.  Well-maintained gravel road.  No cell reception.

name: Crow Creek Sno Park
description: Large area near Crow Creek Campground in the National Forest.  Used primarily as a Snow Park site.  Multiple trails and roads branch off from here.  no cell coverage.  lots of traffic due to people gathering wood and hunting this time of year, but it's still a nice area.

name: BLM near Calsbad cavern
description: flat spot in BLM -easy to get there -road is in good conditions even if it's gravel and sand.  big rig or trailer could fit.  tent too. away from the road by 400 feet.  we still hear trucks from the road.  Nice sunset and sunrise. this site is perfect if you watched the bat flight at the dusk at the nat. park and need a quick spot to park in without looking around.

name: Pine Spring Safety Rest Area
description: Nice rest area with picnic tables and shelters. it's aloud in Texas to sleep one night in rest area.  road is noisy during the day however. lots of circulation.view on montains around. Wi-Fi had passwords and did not see any passwords

name: St George Island State Park
description: Nice place, clear, quiet. Clean restrooms, showers hot. $26,00 night. Near Beach.

name: Walmart
description: Quiet overnight, large parking, close to other businesses.

name: Phipps Park
description: Camping with site in grass, barbecue grill, table. Little shade, laundry. $25.00-35.00 plus tax.

name: Marborg Industrie
description: This company washes trash cans, municipal trucks... You can use their dumping station and use their water (not potable).

name: Evans Plunge mineral springs
description: A bit pricey for a shower. Huge pool, in and out. Out was closed in off season. In addition to the pool, steam, hot tub, sauna, big fun slides indoors! Open all day but not Tuesday in off season. evansplunge.com

name: Coalinga-Avenal Rest Area
description:
A standard California Rest area with bathrooms and running potable water. 

Picnic area, pet walking area and garbages are also available. Snack vending machines may or may not also be available and working. 

As per the California "Department of Transportation" Rest Area usage policies, you may stay in this area "parked" for up to a maximum of 8 hours. They post no overnight camping signs to deter people from overnighting, but check the DOT website for more information.

name: Larry Combs (Westley) Rest Area
description:
Place was busy all night. I looked for a sign that said overnight was not allowed and found none. Police were here when I woke up, they looked around and left without contacting folks. There is staff here now cleaning up area, emptying trash. It's noisy, but Ok.

Southbound  Dump station is closed.

name: Ontario Rest Area on I-84 Westbound
description: Big parking with Oregon Visitor Information

name: Blacks Creek Rest Area on Hwy I-84 Eastbound
description:
Big rest area. Maximum stay 10 hrs to recover from fatigue and to regain driving ability.

There is a rest area on the westbound side as well. I assume that same rules apply there.

*”Pet area” for dogs to use is covered in the plant called Foxtail. It is harmful to dogs and can imbed itself under their skin requiring surgery for removal. Use the very edge of the area cautiously and check your dogs paws, underbelly, face, and nose for the spores as soon as you are done.*

name: Lutheran Church Parking
description: Parking at Lutheran Church parking lot. $2 per hour or 12 overnight. From 15pm to 8am we were charged 15 dollars. Nothing special just a quiet place in downtown.

name: Sausalito Parkinglot #3
description:
RVs are permitted only at Lot # 3 (max 72h); save and quiet, with public restroom and ferry to San Francisco nearby. 25$ a day (10pm - 7am free).

Fast an free wifi at de ferry terminal

name: Schat’s Bakery
description: Good bread :) lots of good food, fresh orange juice, ...

name: Safe Road Parking
description: Safely parked on the road overnight at this location. Only 8 minutes from PHL.

name: 24 hr Gym Parking lot
description: Safe parking lot outside of Planet Fitness

name: Bear River Campground
description: National park campground, tents and small trailers. Sign says “Not suitable for large trailers. Beautiful camp right on the river, pit toilet, fire rings, tables.

name: Bonham city ordinance
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced

The city of Bonham passed an ordinance that prohibits overnight parking in all city parks. Officer informed us that this was not a very safe place at night.

name: Lake Fannin Free Camp
description: Great boondocking place at the lake. Free. No permit necessary. Shadow, sun and quiet. Easy access by gravelroad for all rigs. Near this point you can easy turn your rig. No amenities. We enjoyed 3 peaceful days and nights.

name: Entry Track to Lake Fanning Free Camp
description: Follow the Lake Fanning sign from the Farm-to-Market Road 273 and then take this track to the free camp spot.

name: Sherwood 54300 National Forest Free Camp
description: Perfect open grassy boondock spot in the pine forest. Free. Quiet.  Easy access by gravelroad for all rigs. No amenities. From this spot the track leads to the river in 1 mile , (as the crow flies). Halfway, the track narrows a bit and you have some moderate ascends and descends. Just before the river there is another spot to camp or to turn.

name: Upper Spavinaw Recreation Area
description: A lot of places to camp here along the creek. Huge recreational areas on the grassy shores. Free. Easy access for all rigs.  Boat ramp available.

name: Vista Point San Francisco
description:
Nice place to stay a night. A lot of RV's there. But amazing sunrise with a view on The Golden Gate Bridge. A little noise because of the road next to it at about 5:00 AM. Access from and directly at road 101. 

This is a formal rest area where sleeping is allowed and legal for up to 8 hours. It's good for a night or two, but not a place to settle and make it a campsite. the view is absolutely amazing and there are toilets open 24 hours. Just be aware that the place gets packed during the day and even during the night there are photographers and others around. Enjoy!

name: Whiskey Creek
description: Pretty campsite right along the river. Is a recognised stop on the Continental Divide bike route. Has potable water, benches, fire pits and toilets. You can hear the river rushing by from your tent. Note if coming from Pinedale you will need to do about two miles off pavement to reach it.

name: Lynx Campsite
description: Pit toilets, benches and during summer months potable water.

name: Red Mountain RV & Campsite
description: Great option for travellers passing through the unremarkable town of Kremmling. This makes a good option for those riding the Great Divide. For tents we paid 12 USD each including unlimited WiFi and hot showers.  20$ for 2.

name: Raven Roost Trailhead Snoqualmie NF
description: Beautiful view of Mount Rainier!  This is a parking lot for the trailhead near Raven Roost lookout.  This borders the Norse Peak Wilderness.  Awesome sunset and sunrise!

name: Mile High Campground
description: A rustic campground along the spine of the Blue Ridge Mountains located on Cherokee Indian Reservation property. Many of the campsites have fantastic mountain views.

name: East Table Campground
description:
National Forest Campground on Hwy 89. Nice shady places at river.

Campground not maintained from October to mid May. No fee during this period. At least there were no fee envelopes at pay station and no Informationen about fee. Only sign that not maintained.

I'm not sure what kind of facilities are available during season. Might not be suitable for big rigs due to narrow road and trees.

name: Yellowstone South Entrance parking bay
description:
This is a parking bay just outside the park. Right next to highway, but seperated by 3m of grass.
No signs prohibiting overnight parking. 100m southbound, however, there is one prohibiting it along highway and in parking areas. I honestly didn't see it (coming from the north/Yellowstone), and I'd say it doesn't apply here. In total there were four campers and I am sure the cops or rangers must have driven past. Didn't get bothered.

Highway is busy during daytime, but hardly any traffic at night. Nice surroundings. Not sure about popping a tent here, but behind the bushes you'll probably be fine. Toilets 500m to the north, next to park entrance (seperate parking area). Free.

name: Showers @ Signal Mountains Campground
description: Public showers, ok to use even if not staying at campground. 7min for 7 USD. Didn't try them, found it a bit expensive. But maybe you're dirty enough to make it worth. ;-)

name: Pullout off quiet side road
description:
Gravel pullout along quiet Henry's Road, a parallel to the main highway 189. Between 8pm and 10am maybe five cars passed, so it is quiet - apart from some remote highway noise from the other side of the valley. 
No signs prohibiting overnight parking. Really nothing to write home about, but level, legal and free.

name: Assateague Island State Park
description: Nice camping right next to the beach. 34$. Wild horses.

name: Campsite 14
description: Dispursed campsite right on the creek.  Secluded, maintained, and not very publicly know.  Site has tent pad that you can pull your vehicle on.

name: rv dump
description:
Free dumping in the sanitation station. Go at the end of the street and follow the blue signalisation. 
No drinking water.

name: Olgiby Road BLM
description: Close to I--8, wide open BLM land, clean with just a few full-timers during the winter. Huge area could fit hundreds of RV's. There are secluded spots if you drive in a bit. Could be windy at times. Decent 4g data AT&T. 5 bars of Verizon. 14 day stay limit.

name: Wilson Lake
description: leave hwy 36 to the north, go on a forest service road, called "wilson lake road" up to the lake. easy access, many spots next to the road and down by the lake available. realy quite!

name: Canyon Street Laundromat
description: Laundromat, showers, water. parking nearby, wifi from weston next to it and plugins for charging stuff like macbooks, phone etc.

name: Appalachien Bay -Corps of Engineering -Keystone lake
description: 18 very primitive sites.  tables. toilets. water. swimming. Beach. was $8 years ago.  info taken from Don Wright' s Free campgrounds.

name: Brush Creek campground -Corps of Engineers-Keystone lake
description: 20 sites. toilets. water. dump station. May use dump by pain day use fee.  camping fee were between $10 to $20 years ago.  info taken from Don Wright's guide "Free campgrounds ".

name: Cowskin Bay South-Corps of Engineers-Keystone lake
description: 30 primitive sites. no rv size limit. Table.  toilets. water.  dump station. Free. info given in Don Wright's guide "Free campgrounds "

name: Goosenecks State Park
description: $10, clean pit toilets, tables with shade. On rim with fantastic views of goosenecks in San Juan river. Windy!

name: North Cove, Bonny Lake State Park
description: Abandoned campground near empty reservoir. Free, vault toilet, tables with shade. State Wildlife Area.

name: Enders Reservoir State Recreation Area
description: $8 primitive camping + $8 day entry. Tables and fire ring. There are some electric sites for $20 and pay showers 50 cents for 3 minutes and water (on eastern side of lake).

name: Riverside Park
description: Quiet city park with showers, toilets, electricity, water, tables, shelter. $5 tent, $15 RV. About 16 powered sites.

name: Hoot Owl Bend
description: Quiet spot near the Missouri River. Sheltered, pit toilet. Dirt/gravel road in for about 1km.

name: Pierce Creek campground
description: Lovely sheltered campground with trees, tables and fire rings. Electric sites $15, primitive $6. Flush toilet, hot shower.

name: Mormon Trail Park
description: 20 sites, electric, pit toilet, table, fire ring, water. Lake nearby for boating and fishing. Quiet spot. $9 tent, $12 electric.

name: Orient Lake Rec Area
description: 22 sites, $15 electric $10 non-elec, toilets, shower, table, water, fire ring. Nice spot beside the lake.

name: Gifford Pinchot NF
description: National Forest Road 28 south of Randle near the creek.  There are numerous places to pull off all along this road.  This one has a nice path down to the creek and is surrounded my some very large trees and abundant moss.  It seems to be much cooler and damp down near the river, so this would likely be a great summer spot, but it was pretty damp and cold in early October.  If you're coming north from Randle, stop at Layser Cave on the way which has a great view of Mount Adams.

name: Washington Irving Cove South-Corps of Engineers-Keystone lake
description: 2 primitive sites. $10 years ago.  38 Electric sites. $15. rv limit size 65 ft.  tables. flush toilet. water. Beach.swimming. showers. dump station.fishing. boat ramp.

name: Tulsa Walmart
description: parking lot at one of the 3 Walmart in Tulsa.  we red that one of them do not accept boondoking.  This one is.  There is security in the parking lot however.   Nice and quiet spot if you park at the right place.

name: Lost Lake
description: Free, no facilities in a beautiful setting. There may be fishing. In the fall the colors are stunning. In October I was the only visitor. Room for 2-3 rigs. Also there are two sites on the 4 mile drive in from the freeway.

name: Scottys Junction - free overnight
description: Just at the junction starts a big, flat place. Nothing  special but a lot of space to stay for a night. The road to Scottys Castle is closed since month (10\2017) so you should finde even more privat places on this road. Here it was very quite at night!

name: Pull out #168 with great view
description: Just a pull out but with a great view. Less traffic in this small road. Long and big vehicles are not recommended because of steep grades and sharp curves.

name: Home Depot Livermore
description: The only market without "no overnight" signs like all the other shops around. WIFI near store.

name: Lake Evans
description:
This is a small lake that has a lot of open space to pitch a tent or pull a rv into. The grass was freshly mowed when we camped here. The roads comming in are narrow farm roads and you may have to drive down some smooth gravel roads. Enter from the south 

Great 4G for ATT, no service Verizon 7/13/21

name: Harrisonville Walmart
description: Huge parking lot.  quiet if you chose the right section of parking.  avoir beeing near wm trucks they might use there generator all night.  Restaurant near by.  PFK, Arby's and MC Donald.  B&B theater too if you're in for a movie.

name: Lick Creek State Forest Campground
description: Grassy shady places in the forest, with picnic tables, fire pits and half open horse stables. Nice and quiet. $ 9 per site per night. No creek, no horses, no people, only trees, pit toilets, one watertap and a honesty box.

name: Hector Martinez Welding
description: Welded and improved my broken spare wheel carrier in no time. Super friendly and seems to know what he does :)

name: Los Padres NF
description:
Another spot in Los Padres NF. Nice views of the mountains and Santa Barbara, off the road and provides shelter from the wind. Caution: the last bit to get to the spot is very step, low range and high clearance required because of washouts. You can stay above as well but then you will be exposed to the wind. 
1-2 bars LTE with ATT.

name: Overlook Sonoma lake
description: We had a quiet night at this beautiful spot! Great view/sunset on Sonoma lake! Dinner table and toilet (as of June the toilet was tipped over) at the spot. Some other cars stopped to use the toilet or rested here during the night. No sign 'no overnight parking'. Big rigs probably don't fit, a van or pickup/motorhome fits.

name: Sand Mountain Rec. Area - free on Tuesday + Wednesday
description:
Sandbuggy heaven! Lot of space for camping near the dune, sometimes during the day noisy because people playing with their sand-toys but quiet at night. Weekly fee is 40$, BUT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY ARE FREE!!!
It is BLM but Agency Annual Pass is not valid.

name: Marshall White Community Center
description: 3 USD per person per day. Gym, pool, hot showers. Just a mile from I-15.

name: Athena Launch Complex
description:
If you ever wanted to camp beside an abandoned nuclear missile silo, here is your chance. Still can't believe this.

Several level spots right beside or on the concrete launch pads or infront of the control bunker. 
Free, very quiet, good vistas. Gates on all sides are open, seems to be BLM land these days. Needless to say, the place has a bit of an aura of death.
The paved access road is a bit rough. Big rigs should watch out for the washouts (can drive around).

If you keep driving about 300m further than the spot marked here, you'll come to a fantastic spot outside the fenced area. Incredible 360 degrees views from a ridge, level concrete pad, space to turn around your rig.

Disclaimer: I didn't bring my Geiger counter. 
Athena and Pershing missiles were tested here until 1979. From what I read online the area has been decontaminated (asbestos, uranium). There is a nuclear waste dump in town. On the web it said the soil right next to the pads was problematic, so maybe not the ideal sandpit for your kids or the dog. Also, asbestos concerns (and shattered glass) would deter me from popping my tent in one of the remaining structures or on that soil.

name: dump station at Love stuck stop
description:
Dump station is on the auto side of the station next to the air fill. Very tidy for a dump station. $10 to dump

Not the easiest place to get out of if flat towing, but we did not have to unhook to get out

name: Miami lake area -Monroe County park
description: some sites with electr.  some full hookups and tent.  Tables   flush toilet. water  dump. Showers. shelters.  fishing.  price years ago varie between  $6 and $15. info taken in guide to "Free campground by Don Wright.

name: Valley wells resting area
description: It's a resting area on the road to Las Vegas. Restrooms and fully legal parking over night. Free!

name: Blue Ridge Overland Gear
description:
The Blue Ridge Overland Gear production facility and shop in Bedford, Virginia. Meet the BROG team, do a quick tour and check out our gear in real-time and see where all the action happens! We're in a brown metal building. When you get to the loop at the end of the driveway, just turn right and you'll see us. Parking is in front and in back of the brown metal building.

We have free camping on-site and off-site overflow camping on Private Land available for anyone that has stopped into our store and received verbal permission to camp.  If after store hours and you cannot get a hold of anyone here, Peaks of Otter Campground is 9miles to the NW of Bedford, VA just off of the Blue Ridge Parkway and costs $20/night.

While you're in town check out all that Bedford and the surrounding area has to offer - including restaurants, wineries, breweries, hiking, camping, and outdoor adventuring of all kinds. Set up base camp at the Peaks of Otter, do some day hiking on the Appalachian Trail or other local hikes, go deep into the Washington and Jefferson National Forests, and go exploring along the breathtaking Blue Ridge Parkway.

name: Red Haw State Park
description: Nice quiet camping. Dump station (free for campers,  $2 for outsiders ). showers. restroom.  some site with electr. ($11) some without ($6). some site pulltrough. lake in front.

name: dump station in the camping of Red hawk state park
description: fee of $2 for non camper.  Free for those who stay at the campground. can also fill with drinkable water at one of the camping site.

name: Route 66 pull out
description: 50 foot off the road. Gravel pullout  quiet after 9 pm. Traffic dies down. Good for one night just after peach springs heading east

name: Kanaskat Palmer state park
description: Currently no bathrooms or showers as they are being rebuilt, will be completed in December 2017 according to the signs.  Currently there are porta potties onsite.  Loud train, including loud horn/whistle that goes by every other hour to hourly through the night.  Half of sites with electric and half none.  Sani dump at entrance.

name: Stroppel Hotel Hot Mineral Baths
description: Worth a stop for a nice soak. Very interesting history.  A couple of RV sites with hookups seasonally next to the hotel. Wifi. Very quiet town. Restaurants nearby.  We heard Sandhill cranes nearby but couldn't locate them. Must be migrating through.

name: Sitting Bull's Burial Site
description: Memorial to Lakota Chief Sitting Bull. At the entrance to Ft. Yates.

name: Prairie Knights Marina & RV Park
description: closed when we were here in mid October but looked nice. Right on Oahe reservoir (Missouri River). Could wild camp at the end of the road right on the water.

name: Cheyenne Mountain State Park & Campgrounds
description:
Colorado State Park very near Colorado Springs and Camp Carson US Army fort & Air Force Academy. Nice new gov. Style buildings. Closes around October 1st you can still camp but services will be closed (washer/dryer, showers, electric, water). Still have toilets, tables, fire rings. In the winter season it’s self service only. 
Park fees $7.00 per day and $26.00 per day for camping.

name: Turkey Creek Boat Ramp
description:
ADMIN NOTE: This place is seasonal, check with local authorities if camping is allowed. 

This place is NOT free, you must get a permit from the state park office which cost $12.  Rangers will drive by and will look for permit posted on your campsite.  Dry camping, picnic table, campfire rings.

The state park also has places for rvs with hookups. The site is located 20 min away from Lynchburg and the Jack Daniels distillery.  There is plenty of room to camp at this location.  
Great ATT, Verizon 4G

name: Westside Park Campground
description:
Camping in the town of Harvey.
Hot showers.  Electricity at sites.

$15 daily
$20 with power

name: Geographical Center of North America
description: This place is as far from the Ocean as you can get in North America.

name: Madison Campground
description: Big (228 sites) NP Campground in forest. Paved sites. Not all level.

name: Walmart
description: Parking possible near A&W after asking the manager. Place seems quiet and minutes walk from the lake where jogging is possible.

name: Walmart
description: Asked the manager, no problem to stay overnight in parking. Quiet place apart from the road passing by.

name: Highway 383 rest stop
description:
Nice rest stop, flush toilets, picnic tables, shelters, trees for shade, water (“not for drinking purposes”) see photo. Some traffic noise from highway until after dark, then pretty quiet. 
Free.

name: Pullout of Hwy 191 overlooking Clay Basin
description:
Gravel pullout just of Hwy 191 on Flaming Gorge Scenic Byway.
Space big enough for a few RVs/Trailers/Motorhomes.

There are multiple options for wild camping along Hwy 191. Just take one of the sideroads and drive for a bit.

Great view of basin & mountains. Potential wildlife viewing, too.

name: Red Cloud Loop (Hwy 18)
description:
Take Red Cloud Loop (signposted) from Hwy 191 towards Vernal. First part of road is paved. When you turn left it is unpaved with some potholes. This part is probably not suitable for big trailers. There are multiple options to camp along the whole loop. Some seem NFS maintained and might require registration and be subject to a fee. 
We stopped for lunch at this place. There are remains of old camp fires.

name: Off the 199
description:
On the right. Looks like a pull off but there is a road down. Sign: Cooper Flat. Great boondocking spot right off the 199 about 4 miles up from Hiouchi on the right. There are three designated spots for vehicles/campsites. Middle spot by the stream will fit a big van and can get level here. Other spots no-go on leveling a vehicle. Tight, steep drive down or up the gravely access road.

Simple hike to the Smith river to the right of the third site. Great views and swimming. Mind the algae bloom and stay out of the pools with it. 

No amenities but a porta-potty occasionally at the top of the access road.

name: Rock Valley
description:
Half a mile off the highway behind a hill, there are a bunch of flat spots with fire pits good for bigger rigs and RVs. If you don't mind driving down a bumpy dirt track and got high clearance there are a couple more nice secluded spots surrounded by boulders near a seasonal creek. Free. No facilities. Really nice!

[Comment: Seasonal creek in moab usually means a wash: very dangerous since prone to flash flooding ]

name: Chamber of Commerce Alamogordo
description: Next to the visitor center there is a dump station with non potable water. No charge.

name: Rocky's Campground
description: Small roadside site with about 30 full hookups and primitive camping spaces too - tents welcome.  Nice new bathhouse and laundry.  Right alongside Rocky's gas station/deli/store.  All very new and in good order.  Primitive tent sites $7 per person + tax.  Right on US98 Coastal Highway.

name: Three Mile Lake Free Camp
description: Follow the signs: Public Area, Boat ramp.  No amenities. Gravel area with concrete boat ramp has enough space for parking and turning. Easy access for all rigs by good quality gravelroad. Quiet. Free.

name: School Section Wildlife Refuge
description:
Just a place to stay for the night next to the road.
Quiet. Lots of birds on a peaceful lake. Swans flying South.

name: El Reno Lake City Park
description:
Large public park on a fishing lake. There's an RV area with electricity for $25, but you can pitch a tent or sleep in your vehicle pretty much anywhere else. It may cost $10 if anyone comes around to ask for money, but the night we were here, that didn't happen.

Fair bit of noise from the nearby highway.

name: Skipout Lake Campground
description: Free, 8 sites on a small lake. Part of Black Kettle National Grasslands. No wifi, but a good strong cell signal (Verizon but not AT&T) Pit toilets, picnic tables. potable water fill up.

name: Open space near Sevier Lake
description: Leave hwy 6/50 at milestone 46 to the gravelroad. gos says: steamboard passrd. follow a few miles, you can camp next to the lake or further on the road next to the mountains. BLM free! verry quite!

name: Miller Canyon
description: thats an realy nice area: miller canyon, exit 99 on interstate 70, than direction north. you pass a great landscape. by the end of the canyon quite places for a night.

name: McBrides spring inc
description: Spring and suspension specialist. Solution driven. They are able to fabricate and install almost any kind of (leaf) spring while you wait, for a very affordable price.  So a perfect specialist for not common (i.e. European) vehicles.

name: Jim and Mary's RV Park
description: Well run. Large sites , clean washrooms.  Good wifi at many sites

name: Colorado Welcome Center
description:
RV Parking behind Welcome Center.
Graveled site - nearly leveled.
No signs - nobody bothered us. A bit noisy from street but ok for 1 night.
Toilets & WiFi at Center during opening hours (9-5). 
Restaurants probably within walking distance in town (we didn't check).

name: Rangley Camper Park (Dumping & Shower for non Campers)
description:
Nice place run by municipality. Paved sites with grassy areas & some trees. Picnic tables & fire rings at sites. Simple but clean restrooms and (hot) showers.

Self registration 
$ 20 with hook ups
$ 15 no hook ups
$   2 shower (non camper)
$   5 dumping (non camper)

Coming from Dinosaur on Hwy 64 drive through town. The campground is on the left shortly before you climb a small hill.

There seems to be at least one privat campground at other end of town.

name: Rest Area on I-70 westbound
description:
Parking lot (not leveled everywhere) on I-70 westbound 1/2 mile prior to exit 227 Westwater. 
Short steep trail leading to outlook with great view of open plains and mountains.

name: Horsethief BLM CG
description:
Nice place off Hwy 313 prior to Canyonlands NP. 
Spacious graveled and level sites - 56 in total. First come - first serve - self registration ($20). Clean pit toilets. Nice 2 mile loop hiking trail starting close to sites 14 & 27.

name: Long Point Boat Launch - Croatan Forest
description: Beautiful free place in the Crotan Forest - Pit toilets

name: Hawkeye Point
description:
Hawkeye Point is the highest Elevation in Iowa, at 1670 feet above sea level!!
Someone paid for and put up this sign, is this a great country or WHAT?

name: Rabun Bald
description: Rabun Bald it the second Highest Peak in Georgia. There is an overlook with 360 degree views at the top. From the parking area it is a round trip hike on foot of about 3 miles. Optionally you can take an old rocky, high clearance, 4x4 necessary, road to the right of the parking area that will get you to a small camping spot that is within 1/2 mile of the peak. Rabun bald is one of the best mountain views in Georgia with few if any other people typically present.

name: Tincup Campground (free)
description:
Very nice spot in the woods and right next to a stream. Near road, but very little traffic. Tables, fire pits, and free of charge. Our RV is 24 feet and fits easily. Another site next to us is huge and could fit the largest fifth wheel I can think of, plus side space for a vehicle. Sites at level.
3g worked with AT&T.

name: Public Toilettes & Showers
description: For free... Here you can shower (free) and take the toilettes... Easy :-) after you pay 2 dollars to park for 1 hour

name: Primitive free campsite
description: Beautiful views and pure nature in primitive campsite with no amenities. Access through a little side road at your right if you are driving towards Capitol Reef. There is with a number of tent campsites. Vehicles must stay on the road so more appropriate for tents, but if you are in a van or short vehicle, at the beginning of the road on the left there is a campsite that will suit a couple vehicles. It is not so far from the main road but it is very quiet at night. We were here alone and had a very good night.

name: Anza borega - grapevine canyon
description: A lot of nice spots in the desert next to the highway 78 but noisy.  First spots 2WD is ok but if you want to go past the creek you need 4WD. Good for overnight.

name: Forest Road 66
description: This is a dead end road with no facilities.  There is no fire ring or designated camping but we had it all to ourselves.  There is a little creek nearby.  You can access this road off of Lincoln Gap Road.

name: Nine mile canyon
description:
Awesome spot in the middle of nine mile canyon. We only passed by here on our way to Arches, so we didn't camp here. But counting the old fireplaces, other people have done it before. 
It is BLM land, so we would have stayed here if it wouldn't be 12 noon. 
If its rainy I assume it is going to be muddy too.

name: Salt Creek Recreation Area
description: Beautiful spots. Many of them are in the forest and some have an ocean view. Cheap nice showers - a quarter for 2 minutes. $27 without electricity; $32 with electricity. Some FCFS sites.

name: Wild in Little Box Canyon
description:
Nice wild camp spot on BLM land. 
4x4 required because of sandy access.
Quiet, completely invisible, free.

name: Sandy flat
description:
Nice campground in the Sequoia National Forest.
Riveraccess, quiet, windy, firepits, watertaps, pit toilets, benches and tables, out of sight from road and unremarkable streetnoise.
23$
Busy on weekends!

name: Hot Springs
description: this is a large community Hot Spring which is clothing optional and serves as the baths for Slab City.

name: State Highway NE-2 Free Camp
description: Gravelparking along a dead-end section of the old road. Not complete invisible from the mainroad, but far enough to feel comfortable. Third of a mile from the railroad. Nice hillside view. We enloyed a quiet afternoon and night.

name: Goodenough Creek Campground (free)
description: This Campground is closed from Sept to Nov for maintenance.. unfortunately we were unable to stay here.

name: Parking in front of a church
description: It’s a free between 6pm and 9am parking on the Main Street in Sedona town... pretty quiet and legal for overnight parking

name: Llantera Culiacán
description:
Excellent tire and alignment mechanic! Very good price!
We got 4 new tires and alignment for 235 u$

name: Seven Winds RV Park
description:
We went there because the Park is in the Passport America book.
Reg fee is $32/nt . With Passport it was $16. It was fine for 1 night. We were ready for electric , wifi and cable. Cable was good.. wifi almost non existent.

name: McFarland Park
description: Full hookups for RVs. Beautiful view of the Tennessee River.

name: highway 1 pull out near mendocino
description: huge pull out on the left side, safe, quiet, no signs, spent the night in our car, didnt get bothered.

name: Walmart Staunton
description: Walmart parking lot, good for one night.

name: Champoeg State Heritage Area
description: Yurts, cabins, full hook up sites and walk in tent sites. General store on grounds and ice, water, fire wood available. Also has dump station for rv's. Free hot showers are available at this location also! Nice place to stay when on the road for awhile.

name: Walmart Supercenter
description: We came to this spot after visiting Acadia NP all day.  Because we are here in offseason most of the camping is closed.  Very friendly and safe walmart.  There were a few RV’s and trailers also camping in the lot.  Clean restrooms.

name: Parker City Campground
description:
Small RV campground with 7 stands.  Just west of town.  Hot showers, electricity, very reasonable rates. The Dakota's have had these little camps right in or near towns.  Nice!

Spots 1-4 are $15 per night
Spots 5-7 are $10 per night

name: Harrah's Resort of Southern California
description:
This Resort Casino is owned and operated by the Rincon band of Luiseno Indians, and is a large Resort/Hotel/ casino complex with large flat parking lots.

Be sure to go inside and double check with Security when first arriving to make sure that you are parking overnight in an area that they would prefer. They have two large lots, one on the North and one on the South side. They'll give you a tag to put on your dash.

The Casino has multiple restrooms, restaurants and on the south side, there is also a Shell Gas station, Subway and 7-11. Be sure to abide by their requests, and to keep the area clean while overnighting here. Very nice and courteous staff both on the Casino floor and behind the desks.

name: Dead End with a View
description:
Great level spot on a short dead end dirt track right off highway 95, about 15min drive east of Natural Bridges NM.
The camp spot is about 250m down the dirt track. Not steep but bumpy. Did it in a 2WD VW bus without problems.You can turn around at the end.
Do not enter if you have very low clearance, a long rig or are pulling a trailer. Anything up to, say, Unimog size will have no problem.
Great views, no shade, legal, free, quiet.

name: Cottonwood Lake Recreation Area
description:
Nice quiet camp on a lake.  Picnic tables and fire grates.
Great cell service.

name: Carhenge
description: silly place with car sculptures that are arranged to look like Stonehenge.

name: Bandy Creek Campground
description: Nice campground in Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area. $19 night without electricity, $21 with electricity. open all year.

name: Port Orford Sunset free
description: Nice place great view the Sunset. Very quiet and next the city. Free, no signs the no overnight parking.

name: Suwannee River Rendezvous
description: Well established campground-RV-motel site. Tent camping, car camping, paved and level big rig parking with electricity, water, sewer, and air conditioned motel rooms. Suwanee River frontage, clear freshwater Convict Spring, super clean swimming pools and hot tub, fire rings, picnic tables. On site restaurant and basic general store with cold drinks and beer available. Clean bathrooms and showers throughout site, with running hot water as well as two coin laundry buildings with washers and dryers. Air conditioned common lodge building with extremely helpful and friendly staff, wi-fi, and tables and chairs. Some nights they offer live music, bingo or sing-alongs. Propane filling available on site. Kayak and canoe rentals as well as weekend lodge activities. Very kid and pet friendly. Owners Susie and Frank are very welcoming and obviously spend a lot of effort keeping the facilities in great shape. Check website for current rates, primitive camp sites were $20 night. We absolutely loved it here and ended up staying a whole week!

name: Mather Campground Dump and water Free
description: Dump station and water free at entrance of Mather campground

name: Free camping in beautyfull canyon, next Canyonland N.P. south
description:
Follow hwy 211, aprox. 5 mile before you enter the N.P. go north on Hamburger Rd. Pass the BLM-Campground to your right (also nice but 10usd) and continue on that gravel road into the canyon. 
You can camp on many sites but if you cross the "indian creek"  (just 4x4) there is a nice and flat plateau on your left.
Realy dark and quite area, great!!!

name: Bruceport County Park and Campground
description: Nice quiet older park with large pines.  The park is right off highway 101, but you hear more sound from the rustling pines.  $21.50 for a plain camp site.  $27 for full hook ups.  The bathroom was old, but adequate.  I liked the campground.

name: West Summit
description: There is a large gravel parking space  off a highway 90 exit, off a paved access road, in front of the lodge.  I stopped for a few hours to rest.  There were several semi-trucks parked near me.  Given the location, there is a lot of traffic noise.  I'm not sure if this lot would be accessible in the winter due to snow or skiers' parking here.  As for food, the lodge may have a restaurant.

name: Thompson Falls Parking
description: This level parking lot is across from a few businesses on highway 200.  It is not paved.  At one end is a small park with some playground equipment.  There is a great deal of noise as one side of the lot parallels a train track.  Trains go by every few hours.  Despite the noise, 3 RVs spent the night with me.  A porta potty is in the train side of the lot.

name: Longview
description: Free dumpstation with water. No potable water.

name: Ballinger City Park
description: city park with small Campground right on top of the Colorado River

name: sanborn's insurance
description:
We bought our insurance here . we pay 450 dollars for 6 months for a RV of 24 feet . The price is expensive but they accept foreigner and the road assistance is included all mexico .  The officman Emanuel is very nice . You can buy your insurance online but here your have more information and explication .
I put a review in case of problem ...

name: Sims Flat campground
description: Forest service campground near I-5.  nice walking trail, cool suspension bridge, popular for fishing.

name: Wild horse Casino
description: Casino Parking. Chandler Az  Big spaces too

name: Gold Nugget BLM
description: Secluded desert camping but with phone signal. This particular spot had a bit of shade in the later afternoon. Make sure to drown campfires. Ours was still ready to ignite wood in the morning. There are signs saying it's close to the border, so be aware of suspicious individuals (and offer them some water and food ;).

name: Gauley Tailwaters
description:
Free camping in designated area. next to the river and Summersville Dam. very nice place.Empty at this time of the year but could be crowded in summer time. no running water
 https://www.nps.gov/gari/planyourvisit/camping.htm

name: Riverside RV Parking
description:
large gravel lot with a pit toilet along the Columbia River. Free, easy access. Tons of room. 

Nice view of the river and windsurfers in the summertime.

name: Walden Visitor Info Free Camp
description: Dirt/gravel parking lot between visitor info and the old yellow train. Here you are allowed to overnight for free. Just outside the town and along the State Highway 125. Easy access for all rigs. We enjoyed a quiet night. Btw: They have a Coin Laundry opposite the Shell. One 20 minutes wash with big machine: 8 quarters of a dollar, small machine 6. Dry also possible, don't know that price.

name: Othello, Fair Ground
description: Very clean, free hot shower, only busy during county fair

name: Coral Pink 4x4
description:
We found this nice place opposite the odd parking nearby the street.
BUT: You need 4x4 AND high clearance.
It's not a through road but leeds to a overlook. We found this spot really the best, flat...

name: Trailhead parking near lake crowley
description: Small gravel lot/parking at trailhead. No amenities but great views over lake Crowley and the Sierra.

name: Burr Trail Road
description: BLM Land. Nice place for the night. Good for 3 RV.

name: Eastern Rogue River/Siskiyou NF dispersed site
description: Camp spots right off the road near the creek.  There are a few potential spots to park/camp here.  Nice forest.  Shaded.  No cell service.  Off Forest road 25.

name: Lawson's Landing
description: Established campground for RVs and tent camping. Huge location, hundreds of spots you can reserve in advance. Beach access.

name: Magnolia Beach
description: Perfect beach location, free. Restrooms (flush).  AT&T connection. Millenicom and Verizon service.

name: Sherwood Habor Marina & RV Park
description:
It is a nice small campground at the river, but it is not cheap (40 USD). The personal is friendly. There is a small store, a laundry and a fishing beach. Boat launch.
Om the main road is a sign "Road closed", but you can drive to the marina.

name: Winter Haven RV Park
description: Establish RV Park .  Grass and lovely... easy entrance to sites

name: Cherokee N.F., Parksville Lake Campground
description: Nice and quiet, in the forest on a lake. $20/night - $15/night if you have National Parks Annual Pass or other accepted passes.

name: Pinestone Gravelpit
description: ATV/OHV, bike, hike, horse trailhead parking lot. near gravel pit. Just off highway. No services. Ok overnight stop.

name: Watermill express
description:
Purified water- self-service 24h
. 1 USD / 5 gallons
Big place to park your big rig.

name: Carrizozo - valle del sol park
description: Free- little pound with birds. Park your rig along fence near the old country club house. Nice view, quiet, short access.

name: Lincoln city
description: Dump station. Water non potable. Big rig ok.

name: Antelope Wells
description: US entry point, water, bathrooms, a vending machine and little else.

name: Bridget-Teton National Forest Road 30650
description: Easy dirt/gravel road with plenty of flat spots to camp on. Hunting season is pretty full, but we still found a spot without a problem. Bigger rigs would probably want to take earlier spots along the road as the going gets a little rough and steeper as you go.

name: Carl G. Washburne Memorial State Park
description:
Day use area Carl G. Washburne Memorial State Park.
Free Dump station. Water available. ...................
On ocean side of Highway 101.

name: Crookton - Side Road at Route 66
description: Decent place for one night on your way to (or from) Grand Canyon or driving along I-40. A side road makes a loop from and to R66 for just about 200-300m. There is some vegetation so you can’t be seen from R66. Nothing fancy and no amenities yet ok. Quiet as traffic is limited. Suitable for towed vehicles or bigger rigs as well up to 5th wheel size. 5bars LTE with AT&T

name: Telephone Cove, Lake Mohave
description:
Lovely quiet spot lakeside Lake Mohave. Clean pit toilets. Can be busy at weekend.
Junction from 163 : 35.192596, 114.64077.

name: Willloughby Creek
description: Two car pull in , right off the road by creek. The spot is opposite of what used to be the Willoughby Creek Campground. Stayed here for free one night, no one bothered us.

name: Top of Lone Cabin Road
description:
Primitive camping.  4x4 and high ground clearance recommended.  Terrific views of the West Elk Mtns, Ragged Mtns and more.   

Access South of Paonia, CO from Lamborn Mesa Rd; Or Dry Gulch Rd. 

Be warned, this road is impassable when wet, even for the most well equipped 4WD vehicles!!

name: Garland Prairie RD
description: An hour from the Grand Canyon and 10 minutes from Williams. Free, no facilities. A forest road where camping is allowed. There are lots of sites with fire rings. In early November it was below 30 at night. They either had a fire here recently or it looks like they intentionally burned the grass to help prevent forest fire. Was a bit smoky. Bring your own fire wood. Pack it in, Pack it out. Quiet with exception of occasional train noise. Lots of room for dogs to run. No one was here when we were. Easy access dirt road but could be muddy. I would drive anything out here. You can camp more in the trees or more in a field. Field had 4G service.

name: Onion Beds Camp
description:
Gotta love the dispersed camping in the USA! In the Monument, nothing but a spot to park with amazing views. Off of the Burr Trail. Quiet. Stick with it & go to camps further west. More spectacular! 
NOTE: The Notom-Bullfrog road is horrible with washboard.

name: Deer Creek campground
description: lovely camp right on the stream. very small sites with nice, level tent spots, 🔥 ring, picnic tables.

name: Blair valley camp ground
description: Lot of great spots next to a gravel road

name: Across Hite, right at Colorado River
description:
There is a gravel road down to the plateau on the river. no sign, we had no problems.
other local camper stayed there too. great views, quite at night!

name: Permit required Coyote Buttes
description:
You need a permit to enter Coyote Buttes.  Available online, in Kanap or Paria outpost. It is a spectacular sandstone area. Do not miss The Southern Wave! (36.965124, -111.98995).
The track northeastwards from these coordinates is extremely sandy, once you drive into it, it is a challenge to turn around! We tried it...

name: Scott’s Lake Dispersed Camping
description: A large number of sites, many with fire rings. Very clean. No toilets or garbage service.

name: Private spot among Jeffrey pines
description: Spot off forest service road not too far from mammoth. No services at all

name: Alyeska Resort
description: Campground at the parking lot at the day lodge

name: Hostel Boise
description: Nice, $25 have parking, quiet clean safe

name: Cracker Barrel
description: 6 RV spaces behind the store. Called up before and spoke to the manager who said it was fine to stay overnight. Highway is in front of the store so no direct noise. Still quite a bit of traffic around + trains passing.

name: Speedway, free dump no drinking water
description: It's a Freeway station with free rv dump yet no drinking water. There's a long vacuum : 1$50 for 5 minutes.

name: At Kaibab Forest near Grand Canyon
description: Quiet place at Kaibab Forest with access through a gravel road. Fire ring, flat, great for a couple nights. The only disturbance are the helicopters which you can hear at a distance but not an issue though.

name: Santa Fe Trail Picnic Area
description: Covered tables, toilets, room for tent or rig overnight - we slept under a covered table sans tent - peaceful quiet night!

name: Hoh River Trust
description:
Just off of the main Hoh Road (which passes through National Forest land with campsites as well!) lies a dead end road with a two track dirt road turn off to the left. Down this road there are about 6 sites, with the final one being on the rocks of the riverbank if you have high clearance. 

I’d expect this area to have people during the weekend in season, but off season it is empty. Amazing site super close to the Hoh area of Olympic NP.

name: Eagle Lake
description: Just off the 139, BLM campground, fire pits, picnic tables, shaded sites, pit toilets and peek-a-boo views of the lake. Really nice site, no sign of how, where, or what to pay - although there are signs for a host, no one came. We camped for free. Dog friendly and a few other friendly campers. Also picked up strong AT&T signal. Perfect. :)

name: Palomar Mountain State Park
description:
Nice campground in the Doane Valley.  About 12 flat spots for camper vans and RVs, rest of the spots is hike in. Beautiful hikes, similar climate and vegetation as in Yosemite valley. 
Hot showers from 1. April - 1. December. I was told it fills up during high season and you should reserve. When we were there in November there was only one other party there. 

Site: $30
Shower: 25c/2min

name: baticueva near Zion
description: good place near east entrance Zion NP. Quiet and free. There are a lot of places

name: water
description: potable water and dump in south campground. Zion NP. Free

name: Rocky Mountain RV & Marine
description: Incredible they had in store  all parts we needed to change as awning bra, fridge roof protection, toilette ring, door catch, screen door lash....,

name: Roadside pull out.
description: Pullout right on US-101.  Fantastic view of the ocean.

name: Cattail Cove State Park
description: Excellent campground that accommodates big rigs and has electric and water at each site. Free hot showers and running potable water.  Right on Lake Havasu not too far from the “London Bridge”.

name: Willow Tree - Colorado River - Mohave Lake
description: This is free camping in the Lake Mead National Recreation Area on the Colorado River just as it becomes Lake Mead for a while. There are at least 3 different camping zones on this side of Lake Mead. Our site is in Willow Tree and it is on the North end of the lake. We have a spot right on the water with a little cove. No one else here. Great stars, very dark and quite. No facilities. Pack it in, Pack it out. Fire rings, but bring your own wood. Mosquitoes are the worst I have seen. We came in at dusk and drove through clouds of them. We got lucky at camp there was a nice breeze keeping them reasonable and same in the morning. Beware if there is no wind. Signs coming in say 4x4 required for the roads. We are here during the dry season and never used our 4x4, but I can see how if it rains you may need it. Due to the signs I don't know what a ranger would do if you came out in 2wd. A swimming dogs paradise. We had no cell service.
