description: Perry Lake Municipal RV campground, near Perry OK. 1 mike from interstate, overlooks reservoir. $25 full hook-ups, $5 primitive.

name: Aubuchon Hardware
description: Great service and fair prices. Excellent hardware store as well.

name: TJ’s Truck Stop
description: Good service. Typically dispenses propane, though line needed repair when we stopped through. Call ahead. Multiple places in town also dispense propane.

name: TJ’s Truck stop
description: Large, flat parking lot. Other trucks in parking lot over night. Quiet, friendly. There’s a restaurant and convenient stop here as well.

name: Walmart Farmington
description: Big parking lot. Very quiet at night. A few rv's around. Shop closes at 11pm.

name: Little Fort - George Washington NF
description: Little Fort is open Year Round. There are 6-15 campsites at this location. You may stay 14 Days at Little Fort.  ATV trails - may fill up quickly on weekends.  Level pads for tents, picnic tables, fire rings and pit toilets.  No other amenities.  Lovely spot.

name: Swingle Canyon Road
description: Free site in Cibola National Forest, Datil Mountains. Easy to get to down hard packed dirt road - just a few ruts. There are maybe 4 to 5 sites before the road turns into a 4WD road. Cold in April. We woke up to snow on the ground. Pretty and quiet.

name: Just off FR 525
description: The sites on FR 525 are all packed at this time, took this road just off and up a bit and found seclusion. The road is bumpy but I did it in a 03 Ford E-150 Campervan, nice spot with a fire pit. Verizon is hit and miss but getting some 3G/LTE. Also allot of day traffic during the day on the FR 525 as it's a main road to the ruins a few miles up, so this gets you off that a bit.

name: Delta Village R V Camping
description: 3836 Highway 82 W, R V Row, Leland, MS 38756. Friendly and helpful. $20 p n. Good laundry. New restrooms.

name: Camping World of Syracuse (+Informal Campsite)
description: Free dump station.  Open 24/7.  Propane and overnight camping allowed.

name: Camping World of Syracuse
description: Propane refill of standard North American BBQ tanks.

name: Manitou Auto Service
description: Excellent, well-priced mechanic. Fixed my Sprinter’s brake lines perfectly and charged less than I expected. Family run shop with honest people and a bunch of dogs.

name: Walmart
description: A big Lot with bushes and trees, clean and quiet!

name: Couterie Forest Trailhead, City Park, New Orleans
description: Small gravel parking lot at the trailhead to Couterie Forest in City Park, NOLA.  No toilets or services, but really quiet once the sun set, except for some road noise, and no street lights.  Privacy in the middle of a city? Unheard of.  City Park is really beautiful, and only a short drive to downtown. The south end of the park has public restrooms, and. also some nice gardens, restaurants, sports fields and playgrounds. If you drive in to the downtown area, park in the Garden District along a residential area off St. Charles St. and Magazine St.  You can catch a trolley on St. Charles that will take you into the French Quarter and back to your car, 24 hrs/ day, $1.25.

name: Jackpot Cactus Pete’s Casino
description: Parking lot behind CP Casino open paved lot with lights stayed overnight there many times with no problems or semi’s. It is a quiet location with easy access.

name: The mamoth site
description: Amazing site where they found 61 mammoths. It's about $10 per adult for entry. Definitely a must stop when you are here as there's not many public, active archaeological sites in the US. You can call to ask permission to stay for one night in their parking lot.

name: Gander Mountain Parking Lot
description: Abandoned store parking lot with huge paved lot. Trucks overnight here too. There's a Walmart directly across the street but not sure if they allow you to stay overnight.

name: Assateague Island National Seashore
description: There are several campgrounds located within the park....one known as Bayside and the other Oceanside. Reservations are recommended here, especially on weekends. There's a fee to enter the park and campsites were $30 per night.

name: north padre free camping
description: nice place. dogs off leash fine light colored sand. no skeeters. just a few campers. hard packed sand is fine to drive any vehicle.

name: Burlington Residential Parking
description: Some street are for residents only, but most are not, check signage. May be better for a smaller rig, but you might get lucky.

name: Market Basket
description: One of the best Grocery store chains in New England. Good food resupply if you are in the area. Cheap too.

name: Camping World of Syracuse
description: Overnight camping allowed in lot.  Free dump station, non potable water and propane also available.  Earplugs helpful - steady highway noise.

name: Bigfoot Trail Camp Rec Area, De Soto NF
description: Large clearing amidst tall new growth pines.  Lots of sites with picnic tables, a pit toilet, fire rings and game racks (for stringing up your deer, etc.).  There is a well pump with water.  We aren't sure if it is potable, but we will use it to clean our dishes and bathe in the morning.  When we pulled in there was no one here.  Just a few minutes down the road the Airey Lake Rec area was packed.  The lake was more a pond than a lake and not worth sticking around for.  This place will be quiet tonight, for sure.

name: White house trail head
description:
Nice blm campground with vaulted toilet,
$5.00. Water at entrance, Paria station.
7 sites for camping.

name: Gila River Recreation Area
description: Just drive down the street you find several spots. Shady places and some have fire pits. You can also go to the river. Very quiet at night. The road is a bit steep but we did it with our van. I don’t know if it’s possible for big rigs. It’s FREE!

name: Green Road
description: Free campground in the Manistee national forest, it is only allowed to camp on the left side of the road, going south.

name: Near Valley of Fire State Park
description: Flat campsites hidden from road.  With 4 wheel drive can go over small hill to very private place. Quiet, good cross country hiking. Free

name: Clear Springs Park Campground
description: State Park(?) On Wright Patman Lake close to Texarkana.  Clean and quiet with picnic tables and fire pits at each site. Cell signal - 2 bars  $26/night. Dogs OK. Very clean showers and bathrooms.

name: Camp Site - Holly Mount Trail
description: Cleared back country camp site. 4wd is a must to get here. No water, cell service, or facilities. Must bring everything and take your trash with you.

name: BLM 30 Km Zion
description: Quiet and nice free place. About 3 km from the highway by a gravel road. Cellular signal good reception. No amenities. Great Verizon coverage (LTE)

name: Space by the river
description: We kept asking around this neighbourhood and one nice guy told us about this spot at the site of the road. Discrete enough and at the side of the river. Nice shade. Perfect for motorcycles. Wouldn't really fit more than one maybe two tents. But all around perfect place for a night.

name: Dome Rock
description: Many places to wild camp along dirt road to Dome Rock. Sites with fantastic views just past the parking area for the summit. Verizon LTE on summit. Please keep this area clean so it will stay open to camping.

name: Palm Canyon - Anza-Borrego State Park Campground
description:
Developed State Park Campground just outside the popular Palm Canyon trail. 50+ sites with hookup but the primitive sites (number 100+) are the way to go (when not 40+ degrees). 

Very nice bathrooms and the setting is beautiful. All sites have tables and a fire-pit. Wood is also available. The toilets are spotless and pay showers are available. 

Cost is $45 a night for full hookup - not sure about primitive. The town is cute and close by with a grocery store and restaurants.

It’s almost always booked in Spring and most weekends.

name: Figueroa Campground
description:
Established campground in the Los Padres National Forest outside Santa Barbara wine country. 

30+ sites within trees up the mountain. Very quiet and beautiful site that’s strangely under-trafficked given the excellent location and proximity to wealthy population centers. We showed up on a Friday afternoon and were the first visitors for the weekend. Less than held were occupied by 10pm. 

Great dog friendly hiking and mountain biking nearby. Also 20 minutes to Los Olivos area wineries. A great bargain 

Sites are $20 a night and firewood is available. There are toilets as well. Very quiet.  

Sites are reservable and some are first-come, first-served. Check in advance.

name: South of Arizona trailhead, Grandview entrance to Grand Canyon
description: Lots of nice camping spots in this area. Also, lots of people wanting to camp in this area so arrive early in afternoon. Very quiet at night, I mean very quiet, no noise last night, not even wind. Nice. Lots of shade in the Ponderosa pines.

name: On FS Road 308, 0.4 miles west of hwy 64
description: Many good camp spots in area. Ponderosa pine forest. Good spot for camping and visiting Grand Canyon NP.

name: Tejon Pass Rest area
description: This rest area allows you to sleep in your vehicle for the night, has rest areas and bathrooms and a trailer dump station near the exit.

name: safety roadside rest area
description: this is a standard roadside rest area with men and women's bathrooms a tower parking in a 24-hour period

name: Northbound 99 Rest Area
description: this is your standard highway rest area but no vending machines.

name: Pittsburgh Duquesne Incline
description:
Price 10 $ for 24h.
Near bus station. 2 Min to downtown.
It is really noisy. Railway and Street.
Security controlled.

name: Beachside R V Park
description: Small site. No toilet block but a shower & laundry. There's a toilet in the office but not always open. We paid $25 for a pitch without facilities. $35 with electricity, water etc. We were able to fill up with water. Some road noise. Lovely beach about 5 mins walk away

name: Honey’s Park -Arco Idaho
description:
Free dry campground and dog park, with wifi, friendly conversation, electricity, a beer fridge and occasional campfires in a pit depending on wind mostly so we don't start a wildfire anywhere.  'Dry; - meaning he has no water source on site, but hauls water from a publicly owned station with water, potable and non-potable located within 1/4 mile.  
 
  There are several buses for use as hostels and one has a shower. Public restroom in a park located 1/4 mile away. Free publicly owned dump station nearby.   All of this information is on a map of Arco posted on his website.

  Microwave and propane BBQ for use by everyone who wants it.

   Ran and started by a disabled Army vet who named the place after a dog who he promised her own park while they were homeless together.  She passed shortly after its purchased but it will forever be hers.  But he believes people shouldn't have to worry about where they are going to camp or whether or not the cops will come knocking in the middle of the night.  

He doesn't ask for donations, but it makes him sad when people don't take the time to read his website. Is that too much to ask?

name: Crawford's auto repair
description:
Small family owned business. We had our X-TERRA tuned up at this place. Very fair customer service, fast work, great job, willing to answer all tricky questions. If we lived in Mesa this would be our mechanic for sure.
tel. 623 297 0986
2855 S Alma School Rd.
suite 107

name: Gila mufflers & radiator
description: affordable muffler shop. fast service. no appointment needed. just show up. they did some welding and replaced parts of the pipe for only $70. don't get put off by the look of the place. they are great people.

name: Casino dump station
description: Free dump station with water. Don’t know if it is potable but we filled in our tank after trying the water.

name: Walmart 24h
description: Quiet Walmart parking lot. No signs. 24 hours open. WiFi available. 3 trucks and a RV did stay with us. No problems. Overnight is allowed to stay here.

name: Great Sand Dunes NP Primitive Road
description:
Fantastic find! Secluded FREE sites with gorgeous views! 

Primitive Rd out of the northeast corner of the GSD National Park leads to 14 designated camp spots in the first 2.5 miles, 7 more through mile 5.8 (between the park and Medano Pass)

Most sites have bear boxes and fire pits. Some have roads to drive into, some are walk in tent sites. 

A couple shallow river crossings and some soft sand. Other than that road is decent but 4WD needed.

name: Sheep Creek Trailhead
description:
Parked here to hike the trail just before sunset and camped here overnight. 
Great quiet woodsy spot off 166 (USFS 622). There’s a parking lot and also a couple spots off the parking lot with fire rings. 
At 1 mile and 1.5 miles down the trail (stay to the right when you reach the river at 1 mile) there are a handful of tent sites. 
Hot springs at the end of the trail. Right on the river. Totally quiet ~

name: Public toilets and beach showers
description: You have here public toilets (close at night) and open beach showers. Also parking place and access to the beach.

name: Parking lot
description: This is a parking lot for costumers that came to buy from some of the businesses in here. There are no signs that says you can't park overnight!! So I stayed 1 night. Had no problems. In addition there's a Starbucks, a grocery store and pets store if you need.

name: Picnic area
description: You have here water, public restrooms and showers, picnic tables, big loans, and all of these right in front of Elcatraz prison and Golden Gate Bridge!! Beach accessible and very good for kite surfing. Sign says no overnight parking, but it's a very nice place to spent a day and taking some rest from overlanding

name: Street along a park with playground
description: Good place to overnight in a very quiet little town, with playground and picnic tables. We spent the evening in the big city park (see other overlander spot) which is nice too with playgrounds, river, free tennis courts, trails to run, bbq, water, electricity and moved downtown as the big park closes at 11:45 pm.

name: Outlook
description: A place with a great view near the street, but less trafic, okay for overnight

name: snow paradise
description: Like the sites a bit east, there is a network of forest roads around this area, tried thine suggested a bit east but there were 4 weird people there, so we kept going west and found this place, is March now and is snowing we loved it. No cell service

name: bigger pull out
description: Bigger than the other previously listed, drive down the side

name: Walker Habitat Management Area
description: Nice place to fish and swimming. Free, 2 fireepits a bit windy and noisy because the train passes close by

name: dug bar
description: Pretty spot on snake River, bordering a Idaho and Oregon, great fishing, high clearence needed. Not suitable for rv's. Get gas in joseph (last one with gas), in a 4runner it took us 2 hours from imnaha. There is a gate by the dug bar sign, open it and enter, goddess comps pots and close the the toilet. Pretty far from the beaten path, but we'll worthed it if you're up for and adventure

name: Signal Peak Rd
description:
Decided to explore this Forest Road off NM15 on a whim as it looked pretty with trees lining the start of the road. Shortly after leaving NM15, you enter a beautiful forest that has been totally devastated by fire, so it's extremely interesting to see. The road through it is an easy 2WD road with only a few very minor rockier sections. The forest fire area goes on for about 6km until you reach 2600m in altitude, that's where the trees come alive again. The views are stunning as this road gains altitude quickly through a canyon and from the top you can enjoy the entire fire area.

Some cautions: I would not recommend visiting here on a windy day. These trees still weigh a ton and are ready to topple over. Also, do NOT camp in the forest fire area.

There are plenty of spots to pull off the road and camp above 2600m. There were also a few spots off to the left side at the start of the road near NM15.

name: Near Toadstools
description: one or more places for overnightparking on BLM land. No toilets. No electricity. No water. No dump but really calm and not far away from hwy 89

name: Cold Springs
description: RV Park with option to boondock on grass verge to side of park. $10 dollar fee includes use of shower and WIFI. Small store , bar and restaurant onsite.

name: Rest Area on US-95
description: Very nice Rest Area with clean toilets and picnic tables with shades. It was not crowded in the evening/night. You can hear the noise of the street but at night it wasn’t so much traffic. Also spaces for big rigs.

name: Flying J
description: Typical truck stop with RV spots and normal parking spots.  Dennys on site. Showers and laundry as well.

name: Oak Ridge Trailhead
description: Good place if you’re just looking for a quiet place to park for the night.  Not totally flat and no fire pit but has 2 bars of Verizon LTE and came in clutch for us in the van at 9pm

name: Grove Street Chicago.
description:
Street parking in Chicago. Grove Street has no parking limits. We stayed 2 nights here and felt safe, but this is something you have to decide for yourself. There are streetlights. It is opposite an abandoned warehouse. 2 semi trucks were also there. It is only 700m to chinatown station (trains operating 24/7). Public Library Chinatown has fast internet. It isn't a quiet or beautiful place but it is free and close to everything. It probably won't be here forever as there is advertising for the warehouse. It seems like it will be renovated in the near future. 
There is also free parking on 16th street across the river. Don't know how the bridge clearances are to get there, we stayed here in a class C RV.

name: Sweet Briar Dam State Game Management Area
description: Free, legal lakeside camping on state lands just off the freeway. Roads are dirt with muddy spots and mild washboarding. I found a site near a pit toilet. Fire rings installed, but "no campfires" signs posted.

name: Up on the hill
description: Great free spot on BLM land south of Sevilleta National Wildlife Refuge. It is up a hill off the road (turn at approximately 34.2238062, -106.9424321 to go up hill to the spot) leading to San Lorenzo Canyon. As you go up the hill you will see a few fire rings, but the best site is at the top. Beautiful view and very private, only saw a few other campers while we were here and they were miles away. Great data signal! There is an unmarked trail leading from the site over the hills. We followed it until it petered out. I don't think big rigs could get up this hill, but if you follow other spur roads from that main road that leads to San Lorenzo Canyon, you can find lots of other sites. The Canyon is maybe a 3 mile walk from this site.

name: Washington DC National Mall
description: We parked here for free all day on Sunday. Get here early before 9 am.  Constitution road. Walking distance to everything

name: Indoor Swimming pool
description: one of the few pools open before season (mid May). $4 for adult lap swim/family swim. located in Kiwanis park, Tempe.

name: Harrisburg Island
description:
Parking lot
10$ regular oversize 20$
Sat and Sun free
1 - 2 Miles to Capitol

name: Walmart
description: Quiet. No signs, did sleep with out any probs with my 23 feet RV.

name: Telephone Tower X
description: Old road for tower repair access. Among Joshua trees. Phone lines line the road. But if you find yourself chasing a full moon and need a place to sleep, anywhere along this road seems ok.

name: Picnic area on SH 43
description: In this nice shaddy picnic area, a sign says camping is allowed for less than 24 h. Not right by the road but close so a bit noisy in the evening and quiet at night.

name: Kickapoo Caverns State Park
description:
$20 pn Inc water & electricity. $12 without. +$3 pp park day fee. Small site. Lovely walks & lots of beautiful birds, butterflies + bats. Very quiet & tranquil.

Pack your trash out there are no dumpsters.

name: Tongue river campground
description: Along this dirt road there are camping spots. Nice creek next to it. There is some traffic at the dirtroad but it’s nice. BBQ/ firepits available. Also a pit toilet at the beginning of the road. Full AT&T and Verizon LTE reception!

name: Canyon of the Ancients NM
description:
Amazing view!!!
In BLM managed NM. Free. 
Access via dirt road. High clearance 2WD is no problem (we have a VW vanagon).
...amazing view. Google maps gets you to the left turn onto BLM. See sign.
(It's 1 mile past the trailhead on the left.)

name: Cape Lookout
description: There is a water filtration system. And two Water fountain.

name: Boundary County Fairgrounds
description: Free 72 hour rv parking and dump station. In Bonners Ferry Idaho

name: Cascade Caverns
description: from primitive to RV this Campground is out of the way but still close to I-10. located on a extraordinary Cavern this place is busy during the weekend no one bothered us during the week

name: Immigration Checkpoint
description: Couple of miles S of Comstock. Asked if we were U S citizens (we're English) & for our passports. As they were in the back they said they were sure we weren't here illegally & let us go. Very friendly.

name: Langtry, Judge Roy Bean Saloon & Museum + Visitor information
description: Free; Excellent with restrooms, water fountain, WiFi, loads of info & great help from the guides for places elsewhere + Cactus garden.

name: Black Hills NF
description: A long dirt good road (drivethru to Sundance) comes to a quiet place in the wood- beautiful!

name: Cracker Barrel in Calvert city
description: Convenient overnight spot close to the highway but rather quiet at night. A few km from the Kentucky dam, a water power plant where you can park to enjoy the view.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart parking lot. Enough space, no signs and quiet at night. We stayed with our 23 feet without any problems.

name: Valley of the Gods
description: Many nice spots in Valley of the Gods. This spot is close to the road, as most are, but you are out of sight. Great views and a nice area to go explore.

name: Space Centre Automotive
description:
Very good Garage which work on all Typs and Models. Very good was that they actually try to help us. The did try to find the right parts in the USA from different sources.

Even that thy did not had to do it. The checked everything and find the rotors (Brake disk) in really bad conditions.All over all they really try to take care as well at issues they did not had too.

name: Walmart
description: We didn’t stay but there is a huge parking lot and no signs for no overnight parking

name: Turbo Auto Repair
description: Although it took a while to figure out the problem we had with our lights we received good service. They even tried to retrieve broken part from junk yard first. Given the time they spend figuring out the problem and the time they spend looking for the part we paid very reasonable price. So if you have electrical problem I recommend this place. Not all shops in town have electricians.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart, ok for the night there were others Campers also here. Security approves as of 6/11/22.

name: Yosemite Dump Station and Potable water
description: Free Dump station and potable water in Yosemite National Park.

name: Hickories City Park Campground
description:
Typical campground by the city of Owego. Clean bathhouses. Well maintained property. $25 a night 30amp
$17.00 tent camping

name: Marathon French Supermarket
description: Small with fast WiFi + unusual foreign products too.

name: Big Bend Birding & Photography Tours
description: Lee is a delightful, very enthusiastic & knowledgeable guy. bigbendtours@leehoyphotograohy.com www.tourbigbend.com 432.386.6855

name: Roadside stop Blue Ridge
description:
Stayed for one night , not moved on. Quiet  I think in peak season you maybe be asked to leave but seeing it is early all ok. Pulloff/Overlook on parkway but further away from the road 
Great views

name: Duke's Creek
description: Trail head parking lot with pit toilets with a view.

name: Free dumpstation and potable water
description: At the entrance of Callville campground. No fee required.  Dumpstation and potable water available.

name: Fairmont Park
description:
Street Parking
Public Transport to Downton
Is Space for a big Rig
We stayed two days

name: Walmart
description:
Quiet. We stay ohne night there.
It is good for a stop over

name: Grimes Point Archaelogical Site
description:
Parking lot with trails.
Quiet at night after 10 PM. Pit toilets, picnic table....

name: Gasstation
description: Gas station with a big parking lot where trucks park at night. Because it is so big you need not nessecarily park in between the trucks. That means it's not so noisy as many such places usually are. And you do not hear the interstate.

name: Jonathan Dickson State Park
description: This is a super state park just outside Jupiter FL. Hiking, mtn biking and river activities. Total for RV spot was $35 (which included the $6 transaction fee for the reservation) Clean bathrooms and cheap laundry facilities. A little concession area with 'happy hour'.

name: Rabbit Island
description: Hanning Flat Dispersed Area. Looks like maybe a former ranch (?) although there are still cattle grazing on this property. Lake Isabella water access if desired. Trees if you need/like shade. No facilities whatsoever just nice space to spread out for free! 30 day limit. Good cell signal with AT&T

name: Marfa Presidio Co Museum
description: Very interesting museum with artifacts going back to the early 1900s Inc war history, uniforms, household goods & furniture, typewriters, phones etc. Open Thu-Sun

name: Purified Water
description:
Purified Water distributor next to the Safeway store.
40cents/gallon

name: Beginning of a trail
description:
The other places were filled with snow. No signs here and a fire ring.
We stayed there two nights. Very quiet although close to the road. No traffic at night.

name: Parking of the Wright Creek Trailhead
description:
Little parking just on the other side of the bridge. The trailhead sign says that it's allowed to camp here.  Free.
A little bite of noise from the highway but not too bad.
Room for 3 medium van (24ft) or one big RV.

name: Purified Water
description:
Purified Water distributor next to a shop.
40cents/gallon

name: Parking of the Dunes Trailhead
description:
Parking lot to a trailhead to the dunes. No "no-sign" but you have to have a national park pass or pay the fee to the dunes.
Surprisingly quiet at night considering the nearby highway.

name: Parking of Trailhead - Siuslaw NF
description:
Room for two or three medium size RVs (24ft). Not much room to turn around.
Very quiet. Free
No 'no-sign'.

name: Parking Lacey Customers Timberland Library
description:
We asked the Library where we could park for the night and they said here.
It's in the woods and next to the town hall. Police nearby didn't say anything.
Very quiet. 
Ok for one night.
Room for small vans.

name: Northport MH and RV Park
description:
Small park with a few sites for RVs/trailers. Nice view, is right on the lake with a little dock. Relatively quiet from a human view, but the geese and other aquatic creatures are a bit loud at times (but we have enjoyed it!).
Showers are hot, laundry is reasonable.
Price is $30/night with full hookups, $15 for Passport America holders. If you have more people in your party than 2, you must pay $2.50 per additional party per day.

name: Hawk Mountain
description: Broad camping areas to the west and north of a large meadow. Most are under trees. Stay off the meadow!

name: Roche Harbor Marina
description: Publics showers in the Marina’s restroom,  didn’t try them but just saw them while passing by

name: William O'brian State park
description: nice clean campground. Busy. sites off the river have a nice view of the St Croix river. Hiking kayaking canoeing fishing boating swiming.

name: HillTop
description:
Nice overnight parking spot just beyond main parking area. Room for a couple vehicles, don’t expect privacy as this is a popular spot with the locals and travelers. Clearly marked trail leads to hot spring tub. 
2bars Verizon LTE, fast speeds.

name: Beach Haven
description: Free hot shower directly at the beach. Restrooms were closed at that time of season, though.

name: hot coin shower
description: very clean 24/7 hot showers, 3$ for 4minutes equals 10 gallons. you can also buy fire wood and ice. there is also a washing machine.

name: Nevada hwy 50
description: Great stop for the night at base of low hills in the trees. Lots of level slots for tents

name: The FlyingJ
description: Food, fuel, showers, propane.

name: Camp Site in Honobia WMA
description:
MUST HAVE Three Rivers / Honobia WMA pass that can be purchased through Oklahoma Parks and Wildlife. 
Great camp spot that is cleared, but with plenty of tree cover and access to river. 
Big enough to fit several vehicles was well as several good trees to hang hammocks.
Also has a make shift structure you couple put a tarp over and have a make shift shelter.

name: Point Pleasant campground on Swan river
description: Beautiful, small and quiet campground with a pit toilet on the banks of the Swan River. About 10 sites, first come first serve.

name: Walmart
description: Stayed one night with our RV(22 feet) without any problems. No trucks allowed but for us ok.

name: Dump station 7 Dollar
description: Dump station. Ask at the desk. Costs 7 Dollar. For portable water just take a  faucet near to the dump station.

name: Walmart
description: Quiet. No signs. No police. Huge parking lot. Slept very well here in our RV

name: USNF Site on Lake Santeetlah
description: The spot is still here however the picnic table is gone and there is a fence blocking the dirt road leading up to the site. I had to park close by and walk up the short dirt road to a big open camping area with a fire pit. Would have been great for car camping or RVs at one point but the fence blocking the road really changed my plans. Still a beautiful spot I would come back again

name: Mancos State Park Campground
description: Great camping at the Mancoa State Park, $18 camping, $7 parking fees. camp sites have gravel, restrooms are super clean (pit toilet). Park ranger bis very nice and comes around a few times a day. Recommend..

name: Siskiyou National Forest, FR 25
description: Long winding road (paved most the way) with pullouts and forest service roads with dispersed camping. Several roads are 4x4 but many are not. Quite spot with plenty of wood for campfires. Great AT&T signal. several pool outs of different sizes, few also suitable for tents

name: Horse shoe bend campground
description: Great campground! Nice view over the lake. Toilets available, dump station at the exit, water at the exit/entrance as well. In this park there are some more campgrounds (we spend the night in Barry’s landing).

name: Harvard square
description: Parking on the brattle st, free parking at Sundays. I spent a very quiet night here. There’s a lot of restaurants around this area. You can use their bathroom

name: FSR 376 - Boondocking
description: Just past turtle rock ~0.5 mile. On FSR 376 just off FSR 375. Easy Boondocking with many sites. Easy with 28’ travel trailer. Nice view of BV. Verizon cell service.

name: Paradise bar and grill
description: best food we've had in weeks. open air bar and restaurant... decent prices, live music, nice bartenders, clean bathrooms.  had a blackened mahi basket,(12.95) smuggled in our own booze and stayed in the parking lot right on the water. even a tiny dog park here too but no dogs in the bar. "no dogs" seems to be the Mantra for Pensacola beach sadly.  enjoy! 😌

name: Cedar Creek Park
description:
Tent, camper, rv friendly. 
Kayaking, and kayak shop

name: Oxbow Recreation Area BLM Blithe, CA.
description: $15 a night campgrounds directly on colorado river. Loud motorboat noises but still nice.

name: Jones Creek Campground
description:
A number of unimproved sites that stretch along the creek. Access is by gravel and dirt Forestry Service Roads.

The Apple map does not show Jones Creek Rd where the campsite is located. Jones Creek Rd intersects with Winding Stair Gap (NF 28-1). The Google map shows the connection

name: Walmart superstore
description: Walmart what can you say typical store. Area a little rough but safe for overnight

name: Walasi-Yi
description:
This is a store and rest location on the Appalachian Trail near where it crosses US29 at Neels Gap. It is at the approach of Blood Mountain. It will be the closest store in a wilderness area that has many unimproved campsites. Cellphone services is typically available due to the elevation.

The store has camping and hiking equipment, outdoor clothing, books, maps, snacks, prepared frozen foods, and other supplies.

name: Big Lagoon/Humboldt County Park
description: Mostly primitive camping (two sites have power and water for an additional $10/day). Campsites are $25/day. Right on the ocean. Mostly tenting sites, only two longer sites that are suitable for RV, they are the ones with power and water. Showers are coin operated and we have been told they are quite hot.

name: West Virginia welcome center
description: Free and convenient Dump station in the parking lot with freshwater

name: Christmas
description:
Small sites by the river.
Very quiet. Nice.

name: Near White Sands
description: Border check. Passports. Asked for nationality

name: PARKING LOT NEXT TO THE HIGHWAY
description: Parking lot next to the Highway, but not accessible from the highway. Noises from the highway at night. Stayed one night, no problem. Check out the picture of the map how to get here . If you navigate with google maps, it will tell you to stop on the highway.

name: A Deming Roadrunner R V Park
description: Amazing place, kitchen with oven & microwave, hot tub & exercise room, very clean washrooms, TV, puzzles, books, fridge/freezer. Very friendly. Good WiFi. Quiet until the early hours when there's some traffic noise. Some pitches a bit close together. Two different WiFis depending on where you are. Cheap 24 hr laundry. $25 p n Inc electricity and water.

name: Chicago dump
description: Free dump station. Non portable water only. Daily 08:00 am - 04:00 pm. Sat, sun and holidays closed

name: Boat Ramp on Watauga Lake
description: Boat ramp with a large parking lot on the North East Arm of Watauga Lake with a beautiful view across the lake of large cottages.  It's at the end of a long paved, but very pot holed road.  The boat ramp was super quiet and dark, but has no amenities.  The parking lot is flat, no hunting for the perfect spot!  You can swim here, and there are no signs discouraging overnight parking or camping.  Not many people were here using the boat ramp while we were here, but it was rainy.... Great for a night or two.

name: Chuker Park Rec Area
description: Nice established campground away from the main road. $5 a night (Half Price with Golden National Park Pass).

name: Smith Mesa Rd (BLM)
description: Nice spot. Close to Zion. High clearance needed  for view spots (no 4x4 necessary). View over a valley.

name: BLM campground near Zion
description:
Eight walk-in campsites (for tent only). Parking for some up to 20ft rigs. Free.
Amazing views!

name: Punta Colonet to Erendira off road
description: beautiful spot on the ocean. some rock fire rings. well used place. pelicans, seagulls and seals on the rocks! we got here on motorbike track from Punta Colonet beach which wasn't the best. on the map there is a graded road from San Vicente. looks like locals use it too. watch for ATVs and dirt bikes.

name: Oyster Point
description:
Official National Forest Camp ground on Newport River and Nousiok hiking trail, lovely cheap place, $10 a night. 

Nicely set up sites with lots of shade and trees, not too far in the woods, so there is internet reception. Fee payment via envelope, a camphost will be there for assistance.

You can reserve with 3+ days notice: https://www.recreation.gov/camping/campgrounds/262810

name: Fred Gannon Rocky Bayou State Park
description: Great state park camping- awesome facilities; showers, laundry, recycling and trails right on the water. $16

name: Hickory Run service plaza, North and South
description: Service plaza with large parking area, overnight parking ok. Has a few restaurants and 24hr bathroom and gas station.

name: Truckstop
description: A big lot in town, unpaved, but safe and surprising quiet

name: Near beaver dam in mountains
description: Several camping spots here and in surrounding area.  Nice views. Short distance from paved road (guessing 2 miles ??)

name: The Black Canyon trail with Saguaros
description: You can park your car here and walk on a trail to see a lot of Saguaros!!!! Free. September to April or early in the morning! We've been there with the kids.

name: Chevron gas station
description: Chevron gas station right off W Ajo Highway at Three Points. They sell propane for 2.49 USD/pound. Prepay inside and then get your refund for the difference if your tank was not empty. Very friendly.

name: P & A Auto and Tire
description:
** AVOID AT ALL COSTS **
Stopped here to get propane as I saw their big propane tank outside. They quoted me "12-18 USD" to refill my tiny 5 lbs/1 gal tank, which normally costs under $3.

Got it refilled at the Chevron at Three Points on the Ajo Hwy (added that point also) for $2.89+tax.

name: Hart insurance center
description: Here you can get an insurance with a foreigner driving licence. 242 dollars for one year ( usa and canada) for a basic one for our 24 feet rv.

name: American legion state Forrest
description: Well established campground with riverside campsites, Farmington river is excellent for trout fishing. Quaint little town of riverton. Hiking across the river in people state Forrest.

name: Chico Flat
description:
Nice free established campsite just off the highway. Dumpster at the entrance and we got weak but usable 3G cell service. Lots of spots for vans and RVs, but this spot is especially awesome for tent campers. 

Tent spots: Once you park, walk down to the river (easiest access on the north side) and walk along the banks to see all the different sites. There are quite a few spots for tents on the soft sand right by the water, tucked in and quite private among the big smooth boulders and shady trees.

name: Beaver Dick Campground
description: $10 per night, $40 for 5 nights. A nice park on the river. Good Verizon signal.

name: Public parking in Bisbee
description: About 5 spots that are not too tilted. Free, just off the main drag of Bisbee. Guests of hotels are sometimes directed here for parking, so odd vehicles not unexpected. We "stealth camped" in what is clearly a camper here for one night. Plenty of public bathrooms nearby.

name: Mel's Car Care
description: We had some problems with our differential drive. They opened it up, refilled, gave us the Rest of the bottle and Charged us 40$ for everything. The fullsyntetic gearoil itself is allready almost 20$. The Most Important thing: we dont know a lot about cars, so I was having a look together with the mechanic. He didnt try to sell, he took half an hour to give us an honest opinion on several things and how He would handle the maintenance. He was not just looking for Profit! I can totally recommend this place.

name: Goose Pasture Campground
description:
site seems to be opened on and off. nice free place. Right now its closes for camping until Jan 20th 2020, but the presence of receipts dated Dec 30th 2019 suggests no one checks it out. Will attempt
 www.mysuwanneeriver.com

name: parking lot for nearby education building
description:
This parking lot is visible from the right hand side of SR-163 just before you exit. Medium sized lot with about 10 white shipping containers lined up at the back. 

This is parking for the education buildings across the street where they do afterschool programs, and other supplemental stuff for the school district I think. During the weeks this lot is empty by 6 and no one shows up until around 6:30-7 am. On weekends it's pretty much empty all the time. 

No shade (unless you pull into the one gap in the shipping containers), but it's a good spot for a quick night on your own. Strangely private in the middle of the city.

name: River City Casino near St Louis
description: River city casino. Stayed two nights. Quiet   All good. Nice casino. 6 miles from downtown

name: Cold showers and restrooms free
description: Free cold showers and restrooms entering to the beautiful Lone beach

name: Cape Blanco State Park
description: Clean campground, with varying sizes of sites. The washrooms are clean, and the showers are hot (and free of you are camping here). There is wood for sale from the camp hosts at $5 per small bundle (about 6 pieces or so). There is a paved road good for bicycling. You can also rent a cabin here too. See photo for prices. We really enjoyed the campground. The nearby hiking trails are great, you can go to the beach or to the lighthouse. The map shows other hikes however we did not have time to check it out. There is also no dump station here as of April 2018. If you stay here, you can dump for no charge at any Oregon state park.

name: Copper Mountain RV Park, Tacna, AZ
description: Approx 1/2 house east of Yuma. On desert, no trees. An incredibly well run park. Rec hall with laundry, hot showers, free purified drinking water, even a dog all area stocked with milk bone cookies. One of the best operated parks we have visited. Cable TV Frequent wifi dropouts make the wifi system almost unusable. If reliable wifi is a necessity, then this park will not be a contender. We used our Passport America..... paid approx $20.

name: Thr Beautiful Rock Campground, RV, and Music Park
description: Great RV campsite, and tent sites as well

name: Pipeline Campground
description: BLM max stay 15 days, only stayed one night slept like a rock. 5 campsites available, first come first serve

name: Uinta Flats (USFS)
description:
Beautiful open field, surrounded by trees, pronghorn grazing, birds flying around...
Easy access via well maintained gravel road.

name: Dump Station - Free - Exit 45
description: free dumpstation, towards back of travel area. Also free water fill up

name: Par-A-Dice Casino
description: Casino car park. Stayed for one night. Little noisy during the day but quiet at night. WiFi and toilets inside. 😀😀

name: Red Rock Canyon Area
description: Nice spot on the way to Bryce. Trails right around the corner.

name: Sno-Park Parking
description:
Small parking lot - permit required from Nov 1 to April 30 ! 

Good for a night or two, no facilities ! Keep it clean :) 

good cell service on T-mobile

name: Summer Lake Hot Springs Resort
description: Hot spring resort very rustic. Nice view when the air is clear. Can be very windy.  Indoor hot springs soaking pool located in original structure and more rustic outdoor pools.  RV parking with hookups.  Cabins/rooms for rent with rustic feel.

name: Lake Casa Blanca International State Park
description: This is a lovely, well maintained Texas state park.The entrance fee is $4 per person and  camping is $18. The sites are spacious with water, electricity, and covered picnic tables. There's lots to do: swimming, fishing, hiking, and biking. It looks like the only entrance is the right turn into the park coming from the south. Note: I believe this park is the one marked as "Lake Casa Blanca National Park" (which doesn't exist), but the name is incorrect and the GPS coordinates take you to a Boy Scout facility.

name: Just off FR 527
description: Nice grassy spot up off of 527, has fire pit. Plenty of room for rv if so inclined. This is dry camping so pack in - pack out.

name: Trittle mountain road
description: 16 National Forest dispersed camping sites along the road, all clearly marked.  6000+ feet in elevation so it is a lot cooler than other parts of the NF.  Lots of ponderosa pines and typical high desert mountain stuff.  Road in is well graded and very easy for any vehicle, maybe 25 minutes from downtown Prescott.

name: Forest road 525
description: Dispersed camping in the NF, full of big pines and lots of shade.  Maybe about 20 sites along the road, they get steeper and less level as you go North.  The highway is quiet at night, about 6500’ elevation so a lot cooler than the desert offerings.  Well used but fairly clean and no problems at night.

name: Bethel Trailhead
description: Great FREE place to camp at the trailhead for the MTB/Hiking trails. One fire ring and picnic table plus pit toilet. No water but wonderfully peaceful and super fun biking!

name: swaleys beach near green river
description: Nice BLM campground, free with a sand beach sourrounded by mountains. Wild and calm. Stay a night perfect spot

name: Kla-Mo-Ya Casino and Travel Center
description: Large, quiet casino parking lot with lots of other vans and RVs parking there. They even have a sign saying "RVs welcome". But you have to check in with the security in the casino. We didn't use the facilities in the casino but there's a truck stop right next to the lot with large restrooms and free WiFi. Good for a night or two when visiting Crater Lake.

name: Cordell Hull Lake Horse Camp
description: Civil Engineer property... free and open to camping... Nice big open area with many options... quite pretty down by the water though might need a smaller rig to maneuver close...

name: High Plains CG
description: large RV Park just off I70. pool, hot tub, Captain Jim's bar and restaurant on site.

name: Hogback Rd west of Lone Pine, Ca
description:
Hogback Rd, ~ 2 miles off Whitney Portal Rd, ~1mile after sign reading "Leaving National Forest"

presumed to be BLM

name: Manti-La Sal National Forest
description: All the way up the hill there are small side roads and pull ins. All of them were full with campers as i rode up on a Saturday. Managed to find this one amongst the trees and bushes. Flat soft ground, great for tents. Just a few rock fire pits around.

name: Dulles Expo Center / Walmart
description: This a massive parking lot shared by the Dulles Expo Center and Walmart. I've stayed here for multiple nights with no issues. Trucks also use this to overnight. Weekends can get busy here when the Expo Center has shows in progress (which brings additional overnight crowds).

name: Near Needles Overlook just before No Camping Area
description:
Most or all of the camping immediately before Needles Overlook has been closed as of May 2018. 

This camping site's turnoff is just before the no camping sign.  There is a moderately sized flat area on the right side of the paved road opposite the two track to the South.  Take the two track path to this site.

There is one fire ring and a few flat spots just before the trail breaks over a ridge and becomes 4wd.  I suspect there are better sites along the rim farther down trail, but my significant other was ready to stop.

name: End of Severn Way
description: This is a nice, quiet spot at the end of Severn Way near the entrance to Alban Equipment Sales Center. It's located in an industrial area so nobody cares that you're here. Also nearby are the Walmart parking lot (posted no overnight) and the Lowes parking lot (which I used for 3 nights). But this spot by far is darkest and quietest so it's my choice in the area.

name: Walmart Milwaukee
description:
Walmart parking lot.
Ask to the customer service to check in.
To be sure to don’t have trouble, park on the left side of the parking lot (when you are facing the Walmart) with the trucks. 
The Walmart is open 24/24 so you can have access to the restroom.

name: hidden cave BLM site
description: Parking lot for hidden cave is about 1 mile from highway 50 (turn right if coming from the east). no noise. cell reception from nearby Fallon. The 1 mile graded dirt road starts near the petroglyph site which is on highway 50 (about 6 miles east before Fallon) . it is ok even after rain. some parts leveled. many more locations near by. We were here with 1 more truck.

name: Lake Meredith - $25 bucks with elec
description: Pretty awesome free campground overlooking lake Meredith... water, showers, toilets, shelters, tables, grills, dump station... all you could need and at a great price... there are a few paid sites if you want/need electricity but the vast majority are free dispersed.

name: Retro Rovers Land Rover Mechanic
description:
Really good English mechanic. Very good knowledge, works really fast. 

Address:
4560 Arville St. Unit C18, Las Vegas

Telephone / whatsapp: +1 (702) 816-8412

name: Rest area
description: Potable water and toilets here large parking for RVs

name: Mexican Hat
description: Quiet place to camp.  Near Mexican Hat rock. BLM. No amenities.  Good ATT reception. 3G Tmobile

name: River bed is your bed
description:
Hidden behind trees and bushes in the river bed. Sand bottom. Be careful when driving not to get stuck, 4x4 highly recommended.
just after the bridge when going towards Coalinga. turn left and follow the riverbed to go behind trees. You can even go under the bridge but it can be noisy, lot of traffic.
Not many spots but it’s beautiful. Good phone service. No water, no toilets ( you can always dig a pit)
Please leave the spot clean.

name: Mack’s Creek Campground
description: Awesome drive up tent site 25 miles outside of central Boise located on Lucky Peak Lake. Clean pit toilets, fire pits, access to the lake right at your doorstep. Some campsites can be booked online at https://www.recreation.gov/camping/macks-creek-park/r/campgroundDetails.do?contractCode=NRSO&parkId=72330 but it was free when we stayed- possibly because it was before Memorial Day?

name: Camp creek
description:
Maintained by an hydro company this free site is near an artificial lake.  It’s clean , has pit toilet, water and garbage bin.
The road is rough but accessible by any vehicle.  A nice and quiet place but without any cellular connection.

name: Derrick Road Campground
description:
A sandy campground with only 3 sites for 2wd camper. Not for big rig.  Lot of room for 4WD véhicule.
Free with the usual passes, $5 for véhicule without passes.  Lot of dunes around.

name: Toutle River Rest Area
description: A nice rest area for an overnight stop (stay normally limited to 8 hours ). No RV dumps. Still some road noise but for the price you cannot ask much more on this busy hightways.

name: Gatlin Point Campground
description: A primitive campground in the forest and by a lake in the huge area Land Between the Lakes in Tennessee as well as Kentucky. There are many campgrounds in the area. Most of them require a permit (fee) which is available at the Visitor Centers at the far North and the far South. This one doesn't. $ 9 for one night and reduction for additional nights. The campground has water, vault toilets and picnic tables. Dump station with potable water at the visitor centers. We enjoyed it except the mosquitoes. The campground is a short distance from the Civil War battlefields in Dover.

name: White Springs state park campground
description: Beautiful quiet clean. 22$ per night with full hook up. Big sites with fire ring and wooden bench. Good space between campers. Toilets shower clean. Plenty of space around to jog, walk or cycle.

name: Lake Hemet Forest Service Picnic Area
description: Free potable water with threaded spigot for connecting your own hose. Located behind wooden post on the west side of the parking lot.

name: Orosco Ridge Pull-Offs
description: Several pull-offs along the road near the entrance of Oroscoe Ridge. Pretty quiet, nice scenery. Watch out for Rattlesnakes - our dog found one crossing the road and almost got bit! No services, no cell coverage.

name: Laufman Campground $10
description: Everything everyone else said is true, unfortunately it’s not free. $10 per vehicle and 7 for each additional. Also it’s a good road up when dry, but the spots are pretty small. I’d say mostly tent spots with a couple that are large RV friendly. Mostly shaded, but low branches at about 10’ clearance. One way road. Enter at the far one from approach. About 8 sites each with a fire pit/grill and a picnic table. Pit toilet, no water, overall very clean and green. 2 bars of Verizon 4G. 1 bar AT&T

name: Castroville Regional Park
description: This 126 acre park is along side a river and has a swimming pool ($5/day) and various fields and courts, as well as an RV park. To get to the RV park drive into the park past the picnic table pay station and follw the road around to the left. It takes you right to the RV park which has full hookups and picnic tables in easy to pull into (and through) flat gravel spaces. Cost is for RVs is $31.50/night whether you use the hookups or not. There is tent camping in a grassy area, but I didn't see the cost. They also have a BBQ grill, laundry room, bathroom, and showers.

name: Casino Oneida
description: We seem to be in the casino trail. Very RV friendly here. Cheap meals. Great service and WiFi. $15 for hookups or boondocks for free

name: BLM Ripstein campsite
description: Trinity wilderness campsite 8 or so miles off HW 299 down a good but narrow paved road.  Pit toilet , fire pits and basic tables in a wooded campsite in the forrest by a river.  The sites are numbered but we saw no means of payment.

name: Sahara Creek DNR Horse Camp
description:
Grassy site in woods with level camping sites , fire pits , tables and pit toilets. Just off main road before Ashford on road to mt Rainier NP.  Usage is for horses but we saw other people with camping only. 

7 day limit with Discovery Pass

name: parking lot near lake
description: no sign prohibiting overnight parking. several RV here . seems long termers

name: Forest road 535
description: There are a lot of spots right off the road on the right hand side. There are a couple larger / flatter ones right here which are somewhat hidden and ones down the road which are much more uneven terrain

name: Lucky Lane street parking
description: Flagstaff is extremely unfriendly to RVs and travelers. I managed to stay here for awhile last summer. If you park across the street from the Cracker Barrel and Super 8 Motel, you can get free wifi from the motel. This is street parking along a fence with the 40 Westbound Freeway about 15 feet away. A lot of people park here. Potable water: there is a small spigot near the trash area behind Cracker Barrel. The water is delicious! Up the street at the Conoco station is a dump station.

name: BLM north of Canyonlands National Park
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No Camping Allowed Past this point sign

Bunch grass, sage and Pinon Pine, a few cows with new spring calves. Feels almost like home (Wyoming), which is a good thing. Just off one of the access roads to the White Rim Trail.

name: Cold Springs RV
description: Cold Springs RV is a full service RV dealership with a parts store, propane and  mechanical services.

name: Mount powerplant
description: $20 camping. Was an old campsite. Picknick tables, fire place, toilet. Clean and quiet.

name: Valley Garden Campground
description: moderate sized camp ground, 18$ a night if you don't have a Montana Fishing License. right on the river

name: Mills Canyon - FREE
description: There are two formal campgrounds. One on the canyon rim and one 3 more miles down the road on the canyon floor. We drove past the campground and stayed at a beautiful spot at the end of the road. Higher clearance vehicles recommended though not essential if you know what you are doing. The campgrounds have sites with tables, grills and pit toilets.

name: Big tree recreation area
description:
Just a little parking lot, very quiet place, shaded in a beautiful rainforest. Good for one night. Road is very windy and damaged, not recommended for low clearance vehicles and big RV.
You will find a table 1minute walking down the trail. Be ready to fight some mosquitoes.
Tents can be setup on the parking ring.
No prohibited camping signs around. And I don’t think anyone will come to bother you here.

name: Upper Itch Kep Pe City Park
description: Great free CG next to Yellowstone River. Tall trees, grassy, picnic tables, fire rings.  Very busy in summer, but over 50 spots, so probably not full most days.

name: NRocks Outdoor Adventures
description:
NRocks Outdoor Adventures hosts a Via Ferrata, Canopy Tour (zip lines), Top Rope Climbing, and numerous hiking trails with summit views.  Caving also available.  Lodging options include a primitive camping area, guest rooms, cabins, and a guest house.  The NRocks Welcome Center has free WiFi.  

The primitive camping area can accommodate small to medium sized vehicles and adventure trailers.  Firewood is available.  Camping is $7.95 per person/per night.

name: Boot Hill Casino and Resort
description: dry camping behind the casino. go left around the main building to the rear. walking distance to the casino, restaurant and bars. join the players club (free) and get discounts on food.

name: Ziggy's Roadside BBQ
description: This is a simple place where you order at the counter then seat yourself, but they serve up the best BBQ we've ever had. I was worried when the meal came served on a foam plate with plastic utensils, but the the ribs, the brisket, and turkey were all so tender they fell apart with the lightest touch of the fork. The BBQ sauce had the perfect balance of tartness and.  sweetness, and we ended up with a plate full of perfection. This place is a "must stop if you like BBQ!

name: Van Duzer State Park Rest Area
description: Great spot! Lots of spaces mainly for campervans and truck campers. Flush toilets. Poor cell signal. Right by Highway 18 so some traffic noise during the night.

name: Clark fishing lake.
description: This is a mix of a park and boon docking. It is a fishing lake/reservoir. There is not much in SW Kansas. The photos are very nice it is deserted now in May. There is a boat ramp. We drove past that to the south. There is a place to the north as well. It is open area. No fires.  We took a chance and were pleased with the location.  The road is rutted out and lots of areas to camp. We are a bit higher overlooking the lake. If you have to pay we did not see any place to do so.

name: F5, camp site.....
description: Remote fire road with multiple camp sites along the way

name: Bruneau Dunes State Park
description:
The tallest single-structured sand dune in North America rises to 470 feet high above small lakes in the high desert south of Mountain Home.

The state park includes desert, dune, prairie, lake and marsh habitat with opportunities to observe nocturnal species.

Activities include fishing, birdwatching, camping, hiking, swimming and viewing the stars at one of only two public observatories in Idaho. 

Feel free to climb but no vehicles are allowed on the dunes. A visitor center offers information on birds of prey, insects, fossils, wildlife and sand dunes and gift items for purchase. 

Two cabins are available for rent. Also 82 serviced with W/E and 35 standard sites.

name: Crawfishtown USA
description: This place is a gem! Roadside crawfish with awesome service and RV park in the rear!

name: rest area on US 400
description: rest area with room for big rigs and trucks and a free RV dump station.

name: Kehl Springs Campground
description: Primitive free campground w pit toilet no hookups no water no garbage 8 sites 22 ft max in the Ponderosa Pine.. very quiet.

name: Keyser Pond Campground
description: Seasonal campground with full hookups, weekend sites and tent sites.

name: Keyser Pond Campground
description: Propane filling station available here...

name: Brushy Creek Recreation Area
description: Great campground. We stayed at the equestrian sites. $14 for non-electric. Clean showers and bathrooms. Quiet.

name: Clemmons Creek
description: You can park your camper and sleep in nice and silent surroundings. There are no amenities, but it is free.

name: Wasatch Mountain SP
description: Nice campground in a state park. Quiet. Restrooms with showers. 20$ per night for a site with water and electricity. More expensive with sewer. Dump station at the entrance of the campground.

name: Rosie Jones Park, Lake Murvaul
description: Quiet, free camping on the shore of the lake. There are a couple of cement picnic tables and some nice trees, otherwise there are no services here. Great for a couple of days boondocking. It is a weekday and there are no people here. I suspect that might change on the weekend. Plenty of room for large rigs.

name: Circle K near New Orleans (3188)
description: A good place to stay one night. 50 km before New Orleans if you are going to Florida. Quiet. Gas Station Valero with a shop.

name: Gas station Loves Cottondale Florida
description: Good place to stop for the night. Wifi in shops and macDonald. Good inside. Sometimes deconnected outside. Just a little busy

name: Walmart Cocoa
description: Free. Quiet at night. 30 km from Kennedy Space Center.

name: Kennedy Space Center Cape Canaveral
description: Entrance of the Kennedy Space Center Visitors. 57 $ pp + 10 $ for the parking. Many movies in 3 D

name: Parking near pompano Beach
description: We confirm. Parking. Free and quiet. It’s a good place to stay one night even more. Restaurants, laundry, supermarket and beach nearby... We find water behind the restaurant Flanigan’s !

name: Supermarket Publix Parking
description: Parking of Supermarket Publix at 30 km south Miami. Quiet and free. There is also Walmart near but the parking is not for camping-cars.

name: Jiffy Lube
description: We change oil here. Possibly to do also : brakes, tires, batteries, jnspections, wipers.

name: AAMCO Transmissions Plano near Dallas
description: Good mechanico. We change here clutch and brakes. We have parts with us but they can find many parts.

name: Parking Fort Worth near Cowtown Coliseum
description: A good place to stay over night . 5 dollars per night. It’s near cowtown Coliseum (rodeo) - Billy Bob’s Texas (bull rider)....

name: MCM Truck Repair Belgrade Minolta
description: Very good mechanics, kind persons and helpful. Every morning our camper did not start anymore because the glow plugs burned. They made a diagnosis and they found the problem. It was necessary to change the relay. As they had no the part they gave us the address of a garage Fiat to make the repairs. We paid nothing and it was possible to stay free overnight on their parking lote.

name: Caesar‘s Palace Las Vegas
description:
The very famous Caesar‘s Palace. 

The reason why I put it on here is that they have really good valet parking. Safe and no hight restriction. Self parking is 14ft. 

Other than that: enjoy, gamble hard, drink and visit Omnia nightclub. 

By the way: Caesar didn’t live there. I asked.

name: Craighead Forest Park
description:
Beautiful little campground by a lake in a well established park. Grassy campsites for tents $10. Serviced sites for rvs on cement pads in forest setting
 $25.00 . No pull throughs, no wifi. Nice clean bathrooms.

name: near to the battery hiking
description: a parking with an amazing vieuw. just at the end of the road. no traffic. there is a camping site for bicycle and walking guy with tables and toilet just 5 min to walk

name: Bogachiel State Park
description:
40 campsites ranging from $25-35 USD (also $12 for hiker/biker sites).

RV dump available at the entrance. No water at sites but can fill up jugs with taps. Some sites have power. 

We didn’t stay the night but did take advantage of their showers. $1 = 6 minutes.

name: Bogachiel State Park
description: Water dump station at the entrance, before campground. Potable water also available!

name: Suburban Commando
description: Suburban neighborhood away from train tracks    Quiet neighborhood at a bit of elevation - feels safe.-nothing special.  good for a night after passing to the North of LA

name: Pony Express RV Park
description: Office people were very nice and helpful. Mini country store. We camped for $20 but they normally charge $25. Electric hookup and water. Quiet and shaded with a picnic table and fire ring.

name: Page Wahweep R V Park
description: V expensive, unfriendly staff. $30 without electricity or water. $2 a shower (only one block) & you have to walk miles to get to them. Have to pay to get into the park too unless you have an America the Beautiful pass

name: Truck parking
description: A truck parking, without anything. Only a park lot.

name: Hwy 8 parking and rest
description:
A very large gravel parking lot in front of a small white church.
Portapotty, picnick table and enough grass for many informal tents. There is a creek in the forest valley about 20ft away. Water tastes like rain, used my life straw and it was fine to drink.

name: Newark road meadow
description:
Reststop right off the road. Lots of parking space and a flowery grass spot to tent on. Great night if one does not mind the sound of passing cars and a bunch of lovely singing birds.
No one bugged us. We even picknicked at roads view with our propane stove. Our tent was further in the meadow between thickets.

name: Hunters Parking by Paint Creek
description: Off a rural road. Parking enough for a party, tin garbage can and many tent spots. The red signs are for hunting purposes within the gorgeous park ( a must if it isn’t flood season)! Some barking roosters in the morning, other than that no one bothers the free roamer.

name: Cherokee camping alleyway
description:
Between campgrounds 11 & 12, enough parking for two cars and a way that leads down to the river. Delicious water to drink and swim in. A fire ring, but hard to find a place to set up the tent.
We set up in the parking and due to a lot of rain plus an old decrepit tent, we were flooded by a little puddle.

Camp ground number 9 was much more spacefull and had great tent spots with lovely access to the river (described in another Ioverlander spot near by).There were many campers this weekend which is why we got what we got

So many options though, in this erea (road)

name: Between San Juan river and Mexican Hat
description: A lot near the road along San Juan river, really quiet, there are several places to park, doesn't work if rains

name: Hog Wash
description: Small top loaders to 5 load washers. Small town and very clean.

name: Desoto state park
description: Upgraded campground is super notch. Very clean toilets. Full hook ups and big sites. Including first night charge little pricey at 46usd but I suppose it will come down if booked longer we only stayed one night. If after 5 pm need to get code for front gate via the phone number at front office. They take calls 24 hrs. Free Filter water next to toilets.

name: Prescott Gas
description: Refill propane tanks. And sales tanks. Stopped in and nice elderly couple runs the place, very friendly and  welcoming

name: Valley of the God's - off the road a little
description: This is a big spot a couple hundred yards off the road.  We were able to get our griup of 7 vehicles in there.  Not as good views as in some areas but quiet and no road noise or dust.

name: Rock Rapids Park
description:
$5 non electric, $15 with electric.

Dump station, potable water and showers.

Park for kids to play and frisbee golf.

Self pay only.

name: Cabelas RV Parking
description: Just a official RV Parking behind the Cabelas with dump and water station. It is a bit noisy because of the Highway, but fine for one night.

name: Los Padres - West Grade
description: Single level pad truck camping off main busy forest road before down hill part

name: Alabama hills with creek
description:
Wild camp spot.  Too beautiful for words. Away from movie loop. Side road off Hogback Rd. #15s01. 
Once on #15s01 take second right off-shoot road (not on map) it leads right to the creek and campsite. It’s right before the wood gate/fence. 
A little air force base noise till after dark then all quiet.  Creek a great place if you have a dog. Fire-ring in place.

name: Camping near Natural Bridges NM
description: Nicest spot along a well maintained dirt road.

name: Wild camping Oatman. Route 66
description: Very calm and not so far from the main road. Free. No amenities.

name: NF611P
description: Awesome spot on the east side of the Grand Canyon. There are many large spots to choose from. Decent Verizon service.

name: Walmart
description: Just another Walmart parking lot. There's also a Walmart on the north side of Frederick which is much larger and nicer than this one.....and quieter.

name: Walmart
description: Yet another Walmart. It's a nice spot combined with a Lowes parking lot and it's fairly close to the Flight 93 National Memorial.

name: Shell with "free" dump station
description:
Shell is 400m from coordinates. 

Dump station for clients of the Shell but we got for free without buying anything. It seems frequent. Information was provided from Humboldt park Info Center as free dump station. 

Staff really friendly!

name: National forest
description: Very quiet place in the national forest, one place flat around 1 mile from the 160. Ok for our 24 ft, may be not to much more...

name: Direction to Rutherford beach
description: When the charted road ends at a T-intersection, take the bridge to your right. In about 5 minutes you’ll see a sign to Rutherford Beach, turn left on that road. Swerve down this final road to this awesome and free spot to chill.

name: Williams Hill blm
description:
Free blm campground with only 7 sites.
Each campsite is equipped with covered picnic table and fire ring
A 7,5 miles gravel road to reach the site but ok with 2w drive.
Pit toilet available

name: Inyo National Forest
description: Free source of water in a big turnout.        Refreshing!

name: Chevron/ Casa de Fruta
description: We slept at this truck parking lot next to Chevron gas station and Casa de Fruta restaurant, playground for kids, shop... quiet at night, free. We asked permission at the shop to sleep here. Open 24hs

name: Hanksville Dukes Slickrock RV park
description: Very friendly welcome. Site office open until 10 pm.  breakfast at Dukes Grill on site. Excellent food there. Per night $16 exc water and electricity. Laundry $1.25 wash $1.25 dry.

name: Rocky park road
description: Small spot to rest right off the 17th Highway. Couple of camping site.

name: Trailer Lane RV Park
description: Great place on someone's property very close to mt Shasta and you can see it from the property. The owner has paved his own short hiking trail up the hill to the rear of his property with a picnic area at the top that overlooks a valley and Mount Shasta. It is 35 per night and it also comes with cable TV.

name: Travelodge
description: Great staff. Nice location in Yuba City Ca

name: Pull off with a view
description: Heading East on the right hand side there’s a dirt lot overlooking the hills. Arrived at 2am, then woke up and continued our drive in the morning. It’s great for a quick nights rest. I’m not sure if you’d want to stay much longer but no one bothered us. Don’t expect to have any cell phone service here though...

name: Slot Canyons
description:
This is the trailhead to the a slot canyons, peek-a-boo and spooky. One of the best things we saw on our trip. Beautiful colors in very narrow canyons that you can climb and squeeze through. The road is washboard, no 4wd needed. Only the last 2 km need high clearance but you can park before that. 
The hike through these two canyons (there are two more) is only 5 km, still quite exhausting because of the climbing and the heat. Enjoy!!

name: Enchanted Rock
description: Beautiful place! They have awesome hike in camping or tent camping right near the trail head, but could easily car or van camp. $14 to camp and $7? per person entrance fee - worth it if you want to spend the day to hike around, camp, SHOWER!! and even fill up your water.

name: Neighborhood Parking
description: Super quiet and low profile place to park for the night next to the river around the corner from Viva Tacoland and El Gloria - there were even portapotties that were super clean!

name: Nice Spot Mojave National Park
description: Off the main road 5 mins to a secluded spot sheltered by some big rocks. There is a fire ring but nothing else. half paved road down that a car can get through. fairly narrow so may be harder for something huge. great view of sunset. little noise from the road but mostly quiet.

name: Price, Walmart
description: Customer service very helpful and said of course we could stay the night in the car park. 24 hr Walmart. Some (delightful) train horn noises & a little traffic noise + other vans' generators in the night but fine.

name: Boardman Marina Park
description: Beautifully maintained grounds right on the Columbia River in Boardman Oregon they are pet-friendly kid-friendly there is a state-of-the-art jungle gym right in the middle of the park full hookups laundry showers bathrooms and very large spaces only 35 a night

name: Myron B Hodge City Park
description:
Basic camping lots with full hook ups. 20$ per night bathrooms disinfected daily. Some lots have lake/ river view and sunset. Ranger comes and collect money couldn’t see the office. 

Great cell service reception. Also has access to swim or drop in a paddle board or kayak.

name: State Park Ochlockonee River
description:
Nice Camp. Full hook up. Clean toilets showers.can swim in the river. Some shade but typical of this state trees are small.
20per night

name: Paul B. Johnson state park
description: Very beautifully set right on a lake. A lot of campsites have great views. Full hook up, decent toilets. Varying cost around 30usd.

name: Tannehill historical state park
description: Good camp. Few spots by the creek (if lucky you may see glow worms at dusk). Water and electricity usd 25 up to family of four. Sewage extra. Clean toilets. On the weekend we stayed there was a local flee market here. There is a series of activities almost every weekend here. Interesting camp.

name: Ole Tennessee Moonshine
description:
The real stuff if you have watched it over tv. $5 per tasting (13 flavours) which you get off your purchase in store of anything from alcohol to t-shirts. Also pick up a 10% discount from tourist brochure stand.
They do live country music shows.

name: tabasco factory tours
description:
really interesting self guided factory tour of famous peper sauce
5.50 dollars per person above 4 yo

name: Timp Point
description: 3 or 4 free camping spots. 100 feet or so from the edge of the Grand canyon

name: Troy Meadows
description: nice campground with water and pit toilet. there is a fee for camping

name: Hog Canyon
description: A nice area to camp. Fire pit and some gorgeous red cliffs. High clearance needed to get into the camp spot, but the road isn’t bad otherwise.

name: Forest Road
description: This road hasn’t been used for camping in quite some time. The camping spots are over grown and hard to get to from the dirt road. Also there’s been a ton of trash dumping in the main camping spots that are still clear. A lot of trash and animal carcasses.

name: Forest Road 16
description: An absolutely perfect camp spot surrounded by trees and next to a stream. Level, and room for a few cars and multiple tents.  Little rope swing at the site. Fire pit and ample wood.  Any car can access this place.

name: Carson National Forest
description: A free camp grounds (lower hondo) and other spots along the road for boondocking.  On the road to Taos Ski Resort.  Right on the river. Spots for all size rigs.  Paved access.

name: Cow Hollow
description: County Park with about 20 spaces. 20 acre park with bathrooms and showers. Ballpark, swings, firepits, and picnic tables. Some sites have full hookups, some just power and water. $10/night pay at the store nearby.

name: Loft Mountain Campground
description: Big beautiful campground in Shenandoah National Park with lots of spots. No showers in the campground but you can drive 1/2 a mile to the camp store where they have coin-showers (quarters). Dump station. $30 per night.

name: Stephen F. Austin State Park
description: Busy campground on weekends.  Lots of shade.  Full RV hook ups, Water only sites & hike in sites.  Lots of gnats the last time I was there.

name: Cracker Barrel
description:
Cracker Barrel parking, not too noisy and nobody will bother you and other vehicles were sleeping here too. 
You can use the restroom while the restaurant is open.

name: Piedra East - Free
description:
For free forest camping, take the forest road turn off on the East side of the river and head north (the forest road on the West side of the river will take you to the Lower Piedra campground and requires a fee).

There are at least three camp sites with fire rings along the Piedra River before the road continues North. This is a great spot for a night or two with access to the river. The only downside was the closeness to the road and the dust from passing vehicles. Folks were flying by for Memorial Day Weekend festivities when we were here. 

After this point, the road increases in elevation for quite awhile with no or limited access to the river below until you reach Sheep Creek trailhead where you can hike down to the river, across, and up to some hot springs. We did not hike this trail or continue past Sheep Creek to determine river accessibility.

name: USNEM 530
description:
The turn-out is down USNEM 500, just before Willis Canyon Trailhead.  Camping is free, but you need a permit (from the Cannonville Visitor’s Center or any trailhead in the Grand Staircase Monument).

All the campsites are quiet and nice, but the third campsite has wonderful views of Bryce.

name: Deadman Lake Campground
description: Free, quiet, amazing. Firewood, canoes, life vest, shelter and a volunteer host. Great place.

name: Walmart
description: Huge parking lot (very clean) which is posted no overnight parking. I checked inside with the employees and they said it shouldn't be a problem and plenty of people stay here. There are several RV's and Semis staying here tonight.

name: Bodie Road overlook
description: Nice site for suv or van. Narrow road but worth the view.  Take left onto road #32046H off of Masonic road #32046. Fire ring. Cool old mines near by. Quiet. Easy access. Go to Bodie ghost town if you have time. It’s better than expected.

name: Walmart Wilkes-Barre
description:
Walmart parking. Quiet and there is many RV. No problem. 

There’s a Starbucks, Red Robin, Cracker Barrel  in the same lot.

name: Rock Pile
description: Camped by the two rock piles out in the valley... quick and easy... beautiful valley stretching out all around... was windy when we got here but died down at night...

name: By Lava Beds
description: Not too much to look at but nice level spot with a fire pit.  Perfect place to pull over for the night or hang for the weekend with some friends.  Full Verizon LTE service.

name: Leader Lake Campground
description:
Organized campground that is free with a Discover Pass ($10 day, $30/ year give or take).
