description: Off of West Rim Rd/CB-115. Turn east (towards canyon) under the power lines. A few dirt roads shoot off from there, several spots along the rim with fire rings. Great view of the Rio Grande canyon and the Sangre de Cristo mountains to the east.

name: Page
description: boondock area near Lone Rock.  do not go past corrals

name: Dome Rock outback
description: This location is right in Dome Rock but further out! This campsite is flat, great place for a camp fire and quiet. We could hear a slight bit of freeway noise at night but not too bad. The terrain is rocks and pebbles but flatter to the ground so not bad on the feet or paws. Beautiful out here!

name: cracker barrel
description: Another Cranker Barrel that has plenty of parking but as part of a larger shopping center. the place is just down from the Walmart listed just down from this location. Several campervans were parked overnight here and a bunch of trailers, RV's and campers at the Walmart. I had a nice breakfast here in the morning. Good and friendly service.

name: Red Hills Lake Texas
description: Older NF campground. Pretty lake with swimming area. Whole place could use some tlc .9 small electric sites for $10. $5 w/our America the Beautiful Pass! Not big rig friendly We only found 1 site that would fit our 26’tt and truck w/out unhooking

name: Helping Hands Retreat
description:
*added by owner. Contact: tfrentz@hotmail.com in advance please.*

Primitive services available. Hot shower with a donation based fee. Short term camping with hostel services including shared kitchen, prepared meals, open gym, yoga, massage sessions & community activities.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel in Port Charlotte, FL. Great spot to stay for the night.

name: Castle Lake pull off
description:
It's one of the most beautiful location where we ever been. 

No cars, no people just wildlife and us.

You have two ways to go in. One on the enter of the curve and another one after the curve. 

Inside nobody can see you 🤘🏼

good internet service (cellphone)

name: Parking lot by highway
description: Parking lot between Home Depot and highway. Lots of big rigs and a few other vans. Nothing special but fine for a night or two

name: Glacier water machines
description: Three glacier water machines in between Starbucks and Family Dollar. 40c per gallon.

name: National Forest Parking Lot
description: We couldn't find anywhere to park our van near Black Mountain ski area. The towns have no parking ordinances in winter and cops are everywhereeeee enforcing it. We were headed 30 minutes north to the Walmart that does allow overnight parking when we found this lot. It is right after the sign that you entered the national forest. pass the turn on the left and keep going straight like a tenth of a mile into a huge plowed parking lot. It is a trailhead and I believe technically you can park here but must camp 1/4 mile from a road or lot. We came in around 8pm and left at 10am. Saw 3 cars of hikers arrive in the am but no one to kick us out and no signs saying no overnight parking. Just fine in 2wd e350 van, absolutely no cell coverage, super close to multiple ski areas.

name: City Hall
description: Free water available at city hall!  Blue pump handle right at the street.  Very easy to pull up.  Bonus: public splash pad kids can play at next door!

name: KOA Klamath Falls
description: Emergency stop here due to snow in the passes, and pleasantly surprised. Quiet, flat spaces, nice showers, helpful staff. Propane is $1.59 per gallon.

name: Chevron gas station
description: Guy was super nice and friendly found it to be cheaper then others in the area. I’m sure he would let you fill water as well

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Typical Cracker Barrel, if you are a heavy sleeper. It is next to a small airport. I slept like a baby, but you may want to choose another location if airplane white noise is not your thing.

name: Water at ranger station
description: Water spigot right in front of the ranger station. Ranger said filling tanks is allowed.

name: Bodega bay view
description: Easy access to a large gravel parking lot next to marina. Can pull up right next to water. Fishing charter boats near. Incredible for sunrise. No overnighting but worth the quick stop to see the bay at least. Great birding spot. Public bathrooms available. Large RV, van, any vehicle friendly.

name: Bodega Bluffs
description: Must see natural attraction. The bluffs are painted multicolor by the native succulent. Many hiking trails. Beach access. Public bathrooms. Paved road, gravel parking lot. No large RVs. Frequent endangered marbled murrelet sightings. NO DOGS.

name: Ice Shanty
description: An ice shack, 20ib of ice for $2 and 1 gallon for 25¢, 3 gallons for 75¢, and 5 gallons for $1.

name: Wal-Mart
description: Walmart parking lot. called and asked they said it was okay to park overnight. Security drove by a few time and didn't bother me.

name: U-Shaped pullover on 112
description: A large U-Shaped pullover, place to pull over and sleep, there is evidence of campfires. no signs anywhere, on USFS land.  Right on the road but not a busy street at night.

name: Madawaska Boat Landing and campground
description: A small public boat ramp with 8 rv sites with electric on each site and water by the restrooms. open seasonally June through October. Contact Madawaska police for booking. price unknown.

name: Camel Brook Camps LLC
description: Four cabins five minutes from Fort Kent, Maine. really nice owners, clean, rates in the picture.

name: Eteral Flame Falls
description: "Eternal Flame Falls is a 30 ft high cascade in two segments. The top is a narrow cascade of nearly 8 ft high. The second tier spreads out more than twice the width as it cascades over shale. A small grotto to the right houses a natural gas spring that can be ignited to create a flame of 4-8 inches in height. Two small cascades (that really aren’t worth the effort to get to) can be found upstream from Eternal Flame". A pretty easy 0.58 mile trail with some steep steps and some steam rock walking that is very slick, so wear good water shoes, and  bring a lighter. quote from https://nyfalls.com/waterfalls/eternal-flame-falls/

name: Love's Truck Stop
description: Love's truck stop, clean showers, clean restrooms, a Subway, and grab and go snacks.

name: Twice the Ice
description: A Twice the Ice shack, Ice $2.50 for 20ib loose. bring a cooler or 16ib bag. Water 25¢ a gallon, 75¢ for 3 gallons and $1.25 for 5 gallons

name: Roadside Table Rest Stop
description: A roadside table rest area no signs other then the no dumping sign, no restrooms,

name: Watermill Express
description: A Watermill Express, no ice, water 25¢ a gallon.

name: Big Creek Overlook
description: Phenomenal site off Forest Service Road 316. Not far from Big Creek campground and underneath Demers Ridge. A little precarious parking along the ledge but what a majestic view of the valley and Big Creek when you wake up in the morning. There are a few sites up and down the road (one closer to the main road on the opposite side if you prefer safer parking) and the advantage is that you’re not far from the main road and Glacier Park entry.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest Area 24 hour parking and rest rooms. Ok for a night. 2 bars Verizon.

name: Sertoma Youth Ranch
description: 200 + sites 30 amp & water $30 primitive $25. Showers & restrooms. No reservations, pay at drop box if on site host isn't in. Awesome place. Bluegrass festivals a few times a year. Convenient store close by with propane exchange.

name: By The Tracks
description: Pull off directly across from a hotel. Camus creek road. It is by the railroad tracks and river. Turn right down the dirt road. Go to the end of the road about 1/4 mile. You will be behind a hill, next to the highway. There have been other vehicles here. Some road noise, one bar AT&T.

name: Walmart Supercenter
description: Good Walmart for overnight parking. I have stayed here many nights with no trouble. Frequently will see multiple big rigs in this lot for the night as well as a camper van or RV. No signs.

name: Roadside parking
description: Big gravel pullout along N Palm Ave. Quiet road. Big rigs parked here already, plenty of room for all size rigs. Obviously nothing special but a good spot for a night off the beaten path

name: mall parking lot
description: great place to park and shop but don't try and stay overnite, I witnessed a flatbed making his rounds at 12:08am and saw him take out at least one car, he seemed pretty thirsty. I didn't stay much longer after that but I'm sure overnighting is not ok here. I posted a pic

name: Indian Lakes
description: Located north east of the city of Fallon. A scattering of small lakes on BLM land with an abundance of aviary and numerous pullouts to camp. Accessed from HWY 50, majority of acres is via paved road with the final portion consisting of mills washboard dirt road. Please pack your trash out!

name: Rest Area Southbound 15
description: Smaller size Rest Area on Southbound side. 2-4 bars Verizon, 24 hour rest room. Loud highway noise but not many spots taken, especially overnight.

name: Flying J
description: Water at pumps 12, 15 and RV gas pumps. Also has propane for sale.

name: Cathedral gorge campground
description: Great site with water and bathrooms. Good cell.

name: Twin lakes
description: Twin lakes. Many spots but fills up quickly. Dry camping only.

name: Bolognas Lagoon pullout
description: Beautiful pullout off Hwy 1 overlooking Bologna’s Lagoon. Large enough for 10 sprinters. People live nearby so don’t be a drag. Make sure to go hike the bolinas lagoon open space trail a half mile further on this road. Many birds in the morning (40 species on a winter morning!).

name: Dinner Island
description: This is a site through the Florida Fish and Wildlife Commision. It is free and beautiful. You are supposed to go online and get a free permit before staying. There are two campgrounds- the Hammock is shaded and the other campground is an open field. Easy in and out - right off the road but quiet. We saw a ton of birds (even a few resident owls), cows, and alligators.

name: Cenex
description: Propane tanks filled and also trade ins along with gas and diesel. Usually stop filling about 1800 or when lightening nearby

name: Flat Gravel Pullout
description: Right off the HWY.   Nice spot if you need a break

name: Wet Weather Waterfall
description: A huge parking area next to a beautiful waterfall.

name: Nutbush Bridge Campground
description:
Kerr Lake, Henderson, NC

Decent bathhouse, pretty flat, gorgeous views. The picnic tables are chained in the far corner of the site so that’s weird but it’s a nice place.

name: Ramsey Mine Rd BLM
description:
Many established spots along the east side of Ramsey Mine Rd between Hwy 60 and Hwy 10.  No amenities, pack in / pack out.
Road noise from Hwy 10 all day and all night.  Not a place I'd come to as a destination but a good place if you need a place to stay.
Country store in Brenda is in walking distance, with basic items, a sandwich shop, and an Amazon locker. 

This place is a popular place for ATVers to stay so all day there are ATVs coming in and out to go riding. 

Flat, open space, easy access for bigger rigs.

name: New Water Mountains Wilderness BLM / Dispersed Camping
description:
The spot I've noted here is the closest to Hwy 10 and easy to get to for any size rig.  Road in is flat and wide, rocky in some areas but not a problem. 

Go further into the wilderness area for more spots, most vehicles should be ok but proceed at your own discretion. 

This area is peaceful and beautiful, quiet, lots of area to explore and hike. Note that this area is used by ATVers, though we did not see very many when we were here on a Saturday in late January. Minimal road noise despite being so close to hwy 10.

Good verizon and ATT.

No amenities, pack in / pack out.  We did see some shooting debris but did not hear anybody shooting while we were there. 

There is a store with basic items and a sandwich shop up the road on hwy 60. There is an Amazon locker there as well.

name: water dispenser
description: this is a paid water dispenser. $1.25 for 5 gallons.

name: i-95 rest stop
description: Rest stop on the toll road. There are no 'no overnight signs posted' and a huge lot for truckers to overnight it appears. Indoor bathrooms and a portapotty out by semi truck parking. 5 bars Verizon. I assume this is a 'grey area' where you aren't supposed to camp or put out slides but we are in a van and nothing says we can't. We semi stealth van camp alot and find the service areas of toll roads to enforce less than state funded information center/rest areas. There is one good van spot by the tesla charger with a grass area to let our pup out. Not many options in this area since so many cities have passed laws about not overnight parking and most campgrounds are closed in winter or due to covid.

name: Crackel Barrel - Denton
description: RV Parking in rear. Adjacent Walmart and Sams parking lots. Several fast food places and fuel nearby.

name: Elk creek campground
description: NPS campground which is open year round.  Has available reservations or first come first serve in peak season. All sites first come/first serve in winter. An hour to Crested Butte, 2.5 hours to telluride. Stayed in winter, sites were $8/night non-electric, $14/night electric. No water. Pit toilets only. Good 4g cell service (AT&T). Was able to work remotely here.

name: Up 288
description: Nice area away from other campers on the 288 heading toward Young AZ

name: Kissimmee South RV Resort
description:
Says 55+ but they have an 80/20 rule so other ages can come. It’s close to Disney but I wouldn’t say it’s child-friendly because there isn’t much for kids to do and the MH residents don’t like the noise. Nice, quiet, gated, pool, etc. Cement sites but not all are flat. Good for a few days or weeks but there is NOTHING close by. People here like it QUIET so don’t come if you intended to party. 

Check website for BOGO deals.

name: Dead End Campsite
description: Great spot for a couple vehicles.  not enough room to get a trailer around.

name: Surf City Public Access #14
description: Great spot in an empty gravel public parking lot less than a block to the beach. There is a fire station diagonally across the street, but no emergencies appeared to happen while we were there. Enjoyed a lovely moonlit walk on the empty beach and the rest of the night was uneventful.

name: DelRay street parking and lot
description: Street spot in DelRay beach close to town with free parking 6pm to 8am (2 hours during the day). Was a good spot for the night. It’s close to a railroad so if you’re a light sleeper then it’s not ideal but plenty of parking like this throughout DelRay as long as you aren’t on the main road. There’s a big parking  lot with a 9 hour limit from 8am to 9pm (fine after 9pm) right behind this spot that I’d do next time as it’s off the street. Overall did the trick and easy walk to town for bars, restaurants, etc. I’d say beach is a 15 minute walk as well.

name: Shell Fuel Station
description: They have propane. The UHaul dealership across the street does not. I paid $3.69 per gallon. Ouch !

name: Love’s Truck Stop
description: Truck stop with overnight parking, showers, convenience store

name: GreenClean Laundry
description: remodeled, clean laundromat. Wi-Fi, bathrooms and new machines. well kept.

name: Little Cottonwood Road Driveway Camp
description:
We are 15 minutes straight down the road from Snowbird and Alta. There is a drive around driveway with views straight up the canyon.   Ski bus drops off in front of property.  
$35.00 per night,  Includes Electric and Water.

name: Little Cottonwood Road Driveway Camp
description:
We are 15 minutes straight down the road from Snowbird and Alta. There is a drive around driveway with views straight up the canyon.   Ski bus drops off in front of property.  
$35.00 per night,  Includes Electric and Water.

name: tractor supply
description: cheap propane fill. just go inside and ask for assistance, they will come right out and fill your tank.

name: Salome Market Laundromat
description: laundromat is behind the market, to the left of the doors. Variety of machine sizes.

name: Balcony trail head water
description: Bathrooms and water spigot. Either NPS pass or entrance fee of 30$. The balcony trail offers absolutely beautiful vistas, a waterfall, and a “through cave—follow the river” segment that is pretty easy to moderate.

name: Beaver Lake (Dam Site / Lake side)
description: Beautiful Army CoE campground with 48 campsites with electric hookups. Each site can accommodate three tents or one tent and one RV. Amenities include flush toilets, a dump station, water, showers and a boat ramp.   Near Eureka Springs, Arkansas.  Day use area near the campground is available for about $4 for the day.

name: Unnamed road
description: Informal camping off unnamed road. Nice views. Spotty AT&T.

name: Space Station RV Park: Propane, Dump, Water Refill
description: The other propane fillup in Beaty was closed. Space station is open until 10pm.

name: Longhouse RV/Truck Lot
description: RV/Truck lot at longhouse market and deli gas station

name: Rest Stop
description: Your typical highway rest stop but welcome considering the two south of here heading north are closed (April 2020-March 2021).  Clean and rather quiet.

name: Navajo lodge tier 3
description: Pretty convenient spot for the winter if you’re looking to go snowboarding/skiing the next day. It can be a little muddy, but not deep, just enough where you might want to let your dog out before you get to the spot. Another thing is that it’s not very level, but it’s free, quiet and right next to the lifts so no complaints here! (Great service, full LTE)

name: Power line camp
description:
Really nice desert camping. Wide open desert, miles to choose from. Great for any size rig, flat, level, hard packed. Some OHV traffic but you can easily get far enough off the road it’s not a problem. 3 miles on a kinda rough road to get here, one really tight turn over a bridge, and a 14’ railroad underpass. But well worth it if you like solitude!
We stayed a week in our 40 foot fifth wheel.

name: Home Depot Oakland Park
description: Home Depot right of 95 on Oakland park. There’s lots of semi’s and box trucks parked there. We just pulled up and parked with no problem. It’s really peaceful, quiet, and feels secluded. Seems safe as well.

name: Ridge Top
description:
Forest Road 315 Split From Rampart Range Road.
A few established spots along the route.  
Excellent views in all directions. 
Cell Service (AT&T) is limited.
Warning:  Larger rigs be weary as roads are dirt single lanes. Turn around locations limited. Twisty climbs up to ridge location.

name: The Cove RV Resort
description: $10 fee for dumping, water is available as well.

name: Glacier Lake road
description: An old quarry 1 mile before the trail head to Glacier Lake. The gravel road is accessible to any vehicle except the last few meter where high clearance is recommended. Space for a few rigs, but wouldn’t drive a trailer on this road. No cell signal (T Mobile).

name: Seymour lake free campground
description: Free National Forest campground. Up to 16 days limit. Dry toilets, no t-mobile service, shady.

name: Toll Mountain free Campground NF
description: Nice secluded National Forest campground with pit toilets. Shady areas for tents but not for rv’s. No t-mobile service.

name: Outside water station
description: Filtered drinking water station outside 7Eleven. It’s next to a red box vending machine. Keep in mind it only takes quarters. It’s very convenient, since you do not have to go in to an establishment.

name: Porter Lake Campground
description:
In Apalachicola National Forest 17 miles west of Sopchoppy 1.3 miles southwest of route 375. Free. First come, first serve. Couldn’t find any information on time limit but some people had been there two months. Any size rig depending how full it is and where others park or pitch tents. A man said it gets closed part of the year so check the website (https://www.fs.usda.gov/recarea/apalachicola/recarea/?recid=75256)
Potable drinking water but not a threaded faucet so can’t use a hose with it. Pit toilets. Very weak Verizon signal. Road in starts very dusty but then becomes paved. No designated parking spots. Florida National Scenic Trail goes through the campground but after 1.1 mile you reach swamp. Can paddle the water in the cypress area next to campground on the Ochlockonee River. Popular spot especially during deer hunting season so could be crowded. We arrived on a Monday and there was plenty of room. February 1, 2021. Quiet.

name: Camel Lake Campground
description: In Apalachicola National Forest 10 hard packed dirt sites (4 with electric and water; 6 dry camping) tables, grills, fire pits. Flush toilets/showers. $20, S/A Pass 1/2, plus $10 for electric sites. Reservations required, no money accepted at CG. 14 day limit. Large sites with shrub and trees between each. Could be muddy if rain. Verizon varies. 1/2-hr trail around lake, connects to Florida Trail. Excellent hiking/mtn biking on the fire rds. Beautiful beach except for the gator warning.

name: Corn & peace
description: Few littles spot for vans after a rest area. Keep driving after the rest area and you’ll find the spot don’t go after the gravel road.

name: Open Lot
description:
Great spot!  No room for campfires. We parked in the area before the main entrance, close to the road. Quiet and beautiful.  Dogs loved it! Stayed a couple nights.  
Drove a AWD Honda Element with a tear drop-esque custom trailer.  Wouldn’t recommend in rain, soft/medium ground.  Other roads and spots available, Before and after the gate.

name: First Rock
description:
On the way to Whitney’s Pocket, off of Whitney pass road on the right side and across from the “cistern” to the left side. The paved road most of the way there is covered in potholes and closer to Whitney’s Pocket you’ll hit a rocky gravel road. We’re in a van and did fine but you could definitely explore further if you have a higher clearance/ 4x4 vehicle. 

There are a few fire rings when you drive in off the road to a wide flat area. You can keep on driving around the rock to another more secluded spot but would suggest having a 4x4/high clearance vehicle or park in the flat area first to scout it out. No cell service but the closer you get to First Rock it can be spotty. Beautiful views! We even saw some free range cattle relaxing off the side of the road.

name: Bass Pro Shop Leeds, Alabama
description:
Park in the top tier parking lot (up the hill). It’s quit and safe.

Verizon 4 bars with or with out we-boost

name: Trimble Park
description: County camp ground with water and electric hookups, and dump station. Shade, Playgrounds and hiking trails. Waterfront sites available but no swimming allowed. 3-4 bars Verizon 5G. $20 a night. Definitely a gem! Must check in before 6 pm to get gate code.

name: high falls state park
description: nice state park  just off 75. t mobile  has 2 bars. Verizon  has 2 bars of service.  must reserve  through  ReserveAmerica.

name: Natural spring with views of the ocean
description: A natural spring with multiple pipes coming from the side of the mountain. Locals were filling gallons of water bottles when we showed up.

name: Moon Rocks (BLM)
description: Huge ATV playground with numerous spots to stay with fire pits. Approx. 30 minutes outside Reno. AT&T and Verizon service is available, we worked remote in this location. The rocks are an interesting feature.

name: Valero Gas Station
description: The employees let me use the water spigot to fill my van. The spigot is next to the metal dumpsters near the private property driveway in the back.

name: Hidden parking area
description: I believe this is an employee parking area during the day but at night no one is here. A diesel did come and stay on the other side but it was just us. You can go use the bathroom at Lowe’s if needed. Good spot to park overnight

name: Northbound 75 Rest stop
description: Dump station and fresh water on the left just before pulling out of the rest area and back on the freeway

name: Bucklin Park
description: A great medium sized park in El Centro with a small pond, ducks, a fountain, and the only one we could find that wasn’t a tiny neighborhood park. There’s a few different parking areas around the park, a playground for kids, picnic tables, covered areas, and even a workout area with machines. We came here to park for a little bit to do some online work and give our dogs a walk. Great place to stretch your legs, and enjoy the grass and some shade. Great cell service for us (AT&T)

name: Boulder Conoco
description: Has a 5gal water filler in the side of the building, which is connected to a spigot with a "Y" connector that has an available branch. Ask inside first, but they said it was fine to grab water.

name: Rest area west bound 22
description: Dump station and water.  There is a lock that the security guard needs to unlock.

name: Shingle Creek Rest Area
description: Rest area accessible by both northbound and southbound traffic. Quiet. Heated bathrooms available. Currently no water (sink or drinking). Picnic tables to eat at. Looked like you might be able to do some very light hiking into the dense woods, but I didn't have time for that this morning. Relatively quiet. We pulled in last night in the dark around 19:30. Couple semi trucks stopped by, a few other travelers stopped for a break, but nothing too busy or noisy. Spacious enough for a semi to maneuver and turn around. We're pulling our small travel trailer and had no issues.

name: S.A river
description: no signs saying don't camp. on the san antonio river under a bridge. lots of bridge noise.

name: Rest Area- West
description: west bound ... the nicest rest area I've ever seen. east bound very similar. 3 dedicated rv spots, parallel parking next to the sidewalk. if they're all taken you can use the diagonal spots for semis, but try to leave them open, since trucks are required by law to stop at certain times of their day. yes, there is traffic noise from I-10, and the trucks in the parking lot, but not terrible. a great overnight stay. immaculate restrooms and lobby area with 3d displays of the area in bygone eras. picnic areas and nature trail (though there's not much nature to see).

name: Rest Area
description: Free dump and potable water at rest area off of 395

name: Brushy Lake Campground
description: Small quiet campground with sites along a lake. Sites have flat spots to park, bbqs, fire pits, and tables. $15 offseason fee, $20 in the spring and summer. Wifi, water,and RV hookups too.

name: Barona station
description: water at the gas station next to the casino

name: Hillside Tires
description: Called ahead of time and asked - guys were super chill about letting us use spigot on north side of building to fill up our water tank in van build. This locations water pipes run inside so they don’t freeze during winter.

name: 24hr Del taco parking lot
description: Just off the highway, fine for one night while passing through. Sign says customer parking only-  so buy something. I confirmed with the employees it was ok to park overnight and they said no problem.

name: Rest area
description: First rest area westbound in Alabama. We pulled in and we were pleasantly surprised to find a nice open rest area. I was overly cautious about no overnight parking. So I must have walked around the entire rest area three times looking for signs. I did not find a single sign that said no overnight parking, and there are truck spots that were full overnight. There are picnic tables everywhere and the bathrooms were open. Signs saying “no pets“ and then a couple feet later saying “keep pets on leash.” So we just walked around and nobody bothered us. We are in a camper van so we pulled into the van spots and had a nice quiet night.

name: Harrah's Casino
description: We stayed one night. There is a lot of parking available, will fit any size rig. It is a pretty well-lit parking lot, but the only noise is from the other trucks parked in the area. It is easy off/on access to the highway.

name: Prescott national forest
description: Great camp site. forest rd 72. Make a right at cattle gate . There is a trail head right there. good hike  100 yards down on left. great spot

name: Crystal mountain
description: Great spot. 6 miles off 95. 7or 8 miles from Quartzsite AZ.

name: Alamo lake
description: Great BLM land. Views of the lake and desert . Easy drive in. plenty of big rig spots and plenty 0f off-road spots. Over all, great place. We have a spot with long range Mountain View’s and lake is right here .

name: Arizona Land Trust off New River Road
description: Good spot to spend the night. that’s about it. close to Lake Pleasant . Get your $21 pass on-line. police did come by on atv to check .

name: LOVE'S truck stop
description: water spigot and dump station next to Loves on east side of lot.

name: Brooklyn Ave street parking
description: Parked on the street here across from the brewery and taco place. No signs anywhere restricting parking. Well lit area across the street and people around during the daytime until about midnight. Light traffic at night and some noise. Right next to the river walk and some decent bars! Farmers market is close by bike. I stayed one night with no issues. Grab a beer and watch over your van before bed. Public toilets at the river walk by the dam, open field for dogs across the river!

name: Rapid Wash Laundry
description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon. Minimal customers and quiet machines. Washers worked well.

name: Gulf Coast Camping
description: I hate paying for dump stations since I usually use them for free at campsites but I’m boondocking so much around here. I had to pay the $15 to use their dump station.  it’s all you really need and one of the few dump stations I found in the area.

name: FCR Park
description: Threaded water spigot on restroom building. You'll need a long hose or containers.

name: Brake Check
description: This is a solid spot for emergency brake repairs! Had some issues with my ABS, they got me in within an hour on a weekend and all stayed late to help finish so I could get back on the road. Really friendly staff and owner, very professional. Cheap oil changes too.

name: Desert Trails RV Park
description:
We were in El Centro, CA running errands and were in need of a dump site, took a chance and gave Desert Trails RV Park a call and asked if they had a dump site available to the public, and they did! The cost is $3 to dump and if you wanted potable water it’s another $3. Potable water is right next to dump and no one checks if you use it, sooo....

.We parked at the entrance where the office was and paid there but the kind lady at the desk told me over the phone that when the office is closed you can use the night drop envelopes - put your money in, and slide the envelope under the office door. The dump/water area is the prettiest ones we’ve encountered yet as it overlooks the golf course within the RV park and everything was clean and well taken care of. There was supposed to be a hose attached to the water spigot used to wash down the dump area but the only hose that was there did not have either end that could have connected to the spigot so we just used a collapsible bucket and filled it up a bunch to wash down the area (we have a small Camco toilet in our van). We paid the $3 to fill our water also and it tastes great! Would definitely come here again if we need to make another trip to town.

name: Pilot flying j
description: Dump station with non potable water, propane refill, and potable water at the diesel pumps.

name: Santa Barbara Sailing Club
description:
There are three parking lots next to each other.  The middle parking lot is free 90 minute parking.  The other parking lots are ~$2 per hour. 

Good place to park, take a walk on the beach, and maybe cook some lunch, in the middle of the day.

name: Barney Schwartz park
description: This is a park that is open 24 hours. The main entrance has a parking lot and restrooms. There is an upper lot that gets locked at night. And another lot to the west. I stayed the night  in the main first lot. There are no "no parking" "no overnight" signs. The lot is well lit, I felt very safe. There are "no dog" signs near the restrooms and I didn't check to see if restrooms are 24 hours or not. I would stay again.

name: laundromat Mall
description:
water located at center sign billboard and near dumpsters.
$2 to fill

name: Walmart
description: I pulled in here for overnight boondock. Several truckers parked here with big rigs. Quiet and convenient. Walmart has a fuel station

name: Horse Pasture Fishing Access
description: South of US-6 along the river. It's a parking area for access to Eagle river but on public land. Bulletin board says disperse camping is allowed along the river. A little noise from I-70 but overall very quiet. Dog poop bags available along pathway. Easy to access in the winter. At&t 2-bars

name: Acadiana park campground
description: Potable water from tap. On the left as you enter / right as you leave.

name: Joseph H. Stewart State Recreation Area
description: Pretty nice campsite but a little pricy. $36/site for full hookup, $2/shower. My water didn’t work. Beautiful trail nearby and pretty quiet.

name: Oceanside Beach Shower
description: Free shower on the beach in Oceanside. Cold water, but better than nothing.

name: trail head
description: This area is a trail head to a 15 mile trail that is totally worth taking!!! Basically the end of a road that the state doesn't maintain due to flooding down the road. Spent two nights here

name: Nice spot to wake up!
description: Nice little pull off on the side of a in mapped dirt road on top of  little hill. Decent cell signal and flat. Great views in the morning when we woke up.

name: BLM site, great view, maybe some cows.
description:
Another option in the Ranch BLM area.  Nice individual spot with stone fire ring and a great view of mountains behind prairie.  No cows today, but clear signs of them in the area.  2 bars Verizon LTE
Normal véhicule is ok 2 tractions

name: Ace Hardware
description: They have a decent price on propane. Fast service.

name: Hawk Canyon Goat Trail Intersection
description: Awesome pull out just before the Y to hawk canyon or Goat Trail (Buttes Pass) - this is great for rigs that can’t handle the softer sand down the hill to hawk canyon or the steeper road up to buttes pass. Very little traffic. Wonderfully quiet. Within hiking distance to slot canyon. Weak cell signal, but with a booster it’s definitely usable

name: BLM Land Right Outside Kofa.
description: There are a variety of campsites near the coordinates right outside the entrance to Kofa on BLM land. Cell phone reception is excellent. Views are excellent. This is all Boondocking.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Free overnight stay for RV’s. Three large RV specific spots plus others for smaller rigs / class B.

name: Hard Luck Road
description: The existing camp grounds have been closed for a long time but there are several pull off spots that work very well for a night or two. A paved road gets you here and it is wildly remote... and yet you can see the cars on interstate 5 a mile away. There are no signs that prohibit parking overnight on the public road. Very quiet and I think I found mountain lion tracks in the drier mud... yikes

name: Roadside rest area
description: Roadside Park with  picnic tables and covers on the side of 84 right outside of Gatesville. good Verizon. service felt safe. little bit of road noise

name: Roadside
description:
A little pull -off parking area (~150’x20’) where people park by the lake. There are not any “no parking“ signs and there are minimal residences across the street all of which are set back and higher up so it doesn’t feel intrusive. I wouldn’t suggest anything bigger than a 20’ vehicle or you might feel like you’re being more intrusive.

I parked just after sundown and maneuvered a bit to find a level spot. It’s the main road that runs adjacent to the lake, so there’s activity until early-mid evening, but eventually you won’t hear any cars passing by. It’s really just so serene!

I have T-Mobile and had 1-3 bars.

There are several other pull off areas along the main road, but this one seems to have the best access and view… all while feeling less intrusive.

name: Lower Hillsborough Wilderness Preserve .
description: The Morris Bridge entrance to the Lower Hillsborough Wilderness Preserve has a faucet for potable water. To use the park is $2. Great stopover and a way to fill up our tanks.

name: Rest Area EB
description:
Convenience water. Free.
You need to pull down the "big opening" (I don't know how to call that sorry xD) and open the water to use the hose outlet.

name: Off Road Recovery (Matt's)
description:
Serves the area to get you out sand/mud/snow. Can also tow broken vehicles.
Make sure you tell them 'the cowboy sent me' 
Winder Towing (aka Matt's Off road recovery)
+1 435 635 2231

name: Planet Fitness
description: Planet Fitness parking lot, big lot nice and quiet.

name: Empty Lot
description:
Empty lot next to a Shell gas station. Also nearby Exxon, Motel 6, and "Huddle House".

No Semis is clearly stated. But there's enough room for any size RV, bus, van, car. 

Not the quietest spot. But good for a quick overnight.

name: Walmart Streetsboro
description: Walmart with a large parking lot. Called to make sure it was okay to park overnight and was told that it was permitted but to park towards the grocery side of the building. Other trucks were there overnight as well. The idling of the trucks were a bit loud, but no one bothered us so it worked for one night!

name: Santa Cruz County Fairgrounds
description: Santa Cruz County Fairgrounds, spigot that I used is in the parking area on the south side of the pens and buildings, I think there are others but this was the first one I saw. Was told to come here at the mini mart when I asked where I could fill up my water tank. Quite a bit of activity here today, I think they're prepping for an event, no one has approached me to tell me I can't so pretty sure it's common practice for rvs to fill here.

name: big gravel spot off Oatman hwy
description:
Spot for several big rigs close to hwy 10, and more down the road closed to mtns.
The respect for wild places is more apparent with every camp. There was excrement (incl. human) out in the open, enormous amounts of glass, cans, .22cal shells, and various unidentified objects.

name: Water Spigot
description: Two city water spigots in front of the small dog park.  One has a hose connected to it, one is without a hose.  Close to the road and a parking spot.  Medium pressure and work fine!

name: Water Spigot - Bonita Beach Dog Park
description: Water spigot near the doggie shower station by the parking lot.  Need a key master water key to turn on the spigot & will need a hose.  Plenty of room to back up and park for water uplift.

name: Potable Water Spigots
description: Potable water spigots at some of the picnic areas (04, 13, 17, as well as others).  Dump station and bathrooms also on site.   Feb 1, 2021 the water is turned on and working.  Signs that say no overnight parking allowed.

name: Venice Ave Free Street Parking / Under Bridge
description: Free street parking on Venice Avenue next to the bridge and near Venetian Waterway Park.  Some noise from road traffic, but it quieted down by 10pm.  I’m in a non-Stealth Sprinter Van & stayed here two nights without issue.

name: Street Parking Near Main Street
description: 2 hour parking Mon-Sat 9am to 8pm.  Stayed overnight for two nights without issue.  Park closer to 2nd/Adelia by BoldLofts to be a little further away from Main Street.

name: Free Street Parking Near Bayfront
description: Free street parking near Bayfront.  No restrictions for overnight parking, stayed here without issue.

name: Potable Drinking Water Spigot
description:
Potable water spigot
At first picnic area next to handicapped parking.  I have a 35’ hose and it was more than enough.  Works perfectly Feb 2021
I also saw more spigots in the main picnic area, did not try them to see if they’re turned on

name: Free Parking - Mount Dora
description: Stayed here without issue, this lot is more hidden and close to downtown.  The next lot over has bathrooms, but is more out in the open.  I didn’t use the bathrooms so can’t confirm their cleanliness.  This town is super adorable!  Two bars Verizon LTE.

name: Venetian Gardens (Free)
description:
Nice place to park for the day and get some work done.  Toilets, dog friendly, and tons of trails through a few parks.
Two bars Verizon LTE.

name: Historic Micanopy
description: Adorable small town gem to spend the day in.  Parking on the street was all empty after 5pm and had no issues.

name: Happy Valley Road disperse camping
description:
Several large sites close to Miller Canyon Trailhead for climbing Mt Rincon.  Large fire rings.

Miller Canyon Trailhead about a mile down the road is big enough for any size rig.

name: Honomanu Bay
description: Local beach site- rough road right before a big corner- goes right to the beach.  Heard there’s sharks in the water here :)

name: Nice spot with the river sound
description: Nice spot with river sound, can spend a night here with no problem

name: AZT Mountain Bike Trailhead
description: I didn’t spend the night but wish I had. Vans were also parked along pull outs on Pistol Hill Road.  This lot is flat and fairly big. Room for two or three vans.  Poor to no cell service (Verizon)

name: Front Sight Campground
description: This is the camp just near the entrance of the Front Sight firearms facility. The gravel camp spot is a few hundred yards from the gated facility entrance on the RIGHT side of the road when entering.  Do NOT enter Front Sight without first setting an appointment. Large space suitable for big rigs. NO UTILITIES. 3 bars Verizon LTE.  5 bar T-Mobile. This property is owned by Front Sight. Take care of it.  The campsite can be accessed 24/7. The facility gates open at 7:15 most days. Expect traffic noise around that time. Also, take a firearm course here! They are FANTASTIC!

name: City street parking
description: Directed to this location by a park ranger at Hunter Springs Park. Diagonal street parking long enough for our 20” Class B with bike rack. Restaurants less than a block away. Some minor street noise overnight. No hassles. Close to Kings Bay park. see the manatees for free (park here).

name: Flying J dump station
description: $10 to use the dump. $7.50 with Good Sam discount.  Water by dump is non potable.  Bulk propane also available here, did not get the cost.

name: Rest stop
description: Large rest stop with a dump station. A lot of semis, but no issues sleeping overnight.

name: 91 N Vermont welcome/ rest area
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: "There are no overnight camping signs, but the rules are as long as you don't set anything up or put out slides you are resting, not camping"

Enormous parking lot/ rest area / welcome center. Free wifi, porta potties due to covid, there are 'no overnight camping signs' but the rules are as long as you don't set anything up or put out slides you are 'resting not camping'. pulled in at 9pm left at 9am with no problem.

name: Big gravel parking lots
description: Lots of room for all size rigs. Lots of big rigs, vans and rvs here. Right next to highway.

name: Arroyo Burro Beach
description: Also known as Hendry’s Beach. Showers are cold but look well kept up and are free. The shower marker on the beach that’s a couple miles to the west of here is no good, those are closed. The ones at the beach near downtown are also open.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: RV parking spaces behind the restaurant.

name: Old Diner Parking Lot
description: Old diner parking lot. No diner anymore but large concrete pad. Next to the Truck Stop and interstate so you hear trucks through the night and morning. Perfect for a nights stop

name: Exxon Gas Station
description: Water spigot on side of the building. Ask the employee before using. Friendly.

name: Broomfield water treatment plant
description: $25 annual permit provides access to dump for one year after date of purchase. Permit sticker must be on windshield. Permits are only issued at the office M-F 8AM-4PM at 2985 West 124th Avenue, Broomfield, CO. Phone: 303-438-6339. The dump is only accessible from 7 AM to 7 PM, 7 days a week, closed Thanksgiving and Christmas.

name: Agua Caliente Regional Park
description: A Beautiful little park, super clean restrooms, picnic tables, and wildlife. I saw ducks, birds, and turtles. A great place to have a Picnic.

name: lawful street parking
description: Saw a few cars legally parked on both sides of the street outside a small apartment complex and decided to blend in for a good night's sleep. Neighborhood was quiet, and it's not a main street so minimal traffic. Also, road is level. I wouldn't stay here many nights in a row but as a 1-night sleeping spot in town, it works.

name: Bryan Beach
description: Be careful with 2WD, if no washed out sections. Can get crowded with locals on beach, some come down this far to fish. Can probably get a space on your own if you get down far enough.

name: Pullout on  #41
description: A large pullout on the 41 just outside of Morro Bay. Noisy but effective. Several RVs fit easily, and one overnighter confirmed that they sleep here often. Not a good spot, expect locals to honk at you all night long.

name: AZ Forest Land
description:
This is Arizona State Land property and you need a $15 annual permit to camp (good for all state lands). 

There are a number of wild camping spots in this particular juniper forest, with sweeping views to the north. Dirt roads circle through the forest and some are pretty rough. While the land slopes to the north, there are many, smaller level places. I was the only person here on a 3-day holiday weekend. 

There are no services of any kind. Please be cautious with fire and take your trash out with you. 2-3 bars of Verizon LTE. 

You can purchase the permit online in less than five minutes. The URL is on the sign at the entry. I expect no one checks for permits. Close to the local road, so you'll hear an occasional vehicle. Don't really recommend for big rigs -- not many larger, level spots.

name: Tonelea Trails dispersed sites
description: Nice site near Interstate 17 with great Verizon and AT&T reception. Part of Agua Adria Monument area. There’s a sign saying 4x4 needed but this is not necessary to reach some sites. Great view!

name: Placer Cove
description: No cell service unless you hike up the hill. A few nice flat spots. Incredible views and great swimming and cliff jumping from Nelson’s Cliff.  Pit toilet.  Medium rig would be fine if it’s dry.

name: Bass Pro
description: We didn’t see this location on any of the apps we use to find free parking, but we took a chance, ran in and asked and they said yes! There was 1 RV in the lot. The lot has some slight sloping so it took a bit for us to find the “right” spot.

name: Blair City Park
description: RV full hookups at the city park.  Restaurants nearby, mechanic nearby, nice quite camping. Safe quiet neighborhood.

name: All American Fuel
description: Right off Hwy. 95 small gas station with propane fill outside.

name: 87 N rest area
description: Big rest area with truck parking, food, restrooms, wifi, good Verizon coverage, toll road

name: Del's tire shop
description:
Del's tire. Truck failed to start at Love's travel stop. Lori at Love's gave my Justin's number. 520-221-0898. He came west one junction and jumped my truck. New alternator on its way to his shop now. Battery on charge while waiting.

Job done Alternator fitted and working. I would use Del's again. Not sure how to change the Star rating but I'd give it five, if I new how.

name: MacKenzie River Pizza
description: Have stayed overnight 3 times here, now, while passing thru Montana.    Great food and drink.  Parked on street in front of Pub each time, for the night, after having a couple beers in the bar.    Quiet and no trouble each time.

name: The Real "Up" House
description:
It’s a faithful full-size replica of Carl and Ellie's house in Pixar's animated movie "Up," built by a local developer and sold to a fan couple in 2011.

It is private property with a sign on the gate stating that a few photos from outside are fine, but anything else, like filming or entrance, requires permission. 

Address: 13222 Herriman Rose Blvd, Herriman, UT

Directions: From Main St. on east side of town, turn south on Herriman Rose Blvd. Private property - visible from street.

name: Caliente Mountain Road
description: Lots of options for campsites along Caliente Mountain Road past the established campground. Some spots are larger than others, some are tent friendly. Fire pits are filled in. Please check fire restrictions in the area and be careful! Road is steep and narrow but accessible in any vehicle in dry weather. Most sites overlook the plain with views of soda lake. Expect windy conditions. Road ends with Caliente Mountain Ridge Trailhead. Occasional cars pass during the day, very quiet at night. Don’t expect complete solitude though, this place is fairly popular.

name: The Station - Truck stop
description: Large open lot. Mostly semi trucks parked. One other van beside me. No 24 hour services. Small cafe open during the day. 2 bars on AT&T. It will do if you are tired and looking to call it a day.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: There is designated RV/BUS parking in the back for about 4 rigs. We asked if we could park there at it. no problem.

name: Pioneer Gas
description: Propane fill up. Difficult entry with cars always parked.

name: Creek camping
description: A few beautiful dispersed campsites by a creek, close to the road

name: Walmart Parking
description:
•This walmart has a very large lot. I parked around the fenced in water drainage pit thing with a few other Semi trucks.
•Full cell service
•Some highway noise but not too terrible
•Stayed 9pm-noon and was not bothered.
•Plenty of surrounding stores/food/gas
Theres a Loves across the highway but this seemed the quieter option.

name: Pullouts on Forest Service Road
description: Lots of pull-outs past sign for fires. Gray area. We were able to set up a tent. There's plenty of spots that could for a small RV.

name: Minersville Reservoir Campground
description: Campground with fees, private cooking areas, and running water. Service with Verizon works relatively reliably here with some spotty AT&T. Electricity available even at tent camping sites.

name: Antelope Island Beach Showers
description: This restroom/showers complex offers coin-operated, private showers

name: Love's Gas Station
description: Free station to get water and empty black water. Arby's and gas nearby. Very convenient. Currently, there's still construction, but I was able to fill up anyway.

name: Clear Creek Campground
description: This campsite is accessible by any vehicle, free, and quiet. It is nestled between two mountains with a creek running through it. I've heard that the creek has excellent trout and offers an opportunity to pan for gold. The sites are shady, with large tables, fire rings, and grills on top of the rings.

name: Kerrville Rest Stop
description: Nice rest stop for camping. Has running water and rest rooms, as well as picnic tables

name: El Dorado Co Fairgrounds recycling bins
description: several blue bins for mixed recycling.  glass, cans, aluminum, plastic.

name: Express Fuel dump station & potable water
description: $10 to dump, green handled water spigot as well to fill your tanks. Dump is behind car wash. No bulk propane here, the big tank is for store use. They do have the cylinder exchange here though. Very nice and clean place.

name: Wild West RV Park
description: $10.00 to dump. Pull into any spot and call the office

name: Goldkey Boathouse propane fill
description: boat storage facility that will fill propane tanks (both the cylinder and the on vehicle tank). $3.99/gal. Propane fill is behind storage facility behind locked gate, employees will open gate and let you in the back.

name: Paraco Gas
description: They have a fill station for RV also is the closest place to NYC to get Propane

name: Bryce Canyon sunset
description: Beautiful sunset spot over the town of tropic and Bryce Canyon. No RV. I have a forester and the hill is steep. Amazing sunset. No sedans or Honda Fit cars.

name: flat open many spots- big enough for RIGS
description: 40 foot diesel pusher no problem...up on gravel plateau  flat in this spot. nice big turn around area. views great. (not everywhere at Stewart's Point can handle big rigs- some places the road is too rutted. This spot was easily accessible)

name: Pull off- TV tower Road with views
description:
Pull off on TV Tower Road- 360 views from the top of our Sprinter Van.  Drove about 30
Mins up rough dirt road to get here but very private and worth the ride up.

name: Walmart in Robertsdale, AL
description: Free overnight. Called to ask and they said yes but to park as far from store as can. Fairly quiet.

name: army Corp of engineers  sturgeon bay
description:
It's a beautiful spot during the day, and I can only imagine how pretty the night sky is. it's incredibly quiet, very peaceful. During the daytime, there are definitely a few boats passing by, or in front of the parking lot fishing. there's a large grassy area next to the parking lot which would be perfect for a tent. It can get a little windy, so I can imagine it might be a bit cold at night, even during the summer. After a good night's sleep or if you just need a peaceful day trip, you can do some fishing on the cemented pathway.... or just watch the big expensive boats pass by. 
Official personnel does pass by in boats as well - Coast guard? Water police? 

Once you make a left turn for that final mile, it is all gravel, but it's not bad. Going slow, my old grrl, made the the one mile without any problems. There's definitely room for a couple of big rigs up to you maybe 35 ft. Possibly bigger if you are really good at making tight u-turns.  there's plenty of room for camper vans/ Sprinters / large class B's. 

WiFi
Sunny spot for solar panels: 
Dog /cat friendly: No signs & lots of grass
Fishing

name: Walmart parking lot
description: Called the store and the woman told me we could park at the end of the parking lot on the right when you enter the lot. It’s a strip of spots between Home Depot and Walmart.

name: publix
description: publix parking lot. I parked for one night and no one bothered me. there is a walgreens across the street too. One spot I saw had a "tow away zone" sign, but I think that was for parking in the bank parking lot. The water fill up in the publix was out of order, so if you need water here, double check first.

name: Riverfront RV Park
description: Weekly, monthly or long-term sites only, but very affordable. $175/wk or $320/month. This is a hidden gem for sure. No frills(no pool, no wifi), but quiet, on the Colorado River and eclectic. Antiques scattered around the park, mostly winter residents but very friendly. Jean, the owner is kind and accommodating. Currently the bathrooms are closed due to COVID.

name: Heritage Park Aquatic Complex
description:
Very warm showers, price $4. Senior price $2. This includes use of the pool and gym. There's an indoor and outdoor pool. Great staff, large complex, and popular with the locals. 

https://www.cityofhenderson.com/Home/Components/FacilityDirectory/FacilityDirectory/174/786

name: Walmart
description: Good for a night. There was a noisy train on one side of the parking lot that was pretty loud at night a couple of times, so not ideal but adequate.

name: Boat ramp
description: Large flat area under the overpass. Next to dead end road too.

name: Dispersed Campsite 1
description: It’s the first small dispersed campsite in this national park. It can fit cars and vans but not much larger then that. Larger camp sites up the road. 2 bars Verizon. pretty good view.

name: Roadside Ridge
description: Great view and cell phone coverage.  Open area for multiple vehicles large and small.

name: TA Travel Center
description: TA travel center. best price on fuel that we've seen on our trip so far

name: Baytec Propane
description:
Friendly people. Turning circle might be a little tight for a big rig though just to be aware. You might want to call to be sure you'll be able to make the turn. 

They were also kind enough to let me fill up my water tank.

name: Walmart
description: I called. Lady said o.k. but to park all the way out next to the highway on the side where the bank is. A bit noisier being so close to the highway and entrance to parking lot but not too bad. Worst problem was finding a level spot. Parking lot slants.

name: BLM land
description: Great views, quiet, and I got service with at & t

name: Forest
description: Rough road to get here, but really pretty and private

name: Motel 6
description: Motel 6 has several water pumps around the parking lot, with hose connections

name: Free dump and potable water
description: Suggested donation $5. Potable water with hose hookup.

name: Gas n Go
description: Water, propane, gas, ice. Air for your tires.

name: Bouse Community Park
description: Nice little campground in the desert. Some electric and water sites, some without. Some picnic tables and fire pits. Also offers sewer dump and potable water fill. $15 and $5.

name: Dumont Dunes
description: Great dry camping spot right next to some massive sand dunes. $30 per week and you can buy the permit here at a kiosk. It is popular with OHV, so it can get loud (I’d avoid the weekends). Pit toilets available. Good cell service on ATT.

name: Street parking
description: Plenty of parking along this street and a few side streets nearby. Very safe and quiet neighborhood and close to trailheads. We stayed in our 27ft bus with no problem.

name: A to Z Equipment Rentals
description: Propane fill Station with super nice guys.

name: California welcome center
description: Free wifi, you can stay outside because there is a bench.

name: James River State Park
description:
Campsites ranging from $20 (primitive) to $35 (full hook ups). Cabins also available. Reservations advised for much of the year. 

Limited cell service here. WiFi may be available at visitors center.

name: Nelson County Tourism Center
description:
Overnight parking at the Nelson County Tourism Center. Park close to the portable toilet in the north-west corner of the lot. Check in at tourism center/library if arriving during the day. Quiet lot. Some morning traffic from workers arriving but nothing major. Best for vehicles 25ft or less. Larger vehicles are best advised to check in and get parking instructions.
No services other than a portable toilet. Cell service is good. WiFi may be available from library but a signal booster will be needed for it to reach parking area.

name: Miller’s Ace Harware
description: Propane refill available in back lot. Check in with cashier to get assistance.

name: Speedway gas station
description: This is a Speedway gas station. It has two water faucets (tap water) on sides of the building.

name: Eastern Lake Campground 1
description:
These coordinates take you to the gate for Campground 1. Nearby is Campground 2 which has been logged in iOverlander by another user. 
Campground 1 has four sites and a pit toilet. No water or electric. Each site has an elevated and leveled tent pad, pole for hanging a food bag (bears are a real concern here), and table. Sites 1 and 2 have low hanging branches which will prevent most high roof vans and campers from accessing the site. Sites 3 and 4 are more accessible (my rig has an 11ft roof). All sites have narrow access. Reverse in or reverse out. Pick your poison. 
AT&T Cell signal was good. 
Reservations are required. $9 per night with a $6.70 reservation fee. 
Campground 1 and 2 are several miles into the forest. The roads are sandy and rutted. Use caution after rain and when approaching puddles. Some can be surprisingly deep and soft bottomed.
There are many other iOverlander entries listing free dispersed camping in the Point Washington forest. It is doable and most check-in’s report a positive experience but Campground 1 and 2 are the only approved camping areas in the Point Washington forest. All others areas are day use only and require the purchase of an access permit. 

https://www.fdacs.gov/Forest-Wildfire/Our-Forests/State-Forests/State-Forest-Recreation/Fees-and-Rules

name: Costco (Additional Parking)
description: This was a safe, well lit parking area between the main Costco lot and the Costco Fuel area. There was no one else around, no signage prohibiting parking. Would be ok for a night or two. Large RVs would probably be ok. Bathrooms inside if you have a Costco membership.

name: James M. Scott Deadening Alpine Trailhead
description: Small stone parking lot by the trailhead. No signs about parking, camping etc. My buddy and I camped for 1 night here in our two trucks with kayaks on the roof. Nobody bothered us, but I would only stay for one night and keep things quiet. A few cars drove past early at night, but other than that it was quiet. Site is about 300yds across the street from someone’s house. Overall, I’ve been at worse trailheads.

name: Road Pull Off
description: There is a dirt road pull off that myself and another car camper happened to stumble across! It has a two-sided entry. On the north is a little flatter & easier to pull up, and south entrance is more steep. My Ford Escape still made the south entrance though. It’s directly off the highway so you get a lot of highway noise, but trees hide you from the road for some privacy.

name: Dillon's Parking Lot
description: Parking lot where buildings were torn out, with walking trail and river behind. This parking lot is in a safe area and away from people for lots of privacy. Perfect to grab a few hours of sleep.

name: Benicia State Recreation Area Enroute Camping
description:
One night only camping for self contained vehicles. No amenities. First come first served. Can't pull in to camp spot until 3pm and have to leave by 9am, but you can stay in the day use area outside of those hours. Great place for an overnight, especially with bay area camping prices.
$12/night for camping. Day use fee is $6 (which you don't have to pay if you're staying the night).

name: Sparrow Park Rd pulloff
description: A little pulloff on the side of Sparrow Park road, enough room for a van. Flat, with a pull off on the other side to turn around easily. Easy to get to with 2WD in the dark.

name: Safeway parking lot
description: The nearby Walmart has signs for no overnight parking, but this place doesn’t! I saw two other campervans here but they left before I woke up at 10:30 :) Big rigs and trailers will have trouble, it’s a small lot, but camper vans or similar will be fine for one night! If here in the winter, park where you won’t block snow plows from clearing the lot.

name: Building next to burger king/gas station
description: Water spigot on the backside of the little strip mall. Businesses weren't open so we couldn't call and ask for permission.

name: Peralta pullout
description: Quiet, not quite level, plenty of room. Only wildlife was a big old longhorn cow who checked on us after sunset. Lots of other options along this road. Saturday morning this road was quite busy early with day hikers heading out to Wave Cave or Peralta, so it was worth it to try to be a little off the road or hidden.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: RV spots in the back. Well lit but a little out in the open. They don’t mind overnights campers and rv’s.

name: Wal-Mart
description: Busy walmart, bring ear plugs and sleep mask. many rigs and cars here this morning. some ran generators all night, nd there is a "Thank you for shopping at Walmart" message that plays over the whole parking lot every ten minutes.

name: Big Bend Dump and Water
description: There is a dump water and trash located at the big Bend campground and for $10 you can do all three things very nice design.

name: Trinity river access
description: Huge area by the river. Good views and quiet

name: Black Creek Ravines Conservation Area
description: Hose with pottable water in parking area. hiking trails for walking and horses.

name: The dirt road
description: Nice little spot. No “no overnight parking” signs. Right by beach. It’s a dirt road to a sandy spot. Cars can pass by and see you, but you can also pull in behind trees on the left side.

name: Tyee Recreation Site
description: Perfect little campground right on the Umpqua river. Very clean vault toilets, drinking water spigots. $14/night.  no hook ups but plenty space for RVs.

name: Love’s gas station
description: $14 showers, good and clean. towels provided with unlimited time at the Loves Gas Station

name: I 81 west rest area
description: i 81 W rest area. Spent the night here in our van. Bathrooms, recycling, dog walk, big rig and car parking, 3 bars Verizon, dog walk but covered in snow.

name: Camp spot outside Big Pine
description: A sweet little spot down a dirt road directly adjacent to the highway. There are a couple of spots all along the road, relatively flat. The highway is close, but traffic is fairly light, especially in the evening. Beautiful views of the Sierras and the town below.

name: Torry island campground
description: Busy campground with canal front sites on peninsula fingers where campers can pull up to their site by boat with quick access to lake okeechobee.

name: Public Boat Ramp and fishing pier
description: The most beautiful place! 2.5 miles off the highway. Got 3 bars of Verizon LTE. Beautiful moss trees , lots of space for rigs. Lake access

name: Valley of the gods outlook
description: Large site with fire pit that has expansive views but is exposed to winds

name: Herdsman Motor CO
description: The technicians are professional and knowledgeable on many vehicle types, small cars to to commercial trucks and RVs.  They have some experience with European expedition trucks like MAN, MB, Iveco.  They have been in business for over 30 years. I highly recommend them. Located just behind the car wash which they also own.

name: Behind Coin Laundry
description:
In key largo there is a popular divers direct store, the parking lot is huge, towards the end of the strip mall there is a coin laundry with parking spots behind it tucked away. super quiet, no hassles. nothing beautiful but nice place to stop if need be. 

you can also connect to the free wifi of the coin laundry place. phone is like a bar or two but laptop was okay.

name: Tin Valley Campground
description:
Super quiet, private and dark; lots of stars .. privately owned place by Ronda. Several RV campsites or retro airstreams and busses for rent. Electric hook-ups. Water and sewer is available but not at the sites.
Picknick tables and bbqs and fire rings.
The spot we stayed in was fenced in case you have a dog.
Ronda is Super friendly.
There are cats, dogs, chickens, pot belly pigs and a burro; all a small walk away from the RV spots.
We paid $30 a night for electric. She wants to do monthly also and has email and telephone: Ronda Haberer. Tinvalleyretrorentals@gmail.com
432-446-1011.
She is on maps.me with Tin Valley! Google and Imaps send you to the wrong place, so call or email here, she has a detailed easy map description to get there.. would surely recommend. She is 5 miles from the back entrance to Big Bend on dirt road or 38 miles if you prefer paved road. Lots of hiking!

name: Deen's Landing
description: Overnight rest stop maintained by county on Altamaha River with restroom, picnic tables and gorgeous view.

name: Rest Area Water Spigots
description: A few of them are positioned close to the parking spots.  Just need your own hose.  There was a spigot in the back car lot that had orange water coming out from rust.

name: Uphill Public Parking Lot
description:
Public parking lot close to historic downtown
Only a few cars around, as it’s uphill from the town area
In a Class B and stayed overnight without issue

name: Picnic Area Water Spigot
description: Close to parking area near Cool River Tubing Picnic Area.  Need a hose.

name: Free Street Parking
description:
Noisy from all the shops but awesome spot!
No signs restricting overnight parking
Probably best to be low key at night

name: Drinking Water Spigot & Fountain
description:
Drinking water spigot & fountains
I filled my 40 gal water tank and had no issues with attaching my hose and using the spigot
Broome Lane Trailhead - Spanish Moss Trail
Park in the closest spot to the handicapped space
There’s also a Port a potty here, did not use it so can’t speak for the cleanliness
Awesome trail, super dog friendly!

name: Concho Recreation Area
description: Free camping by a small lake: it has small campsites, and a medium size parking lot made of mixed hard dirt and gravel. campsites are good for tents and passenger vehicles. My 22' TT fit on the side of the parking lot, I wouldn't bring bigger than that or you'll block the exits. No amenities, but very quiet at night and relatively clean. You can hike around the lake, a couple miles if you like. 3 bars Verizon

name: Lake Ponchartrain beach lot
description: Nice parking lot right on the lake! Great phone signal and feels safe. Spent two nights here

name: Road to BLM campsites
description: The camping area cell service was to spotty and very uneven so drove out and parked on shoulder of road to camping.

name: Small clearing with fire ring
description:
Not far from the highway, you can still hear the cars in the distance.
There are 2 houses just down the road.
In a small bit of State Trust Land surrounded by private land.
There was already a small established fire ring and some wood.
Had 2 bars LTE cell reception with T-Mobile.

name: Trout Creek Rd campsite
description: A little offshoot with space for a few vans and two fire rings already here. Kind of lumpy, but can get really level with a little maneuvering.

name: NF-2027 pullout
description: At an intersection with a blocked off old road, enough room for one, maybe two close vans. a little sloped downhill but laterally flat. No traffic in the afternoon/evening and only two trucks at about 9am. Nice little coffee walk up the blocked trail to a lookout over the little canyon.

name: Winslow Visitor’s Center
description: Parking lot that you could pull into for the night.  Just north of the train tracks. Train runs all night, but could sleep through the noise.

name: $5 arco rv dump
description: 5$ for dump station, no rinse water. Potable water on west side of building. Could probably get water for free if you aren’t using the dump station

name: State Trailer Supply
description:
The folks here are knowledgeable, kind, and efficient. They installed a base plate on our Smart Car, wired it and installed the battery disconnect. Their prices are reasonable and they are thorough with their work and explanations. Highly recommend. Ask for Steve - he will take care of you!

Bonus: They also fill propane here and there’s a free dump station!

name: Saguaro National Park
description: This is free camping in the Saguaro National Park. It is up a mountain road. The road is rough but we made it in a Nissan Rogue and we saw smaller cars than us make it up the road. The first time we came was on a Friday and it was packed. We came again on Sunday and a few spots had opened up. No facilities and a good deal of traffic, but the view is spectacular. We had okay signal through Cricket.

name: mountaintop on nf-2375
description: A nice level site way up high on what appears to be a very rarely travelled forest road. solitude.  I used 4x4 as the road is steep and rough in places.  If you can get here you will love it.

name: Sycamore camp
description: Passed by this spot on my way back from childs camp. Few fire rings nestled among some large sycamores in a creek. Water not flowing. No amenities. Camping allowed all year. Pack it in pack it out.

name: Tractor supply co
description: Easy place to fill up propane tanks. Can drive threw.

name: Bosque Redondo Park
description: Small park with established picnic areas, portapotties. Very clean, small lake. Nice stroll around the lake. Two bars of T-Mobile. No real signage allowing overnight camping, but a local suggested it to us as a good spot. It was great. Be sure to check out the Billy the Kid museum in town.

name: shell gas station
description: $2.51 per gal July 3, 2021. Ask for someone at the Shell gas station across the street.

name: Sportsman's Warehouse Parking Lot
description: I called ahead and was told it was okay to park overnight. It was reasonably quiet for a parking lot. No services, but there are plenty of shops and gas stations nearby. I stayed here in a small van camper and was not disturbed. It's a change of pace if you're going to be staying in the area for a couple of days and don't want to park at Walmart every night.

name: Up the hill from Lone Pine - Great View
description: This is just East of Lone Pine.  Views of the valley.  Dirt road in good shape.  Can fit any size rig

name: NW Vegas Easy Street 1 or 2 Nighter
description: This is just off the freeway boondocking spot.  Easy on/off access.  Big rig compatible.  Lot's of food options in walking distance.  4/5g cell service.  Will be good to stealth it for a night or two if you're passing through and need a quick free spot to lay low.

name: Quiet NW Street Stealth Free
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

This is a free quiet place to stealth boondock for the night.  I'm just trying to get some free options out there for people.  I live in the area.

name: FS-1004 - Spur off FS Road
description: In the Siuslaw NF just outside of the town of Beaver. Mostly flat spot large enough for a camper van or short RV, fire ring. Ok morning sun for solar/south aspect partially shaded by trees. Some trash. Quiet during the week with a few cars going by on the weekend. 4 bars on Tmobile.

name: Parking Lot
description: This is a business complex parking lot in an industrial area. No amenities connected to this parking lot. It's easy to access from the highway, and any size rig would fit here. However due to the fact it is a business parking lot please be respectful. Great for one night. It is safe and quiet but there is a little bit of noise from the highway. Definitely safer and less people around than downtown. Roughly a 25 minute drive to downtown riverwalk or 15 to the airport. There is also a Walmart and other gas stations about 5 minutes away. Full T-Mobile signal.

name: Arkansas Campground
description: Arkansas campground in Lake Pueblo State Park.  Established campground, level asphalt pads, picnic tables, Sun shelters, bathrooms, 30 and 50 amp electric hook ups.  Freshwater, dump station. Location overlooks Lake Pueblo and marina.  Plentiful mountain biking trails nearby.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel parking lot allows overnight stay. they have a dedicated section for rv's and camper vans.

name: Walmart Supercenter
description: Nice quiet Walmart parking lot. No signs restricting overnight parking. I stayed here without any trouble. There were four big rigs parked overnight with me.

name: Water Tap outside of OMBU restaurant
description: There is a water tap on the outside of this building located to the left of the Korean BBQ joint. I would recommend using this late at night as it’s in a busy shopping center

name: Maverik Gas Station
description: Very nice pump with a hose nozzle attachment. It is located near the RV and truck fill up to the back right of the gas station. There is also a very very nice Smiths Marketplace located directly behind this location.

name: Little Butte dirt road
description: Great site. Just before road is closed. Nestled in the trees, fire ring, lots of places to roam. Several sites down this road. Internet in and out, tmobile.

name: Sweetheart Overlook
description: Great overlook with amazing sunset views. Large enough for multiple cars, decent cellular coverage.

name: Service Road 340
description: Service road ends in a small loop. 2wd chevy express had no trouble, but it does cross a stream which would be unaccessible during rains. No services at all, and too much trash; but the forest is thick here. No tmobile service, 2 bars lte of straight talk.

name: Edistos Gas
description: You can refill propane at this location, right before entering the Great Smokies. Call ahead to make sure someone is available to help you.

name: Amerigas
description: Propane refill is available at this location. Price is reasonable. They only take credit, no cash.

name: Davis Service center
description: Motorcycle, ATV, UTV, Snowmobile Sales, Parts and Service. Open Monday through Saturday. Dealer for Honda, Kawasaki, KTM, Suzuki and Yamaha

name: Industrial side street parking
description: Very quiet at night on a long street. We stayed two nights and left during the day. Small businesses along part of the road so employees show up after 7am. Felt safe. Had no trouble with anyone. Very WIDE road.  Can fit any size rig.  We were able to get water from a spigot at a building in the culdesac

name: McCoy Creek Campground
description: Camp spots for tent camping and RV'S, with several pull thru sites. Stayed here 2 nights the week after Labor day. Some of the cleanest pit toilets I have ever experienced. Each site has a bear box, fire ring and picnic table. Very well kept campground. Beautiful views of Palisades Reservoir (was low when we were there) and surrounding mountains. $14 dollars a day. Highly recommend.

name: Canton Lake, Big Bend campground
description: site A50 with electric 30 amp and water, close to the lake

name: Street parking
description: Free street parking in residential area. No parking allowed only on Wednesday mornings 8am-11am for street sweeping. This spot is next to some small apartment buildings. Area feels very quiet and very safe, and is only a few blocks away from Koreatown. The spot I’m in isn’t particularly level, I need to sleep diagonally on my bed, but that’s the only con. If I had had the energy, I would have kept driving around in this neighborhood looking for something more level. But it’s not too bad.

name: Kolob canyon visitor center
description: Right off the highway 15. Potable water spigot.

name: Craggy wash
description:
BLM land. great spot. 3 miles in 4 wd might be needed. road a little soft . Great at&t service.
Great area, well worth the drive up the washboard trail to here. This is not the only spot in this area. If it is taken, look around for lots nice spots. Try further ahead, or try turning right at this junction, there are some nice spots 100m down the trail on the high ground with great views.

name: Walmart Okeechobee
description: Parked near the auto center and was able to connect to the Walmart WiFi. Wasn’t bothered and didn’t see any signs.

name: Co-op
