description: Good country service. $2.79 per gallon as of Feb 2021.

name: Open lot
description: Camped here last night after seeing Love's parking lot totally full. Under the overpass and the connecting lot. No issues. There were other trucks parked here as well. Close to gas and McDonald’s too.

name: Street parking
description: Quiet residential streets with no restrictions

name: Brookling
description: We camp out here for a night. Big parking spots in front of the church. At night is a little loud and people walking by but we sleep well. The spot is close to the highways and the neighborhood seems sketchy at first but chill at night.

name: Eddie World
description: Gas station with HUGE snack selection, restaurants, vegan options, water tap.

name: Isle of Capri Casino and Hotel
description: Huge parking lot!  They have an RV lot here with hook-ups for $$.  We did not need hookups, so asked permission to spend the night in the parking lot.  No problem!  Very quiet at the far end of the lot (near the berm).  Lot is well lit and security drives thru all night.  Felt very safe and comfortable spending the night here.

name: Pull out
description: Descent sized pull out on the way in to Garibaldi. No signs that say 'no overnight parking'. Pretty quiet at night. Lots of traffic in the morning. Good place to stay one night and move on. 2 bars of T-mobile, 3 bars of Verizon.

name: Air Park Recreation Center
description: Free Wifi at the Air Park Recreation Center.

name: Daylight Pass Road
description:
Random turn-off for OHV road. Sign indicates 4x4 - high clearance and allows for camping after first mile. No fires. No toilets. 

Some extremely rocky parts I definitely wouldn’t try without A/T tires. Didn’t explore much and found a turn off just after the first mile. Quiet. Clean. Very scenic up off of Daylight Pass Rd. Perfect crash site between Death Valley NP and Rhyolite. I slept in the truck, ground and spiky bushes would probably make getting a tent down pretty rough.

name: Dirty Socks Hot Springs
description: interesting place but we didn't go in the springs.  water is cool and very slimey and full of algae.  you can't see the bottom.  but, it's an isolated area and so far we haven't been bothered.

name: Walter’s Camp Road BLM
description: Dirt hard packed road off HWY 78. Just a 1/4 mile or so off the main road. WiFi open spot that would accommodate any large vehicles. Quiet. No one else around. Further down the road there were no other accessible pull off without risking a sand/stuck vehicle. Good cell phone service with Sprint.

name: Butterfly Meadows campground on road 209F.
description:
There are three campsites. All can accommodate a few vehicles or pull behinds. Near a river. All sites are surrounded by tall overgrown field. Nice area. Has a port-a-potty. One bar of Verizon 1x. 

Gates blocking the entrance. not sure if it's normal to block entrance later in the season. further up the road there is an open BLM free, 14 Day stay limit, campground with 6 or so campsites where we stayed. it's about a mile further up the same road

name: Fish creek Rd campsites
description: There is a large campsite that can accommodate two or three RVs or large pull behinds. There is also a smaller spot for one or two vehicles. A couple of spots can accommodate a single vehicle. There is access to the river via a 100 yard trail with a couple of fire rings back there. No Verizon service but spotty, weak T-Mobile service near the river.

name: Open campsite at fork of FR 415 and 1124
description: Large campsite for lots of tents, trailer or self contained. Very well shaded so lots of trees for hammocks. No cell signal, no water source, dig your own toilet or bucket. About 40 minute drive from Logan Canyon, very dusty.

name: Dirt road campsite
description: You turn off the main road (Skyline) onto this smaller dirt road. Recent windstorm has tree debris along road. This spot is big enough for a few vehicles but not a large level spot. Great view of the valley. No cell reception.

name: Black water park Dump Station
description: Came here as a last resort (not many dump stations in NW FL). The ranger let us in the gate just to use the dump station no charge. Not sure if that’s how it always is but we came right at closing time and then left

name: Olustee Historic Battleground
description: There are picnic tables and free water faucets to fill up tanks.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel - allows overnight parking. Called and asked first, they said it was okay "for one night". Lots of other vans and RVs when we arrived at 8pm. No perfectly level spots but good enough.

name: Warm Mineral Springs Park
description: Great spot to spend the day. $20 per adult entry to a natural mineral spring where you can swim or sit on the grass and relax. Plenty of room for all size rigs. Includes access to bathrooms with full indoor showers. No overnight parking but again, great spot for the day. ATT reception is good.

name: War Veterans Memorial Park
description: Great spot for day parking. Quiet park, has bathrooms. There are water spigots throughout, only some are accessible from parking spots (25' hose worked but it was tight). A ton of wildlife to watch, the raccoons are cute. Try to find Pepe the rooster near the kayak launch!

name: Robe Lake
description:
Feel like I stumbled on a hidden gem. 
The wind at other Valdez camp spots was a bit out of control so I decided to head out of town, but stopped by Robe Lake to check it out before I left. It’s perfect! 
Killer view, quiet from road, no ‘no overnight’ sign (that I see), and no one else here. To me, this is exactly what I’m after!
Enjoy! Keep it clean and legit. I’d love for this place to exist if I ever find myself in Valdez again.

name: Powder Mill Campground
description:
8 camp spots beside the Current River. I don’t see a bathroom anywhere though. 
The sign reads FREE until April 15, 2021 (over a $5.00/night sign) due to reduction in services. The place is nice though. If it was later in the day, I’d stay, but I’ve got my eye on another iOverlander camp spot. 
Enjoy! Happy travels!

name: Clarksville Aquatics Center
description:
I’m not sure if it’s always free, but I did not get charged and I just scored a great shower here. They checked my temp as I walked in and masks were worn. It was great and now I feel fresh! 
Thanks Clarksville!

name: Lake Martin
description: I was disturbed to see No Trespassing when I first arrived. I checked the map and reread the other spot on iOverlander to realize this was the spot, but I almost left. Assuming the app loads it in correctly, this is the true spot between the lake and river. It is peaceful and quiet, though I am having a few battles against mosquitos, but that’s probably to be expected on warm weather. It’s also 80 degrees in late October so no complaints here. Ha

name: Cock&Bull Farmhouse
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
Working farmhouse. Artisanal bagels , pretzels. Award winning meatballs. Over 700 beers, wines, cider, kombucha. Please call ahead for availability. Limited electric available.

name: Wolf creek campground
description:
Lovely campground with tent site, pull through and electric and water. Crystal clear creek and super quiet. 
Playground horseshoe disc golf. Wooded with plenty of separation.

name: Minits
description: Coin operated laundromat in mini mall by  gas station. Many machines; 50lbs, 30lbs and 10lbs washers and a wall of big dryers. Typical older laundromat. Could be cleaner but does the job.

name: Rock Dump
description:
Just off the road, spent night here with a 32 foot trailer and small horse trailer.  Yes we are traveling with a pony. 

1 night here so far, quiet but little dumpy as the locals come here to rock climb and dump trash.

name: Sammie’s Pizza
description: Amazing local little family run cafe! If you are willing to be patient- the pizza is amazing and made from scratch (hence the need for patience) and the milkshakes were some of the best I’ve ever had (Raspberry delight was soooo good). It was lovely 10/10

name: Meyer Campground
description: Nice old time RV resort. Seems like it has all the amenities including a small camp store. Friendly. They let us pull up and park in a non-designated spot overlooking the water, probably because there were only a few other campers and we didn’t need any hook ups. One bar of T-mobile. Imagine bugs would be bad in the summer, only a few mosquitoes now. Would return. $20/night

name: Bieber Unified School
description: Safe place to sleep on the way Death Valley NP.

name: BLM land by Arkansas River
description: Unpaved road off of Hwy 24 and Elephant Rock Lane. I came here late February and there was a decent amount of snow on the ground. I made it down to the campsite just fine in my 2WD RAM Promaster, but headed back out you will need chains because of the snow and slush. It doesn’t appear to have snowed in a few days, so this may be inaccessible if a large snowfall just occurred.

name: Poague Conservation Area
description: Beautiful place to stay for the night right off 7. Good AT&T service, 3 bars of 4g in some places. Camping allowed in designated parking areas. Hiking, fishing, and boating allowed in certain places. Absolutely stunning swamp area. Fire pit. Do your part and pick up your trash and other's trash to protect this gorgeous conservation area.

name: Kremmling Water Sales Station
description:
Potable water can be hard to come by along this stretch of the upper Colorado River!

Pay for water spigot. 25¢ for 2.5 min which is appropriately 25 gallons according to the sign. Bring your own hose.

name: Loggy Bayou Wildlife Management Area (WMA)
description:
Camping is allowed in Loggy Bayou WMA.  This is a camping area with gravel pads suitable for big rigs. The road coming in was well-maintained, narrow, 2 lane, unpaved. It is beautiful, very secluded, bona-fide Louisiana bayou camping. Free! 
2 bars AT&T LTE

name: Peach Valley
description: This is an OHV area that offers camping with pit toilets, grills and awnings

name: Mount Ord
description:
small site for a van or truck at 5600 ft overlooking a mountain range.  there was a fire up here in 2016.  take the road all the way up to the lookout and the view of lake. not for huge rigs or 2wd in wet conditions..
PACK IN, PACK OUT!!

name: Hyalite Canyon Parking Lot
description: First big parking lot before going into Hyalite Canyon. Most people begin their carpools into the canyon here. Had a couple of teenagers pull in playing their loud music and revving the engine around 10pm but they left quickly.  Otherwise, a good night.  No signs prohibiting overnight parking. One bar of Verizon service. Plenty of room.

name: Kodachrome Campground
description: The best campground showers I’ve ever seen. It was like I was walking into a spa. Super clean, nice tile work, rain shower head with separate detachable shower head. You’ll have to pay the $10 entrance fee and then an extra $1 for the shower if you’re not camping. No time limit. If you’ve been on the road for awhile.. Worth it.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Nice quite safe place to stay for the night! Just don’t be the guy that parks sideways and takes up 5 spots! Be courteous people!

name: Bolivar beach
description: Nice free spot on the beach just before the Bayou. Busy on the weekend, but still nice. There was one night where trucks came at 3 in the morning and did donuts in the sand by us, otherwise no other problems. Good Verizon reception (with a booster).

name: AZ State Trust Land
description: There are a bunch of primitive camping spots on this dirt road. You need an AZ State Trust permit technically, but we never saw a ranger come through. A year permit is only $20. Anyways, we’ve loved this spot! You can have fires on trust land if it’s not explicitly marked that you can’t. The spots are large and can easily fit 3 vans. The first two pull offs are easy to get to, the rest of the road is a little rough but we did it and have seen plenty of other vans go down the road. It’s a really beautiful spot!

name: Johns Peak
description:
Flat area, great view.
Established fire ring. Very quiet except howling coyotes all night. No light pollution. Cell service for map updates and travel planning.

name: White Reef Trailhead
description: Water spigot and pit toilet outside of RedCliffs Recreation Area. *Caution, 11ft clearance one lane pass though on the way in.

name: Flower Pot road
description: An informal site with a circular road. Level and easy access. About 0.5 mile from I17. Bumpy gravel for just a little bit, nothing bad for our 18 travel trailer. Just a little traffic noise, otherwise quiet. Occasional local traffic. We would stay here again.

name: Beautiful overlook
description: The most beautiful place I have ever open my back doors to my van to

name: Tackle Shop / Rest rooms
description: Water taps for class B’s only - connected to the restrooms. Larger vehicles would not be able to turn around in the lot leading to fishing pier.

name: Amelia Island State Park Beach Parking Lot
description: Water spigot behind small building at entrance of parking lot. Just filled up here!

name: Chevron propane bulk
description: $3.25/gal but there is a $14.99+tax minimum charge per sign, but operator did not charge me that.  Will fill tank on your rv.

name: Claiborne Lake Dam West near Silver Creek Park
description: Spacious park by the dam. Pit toilets, trash cans, and picnic tables. A little trashed, but not near as bad as I've seen. One other van here, besides that it just fishermen in the morning and 4 wheelers coming trough in the afternoon. No signage anywhere, but we didn't have any problems in our two nights. One tiny bar of tmobile 4g LTE and decent LTE for straight talk

name: Davis Service Center
description: Motorcycle Dealer, Sales, Parts, Service. Dealer for Honda, Kawasaki, KTM, Suzuki, Yamaha Open Monday -Saturday

name: Camping World near Memphis, TN
description: Spent a good restful night here.  Asked staff for permission and was cheerfully granted.

name: Gunsight Wash BLM Area
description: Free RV, car, and van camping. Stay limit 14 days. Pack it in pack it out. No facilities. Fire rings. Road in good condition. Many big rigs and a few vans. Many spots 50+. Road in mostly great condition. Spots go back for a mile or so. Little library near gate for book exchange. Some residents set up hummingbird feeders. Close to Organ pipe and Why. Enjoy!

name: Osborne Wash on Shea Road
description: Large gravel area with multiple fire rings along Shea Road. Some areas are a little Sandy bit nice area for big rigs, fifth wheels and our class A motorhome. Great cell coverage, antennas at top of mountain but if you drive half more you lose all coverage att and version. Tons of off road trails for Jeep’s and ATV’s

name: Shell Gas Station Water Pump
description: Great water spigot with blue handle near the RV/ Truck pumps. It has a threaded nozzle for hoses. Dump is easily accessible with non potable water.

name: Home Depot
description: Myself and my friend are traveling in our skool buses and so far have spent one week camping in the parking lot of Home Depot in the most northwest part of the lot. A cashier told us other vehicles have stayed overnight here and we saw plenty of other people overnighting in their vehicles or leaving their vehicles parked here and going elsewhere. Police regularly patrol the lot and neighboring streets but we were’t questioned or hassled. This is a beautiful town and the parking lot has awesome mountain and palm tree views!

name: Tower Market Gas Station
description:
Free Water fill station in main parking lot.
located inside Black metal cage (free standing) road side of lot. combined with air station dispenser.

name: Craggy Wash 2mile
description: great location, was still busy in Feb. good Verizon and TMobile cell signal. nice views.

name: Walmart
description: Standard Walmart overnight. Seems flatter off to the right. Was able to piggy back on their wifi. 1-2 bars  of verizon. Big rig could fit although the access road in a little sketchy.

name: Veterans Memorial Park, Tupelo MS
description: Spent a nice quiet night here and slept well.  Called the Tupelo Parks & Rec dept yesterday (googled for phone number).  Asked for permission to spend the night.  Were told, "no one's ever asked that before, but I don't see why not.  Stay In the parking lot by the Aquatic Center."  We made sure we told the lady behind the counter inside Aqua Ctr that we were there and what we were doing.  While center was open, we had access to toilets.  Very nice stay!

name: Lowes
description: park in evening .10 pm quiet. leave rested too. but sheriffs enforce ordinance at other places. best to ask. do business. park far from store..

name: Hidden Redden
description: No homes were ever developed on Reddent Ct, so you have a hidden cul-de-sac surrounded by forest with some views of the surrounding hills and ocean.  Best to be discreet coming and going as other iOverlander users have been politely asked to leave from other locations in Shelter Cove, but these were on dead-ends with nearby residences.

name: Confluence of North and East Forks, Trinity River
description: 3-4 sites all in the vicinity of the confluence, BLM land. The exact coordinates is a flat spot tucked off the road with a trail to some beautiful turquoise pools in a rocky canyon. Across the street are some flat spots at what appears to be the foundation of an old homestead with apple trees.

name: NF Pull Out
description: All the other spots were taken so after some exploring I found this pull out. It’s right on the road but maybe 4 cars passed all day.

name: Picnic Area
description: Picnic area along I10, highway noise but a good place to rest or spend the night. Lots of parking. Cell service is adequate on Verizon and AT&T.

name: Fort Sage OHV (Free) - Diamondback TH
description:
Free camping at this BLM OHV trailhead. Three sites with picnic tables, fire rings, and BBQ grills. One pit toilet (very clean!), trash cans, and an off-loading ramp for OHVs. There are another six sites at the Fort Sage TH but this one was closer to the hwy and has great views. Far enough from the road so no highway noise but we

 could occasionally hear a train in the distance. Very quiet and peaceful at night. OHV trails go all around here so it would probably be noisier when it's busier/weekend. 14 day camping limit and need a permit from BLM for a campfire. 4 bars LTE on Tmobile.

To get here: From U. S. Highway 395 turn East on Laver Crossing road (0 .8 miles north of Doyle) and travel 1.4 miles to Hackstaff Road. Turn south (right) and travel approximately 1.2 mile to Fort Sage Road. Turn east (left) travel 1.1 mile to the entrance of the Fort Sage OHV Area. Turn east (right) and travel about 1 mile to the Diamondback trailhead, the Fort Sage trailhead is .05 miles up the road.

name: Jefferson Municipal Lot
description: This is a lovely little parking lot in a small town. It has picnic seating, a good amount of spots, and is right across from the police station. We stayed here from midnight to 8 with the only disturbance being a train that passed through once or twice. It’s not the most quiet spot, but for a one night stay, it was wonderful.

name: Big Cracker Barrel Parking Lot
description:
After failing to find anywhere to stay in Sanibel island we drove inland and found this Cracker Barrel. It has a big parking lot, lots of open spaces round the back. It’s quiet, some road noise but nothing crazy. 
Very easy stopover.

name: Tullahassee Loop Recreation Area
description: Very nice area next to the river. There is plenty of spots to park. Formal fire pits with grates at each site. Pit toilets. Free for up to 14 days.

name: Aspen Grove Rv Park
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
Over night or weekly rv park, with full hook ups at every site. Both 30 and 50amp connections at each site. Sites are very large, with concrete pads 70' - 100' long, and 24' wide. Each site is 40' from pedestal to pedestal with grass at each site. Great for big rigs. No tent camping. Onsite showers, bathrooms and laundry facilities.

name: murphy and walmart
description: Water spigot at the Murphy gas station. I stayed overnight at the Walmart too without issues.

name: Siskiyou Fork USFS Dispersed
description: Beautiful flat spot along the river, clean and peaceful. Gravel road in, a little steep on the last spur road to the spot and a bit muddy if it has recently rained. Most vehicles can make it with careful driving, but high clearance recommended. Water has a nice turquoise color due to the local serpentine deposits.

name: Siskyou Fork meadows
description: Large clearing next to the river with many flat areas to camp. High clearance definitely needed to get here, 4x4 recommended, but careful driving can get you here without it if it hasn't rained recently. High top vehicles not recommended unless you don't mind limb scratches. Pretty spot out in the mountains.

name: Rest Area/Florida Welcome Center
description: Rest area just across the Florida State line along US231

name: Alum Trailhead
description: Pull off for the Alum Trailhead. Room for a few big rigs right along the road. There’s a dirt road you can drive on in addition to the pull off, not sure how far it goes or where it leads. Would not recommend driving on that road unless you have a 4WD, high clearance vehicle. Gorgeous views. The trail goes about 1.25 miles downhill to Gila River, where there are tent camping sites: one right next to the river and a few more along the path to the bridge.

name: Snow Eagle Brewery & Pub
description:
Small lot next to the brewery. I asked the bartender for permission and he said it was no problem. Full strength on both Verizon and AT&T. Good for a night. 
Food and beer were good in the brewery. There is also a sushi restaurant attached. I did not try the sushi.

name: Cottonwood Canyon State Park
description: Rest rooms with showers, 4 rental cabins, established walking/bicycle trails.. Fishing, nestled along side the John Day River. Camping first come first server, no reservations..

name: Fox Hill Road pull off
description: Pullout off of Fox Hill Road. Nothing fancy except the view. Great cell reception. Good for a night.

name: Corrals & Tanks
description: Nice campsite by an old corral and empty water tank. 3 bars Verizon signal and quiet at night.

name: Perryville Road Dead End
description: This is a dead end road with a large gravel area next to it and behind the barriers. There are a few semis here tonight. Seems like a good stop for a quiet night.

name: Off Dubinky Well Road
description:
Open area with a rock fire circle. Little
Higher ground.

name: Midvale Hill Rest Area
description: Rest area with nice heated bathrooms. Mostly level. Ranger lives onsite. 2 bars Verizon.

name: Little Tennessee River Roadside
description: Peaceful pull-off alongside little Tennessee river. Stayed 2 nights. We saw many locals and fishermen drive by throughout the day time (less than 20), never bothered at night. Fairly level ground, no signage about overnight parking or camping, saw another car stay the night up the road. 8 mbps download, 1.2 mbps upload with booster on Verizon. 3.4 & .21 with no booster.

name: Bighorn Mountain Biking
description: Bike Rentals on location across the street from Moab's most popular trail system "The Moab Brand Trails". Beginner friendly - Family friendly - beginner, intermediate and advanced trails all in one trail system. Guided tours available. Call ahead or book in advance.

name: Parking area
description: Parking area on I-10. 24 hours parking permitted. Plenty of space for rigs of all sizes. Lighted. Free. Interstate traffic noise.

name: Coconino NF Secluded Campsite
description:
From frontage Rd of I-40 take 171 north. Turn right onto Rd. 9001. Follow this all the way until it ends. Continue to veer right at a couple of rd. forks you come across.
I made this in a modified 2wd 4Runner. High-clearance definitely suggested and just take your time.
Stayed here 10 days and only saw one other vehicle, which turned around and left. Great breeze during the hot days. perfect area for a short walk to an overlook.

name: Snake River Rest Area I-84 Eastbound
description: First eastbound rest area in Idaho after Oregon. Mild noise from highway. Max stay 10 hours. Porta Potties outside. Nice view of Snake River.

name: NO OVERNIGHT IN COUNTY
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced

name: NO OVERNIGHT IN COUNTY
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced

name: NO OVERNIGHT IN COUNTY
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced

name: Tubac dry camp
description: Closest free camp to Tubac. Welcomes birders. State land, common to see hunters in season. No fire rings or anything. Good for one night. Some highway noise. Likely more spots down the road.

name: Old Hickory Dam
description: Spent a quiet, restful night here at the public parking lot.  The area is well used by fishermen, but they all left by evening.  There is a 5th wheel all set up and I thought it was maybe a security guard.  But the couple left around 5pm and, when I asked if I would park overnight they told me they had no jurisdiction and they don't care.  They said they doubted that anyone would bother us, and no one did.  There are restrooms here, but closed at the moment for winter.

name: Near London Bridge
description: This little area of shops by the beautiful London bridge is both dog friendly and has free WiFi. I believe it is called the Island Mall. Coordinates take you to parking lot.

name: Near dam
description:
great spot right by the water near the dam. 
pros: secluded, nobody was here except us for miles. pretty cool spot! 
cons: a lot of trash! smelly next to the water. Gnats at night. 
Overall we stayed for 1 night and liked it! 
Had no problem getting our 24 ft rv in here!

name: Hueco Tanks State Park and Historical Site
description: There is a campground at the park but a ranger told us it was o.k. to park along the wide area along the road outside the park gates but not where it says "No Parking." Park further along the road. Room for one or two small or one large RV. No services but we got pretty good Verizon signal at the park. Free (31.905417 -106.04845)

name: Steen Road pull offs
description: Beautiful place in the utah desert. A few nice pull offs on a fairly nice dirt road. beware of cows in the road :) Accessable by almost any vehicle. Private Property signs and a fence on the right side of the road for a bit, but most of the road seems friendly to campers. 3 bars LTE of whatever service I have.

name: Wahoo Seafood
description: This is a truck parking spot behind Wahoo Seafood and Holiday Inn shared by 2-3 motels in the location. Only 2 trucks here on a Friday night, very quiet. 2 bars AT&T and 4 bars T-Mobile.

name: Walmart
description: I checked with staff to confirm overnight parking was okay, despite there being fellow RVers already in the lot.

name: Cave Valley CG
description: BLM campground with about 10 sites and pit toilet. Graveled roadway in campground. Verizon LTE with 2 x bars. Minimal shade.

name: Riverbend Hotsprings
description: About $80/night for a small RV park at the Riverbend hot springs. A splurge but worth it as your RV parking charges gets you access to the beautiful hot springs along the bank of the Rio Grande. Water, electric and dump hook ups, although so easily-accessible spigots for vans like ours with small internal water jugs. During non-COVID times, they have showers available. Not the most scenic place to park but the hot springs are gorgeous.

name: Sawyer Yards Art Campus
description: The back parking lot is huge and within walking distance of Buff Brew where we had drinks  and dinner in their outside dogs welcome area.  They brought our dog a water dish with ice.  There is a rock climbing gym and every second Saturday the doors of the art campus are open to visitors for free. Negative...right by a train track.. but we only heard it once.

name: North Palm Canyon fuel
description: Propane and diesel available here at North Palm Canyon.

name: Victoria Park. Palm Springs
description: Water spigot located between men and women’s bathroom, will need 50 foot hose plus needle nose plyers or square tool to turn on water spigot

name: Long Canyon hike trail head
description: Found the spot using satellite overhead map. The road seems to be well-maintained with plenty of pull off locations for camp. This is simply a great spot for overnight parking or making camp with no amenities. It appears that many have had camp fires out here

name: Bucklin Park
description: Must have a square key tool (found at Home Depot). Water spigot located on the exterior of the building. building is between the road and playground

name: Palo Verde County Park
description: This is a small park with room for larger rigs like mine 38 feet long, one other RV camping overnight here.  They have a fireplace just outside their rig with stones

name: Flying J
description:
At the truckstop area there are several hot and cold water spigots
Overnight parking.

name: Cracker Barrel parking lot
description: Stayed overnight here for one night, plenty of room for a vehicle 40 feet or less

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Was going to stay at the welcome center on I-22, but all the spots were very far from level. This Cracker Barrel was about 30 minutes up the road and located just off the highway in a nice little city. Plenty of gas, food, and grocery stores. This was probably my quietest night at a Cracker Barrel even with the highway about 80 yards from my spot. Had one other neighbor in a 22ft(ish) travel trailer and neither us were bothered. As always, I recommend parking as far away from the dumpsters as you can. Trash day sounds like an artillery strike at 3am.

name: Parking Lot near Walmart
description: Extra parking lot between Walmart and Ross. No one here. Stayed for 2 days and wasn’t bothered

name: Monroeville Walmart
description: Average Walmart experience. I don't think it's a 24 hour Walmart, but we weren't bothered for the night we stayed.

name: FR 607
description:
Campsite with fire ring off of Forest Road 607. Room for several vehicles but probably not possible to get a big rig into the site. Nice view of Tuscon down below and nice stars at night.

Very quiet and out of view of MT Lemon Hwy despite being so close.

Moderate Verizon 4G service. Intermittent AT&T service.

name: Toquerville Falls
description: Great spot for those with high clearance and 4wd. I did it in 2wd, and good tires. The falls themselves are amazing. Excellent photo op for your rig. Lots of side by side rigs and motorcycles use these trails. There’s about half dozen spots to pick from. All informal. Great swimming spot during the summer. Took about an hour to drive in.

name: Loves Truck Stop
description:
$10 Dump fee, however water is free at dump station. second water source across parking lot. 
be AWARE. Dump is on a dead end for those towing.

name: Boat ramp free water/shower
description: At the park there is a boat ramp. Next to it is a free outdoor shower and a hose to fill van/rv with water! You’re welcome!

name: Riverside Casino Dry Camping Campground
description:
So this isn’t a campground with hookups or anything but Riverside calls this their dry camping campground. It’s in the casino parking lot at the back where it is designated for RVers. You can stay for up to 14 days for free. 

When you arrive you will need to register with hotel registration. You are required to have a players card and provide your vehicle registration, insurance, ID, and your players card. Once you’ve checked in security will come out to inspect the outside of the RV to make sure there aren’t any leaks anywhere. 

There were some vans camping here also. There is also free WiFi. Riverside does have a more established campground across the street for $28+/night but this is free and it worked for us.

name: Helms Deep
description:
Good for taking shelter from strong wind. Decent shades from trees. Hiking opportunities. 

Bad for driving in with sparse campsites. In between ridges so it get cold, moist air at night. May not find a site in peak seasons. Muddy when wet. permit required between April to October. Cattle patties galore. No signal. Everything uphill from here on the highway was muddy from rain and snow. Road closeures into forest road. Lower Lake Mary was open but had snow and muddy conditions. Good luck in winter.

Would not recommend coming down this road for an overnighting.

name: GilaRivers Hotels & Casinos - Lone Butte location
description: Large, active casino just off the 10 freeway (220 highway). Well lighted, security and quite a lot of room. Sign says “24 hours maximum” but the word from security is that it is loosely enforced. In any case they say that one has to leave the property and immediately return to meet the rule. About as noisy as one would expect but free is the key. 5G and 3 solid bars on Verizon.

name: Maximo Park
description: Water located on 4 x 4 spigot is facing the water, city water.

name: Dump at Henderson State Park
description: Fee dump station at Henderson State Park. Was told on phone that it was $13, which includes day access to the park. Park has bathrooms.

name: Maggie’s Canyon Dry Camp
description: Large pullout that measures about 40 meters by 100 meters, only one fire ring. Good option for birding the Patagonia area. Forest service land. Free. Road crews are working on refining the road a little further up. It’ll be beautiful once done. East to do in a sedan. Road is good. Latch gate at highway. There is private land between here and the road, but just using the road to get to the forest service land is OK. Patagonia lake state park is gross and over run by cows and costs 15/20 dollars. Gross. Version three bars. Free!

name: Whittaker Swamp State Forest
description: Quiet pulloff from gravel state park road.  High and no sign of swamp

name: NFS Campground Road Turnout
description: This wild parking stop is 100 yards off lightly traveled route 125 on the 4-mile road leading to a National Forest Service campground.  A babbling stream is feet away.  The nearby Robert Frost parking lot  had "open dawn to dusk" and "no camping" signs so we were more comfortable boondocking here on our way to Burlington.

name: Cozy Hills Campground
description: This campground fills RV propane at a reasonable price

name: Menards
description: This and many Menard's fill RV LP tanks.

name: Mallards pond
description: Rougher entrance than Wilburton pond.  Very quite too

name: Leveled BLM lot just off RT 78
description: This area is quick and easy for any size vehicle on gravel. Its near the road so there is traffic noise.  Mobile phone connection is spotty but we connected with two bars LTE Verizon.

name: Howdy Ranch RV Park
description: LP sales when the technician is available

name: Ramsey Sunrise Camp
description: Forest service road, fire ring, good maintained one lane dirt road. Only cars/vans. The sunrise here is impeccable. Free. Three bars version LTE.

name: Canterbury Rest Area
description: Rest area off 93N. Lots of parking, clean restrooms, a little noisy from highway, but all in all no problems. Restroom and information hours are 9am-5pm Thursday-Monday, closed Tuesday and Wednesday. They have a couple of port-o-johns otherwise. Pet walking area

name: Mill Creek Camping Area
description: Camp area with a loop drive/parking. Fire pit and trash. Trail head. Located behind environmental building. Also down the road is Kiwani’s Park with ample parking and open space. Both locations are well enough off the road.

name: i90 Travel Center
description: Big truck stop with plenty of parking in the far back near the water tower. Easy to park in between unhooked trailers for extra privacy. Please be mindful of truckers since their rest time is regulated by law (I'm one of them).

name: Beaver Creek
description: Campground with pit toilets and water. Next to creek. $10/night.

name: Blue Star Propane
description: I get propane here all the time. Vehicle mounted tanks or bottles accepted. 2020 price was about $1.99/gal but 2021 been running $2.20/gal. Weekdays only!

name: Twice the Ice
description: water fill up and ice. 25 cents a gallon

name: Settlers Green
description: Excellent free public wifi next to Michael Kors

name: Forest service road
description: Forest service camp spot. Mountain views in every direction. A few large spots to accommodate any size rig. There are numerous boondocking areas along the main rd. No view of the lake from this one, but very beautiful surroundings. Great cell phone reception.

name: Desert Cypress
description: This is a nice commercial campground within walking distance of downtown Wickenburg. It’s a bit pricey but the showers are very good and it has a laundromat and hook ups are full water dump electricity. You do hear some Road noise at night and occasional train.  It can accommodate all size rigs but the time when we were there, there was only one spot available that was 34 feet long. we are a 25 foot truck camper so it worked for us. Cell service is good since you’re in the middle of the city.

name: Bird Key Park
description: Park that features a long path by the ocean (including underneath a long bridge), a hose connected to potable water perfect for filling up at, picnic tables and benches, and a parking lot with ocean views. Pet friendly park and sometimes dolphins can be seen (especially at sunset). Park is closed from 11pm-5am so I wouldn't recommend parking here overnight.

name: Thunderbird Inn
description: great bar with a few rv spots behind.  free. some first serve.

name: Fred Meyer
description: There is FREE water at the air pump near the gas station at Fred Meyer. It has a sign that says non potable, but the gas station attendant said that it is just city water; think they put that sign for liability. I drank it this weekend and was fine.

name: Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee
description:
this is located at the seminol casino east side of the parking lot on the immokalee reservation (no camping elsewhere on rez— please respect that!). you can stay for one to three nights. it is free but requires registration on a first-come-first-serve basis, offers over 10 spaces. i stayed in a full-size van.
in order to register you need to get a players card (free) and go to the security desk for permit. put your mask on and bring your ID and know your vehicle length and license plate. enter at the front, head to your left and keep going. it’s rather confusing and over-stimulating but soundproof headphones help a lot! the workers are very helpful if you get lost. get a players card and then go to the security desk and register! then you’ll get a yellow paper that you put in your windshield and you’re all set.
spots come with electrical hook ups, you’ll have to share with your neighbor.

name: Watermill Express
description: Watermill Express - 25 cents per gallon.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Parking lot. Good place to stay nice and quiet.  Great breakfast in the morning.  Enough room for vans and class B or small trailer.

name: Mittry Lake Maze
description: Large dispersed camping area near the lake. No view of the lake because of thick vegetation, but tons of campsites with good privacy from each other and the road. Just remember how you got in - the roads are a complete maze!

name: Marr Park Campground
description: County campground with RV and tent sites, shower house, dump station. No reservations. Costs $16 electric / $10 primitive per night.

name: Dump station
description: Free dump station. On street near motel.

name: Central Green Lot
description: Overnight parking is allowed on Saturday, Sunday, Tuesday, and Thursday nights. No camping. Parking spaces are fairly tight. 15 amp power in center median for engine block heaters. Businesses nearby and gets busy on week days.

name: Madera Canyon Proctor Rd Arizona
description: Ten unimproved and private sites. Very rough rocky access over stream will bounce stuff from your cabinets, for about 3 blocks. Scrubby trees and grasses. Open area with 50 mile view to the west over Green Valley, AZ etc. Very pretty at night with city lights and glorious brilliant stars. It is a nice quiet camp area. It is our second year. We saw many deer and some javelinas last year. There are cows and their calves and this year they were a great nuisance, wanting to take back "our" site. Our trailer and SUV are covered with dirty slobber marks from the cows licking them the first night. We didn't get much sleep as they bumped the trailer all night. There are beautiful and easy hikes. An established NSF paved campground exists a few miles away at Madera Canyon.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Typical Cracker Barrel experience. No knocks and relatively quiet. Highway is very close, but did not bother me. The designated RV parking is not flat at all, as is the rest of the lot. If you’re in anything that can’t fit into a single parking space, I recommend parking in the parking lot adjacent to CB. There are no businesses there and about 3 campers and 5 tractor trailers stayed there through the night. I don’t believe they were bothered as they were still here when I woke up.

name: Five Cuts
description: a peaceful secluded piece of BLM land accessable by 2-WD (keep momentum through sandy sections). an unpaved road that leads to many informal camping spots. at the base of a few hills located within 10 miles of a main road. occasionally can hear cars driving in the distance. this spot looks heavily visited due to a section against the hill scattered with "art" and casings. highly recommend as a camping option when the joshua tree national park is full. it is March 8, 2020 and I arrived in the middle of the night. watched the sunrise made coffee now playing guitar. not a soul in sight. please remember to "leave no trace" we can all do our part.

name: Payson Laundromat
description: Clean, friendly laundromat with WiFi and restroom.

name: veteran center parking lot
description:
Veteran Center off the freeway. 
there was another rv parked here with us for the night! 
 Nice Spot & safe! 
we stayed 1 night in our 24ft rv with no problems! 
follow our travel ig: @celestial.travelers

name: Water dispenser at 7/11
description: Water dispenser outside 7/11. 25¢ per gallon.

name: Silver Peak Rd near Alkali Springs
description: Large pull-off on the north side of Silver Peak Rd just a few miles from Alkali Springs. Multiple spots could fit quite a few vehicles and could accommodate a couple larger RVs. There's a pit area in the middle that blocks the wind as the other spots were quite windy. A few fire rings spread out in the area already. Far enough from 95 to not have any highway noise and not much traffic on Silver Peak Rd. Nice spot to overnight if traveling down 95 or for a few days if you're hanging out at the hot springs. Tmobile signal was good at times, though it would sometimes slow down. Google Fi was pretty solid.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel location with RV specific parking spots and overnight camping allowed.

name: Rest Area East Bound
description: A rest area with plenty of parking. Restrooms are clean, picnic tables onsite, and there is dog friendly area. all Tennessee rest areas now have a maximum stay of 2 hours

name: Table Mesa Road - Multiple spots
description: This is a few miles in on a well maintained gravel road off HWY 17. There are multiple spots to camp, with rustic fire rings where others have been. Some spots have a lot of privacy, other spots will have UTV’s and Jeeps passing by to get to trails

name: CDOT-Pagosa
description: Park your RV/Van in among the big riggs at the DOT parking lot. Flat Quiet and maintained by DOT (trucks wait here when MT pass is closed). perfect overnight

name: Walmart
description: Walmart allows overnight camping. Also has Walmart Wifi available. Little bit of noise from people revving engines and music in the morning on the Walmart speakers but overall pretty decent stay especially in this area where it seems difficult.

name: ABC overflow parking
description: Slept here the last two nights and it was great. Second night a diesel parked here but first night I was by myself. Close to a home but if you don’t make noise I don’t think they care. Went and chilled at the beach park during the day right down the road

name: Ridge Park Rd
description:
This road goes to a park and to a trailhead. It’s free parking with no “no overnight parking” or street cleaning signs. A vanlife local let us know about it. It seems to be a common overnight spot and we weren’t hassled. There is a sign recommending to keep your vehicle locked and belongings secure, probably smash and grab style theft. The area felt safe and is very beautiful. Highly recommend! It’s up on a hilltop with great views.

Heavily trafficked with hikers starting early morning (5-6 am) especially on weekends.

name: McGarry Canyon dispersed camping
description: There are approximately 8-12 campsites down this road, most sites have a fire pit and are enclosed in trees. Located in the Targhee NF. These are all wild campsites with very little amenities. Plenty of ATV trails in the area, and some beautiful mountain roads to drive to get a good view.

name: Warren Allen Loop Rd
description: Dispersed camping north of Utah State Route 95. A little hard to find on the road but when driving west, it'll be a small turnoff on the right. Spots scattered along the way on the loop, some with fire rings. Quiet and secluded but can be windy since it's exposed. At&t 3 bars

name: The BIG Texan
description: A Texas institution since the 1960s. Huge casual steakhouse, cowboy motel, arcade games, dog park, brewery. Semi parking available too! If you can eat a whole 72 Oz steak in less than an hour it's free! Check out Cadillac ranch too!

name: Fairy Stone Campground
description: State park, nice sites. When we stayed there were only 2 other sites filled, but could be crowded in high season. We were able to get a fast ATT cell signal with a WeBoost antenna, but barely had signal here without it.

name: Panaderia La Cathedral
description:
Cute little Mexican style bakery in Nogales AZ. Convenient self service and reasonable price. 
Parking available.

name: Tonopah Station
description: They have a small RV park behind the casino. The front desk let us fill our potable water for free. We also slept in the parking lot with no issues.

name: Arden Grove St Parking
description: 4-6 spots on Arden Grove St that have no prohibitions against parking 24/7 and being a one-way street with no traffic. Just a couple meters to the riverwalk yet quiet and secure. Occasional joggers and people walking their dog is all you get. Good AT&T and T-Mobile signal. Wyndham hotel across street has restroom if discreet about it and riverwalk south has public restrooms open daytime. Building next door has slow/medium public Spectrum wifi.

name: Cracker Barrel - Lima, OH
description: Six RV sites behind the Cracker Barrel. Very quiet!  Barely can hear the highway. Hard to level a B-van w/o blocks, but lots of nice options. Line of car parking up against trees is second option. Felt very safe

name: Point Campground
description: Reservable campsite at John Martin Reservoir, make sure you also get a car park pass for any vehicles. Small fire pits, dispersed vault toilets, great views of the lake & night sky, and a thriving local animal community, make this a truly fun time. I was totally alone in mid- March and spent my night listening to the coyotes packs in the distance, and spent my morning observing the prairie dogs all over my site (263).

name: Altamont Pass Brake Check/Rest Area
description: 580 exit Flynn Road, one area WB one area EB joined by bridge over freeway. Overnight parking allowed. Large gravel lots with a few lights. Often many semi trucks parked. No amenities. Moderate noise from freeway and semis.

name: Carl's Jr/Joe's Travel lot
description: I5 Howard Rd exit. Large paved lot behind Carl's and Joe's. Minimal road noise, well lit, private security (on Joe's property only). Carl's Jr drive thru and Joe's Travel Plaza (with clean bathrooms) open 24hrs.

name: Oversized parking at Planet Hollywood
description: Free oversized parking behind Planet Hollywood. Perfect to enjoy an evening on the strip. 13ft high, approx 30 ft long.  A security guard took our contact information when we parked. Coming back at around 10pm, the gate was closed. We called the security (phone number is everywhere on the walls) and a security guard opened the gate for us. Super secured, and I felt like a VIP!

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area parking lot. Stayed here one night, right off of 77. No amenities, but a few picnic tables and trash cans. No signs prohibiting overnight. Highway noise is loud but overall no issues.

name: Cabelas
description: Pay dump station along north side of lot by RV parking area. I think fee was 5 dollars, unless you buy something inside or are a club card holder.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: A very quiet location. Manager said not to park in front of the dumpsters and I recommend staying closer to the Logan’s Steakhouse side as it’ll block some of the trash day noise. The only downfall is that you’ll go to bed hungry for steak.

name: Pace Bend Park
description: A nice county campground in the park. Only a small number of spots. Each had electric and water, fire pit, picnic table, and grill. There’s a dump station at the park entrance. Short walk down to Lake Travis. The bathrooms are currently under construction so there are portapotties and hand washing stations, but normally flush bathrooms and showers are available at the campground. Pretty trees and nice hiking trails around.

name: True Value
description: Local true value that can fill propane tanks.

name: 16th Street Laundromat
description: Clean and good parking lots in front of the store.

name: Lake Village Welcome Center.
description:
Rest area style parking right on the water, Good for one night. 
( No reg. or check in like casinos. )

-No signs about overnight parking, no one bothered us.
-Bathrooms / Visitor Center were not open, may be open after C-19.
-Nice park and dock on the water. 
-Quite at night, traffic picks up in the morning.

name: Sallisaw Rest Area. East Bound I40
description:
Standard rest area, good for one night. 

-No signs prohibiting overnight parking. 
-Park as far back as possible to avoid highway and truck idle noise. 

Note: Only added due to the other listing is stated as a tank dump water fill. Rest Area also on West Bound I40.

name: Lee County Rest Area I75 North & South.
description:
FL. does have time limits on rest area parking, however it does not seem to be an issue for overnight stays. 
-Note: FL Highway Patrol has a station behind this R/A. 

-Pulled in at sunset, stayed the night with no issues.
-Next morning the lot was full of several vehicles of all shapes and sizes that had also parked overnight here. 
-Data on your devise should not be a problem here.

name: Pier 220 Under the Max Brewer Parkway.
description:
Many places to watch a launch in this area, this is where I ended up this evening for a 1:15am. launch. 

-No overnight parking restrictions, if fact it seems to be a van life spot. 

-Sandpoint park is next to this area if you need water, bathrooms, or a place for your kids to play. 
-Pier 220 Grill is open until 9 or 10 weekdays, later on weekends. 
-Your internet devise should work well here. 
-I parked on the dirt under the causeway facing the launch area.

-To check the upcoming launch schedule;
https://www.kennedyspacecenter.com/launches-and-events/events-calendar?pageindex=1

-Launch's do get scrubbed, check local media on the day of your visit.

name: Texas Welcome Center Rest Area
BLM dirt road right by the river
description: Very last pull off before privately owned ranch land. Occasional traffic noise but hard to hear over the sound of the river. Excellent place to camp in the sand. Can be windy through the canyon.

name: Eunice Rest Area. NM TX Border.
description:
-Basic stop for the night, one other vehicle in the morning.

-Listed as a Rest area but more like a picnic area, no bathrooms. 

-Quiet until the trucks starting rolling in the morning. 

-If you need food or fuel there is a Loves right across the street. 

*****This is a major oil producing region, if you can't keep your windows / vents closed at night you may not want to stay here due to the fumes!*****

You have been warned.

name: Lightfeather Hot Springs Trail Head
description:
Big thanks to the NP volunteer that turned me onto this great site. 

-The place I marked on the map is the parking area where the trailhead is.
-I will place another marker where the actual spring is.  

-I was able to drive to this point in a 20' motor home with no issues. 
-If you are in a larger vehicle or are pulling a trailer you may want to park in the NP visitor center parking lot and walk up the hill about 1/4 mi. to the trailhead parking.
-The park entrance and use of the hot springs are totally free. 
-The 1/2 mile walk to the springs was easy to follow. ( Trail is shown on iOverland map. ) 
-You can cross the river twice as shown on the map or try to stay on the bank and walk to the hot springs but the brush may be? dense.
-If you travel with a small shovel, I would recommend bringing it to dig out the area for better soaking.
*****Warning: The pipe and area that the water comes out at is too hot to soak. Just move down and test the water until you find a place that is comfortable to you. ( This is where the shovel comes in. ) 
-For more information use the NPS website. ( Also for the other Hot Spring in the park. )

name: Light Feather Hot Springs. ( Actual. )
description:
Hot springs are next to the river. 

You can't drive to this point, the trailhead parking is 1 mile from here.

See other listing for description.

Great Soaking!!!

name: Fort Craig Rest Area. North and South I 25
description:
Nice scenic rest area, has wind sheltered picnic areas.

No issue parking overnight at NM rest areas. 

All providers should give good cel. and data coverage here.

name: Roadside pull off with sledding
description: Super large area (always plowed in winter). Nothing but views off a little traveled county road.  A gravel parking lot surrounded by national forest. Legal camping

name: Gravel lot
description: Just a couple of large gravel parking areas south of the interstate. Empty at the moment but I expect truckers probably use the lots too. Trash and broken glass in some spots but not horrible. Verizon signal was good. Couple of dumpsters here too. Looks like amenities across the interstate but I've not checked it out.

name: Cheyenne Bottoms Wildlife Refuge
description: A local City campground. attached to the back of a wildlife refuge and hunting area. nice spot for a night. there are about 7 established campsites with fire rings. and another area where you could fit larger rigs.

name: Valley Event Center
description: Large gravel open parking lot for the event center. I talked to the local police and asked where a good place to park overnight and they said they don’t mind if I park at the event center parking lot as long as it isn’t for more than a day or two. Parking lot is large enough for big rvs.

name: Erie Street
description: This place is must stop! FREE. Classic old cars always parked in front of preserved historic buildings. The pickers store is also a must stop. So many wonderful things!

name: Ash canyon bird preserve
description: Free bird viewing that is very well kept up. Sit and enjoy the many birds this area has to offer. New to birding or not, there are always helpful people to chat with! Please donate if you can afford it!

name: Cave Creek Bird Preserve
description: Proceed to the preserve main building to access the bird feeding area. Cost is 5$ on honor system. Bathroom on premises. Car or van only. Staff is super nice. Bird guiding offered—inquire at front desk. Incredibly friendly staff. If in the area, stop in to get the low down on the area. Petroglyphs trail off of ranch. Amazing Merch. Clean restroom just ask. Blue throated Mountain Gem commonly seen at feeders.

name: Chiricahua National Monument
description: No entrance fee. Coords are to the main overlook. Absolutely stunning park. The best of everything can be seen by a 4 or 9 mile loop hike from these coords. Nature trail is informative. Who doesn’t love hoodoos?!

name: White River
description:
Fairly steep dirt road down to ~6 sites along the river by the bridge. 2 sites accessable with 2wd high clearance, others by 4x4. 

This area burned recently, but this pocket survived and is scenic. A few old beer cans around, it might be a party spot weekends but was quiet for me midweek.

name: Dog Creek Reservoir, Idaho 83330
description: Small reservoir out in the country with free camping, pit toilet, cell service close to Twin Falls. There is at least a dozen spots some suitable for  large RVs, vans, cars and tents. Some fire rings already built and lots of stars out at night. A few broken bottles and bullet holes but largely a clean and private spot with pleasant views. There were two parties of fishers in the morning. This and other water spots can be found on the website https://idfg.idaho.gov/ifwis/fishingplanner/mapcenter/

name: Planet fitness
description: Planet fitness, stayed here in a 22ft RV. Would be harder in anything much larger, the parking lot isn't huge. A lot of road noises, but one other vandweller took advantage by using their generator at night. Near a publix and other shops.

name: Fountain of Youth RV Park
description: A old semi run down RV park that has the biggest hot spring I've been to in my life. it flows 1.5 milliom gallons per day and is enormous so social distancing in the pool is no problem. The RV park is nothing special, pull thru spots, cabins, playground, old bathrooms, but the HOT SPRINGS ARE AMAZING. We always boondock but for $33 for a tent site with our van or $49 full hookup it is so worth it to soak. We had 3 entire giant pools all to ourselves last night and again this morning. Great spot to check out the other bath house, state park, legend rock, and dinosaur museum in Thermopolis. If you have a van or tent, request site 14. It has a bubbling geyser practically in your campsite! Enjoy this absolute treasure. Empty in the off season!

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel allows overnight parking with quite a few RV spots.

name: Rest Stop
description: Water in picnic area of rest stop (car side).

name: Arco
description: It looks like they have at least 2 dump stations along the curb when you first enter.  I'm not sure if they are free or paid.

name: Pull Off
description: No services. Just a quiet place to stop for the night on a backroad. Stay in front on the fence.

name: Hay Conservation Park
description: Fantastic spot near the ocean. Pit toilets but otherwise off-grid.

name: High Tide Laundry
description: Decently sized. only $1.75 for a wash. They also offer drop-off service for $1/lb and a $10 minimums. Attendant is very friendly. Parking is limited so big rigs won’t fit.

name: Oak Park Campground
description: $35/night. Surprisingly secluded and quiet considering it is close to train tracks and freeway. Picnic tables, fire rings, bathrooms, playground, basketball and volleyball courts.

name: Near Red Rock Canyon SP
description: Off the main highway you'll drive approximately 4 miles, beyond the state park boundary. Informal campsites on both sides of the dirt road. Not too bumpy at all, it is sandy in spots, but no issues. We have cell service here. Free.

name: Carrabelle Beach
description: Really cool row of tables with power outlets and charcoal grill stands along the beach. Indoor bathrooms nearby. Great place to grill and charge your devices. Beautiful at sunset

name: Valley of the Gods
description: Valley of the Gods is one of the most beautiful BLM areas I think in the country. The fact that is hasn’t turned into a national park is astonishing. I could live here in my van. 10/10. This site was part of bears ears but is now BLM. no campfires allowed. no services.

name: Okatoma & RV Park
description: Nice quiet and clean park with a fishing lake,  friendly,  laundry.  A bit pricy at $45 for a tent site.

name: Higgs Beach
description: Stayed overnight on the neighboring streets by Higgs Beach with no problem. Found out the next morning that there’s free parking on Higgs Beach. I parked here all day and enjoyed the beach. There’s outdoors shower/rinsing area and public restrooms available right by the parking area/pier.

name: Independence Park
description: This park has full.hook ups for RVs for 30/night but let us dump here for free. The front desk of the clubhouse is where we asked. They said it was fine.

name: Cibola NF
description: Primitive spot just off Highway 42 on C003 in the Cibola National Forest. Flat,very quiet.

name: Geneva State Park Campground
description:
Pulled in June 28, 2021. Signs said no walk-ins accepted any more, reservations required.

Electric hookup, fire pit, picnic table.

name: Walker honey farm & Dancing Bee Winery
description:
Walker honey farm/Dancing bee winery
they are on a number of sites like harvest host/boondockers welcome. and do allow overnight parking for a night or 2. 
you should call ahead if possible to make sure theres room, and definitely check in at the store when you arrive. theyll give you details on where to park, gate code, etc.
room for 7 rigs. 

very nice shop. good wines, mead, local honey etc.
tastings are only 10 bucks for 6 kinds. 
if youre going to stay try and purchase something, even if its something small to encourage them to keep allowing people to overnight.

name: lot next to gas station
description:
Empty gravel lot behind/next to chevron.
Seems fine for overnight parking

name: Suncrest Southbound rest area
description: Typical rest area; bathrooms and lots of grass. Parked overnight in our van because it was close to Medford where we had an appointment the next day. Quiet. Car door noises. No one bothered us or our rig.

name: Wal-Mart, Oak Ridge TN
description: Typical Walmart Parking lot.  Spent a restful night here, no issues.  Restaurants and other stores nearby.

name: Wal-Mart
description: Parked last night Dec11, 2020Had an overall decent night sleep..thought I heard lite knocking twice but when I looked no one was there.. Such a huge parking lot and there's nearby fast food which seemed open all night so besides for the knocking -which May have been imagined, the cars and some trucks parked in the lot..I'd say it's relatively safe (I'm in a stealth van)

name: U haul
description: The cheapest place I have filled up propane in all of Florida! Lady even charged me for the cheaper propane price! They have a hose right next to the propane station I was able to use to fill water. Awesome!! A+++

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel 10 minutes from San Jose Mission in San Antonio. On a busy road but good for one night.

name: Walmart
description: Parked here for one night and it was no problem at all. No one bothered us or came out to say anything about us being here. We parked toward the back of the walmart closer to the Burger King. Theres a huge strip mall here so you have many options on where to park but we chose walmart. Lots of trucks overnighting

name: Patagonia park bathrooms with water spigot out front
description: Easy access parking for water or to dump a cassette toilet

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Nice little spot. Plenty of flat areas for vans or small campers. I always call to double check overnight camping is allowed before arriving and the nice lady over the phone said larger rigs can also use the lot directly across the way located in front of the Outdoor store. Well lit and not too noisy when it gets later in the evening.

name: Cracker Barrel in Pigeon Forge, TN
description: Thank you, CB!  Rainy, dark night yesterday and the national park campground we expected to stay at was a no-go.  It was getting scary to drive!  Found this CB and had a good, restful night.  Now getting a delicious Covid safe breakfast to go.  Who can beat that?  Plenty of grass to walk the dog - pls pick up!

name: QT ( Quit Trip )
description: a place to file up, grab a snack, powder your nose, and rest your head. Grass around for your pets to do what they need to as well. I give this place a 10!! this app won't allow me to give a dabbled 5 star rating.

name: Dripping Springs cueva picnic area
description: easy use water spigot accessible from the parking area

name: Historic Downtown Aiken
description: Very friendly & adorable small town!  Cute shops & restaurants, with infinite free street parking.  I stayed on this street near the pretty pine trees for a few nights without issue (in a Sprinter Van).  I am fully self-contained so I am not sure about nearby bathroom /shower facilities.

name: Murphy USA
description: Potable water spigot. Very friendly gas station!  I asked to use their spigot after I put diesel in my Sprinter and they said absolutely!

name: Chamber of Commerce
description: Potable Water Spigot. Free to use. Need your own hose

name: Ninety-Six Visitor Center
description: Good WiFi!  Worked outside the visitor center.

name: Conservation Park
description: Drinking water spigot, fountains, and water bottle stations.  Filled my 40 gallon water tank without issue. A water pressure regulator is strongly recommended. There’s also an outdoor cold water shower. Right across from the welcome center. This park is amazing!  So many hikes & is pup friendly!

name: Belly of the Dragon
description: Few sites off of the highway. Road noise is prevalent. Several spots past the belly of the dragon mini-hike. One bar Verizon. Very good dirt road. Got good ATT service.

name: Anderson Pond Eglin AFB
description: Primitive campground on Eglin Air Force Base.  Open to the public but you are required to get a camping permit at the Jackson Guard Office in Niceville.  Nice fishing pond and hiking trails.

name: Sockum Ridge
description: Sockum Ridge County Park. Free primitive camping, with several hiking trails.

name: Road to Palm Canyon Kofa NWR AZ
description: Many flat free sites near the road. Slow driving because of washboard road but close to the main road so you won't have to go far if you don't want to. Fair amount of traffic but quiet at night. Surrounded by desert vegetation and rugged mountain views. We  were on the way to Palm Canyon but stopped here because it was getting dark and the road was very washboardy. Sites are well dispersed with good distance between each other. we would stay here again. Three bars Verizon.

name: Halfway Or Fairgrounds
description: Caretaker allowed access to city water from taps along fairgrounds building.

name: Desert Sage Event Center....Malheur County Fairgrounds
description: RV spaces with electric and nearby water.  Dump station across the road.  Arrival on Sunday 6pm, unattended, self pay, $15 with Passport America discount.  Bathrooms were locked. Water and electricity worked, wifi  password at pay station.  Good AT&T cell signal.  Quiet, nobody here on this trip.

name: Foster fuels
description: Propane tanks filled, probably only normal businesses hours.

name: Home Depot
description: Safe place to park for a night. We tried staying at the Walmart across the street and the security guard told us no one would bother us here. A little noisy from the main road but we slept fine. The roosters might start serenading you around sunrise though :)

name: Beard’s Bluff Park
description: Small campground on Millwood Lake near Saratoga, Ak. $15 / night for paved site, electrical, and water.  Dump station near entry to the park.

name: Amazonia 4x4 TLC specialists
description: TLC specialists 4x4 restoration and repair dealing with only toyota land cruisers custom restos and repairs. worked on my 100 series efficient and trustworthy. give it 4.5 stars app would not take it!

name: Parking on Cabrillo bvld
description: Harbor view hotel WiFi reaches onto street (password: HarborView) free parking 6pm to 9 am

name: Piney Point Campground
description: Sleepy Creek Wildlife Management Area. Dispersed camping throughout the area. Self registration, $10 per site off-season, $20 per site peak season. Very quiet, no other campers mid March weekend.

name: SAFEWAY
description: Safeway in a small town. I frequently visit here for supplies and see campers. Some I have encountered repeatedly.

name: Water Gallon Fill Up Station in front of Sinclair
description: Water gallon fill up station outside Sinclair gas station. Super convenient!

name: Off street quiet parking
description: No one bothers for a night or two. Can accommodate big rig but could a knock on the door if you park here too long.

name: Mountain Springs Ranch RV park
description: Awesome views, decent cell. Super nice owner. He’s trying to get the park up and running. Nice level spots. Down side there’s no tv reception. But worth staying at.

name: Loves Truck Stop
description: No water, even though sign says water. They do have an RV dump though, for $10.

name: Summit Springs
description: Dispersed Site in Mendocino NF. One site with picnic tables and fire ring, other areas to camp nearby.

name: waaay out there
description: 30 minute off-road drive, any truck or suv is fine. Little sandy. Epic camp spot. No neighbors for 30ish minutes. Park on cliffs.

name: Sanford-Yake Campground Dump/Potable Water Station
description: One potable water pump (cutoff hose, no threads) and one dump hole. Potable water pump is currently out of order; the pipe burst during the last big freeze and the water just shoots out the side.

name: BLM land
description: BLM land this section is for equestrian riding but also lots of atv/offroad vehicles. Pretty quiet past 5 but pretty active during the day. Goes from paved road to gravel/sand road.

name: Washington State Fair RV Parking and Camping
description:
No tent camping. All RV's must be self-contained. No restroom faciliaties are available.
Overnight parking for RVs is available year-round. Full power, sewer and water hookups are available in the Orange Lot; power, water and sewer dump are available in the Green Lot. Specific 
RV spaces are not reserved. You will be assigned a spot based on availability.
Advance reservations required. Prices not applicable during The Spring Fair and Washington State Fair. 

$35 per night in advance, during Fair office hours; Mon-Fri, 10:00am - 3:00pm
$40 per night at the lot and after hours (based on availability)

name: Can Do Country Market
description: They have an amerigas propane fill on site and a water filling station for water jugs

name: Walmart Terrell, TX
description:
Good for one night. I called ahead to make sure it was okay and was told yes. Parked on the garden side to be out of the way. 

Phone number: 1-972-563-7638

name: 76 Fuel Station
description:
Bulk propane sold buy the gallon.
(Recommend arriving before 5pm)

name: Small Site w/ View
description: Small campsite with amazing view of Table Rock and the Gorge. It is right near the road, but the view is worth it. Rock fire ring. Trees for hammock camping. This is the best view right from the campsite that I found on NC-105. There are other larger campsites off the road a bit more, but they don’t offer the same view. Oh, and 2 bars of Verizon 4G LTE.

name: Lee vining museum
description: Before lee vining museum there is big flat gravel lot for a stormy night. Quiet place for winter.

name: Rolls OHV area, Pobrecito Entrance
description:
Off-highway vehicle parking and camping area.
No permit required.
It’s dry and lots of four wheelers but road noise is minimal.
 one bar of Verizon cell service

name: Moran mini mart
description: Propane out the back. Didn't stop but wanted to note on the map.

name: Emigrant Picnic Area
description:
Day use paved parking, restrooms and potable water, all free. Water is a spigot with garden hose threads near the restrooms. Probably best for filling containers - it would need a long hose to fill tanks directly. 
Emigrant campground, also free, is 50 yards west with a separate entrance

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Standard Cracker Barrel but a good quiet safe night sleep. There was a wind storm in town and this spot was barely a breeze. Bonus is the ability to connect to La Quinta wifi.

name: Recycle Centre
description: Recycle centre to the right of Fred Meyer in Brookings

name: Turtle beach parking water spigot
description: Water spigot is located on the backside of 4 x 4 post right next to another post With a sign of beware alligators

name: Bucklin Cafe & C Store
description: Got gas here and asked for permission to stay in their large gravel lot. They said it’s fine; it’s a free truck stop. There were a few trucks parked here. Mostly quiet, but every now and then a truck would pass and it would be a bit loud. The lot has many potholes; watch where you drive.

name: Kelley Car & RV Wash
description: Dump station at the back of the property. $10 cash, or pay with a card in the office. Potable water, hose threads are in good shape. Plenty of room to maneuver for large rigs. There's also an open-top RV wash bay, if that's your thing.

name: Chitwood Feed & Hardware
description: Propane tank refill. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Not sure whether they can accommodate large rigs with built-in propane tanks

name: Loves travel Station
description: Stopped for a night, quiet and wasn’t bothered

name: Premium Propane
description: Propane gas company. They will fill your propane tanks. Nice people.

name: Bill Evans Lake
description: Lake is owned by the local mining company and leased to the State of New Mexico.  Stocked with fish, lots of folks here trying their luck.  Very windy at times.  Flat area on the west site of the lake for all sizes of RVs and/or tents.  Room on the east side of the lake for smaller RVs and tents. Three bars of Verizon 4G

name: Water spigot
description: There is a water spigot at the restrooms between the water fountains, there is a concrete walkway path but this is only for filling up containers and carrying back to your vehicle

name: Chevron - Water Spigot
description: Asked the attendant nicely if I can use their water spigot right outside for free.

name: Roosevelt state park
description: Nice campsites by a lake. Fire towers for views. Good ATT connection before the WeBoost.

name: Green River State Park
description: Nice clean state park campground. Sites have water, electric, tables and fire rings. Bathrooms have showers. There is a gold course and a boat ramp on site. There is a small amount of train noise, but not bad. The sites are pretty big and spread apart. There is also a dump station. $10 if you didn’t camp here, free if you did.

name: Tonopah Stargazing Park
description: Turn on the road next to the 76 gas station, across from the family dollar. Drive past where the pavement ends, up a short dirt road. There is a fenced in area with picnic tables and star gazing benches. Great cell phone service and plenty of flat spots.

name: Cracker Barrel El Paso
description: Cracker Barrel on Remcon Circle in El Paso. Right off I-10, they have a few dedicated RV spots in the back (on the street side), they’re 40ft long. There’s a Walmart across the street for groceries if you need any.

name: Mohave Desert near Kelso Dunes
description: This site is on a firm dirt road that is about a 1/2 way between Kelso Depot and the turnoff to Kelso dunes on Kelbaker Road (heading south from Kelso depot). Several pullouts early but we kept driving about a mile and found a nice firm flat spot to park. Views of dunes, mountains galore. Be careful in other areas in park where roads are sandy — easy to get stuck. This road is packed gravel. No cell coverage

name: Don’t park/camp here, police routinely ticket this street
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced

Cop told me they often patrol this street to look for “campers.” They let me off with a warning. Cop recommended Los Osos down the road for overnighting, said the sheriffs are more hands off there.

name: San Juan River - Swinging Bridge
description:
Saw what looked like the remnants of a foot bridge near here. This is on the bluffs on the north side of the river. We were the only ones there the night we camped. Gorgeous views, very quiet.
To get there, highway 191 north turn right onto 162, which follows the river. Just before mile marker 3 there is a cattle guard and dirt road going to a broad bluff off to the right. A loop road appears very quickly on your left taking you out to the campsite on the bluff edge. Only room for 3 or so large rigs out there.

name: John Pennekamp State Park Dump
description: charge of $9 for a vehicle (rv + tow) to enter park, then an additional $10.75 to use the dump station that is primarily used by the RV park on site. full circle, drive through, clean and easy

name: Love's Truck Stop
description: dump station next to water/air, $10 charge

name: Loves Travel Stop
description: $10 dump facility, next to air behind gas pumps

name: South City Park, Opeleusas free dump
description: free dump, water spiket next to it did not work while we were here Feb 2021. can stay the night with electric/water hook up for $11 too

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Limited rv spaces and allowed to stay only one night. Near a gas station and an in-n-out burger so lots going on/noisy but free and 15 min from the strip.

name: Backcountry Conversions - (406) 261-5065
description: Camper Van conversion shop specializing in Ford Transits.

name: Ace Hardware
description: don't bring your propane tanks into the store.  take them through the chain link fence into the lumber yard.  not very big rig friendly...a large class A or 5W would have a hard time maneuvering.

name: Bob's Propane & Sm. Eng. Repair
description: fast, friendly service.  good price for propane.  a big rig might be a little tight getting in, but would be doable.

name: Hwy 188 Tackle & Supply
description:
Propane hrs:  
8-4 M-F
8-? Sat
closed Sun

refill and/or exchange

name: Overlooking Roosevelt Lake
description: pretty smooth dirt road leading in...not like the spots further up the road.  level spot large enough for one big rig.  rock fire ring.

name: FS 689
description: numerous dispersed camping sites along FS 689.  plenty of room for any size rig.  if the first couple of sites are taken, when you turn off of 618, never fear.  keep going.  Plenty of room to turn around at the end, where these coordinates are.  stone fire rings.  you packed it in/you pack it out.  far enough from the interstate you don't hear road noise.  15 min to Red Rock Scenic Drive, 30 min to Sedona.  4 bars AT&T.

name: Super Clean Laundry
description: Large operation.  lots of machines of multiple sizes.  reasonable prices.  wifi, restroom, detergent dispenser, coin machine.  Mexican food truck next door while you're waiting.
