name: FS Rd 119/Montezuma Well Rd
description: large, mostly level area with numerous loops could accommodate 10 or more large rigs.  no signs saying "no camoing."  2 entrances/exits.  5 bars AT&T.

name: Near Oatman Massacre
description: Large BLM site.  No trees, plenty of sun for solar.  Near the site of the Oatman family massacre.  4-5 bars AT&T.  Stone fire rings, no other amenities.  Pack it in, pack it out.  Please do not throw your beer cans in the fire.  Aluminum doesn't burn and someone else has to clean up after you.
Beautiful camp. Huge fire pit! A bench to sit on with a rock wall to reflect the heat.

name: Narragansett Town Hall 5th Ave Street Parking
description: Street parking (parallel parking spots) along 5th Ave in front of the town hall. No visible signs preventing overnight parking. Stayed here a night in October and street was quiet, no one bothered us. Might not be good for big rigs but great for vans. Very residential so stealth is best and respect is a must.

name: Dirt Pull-off
description: Wide dirt pull-off next to Buckingham Park. Great for one night. Came here bc local National Forests were closed due to fires. Cars until 11pm then again at 6am. Neat little spot.

name: AZ Hwy 77
description: Lots of spaced out camp sites with fire rings. 2 bars AT&T. Pretty clean.

name: Bowery Guard Station
description: USFS Guard Station and trail heads for several areas nearby. From East Fork of the Salmon River on good to fair roads cross two gates to access wild camp just before the guard station where there are four  hot spring soaking tubs. Great views with open camping.

name: Burnt Rancheria Campground
description:
Large campground among pine trees with bsthrooms and showers.  108 sites, half reservable, half first come first served.   Hiking trails and PCT nearby.  Verizon cellular works good. Restaurant on highway within walking distance. 



I just wanted to fix the web address, this whole check in business is stupid. The link should work now.

name: Domeland Road turnout
description: Just off the dirt & gravel road going to Domelands trailhead.  Located on a small hill with nice views.  This is within BLM land and you can camp free up to 14 days.  There is a flat level parking area next to a rock fire ring.  Road has soft sand and not recommended for RVs.  Pickup truck/camper or Jeep’s or 4x4 vans will be fine.

name: Xtreme Off-Roaders
description: 4x4 a must! Awezome zite! AWD do-able. Test your vehicles ability to reach new heights, safely please!

name: easy big rig spot
description: We arrived after dark in a 35 foot motorhome and this was the perfect, easy pullover for the night. Still relatively quiet even close to the highway. As others have said, beautiful spot!

name: Jordan Creek Roadside Camp
description: Pull out with large established fire ring visible from Jordan Creek road. At the junction with Camp Friend Road. Nice wooded spot. Plenty of space for several tents. A couple of flat spots for smaller vehicles. No problem getting our Revel level.

name: Fort Morgan Library wifi
description:
Free & Fast wifi, if you park along the road you probably will be able to get it. it will only let me put 2.5 stars for some reason  

I believe the library is open most days until 6 or 7 pm.

name: Tony’s Crabshack
description: Free Open Wifi at Tony’s with a parking lot out front. Signal strength is good, so if you park outside you can connect without having to leave your van! 11.1 Mbps Download, 9.86 Mbps Upload (parked closer to the water).

name: BLM on Lake
description: Steep rocky entrance down to several (not very level) gravel spots. Beautiful reflective view in the lake of the mountains! Some local fishers parked near the water. great signal with Verizon.

name: Secluded Dispersed Camping
description: Coordinates are for a small pull off on the side of a forest road. Big enough for 1 vehicle. Several more spots at the end of the road, and along surrounding forest service roads. LTE service was available here.

name: Dessie Smith Prescott Boat Ramp
description:
Big open parking lot on Lake Rousseau. 
No signage with park hours or overnight restrictions. Building at one end that has a light that stays on all night, but other than that it’s quiet and hardly any noise from the street.
There’s a porta-potty, and 3 covered docks with picnic tables on the lake.
One bar of service with Sprint, but worked well enough. 

Highlights:
Fireflies at night, lots of stars, big grassy areas perfect if you have a pet, felt safe and quiet enough to sleep with my back doors open to let a breeze in. 
Picnic tables on dock were perfect for coffee in the morning. Even had an alligator keep me company while I journaled. (he was nice and stayed in the water.)

name: Placerville
description:
Street parking in Placerville. No restrictions. Quiet at night, but busy in the morning. We tried every other option in town, but this was the only place without restrictions we found to spend the night. 
We spent the night in the library parking lot. Even better than downtown.

name: Lake Iowa Park
description:
Small fee with a dropbox. First come first served. All sites have electricity (30A - and two sites with 50A) and water. Two shower houses - currently closed showers 5/11/2022

Basically deserted in the winter time - had the whole campground to myself.

Commodore Keith: this description must be for a different campground. This is a very large campground and both shower buildings were open.

name: Montezuma Canyon Road
description: Several flat camping sites with fire rings. Nice in cooler weather but would be very hot in the AZ summer. 1 or 2 bars Verizon. Scotia Canyon has more shade but this has Verizon reception and less traffic. About ¼ mile to AZT for hiking.

name: O’Reilly
description: Super nice team, helped w oil change , free oil recycling . Plenty of stores: mail , laundry , shopping , and auto stores nearby. Large lot to work in. Dumpster ok to use right side of building

name: Horn Bend Trailhead
description: this informal site is a small paved parking lot for the trail head. No 'no overnight camping' signs.  good cell, good solar, nice hikes.  there's hunters right now.  its a week day, so not a lot of traffic and so far no 'bang bangs' (gun shots).  we'll see what happens on the weekend.

name: Neighborhood street
description:
A quiet road in the Historic district of Folsom. There are a few streets around and none of them have “no parking” or “no overnight parking” or “permit only” signs and there were other vehicles parked on the road as well. We stayed on Scott street by a long white fence to make sure we weren’t blocking anyone’s driveway or taking up room for home owners guests as we are in an extended van. We didn’t have any issues and we both slept well. 

This is a great location if you are visiting the historic district of Folsom which is just a few blocks away. They have lots of shops and restaurants and it’s a really cute part of town and gives off safe and friendly vibes. 

Good 3 bars Verizon

name: Alpine ridge Corp park
description: Army corps of engineer park, water, electric and level sites for $20 a night, bathrooms are big and clean, it is right on a Lake. Lots of 5th wheel trailers here.

name: Mountain View RV Park
description: $3/gallon for propane.  Great food truck next to it.  Water for $5 flat rate if not staying in RV park

name: Saddle Vista Ranch
description: Great little spot.  David has a dump station and both potable and nonpotable water.  Fee is sliding scale based on usage of water and amount dumping. $10-20.  Has dog food, toiletries and pet meds.

name: Scenic Loop Road
description: Off Darby Wells Road on Scenic Loop Road. We had been headed for the site further up the road but there was a dip that our friends couldn't drive over so we stopped just before the dip where there was room for two rigs. Later we walked further down the road and there was a dip that neither of us could have made. A jeep that drove there later left tail pipe marks on both sides of the dip. This place had room for two campers and was quite pretty. It's 2.5 miles from route 85.

name: Half Moon Creek
description: Many dispersed sites with rock fire rings off graded dirt roads. Some sites best suited for car camping but many spots good for RVs. Crowded this time, not as bad as years past. Possibly die to covid.

name: Planet Fitness
description: Planet Fitness parking lot. Fairly quiet at night. Had no problems. Nice hot showers inside.

name: Cracker Barrel Parking lot
description: Nice cracker barrel with plenty of parking. Good location close to downtown Saint Petersburg. Looks like RV parking is behind the Holiday Inn. Has shaded areas under tall trees. Good for a night. A little bit of noise from nearby highway, but hey it's free. Enjoy!

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Super quiet with tons of space for larger rigs.

name: Walmart
description: This walmart is not 24hrs so the lot is quite quiet. There are a couple of “lot cops”. No issues for one night.

name: Abandoned Campground
description: Site of the old Pecos River Campground. No signs prohibiting camping, though no services. Water available at the NP boat launch half mile away. Self contained rigs only, remember that toilet paper is trash. Quieter than the nearby picnic area.

name: Amistad Boat Launch
description: NP ranger station with bathrooms and water spigot. Easy access for getting water.

name: Utah-Arizona Border
description: Site is on the Arizona-Utah Border in Utah, minutes drive from Kanab. This site is up a maintained dirt road, and is just off the road, don’t need 4wd or high clearance. Can walk over a downed part of barbed wire fence into Arizona. Fire ring, beautiful view of town and 89.

name: Little Tallapoosa Park
description: Tent and RV camping at a County park. Clean shower/laundry/toilet facilities at tent camping area. Playground. Day-use option. Seven miles of trails, some paved. Equestrian camping and parking areas.

name: Shell gas station
description: I have a very large rig (38’) , I went in and got permission first, there is a spigot on the corner near the large dumpster, at the time there was a hose reel attached to it.

name: I-80 East Rest Area
description: No amenities except trash and a picnic table. Noisy. 7 truck-sized parking spots but room for more. There’s another rest stop with toilets and WiFi just another mile down, but I stopped rather late and was worried they’d be full.

name: Roadside
description: there are a few fire rings just off the road. probably wouldn't park anything bigger then a sprinter or cabover at the site. the road is nice - a bit of washboard but not too bad.

name: Truck stop pumps
description: City water available at truckstop pumps, water spigots with black hose

name: Osbourne Park
description: No signs that disallow overnight parking. Only signs for no loitering. Have bathrooms and a pavilion. Good cell signal on att and T-Mobile. There were a lot of 'no parking' signs posted at the Kingsland Marina spot next door so we stayed here in our truck camper.

name: Site 6
description: Make a right off of gravel road and cross stream. Plenty of room for an overland trailer to maneuver around in. site has room for roughly 3 vehicles. High clearance vehicle access only as there is brief articulation necessary for site entrance.

name: Montebello Country store
description: Pump Diesel, ethanol free 87, and 87 available. Pumps only open during business hours. USPS next door. Store sells basic needs as in food and camping needs.

name: Summerville Walmart
description: Walmart Supercenter. There are signs saying "no truck or trailer parking". I didn't see anything prohibiting RV or van parking. they close at 11:00pm during COVID. No one bothered me and the side lot seemed pretty quiet.

name: Walmart
description:
Safe Walmart up on a hill that allows overnight parking, per law enforcement. Drive to the side where the garden center is. Take that road all the way to the back by the auto center. There’s a big, secluded, quiet lot surrounded by trees and away from the main road. You can still hear some road noise but it’s faint. WiFi worked well in this area
Auto center closes at 6pm, and then it was super calm
Plenty of green space for pups :-)

name: Border Patrol Checkpoint
description: Border Patrol checkpoint only on west bound lanes. Most vehicles are just being waved through.

name: spot off us 60
description: nice site on the hillside up a curvy dirt hill. quiet spot for the night with minimal highway noise.  if you have 4x4\AWD go farther up dirt road to a more secluded spot.

name: Still Waters Campground
description: Small privately owned campground surrounded by Elkhorn River as it enters into the Kentucky River.      Tent & RV friendly.  Basic accommodations for restrooms/showers.   Has access for boat put in near KY river confluence with Elkhorn.   Great recreation to float on tubes from road entrance around the property on the the Elkhorn.

name: 2 drinking water hoses
description: 2 blue drinking water shacks here. On either side by Basquecha Restaurant and gas station. 5 Gallons for 50 cents.

name: Grant’s Canal
description: Several areas here under the overpass by Grant’s Canal. Tiny display, nothing going on here. Noisy. No amenities. But can rest here if needed and be out of sight.

name: By the Mississippi River
description: Small loop by the river, near Corps of Engineers site. May be flooded in season. Can see the water here. Quieter than Grants Canal area. Nearby town looks rough, but if passing through this is a nice respite area from the road!

name: Poole’s Boil and Go crawdads
description:
This is authentic crawfish boil!! Hand selected, washed and boiled right here. Comes with corn and potatoes. They also serve fish and shrimp!
We met the owners and got a little tour of the place. We asked to park for the night in our bus and they said yes..

name: Old Kingman Hwy
description: Some BLM land outside of Laughlin just off of AZ-68. Moderately rough gravel/old pavement road with a number of pullouts starting right off the highway. Should be passable for most cars (2WD fine) as long as you go slow, at least for the first 1.5 mi. We heard someone shooting near the road and there's lots of evidence of people shooting fairly recently all up and down the road along with a lot of other trash. A few other people camped out here and a couple trucks went by in the morning but mostly quiet. Big rigs could fit near the road and possibly further down, but limited turn around spots. Decent cell signal on Tmobile (3-4 bars). Could hear some burros braying at night!

name: TSC Tractor Supply Co
description: Will fill RV’s built in tanks too, Latest price was about 3.80

name: Gila forest dispersed camping
description:
Road past Gomez trailhead in little walnut picnic area leads to some nice turn outs for camping on forest land. There’s a few spots before here. Intermixed with some private road and lands so just pay attention to signage. 

Easy access gravel road, 2wd fine. 2-3 LTE bars in places on Verizon or T-Mobile. No Att. 

Pretty close to silver city. 10-15 minute drive into town. Good spot! Peaceful and felt safe. Better than Walmart parking lot for sure!

name: Moundsville Archeological Park
description: A park containing a number of well preserved Native American mounds and a museum run by University of Alabama. Camping area with about 30 sites. Some with water and electricity and sewer, some primitive.  Gravel surface not necessarily level. Bathroom building not open in December though February. RV camping only during these months. Campground closed some holidays. Quiet except for train nearby. It's worth exploring the mounds and museum while here.

name: Katherine Landing CG showers
description: Free showers next to the North Campground at Katherine Landing. There are old coin slots but all of the showers were free. Decent hot water and pressure. There is a laundry room next door but I didn't check it out.

name: South Tucson, intersection Hwy 86 and S Camino Verde
description: BLM open site.  Sign says 14 day maximum stay.  Open lot with brush.  Several rigs of various types here.  Close to busy Hwy 86 but a good staging location while awaiting opening at Gilbert Ray CG or for easy access to downtown. Good ATT cell signal.

name: Paul Bunyan's Log Pile
description: small disperse camping two or three campfire pits one picnic bench nice mile long hike to torch attraction one other party present when I pulled up very nice stay quiet no bugs secluded trees no water

name: Town's Bluff Park
description: primitive camping and day use sites on river.  Yurt rentals, museum, heritage center, boat ramp, bath house, rv park

name: Harrah's casino parking lot
description: When i called two days ago the lady at the front desk told me to stay in the upper lot and i did. But thats what the front desk lady at Mote Blue said too and that turned out to be wrong. There is a few other small RV's here. I'm really not sure if the people are in there or not. I just stealth camped in my rig. So i wouldn't get bothered. I made sure to buy dinner inside just incase anyone asked.

name: 180 E Picnic Area
description: If you’re headed through here and need a break, this is great. Quiet, clean, two pavilions and trash cans here and plenty of room for big rigs. Grassy area as well.

name: Another 180-E Picnic Area
description: Great picnic area. Two pavilions and two trash bins, grassy area. Big rigs OK.

name: Water spout & bathrooms at free day-use state park
description: Free parking here 8am to sunset. Spotted a tall water spigot in the front picnic area overlooking the sea. Flush toilets in the park itself.

name: Overnight parking @ edge of dirt lot
description: Stayed here one night beside a white sprinter surfer van that pulled in shortly after I did. No one bothered us. Could hear cars on occasion in the night on the main drag. Lots of other cars parked here all night so we blended in.

name: campsite in woods
description:
when entering the pow campground make a left at the fork! 

this spot is less than a half mile from the Pow campsite. 

we drove our 24ft rv here no problem. the spot is pretty long so you can definitely fit 2 medium sized vehicles here. 

we saw so much potential in this spot so we picked up as much trash as possible and cleaned up the area; unfortunately people have come here and left glass bottles, etc. 

we made a little bonfire in the back of the site, as well as put down some logs in front of the spot to indicate where it is. 

overall beautiful area and spot! 

if you keep driving down there's another spot but we couldn't get past cuz it was muddy! 

signal goes in and out, I have Verizon and had 1-2 Bars. husband has t mobile and had 1 bar and sometimes no reception. 

on the weekday we barely saw anyone, during the weekend we saw maybe 5 overall. there was a group of teens that passed by and we heard them shooting in the distance. but they left shortly after. 

follow our travel ig! @celestial.travelers 🌿

name: Flying J’s
description:
Flying J’s are great places to stay over night. 
This one wasn’t too loud at all and obviously you have some amenities.

name: Semi-residential
description: Stayed here occasionally when I was in the area. Never had a problem. Get in late and leave early. It’s quiet after 10 pm. Nearby park on the creek has clean public bathrooms. Quiet biz district /semi-residential night spot for van or SUV.

name: Oklahoma Welcome Center
description:
Very convenient rest area on the Will Roger's Turnpike. Be aware the building (including the bathrooms) is only open during normal business hours 8am-5pm. We got in super late when we really needed a safe place to sleep. This was a great spot with a fair amount of parking and room for us and the dogs to stretch out legs. There is also a newly fenced-in dog park which is a huge bonus. We can't say anything for the bathrooms or other facilities but google reviews all sounded like its a well kept place. Only downsides are the highway noise and no facility access after hours. All in all, great place to overnight when you don't wanna end up in a casino or Walmart parking lot. And it doesn't require you to exit the turnpike. 

*Rate this 5 stars

name: NE entrance Ash Meadows NWR
description: BLM just outside Devil’s Hole entrance to Ash Meadows NWR. Flat open area without vegetation. Mountain views. Perfect spot to spend a night while visiting NWR for early morning bird watching within refuge. No cell service Verizon / ATT.

name: 7th Street Laundry
description: This place has showers, bathrooms, vending machines, free wifi, books, and of course...washers and dryers!

name: Street
description: Good streets in area for overnight in camper vans. Lots of streets in this area with signs that only prohibit parking for a few hours on thursdays. Lots of late-night food, groceries, bathrooms etc. CVS, Ralph’s. We stayed in front of an apartment on street. Quiet. We’re able to sleep until 11 am.

name: Roberts Bottom Road
description: BLM dispersed site, one of a handful along this road. Beautiful canyon spot with some wind protection, a nice turnaround, stone campfire ring and plenty to explore on foot. Scout around for quartz and agate, if you're into rockhounding.

name: Echo Bay upper campground
description: There are two developed campgrounds down this road. upper and lower Echo Bay. They’re both just fine campgrounds. they might need a little bit love but they’ll do. The upper campground has a bit more room for bigger rigs. Because of the lowering of the lake neither campground is anywhere near the water. This is our third campground we stayed on Lake Mead. Temple bar and Las Vegas Bay or better kept them this campground.

name: Harbor Bay Campground
description: Large area, some level.  Some covered picnic tables.  Rock and metal fire rings. Lovely lake views.  Hike with sunset vista.  Free for two weeks.

name: Shell station propane
description: Per attendant it's $2.99/gal which seems awfully cheap, we'll see when I go to pay and I will add another comment if that's not the right price.  It's been hard for us to find bulk propane in this town, this is the only spot we were able to find.

name: Bluff Springs
description: There is a sign up online for free camping (which we did) but the campsites were tent only. So we parked down by the little boat launch and stayed for 3 nights with no issues. Verizon reception was OK (with booster). We were the only ones there that camped overnight and the few people that came were fishermen. No one bothered us.

name: Poli Street Ventura
description: there are no signs to indicate any sort of parking restrictions on Poli Street. We stayed here last night and had lovely views over the city and woke up this morning able to see the ocean. There is certainly road noise but nothing that prevented us from sleeping properly. We were able to walk the dog easily and had great phone service.

name: Kerr County Rest Area
description: Lots of trucks come by at night which makes a noisy but if you are not a light sleeper then this is a good place to rest for the night. Clean bathrooms and a dump station included

name: Pleasant Harbor RV
description:
Dry camping up the hill from the ritzy campers in the metro of the Rv park. Nobody around beautiful views quiet. Rocky and a bit rutted but not to bad. 
2 bars Verizon lte. This seems to be a high end all needs met Rv park if you’re not up in the dry camp area. There are tons of workers driving little carts around below catering to folks it appears.

name: Sundance Mobil
description: Laundromat around back. you have to go to store to get change.

name: Lost lake day use area
description: Big dirt lot with access to the lake. No “no camping” signs. Wasn’t bothered. Near a train and highway but not too bad. Lake is pretty. Couple of other cars were here as well. Nice little stop come from Vegas to LA.

name: No Spring Campsite
description: Wild camping near Arivaca on BLM Land. The map shows a spring here but there isn’t one anymore. The campsite has a rock fire ring and probably some shade when the trees are leafed out. Need high clearance to get down the hill.

name: Hwy 19 NB Rest Area
description: Water tap near parking spaces just south of building. Would need a decent length hose, maybe 10-15’ if you pulled up sideways right at the curb. Clean restrooms and nice picnic pavilions, too.

name: Wild camping on Yellowstone River near Terry
description: Found this spot while out exploring. Right beside the Yellowstone River down from a historic railroad bridge repurposed for vehicles. We did not camp here. Likely BLM property but best to check.

name: Silver City ranger district
description: Nice parking area that park any class C.  no signs saying no parking

name: Lake Henshaw Pullout on Hwy 76
description: Large Pullout at Hwy76 with a nice view to the lake. During the day some traffic. We hope it will be quiter at night. Nearly all campgrounds are closed (Covid-19 lock down)

name: Big Loop above Rio Chama
description: Big dirt loop here near the road. Lots of small trees and some privacy. Good for a nap or one full night!

name: Water and all the things!
description: This nice RV park has it all. Water for $10. Propane. A little grocery store. Showers. Super cheap stay too if you need. I couldn't change the rating for whatever reason. I'd give it a 5!

name: Dirty Boy Laundromat
description: Quarters available, nice seating, A/C. Vending machines

name: BLM Big Rock Road
description: No service but quiet spot right off highway. Fire pit nearby. Very little road noise as it isn’t a busy road when we went.

name: Phillips Lake SRA
description:
Great secluded spot with a view of the lake. Follow the gravel road as it meets a dirt road, and then changes to a low maintained road. DO NOT VISIT IF IT THERE'S RAIN, unless you have a 4×4 smaller vehicle. I would not recommend a RV to come through due to the lesser maintained road.

Seems to be where locals come once in awhile. Beer bottles and common trash is scattered off the road. There is a good amount of land to pull off and stay a night. The road has two roundabouts at the end.

name: Cibola NF
description: nice quiet little spot in nature, a bit windy but peaceful. dispersed camping.

name: Drinking Water Spigot
description: The drinking water spigots in between bays at the truck area were shut off for the winter.  The lady inside was super nice and helpful and told me to pull around the side of the building (opposite of Wendy’s) and there’s a working water spigot here.  I parked into the spot closest to the spigot, have a 35’ hose, and it was more than enough.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Right next to the freeway so can be noisy although the sound can also be a white-noise and help you to sleep. Nice spot though for one night.

name: Suire’s Cajun restaurant and grocery
description: Small grocery store with a restaurant with delicious etouffee.. we had the crawfish etouffe that came with gumbo.. also homemade cookies and pies and brownies

name: Bee’s Marketplace DogPark with Potable water
description: Potable water is located inside the fenced dog park under the “Bee’s Marketplace” sign. It has a thread for the hose but you must drape the hose over the fence. Brand new grocery store opened March 3021.

name: Lee Builders Supply
description: Hardware Store, camping supplies, propane

name: Lake Whitney State Park
description: $5 park entry fee, and a free dump. looks like a nice state RV park too. Lots of water spigots to fill water tanks.

name: Reverse osmosis water refill kiosk
description: $0.30 per gallon $1.25 for 5 gallon. Propane at Chevron also available if equipment is working.

name: Uncle Dick Davis Park
description:
What a find! Asphalted RV spots with full hook ups.
Green lawn. Along a road but not a busy road at all. Also right on a river! Lots of birds.. $15 a night and $10 for 65+ers.
Beautiful.. Verizon has 2 bars.. very quiet! Call 337-319-5758 for questions.. we arrived in the pm and called ahead and he said park where you want and I’ll see you in the morning! Very friendly!!

name: Madeira canyon camp
description: 8 sites. Picnic table and fire rings. Nature trails. Cold in winter. No water. No no signs

name: Brewing co
description:
Free gravel parking lot, no signs prohibiting overnight camping.
Talked to the bar guy at brewery, he has left his car overnight here many times no problem. no amenities, very visible.

6/18/22 - I would not recommend coming to this area at all especially not at night.

name: Gallup Cultural center
description: To the west of the Cultural Center there is free parking. Tons of spots available, not big rig friendly but I got my 25 ft RV in here so anything 28 ft ish and under would be fine!

name: Dirt lot off freeway behind hill
description: Big dirt lot just off freeway less than a mile north of pyramid lake. We camped in a van and it was a bit windy and cold at night in mid March. The Mountain view’s were beautiful. It was relatively quiet. Shielded by a hill from noise of highway. Beautiful place to ketch the sunset.

name: Semi-hidden quiet pullout near town
description: Spent a night here in a van the summer without any issue. Decent cell reception. Nice local general store with good grocery selection.

name: free BLM campground with clean vault toilets
description: Stayed here a week in summer even during COVID. Clean, beautiful, lots of birdwatching. Groceries in Spalding around the lake. Good Verizon at campground, less so in the residential area about a mile away. Bring mosquito nets for your windows or repellent. Clean pit toilets.

name: First Crossing - Coyote Canyon
description:
There are many places to camp from the park boundary to the gate (which is locked from June 1st to sometime in the fall). All sites are free and are pull outs/wide spots on the road. Use existing pull outs. 

While the road is marked as a Jeep trail, any high-clearance vehicle can get to the gate - about 5 miles from the beginning of the dirt road. We brought a converted 30’ school bus in towing a Jeep and we’re met by family driving a Prius. Further up the road the Prius would not have made it. 

Cell signal is poor 1-2 bars for both AT&T and T-Mobile. While texting and calls work, data is very slow to non-existent. 

Lots of Ocotillo in bloom (in March) and lots of Cholla - be careful with friends with paws. 

Very peaceful at night with little to no traffic during the week and some weekenders but generally very quiet.

name: BLM south of searchlight
description:
large wide open flat area with fire pits. easily fit half a dozen rigs, probably more. but our friends and us were the only ones when we came. 
nice views of the hills and sunrise/sunsets. 
road in should be taken slow, few bumps here and there.  but its hard packed and easy to drive on. should be no problem for most any vehicle. i pulled in a 30 foot trailer.

i suggest using sattellite view to see the turn off and which eay to go once off the main road. 

full service with tmobile

name: Residential street parking near apartments and Safeway
description: Stayed here at night off and on for a time, in a minivan. Quiet at night. Park nearer the corner away from the front of homes. There’s an apartment building and lots of landscaping on one side.

name: San Juan NF
description:
Great open space. No water. RV friendly. 
Visited early spring. Still lots of snow, mud, swampy areas. Many other roads still closed. Found this spot. No one else around. No wifi. No water.

name: BLM Knoxville Recreational OHV Area
description:
Large open, Staging area, room for several rigs. We are here on Wednesday and plan to leave Friday morning. I imagine it may get pretty busy here on weekends with OHV traffic. Verizion and T Mobile is decent. So far nice and quiet. I'll update this entry with anything of note before we leave.

Update: Plenty of cars driving by and some dual-sport bikes. Nothing disturbing. 

We walked around the area and there's a ton of trash, including an abandoned car. We went back to camp. So depressing. :(

Overnight it was super quiet.

We're moving this morning on to a hopefully better BLM site at Wailaki campground.

name: BLM
description:
This is off the dirt road from the highway. When you pull in, there’s a larger lot that a few vans and RVs were parked in. If you keep driving, there’s two small pull outs and then past that there’s a hill that was a little tough to get up but we did with 2WD (not good for a RV most likely).

Then there was a nice spot with a fire pit and cool rock formations. I’m sure there are more spots past this but we loved this spot and stayed for 2 nights after exploring everything in Valley of Fire!

Also, had great reception!

name: Sedona Public Library
description: great wifi in the parking lot.  Password is on the bulletin board outside the main entrance.

name: Jackson Hot Springs
description: Great big hot spring pool, good bar open late, cheapish rooms, or soak for $10 with a shower. Very Montana hunting lodge, lots of dead mounted animals. Pool was hot, clean, and up to 7 ft deep. $7 if first responder, RN, or military. No covid precautions and no workers wearing masks but a cool stop after skiing and 4 bars Verizon which is hard to get in this area that largely has no cell coverage.

name: Freeman rd dispersed camping
description: Many pullouts along freeman road on state trust land, east of the GPS marker. Beautiful Sonoran Desert with minimal highway noise. Dirt road is wide and well graded. Good Sprint LTE for the first couple miles

name: Pilot Gas Station
description: RV dump available + potable water. Both are located around the back side of the building. There is a sign at the entrance.

name: White Tanks 4
description: Another access point to AZ State Trust Land (make sure to get the $15-$20 pass online). The other road just west of here (to White Tanks 1-3) was deeply rutted as mentioned. This is the location for the nearby "gate" (metal post holding up wire). Easily identified by the sign hung next to it that says "Close Gate". Gravel road easily passable in most vehicles, with lots of spots that people have camped at previously (fire rings, trash, etc). However, the gate is only accessible going eastbound, so you have to find a crossover through the median about 1/2 mi past it and do a U-turn if going westbound. Decent (3-bars) signal on Tmobile.

name: Oak Hollow Family Campground
description: Nice sites next to a lake. All hookups, cable TV and WiFi. We paid $80 for two nights. Some sites are on the lake.

name: Diamond Lakes Campground
description: Nice quiet family campground behind a large outdoor sports complex. Must reserve online. There was no checkin place when we were there. We paid $28.50 (senior price). $5 more if you are young. 😊. Electric and sewers at the site.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Cracker Barrel parking lot. Clean and well lit. Some hwy noise. Felt very safe.

name: Lowe's Buckhannon
description: Free wifi at Lowe's. It reaches to the parking lot and the Microtel lot next door.

name: Tolland State Forest
description:
Situated on a peninsula that juts out into the Otis Reservoir, this 92-site campground offers a unique camping opportunity. Easy access to boating, fishing and swimming as well as mountain biking and hiking trails make this location an outdoor paradise.

Camping season is from mid-May until mid-October. 

Camping is $17/night for Massachusetts residents and $55/night for non-residents.

RV sites have a 35-foot driveway and are non-electric.

name: Pyramid Lake dispersed
description: Right along the lake has a fire pit and 3 bars of Verizon LTE. Great views of the lake and mountains. Close to gas in Nixon

name: Patton Airstrip Labyrinth
description:
It has excellent Verizon service due to proximity to i8.
Beautiful area off of Ogleby and American girl mine Road. A labyrinth is here. Lots of places to hike, walk or just sit and enjoy the views. Can get quite windy. Approximately 17 miles to Yuma for shopping, laundry, fuel...etc. also close to border crossing at Algodones. Totally boondocking. Nearest water and trash 7 miles to the west at rest area.

name: ash fork
description:
Go a little further past the big lot at the beginning where others campers are...dispersed camping, .no road noise, private, a huge hill behind you for hiking, nestled among juniper but still have view...enjoy the little fire pit I made :)
I will definitely come back here!
I give 5 stars!

name: Bearhead Hammock Recreation Area
description: Equestrian campground open to any type of camper, with or without horses.  Three campsites in state forest. Lots of space for any size rig.  The road in does a loop that is supposed to be one-way.  Larger rigs may want to come in the wrong way, to the right.  The road is very wide here and the camping area is just inside the "Exit" sign.  We saw a few vehicles come in this way on the way to the trailheads.  There are corrals for horses and a single vault toilet at the trailhead.  Do not confuse this with the hike-in campground at the north end of Two Mile Tract.  You can make reservations at Reserve America.  Price we paid is $9 a night plus fees.

name: White Tanks East
description: Another spot on Arizona State Trust Land. Accessible from eastbound or westbound. Lots of trails and open spots for rigs of all sizes. 3-4 bars LTE on Tmobile

name: Cabela's
description: Nice spot to stay for a night. We stayed for two nights with no issues. Only complaint is the road noise and multiple trains going by. Wouldn't recommend for light sleepers. Great Verizon reception (with booster)! There is a little fenced in dog park across the way owned by the apartment buildings that we used, which was really nice for our two dogs! No signs saying we couldn't camp and we didn't see anyone else use it while we were parked there for two nights. Also I called to make sure they allow overnight parking and they said yes. There was a dump station on the right side of the building too!

name: Sundance 1 RV Resort
description: Full feature RV Resort. Passport America discounts. 50 amp full hookups. seasonal rates. 2 pools, gym.

name: Blue Crab Municipal Parking
description: Pay to park 10 9am - 11pm May 15 - Sept 15, otherwise pay parking is not enforced!

name: Costco bulk propane fill
description: will fill onboard rv tank as well as small 5 gal cylinders. $2.80/gal at this time. For costco members only.

name: Carrizo Plain boondock spot
description:
Moderator Note: Be aware that the User did not stay overnight. However, the Place is accepted because significant detail is provided.
 
We didn't camp here, but discovered this spot while on a hike while staying at Selby Campground down the hill.   It likely gets very windy here at night. Also, though the road up is steep but flat and doable in most vehicles, there is a significant dip going into the spot from the road.  To get past this dip you'll need a high clearance vehicle or build yourself a bridge or ramps or something. Marking it as unsuitable for big rigs for this reason alone.   Very quiet and peaceful area , very beautiful. After a wet winter the blooms are supposed to be beautiful here.

name: Alpine Creek Lodge
description:
Amazing lodge with incredible food and a full bar (evenings). Lots of day trip opportunities as well. Perfect location for ptarmigan, caribou, moose and bear hunting in the fall.
907-398-9673
Jennifer, Claude and Bob Bondy

name: Cracker Barrel
description:
The usual :-)
Close to Highway and main road, so lots of road noise.
Friendly staff, clean, & it’s free!

name: Laundromat
description: Place not on maps, locals pointed it out to us. 3.50 for big load washer and dryer was pretty cheap as well. Kinda a sketchy place but everyone was nice. 7am - 7pm last wash 5:40

name: Trail 810
description: Couple of pull offs up the road to trail 810 before the cattle guard. Cattle grazing area and some broken glass around. Stone fire pits. Moderately rough road. I didn’t use my 4WD until maybe a half mile up the road. I ended up using the pull offs relatively close to the beginning of the road. Pretty quiet and nice view. A truck with an overcab camper went up the whole road presumably with 4wd and they didn’t come back down before I left in the morning so I assume there’s more pull offs up the road as well.

name: No Overnighting in Parks!
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per city ordinance camping is prohibited, fines will be enforced. No Overnighting in Parks!

name: Bertrand RV park
description: $10 for dump, and $5 for water only. Self pay. Very nice people.

name: Bertrand RV park
description: $10 for dump and water if not staying at park. Self pay.

name: Ute Lake State Park
description: Primitive sites are currently closed for COVID, but this would make one heck of a stay during normal times. Each site on the water has a water spigot. Don’t believe it’s potable, but would still be nice to have. The views are stunning and each site has a covered cabana. Awfully windy on the lake but absolutely gorgeous and so blue.

name: Trailer Village RV park
description: Tons of spots here for RV's or camper vans only, no tent spots. About 40+ spots half of them are back-in but there are many pull through spots so perfect for big RVs. There is a coin laundry, small little library, dumpsters, propane, wifi, and bathrooms with showers. Each spot has full hookup; sewer, electric, and water. great RV Park and the people at the front were super nice!! I am not sure the pull through spot price, but my back-in spot was $26! Also very pet friendly!

name: Trailer Village RV Park
description: There is a propane station at this RV park, the price per gallon is about $3.50 so a little pricey but it works if you are in the area!

name: Avi's water spigot
description:
free, next to the gas station. "no RV parking" sign
-potable
-overnight parking in same parking lot, you are allowed to get water here.

name: Tule Patch Spring
description: Small rest stop alongside hwy. A few car spots on the west side and larger rig space across street. Spent the night with a semi for company. A few semi trucks went thru overnight but noise wasn't too noticable. This place appears busy in summer so ability to stopover might be seasonal.

name: Walmart
description: Park in the back corner spot on the auto center side. You’ll see a tent with picnic tables and trash cans.  I assume this is an employee break area, but I arrived around 5pm and left around 8am; didn’t see anyone using it at all. Slept 7h41m without earplugs. Didn’t hear any trucks all night. Tons of lights & cameras. The other side by the Pickup area has more parking spaces, but it’s where all of the employees park so I figured it would be loud and that’s probably the way the trucks enter the back area to drop deliveries

name: Gravel Parking
description: Lots of space to park. Only one other camper was parked nearby. Beautiful sunset and sunrise views!

name: City Water Spigot
description:
@ Murphy USA
I asked permission first and the lady said it was no problem
They have their own hose attached to it if you need it, but it was an easy disconnect and I used my own
Close to the parking area, which has a little bit of a slope

name: Chief Ladiga Trail via Germania Springs Park
description:
Lovely & Quaint park to spend a few hours relaxing or exercising
Chief Ladiga Trail is great for biking, running, walking, etc.
There is also a DOG PARK with an obstacle course and water.
Picnic tables & trash located throughout

name: Medix Grade Road site #8
description: One of 10 free campsites in Moshannon State Forest near Quahanna Wild Area. MUST register in advance to reserve site. NO cellular service along road. Some sites level, some suitable for tents only

name: Robinson Preserve Expansion
description: Several water spigots beside the road and picnic tables. Some appear to be set up to rinse off kayaks, but there are not any signs warning that they're non-potable. Also, the spigots all have backflow preventers (which suggests that the water is fresh and being protected against contaminants.)

name: Old Lock 1
description: Old Lock site with campground, flush toilets, trash cans, picnic tables, grills and pavilion. Man here was friendly and explained he was the campground host and camping here is free. Right on the Tombigbee River.

name: Road Runner Gas Station
description: Two water spigots by the pumps. The water was a little brown coming out at first so be warned. It cleared up after running it for awhile.

name: Coconino National Forest 9515
description: Several spots along National Forest Roads. Very quiet, much less campers than in Sedona. Full bars t-mobile reception.

name: Laundry
description:
Nice laundry with lots of large washers. Free WiFi & decent bathroom. 
It’s Usually pretty clean except today. 
Snacks, pop, two change machines.

This used to be a drive-thru so it’s right on the corner of 2nd & Poplar, and has a big garage door.

name: Coconino National Forest
description: Plenty of parking. 2WD van drove just fine through the area towards our parking spot for the night. Quiet area with beautiful views!

name: Carrizo Plain boondocking
description:
Legal dispersed camping on a secondary dirt road.  North of established KCL campground, which was full when I got there. 
Best for vans or cars without trailers.  It is a level spot near a bend in the road.

name: Site #17 ANF
description: Stream side parking with tent camping below and across the stream. Multiple fire rings and beautiful creek running through. Parked 21 foot class B camper in space and stayed the night. Sleeping amongst the hemlocks!

name: Toad Pond
description: Nice large pull off from the road with a fire ring. Near hiking trails. Had a large puddle full of toads when we visited in March. Easy to get to. I wouldn’t recommend taking your moms civic but you don’t need 4x4

name: Holiday / Sinclair gas
description: They have RV gas pump lanes, they also have propane. Clean bathrooms & mad snacks. Easy to get in and out. BOMB VIEWS.

name: Ute Lake State Park
description: Decent campground on a lake. Level sites with water and electric. Can’t beat this place for $18 a night.

name: Ruby's campground showers
description: Clean showers, $8 per person (as of 4/15/2022) if you don't stay at campground, unlimited time. Check in at the office to get code. Bring your own shampoo/towel

name: Stevenson City Park Campground
description:
Wow! What a gem! 

Cost: $10!
Ray, a.k.a. “Chopper”, a man who works for the city came by and said through the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) and Stevenson City Hall (104 Kentucky Ave, Stevenson, AL 35772, United States) a camper should stop by city hall on their way in, pay, and stay the day until sunset the following day! Worth it! In fact, he said he was heading that way, took my name and $10, then showed back up with a one page document and my pass.

There is electric (30, 20), potable water, and trash cans provided.

Water is potable, had a strong flow, and we topped off our tanks.

The trash cans were placed at each pole (which hosted two plugs, two water spigots, with standard RV spacing equal to that of a RV park.

No dumping of grey/black water offered.

The ground/field is all mostly perfectly level. Of note, watch the forecast. I checked the historical data before arriving to ensure that there has been limited rainfall due to the low lying area around this park. Aka... don’t get stuck.

The spaces are backed up against a beautiful tree-line along the Eastern edge. So if you’re solar preferred, you’ll have to move to catch any rays of sun before noon.

There was light vehicle movement all night, on a Saturday night, which is normal because there’s a boat launch directly west by Southwest under a mile away.

Check the photos! Peace!

name: rest area
description: water spigot by bathrooms. looks like hose will attach.

name: Deseret Peak Wilderness Area - North Willow Creek
description:
3 camping areas located right off the river with fire pits.
Well maintained with some cute areas to sit & enjoy the river. Very quiet, zero traffic besides me. Good trees for shade but also some open areas for camp setup. Some trash unfortunately, picked up what I could.
Can be a bit muddy and rocky (March) but manageable.
Very secluded & safe

Cell service 3-5 bars

name: Sunset viewpoint
description: perfect place to watch the sunset then camp afterwards nearby in numerous dispersed campsites, all with fire rings.  spot is a scenic overlook overlooking Skull valley to the right and Wilhoit the the left.

name: Double Gate BLM
description: You don’t get much more secluded than this! Great spot down Silverbell Rd, then take the side road to east to these coordinates. Road has signs for “high pressure gas lines”. The road is long and bumpy. You’ll definitely need a high clearance vehicle but not necessarily 4x4. You’ll go through a cattle gate (a sign asks politely for you to close the gate so please remember to!) and take the road all the way down to a second gate. Don’t go through the second gate but instead follow the road to the right. You’ll soon see the site. Established fire ring. Great views of the mountain.

name: Gunlock State Park
description: This is a campsite on the Gunlock reservoir. It only has five campsites and they are non-reservable. The campsites have tables and fire pits and the pit toilets. There is no water and no dump Station. There is good cell service for both Verizon and AT&T. The view of the Reservoir is nice and there is good hiking across the dam on the other side of the Reservoir. The cost is $20 per night which seems a bit high considering what is available there. There is also a trash dumpster

name: Forest Road
description: small pull off on a decent forest road.  Good for a night, or two.

name: Dayton Field Pullout
description: This is a massive pullout that can fit a couple semi's. I truck camped here for about 3 months. It's near a road that doesn't get too much traffic and is pretty quiet at night. Lots of deer and turkeys in the area. Also can see the stars really well.

name: Snow park
description: California off-highway snow-park at Senora pass road closure for winter. Flat and paved, with pit toilets. Stayed in my van. Permit only and I think they do give tickets without permit ($25 season). Sign says limit of 3 nights. I just put on snow shoes and hiked into the forest with my dog. Pretty peaceful and secluded. Been here a couple times. No cell signal w AT&T.

name: Home Depot
description: 1305 S Lone Hill Ave, Glendora, CA 91740. NW corner of the Home Depot parking. Call (909) 592-0691 to ask for permission. They will let you park overnight for one night only. Keep it clean so they continue to allow us there. Within walking distance of Starbucks and other fast food restaurants. Most cities to the west of here have anti-RV and overnight parking ordinances making this one of the first locations going eastbound and one of the last going westbound.

name: Maternity Well Group site
description: Large group site that could accommodate 3-4 RVs comfortably. Free camping on BLM land north of Sonoita, AZ. Reservation is only required part of the year, but as long as it is not reserved for a group, they allow solo camping on it for up to 14 days. You can verify any potential reservations by calling the Tucson BLM office. Water available at nearby Empire Ranch historic site, which is a fun area a few miles away for history and hiking. This area has many other BLM camping spots very nearby if this one doesn't meet your requirements.

name: Juniper Rangeland
description: Open rangeland up dirt road. Amazing views into valley. Very private and not near anything. Very rough unmaintained road. High clearance vehicle needed. 4gLTE  cell phone service is available for Tmobile and verizon.

name: Smokemont np campsite
description: I’d rate this site a 6/10. We were in loop a(non generator). Sites were on top of each other w nothing in between, and the campgrounds weren’t anything special. But our site was on the river which was nice. As well as fairly close proximity to the heart of the park. 25 a night , flush bathrooms w electricity. Dump station to. Must book on recreation

name: Murphy Gas Station
description: Water spigot on side of building. almost all Murphy (and seem seem to have spigots).

name: Great views and very secluded.
description: Great Mountain View very quiet and isolated.

name: Dateland RV Park
description: Kind of a funky RV park between the highway and the train track. Full hookups, $18.00 a night.  A few spots for overnight guests.  Pay at gift shop.

name: South City Park, Opeleusas, LA
description: park in an old neighbour hood that offers 50/30 amp and water hook ups for $11 a night. a friendly park warden is around from 3-11 to direct to a spot and collect fees. there is a dump within the park too. a little run down but we had no issues, gates to park close 11pm-6am

name: Basha's supermarket
description: Seek permission from the manager to stay 1 night in the back of the car park as far from the entrance to the supermarket as possible. parking spots are fairly level, try to take up as little space as possible. We purchased items from the store before staying the night.

name: Eight Dollar Mountain Free Dispersed
description: Random spots beyond the bridge. Good Verizon and T Mobile. Sounds of the river nearby. Minimal solar.  Lot's of traffic so far especially for a Monday. I'll update with anything of note.

name: Cliff edge river view with great fire pit
description: Very secluded spot right at the edge of a cliff overlooking Waterville lake and i40. Came up Wilkins Creek road entrance just down and across from the welcome center. Very technical to get to and very tight roads. Definitely not for BIG rigs or trailers. Made it in our first gen tundra. Need clearance and 4x4. Nice big fire pit with grill, great view. Some noise from highway but very private, use the satellite view from google maps and you’ll find your way. Full bars of metro and at&t

name: Hells Half Acre camp site
description: Nice spot at end of dirt road approximately 2 miles off highway 93. Limited cell service, relatively level, fire ring, well used desert campsite.

name: k2 dispersed camping, beautiful
description: Awesome area just off rt 9, less than 15 min to zion.  Beautiful views, mostly flat, nice shrubs, fire pits, small restaurant 7 minutes away, decent Verizon cell service,  multiple spots to pick from, 2wd is fine. Take second left off side road to get in here. 5 stars

name: Aquatic Center - Tualatin Hills
description: Paid showers. $3.00 pp for 15/20 minutes. Due to covid, you must bring your own towels, shampoos and conditioner.  Ladies at the desk were super friendly and happy to help.

name: Non Potable Water
description: non potable water available right next to the dog park

name: Dog Park at Love's with Non potable water
description: Two separate areas for dogs. Completely fenced in. Super nice. Has non potable water you can full up

name: Sinclair water and dump station
description: Fresh water, non potable, air and Dump ststion at this gas station..all free

name: Sunset + mountain views
description:
Large, Van-size, pull off that is road pull off and entrance to cattle road. Can pull perpendicular to traffic to minimize headlights shining in your van. 

2bars on Verizon. Great sunset views!

Be sure to stay off grass during dry seasons to avoid starting a fire from the heat of your car.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart off Atlanta Highway. Had no truck parking signs but trucks were parked. Massive parking lot stayed two nights and three days no problem!

name: Chevron
description: Propane tanks filled at a local gas/service station. Easy access on and off interstate.

name: Sanders Propane Express
description: Great pricing and customer service!! Would definitely recommend

name: New Mexico Badlands Overlook (close to road)
description: Came in late last night and just parked at this pull off close to the main road. Woke up to the beautiful New Mexico Badlands. I went on a short walk with my dog both ways and took in the sights for a little before heading out. The place was quiet all night (I stayed in my conversion van). As with most badlands, it was windy. This place is definitely for camper vans and car campers. RVs and bigger campers won’t fit. Great AT&T reception. There are also a couple of picnic tables, gazebos, and a pit toilet about 200 yards from this area.

name: K’esugi Ken Campground
description: State Park Campground. Amazing view of the Alaska Range. $30 per RV. Great toilet paper.

name: Arizona Trail Intersection
description: On South Pistol Hill Road. There is room for 4 to 5 short campers, depending how people park there. Besides walking the trail, it’s a popular biking trail. It’s easy and probably not challenging enough for serious off-road bikers but a good trail for those who don’t want challenging off-road biking. Some traffic on the unpaved road but not too bad. Several through-hikers passed through. Not totally level. Quiet.

name: Pinnacle Propane
description: easy in & out to get propane. nice guys, & right off the highway...

name: BLM camp near Belly of the dragon trail
description: Nice campspot along the creek. pretty crowded since there is trail nearby. Perfect ATT service. zero Sprint service. no amenities. No road noise except occasional ATVs passing by on the gravel road. Verizon reception is spotty.

name: Kershaw Ryan State Park
description: This is a nice state park campground. It has access to both hiking trails and mountain biking trails. Be aware that there is almost no cell service because it is in a canyon. It has good bathrooms and showers. Showers cost about 50 or $.75. We had a good experience here

name: Virginia welcome center
description: Right across the boarder on 77N. Kinda noisy, typical rest stop

name: Walmart
description: Overnights allowed. They request you park towards the back on the side of the strip mall. Huge, level parking lot. Clean and safe. Go major road, but noise wasn’t an issue; only downside is trains at night, but it works for an overnighter.

name: Nice spot on side of very small road
description:
This site has everything - nice size for a single rig or maybe 2, it's on a road that isn't even on google maps (we saw only 2 people in 3 days), several hiking trails 0.4 miles away at the intersection of FS90 and FS16. Another couple of hikes down at the end of FS16. Even a bathroom built by boy scouts 0.2 miles up the trail at FS90 and FS16. (I think up the Bushwacker Trail).

To find this spot, off of US58, take FS90 going north. Although maps show FS90 going a long way, it actually dead ends after about 30-45 min of driving. At the dead end, take FS16. The spot is on the left after about 0.4 miles. If this site is full, you can go another half mile down FS16 to its end and camp there. 

Road was decent for our AWD. Might be tricky for someone pulling a trailer.

name: Hurricane Gap Rd.
description: Two very large sites, one on each side of Hurricane Gap Rd. We tried to find a site on Lower Paint Creek Rd, but there is only one designated dispersed site that was not very nice. From Paint Creek Campground, take Hurricane Gap Rd. for 30-45 min. Probably don't need 4WD.

name: Dead end road off Holston Creek Rd
description:
Nice big clearing at end of very easy hard packed dirt road. Off of Holston Creek Rd.

We had good wifi with a signal booster and Verizon.

Lots of wood around.

This forest is hard to find a place to camp in as most of the gates to small roads are closed. Several people came to look at this place in the two days we were there. Also a group of 11 vehicles with locals came to party, but when they saw us there they were respectful and left, saying whoever gets there first has it.

name: End of Holston Creek Rd
description: Large clearing at end of road. Easy to drive here. Lots of wood around. We had good Verizon cell with a signal booster.

name: Coso Junction Rest Stop
description: Fresh water spout at rest stop, easy to miss, but is right next to the lamppost out front.

name: Athens Cracker Barrel
description: secluded spot in back of Cracker Barrel. fits my promaster but nothing longer. just regular parking spaces. walmart is right next door. it was quiet all night but I got blocked in my loud delivery trucks in the morning for a few minutes.

name: Henderson's Wharf Marina
description:
Inquire at the hotel. I paid $20 per day to park in a lot that serves liveaboard boaters. There is a bathhouse with showers and flush toilets. 

The location is super convenient. It's a 5-minute walk to the heart of the Fells Point neighborhood (bars, restaurants) and maybe 15 minutes to the Inner Harbor tourist trap. 

The lot is gated, which is good, because Baltimore is a tough town.

name: Fair Park in Hope AK.
description: City park with plenty of water spigots to fill up. Good restrooms as well.

name: Dissolved Ancient Seabed Canal [BLM]
description:
Potash is a mineral used as a fertilizer. It exists as ore deep in the earth. One mining technique is to pump water into the ore to dissolve it and pump it to the surface. Once at the surface the dissolved ore flows to a processing facility to be re-evaporated into crystals. 

pretty light blue-green canal pullout near interstate. 

Feels isolated even though the highway can be seen and heard.

name: Exxon
description: Dump station and water hydrant, doesn't say potable, doesn't say it's not so I screwed my filter on before filling my tank. Easily accessible for big rigs.

name: Stoddard Valley OHV Area East
description: Nice open Sandy areas just off the highway but it’s not a busy highway with very little road noise. Off road vehicle trails are all around but make nice walking paths to the hills not far away. There is plenty of space for multiple RVs of all sizes. There are no amenities but there are rock fire pits throughout the open areas.

name: Uncle Sud’s Laundry Roswell
description: Rather spacious area with plenty of seating and the parking lot is gigantic so it could easily fit a few 5th wheels. Also, please don’t use bleach at public laundries.

name: Parking lot
description: Large parking lot next to a Carl's Jr. no signs declaring ownership or restrictions on parking overnight. several commercial trucks parked for the night as well as a couple of RVers. We spent the night and we're not bothered by anyone other than it being a fairly busy truck stop area.

name: Free Tulare Water Pollution Control
description: Pull up outside of the gate and align your black tank without hose and dump then rinse off with water hose provided.

name: Large, well lit parking lot.
description:
Random paved lot on a busy road. The parking lot was full of cars and CalTrans trucks during the day. Only my van and two other cars were there all night. 

The lot has no signs indicating what the space is intended for. It also does not say no overnight parking. There are no trash cans, no water, and there is a lot of ongoing traffic from the nearby street.

However, it’s only an hour from Yosemite Valley and the adjoining cow pasture was blooming with lovely spring wildflowers and oak trees.

And full bar reception on Verizon so I got a few hours of work done. Also full bars T-Mobile and AT&T.

name: Bass Pro Shop
description:
Bass Pro Shop that allows overnight RV parking!  We asked and they said absolutely, just make sure to park out of the way.  I came over to the side where the boats are.
It’s near the Highway and lots of main roads and other stores, so it’s pretty loud.
There’s also a ton of food options nearby.

name: General store
description: Dump station and potable water. No signs saying not free. Showers, laundry and a store as well (showers laundry closed rn due to covid)

name: Camping world
description:
Free dump station. Even had a hose already hooked up. Although there is no water to fill and/or flush it’s nice to have a free dump station 

user reports it is only for Good Sam membership otherwise it is à private property, please confirm and report issues. it's forbidden to use water and dumping Station, only for good Sam members. it is under video surveillance and police will come and arrest you

name: Creekside dispersed camps
description: A few different spots hillside to a creek (just before the Grover Hot Springs). Theres one spot with easy access for 1-3 cars (2WD). Several other spots further down a steep road (4WD). No Campfires allowed here. No T-Mobile service.

name: Echo Canyon Road
description: 2.4 miles off paved road. Camping is allowed once you get past 1 mile marker.

name: San Juan River Colorado
description: North of Pagosa Springs. Several places alongside the river.

name: Walmart Parking Lot
description: Large Walmart parking lot. We parked lookers right of the auto center. There were a few teens hanging out with loud sun-woofers but they were harmless and eventually left us with a quiet restful night of sleep tucked up against the trees.

name: Ace Hardware Propane
description: In front of the store have a gas propane filler for any RV

name: National Forest
description: This spot is in the bend in the road just past the main areas. It’s pretty open for a small space so you can catch some solar. Ground is not very level but if you position yourself across the dips it’s not too bad. It could probably fit a few vans no problem. It’s very secluded and the whole forest is very quiet. Two locals showed up and went further down the road and came back an hour later. One was in a Camry and didn’t seem to have any issues. The road is gravel but there are some very large rocks mixed in. If airing down your tires is something you’re into I would definitely advise that. Just take your time and pick your route wisely and you’ll be just fine in any rig. If you come in from Roswell like I did, the elevation gain is very subtle so check weather before coming in. My buddy heater struggled with the altitude. Up the road 5 minutes is a town that has many restaurants and cafes as well as a Family Dollar. Cute place. 2-3 bars of T-Mobile 5G! 10/10 spot!

name: RV Dump Station
description: Free dump station associated, but separate from the Edisto Campground. Appears to be available to anyone, no gates or guards. Water available for rinsing- not potable.

name: frenchglen hotel state wayside
description: Small wayside park next to the frenchglen hotel. Water spigot on the right side as you pull in.

name: Lead Lake campsite : Stillwater NWR
description: One of two dry ‘parking areas’ approved for overnight camping in Stillwater NWR. If you are into bird watching this place is amazing. White pelicans, harriers, ducks, coots, herons, shorebirds.... the water levels vary so... in 3/3021 this was the better site to be at. Good verizon. Ok ATT with weboost.

name: Lincoln Point Parking
description:
This is a gravel parking lot for public Utah Lake access. It is slightly slanted away from the road but otherwise flat. There is room for 6-8 small and medium vehicles. It would be best for a van or small class B. There are no signs indicating no overnight parking and I was unable to find anything about it online.

I stayed for an afternoon and overnight. It was  a popular sunset spot, but all the cars left after that. The road was busy and fast, but I didn't hear any cars after about 10:00pm. There is a nice rocky beach on the shore of the lake with several fire pits. Awesome spot with beautiful sunset and sunrise. Also a cool view of Provo at night.

Good cell signal with Verizon.

name: County Fairgrounds
description: $5 for pumpout and $5 for water. Takes credit cards. Water is on timer $5/5min. Unknown how many gallons/min.

name: Cottonwood Creek Beach
description:
Really nice sandy beach on Cottonwood Creek, off Cottonwood Canyon Road. 

Totally private and secluded. Fire ring here, but if gone, easy to build another with plenty of loose rocks in the area. 

We did it in our 2WD Sprinter but I would not bring a trailer or RV here. You can get stuck on beach sand, so park on non-sandy parts. 1-2 bars of AT&T, very slow data.

name: Bass Pro Shops Outdoor World
description: Large parking lot in downtown Oklahoma City with amazing Centennial Land Run Monument (large bronze public art) adjacent to store parking. We stayed here in our 40ft converted school bus with no problems!

name: Conrad Crossing Campground
description:
Conrad Crossing Campground features 8 camp units (3 on the river and 5 above the highway), potable water (June-October), vault toilets, and a day use area. Please observe the Pack it In Pack it Out refuse policy. Attractions include historic Montana Trail, St. Joe Wild and Scenic River, fishing, and floating until mid June.
Open Memorial Day - November 4th.
$15/ night if water pump in operational or $12/ night when pump handle is removed and $5.00 for third vehicles.

name: Tin Can Flat Campground
description: Tin Can Flat Campground features 11 camp units, potable water (June-October), and vault toilets. Please observe the Pack it In, Pack it Out refuse policy. Attractions include St. Joe Wild and Scenic River, fishing, floating (until mid-July).

name: Parking Area Edson Creek Campground
description: The Edson Creek Campground was closed at the time we arrived. A government employee who just happened to be on the road when we drove in said it opens in May. We didn't have any other options so we decided to camp in the parking turnout next to the group camping area. We were able to access the day use area and walk down to the river. The area is gorgeous! There's quite a bit of traffic as there's a private road just above where we parked. There were also many locals that came in with their dogs to access the river. A horse arrived just before sunset to graze on grass and daisies right by our camp. Our best guess is he belonged to a nearby neighbor. He was a welcome visitor. No cell service at camp, but was able to get a weak signal near the river. Definitely not a long term spot while the campground is closed, but a good overnight option in a pinch. Pit toilets are onsite, but not open.

name: Water spigot
description: Water spigot next to the propane and air

name: BLM off of old 99
description:
take exit 1 if coming northbound from cali.  i believe its exit 5 if coming southbound. 
just a couple miles up from exit one theres a turn off on a dirt roadm and like a qtr mile down that road is the flat grassy area.
plenty big enough for a couple rvs or a few vans. 
there will be plenty enough room to turn around our truck and 30 foot trailer when its time to leave. 
nice views of the woods and mountains. far enough from the highway to not hear the trucks driving by.

name: The Clothes Bin
description: Coin or Wash'n'Fold laundry services. $3 loads or $1.75/lb. Miss Lilly is a saint and a pleasure to chat with.

name: Park & Starkey Laundromat
description: Very clean place with great AC. Near plenty of other shops within walking distance

name: Between Tumbling Waters Trl & Ridgeway Rec Area
description: Just a parking spot at the fork in the road near Tumbling Waters Trail and Ridgeway Recreation Area. (free) Stayed one night in our camper van. Not suitable for large rvs. However, there is a big parking area at the boat ramp near Tumbling Waters Trail. It's not very level though and there is a pay booth at the entrance. Not sure how much the fee is or if overnight parking is permitted. Didn't see any signs saying you couldn't. Road in is a little over 3 miles from 76. Paved, 2 lanes. The road to Ridgeway Recreation Area was closed. 1-2 bars of T-Mobile service. There are toilets at the boat ramp but I didn't check to see if they were open.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart shopping center with free overnight parking. Small lot but row of parking spaces in the back near the garden center. Called ahead to check with manager.

name: Timber Camp Recreation Site
description: USDA Forest Service campground with 14 campsites, bathroom facilities, and a day use area. $16/night or free with certain passes (see photos or check online). No wifi, but very exceptional cell service. Nice sites for tent or big rigs. Some noise from US-60 but not too bad. (wouldn't let me update stars, but 4/5)

name: Camp spot on Mojave Road
description: Nice open area.  Good LTE, space for several campsites although not much traffic at all on a weekday.  Weekends might be different.

name: Barker Canyon Boat Launch
description: Variety of lakeside sites west of the Barker Canyon Boat Launch. GPS location has shade and a small beach, but there are other spots nearby. There is a pit toilet at the boat launch. When reaching the boat launch info sign, turn right (rather than left, towards the boat launch) to reach these sites. Marginal cell service.

name: Blm camping
description: Close to many others but I wanted to point out where I’m at had a pit toilet maybe 3 minute walk away at a trailhead and it is the best one I’ve ever seen. Luxury to have within walking distance. Many other sites down the road. Relatively flat.

name: Geronimo trail
description: Several places along Geronimo trail. Some fine for vans. This was good for our 20ft trailer.  Border patrol said they were see more smuggling and just keep your eye open.

name: Turn out
description: There are a few turn outs in the road to camp.  Nice views and quiet.

name: Conoco
description: Conoco station has free air and water. Also a dump station but not sure if they charge for it.

name: Little Walnut Road
description: Wide semi flat pullout in the forest. Big enough for our Suburban and 20ft trailer.

name: Clark Fork  Recreation area
description: Well maintained dirt road (No high clearance needed).  Not really for big rigs.  Lovely shaded campsites right by the river with fire pits.  3 bars LTE for Verizon, 1-2 bars ATT.  St Regis Travel Center only 15 min away for any supplies.  Great spot

name: Lake Isabella South Fork
description:
Free with any National Parks (e.g. America the Beautiful) annual pass. Otherwise $10/day. There’s a machine on your left as you pull in.

It is a large gravel bank about 150 yards wide that slopes down to the water and wide open for camping. Getting level is a challenge higher up, but you can drive down to water where it’s more level. Sand is soft in places but stick to the gravel roads and you won’t get stuck. RVs of every shape and size able to fit anywhere.

Cell service very strong on ATT.

name: Big Bear Transfer Station
description: Large dirt lot next to the Big Bear Transfer Station (dump). Actually quite a nice area, and a quick drive into Big Bear Lake. Room for multiple vehicles. Located at the end of a dead end paved road, almost no traffic once the dump closes for the night. There are a few 4x4 roads in the area (occasional traffic) and the PCT is just a hundred yards away. Employees for the dump did start coming in around 6:30am so you may be awoken by them driving in.

name: Recycling Center
description: 24 hour recycling. no plastic, no glass. yes cardboard, paper, tin, steel. other recycling areas in town take plastic but close at 5pm. Google them.

name: Athens Walmart Supercenter #1400
description: Walmart parking lot. Open until 11pm due to COVID. I see other Vans and RVs here. I had no issues staying here.

name: Rosewood Landing
description: Rosewood landing 4698 Peachwood Ct, Myrtle Beach, SC 29588. Single boat launch with medium sized, natural surface, parking area. part of neighborhood with mostly double-wide modular houses a few larger two story. 1 picnic table, City Park type trash can and fire ring that we did not utilize. Over the course of Friday evening and night about 8 cars staying from 3 minutes to 60 minutes. one of two street lights operable on pole with cameras. picked up a bag of trash  on the side where we parked . Woke up to very distant white noise of Highway, owls and songbirds. We would stay here again. 3 bars T mobil

name: West Texas 4 Wheel and Off-road
description: Off-road truck repair shop that helped us out because we had a sag issue in the rear of our Tacoma. Mark fit us in the day after Christmas in a pinch. Added a lead spring to bolster the suspension and correct the issue. A real straight shooter. If you are in the area and need any work done on your rig give him a call.

name: Love’s
description: Convenient to crash for the night. Massive parking area for trucks and fairly large and quieter area for RVs and vans.  I parked in the RV section and had a good night sleep. Clean bathrooms, good cell reception and good selection of restaurants.

name: Forest road 225
description: Large area with several roads and places to camp.

name: Kitch-iti-kipi
description:
Kitch-iti-kipi ("KITCH-i-tee-KI-pee" with short "i"s)[1] is Michigan's largest natural freshwater spring.[1][2][3] The name means "big cold spring" in the Ojibwe language.[1] 
Kitch-iti-kipi spring is one of the major tourist attractions on Michigan's Upper Peninsula.[4] It is located in Thompson Township of Schoolcraft County, northwest of the town of Manistique, within Palms Book State Park.[6][7]

name: Flying J Travel Center
description: Large, well lit travel center / truck stop with dedicated RV parking marked. Not the quietest - semi trucks idling all night - but safe. Pulled in around 10pm and saw several other vans/RVs.

name: Lake Hefner Marina
description: Public Marina owned by City of OKC. Water spigot across road from the marina has a gravel pull-out next to it, allowing you to pull up alongside it within 3 feet. Pump is not locked - just bring your own hose!

name: Walmart Primo water dispenser
description: Seems like the only place to find a purified water dispenser in town. Inside Walmart, soon after the entrance on the right, before the gate. $0.29/gal. Was instructed by Walmart associate the code to the self-check out station for refill is “9510” and then quantity in gallons.

name: Gallup Propane
description: Propane dealership north on main road at exit 16 in west Gallup, NM. About a mile up. You may think you are leaving town. Easy in. Can see fill-up as soon as you pull in. Two young men came right out to help me. Paid $2.05 a gallon on April 2, 2021.

name: Mission Beach free parking
description: Free place to park until 10pm! Plenty of space for RVs along the edge of the lot

name: Lafayette Park
description:
Free parking by Lafayette Park. It’s a beautiful park at the top of the hill in Pacific Heights. Park bathrooms are open 8a-6p daily and are generally clean. Has a dog park. I’ve met plenty of random people here and had great conversations.

I started parking here last summer when SF did away with all parking restrictions. Also, they have been reintroduced and now Monday-Friday 8a-6p the streets around the park are 2hr parking only (but not paid). I usually get here Friday nights and leave Sunday nights now. I’ve stay here too many times to count, never been bothered by anyone or had anyone try to break into my van.

Pretty quiet at night. Park has huge trash bins that I use for dumping my trash bags. The north side of the park (Washington) has flat parking spots and is the most quiet. East side is also flat, but on Gough which is busy even at night.

name: Walmart
