description: RV sites with water and electricity- $35, tent sites $15. Pretty because it's right on the water, includes a free shower, boat launch.

name: Brewster Free Wi-fi Hotspot
description: Free wi-fi hotspot at Columbia Cove Community Center. A parking lot with school athletic fields adjacent. Paid camping nearby at Columbia Cove Park.

name: Central Ferry Canyon
description: Flat parking area in the middle of a wildlife area. Road is dirt but recently graded, easy with 2wd or even RV's. Larks, coyotes and balsamroot- but hot mid summer without shade and snowy in winter.

name: Methow River- Irv Conner Public Fishing
description: Fishing and boat take out parking lot next to the river. Its not great, but not bad either. Didn't see any signs prohibiting overnight stays but I'd still be a bit stealthy about it. Pit toilet, decent wireless signal.

name: Methow Free Wi-Fi Hotspot
description: Down a dead end road with a burned out trailer and an old shed. Obscure place to have it, but it is here even way out there and free.

name: Bill Shaw Road Public Fishing
description: Flat gravel parking lot with a pit toilet, need a Discovery Pass, but otherwise free. No one ever uses it because the route to the river is treacherous, but it's a nice parking lot with views of the river and mountains, and fairly quiet besides the highway across the river.

name: Olds Station Industrial Area
description: Lots of free unrestricted parking in this industrial area, showers nearby at the State Park.

name: Willard island park
description: place to cook out with power at gazebo picnic tables. part of hammonasset park. you get there going through hammonasset park. nature trail to island and around it.

name: Mirabel Park
description: Campsites / RV resort. Basic and affordable. Visited during Covid, so every other space was left open. Don’t be intimidated by the locals, it’s an affordable spot right on the river.

name: MS rest stop
description: Rest stop for cars, Tricks and RVs with RV dump station & water

name: Recycling Bins
description: Larger recycling bins adjacent to city park.

name: Valero Gas
description: Pumps are openand operational to fill up. but currently the store is closed for in-store purchases due to construction

name: Valero Free Air & Water
description:
Located on the front corner of the building. Short hose, non threaded type. May not be good for drink/possible non potable - couldn't confirm with anyone there.
You may most likely get potable water and use showers at the RV ground down the side road

name: Among the short Pines just off 261 near Natural Bridges NM
description: Old Jeep trail off 261 going South, entrance is a diagonal trail that takes off to the West. Drove in about 1/2 mile, secluded and flat

name: Access trail to Wild Camping near Natural Bridges NM
description: Remote trail accessible by 2x, good view of Bears Ears. A few flat areas for 1 or 2 vehicles

name: Walmart-largo
description:
We stayed here for one night. We were the only ones here so we’re kind of worried we’d get kicked out! But when we woke there were a bunch of other RVs and campers here. Nice Walmart. Nice area. No creepers or loud noise at all. You can’t hear the highway. Perfect if you’re coming from honeymoon Island as the distance isn’t more than a half an hour away. 
Good service of course. 5G 3 bars At&t.

name: Chester City Park Campground
description: 2 small campsites at the pavilion at Croop St and Nebraska 8, another 5 RV sites at Church St along Nebraska 8.  We stayed next the pavilion here and once in 2011, no cost for one night either time.

name: Roadside parking
description: A few spots on side of road. Minimal cell service. No signs prohibiting camping or overnight parking. Great views.

name: Whigham City Park
description: Stopped overnight at this city park, had to go to the Police Station to register.  No Fee for my first night.  Some road noise but no worse than a truck stop.  Camping with electricity, who can complain.

name: Luna Mystica
description: This is a hotel with a dozen or so restored trailers for rent. They have RV parking and an area for tent and van camping. It’s $10 per night or $50 per week. WiFi and bathhouses with showers. Also 2 outdoor showers. There’s fire pits throughout and a little amphitheater for the occasional show. There’s a store at check in that sells wood.

name: Watson Mill state Park
description:
Small state campground with about 20 sites with water and electric.
Dumpstation $8 if you just want to dump.
Very nice camp spots with table and fire pit.
Toilets and showers.
Lots of shade under the trees.
Big rigs possible. Pull-through and back-in sites available. Very clean!
Walking distance to longest covered bridge in Georgia with possibility to swim in river just under the dam by the bridge.

name: Camping right next to Taneum creek
description: We found this big spot to camp right next to Taneum creek. The site is mostly flat and could hold about 6 camp sites depending on how people park. Good for both vans and tents.

name: Dump at Town Pump
description: Free dump, and non potable water at Town Pump. Potable water is not available during colder seasons.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Overnight parking allowed. RV parking in the back of building.  About 1/2 mile from freeway, very quiet at night.

name: Tintin Road Pulloff
description: Trailhead outside spearfish, good space.

name: Paradise Valley SWA
description: DNR parking area big enough for 3 trucks or vans w some trees between lot & road. We used for overnight boondock between Ice Age Trail day hikes. No signs prohibiting overnight parking.

name: 4 Spirits Distillery
description: Dead end paved road ending at a brewery and distillery. Distillery employee told us we are welcome to park on the street in our van. Good wifi.

name: Parking lot
description: 72 hours free parking at the pier. Flat sunny spots. No big rigs. Vehicles only. They ticket if you’re not a vehicle (vans are fine) or stay longer than 72 hours. But awesome spot if you follow the rules. Plenty of parking.

name: Arizona welcome center
description: You have to come off 40 to access this rest area, but there are a couple spigots that say "conserve water." They are only designed for container filling.

name: Rest area picnic area
description: There are a few spigots spread throughout the picnic areas. There's one that's pretty close to the parking spots near the very last picnic table on the car side. You may have to use a container to fill up a tank, but a long hose might work.

name: Locals Gas station
description: There is a spigot next to the air pump on the left of the building.

name: York Farm and Mill State Park
description: There are spigots next to the picnic pavilions that are on (I assume) year round because I came in February. They're a little walk from the parking lot, so if you're looking to fill up, you'll have to bucket it.

name: King Cayon camping
description: Established camp site with water and dump but no showers yet. And theres icecream!!

name: Dino rv park
description: Campground in town easy to bike everywhere

name: Peoria Boat Ramp
description:
This spot has several parking for larger rigs as well as picnic tables and a few outdoor grills. it also has a basic toilet. No water and power here. we stayed one night here and had no trouble. no signs saying no overnight camping. Mild traffic noise but not a lot of cars overnight.

We ended up staying 3 nights and though the Linn County Sheriff's Deputies were through everyday we never had an issue.

name: Bear Creek Trailhead Overflow
description: Great spot right next to Bear Creek. Tons of fire pits and pull outs throughout the area once you go past Palisades Reservoir. Roads are gravel/dirt but solid and it’s only May 1. Roads get a bit more difficult the further you go into Caribou NF.

name: McCarthey Boat Ramp
description: McCarthey Boat Ramp is quiet and secluded. There is plenty of space for our 37' RV. A few Boaters came in and launched their boats of course but we had no issue. If you come in the right season you will be able to get all the blackberries you could fit in your rig.

name: AMPM Back Lot
description: Large truck lot behind AMPM and Sonic. Noticed a rig with curtains up for the night and another sedan boondocking so I decided to give it a go. The lot is somewhat sloped but there are some spots to work with. There is a small section to the west of the main lot that is darker, but the lights are considerably bright, which is good for safety if you have a low key blackout. I suspect that it is wise to maintain a low profile here although I didn’t notice any signage anywhere banning overnight camping so it appears to be allowed.

name: Parowan gap Dispersed petroglyphs
description: Lots and lots of camping all over the place here on free BLM land On both sides of the road, both before and after the Parowan gap petroglyph area which sports a seating area and a pit toilet. Good for any size rig. 4 LTE bars on Verizon. 14 day limit. Extremely clean sites - let’s keep it that way.

name: J&J’s Getaway Campground & RV Park
description: J&J's Getaway is a Full Service Campground, that has 2 separate bath houses with private, individual bathing facilities, 3 bunkhouses as well as primitive sites. There is a large pavilion for group meetings or family reunions that is fully lighted with electricity available.

name: Marshall’s/Walmart parking lot
description:
Nice safe and quite spot on the side of Marshall’s. I guess it’s staff parking area so only a couple spots were taking but they left after the store closed. You could also stay at Walmart but there is a “no overnight” sign just for the west side of Walmart parking area. 
If you have a bus or big RV you could park at the turn around spot SE of Marshall’s. 
I did read online there is NO ordinance banning overnight parking in the city. So you’ll be fine! 
Was going to originally park at the Cracker Barrel a mile down the road but had a hard time finding a flat spot

name: Overnight parking for vehicles and big rigs
description: It's a parking area for big rigs and vehicles with a wide shoulder but the signs clearly says no dropped trailers and a bathroom across the street at 7-11. Great phone service here.

name: Cracker Barrel Rehoboth Beach
description:
When I called and asked if they allow overnight parking, the kids on the other end said 'Yep.'  Then there was a long pause. So I said 'okay, I'll be over for dinner.'

There are not many spots for large vehicles, but if you are in a cargo van like mine, you can fit in the spaces. I parked in the back, on the hotel side away from the road. It wasn't a quiet place to sleep, but nobody bothered me. The food was actually okay.

name: Coronado National Forest Dispersed Campsite
description: Campsite along dry creek up FS Road 42 (follow signs to Rustler's Park), past private property and organized campgrounds.  Two turnouts here; room   enough for a few small vans/campers.  Rigs bigger than  41 feet are  prohibited on the roads coming in, so not suitable for long-medium or big rigs. No cell service, or other services.

name: Delaware Seashore State Park
description: Two campgrounds, one on each side of the Indian River Inlet, accommodate a variety of camping units, from tents to large recreational vehicles. North Inlet campsites feature three-point hookups (electricity, water, and sewer service), with three-point hookups (electric, water and sewer) and Standard (no hookups) sites, and tent sites available at the South Inlet campground.

name: ouachita forest road
description: very quiet, off the road spot with wifi by cricket. would not let me change rating to 3.5 stars. make sure you park off the dirt road.

name: Greenville US FS campground
description: Lovely forest service camp just off the road. At the moment it is closed, but there are plenty of nice places to get off the road for the night just outside the campground.

name: USFS Campground Beaver Creek
description:
This is one of the saddest and yet the sweetest little forest service campgrounds I’ve ever been in. Five campsites along the river, and two up above near the road that are hard to tell how you can even get to them. It’s sort of falling apart, but it’s such a sweet little green leafy oasis in the middle of a big burn.
The road is paved to the site, and each of the campsites could accommodate a smaller travel trailer. Picnic table and fire ring at each site. Vault toilets. No water. Pack it in, pack it out.
I spent a delightful night here listening to the water, and even panned a couple of tiny gold flakes with my dinner plate.
No connectivity whatsoever!
Also, didn’t run into any poison oak.

name: YMCA Park
description: MC-Public WiFi hotspot is open, YMCA-Guest requires a password. 2mbps.

name: Aquatic Center at YMCA Park
description: $12 for a day pass - includes shower and swimming.

name: Starbucks, Sushi Maki
description: WiFi is fast at 50mbps but no outdoor outlets except for one in in the middle of a barrier garden that is nearly out of WiFi range. There is also an outlet under the valet shelter but you are not allowed to use it when it is open between 9am-6pm.

name: OpenSeas Cafe
description: Very slow WiFi at 1mbps. Outlets can be found on pillars. I sat on the perimeter of the seating area and plugged in to avoid taking up seating area, nobody bothered me. I received the WiFi code without buying anything by asking the staff for it. What else can you ask for - it’s by the beach!

name: Crandon Beach Bathroom
description:
Outdoor showers next to the large bathroom. Nobody is there in the morning before 10am. Nobody bothered me when using soap/shampooing. 

Supposedly you’re supposed to pay $5 for parking for the day on weekdays and $8 on weekends but not enforced after several times me parking there for half days...

name: OpenSeas Cafe
description: Abysmal WiFi speeds and connectivity <1mbps - but it’s there. No public outlets but I asked an employee to plug in to the extension cord for a couple days and he graciously agreed. You can ask for the password.

name: Crandon Park - Free COVID-19 Testing
description: On weekends at these coordinates next to the main restroom at Crandon Park free COVID-19 testing is offered. I’ve confirmed this visually on the weekend of 1/24/21 and 1/10/21.

name: The Boardwalk at Lake Anna
description: Several open WiFi networks with speeds at 10mbps. A couple outlets with picnic tables available. I visited on a Monday when businesses were closed for the day so this could work for those who want to be around fewer people but not those who want the services the businesses provide (food, restrooms). One of the networks worked from my van in parking lot.

name: Deception Pass State Park
description: Large established campground run by Washington State Park. $25-45 dollars per night, ranging from walk-in sites to full RV hook-up. We spent $30 on a dry RV site in Loop A. All sites have a firering and picnic table. Many different walking trails, bathrooms, token showers, dumpsters, potable water, and RV dump. You can only buy tokens for shower when you check-in at the office. Campground is less than five minute walk to the beach. Poor cell service on ATT. Recommend reserving online through parks website.

name: Oak Flat campground
description: 6 Sites with 1 vault toilet, covered picnic tables and level parking pads. From Colingua rd, Clear creek rd provides access to the campground and is 2 miles of rutted road with several deep (10") washouts. It looks like BLM is currently working on the road to this campsite. Besides the state of the road limiting access right now, this campgound can accommodate any size rig and has access to nearby Clear creek. absolutely beautiful! note there is a fee station when you enter, $5/vehicle for 7 days with the std 14 day stay limit.

name: Billy The Kid Museum
description: Billy the Kid museum located here as well as his grave 5 miles away

name: West Glacier RV Park
description:
Nice, big, RV park with contemporary bathrooms and showers. Located right outside the west entrance to Glacier National Park.

I would have given 5 stars, but app wouldn't let me.

name: 1901 Historic Airbnb- Primitive Camping
description: This is an Airbnb in Raton. The home is being renovated and uninhabitable, and the hostess welcomes primitive campers at the rate of $10/night (+fees, I paid $25 for two nights). There's a ~12' square covered gazebo with trellis walls for primitive camping, and plenty of driveway around the house to park an RV. There's an outdoor 15a outlet that was fine to hookup an RV, and no running water or tank dumping. To put it gently, the neighborhood is prime for gentrification. I parked behind the house, out of site and mind, and the neighborhood is quiet. Downtown Raton is about a half mile away.

name: California agricultural inspection
description: A quick check if you have vegetables in your vehicle. They are not lawn Force, no dogs either.

name: Roadside turnouts on the water
description:
Lots of areas to camp along the water. There is a fair amount of vehicle traffic with the shift workers going to work at the refineries. 
There were oil tankers silently passing all night. Which was pretty cool to watch. I had good cell service with Verizon.

name: Cameron RV Park
description: Large campground used for housing post-hurricane. They sell propane. Current rate is $600 per month.

name: Walmart - Manchester
description: Manchester Walmart, decently quiet with adequate parking in parking lot.

name: Noon Creek Campground
description: $15/night for dry camping with pit toilets. Coordinates are just shy of campground. Designed for tent camping or short vehicles. Parking spots are not level. Possible cell service.

name: Conde Creek BLM
description: Paved BLM road with multiple easily accessible grassy pasture or gravel sites. Could fit any size rig. No service on Verizon. No amenities. Surrounded by white fir and Ponderosa pine forest. 25 minute drive from Ashland, Or.

name: Shale City Road BLM Site
description: Forested sites along the road to Grizzly Peak. Take Shale City Road turn off from Indian Memorial Road. First 2.7 miles are private property on either side and the road is paved. Shortly after the turn off of Shale City Road onto the gravel road to the Grizzly Peak trailhead, there is a large flat spot to the right in the trees. There was an abandoned tent tucked off to the side. More sites further along the road toward the trail and on several spur BLM roads. Well graded gravel roads, no high clearance needed. No amenities or cell service. Good for small or medium size rig. Grizzly Peak is a beautiful 5 mile loop hike with views of the valley if you have time. 20 minute drive to Ashland.

name: Lassen National Forest Wild Camping
description: Wild camping along FS road NF-33n55 about 14 miles north of the park along Highway 89. In late April, all of the surrounding forest service campgrounds and roads were gated and locked closed. This road was open. One big site with a camp ring but it had been used as a dump site. We kept driving and were able to pull off on a wide spot in the road. Suitable for small rigs only. Nice view of the mountains. No cell coverage on Verizon. No amenities.

name: GSENM Egypt Rd BLM240
description: Nice large spot in a grove of junipers just below a little hill. If you walk up a path to the top of the rise, you can get AT&T 3-4 bars LTE with 60 download and 1 upload, plus a fantastic view. Site is big enough for multiple vehicles. Tent spots possible on the rise. Roads to get here extremely washboardy.

name: National Forest Service Campground Schnell Recreation Area
description: National Forest Service Campground Schnell Ranch Recreation Area Here. 6 or 7 very large campsites each could hold several Tents or RV's post COVID19.

name: Open Camp sites near creek
description: Beautiful place to stop for the night. No amenities so pack it in, pack it out. No bathrooms. Clean up after yourself. More sites after this one.

name: Grant County Fairgrounds RV Park
description: This county run RV park is just off downtown John Day. You can either have full hook ups or you can dry camp. Full hook ups were $30 a night dry camping was $15 a night. You have access to a bathroom with showers. The camp is right by the John Day river and you can walk downtown to shops and restaurants. The cell service was good for both Verizon and AT&T and all size rigs can be accommodated. Enjoy

name: Dog Park
description: Dog park accessible from library parking lot

name: Family Castle Health Centers
description: Just off the main road. Accessible by all vehicles. This parking lot lends a relatively quiet place for a night. With an occasional train. Some highway noise. I found it easy to sleep.

name: Water under a tree.
description: If you drive past the camp, a large opening will be visible, turn around and you'll be facing the faucet under the 2 trees. I came here with my 40 foot 5th wheel,  topped off and headed out.

name: Stony Lonesome OHV Park
description: Off-roading park that has a small RV park as well as basic cabinet and single side trailers for overnight stays.

name: Goodman Ag
description: Propane $2.49/gallon.  Pump is in front of the store on the right, on front of gate.  Open 7-5 daily, closed Sunday.

name: Eldorado USFS
description: Dispersed campsites off of E Camp Creek Road. About 2 miles off of Highway 26 on a nice gravel road. No amenities. No cell coverage on Verizon. Approx 6 flat sites spread out in the trees by a creek. No charge.

name: Beebe Bridge ParkCampground
description: Great little campground along the Columbia River. Beautiful landscape, green grass and trees. Great cell. Electric and water, there is a dump station. Spring rate is $25 per night. Requires a reservation. Easy online process. There are two docks with a boat launch. One negative to me is no shade and the picnic table is bolted down so you can't move it to escape the sun.

name: Rest Area
description: Clean bathrooms available 24/7 with plenty grass to walk your dog as well. We parked after 10 pm and there was only semi trucks parked. It is kind of noisy due to the semi trucks but if you can sleep thru it then this is a great spot!

name: Extenda Stay
description: The parking lot here is perfect for vans. The entire street is great for all vehicles of any length. This is a clean industrial area with lots of parking you'd fit right in. Coffee shops Food and shopping within 5 min. Great area for boondocking. Quiet, No one bothered me and no parking restriction signs anywhere. WiFi ESaconnect (open network).

name: Walmart
description: Lots of shopping and eateries in same lot. Large lot can stay away from the crowd. High traffic but safe place to stay the night.

name: Target
description: Very large parking lot no signage quiet if you park away from the building

name: Planet fitness, Lowe’s, bass pro, Walmart
description: Large parking lot, tons of choices, Walmart Lowe’s planet fitness bass pro shop

name: Green field rest area
description: Restrooms, nice picnic areas, large trash available, well lit. No signage I’d sleep here...

name: KOA
description: large RV lot.  expensive,  limited hours on showers,  toilets, and, laundry. hookups work,  but sewer elevated 6".

name: Dutton Farm Stand
description: Incredible farm stand with local veggies, home made breads and pastries. Great selection of local beers and wines. Takes credit/debit.

name: Hale Lake Trail
description: Large site with three fire on a saddleback.

name: Walmart Melbourne
description: Parking of Walmart . We saw the signs «  no overnight parking , but we asked to thé manager if we can stay for the night , she said ok if you stay in your rv but not if you let thé rv alone , we said that we just want to sleep for thé night and go away and she said ok !  We parked at the pick up area , next wine and spirits and there us a good wifi , not noisy , very quiet no roads . Good place ! I think it is always better ask before to stay in a place

name: Ice House America
description: 24hr self serve station for purified drinking water and bulk ice. Price during my visit was $1.25 for 5 gallons, and $2 for 20 lbs ice.

name: Apache RV Park
description: This is one of the few RV parks in the northern Gila NF. They have 50A, 30A, and 20A electric, and water hookups. There is a heated bath/shower house. Dump station, propane refill station, and laundromat on site. Great place to stay after boondocking for several days.

name: Apache RV Park
description: Bulk propane fill station on site. Open 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM.

name: Apache RV Park
description: RV park, but potable water available to purchase for any travelers. You don't have to be a guest.

name: Shower in fort Pickens NPS campsite
description: If you’ve got a parks pass, this is a great place to stop for a shower/bathroom/trash. There’s parking right next to the bathroom.

name: Social Security Point
description: This is a gravel road with a few pull outs for camping and a vault toilet.  The road will dead end at the shoreline of the lake.

name: Pillar and Shoshone Falls Epic cliff
description:
Great spot for a good night’s sleep. Gorgeous cliff overlooking two cascade areas. This side of the Snake river is undeveloped, with several areas to pull off the main road. This is one of my favorites. There are dispersed camping signs as you come in from HWY 93. You don’t need 4x4 for this site, just drive slowly, as some parts of the road are slanted. Enough space for RV, although I’d recommend scoping out other pull outs. No shade or large trees. Clean area/little trash. Very quiet at night, no street lights. Town nearby for your necessities. when you turn off the paved road onto dirt, there are huge pot holes. some filled up high with water. 

We have 2 dogs. This spot is covered for miles with fox tails/ corn pickers. They are horrible plants that get their pickers stuck in dogs paws and cause lots of issues. Barbed and very hard to get out. Be aware !!!

name: Love's Truck Stop
description: Loves truck stop has parking for RV and Van's.  Had no issue staying one night here.  I fueled up while was here and put the receipt in my window.

name: East Bound Rest Area
description: Rest area with bathrooms, trees, vending machines and picnic area.

name: I. B. Magee Beach Park
description: Campground run by Nueces County, dump and water fill $10.

name: Eastbound Rest Stop
description: Rest area on the side of 70. Eastern most loop has nice parking areas roadside. Plenty of grass and shade trees. I did not see any no camping signs. Several vans staying the night.

name: Juniper Library
description: Free WiFi indoor and outdoor at the public library.

name: Gander outdoors fort pierce
description: Camping World Store. A great place to buy stuffs for your Motorhome and see the many kind and aizes of campers and motorhomes to sell.

name: Rest area West/East Access
description: Rest area with Bathrooms, water fountains, picnic area and tourist info center.

name: Marshall Senic Overlook
description: No overnight parking.  Has a small coffee shop and picnic area.

name: Gander Outdoors. Fort Pierce
description: Free water and dump area in Gander Outdoors/ Camping World parking lot.

name: Uhaul
description: Was $1 cheaper a gallon than other propane stations in the area

name: Dipping Vat Campground
description: USFS campground with potable water, vault toilets, but no electric. The vault toilets are made of brick and had nice painted floors. Tall shady pines, with nice views of Snow Lake. There is also a boat ramp for the lake. Very quiet and dark skies at night for star watching. No AT&T service even with a booster. Fee $5/night.

name: Fox Mtn Lookout Rd
description: This is a simple dispersed camping area. It is a flat, shady area. Plenty of room for several vehicles, and big rigs. There were several rock fire rings. Very few rocks, mostly flat dirt areas shaded by tall pines. No AT&T service, even with a booster.

name: Kanab City parking
description: Not sure what this parking lot is or who it belongs to but has RV marked lanes. Right next to Comfort In Suites but doesn’t seem to belong to them.

name: CoinLESS Laundry
description: Big laundromat that uses a card system - no coins needed. Card is $0.50 and then you load it with however much you’re going to use. Lots of different size washers and regular and large dryers. Not too crowded on a weekday and pretty clean. The neighborhood is a little...unsavory but the laundromat itself felt safe enough.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area with potable water spigot in the lawn in front of the restrooms.Far enough from the parking lot that you could not drive up to it, but you can use a container for free water.

name: Rocky turnout off FS689
description: road sign is 6S15 (from the south). huge turnout that can accommodate larger vans, plenty of tents. fairly level, with several hiking trails nearby. no cell reception.

name: Parowan gap petroglyphs west of the gap
description: Pretty much the same as the west side of the gap but possibly fewer campsites. Lots and lots of large level campsites on the north side of the road. Good for every rig type. Up to four bars of LTE Verizon

name: Sierra National Forest
description: Beautiful spot in the woods with a fireplace, surrounded by trees. A little dusty, no 4 x 4 required. We spent two nights with our be t2 here and the only annoying thing was the sound of the cross bikes. But nevertheless a beautiful spot!!!

name: Harbor Island Street Parking
description: There are a dozen or so parallel parking spots located along the shore of Harbor Island that have no time restrictions from 6 pm - 8 am. Nearby Harbor Island Park has public restrooms. Not suitable for vehicles over 25 feet in length.

name: k2 service station
description: Nice rest stop/service station.  No signs about overnight parking. This is the second service station in NY (rt 90) I have slept at with zero issues. 24 mini convenient store inside. Super clean restrooms. Great cell service. I do camp in a mini van so I can stealth camp, but I did see 1 rv and a pick up truck that clearly had reflectix window coverings...and of course over a dozen 18 wheelers.

name: Laundromat
description: across from Walmart in strip mall next to Dollar Store. Card accepted at washers and dryers. Very clean.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
description: Call ahead to confirm they allow overnight parking. The wifi was available free from Ashmore Inn  and Suites adjacent to the rear of the parking lot.

name: stop 'n save
description: nice little parking lot very friendly and was more than ok to park for the night and water available on the side of the south side of building  good Verizon service

name: off RT 156
description: about 4 camp sites. small dirt rd. dirt rd for is good for any vehicle and there is no need for 4x4 however big rigs won't be able to turn around. I have a 15 ft trailer and it is just right. great T-Mobile reception and 20° cooler than Vegas. lots of trees but not much shade in the campsite.

name: Tree Cabins RV Resort
description:
Pleasant RV park (and cabins) on the river across from the boondocking area.  Hook up sites at $35 a night. We were charged $15 because we were just passing through for the night and didn’t need hook ups.  
Nice bathrooms.

name: Monroe Canyon
description: Small site off road. Fire pit, more or less level. Good for smaller rigs or tents. Quiet day and night. Great LTE Tmobile service.

name: Speedway
description: Spigot edge of lot away from building. Remember to ask and patronize buiz.

name: Love’s truck stop
description: Showers $13 unlimited. Fluffy towel+washcloth, great pressure and heat, super clean. Laundry available too. 24hrs. Nice staff.

name: Grassy alley
description: Large grassy area parallel to the road with a decent tree line between you. It’s right next to the creek to hear the water. I pulled in fine with my rear wheel camper van but larger vehicles may have some difficulty. There is a makeshift turn around and I backed in. Minimal to no service with Verizon. Definitely worth the drive from the interstate for a one night stay.

name: Ocean overlook
description: Great place to stare at the ocean with an incredible view in a very large turn out on the 1 highway. There is a little bit of T-Mobile cell phone service about two bars in the right position and I was able to do some work here as well. Admittedly the turn out is on a little bit of a slant but for my van it actually is nice when I can have a slight incline when I’m sleeping. Nothing too bad but for some people it might be too much. You could also park sideways and avoid that but for the area with no cell phone service and often blocked views this was a gem.

name: Pomo Canyon Campground
description: Very very large parking lot and then small walk to campsites from car (no parking near campsites directly). One portapotty in parking lot. We were the only people there and just camped near our car in the parking lot and had no issues. Heard a few coyotes in the evening, but nothing else the remainder of the night. One other car showed up around 1 am and we’re absurdly loud but didn’t hear anything else at all throughout the night. 4 mile well maintained dirt road to entrance. Overall super private and great location! $25/night self-pay. No dogs allowed! Pack in pack out.

name: Lakeside Pull-Out
description: Nice pull over place for the night. No facilities. Right on the lake with a swimming beach just a little south. Scenic route without much traffic. No signs of any kind.

name: U Haul
description:
Propane tank refills 
Price today $3.44 per gallon 
(208) 735- 0075

name: Cheatham wildlife management area
description: Free camping. This place is strange. It could be awesome, but... There is a designated camping area up front. then there is the main trail which goes for miles into the woods with many side trails. the main road is clearly marked no access or presence after dark. Plus every one of the side trails have a locked chain preventing access anytime of day. Not sure why this is. But camping in the designated area is free. There are no services of any kind here. no water or even pit toilets.

name: Kaibab National Forest
description: About 1 mile off highway 64 on the south entrance of the Grand Canyon have seen plenty of wildlife but no humans.! totally alone....amazing easy access in the spot about 200 yds off the gravel road site is about 2 miles from the park entrance community.... so supplies are close but it’s totally free camping....

name: Chester Laundromat
description: besides the laundromat, they have pay showers AND dog baths! $3 in quarters for each. this is a perfect stop around Lassen NP, with plenty of dispersed camping in the nearby national forests.

name: Lmuma Creek Recreational Site
description:
Quieter than the Pine Creek Camground just up the road. A better option in my opinion. Sites are around the edge of the grounds, numbered but not individual parking pads. Each has its own table and fire ring though.

Cell: AT&T - 4 bars LTE

name: Parking strip off the beaten path
description: There’s a bunch of trucks and campers parked along this not very used road here. It’s between highway 5 and the railroad tracks so not super quiet or scenic but there’s lots of parking options and it’s close to Local businesses and there are some trees and bushes so it’s not just desert.

name: Currituck County Rest Area
description: Quiet well lit rest area off Caratoke Highway 168 which is lightly travelled at night. Truckers and traveller overnight parking allowed. Ample parking, picnic tables, restrooms and a pet walking area.

name: Tulie Pines RV Park
description: Dry camping is $5, they have sites with electricity for more $$. We drove up late and only one other van is here. Nice for outside the Sand Dunes NP for cheap. No other amenities that we can find.

name: Laurel Walmart
description: Pretty busy Walmart, no signs prohibiting overnight parking. There is a low clearance bar, I'm 8' and fit fine. The back entrance doesn't have one that I recall.

name: Banks Lake Access
description: Flat parking lots with pit toilet. Also a good place for launching kayaks. No fee, no signs prohibiting camping. A couple big RV's and tents staying there when I was there, but there was still room.

name: Glacier water dispenser
description: 2 machines outside of Albertson’s. Both accept credit cards, Apple Pay, and cash.

name: Gravel Pit/Shooting Pit
description: Off oil city. Logging road that lead to Gravel Pit. Fire ring available. Decent spot in pinch. Did not explore out far enough to find the Hoh River.

name: Huber RV Park
description:
This is a city park with FREE camping with water and electric (20/30 amp). There are about 7 sites and a dump station with potable water. There is a 3 night stay limit. The park is super clean and offers walking paths,basketball hoops,volleyball,playground, bird sanctuary, veterans memorial, 911 memorial and picnic pavilion.

5 minute drive from a Walmart. 
Im Only giving it 4 stars because of the noise. There are train tracks close by and lots of loud mufflers in this area.

the app is auto set to 2.5 starts but I would rate it 4 stars

name: Nashville Fairgrounds Rv Park
description:
only stay here if you are desperate for a place close to downtown Nashville.

It is full hook ups. The water was brown in color, complained twice but nothing was done. Very narrow spots and its basically a small parking lot.

loud noise from traffic and the trains.

name: Buhler’s Laundry
description: Very clean. Big washers to do comforters. Reasonable prices. Fast. Parking on the side. No broken washers or dryers.

name: Mobil Williams
description: Full service gas station with propane fill and tire shop.  Propane was $3.69/gallon.

name: Tire shop Williams Mobil
description: Fixed a flat for us while we waited. Good service, $25.

name: Lower Plum Creek Campground - FREE
description: Beautiful well kept with toilets but no water. 1-2 bars AT&T. Five established sites with tables and canopy but you can camp anywhere you want. First come first serve at established sites.

name: Walmart
description: standard Walmart parking.  Large, flat parking.  Asked inside and they said fine to park overnight.  Spent a quiet night, no problems.

name: FR201 down in the ravine
description: Pretty scrub oak and creek! One-way road with some rocky parts but doable in our 25’ motor home. About 10 minutes drive from the turnout to get down to camping sites with fire rings. Passed two large multi family camping groups and then found a decent pullout. Lots of ohv and dirt bikes, even at 9pm (full moon though) and 7:30am. But nice creek for kids to throw rocks. 2 bars att 4g.

name: Peaceful in the pines
description: Large pullout with room for several vehicles. Liked that we could find a grassy spot farther away from the road. A few fire rings. A little ohv traffic on the weekend. Very peaceful. Kids liked venturing down hill and making a fort. 2 bars att lte.

name: Rest Stop
description: This rest stop is accessible from both east and west bound i-24. We didn't end up staying the night, but we have been on the road for 12 days and this was the most beautifully rest stop we saw anywhere. There were lots of picnic tables, a small playground, trees, lots of grass, a small creek with bridge, and a place to take your picture as superman

name: KOA Tucson
description: Full serve KOA. Even delivery from the BBQ to your door.

name: Fort Scott Lake
description: Municipal lake with a couple primitive campgrounds.

name: White Trellis
description: Motel with short stays, it old, needs a lot of care.

name: Andrus Lake Campground
description: 15$ a night, spots are around the lake on either side, bathrooms and fire rings. Very pretty and quiet.

name: Off 12 near Escalante Airport
description: Small off highway location with a view of the valley. This is on the edge of BLM and Escalante land but using Avenza it appears to be BLM

name: Tulelake Rotary Club
description: Nice dump site offered by the tulelake rotary club. Very well taken care of and water has good pressure.

name: FS Dispersed Camping County Rd 443
description: Several wide spots off of County Road 443. Gravel road in forest service land off of Highway 160. Rough at times, especially if approaching from the South. Views across canyon, but most of the forest is burned. No amenities but service on Verizon. Weak T-Mobile service comes and goes. Convenient and free for a night on the road.

name: Three Point Star Motors
description: Stopped at Three Point Star Motors, to have work done to Dodge Sprinter, and was blown away how Eduardo and his team went above & beyond with their service. They were able to get us in with short notice. Highly recommend!

name: Cracker Barrel (Central Ave Pike)
description: Moderately sized back parking lot for all types of vehicles. Called and confirmed overnights are possible.

name: Greenwood Walmart
description: Signs posted for no truck parking (refers to semis). otherwise, quiet spot for the night. I parked in the back by some grass to walk my dog around.

name: Florida Highway 76 Rest Area
description: Google Maps has this address for this spot: 432 SW Kanner Hwy, Canal Point, FL 33438 which is a turnout from Highway 76 at Highway 98 at Port Mayaca. A simple picnic rest area with five covered picnic tables and no facilities at all, not even trash cans. Verizon signal is strong. Some traffic obviously but nothing exceptional. A pleasant overnight stop.  The parking area across the highway at the lock itself attracts locals with loud stereos enjoying the lake view so this rest area is a better sleeping spot in our opinion.

name: WalMart parking lot
description: Overnight parking friendly in a pretty area close to University of Arkansas

name: Detroit Lake State Campground
description: Nice campsite with electrical and water hookup for RV.  No common access waste water dump.  campsites are nice and campground has a nice canopy.  Very popular site ahead of the Fourth of July and is close to highway 22 traffic noise.

name: Tower Rock U Fish RV park
description: Nice site run by super nice couple.  Power and water hookups and sewer at some sites.  Dump station for guests.  Some of the sites are a little small but good privacy many shaded spots under a good canopy.  Mostly for RV's but many grassy areas for tents too.  Short walk down nice trail to river makes for a great afternoon.  No fishing during COVID-19 but looks to be a great pond when filled.  Zero road noise as is well removed from highway and town.

name: Blue Lake Creek Campground
description: Fantastic campground with privacy that has Blue Lake Creek running through it.  Mid-week in July we were the only occupants of this 11 site reservable site.  No water, no electricty, no dump.  This site will be challenging for tents because of no potable water.  Also challenging for big rigs as many of the sites have limited length.

name: Rainbow Falls State Park
description: Nice sites that sit right next to the Chehalis river.  Good canopy and sites have good privacy.  Falls are short drop and kids can swim at the base.  Highway noise from HWY 6 is noticeable and there is private BMX track close to falls which can be loud depending on the day.  Exploring the banks up river from the falls was more peaceful.  Some sites have electric/water and sewer.  Campground has dump station.

name: Mavis Tires and Brakes
description: Free self help air pump at tire shop. Located by front door.

name: Tri State corner plaque.
description: Tri-state marker. Missouri to the east Oklahoma south and Kansas north

name: Reddick Canyon
description: Small grassy spot off of FR0101, many different spots between here and Levan, but this is what was open. Small firepits and a creek next to a beautiful rock face made this place home. Road accessible from Levan with AWD/4WD. Big rigs can access from Wales.

name: national forest
description: Large spot, fits many rigs, class c accessible when dry, 4x4 needed when wet or snowy, two rock fire rings. Wasn't windy but likey is sometimes.

name: Mesa Terrace
description: Moblie home park with RV Sites up to 32'

name: Dark Sky RV
description: Excellent campground. Many RV sites with full hookups, as well as tent/van sites. Check their website for reservations. Very nice people. Spa quality bathroom suites, laundry, propane fill on site. Sites are spread out for privacy. Just outside of town, with beautiful dark skies. The town of Kanab nearby has a few good restaurants and some decent small supermarkets. Highly recommend. RV sites do fill up, so book in advance if you can.

name: Anvil Rock Rd pul off
description: Gravel pull off next to highway.  Fine if you are exhausted and need to rest.  Big rig friendly. Good Verizon signal three bars

name: BLM near salt flats
description: Small pull off spot with campfire pit. We have a 26’ RV and a much larger rig would fit. This spot was probably about 3-4 miles. Probably 2 from the BLM sign. Road was washboard but didn’t require 4 wheel drive. It was very dry when we were out here.

name: Bee’s Marketplace
description: Free RV dump and potable water behind grocery store. Large  pull-in area and plentiful space to pull over on the side. Large grocery store and fuel station as well.

name: Spring City coin laundry
description: small but decent coin laundry. Not expensive, gets the job done. No attendant, there is a number to call for assistance, hanging on the wall. 2 soda machines and a carousel out front for the kids. Next to Piggly Wiggly.

name: Bullfrog Laundromat
description:
Moderator note: Laundromat location may not be exact, please update location if possible.

----------------------


Laundromat near store. Free showers also.  $1.00  to wash and 50 cents to dry

name: Bee Run campground
description: USFS, 8$ with a pass.  Great place to overnight. 10 sites, you mighty need to catch it on a weekday, it might get busy?  But we’re the only ones here tonight, and it’s a Saturday night? Nice host.

name: NF-257A in the trees
description: Easy access secluded spot not far off 89A. Second left off NF-257 (onto NF-257A). Several flat areas for smaller vans/vehicles. No fire rings. Cooler temps in the shade of the trees, good T-Mobile and AT&T. Quiet, but you can hear a little of the traffic on the main road from time to time.

name: Rainbow Bridge/Brush Creek Arch Bridge
description: Arched bridge on old Route 66. Only bridge of this type left

name: Morro Bay State Park campground
description:
State park with usual amenities from basics for cycling/hikers to full hookup for large (<=35’) RVs. 

Good wifi, clean toilets

name: BLM Trail
description: Trailhead off the main road in BLM land. You’re close to the cars passing by but able to take a great early hike.

name: Rest Stop
description:
Has a fenced in dog section to let your favorite companion run free.

I been coming here off and on spending a night or 2 on each side of the high way. It’s a nice spot to rest for a bit but I suggest coming later at night and leaving early morning. Also try to park near the end so you don’t block other people there to use restrooms.

name: Santa Fe NF
description: Santa Fe National Forest One spot but maybe more down the forest road. Very quiet. 1 bar T-Mobile

name: NF-257
description: Very quiet and secluded spot of NF-257 near Arizona Trail hiking trail. Stayed here after spending the day exploring the North Rim. Flat, easy access, fire ring. The dirt road was good getting here, although there were some old muddy ruts you need to straddle. Good AT&T and T-Mobile service.

name: Flying J
description: Nice showers but $15. Wait was less than 5 min. Everything looks really new and updated, the shower rooms are huge. Fantastic water pressure, HOT water, and very clean!

name: Rest Stop
description: Very nice little rest stop with bathrooms, picnic tables and ample parking. Gets very little use at night and is very quiet. Sign says that you can park here for up to 18 hours (overnight thus not a problem).

name: Beaumont
description: Beaumont hotel and cafe Frisco water tower. The town of Beaumont. Includes grass airstrip Hotel and cafe and old railroad water tower

name: Gas Station Parking Lot
description: Huge Parking lot near fuel station and restaurant.  10-20 big rigs and Rv’s.  Park away from gas station for a quiet night.  Can’t hear highway.  Fairly Level.  2-3 bars of ATT cellular.

name: George Washington National Forest
description:
Small clearing in the woods in the George Washington NF, just off the road about 50ft. Room for several small vehicles, got in fine with our van.

Stone fire ring, nothing else but nature!

No AT&T cell at all.

name: Lorain Rest Area W. Bound
description:
Smaller, wooded rest area with good vibe.
Overnighting never an issue. Unusually large separation of cars from big rigs. Clean bathrooms. Picnic area. Trail to scenic overlook.

name: Thunder Ridge parking area
description: empty parking lot a little way off the Blue Ridge Parkway. plenty of room to park with a trash can and picnic table. we didn't see anyone else until mid morning, no noticeable road noise. there's a short walk to a beautiful overlook. 2 bars T-mobile.

name: Boston Mtn. Pizza & RV Park
description: small place with a pizza place and places to park RV's

name: Tyler Bend Buffalo National River Campground
description: Campgrounds with hiking, picnic areas, river access.

name: Sheep Creek Vista
description: This is a location with a great view of the surrounding hills and mountains. The main gate was closed (will open in June) but there is another access point further up the road.

name: FS 292
description:
Bumpy and gravelly road, landed at a nice spot with view. Minimal road noise from way below. Fire pit and tons of wood. Probably good for class C and under.
FS 290 also had a few spots back in the trees. Great T-mobile service. Not so great Verizon service (1-2 bars).

name: Self/Full service laundry
description: what can i say, its a laundromat. but get this.. all machines are working right now. bring ya quarters!

name: Greenfield rest area eastbound
description: spent the night with no issues. clean restrooms, picnic tables, pet area, vending includes ice cream and coffee.

name: Rest stop
description: Rest stop with bathrooms and water. Just a fairly large rest stop with a water spigot on the right of the building about 50 feet away. River running behind it.

name: Horn School Safety Rest Area
description: Rest area with flush toilets. No sign indicating limitation for length of stay.  I spent the night.  sign says patrolled by Washington State Patrol. Good cell service.

name: Delta NF
description:
There are a ton of sites all around here.  It's muggy with lots of mosquitoes though.  But also, it just rained here.  So, maybe it isn't usually?  

No AT&T.  There are numbered sites throughout the NF.  No amenities for the ones near here.

name: Yankee Dispersed Camping
description: Dixie National Forest dispersed camping site. Up on a hill in some  Ponderosa pines overlooking a meadow. Yankee Meadow Campground was still closed so we picked a spot up on a loop next to what looks like a permanent resident in a camper. Absolutely no AT&T or Verizon.

name: Hwy 1, pull off
description: small pull off on CA 1, with a beautiful view. no "no parking" signs. a bit noisy due to road traffic and cattle crossing but the view is worth it. the water is below, the spot is on a cliff face. 1-2 bars of verizon LTE. not big rig friendly. we were fine with a 25 ft skoolie but anything larger than 30 ft would be hard to maneuver and turn around

name: Vons water kiosk
description: 40¢ a gallon. glacier water kiosk. outside

name: Paradise Bay Family Campground
description: Campground with Sani dump useable by non campers.  Price $10 includes potable well water.  It's right by the entrance on the right in front of the pool.  Pay at office.

name: Milestone Road
description: Milestone Road M3/M4 Pulloff. Nice spot along the Milestone creek.  Parking is on creek for couple of vehicles.  Short walk into a large camping spot with fire ring next to water.  We were able to get fairly level spot for van and setup our solo stove.  Fabulous spot but no cell service on T-mobile, Verizon or AT&T.

name: Paws and wash
description: Free red spigot at the carwash/pup tub. A local came by and told me it was good potable water. Open 24/7

name: Jones Pass Road
description: Large snowmobile parking lot next to Henderson Mine. It’s level, free, with no traffic and okay to overnight. It is acceptable for one night. Two bars of Verizon.

name: Manilla Senior Center
description: The senior center is on Hwy. 43, across the street to the east of grocery store. (Very nice store and fair prices for a small town). On that side of the building, facing the side street that goes between the center and the grocery, is a dump station. There is a can for donations. We went around back of the building to the right to go around and back to the front and the highway.

name: Rio Grande National Forest
description: There are many sites in this area with great cell service using Verizon and the views are fantastic!!!

name: South Rio Grande BLM
description: Big open field just a few minutes off the main road. There is a small segment of washboard (about 3 mins), then smooth road for the last bit. Easy to get to. Strong Verizon and AT&T service.

name: Summerdale Campground
description: Established campground passing Fish Camp towards the South Entrance to Yosemite National Park

name: Wildwoods Campground and RV
description:
if you need a place to stay and you are in a pinch this is a alright spot. kind of expensive. big hippie community. real nasty showers and bathrooms. But, it will do for a night. 

tent camping is do able, don't pick the campsites in the woods they are very slanted and you almost need 4x4 to get to them. 27.50 a night for a tent... very expensive.

if your a van you can pay for non hookups and there are water spots everywhere with hookup for hoses.

name: Rouge Private Waterfall Wild Camp
description:
10/10 spot for vans, trucks and high clearance vehicles. 

when you pull in off the main road take first left, immediately you will see a small dirt road on your left, then immediately veer to the right. Take that road past a small campsite, then the end of the road is the campsite! 

it has waterfalls and 2 fire pits, swimming hole. 

could fit 8 vans or cars back here.

name: Tyler's Hot Spring Wild Camp
description:
Hugeeeee area with fire ring 10 minutes to hot springs. could fit 15 cars at this spot. tight bumpy short road in , but okay if you miss the pot holes. No shade and wind vulnerable. A one night spot.

verizon LTE, att no

name: Quiet Private Culdesac in the woods
description:
this is a great spot. could take camper up here. great roads, not too steep. 

a ton of spots up here. recommend if in area.

name: The Lookout Spot
description:
This is a amazing spot. You can get here in any vehicle. 
drive up to the pond then take the first left before the pond. follow that road till you get to a dirt 4 way intersection. then take a right!!
there are two ways to get here one is very rocky. one is not at all. 

you can see the entire cascade range from this spot.
Fire rings and views for days! Enjoy

FULL VERIZON AND ATT

name: Michelle's Store
description: This is a 24hr fuel station with gas and diesel. After hours, it's credit/debit card only. One of the few places to find fuel for miles. If you are venturing deep into the Gila NF for several days, this station can be your fuel resupply point.

name: Summit RV
description:
RV Parts, Repairs & Storage in Tacoma, WA 
3119 84th St E, Tacoma, WA 98446
"Great selection of parts and knowledgeable staff. Fair pricing when I've had work done on my motorhome. Best RV shop in the area."
- Dean B

name: halfway to nowhere
description: many dispersed campsites along 236.  about 14 miles for anyone.  this side is along the CDT trail

name: disperse camping along the CDT Trail
description: disperse camping along the CDT Trail. Just off of route 197 BLM land.  The road is little rough but it is passable.

name: Rio Chama - CDT trailhead
description: many dispersed campsites along Forest Service Road 151 and the Chama river including to campgrounds one called Whirlpool Dispersed camping and Rio Chama Campground.

name: Santa Fe NF - FS 102
description:
Nice little spot along FS 102 with a small stream.  Enough flat space for two class B vans.  No phone service.

About 4 miles down FS 102

name: Vista Grande Overlook
description: Vista Grande Overlook Observation Site with nice view of Santa Fe.   People come here to see the sunset.  Quite about an hour after sunset.  Elevation little over 10k feet.  Verizon service here

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Nice and well lit place. It has 7 RV/BUS spots. I was the only one staying for the night. Little bit Highway noise was there but still had a good sleep.

name: Walmart
description: Good Walmart. Nice bathrooms. Didn’t get kicked out!! There was another camper van and semis here. One of the best Walmart’s we’ve been too!!

name: Chassawitzka Reserve
description: Hunting reserve. There’s a sink and also a spigot outside the building. Are open all year round! There is also a bathroom here! you have to pay to be in the reserves but not to use the facilities.

name: Van Buren State Park
description: 35$+ a night, lots of sites, easy access to beach. Not buggy, I think because there are a few bats around!

name: Walmart
description:
Walmart Foxcroft Avenue 
Lighted overnight parking
Decent Wi-Fi

name: Walmart Pella
description: Just a walmart. Other RVs here. Mostly quiet. Food close.

name: Rest Stop
description: Rest stop on the edge of Kentucky. Bathrooms, vending machines, and decent amount of mostly flat parking for campers and RVs. No wifi, but 3 bars of Verizon.

name: Side street by park
description: If you mind street sweeping signs, these is plenty of flat parking around the park.

name: Dominguez Canyon Road BLM
description: This dirt and gravel road is accessible from both East and Westbound Hwy 50. It’s a good smooth road that most cars could go down. At least as far as we traveled down it. There are several places to pull over in already established camping areas. It’s open BLM land with no facilities so please do pack out your trash. Unfortunately, we see quite a bit around the camp areas. It’s close to Hwy 50 so we can hear some of the louder trucks on it but it’s a great easy place to overnight.

name: Loaf & Jugs
description: Dump is behind the building. Dump cover has a padlock so go inside to ask if it’s accessible for a fee. There is a spigot at the dump for tank flush only.

name: Kendall Campground
description: Kendall Campground is right next to Wolf Creek Dam. This is a full hookup campground with spacious sites, many restrooms/showers & plenty of places to fish.

name: Joshua tree blm North
description: nice place to pull in for a night ..only a mile down a dirt road, other dispersed campers, near to town

name: Roadside Overnight Parking
description: Plenty of room to pull off to the side of the road located along Valley of Fire Hwy. I stayed here for several days. Traffic can get noisy and shake your vehicle but overall a nice scenic spot to pull over.

name: Penny Hot Springs
description: Small dirt pulloff right next to Penny Hot Springs. Not recommended for bigger rigs. I stayed for a night in my mid sized school bus. No cell reception.

name: Conasauga River
description: Parking spot fits about two vehicles it has posts to prevent large trailers. Beyond posts is a gravel pad and earthen/rock fire rings. Right on the river that has a few rapids so it has a great sound all night. Lots of tree coverage to give privacy in the leafy seasons. Other sites are far apart. Hiking trails and snorkeling holes near by. In the Cherokee National Forest. Careful which roads you travel as the roads can be challenging if you are pulling or in a non 4 wheel drive or low car. Composting toilets are about a half mile away and aren’t always open so you might want to bring a shovel

name: Overlook
description: Nice overlook pullout near Blodgett canyon trails. Enough space for 2 vans. Spent two nights, quiet. Good cell service.

name: Canyon Loop Spur
description: Decent road in, see large rigs. Good Verizon. Restricted fire area year round past sign. Sparse pine restoration area but cool breezes coming off the mountain

name: Sleepy Creek Upper Camp Ground
description: Beautiful lake. 3 campgrounds. Isolated. barely have cell coverage with Verizon. Vault toliets. Serveral "free" places to boondock on the road to the lake.

name: Safeway - Glacier water kiosk
description: This just a regular Glacier water kiosk outside at a Safeway, this Safeway is a bit nicer than most we've come across in Oregon.  Water is $2 for 5 gallons or $.40 per gallon.

name: NF Better spot
description: Take the small road on the right past the first spot. Road is a little washed out, drive slow. Nice open spot with fire ring. too many cars on the main road for us. much more private.

name: Amerson River Park
description: water spigot by pavillion. and shower connected.

name: Whiskey Basin Wildlife HMA
description: The smallest of 5 designated camping areas in the HMA. A couple car sized flat spots with tent sites 25ft away. Bear resistant food storage bin as well. Fire rings next to tent sites, no firewood gathering, bring your own wood. No cell service. No restroom at this site, pit toilets at other sites. Road closed for winter till end of April.

name: Dump and Water
description: This is the best dump/water we've ever used. There are three dump spots and then you drive around the loop to the three potable water spots so no contamination of drinking water with dump, etc. It's free.

name: FR 525 with Mesa Views
description: Off on the right side of FR525 near lots of other spots. This one has a pull out road that leads to several spots further back off the main road among the trees. We passed at least 4 spots on this side road before we chose this one, and we can see another rig yet further down the way. Lots of toilet paper around (ugh!) but otherwise a lovely spot. Good AT&T and T-Mobile, although it does fluctuate a bit. The whole area is pretty crowded, but this is a nice spot away from much of the FR525 traffic.

name: Sav more
description: Free water and air at grocery store at SavMore

name: Three Rivers Rest Area
description: Highway rest area. Kinda loud and somehow there’s no cell service here.

name: Dispersed Camping between Rustic and Red Feather Lakes
description: Quiet, peaceful, agree with the others who posted. Verizon one bar.

name: Swede Point Park
description: Nice little county campground on the banks of the Des Moines River. Very clean. $11/non electric rv/tent or $18/night electric with some water hook ups. We normally boondock so by our standards we were a little too close to our neighbors however, given we were seeing family in Madrid, this place fit the bill perfectly.

name: Northbound I-196 Rest Area
description: Standard rest area. Close to highway so is a loud one for overnight sleeps.

name: St Regis Travel Center
description: Huge lot across from the St Regis Travel Center (the huckleberry shakes are insanely yummy). They have signs up discouraging semi truckers from parking but I asked inside and said it was fine for anyone else to park overnight. RVs and campers stayed the night too with no issue. They have meticulous bathrooms inside and there is even a little dog park right next to where the lot is. Right off the highway but it isn’t a super busy highway and it definitely gets less loud at night! Oh and the best part— full bars on my Verizon network! I sat at the picnic table and actually worked.

name: Pullout south of Wheeler Gorge Campground
description: Roomy pullout next to a creek with easy access down to the water. A nice, relatively quiet place but with some traffic on the road, especially during the day. Stayed two nights, no trouble.

name: TA Lot
description: Great place to park overnight. Walking distance to downtown Nashville.

name: McGolrick Park
description: Really nice park a lot more chill than McCarren Park. With good playgrounds for bigger and smaller kids. Street parking depends on the side you’re on but mostly 1 hr 30 minutes in the morning so you can just sit upfront to avoid a ticket. Lots of shade under trees for when it’s hot, not much solar coming in for our batteries but we’d rather that than die of heat exhaustion haha. Our vehicle is 20 ft long we just had to wait for a space big enough to open, there are more spaces in the mornings. Back up camera helps. Try and be discrete as there are plenty of elder Polskis that will judge you haha

name: Industrial Parking
description: Lots of big rigs and some vanners in the area. Arrived just after sunset and had no issues. I did leave around sunrise. Plan on staying here for a couple nights but leaving during the day.

name: Sinclair
description: Nobody to ask. Pump on grassy area next to diesel pump.

name: Pemaquid Pond Preserve
description: Small parking area just off the road. Quite and a great place to park for the night. Fun little hiking trail and peaceful white noise of a relaxing forest.

name: Coin-op Laundry Sidney
description: Nice clean coin-operated laundry facility. Open 5am-Midnight daily. Washers are $3 or $4 depending on size, 25 min long. Dryers are .25¢ for 6 minutes. Wifi works great, password is posted on both walls, easy to see. Lots of machines, soap and coin changers are available. Clean restroom, too.

name: NF pull off by the bridge
description: We entered Shasta Trinity NF after dark, many of the early spots down dirt roads were occupied so we kept going. Paved road all the way, a few pull offs as you get higher up but due to steep drop offs there aren’t many forest roads. Nice creek sounds, no traffic all night. A good spot for a quick night. Minimal Verizon service but no LTE.

name: Water pump
description: There’s a usable water pump in this forest preserve.

name: Kofa Queen Canyon
description: Wild camping spots on the Queen canyon road in the Kofa Wilderness area. 2 track in good condition, high clearance required.

name: Moab rest stop
description: Rest stop south of Moab. Got into the area after dark and didn’t want to risk the dirt roads in the dark to go to the BLM site I was planning on. Stumbled upon this rest stop. Lots of semis here plus about 8 other vans, travel trailers, and SUVs with people staying the night. Building with vending machines outside, but didn’t check it out. No T-Mobile service, got AT&T enough to send some texts but that was about it. Good option if you don’t have a place to stay in Moab and are coming in after dark.

name: Beautiful camp spot
description: Campsite by a creek. Best time is fall , surrounded by Aspen and lush grass. Great is spring and summer too. Keep in mind the road is maintained from May  to October. Also a great spot to camp near hike bike Mavresso trail 204

name: Camp and Hike
description: Beautiful spot , with a cement pad and fire pit  Aspen and lush grass. Then hike  or bike Maveresso Trail 204 : which is a 5.8 mile

name: Washington County State Recreation Area
description:
This is a huge recreation area in IL. So beautiful. Offers three different camping locations. One is an even park with a few tent camping sites. The other two are tent camping sites. All the sites are nicely spaced apart. The lands are very well kept. There is a HUGE lake too. Lots of people, trails, picnic tables, picnic areas and camping spots. We really enjoyed it. 

The two tent sites are FREE. The rev site is $20 for electric and $8 for no electric.

name: Old Bunker Hill Road Bridge
description: Dead at a bridge that was torn down 35  years ago. Quiet. Some garbage in the East side of the bridge. Great place to stay for a night. The is a turnaround 150ft front the old bridge on the east side

name: Off leash dog park
description: Small dog park next to river . Great place to stop to let you pup out and play before heading into town for a beer or two

name: water refill in coronado
description: in this place you can refill you potable water

name: Parking lot/Canoe dock
description: Large parking lot with no signs and a beautiful lake view - stayed here 2 nights no problem. Also if you head down past the restaurant there’s another dirt parking lot with a port-a potty and a picnic table and  dock where I worked at both days - plenty ATT + verizon

name: Feyrer County Park
description: This is a small county park about 20 acres in size with 20 RV spots that contain power and water. It’s a pretty park right next to a creek. The challenges are as follows the price is high at $34 a night and there is significant traffic noise from the road next to the park we stayed only a single night. There’s good Verizon and AT&T service here. There are showers and bathrooms. So overall it’s decent for a one night event as long as road noise does not bother you. There is also a dump station.

name: Pullout with fire pit at defunct road
description:
A medium-sized pullout at an old, defunct road. Could easily park 4-6 cars. Probably too small to turn around a big rig. Someone built a small fire pit and gathered some wood here prior to our arrival, just up a 15-foot path from the gravel pullout. 
No amenities here, and no AT&T service. Very close to the road so you will hear traffic, but very few cars drove by on the mid-week night we stayed here. 
People prior to us did a TERRIBLE job of leave no trace. Please clean up after yourself. 
I’m not 100% sure this place is Kosher to stay, but it was a nice night for us!

name: Lazy Lizard Hostel - Public showers
description:
The Lazy Lizard Hostel offers public showers for 4$/person, no time limit (only from 9am to 9pm).
You can lock the shower and there is space to put your clothes, etc.
Clean and easy.
You can pay with card.

I added the place a second time just so the shower is easier to find.

name: Celilo Park
description: This is a park with a boat ramp located right along the Columbia River. There are signs posted allowing camping seasonally, however tent camping is only allowed Friday-Sunday. For cars and RV’s you are allowed to sleep in the very large parking lot with river views all week. It is right next to the highway and the train tracks if the noise bothers you, but otherwise seems very nice. Only one other van here tonight. Pit toilets (one of the two is closed for repair). 2 bars and LTE with AT&T.

name: Courtney Road Overlook
description: This is a gorgeous clifftop spot overlooking the Columbia River. It is down a pretty rough dirt road, higher clearance and/or 4WD recommended. Fire ring out set up by a previous camper. No signs. Decent cell signal and LTE with AT&T. No services, pack it in pack it out.

name: Redpoint Climbing Supply
description: Coffee shop & climbing supply store with free WiFi for customers. Workspace is great - couches, tables, and outdoor seating - and WiFi is fast! Lovely place and lovely people. Super close to Smith Rock State Park & a rest area.

name: Weed Rest Stop (northbound)
description: Basic rest area with facilities, covered picnic tables, and pet/dog area. Pull through spots for RV, semi trucks, ect.

name: Kamiak Butte County Park
description: 8 sites, 7 for under 18 feet one for anything over that.

name: George L Smith State Park
description:
Located on a beautiful 400 acre mill pond. 
Well maintained; clean restrooms. Water and 20 amp power at all sites, 30 amps at pull through sites.

name: Yuba River spot 3
description: Wasn’t a huge fan of the other two spots so we kept going and found this rad flat rocky lot overlooking the river right off the main road in. The road wasn’t any worst then the beginning of it and we made it in just fine with three rear wheel drive ford transits (dry conditions). There are lil trails down to the river and some small sandy beaches. Spots by some trees for shade too if it’s super hot. Some locals drove but overall super chill.

name: Bush Canyon Overlook BLM
description: Decent spot on the edge of some BLM land right off CO-141. Large area just off the road, low clearance & 2wd fine, that could fit several larger rigs. Mostly flat. There are more spots further up on top of the overlook with fire rings, but there are a few big ruts on the way up so you would want some clearance to get over but 4wd not necessary. Great views and fairly quiet even next to the road. There's definitely some trash around, and it looks like people ride ATVs, etc nearby. Not much traffic during the day and none at night. No service on Tmobile and spotty on Google Fi.

name: Woods and River RV Park and Campground
description:
Tent, RV, No Hookup or Full Hookup. 
Spots right along the river are a few dollars more, but the whole campground is pretty nice. I’m in a Ford E250 van conversion but got a FHU site so I could hunker down here during a rain and snow storm and plug in my little space heater and wait it out.

name: Amistad NP Diablo East
description: Free water and dump station. Big enough for even the biggest vehicles. well maintained.

name: I-49 Rest Area
description: Clean bathrooms, vending machines, pet area, and night time security cameras and guard provided. There are also several scenic ponds as well. Loud frogs during our brief overnight nap from driving.

name: Hurricane, UT
description: Propane fill station. in the parkinglot of Performance Fitness.

name: Mt. Roosevelt - SE Peak
description: Pretty tough to drive up, but possible. We did it in a lifted compact SUV with 4wd. You need to head up several shale hills, cross a cattle grate, and drive through a foot deep mud puddle, but it's totally worth it. Some of the most beautiful sights. Had full LTE with T-Mobile and Verizon.

name: Sites Near Henry Lake
description: There's quite a few sites near Henry Lake. I know others have posted some closer to the highway, but there's a bunch a little up the road. We used a site kind of in the open, but still pretty nice. No issue getting campers into most sites. Just a little bumpy. There's a small creek if you feel super out-doorsey.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Standard Cracker Barrel rv parking.  Quiet, not much road noise.

name: Telluride City Park Shower
description: HOT showers! Yay! $3 for 5 minutes. Quarters only. Cleaned daily. Open during the day. 6 or so stalls that are “private”, but only because of a shower curtain. Hooks for your towel and free soap on the wall! Great little find!

name: Pulaski Trailhead
description: Just a few parking spots, USFS trailhead next to a river that leads to a two mile hike (Pulaski Trail). There is a bathroom, it had no toilet paper. The parking spots aren’t big enough for large rigs. It was surprisingly quiet, not a lot of cars passing through except folks coming for the trail. The river acts as a bit of white noise.

name: Road to Egypt
description: Away from the traffic of Hole in the Rock Road yet close enough to the trail heads for Spooky and Peek-a-Boo to beat the Disneyland like crowds.

name: Walmart at Lewis Center
description: Walmart parking lot. Well lit site with lots of flat parking spaces. Some Hwy 23 road noise. Set in a strip mall area with other businesses nearby.

name: Grasshopper
description: Set back from main road , under the pine. Only one flat spot, otherwise there are about 4 or 5 other spots for overlanders and pickup cab overs to camp. Not made for any type of trailer camping . Fire  pits and lots of shade . 14 day max (Free )

name: RV Park
description: In Boulder Utah, attached to gas station and convenience store. Has electric and water hook up.

name: Camping World
description: You can refill your on-board propane tank here. Note: there is no dump station or water fill station.

name: Jefferson National Forest FS 90 Turnout
description: Small turnout shortly after getting on FS90. Someone built a makeshift firepit out of rocks and concrete blocks. Room for 30 ft RV or smaller. Don't need 4 wheel drive to get to this spot. Absolutely ZERO cell service. Quiet. Right next to a stream.

name: Queen Anne Sanitation District
description: You must call 410-643-3535 ahead during business hours to make arrangements to be escorted to the dump site. Open limited hours.Cost is currently free during Covid but usually $10. There is no fresh water to rinse your hose.

name: Redding Recreation Area- USFS
description: Approximately 20 sites with picnic tables and fire pits .  Nicely dispersed along the Mulberry River.  First come, first serve. $10/night.

name: Piney Peninsula - East Fork
description: This site is about 2 miles from 160 in national forest land. Road is bumpy, but we had no issues in our Ram Promaster City (named Crystal). The site is right next to the river and has a fire pit. River is fast moving, nice to listen to all night, and is very refreshing for a quick dip. Area is quiet and picturesque, we only saw a few people go past during our stay. No bugs either and little problem finding firewood. Loved this site. 5/5 but could not it that for some reason.

name: Hickory Run State Park Pulloff
description: Open area to park with a trailhead for several beginner to advanced hikes. Full sunlight for solar potential. U shaped drive and out for ease. No amenities

name: Uhaul
description: $2.79 cheapest I have paid in a long time

name: Windy Hill Overlook
description: Small hilltop site, no water, wild brush and rock ring for fire

name: Riverside
description: this is a great little nook. wind protection. 10 minutes from multiple hot springs. first campsite on this forest road. great after soaking all day. great river access. can't complain.  if you need a good sleep, this is it. more spots everywhere around here.

name: Off BLM 300
description: Big empty space with fire ring surrounded by beautiful rock walls

name: Territorial Statehouse Park
description: A couple red spigots near the picnic tables. Also blue by the museum. Nice park, and museum. There are also covered electrical outlets

name: Easy Wash
description: All new machines. Accepts credit cards (even contactless like ApplePay) or coins. No wifi, but great place in fine neighborhood.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Nice quiet Cracker Barrel. dedicated RV parking. Between Dallas and Fort Worth, right next to Six Flags.

name: CY Laundry
description: CY Laundry is a full service laundromat right on the main road into Casper when coming from Alcova Reservoir. We found the place very clean and the laundry machines were in great condition.

name: Remote.ly
description:
This is a place where you can pay to use their workspaces.  It's $25 for a day pass ($20 with a student id) & you get access to unlimited super fast wifi, varied workspaces, and a barista. Drinks are free with a day pass & food is cheap (vegan bagel & cream cheese was $2.50).

**iOverlander won't let me change no. of stars. I loved it - 5 stars.

name: Ace Country Coop
description: Water is .40 per gallon. You just have to go in to pay.

name: I 75 rest area, Northbound
