No shade. It was very windy. You are at a high altitude. We woke up inside of a cloud. There’s a street light across the street but it didn’t disturb us. If anything it helped. You may see some neighbors. They were super friendly and quiet

name: Maverick Convenience Store
description: Water spigot at the end of center pumps, facing Glendale Ave. Good city water.

name: Sinclair Dino Mart
description: Potable water here. You have to pay $20 for the dump station, but if you only need water you still need to talk to the attendant before use. We dumped and paid the $20 so not sure if you still have to pay for water if you don’t dump.

name: Wold Rd
description:
Moderator note: Location may not match road descriptions. Please update when possible


---------------------

A pull-in/back in spot on the left side of wold rd  once you pull  off the main road (skate creed rd south). We fit our 26 ft camper van in this spot no problem — still had a good amount of room so you could fit some maybe a couple feet longer. We also had to use some leveling blocks, but not crazy horrible if you don’t have any. We were here on a weekend and it was crazy crowded so it was nice being off the busy road where tons of people were camping. Several smaller pull offs along this road, probably for smaller cars and maybe tent camping. We were wary about what spots were up for grabs, but there weren’t any “no camping” signs or “private property” marked anywhere along this small road. Another camper was parked at the very end of the road in the dead end and there were so many other people camping in the NF when we came I doubt they patrol it or care. No signal (Verizon). No toilets obviously other than good old Mother Nature and the forest she provides :)

name: Mill Meadow Reservoir
description: East side of Reservoir (Rt. 25) near boat ramp.  Follow dirt paths to 3-4 sites. No services but great sites. Highly recommended!

name: Crown Hill Park
description: By the bathrooms, they have a water bottle fill up fountain, not going to work for an RV, but to fill up a few gallons.

name: Gas&Go/ Dog Park/ Truck wash / Overnite
description:
Gas & Go 
- truck wash 
- Subway
- off leash Dog Park
- parking in rear to sleep or rest

name: Northbound and Southbound Reststops
description: Small reststop with picnic area, bathrooms and vending machines.

name: Crook County RV park
description: RV park with showers and dump station available to travelers

name: Love’s Travel Stop - Rockwell TX
description: $10 Dump Fee. Prepay the cashier and they unlock it for you. You’ll find it beside the parking strip in the front.

name: Red Rock Canyon Adventure Park
description: Great campground with grassy sites, trees, and beautiful red rock walls in a hidden valley just of the I-40. Paid 15 bucks for a tent site. Access to short hikes, playgrounds, and you can climb the walls. Owner was nice and helpful. Good AT&T service. Verizon spotty and good in places.

name: Kansas Rest Stop
description: This rest stop has a free dump station with non potable water. Drinking water is available from a different spigot at a picnic table next to the dump station. You will need a 50-foot hose to get fresh water here. There may be other spigots with better access.

name: Walmart Parking Lot on the beach
description: Not 100% sure if you’re allowed to park here, but it’s the only lot without visible sign forbidding it. It seems quiet. There was another van parked here so maybe it’s ok. I would still say only stealth vans can pull this off.

name: Dunnigan Rest Area
description: Decent amount of parking for both trucks and cars, still plenty of spots for both on a weekend day. Men's bathroom was disgusting. At the moment, is the only rest stop open for about 60 miles along 5 as others are closed for construction.

name: safeway
description: 30 cents a gallon or $1.50 for 5 gallons.

name: the best spot around
description: amazing spot on the rim with excellent views. made it here in two-wheel drive. spot has fire pit and plenty of wood to burn.. 3 bars lte on sprint. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: French creek Campground
description: Horse and tent sites. Fire rings with grills, picnic tables.  Vault toilet. Access to the agate fields

name: Horse Gulch
description: BLM land. Near OHV trails. Lots of level space. Camp up to 14 days.

name: Sweet Grass Coffee Shop
description: Overlanders heading North from Capitol Reef have few options for great espresso & food to carry them through the paved miles before the miles and miles of off pavement overlanding opportunities in Fish Lake National Forest.  The Sweet Grass Coffee Shop is fantastic - true espresso craftsmanship by skilled baristas along with home crafted food & bakery goods to meet most diet preferences.  All housed in a historic stone building artfully restored.  Definitely on our must stop list.

name: Cracker Barrel
description: Spent two nights here. Mile road noise. If you do stay in the area I highly recommend going to see turnip rock. It was amazing!

name: 3 Forks
description: Gas and diesel station and convenience store. Expensive, but if you need gas at least you can put in a few $ until the next gas station.

name: Sulphur Springs Camp
description: Grassy bank site on the Colorado River. Good fishing. Must have 4 wheel drive and high clearance.

name: Chimney Rock campground BLM
description: One of several BLM campgrounds along the Crooked River.  This one  has potable water from a hand pump.  Only $8 per night.  Vault toilets.  Popular with fly fishermen, but not usually crowded.

name: Flathead Glacier Rim Boat Ramp
description: There are a number of spots in the National Forest along a road that leads to a boat launch. Fire rings, plenty of space for big rigs, road in is mostly paved. Pit toilet in the parking lot. Posted 3 day max. We stayed right by the sign because it was nice by the water and a few of the other spots were occupied. Not busy on a Thursday night or Friday morning! 1-2 bars Verizon LTE. The spots closest to the water seem ideal for tent camping, as the fire rings are blocked off by boulders so you can’t pull your vehicle right up.

name: Catgirl Waifu
description:
Very nice BLM paved road with many wide pull-outs perfect for a relaxing night in the woods. The road goes very far back, paved most of the way and manicured gravel past. No need for 4x4. First spot near the front may need 4x4, possibly access to river. 

Map included shows BLM land, but it seems anywhere is fine to camp. 
I've highlighted some of the spots to check for good spots! 
Probably a C class would be the biggest you would want to take in here.

name: Round MTN.
description: Nice stop for fuel and supplies. Well stocked general store

name: Panguitch
description: Gravel ATV trailhead parking area. good size with a simple bathroom. Behind the hospital, so should be safe. Did not see any 'no camping' or 'no overnight' signs.

name: Sausalito residential
description: Not far off the highway but super quiet. beautiful viewpoint in a nice residential neighborhood, so be quiet and discreet. sign says 72 hours max, no trailers. great view!

name: Mount Tom view
description: Basic free campsite,  no facilities,  good dirt road in. The road is accessed just at Northbound 395 uphill, paved exit lane on the right. Cross cattle grate, follow Forest service road, take first Right and follow power lines up/down hill. Go left, lots of area to camp. Some 395 noise, but at 6000ft, way cooler than Bishop..

name: Forest service road
description: Forest Service road, signposted 'dead' end. Camping Place will be on your Left as you drive on Forest Service road into Inyo Craters.

name: West Fork (San Juan NF)
description:
Get off the main road and there is wild camping all over. Follow all the way to the end and you can hike Rainbow Hotspings, 5 miles one way.
Nice road for any car! Lots of fresh water flowing ... enjoy

name: Treasure falls
description: Small hike to waterfalls. Great for kids of all ages! Parking lot! Cross the bridge to get back to the parking lot..map doesnt show but there is a trail no need to go back the same way!

name: Overlook
description: Parking off the main road... path way behind the fence for an amzing view. High above the valley.

name: Adirondack Adventure Base
description: This is a location with a mix of stay options, owned and run by overlanders. The campsite can handle smaller, fully self contained RV’s up to about 20’. The owners (this writer) test access with their Lance 825 on an F350 SRW Superduty. Tight, but doable. It’s a no-pets - no generator site. Smaller RV’s and vans can also access the Overlook Leanto site. Check www.adirondacksdventurebase.com for availability and pricing. Pictured in this post is the leanto site.

name: BLM road 4524
description:
Large, flat pullout off of BLM road 4524 just before the creek ford. Located about a mile from the state line on County Road G, about 12 miles past the Sand Canyon Trailhead in Canyons of the Ancients NM. 
No shade. I had between one and three bars for ATT cell service. Some intermittent road noise, but otherwise I had a couple very peaceful nights here.

name: Apgar Campground
description:
Your basic National Forest Service campground in the woods beside the Lochsa River. $14 gets you a site that might or might not be level, a picnic table, fire ring and pit toilets with no toilet paper. Thankfully the sound of the rushing River drowns out the highway sounds though there isn't much traffic at night.

We ended up here as all the other sites along the river posted here on iOverlander were occupied, mostly by kayakers. And due to Covid almost all the other campgrounds are closed. Forest Service roads were also still closed as of June 4, likely due to snowpack.

This tiny campground is no good for any rig larger than a pickup. No water other than the river. Knife Edge campground 4 Mike's east in Hwy 12 is much larger, same price, and has a sewage dump that is free.

name: Dump station + water 10$
description: Dump station and water next to chevron gas station, supposed to be 10$ but no one was there to take our money...

name: Roadside parking area
description: Large flat roadside parking area next to scenic highway. While the road is well trafficked during the day, there was minimal traffic after 10 PM. Nice view of the lake but the Lakeshore is actually on private property.  Slept like a baby here. AT&T service between one and two bars.

name: Shangrila Campground
description: Equestrian campground but not exclusively for horses. Next to Florida Greenway. Hiking, mountain bike, and horse trails. Spacious pull-through sites with NO hookups.

name: Dalton Wash Rd.
description: Few pullouts on dirt road off highway. Very quiet road without much activity

name: Whole Foods WiFi
description: Great spot for WiFi.  There are tables out front to sit on and lots a shade to park in.

name: Del Norte Town Park
description:
Town park that allows 1 free overnight stay.  Dry camping.

Rules / customs unclear - I and another camper stayed parked on Spruce St border of park, though sign says only in “parking lot”.  Unsure what “parking lot” it refers to.  Sign also says permission required (from town office across the street), but nearby resident says permission is required only to use the central water tap - free to camp at will.  There is a dump station, don’t know if it’s working or if permission is required.

Room on Spruce Street for maybe 4 big rigs or maybe 8 smaller ones.

Got a T-Mobile signal. Did not get a Verizon signal.

name: By old campground
description: Nice camp spot right close to the main toad. Behind trees so pretty quiet and private. Two entrances and able to drive right through.  We had 4 bars 4g

name: By reservoir
description: Great spot close to water and under camped under shady trees with gorgeous cliff views. We have a 2wd sprinter and easily got there.

name: Side of road
description: Enough room for large rv if backed in. Stayed here in truck camper and another person in a van. Flat and just off the road. Noisy during day not bad at night. Creek runs by and we saw 5 cops pass by with no issues. No no camping signs and gravel. Safe level in the back of lot and free.

name: Small Pull In Near Glacier
description:
Very small area with fire ring for car or van camping. Level ground about 100 feet from the paved road. Could tent camp but you are close to Belton Stage Road so vehicles pass by periodically. We were able to pull in to give ourselves some privacy by blocking the road. Some noise from Route 2 but quiet at night. 

One bar Verizon service. Not much dead wood so bring your own for fire. 

We saw another camper down the road but didn’t see anyone else who looked like they were spending the night. No one bothered us though.

name: Campground St. Regis
description:
Campground and RV Park. 
Grassy area for tent camping. 
20, 30 & 50 amp sites (back in and pull through) with water, some with sewer. Varied sites for smaller and larger rigs. 

Pet friendly with designated dog walk area. 

Pool, laundry, hot showers, dump station, potable water, propane refill, free wifi, general store & gift shop, free shuttle to/from town from Memorial to Labor Day. 

Very nicely kept grounds with mature trees all around. Very clean restrooms and showers, nice vibe and friendly owners. 

A bit of road noise bouncing off the mountains, but did not bother us in our pop up truck camper.  

***No late arrivals, must check in by 8pm. 

Reservations by phone only 

888-247-8734 (toll free)
406-649-2470

www.campgroundstregisrvpark.com

name: Logging Road Pull Off
description: This is a small clearing off a sandy road. Very primitive as it is part of a logging road. You will definitely need four wheel drive in winter. You may have to share if others also find this site.

name: Rite aid glacier water refill
description: There’s a water refill for gallons outside this Rite Aid. Cheaper than buying new gallons.

name: Residential offshoot from magazine street
description: Quiet streets, neighborhood feels safe. Parked right next to magasin (the restaurant) and had no issues throughout the night. Saw other vanlife around then neighborhood when driving for coffee

name: KOA-Red Lodge
description: Nice KOA about 4 miles north of Red Lodge.  Friendly, new owners make you feel welcome after a long drive over Beartooth.

name: Dominguez-Escalante NCA
description: Opted to stay here over the nearby parking area as we had this little pullout to ourselves. Take 141 to Divide Rd (well graded gravel) and it's about 6 mi, up on top of the mesa. Great views as you drive up, but not many camping options along the narrow road, and none early on. We passed a few before this but they were either occupied or were too small/rutted for our bus. There was a little fire ring and some nice, short trees for shade but full sun for our solar. Was flattish, but not big enough for larger RVs (we're 22'). Some traffic on the road during the day but very quiet at night. Decent signal (3-4 bars) on Tmobile and Google Fi.

name: Wow!! Amazing Red Canyon views
description:
BLM LAND. Use Google satellite to drive out on this road. you can camp on a cliff ledge with amazing views. The road isn't too bad. Can be windy at times. if rain in the forecast I wouldn't come out here. 

btw if you have 4x4 keep driving down the highway towards flaming gorge and look for the red creek sign to do some very fun Offroading. Absolutely filled with antelope.

name: Moose River State Forest
description: State forest land, dispersed camping is therefore free. There are several open areas just off the sandy trails throughout the forest land. Be mindful of the boundaries, the state forest is not very large. Fire pits are minimal, usually a hole dug in sand. There is ample firewood to be found. Cell signal is non-existent in the forest, but just out on the highway it is usually available.

name: Nice spot by the river
description: Nice, quiet and cosy spot right next to the river. No "no overnight camping" sign.

name: Walden Reservoir Dispersed CampingBLM
description: Pick a spot! It's dispersed so no assigned spaces, there are several spots by the water. Excellent cell service and close to town. The only drawback is the insects, lots of ants.

name: Rd 307 Dispersed Camping
description:
There are sites along this road that I have stayed at many of times. It is also fun to explore the dirt road that this is attached too. Some really cool spots back here. A family of bighorn sheep live on the hill behind this road. They have been here for 10 plus years! 

Enjoy.

name: Krause springs
description: amazing spring fed traditional swimming pool and creek swimming hole with waterfalls, huge cypress, huge stone picnic tables. tent camping is 15/night/adult. I'm single in a car so unsure of the price structure for children and rvs. RVs may need reservations. tents never need reservations. there is 34 acres of land with plenty of tent sites, choose your level of remoteness. plenty of shade, streamside camping. pretty much paradise. what's the catch? no pets allowed. must be in before 8pm. cant go in and out of the gates at night. no hot showers??, but there are bathhouses with cool showers. no general store on premises, but ice and firewood.

name: Hard Rain Cafe & RV park
description:
I saw this named location somewhere else on the iOverlander map, but am not sure if this is a second location or if they moved here. $28 non-electric/$38 electric hookup. You can tent camp here too. Bathrooms and showers as well as a cafe with food all day and a gift shop for souvenirs. Only thing about the showers is when we went there was no hot water so the water was freezing—not sure if they ever have hot water. All the spots are pretty level and it’s right off the road towards Hoh Rainforest if that NP campground is full. Our 25 ft sprinter fit perfect. 

3603749228 (after hours 3606402792)

name: Safeway
description: Spent one night (Saturday) at the far end of the lot closest to Mt Si Blvd.  Had no issues.

name: Showers at Gas Station
description: Showers at the route Phillips 66 gas station.

name: Dino Footprints Trailhead
description:
Parking lot with pit toilet at the beginning of the dino trail head. A few vans were here when we were overnight. 1.5 mile hike to lake with dino Footprints.

Fast Att service.

name: Dino Land Wild Camp
description: One of many turnoffs out here. this one is very easy to get too and has a great view. Close-ish to the road but there is no traffic out here. Fire ring and Amazing views!

name: Chill spot
description: Great access to highway, not very populated during a very popular time

name: Holbrook Parish Park
description: A basic Campground from the Parish, 12$ for water and electric, tent site 4$. HOT showers, clean and well maintained. Friendly camp hosts, 24h on site, it's the small house right at the entrance.

name: Holbrook Parish Park
description: Dump station, nothing more to say about. Ask camp host for price.

name: Conoco Loa Hwy 24
description: Water tap on side. BYO hose, but can pull up right to the tap. Saw an RV filling up - not sure if free or pay.

name: Rolling Mountains
description: gorgeous spot - we would have stayed a few more days if we had the time! unreal sunset, no one else around, easy 2wd in the whole way (just dodge the pot holes), and a great boondocking spot! 9/10 && keep it clean.

name: Walmart 12401
description:
This is a Supercenter Walmart and a Sam’s Club. There’s also a Sam gas station too. According to Allstays.com, you’re supposed to park in the Sam’s side where the trucks are. I did. :-)

I spent the night here, didn’t ask, but had no issues. No knock, mostly quiet, you’re right next to the highway…so if you can live with that, you’ll be fine. 

If however you do get a knock or the highway gets to you, there’s a Cracker Barrel up the road.

There are a bunch of other Walmart’s in the area. This is the only one that seems to allow overnight parking. 

Do NOT park in front of the Walmart…

name: Bask streets
description:
Street parking. Cafés and other businesses nearby. Most have restrictions high or time limit restrictions, this block doesn’t other than street sweeping Sunday 11a-1p.

Mostly level (not perfect but close enough).

Also near a WeWork location that has a shower. Members only but first month at WeWork is free.

name: Samoa Boat Ramp
description: Dry camping location on parking lot next to the bay. Showers were closed but bathrooms are OK. Some spots have tables and fire rings. When its quiet, its nice. But when its crowded, generators from RVs disrupt the otherwise quiet peaceful site.

name: Flying J
description: Clean showers, friendly staff. The towels are a little nicer than at Love’s and they offered a second set since we were sharing.

name: Lake County Recycling
description:
Large dumpsters for separating recycleables next to the baseball field. Very specific instructions for what is/isn't allowed and different drops for each type (plastic #1&2, paper, glass, cardboard, etc). See photo. There's also a dumpster for trash but you need a pre-purchased bag.

Open Fri-Tue 9am-3pm

name: Shell Station
description: Propane fill behind the garage at the Shell Station. Not cheap but the other one in town was broken. $4.59/gal

name: La Cuesta campsite
description:
Located in Big Bend Ranch State park.  This is an hour outside Big bend National park.  (60 plus miles) 
Quiet campsite. Occasionally border patrol checks hill at night and local guide service uses boat ramp for launching kayaks during the day. 
Only 4 “sites” here. Close to the road and unlevel.  Centipedes are plenty and saw a scorpion or two.  Would do in a pinch.

name: Forest Road 913
description: Camping spot just off an unmapped road and under the pines.  No fire ring, just a beautiful quiet spot with birds and deer and cattle grazing off in the distance.  From FR 913, look for a turn off to the west between the edge of the forest line and a culvert that crosses under FR 913.  There are some low branches that will be an issue for vehicle height >10 ft. Please keep this place clean!

name: Kolob Terrace Rd spots on the river
description:
Turn off on the right between the "Subway hikers need a permit" sign and the actual pull-off with a bigger info sign. There are probably 15 sites off this rutted dirt road (did it in AWD Forester no problem), but most are crowded together in one main area. pull your car up to side the of the river, find a fire ring, you're good to go. 

There are 2-4 other more secluded spots. one on the way to the larger area. If you turn to the right (south) of the larger area and follow the road, there's an incredible little site RIGHT on the river within the trees. Farther back, the road ends at a larger site off the river a bit. 

GPS and pictures are from the smaller secluded site in the trees. plenty of space for 2-3 tents, not great for hammocking though, unless you have long straps. plenty of hammocking spots in the larger area.

name: Merchants Millpond State Park Campgrounds
description:
Merchants Millpond State Park offers several types of campsites, each with different amenities (as described below).  I stayed at a very spacious paddle-in site, which I reserved online.

In addition to camping, the park offers several amenities: hiking and paddling trails, canoe rentals, picnic tables and shelters, fishing, and a visitor center with snacks, drinks and exhibits.

Decent cell service with Verizon.

Park website:  https://www.ncparks.gov/merchants-millpond-state-park/home

The following descriptions are from the park's website.  Note: prices vary depending on type of site and season.

Tent and trailer camping
The family campground is in the midst of a pine/hardwood forest just beyond the park office. Twenty campsites for tents and trailers offer picnic tables and grills. A washhouse with drinking water, restrooms and showers serves the campground. There are no electrical hookups, water or dumping station.
 
Group camping
Organized groups will enjoy a stay in the walk-in group camping area or in a canoe camping group site.
Facilities for the walk-in sites include a small washhouse with a shower. Drinking water is available nearby.
 
Backpack camping
Reach five campsites for backpack camping by hiking a side trail off Lassiter Trail.
Campers must pack all supplies, including water, to the sites. A pit toilet is nearby.
Views of the "enchanted forest" and Lassiter Swamp await those who travel to the backpack camping area.
 
Paddle-in camping
Reach three canoe camps by way of paddle trails leading from the boat ramp.
Orange markers lead to the family canoe camp with 10 sites. Yellow markers lead to the group canoe camp, which offers three sites. Pit toilets are available, but campers must carry in all supplies, including water, and carry out their trash.
The third canoe camp is located down Bennett's Creek, approximately 4.5 miles from the boat ramp. Bennett's Creek canoe-in campgrounds are carry-in, carry-out with no restrooms.

name: Hatcher Spot
description: Good flat spot. No view of the Tetons at this particular spot but there are others along the road that have good views. No Verizon service. Early June, terrible for bugs. We had our bug nets up and still decided to leave and go somewhere else. Could not stand to be outside at all. Bugs are terrible everywhere along this road.

name: Cleared pull-out just off road with great view
description: This pull out has been cleared out and goes further back an additional 80’ or so. It ends up behind a hill that hides it from the main road and blocks out much of that noise. It has a great view of the canyon and river below. You can clearly hear the river running as you go to sleep. This is a very nice spot for car or van camping. There are some large ruts ands slight incline about 25’ as you pull in so it may not be suitable for a larger RV.

name: Loves Travel Plaza
description: Right off of I-5 and does the job in a pinch. Back lot is only for semi-trucks, but we parked our sprinter in the front and had no problems. Didn’t see spots big enough for an RV or trailer, so recommended for smaller rigs only. Garbage cans available outside and flush toilets inside. Cell service on ATT is intermittent in this area.

name: Dixie tech
description: Big lot at entrance of campus. Park close to the buildings to get free WiFi connection.

name: Lynn Street Mini park
description: Lots of cars parked along the street because it’s a residential area but found a solid place to park my van. And quiet at night next to a nice park. Also a convenience store across the street. Full bars of service. Probably only good for a night because the signs say only 2 hour parking from 6 am to 5pm and probably good to get out early because it is a residential area

name: Walmart #2730
description:
This is a Supercenter Walmart. I didn’t ask to stay but according to Allstays.com they don’t mind. Just keep it on the DL.

I parked along the bushes near the edge of their parking lot. I spent 1 night here. Felt safe. If you get a ‘knock’ there’s a Cracker Barrel 18 miles away or a 24hr Waffle House just up the street.

name: roundabout on the west end of rest area
description: huge roundabout very dark at night so if you'd like to move a little bit away from that 18-wheelers and car camp or pop your rooftop tent this spot is perfect for the night

name: Williams Fork Reservoir West Side
description: Free camping with 360 degrees of wide, rolling vistas: mountains, hills and water.  Plenty of space to be alone even on a Saturday night in June!  Beach camping for those who won’t get stuck. 2 bars Verizon. Can be windy on the top. 2wd dirt roads galore. Fire pits, toilets, as well as picnic tables in certain areas.

name: Logging Road by Creek
description:
This is a flat, dead end in the middle of nowhere, but other dispersed spots were either right against the roads or they were taken. You will be pleasantly surprised by a little waterfall!

The road in is steep like a roller coaster but I kept thinking if the giant logging trucks could do it then so could my fwd Promaster. 

Note: at least when they are hard and dry. Would not attempt if the roads were wet!

name: Logging Road
description:
Just a pull-off and nothing else but it’s flat, there was nobody on the road last night and the view from here of the snowy Rockies is stunning! 2 bars Verizon. 
AVOID Hurd Creek Road unless you have 4WD at least!

name: Forest Flatts
description: Simple spot not too far off the road. Pulled in with a 30 foot school bus no problem, could easily manage larger rigs. Nothing fancy but a quaint lil spot in the woods with one of the finest sunsets over the adjacent flatlands. Close to the highway so theres a little noise.

name: WisDOT rest area
description: A nice quiet rest area. It was busy with come and go traffic until about 10pm then I was the only one there all night. Quiet and nice bathrooms.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Dump station and propane available. Dump is $10. I didn't see any potable water, but I didn't need it and wasn't looking. There is a rinse hose for the dump.

name: Wounded Pine
description: Pull out on a forest service road. Pretty close to level, with a campfire spot. Though the trees you can just see Pikes Peak

name: Snow Canyon scenic overlook
description: Beautiful views and nice walking path to get out and stretch. No fees to park during day use hours only.

name: Mores Summit parking lot
description: Big open space right off the main forest road, but the traffic is light, at worst. Pit toilets, cell service, and a decent view, too! A nice compensation if all of the woodsy sites seem busy with other campers, as happened to me before i found this lot.

name: Woodrat Mountain
description: Only 30min from town, very nice views and quiet camping!! Even has toilet at top where the paragliding launch pad is. Not too many holes of road for privacy, but big parking lot at top with good views.

name: Summit Rest Area
description:
Rest area with about a dozen picnic tables, lots of parking for cars/vans and RVs/trailers. Indoor restrooms and information. Potable water is available, but only in warmer weather. Interstate noise is negligible inside your vehicle. 3 bars LTE with AT&T. 
Per Wyoming Department of Transportation: “Camping is prohibited at rest areas, but drivers who need to rest to safely continue their travels can sleep inside their vehicles. 
If you need more than a nap, you can sleep in your vehicle for a longer period, but don’t pitch a tent, extend your RV’s slideouts, or otherwise set up for an extended stay.”

name: Walmart in Huron, SD
description: Standard Walmart, I asked to stay overnight and was told to just park “out of the way”. Quiet, with one trailer and one car dweller parking overnight as well. It’s a convenient place to stop in an area without many free options.

name: Staples Side Parking Lot
description: The Walmart next door stopped allowing overnight parking in early June 2021. I stayed here, in the parking between Staples and Wendy’s without any issue. I’m in a pickup truck, so I can recommend it for true stealth campers, not RVs or trailers. As always, leave no trace.

name: San Luis pass
description: Nice place, entrance is rough. Fairly quite. Ice cream truck came through. Will get stuck if not careful.

name: Williams Peak Rd (BLM)
description: Just off CO-9 on Williams Peak Rd/FS-200. The first 0.5 mi or so of this road is BLM, then private property before it turns to NF about 2 mi in. Road to here is easy for all vehicles but the road gets worse/more rutted as you go. We drove the 0.5 mi to the end of the BLM and there was only one more small spot past this one on the left.This is a large parking area just off the highway and has space for several vehicles. Seems popular with OHVs, but was fairly quiet on a Monday. Fire rings, some bones, and evidence of shooting. Decent spot and less crowded than the rec site a few miles south on 9. Very faint/no highway noise. No cell signal on Tmobile or Google Fi.

name: Parking at Bryant Canyon Road
description: Big parking lot just north of Soledad Cemetery in Bryant Canyon Road. Large enough for several rigs. Parking is not restricted here. A good and quite place for the night going to/coming out Pinnacles NP (West). No amenities, just a parking!

name: Lot across from state park
description: Big flat gravel lot across the street from the state park. No “no overnight parking” signs. Little beach and two porta potties. Directly adjacent to road so there is noise but good for a night.

name: Street parking
description:
Street side parallel parking.
Not too noisy.
5G 3 bar TMobile service.
Spent a night in a camper van

name: ZENITRAM AUTOMOTIVE SVC. & SAL
description: General Mechanic of foreign and domestic vehicles.

name: Sunshine Laundromat
description: Clean place with decent machines. Free WiFi didn’t connect me to the internet.

name: JC’s Pure Water & More
description: Water refill station on the front of the building. We filled both of our 6 gallon jugs for $4.20 total. Clean water.

name: Truck Stop
description: Large lot north of fueling station. Lots of trucks. A few rigs. Register inside, but free. Cell signal Version.

name: Target
description: Target Parking Lot. Well lit. Walking distance to lots of restaurants, and stores.

name: Hapgood RV Park
description: City Park. Dump station at exit. 12 pull through sites with full hookups (electric, water, and sewage) relatively level and No shade. Located just off hwy 287. Very good ATT data signal.

name: Outside DPW
description: The north end of the second gate has some fairly flat asphalt that will take any size trailer. Don't block the gate. Some AT&T, no Verizon or Tmobile.

name: Quosatana Campground
description:
43 campsites (3 accessible sites) with picnic tables and fire pits

Day use area (with mowed play area)

Campground host available

Firewood available for purchase at host site

Boat launch. Fish cleaning station

Drinking water. Flushing toilets. Garbage disposal. RV dump station

name: Good Campsite on Shaw Bay
description: Well-used campsite on Shaw Bay in the LBL area. Wild camping, pick up your trash. Permit is needed for this spot as it is considered Dispersed camping. $10 for 3 days

name: Forest Road 617
description: Large 125' x 100 clearing on recently graded dirt forest service road in Holly Springs Nat'l Forest. Lots of tree bark and other somewhat recent tree debris. Rather even and level. Multiple rigs could fit here, especially after the bark and chipping remains are smoothed out more. Verizon 4 bars. Very quiet. 2WD low clearance OK.

name: Casino rv dump
description: Free and easy to use. Has both non-potable and potable water. A+

name: Weiser River Trailhead
description: Trail head just off the main dirt road. Potable water, pit toilet. Quiet except for the occasional car/truck and going by.

name: Ethel’s Hideout
description: Ethel’s Hideout is an established campground with 5 rv hookups with power and electric. They just put in 5 tent spots that has a port-a-potty and potable water. They have a fire ring, benches, and  some solar lights to sit out under the stars. I booked through HipCamp. $35 for hookups...I’m not sure about tent spots.  Verizon cell service was enough to stream tv.

name: Park & Ride
description: The signs in the Park & Ride lot said you can park up to 24 hours then you’re subject to tow. It was a great spot for 1 night. Well-lit, clean and we felt safe here. We parked here for 1 night.

name: Jemez Falls Campground
description: Reservation only campground. Paved roads and campsites. $10/night. Vault toilets. Beautiful tall trees.

name: Rexford Bench USFS
description: Established campground with large, paved and level sites.  No hookups.  Nice shaded forest cover.  Okay Verizon service.

name: Milner historic
description: Quiet BLM area with pit toilet and trashcan. Campsites have fire ring in some places. 13’ max under one bridge. 2-3 bars Verizon

name: Maple Set Campground
description: Dispersed camping in John Bethea State Forest. Sites near a small pond in the trees. Picnic tables, camp rings and garbage cans provided. No other amenities. No cell service on Verizon. Reserve sites on reserveamerica.com to get gate code. Fee is $9 plus taxes. Hot and buggy in June.

name: panoramic view
description:
panoramic view of provo and surrounding areas from a high viewpoint, come visit & find out!
 high clearance needed (6 inches +) to get to spot. i got up here in a FWD 4cyl.
there is a fire ring up here also. i camped overnight with no issues! 15mbps download and 8mbps upload on boost mobile\ sprint

name: Coin-op Laundromat
description: Easy pull off and parking. $3.50 for there smaller machine...I would say triple loader.  In the same lot there is an area to wash rvs.

name: Free potable water at Chevron gas station
description: Free potable city water and air. We were driving by this chevron and saw a small sign on the building saying water and air so we stopped and talked to the guy inside who was super nice and said go right ahead and fill up. Small spigot on left front corner of building that is easy to access.

name: Plumas backcountry 1
description: Drive through plumas eureka state park.  Pass by the state campground entrance turn and follow the one lane forest road (johnsville McCrea rd).  High clearance recommended

name: Plumas Nation Forest 2
description: Drive through plumas eureka state park.  Pass by the state campground entrance turn and follow the one lane forest road (johnsville McCrea rd).  High clearance recommended

name: Moraine View State Park
description: Free dump station and drinking water.  A beautiful state park with lake as well.

name: A hidden gem if you are going to/went to Sequoia
description: north side of the Sequoias NP, paved road the whole way down to these coordinates. secluded, quiet, birds, a little stream, flat space for any rigs up to 30ft most likely.. doable in 2wd. no signal, as with the whole park, I believe, but well worth it. makes you enjoy the nature more and appreciate the beauty. soak your feet in the stream down the hill and watch the sun set, read a book, listen to the birds, and just enjoy yourself in this hidden gem of a boondocking spot!

name: 2 with a view
description: Two spots with incredible views of Lake Cushman and surrounding mountains. Close to the trailhead for Upper Mt Ellinor. Peaceful and quiet. Verizon available.

name: Don Chuy
description: Great authentic Mexican food! Stop here every time we are in the area!

name: Chevron
description: Water spout right by the car wash behind the service station

name: Walmart & Truck stop
description: Standard Walmart, not 24 hours, but there were other vans and cars parked over night. There is a gas station truck stop in the same parking lot with clean bathrooms that is open 24 hours. The gas station has showers. I didn’t use them so I’m not sure the price. It was quiet during the night but a little road noise in the morning. Easy one night stop on our way out of Texas.

name: Jupiter Beach access 68
description: Great place to park and spend the day. There is a restaurant, free outdoor showers, bbq, shaded benches and just steps to a beautiful beach. Spend a few hours here just chillin’!

name: South flat head rover spot
description: Lovely little spot on the river if you can handle a little bit of dirt roads. Pull off and relax

name: Estrellas Laundry
description: Excellent local business that is very traveler friendly. Toni the owner is very friendly and helpful with operating the machines if you need assistance. Conveniently located and not far from the Super Walmart. Clean reasonably priced machines. Restroom if you need it. We arrived in Flagstaff hungry weary and travel stained… but full of hope. We left this laundromat not disappointed and clean

name: Aspen Grove near Summit
description: Site off forest service road. A number of places to camp along the road, all with gorgeous views of the valley.

name: Pacific Creek Rd Dispersed Sites
description: Access through National Park. About 8 miles from main road in park. Nice location backing up to river.  Dirt road to site is in good condition, the driveway to our site was rutted, not sure low clearance vehicles could make it. There are sites further down that may have better access.

name: Secret spot with views near YNP
description: Somehow this hasn’t been posted yet...on a little side road in NF, past a small pond with some sort of house-like structure. There was a no camping sign right by the water but if it applied to the whole road we figured it would’ve been positioned better. Drive around the bend beyond the water, and the road will end on the side of a hill overlooking the valley. Space for one vehicle. Fire pit, 1-2 bars Verizon LTE which worked fine for texting, and Google maps says it’s 15 min from the park entrance. We’re about to find out! Really beautiful skies at night and in the morning.

name: Camp Wood Road past cattle grate
description: Boondock spot on, Camp Wood Rd.  just past cattle grate on National Forest Land.  Roomy and flattish, spotty cell service.  There is another spot about 1/2, mile down the road as well. Both treed with plenty of spots.

name: Near Hyatt Lake
description:
Site can be found by heading toward the Table Mountain Winter Recreation Area on a gravel road. There is a sign for BLM land to your left about half a mile down the road; turn down this turnoff and continue until you see the campsite. I stayed here during the day for a couple of hours to chill and I didn’t see a single soul.

Rather large site, room for at least a couple of cars. I’d say big rigs could fit, but I recommend a high clearance/shorter vehicle for getting to the site itself. Campfire ring, shade, plenty of trees. About a 10 min drive down to Hyatt Lake. 2 bars for AT&T.

name: Rest Stop
description: 6 trailer/semi/RV spots. Bathrooms locked at night. They open at 6AM.

name: Fox loop
description:
This is a primitive campsite in Beavers Bend State Park Stephens Gap Area. It is a first come first serve site. Pay the parking fee and pick a site. The Parking enforcement person will come collect the $16 fee. 
The campsite is at the bottom of a dirt trail by the lake. Very scenic.

name: Wild camping
description: Perfect spot for one or more than one nighter. We arrived súper dark and it was a little mirk and nobody was here but we slept really good and this morning was amazing to Wake up in the middle of the forest. Totally legal after a mile from the hwy

name: Roadside Wild Camping
description: Campground with an established fire pit and room for two van sized vehicles. Close to dirt road. No amenities. Dirt road has semi regular traffic that can be heard. Surrounded by hiking trails.

name: Robert H. Treman State Park Dump Station
description: You can use the dump station as a non-camper for $8. Pay at the park office. No reservation necessary. If you come after hours, use the pay kiosk at the entrance for $9. Dump station open 24 hours. Go through the park on the main road until you cross a bridge and it will be on your right just as you enter the camp ground area.

name: North Main Laundry
description: Not only can you do your laundry but there's coin-op showers. $5 for 6min hot shower. Bring your own soap and towel.

name: Big quiet open area
description: Big and quiet open area, no noise from the road

name: Right off 1-15
description: Right next to tractor supply, maverick and Brigham city utah exit. Large flat area for overnight.

name: Jaymar Travel park
description: Very nice family owned campground. Most are permanent trailers (very nice ones) but they have RV spots available. Very friendly people. Full hook-ups.. picknick table. some with shade. Bathrooms available. Very quiet area and lots of green. Very friendly neighbors. $40 a night, $240 a week and $635 a month (all for 30amp service); tgey have 50 amp also

name: Group Spot!
description: awesome group camping spot right near Sisters! plenty of other spots around too, this loop in particular has 4 sites. 4 bars Verizon and Sprint, easy road access, only thing is a bit of road noise but it dies down at night

name: Camp One, Jackson state Demonstration Forest
description: Awesome site, surrounded by tall trees and lots of greenery. Established fire pit and pit toilets, trash. Right next to the river. Was all alone no one around. Location leads to a couple of trails. Very quiet till the morning you hear logging.

name: Crystal Blue Swimming Hole
description: Local swimming hole. Beautiful light blue water. Alot of people in the summer stop to swim and float. Has a beach. Bring a float! very nice place!

name: San Lorenzo Canyon
description:
This is a amazing place. Sleep under 150ft canyon walls. Locally used, as I am from New Mexico and come here to camp. Drive on an old river bed out here. It's a big slot canyon. beautiful, big horn sheep.  

Do some research on google before coming for some directions, as sometimes google takes you to a closed gate. if you search San Lorenzo canyon there are some articles online.
This place is open year round. Someone posted that it's not big rig friendly. that's not the case. I've seen massive rigs out here. the river bed is just fine to drive on. Don't be scared!

name: BLM North of Black Canyon North Rim
description: BLM land 1 mile north of the entrance to the North Rim of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison. Road easily passable for all vehicles. A few level dirt spots. Plenty of space for vehicles and tents. Can’t vouch for the road too far back as I got one of the first few spots. 2-3 bars of LTE on Verizon and AT&T. Gorgeous sunset, great stars at night. At least a couple spots with fire rings. Only one other camper on a Thursday evening.

name: Above Tibble Fork
description: Multiple campsites off American Fork Canyon Rd. above Tibble Fork Reservoir. Some sites are accessible without 4wd/HC, but the road has some big potholes/puddles as you go higher. There was a lot of traffic on the road during the day and some dust, so sites that are further off the road are a little nicer. All have access to the cold, swift American Fork River. 14 day stay limit. Please LEAVE NO TRACE and keep this area open to dispersed camping!!

name: Idlewild Campground
description: Just off John Day Burns HW 14 miles north of Burns on HWY 395. Large sites, pit toilets and potable water. $10/night or half with pass. Will take up to 22’ trailers. Quiet and clean for a quick overnight.

name: Themistocles Nomad - BLM
description: Simply some BLM land off of Applegate valley, potentially some better spots, but I didn't look around too much. Cell service but poor. Handful of flat turn offs like this, but it's better than listening to traffic all night.

name: A-1 Mountain Exit
description: Camping is very limited near Flagstaff these days. This road (left side only) is still open. Lots of spots to choose from all along this road. Some big rig friendly. Some abandoned tents and RV’s-we tried to clean up what we could.

name: Showers at Ute Travel Plaza
description: Showers with free wifi. Just about everything you need here

name: Walmart
description: A few others posted up for the night. Safe and quite. Excellent WiFi if you park back by the tire shop. Was able to stream movies.

name: love’s gas station and truck stop
description: truck stop. stayed overnight in our van for free near the storefront. there were a couple other overnighted cars and we could grab a shower in the morning for $13 . good place to bunker down in the night

name: Bookcliff Campground
description:
Nice campground in state park with swimming beach, full bathrooms, etc

$28 for a site and you have to pay $10 day pass fee for beach. Worth it for the swimming, showers, etc.  Lots of trees and shade as well.  No electricity at sites so there’s definitely a few generators running. 

Limited camp store w/ ice.

name: Mountainside near Lamar valley
description: Great spot, not entirely level, on a NF road. Many others as you go up, but we wanted an easy exit when we left early morning. Mountains all around, fire ring, barely any passers by. No Verizon LTE.

name: Twin Oaks Drive
description:
Popular spot for truckers and houseless folks to park for an overnight. City-posted 48-hour parking limit signs are not enforced, from what I can tell. Be prepared for some generator noise.

Nearby Moshofsky Woods Park and Waterhouse Trail make for a nice afternoon walk. Eat at Apna Chat Bhavan.

name: Meridian rest stop
description: Pleasantly discovered this rest stop with great views and even a water Spigot next to a pine tree. There’s a pet walking area as well

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area with toilets and dump station. Parking for large and small vehicles, may experience semi noise.

name: Mountain Valley Rv
description: Dump $15 water $5. All water is potable at the dump station. Pay in office.

name: Near De Beque
description: Spot in the desert along V 2/10 road 5 miles before the other Hoodoo spot marked on the App. Very quiet. Very few cars passing by. Good T-Mobile signal

name: Fort Crowder Conservation Area
description: An informal site with gravel parking area, and some shade trees. Pit privy is about a mile away at archery range. Hiking trails leave parking area. No amenities, some trash. Lots of ticks, some poison ivy on trails. A quiet place to park and spend the night.

name: JR's Home & Auto Center
description: Combination hardware, building supply and auto parts store. They sell propane too. Tank fill station is to left of front entrance about 70' ft. inside their materials yard.

name: JR's Home & Auto Center
description: Front parking lot has open free SkyFibre internet.

name: Information Board
description: This is not a campsite. It is the location of a NFS information board that shows all the designated dispersed camping locations around the town of Gardiner. Dispersed camping in this area is specifically designated on the map. Most sites are at least 3 miles in on the road.

name: Dry River Campground
description: Nice, clean campgrounds. Showers, laundry. Close to Arethusa Falls trails.

name: Maverick gas station
description: Portable water Spicket at the three station RV gas and diesel.

name: Fat Cat Pizza
description: Locally owned pizza with love for cats! Small place with no dine in available at this time. Will deliver in Brookings/Harbor or take out. We had a calzone and it was absolutely delicious, large, and the right price! Really nice people and in a shopping center with a dollar tree, rite aid, a water jug refill station, tobacco store, Dutch bros, and a bar. So you can definitely grab a few things while here too!

name: Farmer Gas Spigot
description: A small unmanned gas station for farmers, has a nice spigot for filling up!
